BJIId5fw9pnA1Vsp9uB1dw.text: I love Cowfish! The sushi is so good and I typically get the bento box which had a little bit of everything. The spicy cucumbers are so good!!! And I also get the sweet potato fries. The thing I like is the mini burger you get to choose! It's like a little same then next time you can get the actual burger! I forgot the name of the spring roll we got, but it was so good!!! Worth the price! It's a trendy restaurant and I recommend everyone to go there!!

SMbAV2io0tGBGisi81L6dg.text: This is by far one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte based off of a couple of things. 1. The menu is very vast (almost too vast at points though) so you are bound to find something that suits your fancy. 2. The atmosphere is great - crowded but not too crowded, cool artwork on the walls, awesome bar with a giant salt water fish tank that spans the front wall, great outdoor seating by the fountain if that suits your fancy. 3. The food is YUM (the Bento box is my favorite as you get a little of everything, burger and sushi). 4. Love that when you enter the bathroom the background "music" is 3 voice where one is a sentence in English, one in Redneck and one in Japanese!  5. The service has always been top notch! 6. They have a combination burger and sushi option that is called Burgushi...novel ideal!   Biggest draw back to me is that there is ALWAYS a wait and reservations are hard to come by unless you make then well in advance. Also, not a fan of no drink specials on the weekend.    Overall, a fun place that I will continue to support.

B9XZPXo3ROtxzRjGe_wtuw.text: One of my favorite places in Charlotte.  The burgushi is amazing!!! The waits can be annoying but I've definitely learned the times to come in order to get in quick!

80EHmwPXPABK_D69WEPIWw.text: YUM!! Great sushi. The wait is sometimes VERY long though. I would recommend going during the week for an early lunch to beat the crowd.

8sfiBYh1Q5a7AiDoA08ufg.text: I'm from the west coast, but even I've never seen a place out there like this! We went early on a Tues (5pm) so there was no wait, which was nice. The decor is part of the appeal..very modern with a "fake" fish tank that looks like a ginormous iPad, a real fish tank, and a poster that mimics "Wicked". The waitress was knowledgable, attentive, and efficient. The menu is EXTENSIVE to say the least...everything from sushi to burgers to shakes to everything in between. I would try more if I could come back! Half priced martini - I got the Asian Orchid which was delicious. I got their specialty - Burgushi, which was very filling. The owner was very personable and came around to say hello after our meal and ask how everything was, and gave us all coupons that I will definitely be giving to a local as to not waste it!

6hpN4pu5m58X16jVlkEk5A.text: Very Good Food-Sushi Rolls very fresh. Presentation good.  Atmosphere is fun. Eeez Fusion (sister location) is just as good. Will be going back again.

kLFjIGf4_PSCs3q0yUT6yA.text: I've been to Cowfish twice already, and while everything was good, it still seems way overpriced to me.  $14 for a salad, even with the tuna, is too much I think.  On the plus side, we did have great service, and our friends loved their sushi and giant burger.

hYmdgOzBz0cf6lS53nRWaQ.text: This is a great place to go when you want quality food and a wide variety of entrees to choose from. The portions are HUGE so be prepared to stuff yourself or have a midnight snack for later. Its always busy so be prepared  to wait for a table, which is no big deal because they have a cool bar to wait and have a beer.

Sc_1hZ1EHBMvD2ygPQBtSw.text: Every time I go to Cowfish, I'm disappointed.  I've never once been and thought "oh man, I have to come back and get that again."

owTxMGyE5blbFgRJrEXhVA.text: Sushi and burgers aren't terrible, actually not bad: however, it's gotten way too much of a destination recently. Bento boxes and doug's filet roll are good

FoEntO9bOzUz-wGXcLACXA.text: The menu and food are SPECTACULAR, however the wait is absolutely horrible. The idea of waiting over an hour, sometimes over 2 hours, for dinner is just too long.

OpSPT4qCiqhVNZuJdS2ffg.text: OMG I love Cowfish! It's my all time fave place. Normally whenever you go out to eat it's easy to pass on dessert and a appetizer and simply order your meal. Not here. I recommend the parmesan truffle fries... they are amazing. & you have to get a milkshake to split when your finished. Sushi is the best in Charlotte hands down! I just love this place. I could eat here everyday I think and never get tired of it.

F1d5zESLzHAQfOqrSWOijg.text: My burger was cooked to perfection and had great flavor!  Service was prompt and friendly.  My friend's pulled pork sushi, ODD.  He and I both enjoy culinary risks and this was a not a win. However, I do like the concept and would go back to give it another try.

QU7Kdm6nzlRcJZzjwVu4ng.text: Cowfish is interesting.  It's good, but it's pricey.    First off, the menu is HUGE.  I will say it may be the largest menu I have ever seen in my life, outside of some wine lists.  If you've ever seen the Gordon Ramsey show "Ramsey's Kitchen Nightmares", well Gordon would have a heart attack at the amount of items on the menu.  It took us over 20 minutes to order and may have been close to 30.  Once you get over the size of the menu, the food is pretty good, and the service is very attentive.    We ordered a burger and some sushi.  Burger first:  It was good - on par with the previous tenant of the space, Custom Counter.  Fries too.  There are other places in Charlotte that have better burgers, but it was not bad.  Sushi - Again, it was good, but not the best in Charlotte.  I still believe Nikko's has the best sushi in town.  However, Cowfish is just as expensive as Nikko's.  And the atmosphere at Nikko's is better. And the sushi was prepared a bit better.  So, for the same price and better quality, why should I not go to Nikko's?  Short answer - I don't know.  I'm not a Cowfish hater, it was just more expensive than I would have expected for the quality.  They allow you to order a custom roll - so whatever you want on it, they will make it.  I had an inside out roll with yellowtail and jalapenos.  It was good and I would get the same thing again, with extra jalapenos though!  In summary, good but expensive sushi, decent burger.      Side note:  They have a bunch of different milkshakes at Cowfish, but their blender sounds like a dentist's drill, so I beg you to avoid that if you can.

vhrAEOO2p8-Qbt1yoGHNwg.text: It is so True that often after eating sushi I am still hungry and would stop for a burger just to give me the full feeling I need.  Well at this restaurant, you can have the best of both worlds as the burgers and the sushi are both top notch and go together flawlessly.  I saw this place fill up in a matter of minutes from when it opened and there were a lot of happy faces.  Just sad I didn't live close to here as I would make it my religion to come here weekly, it is just that good.

bsrx-y6G4aOAMCc0NA_FOA.text: I love the Cowfish! But it could have turned out to not be so great.   My wife and I went on a Friday night. We had been talking about going there for awhile and with the wait being a little long we took two seats at the bar. The food was fantastic, the bartenders were great and even with all the people fluttering all around we had a really good time.   The next day my mother-in-law, sister-in-law and nephew (all of whom I love) came to visit and on the Saturday we took them to Cowfish as we knew our nephew would love it. We had a great time, great food and the kicker for him was the language lessons in the bathrooms where they teach you to say certain phrases in English, Spanish and Redneck! He was thrilled.   Well the next day we were looking for a place to go and here's the part where it might not have turned out so great, with a choice for lunch in all of Charlotte our nephew picked Cowfish again! (I think the fried pickles and the language lessons were a big draw) Anyway it was still great and I can highly recommend it to everyone especially now with the fountain on and the live music on weekend nights.

j58hmvZSFl77g5m1TXIj5w.text: This is the result of the pairing of eeZ Fusion and The Counter.  eeZ Fusion fans will be very pleased with Cowfish.  Myself being a fan of The Counter, was disappointed.  The menu is quite lengthy.  The pricing makes it difficult to build your own sandwich without paying through the nose.  They have done away with the smaller meat options, like the 1/3 lb burger, so you have to bring your appetite.  Some sauces and add-ons are no longer available.  The delicious milkshakes did survive the transition!  The menu steers Cowfish to being more of a dinner place than a lunch place, which is a disappointment.  Worth a visit, but fans of The Counter, don't set your hopes high when you go.  Cowfish is definitely geared more strongly toward the eeZ Fusion crowd.

X038wA3xxJu-0d1wG90Zgw.text: There's an interesting variety of sushis, burgers, and burgushi. I thought the burgushi was good but it's not something I would spend money all all the time since the portion is small. The burgers are good though and their fries goes perfectly with it. I like how the place looks also. If you're in the South Park area give it a try

f2BnX23Dn4TAD6zmRU_7Hg.text: This is a great fusion restaurant, not one of those restaurants where they try too hard to force the fusion or it doesn't make sense.  I would recommend the Bento Box, especially the one that comes with a slider. The sweet potato fries and homemade cucumbers and onions are also amazing!  You can enjoy your meal here if you don't like sushi or if you don't eat burgers. It is one of the biggest menus around. Bu

saU3_Nxn2eFbii9Gone8uQ.text: I went to eat dinner here on Friday May 11,it was crowded and waited about an hour to be seated. Once we were seated i enjoyed a berry berry good martini and my boyfriend had kirin light beer, all was well and all the staff was courteous. We didn't have any appetizers. We ordered Porkey's Revenge, Garlic Salmon Roll, Taste Explosion and a Crispy Salmon skin hand roll. I have posted pics for you all to view and they are at the end of the line.  For the most part everything was tasty and  I would definitely go back and recommend friends....it was also worth the wait.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garlic Salmon Roll

vkkJtjuUyds4BaU7bdgPrg.text: Is something really "hype" or "hyped up" if it fully lives up to its expectations?  Coming from out of town, I had not heard any "hype" about Cowfish. I was just in the area and as usual, let trusty Yelp guide me to a place that looked good.  I read a few reviews to get an idea of what to order, but it was not until I started to read more, that I realized that this restaurant had a reputation to live up to.  We were intrigued that this restaurant specialized in two things our family loved: burgers (my husband & boys) and sushi (me!).  Starving, we made our way over for lunch on a Friday, only to be told it would be a half hour wait.  The wait was only about 20 minutes, which gave me a chance to explore the lengthy menu and look at yelp reviews for food suggestions. We were all ready to go when the very friendly server came for our order.   Warning:  I think just reading what we ate for appetizers might give one coronary artery disease!  The two Moms and their teenage daughters (eating their salads) sitting at the next table looked at us in both horror and envy as we chowed. All I could tell them was, " Eating is different with little boys!"  They laughed and said, "We wish we got what you did!" We had:  Coconut Battered Onion Rings ($6), served with a horseradish aioli & Thai sweet dipping sauce. I am not usually an onion ring fan but i did taste these, especially because I love to dip. They were huge, crunchy,& delicious! Crab Rangoon Dip ($11) - great recommendation by yelpers! Unusual, creamy, yummy! Parmesan Truffle Fries ($8) - with Parmesan cheese & bacon. So tasty! Really sinful!  The apps alone left me stuffed!  They have more unusual burgers at Cowfish than I have ever seen. Husband & 11 year old shared two: 1) the Hunka Hunka Burnin Love ($16):  Yes, a burger with peanut butter, fried bananas, & bacon. You could almost hear Elvis singing! It was good, but not as great as burger #2) the Arnold Hamandegger ($13):  cheese, ham, fried egg, bacon, grilled onions, cowfish sauce, onion roll.   9 year old and I each had our own Bento Boxes. These are combo meals with a mini burger, sushi roll, thai cucumbers, sweet potato fries, & edamame. It is really the best of both worlds and it was a fantastic choice!    9 year old got the Cowfish Bento Box ($9) which came with a plain mini burger and he chose a Philly Roll, which he loved. I got the Ultimate Bento Box. I really did not care much about the double stack featured mini burger. I thought it was somewhat dry and I just tasted it. I got the ultimate because I wanted to try one of the special rolls.  There are many unique rolls (as well as sashimi, nigiri). You can even create your own roll. I tried "The Boss" and it was original, satisfying, and delicious:  Spicy tuna, kani salad, cucumbers inside, coated in tempura flakes, topped with avocado, tuna, etc.   Service was very friendly and efficient.  Our server even pointed out that Joey Fatone was in the house. Woo hoo!  The manager (possibly owner?) stopped by to see how everything was and I begged him to open a place in Fort Lauderdale.   Proof enough we loved this place?

KybAnh2TznVcJ820Dm1vAQ.text: The management is accommodating and the atmosphere is nice. It's a good place for a small social group. From a vegan/allergen point of view, you need to at least offer one in that is non-dairy. A person really should have more options than a lettuce bun. The veggie burger tastes good, but having to eat it with a fork ruins the experience. Also, the fries are fried with meats so those are a no go as well. The make your own sushi was fine, but is not particularly special enough to make me want to return.

rkVxlqYsju7B3OXs6JtsPg.text: Good but ALWAYS crowded. Cowfish has a wide selction of sushi and burgers and some items in between. Their bento boxes offer a little bit of both if you cannot decide. Food is always delcious and the atmosphere is so fun. Definitely a hot spot in south park so prepare for a wait when you go for lunch or dinner any day of the week. But it is worth the wait.

kBpDTwu9p4HIXIoRbfuW6Q.text: I went here with a group of friends.They were able to accommodate a group of 10 of us comfortably.Our waiter was very friendly,energetic,and customer service focused.Majority of the table ordered the sushi and burger combination option but shared they didn't enjoy it as much.I ordered the mini sliders (The Local Yokel) and LOVED my meal.The ingredients were a unique combination thus creating a satisfying taste. I will be back to place another order.

um_dJbUCV5iAQqMbp3CcMw.text: So the wife wants to go here and on Mothers day what could go wrong?  I am not a fan to go anywhere on a holiday but...it was mothers day.  We sat at the bar, She had her Box and me a Burger recommended by the waiter, food was delicious, took the wife nearly 15 mins to get her wine after the waiter took the order and after eating 20+mins no waiter, no check and no reorder on the wife's wine.   We did stop a waitress to advise, few mins passed still no one.   I finally reached out to a manager walking by and he advises he went on break, someone should have informed you, (You think? was my first thought)  Then he did reword it correctly by someone should have picked up the slack and we dropped the ball.   This mangers name "CHRIS", He was a super hero flying in to fix an issue that should never have happened, seamless is the word that comes to mind.  He took our check and charged us and as the Chris is standing there he says "wait let me take care of that."  The wife was extremely upset and man I have never had such bad luck with service as we have had since moving to Charlotte and it is always with the wife's food or special occasions.  I Hope CSBB takes this an educational moment and improves their service with this review.  No matter how good you think you are the DEVIL IS IN THE DETAILS.  Thank You Chris for saving the day and we will be back again and again.

Gu0jx4noiuMtQQ1F0BL63Q.text: Great burgers and great sushi. It was hard to choose between burger and sushi, but fortunately you can try both, and they were both very good. I would highly recommend trying them out.

8X6rMbds-0ZKfJ__1b-ztw.text: Great Charlotte spot! I always take my out of town guests here. Bento box is always a great option. Also love their handspun milkshakes and truffle fries. Also, sweet potato fries! #forthewin. They have a great patio, that is covered and heated when it's cold out. Go in the restroom for fun to learn another language! Parking is small, unless you go into the deck by Dillards, but it is possible.

upPJzfrLrk-mPQNY13eZLA.text: Cowfish is significantly over rated in my opinion. The food is only ever "okay" or "good," at best. Never fantastic. And it's is definitely overpriced for what it is. Charlotte has too many phenomenal options for sushi, burgers, or dining out in general to waste my time with mediocre service, overpriced food, in a hectic, not even remotely relaxing atmosphere.

o8Z5MTMxlHq2lNDxOoWx1Q.text: I visited them yesterday for lunch. First time here for me, I was recommended by some co-workers since we work in the SouthPark area. I had the mushroom burger which was really good, we also had the tuna nachos for appetizer, those were good as well. The only reason why I am giving it a 3 star ( I wish it had a 3.5 star, rather) is because the service was super SLOW. It took almost 10 mins just to get me a drink and they were not busy. I will comeback though when I'm not in a hurry, their burgers are worth it

ZIZ7P_-Oi_tcb3T94eADYA.text: This place is really nice. Our server Cam was the best & the mash up bento box that included a mini burger was just perfect.  Wonderful artwork & you a learn another language while you potty.

MZlCOszmOs2QyEaofZsZPA.text: My friends and I are here while visiting Charlotte and absolutely loved it! The atmosphere was great and the food was even better. What really topped off us having a great afternoon was our waitress. She was so very sweet from going out of her way of giving us different recommendations of places to visit to while in town to even bringing my friends a a free dessert to wish them luck on boards that they would be taking the next day!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

Y46HxbLM4sYi37sbZY3hXg.text: This was my first visit after a few recommendations. I love the option of building your own sushi roll. Anyone would can enjoy a meal here, even if you've never had sushi before this would be the place to go. Even the kids had several meal options. The cocktails were the best! When we arrived there was a line out the door, we were given a hour wait time, but was seated in less than half the time. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because our waiter was forgetful and failed to refill drinks or check to make sure our orders were correct.

X3EKNWb9txQ8gKEUKaT7yQ.text: Went here for a business dinner.  I will give them credit for a very inventive menu, and a great beer list, but I was not really impressed with the food.  I love my raw fish, and while the fish was good, it was not great.  The service is quite good.  It is a hip, trendy place with a hot buzz, so expect to wait for a table (we did).    It is a great place if you have a group where everyone needs to find something to eat, but if you are looking for sushi (which I was), I'd try someplace else.

3KzkZ_yeUcuZmGFMnWFMzQ.text: It was very vanilla. Not good. Not bad. Not even blah. It was acceptable.  I would go back but I wasn't amazed by anything I ate. I ended up ordering a Bento Box with jalapeno sliders and Dion's OMG! Roll.  The sides were actually the best part--especially the cucumbers. There was nothing OMG about the Dion roll--very bland and the Jalapeno sliders were sufficiently lacking in jalapeno kick.  Just not overwhelmed given the wait and the buildup I experienced hearing about it.

h-A7rcG8ktzabwYRVxZRMw.text: I'm surprised to say this but I gave cowfish another try and I'm glad I did. For starters it was much better at lunch - no wait. We shared three items - the minis of the week, the fried pickles and the Miss Muffitt roll. The minis were just he right amount of burger. The pickles were hot, crisp and sour just like you'd want the perfect fried pickle to be. My issue last time with the sushi is it was too big but this roll was the right size! $40 before tip between the two of us - not so bad. The menu is still huge - take your time and don't order too much or go with a big group and take advantage of being able to try more that way.

p0iaaNK4CwC_n_CJXsZdFg.text: This is such a good restaurant especially for kids on the kids meal there is plenty of selection and delicious bento boxes

8tXNJOVwrf_yyDMMG3_NMQ.text: They say opposites attract. Land meets the sea in perfect harmony. I couldn't decide between sushi or their burger of the day... So I didn't. I got both with the bento box: a snack size burger, 6 dynamite rolls, edamame, and Thai cucumbers filled up the tray and my stomach.  I can't really decide which is better, the cow or the fish. That's not a bad thing, though, right?

ZbiCN1bimnHDbLt0PM8r8g.text: I love the unique and delicious taste of the food. The sushi burgers are a brilliant twist to an upscale burger restaurant. Every time we have gone here the food and service never disappointed us. The kids meals are also unique and tasty. The only "problem" is there always tends to be a wait, which is a good sign of a great restaurant!

rK-auoOP0H8kGLzEuXA4Eg.text: Just as great as the Raleigh one.   Great for GF and other food allergies.   Love the make your own sushi and the bento boxes that mix a mini burger with sushi and other items for lunch are a hit with my wife when we go to the one in Raleigh.    Always a favorite stop of mine no matter the city.

b1hhORQDMELZuXkK3gKaZA.text: I have never not had a great time here. The food is always amazing too. If you're a foodie, then this is your spot. Mark's roll, Dougs Filet roll, and pretty much any sushi roll you get here is amazing. Portion sizes are great too. My personal staple is the truffle fries. !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I have not yet had truffle fries like this anywhere else. I will go there just for those. Their burgers are huge and delish as well.  We personally had a great experience there a few days ago with a server in training. His name was Leon. Ask for him he was great!

P4leGkraznKD4sfnFfguiw.text: Ate there an hour ago and now have food poisoning. Last time I ever eat sushi there (fish was half frozen anyway ew). I am so sick. :( At least my boyfriend enjoyed his burger.

ZGXH4Y2U_FkdobycLGzq7g.text: We absolutely loved it!!!! Went there for my birthday and going back for my husbands bday. Worth the drive!

mzuRw20fKmAX2xM_-ZO4SQ.text: The food is amazing,  You literally can't go wrong either way you go, sushi or burgers.  It has a cool laid back atmosphere.  I can't wait to come back and try something else from the menu.

nSDDzGAEJAJg1oVV2brJZA.text: The best thing about this place is the variety. The worst thing about it is the wait and the fact that they don't take reservations. The food isn't anything life changing, but I love the fact that you can go to one place to get both sushi and burgers. I recommend the bento box, where you can get a slider, some sushi and a few sides including cucumber salad and, my favorite, sweet potato fries! As far as appetizers go, the tuna nachos and the calamari are winners. Definitely a must try in Charlotte due to the unique concept.

WBPDT14--v1r7sjtWh0O6g.text: Have been a few times and has been good each time. Fun menu with "odd" things to try that turn out to be pretty darn good.

2yUasoOyxRfrDg4tARZAwA.text: By far favorite place for sushi, and has great burgers. The fact that you can get both is the best thing ever. The crab Rangoon dip is a must try. Place fills up quick and can usually be on a wait-but it's worth it.

MpJfJzqQn1OlQqRjMAj34A.text: I seriously love this original place.  I go there each time I'm in Charlotte.  Love the food, love the atmosphere, love it all.  I especially dig their logo.  PLEASE build one in New Orleans or in Metairie, LA!!!

EaEkMuac9yHMSIgXKAXNIw.text: I just had the jalapeno beer and fried pickles. Really good, not too salty and the jalapeno beer was bomb. Definitely not too spicy with a strong aroma of jalapeno. Friend had a tuna sushi burger on rice buns - they were like flatbread, really cool and the sandwich itself had a great sauce but slightly overwhelmed with leaves.

RomrwL-wv9IvsECIkShHrA.text: Everything about this place is brilliant. Wouldn't be surprised to see them pop up all over the country, it's that fun (and delicious too). Hope one comes to Dallas, Tx, because I won't be back in NC for a while.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Even the bathroom sign is clever.

HOgo8FglroROXNZcX1OLvw.text: A friend of mine saw this on the Food Network show so we decided to drive up from Columbia SC. To try it.  What a great call.  Our waiter Graham was awesome.  All if his suggestions were right on target.  We will definitely make the drive again.

qpU79ES09T3WmCsEs8PXZg.text: I will start by saying The Cowfish is one of my favorite spots in South Park - I've had nothing but great experiences here. Just recently went here over this past weekend and was blown away by yet again. The Cowfish has a HUGE selection of food - not just sushi. I've tried at least 5 rolls and all their Bento Boxes (highly recommend the Brento Box); all have been delicious. The burgers are to die for. The cocktails are also freakin' awesome. You can really tell they care about all the ingredients that go into each drink. I had the Bacon (something, something) cocktail and ended up having 3. Friends of mine tried just about every other cocktail on the menu, and were very pleased.   I would highly recommend the South Park location to anyone. If you want drinks, just apps, or a full dinner, this is definitely a go-to!

6uGTI_etiP_3iMoJQzkW2Q.text: Went for my fiances birthday because of all the great things we've heard and the suhsi/burgers to us were just ok. Nothing special. Maybe we got the wrong thing. Definitely pricy. If we decide to go back, I will edit this review.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Waiting outside for 1 hour

leqOp5EAcnCH_s8RkYgc0w.text: We decided to go here after reading the reviews prior to coming down from MD. And we weren't disappointed.   1st off the crab rangoon dip was AMAZING!  Me and my friends order the ultimate Brento and blackened tuna rolls. The sushi here is really good. The mini burgers that we had left a lot to be desired. It was lacking flavor.  This restaurant has a great concept, great service, and some pretty decent food at a great price. Definitely will come back but may not do the burgers.

sTy2RWE7Xn6oQ3Kx4fDM9w.text: A couple friends brought me here and were raving about it the whole way there. Honestly, the hype made me nervous but thankfully it did not disappoint. The menu appeared straight forward. They had burgers and sushi, both of which I love on their own... but fusing them together to make burgushi?! What an unexpectedly delicious and unique concept.  To start, we had Blackened Ahi Tuna Nachos which were wonton chips with a dollop of the house-made crab rangoon dip accompanied by pico de gallo and avocado topped with a slice of blackened ahi tuna seared rare and mixed greens. Fresh and delicious. I ordered the Mediterranean Lamb Burger for my entree. I've had many Mediterranean inspired burgers all over and this one had to be the best. The burger was cooked perfectly and the flash fried wedge of feta cheese on the burger was a nice touch.  Everything from the service to the food was excellent. I look forward to my next trip to Charlotte just so I can eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna Nachos
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greek Burger

lMQ5hZLTuipvFXiCfv9r2Q.text: Great food and the most interesting menu I can think of.  Their "Burgushi" options are very cool.  Also, the appetizers are amazing.  They have meat "sushi", raw fish in other presentations (faux burgers, etc.)...you name it.  Plus, a full bar with tons of great drink options.   The only downside is the noise level in this place.  All hard surfaces and usually packed.  It's like having dinner in a football stadium during a game. That being said, the ambiance is great.  The decor is eclectic and original (or, probably ripped off from a NYC restaurant).  It's a restaurant that you'll really enjoy visiting.

45oKSUfzWhjZmC3dOEik2g.text: Not sure what to make of this place. They had some issues a while back and we went once everything was resolved. It's a different menu which is nice but I wasn't too impressed with anything we tried. Not sure what the hype is all about.

DMLPhNR1Ko7AHiwgckChXg.text: service- great! the staff was friendly, informative and quick! They gave me no fuss when I asked for my meal to be remade and I appreciated that!  Ambiance- Fun! Love the overall feel of this trendy place!  Food- This is where the two star rating stems from. The food was disappointing. I mean a cool concept for sure, they literally combine sushi and burgers! However, maybe there is a reason that few other restaurants do this. I ordered the Lobster and Filet minion roll, good idea right? I mean it's basically surf and turf! No. The steak was raw, like raw. I am well aware that sushi is raw fish, but raw steak? no. The menu did say it was rare. Tip: Rare=raw! In addition, the steak was overly seasoned and the rest of the roll fell flat. My boyfriend ordered the "taste Explosion" which is a burger put into sushi format. I sampled and enjoyed this roll! Although, it cost $15 the same as the burgers so I mean, why not get a burger?  Overall, this place is cool. It's spendy-costing at least $15 a person. I would like to try again and find something more "normal" with other positive reviews it has to have something in the food category right?

_HrLsal4MkHNdx3zZUxQtQ.text: The lines are very long and the food is ok. Ordered the crab Rangoon appetizer and was not impressed. People rave about the tuna nachos may give them another try and try those out.

82RQafmzmEPWeDaHhYbDVQ.text: So i went to visit cowfish a little over a week ago and this is only because i received a gift card from them when i complained about the horrible service and how horrible my food looked when they presented it to me from a previous visit. So when i arrived there to get my food, I was told to go to the bar,(where i was ignored)!!!   So finally, I walked over to a podium where I saw employees standing, so that i could check on my food order. As they were getting my food together, I saw and heard one of the employees look at me, laugh, and say, "O wow is that the guy," then he started laughing, but what shocked me was that he was laughing with the lady who was getting my food,(who I think is a manager)!! I feel like no one should be laughed at and talked about and to add insult to injury, he was doing it right in front of my face.. That juvenile and rude behavior is completely unacceptable!!!!!!! So with that being said, "Does anybody want a $20 gift card because I will not be returning back!!!"

QJyUT9Nbtu-u2Gch-K94ug.text: Amazing! Definitely recommend if your in North Carolina!  Dining on the road with Peachtree Camera Repair.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cooked lobster tail roll with rare filet Mignon.

cwt9b2qKbQdwcI66rpqJ0w.text: Who says excellent customer service is dead?? After my previous review of  the not so tasty crab Rangoon dip, co-owner Marcus Hall reached out to us to offer a chance to make things right. Our service by LeAnne was good and attentive. We appreciated managers Ronald Cruces and Mickey checking on us periodically.  The crab Rangoon dip recipe has changed but for the better.  This dip was creamier and chock full of crabmeat something missing from our last visit. Delicious! Very nice to see a business take the time to ensure their patrons are happy which yields  repeat business.  Keep up the good job Cowfish!

m3UWjVQysE5gZfDtkpoYvg.text: By far one of the most amazing mix ups of American and Japanese flavors!  Starting with the appetizers you will be challenged to choose one!  My favorite is the Blackened Tuna Nachos..which mix the Crab Rangoon Dip (my 2nd favorite app), guacamole, ahi tuna, sprouts all on top of a wonton.  Sounds crazy, looks crazy and tastes amazing!  For dinner, the selections are also endless.  I always order a mixture of rolls..must have Riggs Roll (topped with a crab cake), and Mark' Roll (all around hotness!)!  For desert do not miss the milkshakes!  I can not pick a favorite because I get a different one every time!    If there is a wait, it is worth it.  Also ask your waiter for a menu tour and you will have an even harder time deciding!  Great for families, friends, entertaining, first dates, and any other occasion you may be celebrating!    (Congratulations) to the owners, chefs, and staff at Cowfish!

Lo8lgLUdRGtyLnHnNQaIsQ.text: One of the managers contacted me via email about my review & is passing along my thoughts. It was wonderful to see a restaurant that is very popular concerned about customer satisfaction. Kudos to the manager. They have invited us back in & glad to know we have such a great customer-friendly, welcoming, attentive neighborhood business. Well done Cowfish!

HG171Gw0MwZavea6m6h9eg.text: Best place for sushi! Love "The Prime Time" with Filet Mignon and Lobster. It's a must have in my book!

PX7dw1CpbISFW6j3uMgQCw.text: I came here with my parents and was pleasantly surprised by the variety of options on the menu.  The sushi was great - while a bit pricey - and there's even a "make your own sushi roll" option.  I ordered the lobster and crab spring rolls, which were fantastic and came with a scallion pesto. Super amazing but super big portion size.  I also ordered the Blackened Tuna roll and a yellowtail scallion roll - both delish, but the Blackened Tuna roll was divine.  I would definitely come back the next time I'm in town!

6MVT5aAJDuG3_5LeDe7SsQ.text: Love the selection and Bento boxes.  Kids beg to go here.  Go early-- its always packed!

lqUmD9kLv2955AjmzyphpQ.text: Seriously!  Maybe the food is great but a 2 hour wait to be seated?  Does not seem like the type of restaurant that needs reservations.   We gave it a single star because hostess was a Bee-atch!

nuQdx_TyH9o8MwWieMSVFw.text: If you love trying out new sushi combos- you have to try this place out. The service is outstanding and I have never had a bad visit. The bento box is a must try.

GHfSvyliU8DFxkqEUs4Izw.text: Very amusing sushi joint. First off the decor is amazing tons of pop art and fish tanks. I had gotten veggie sushi and crab roll and both were amazing.

L__oGuJznBQfReCq_P2kVg.text: I had dinner here a few weeks back for the first time! I have heard a lot of hype about this place and finally decided to check it out.  It was a weekday night, so not very crowded and we got seated right away.  We had an attentive waiter and he answered most of my questions to my satisfaction, but the menu is very long and so I cannot blame him for not knowing everything on it!  I was definitely in the mood for sushi, so ordered two specialty rolls.  Not having been here before, at first glance I thought the prices for the fusion rolls were on the higher end, but the rolls are fairly substantial.  I couldn't finish both of the rolls I ordered that night.  I wanted to have a glass of red wine, so I asked the waiter for his suggestions for a pinot noir and decided to go with the one he suggested.  I was highly disappointed with the quality of the wine, and in retrospect probably should have sent it back, but oh well.    Overall, though, my experience was pleasant and the food was very tasty.  It's definitely not a place I would frequent often but definitely a place I will return, since the menu has quite a lot of delicious sounding dishes!   Pros: Nice service, cute decor and not too noisy (at least on a weeknight) so you can have a conversation with the people at your table and the sushi was really tasty!   Cons: I think the sushi prices are a little higher than expected especially the speciality rolls, compared to other sushi places I go to, and the quality of the sushi is wonderful but not beyond other good sushi restaurants for the price point.  The pinot noir the waiter recommended was mediocre, and maybe that was just an isolated incidence.  I may just stick to beer or cocktails when I go there next time. Lastly, the menu is HUGE and extensive, hence,  making it somewhat daunting to read through, especially the build your own sushi section. I would have loved to have built my own roll, but that page is not easy to maneuver through and since I am NO sushi making expert, I was hoping to rely on my waiter, but was not able to really help guide me through that particular page.

7Pc5uuHB_t7GphszfNYH2g.text: I am not usually one to write reviews, but I have to comment on the amazing cusomter service at The Cowfish.   I have been to The Cowfish several times before and the food was excellent every time.  Yesterday, however, it took almost half an hour for our food to come out and when it did my food was lukewarm.  I am not usually one to complain, but this was really unbearable.  I ordered the fusion bento box, which comes with a sushi roll, mini burger, edamame, sweet potato fries and spicy cucumbers.  Everything that was supposed to be hot was cold, except for the edamame.    I told our waittress who was more than happy to bring me out a new order.  Before my new order arrived, the manager came over, sincerely apologized and told us (my boyfriend and I) that our entire meal was taken care of.  Yes, most restaurants will take one person's meal off the bill if it is not right, but this was simply above and beyond standard restauarant customer service.  You can tell this restaurant truly cares about customer satisfaction and wants everyone to have a great experience there.    One piece of food advice: get the crab rangoon dip for an appetizer, it is amazing!

AVzIL7p47Esb4GM_TKZ56Q.text: I would never have guessed that the fusion of sushi and burgers might make sense. But the dense, fun menu made a different case for this odd argument, and Cowfish is delightfully logical. Go ahead, dare. Everybody wins.

3YETTs5kSdDlyzvPpl8c_w.text: After moving to Charlotte less than two months ago, I decided tonight was the night to go to The Cowfish.  My mother is visiting from out of town and, as a single mother, was obligated to bring my five-month-old son.  Before making the choice to dine at The Cowfish, I looked up their website and read the "About" section to make sure this was, indeed, a family friendly restaurant.  The Cowfish website claims they are "a fun-loving environment that anyone can enjoy " and customers are encouraged to "bring the entire family for a meal ".  However, upon arriving at the restaurant, it was glaringly obvious that our patronage was not wanted.    We were told there would be a 10-20 minute wait--which was completely acceptable for a Saturday evening--however, as we sat on the bench outside the restaurant, we watched at least 5 other parties of 2 be seated as soon as they walked through the door.  After about 30 minutes, I asked the hostess how much longer the wait would be. She promised we were the next party on the list and that they were cleaning our table.  Ten minutes minutes passed by (along with two other parties) and we decided to go elsewhere.    I understand that children are not always welcomed in certain restaurants.  Out of respect for those businesses and the adults who choose to dine in such establishments, I purposefully choose places to eat that will accommodate young kids.  Imagine my disappointment when I found out the hard way that The Cowfish is, in fact, not a family friendly place and that they do not welcome people from "all walks of life".  At least they live up to the promise of making an experience at their restaurant a "memorable experience".  I hope this restaurant adjusts its website to reflect the atmosphere and clientele it wishes to serve--or that they adjust their attitude.  I've never been treated so poorly by a wait staff!

VBV0cph9Lrz6T7or8BpW2Q.text: I had visited this location back in April and I had a great experience. The service was great and the food was great, so I had no reason to expect anything less than great service when I visited last weekend. I was VERY disappointed to say the least. I ordered the lobster and crab egg rolls to share with my girlfriend and we both ordered burgers. The appetizers came out quickly and they were delicious......but that is where the "positive" ends. When I ordered my burger, I asked to add pickles. When the burger came out, there were no pickles. I took 2 bites and noticed that my burger was a little "cool". I cut my burger in half and it was PINK and cool to the touch. The pink meat started to crumble and fall onto the plate when I touched it. The burger was cooked long enough to brown it on the outsides but the inside was RAW. My girlfriends burger was also under cooked but not as badly as mine was. We called the waiter over and showed him the burger and he mumbled "it was supposed to be well done". No apologies or anything. When the new burgers came out, mine still had no pickles, and it looked "thrown together" like someone was in a rush to get it out. My girlfriend ordered the Jalapeno popper burger which is supposed to have fried jalapenos on it but her new burger had no fried jalapenos but instead a huge pile of raw sliced jalapenos. We decided to order desserts and I saw that they had a tall cake dessert made with "moist" pound cake which sounded delicious and there was also a cheesecake dessert. So I ordered the the pound cake dessert and my girlfriend ordered the cheesecake. While we were ordering, the waiter told us that he thinks the milkshakes are a better dessert than the actual items listed on the dessert menu. We should have taken his advice and just ordered the milkshakes. The "moist" pound cake in my dessert were more like hockey pucks and my girlfriends cheesecake was just bland and tasteless. It didn't taste anything like cheesecake and was really disappointing. My girlfriend called the waiter over and asked him to take the desserts back. My waiter now had an attitude and did not say anything else to us. I guess we were supposed to eat raw burgers and disgusting desserts. Just don't send them back? He handed us the check moments later, returned my girlfriends credit card, and walked away from the table and never came back. No good night, No thank you for coming.   One thing that I look forward to when dining out is "CONSISTENCY". I don't want to have terrible service one day, good service the next, and then have it be terrible again by the 3rd visit. Fortunately for my server, I am a good tipper so I left a $10 tip on a $40 tab for mediocre service and terrible food. Unfortunately I will never be back to this restaurant. There are plenty of great restaurants here in Charlotte where I can get great service and food on every visit. Too bad Cowfish is not one of them.

RBp7yBAatXecuKpNJAx4sw.text: Great sushi!!!! Great staff! & it's in the South Park area so there is lots to do when you leave. Great drinks!

1SGOvyxLgQcZuBoF-JZx4A.text: When I think about the restaurants I love they all have something in common other than my endearment- my parents would probably like them too. I think that's what sold me on Cowfish. Sure it's got a hip, swank, rather loud vibe going on, but the food is solid all the way around.   I wasn't with my parents but I was with a friend with a meat & potatoes palate so Cowfish was a no brainer. I get my sashimi, tasty drinks, and a bison burger, and he gets his Dr. Pepper, Chocolate milkshake, and lamb burger (stripped of everything, of course) and everybody is happy and full. Btw- the bison burger here was hands down one of the tastiest burgers I've ever had- props to putting chipotle seasoning to good use! If the price is deterring you a bit- it might help to realize you'll probably have a take home box so it's plenty of food for the average eater.   A couple ok parts: our server seemed a bit exhausted- and watching some of the other servers they all seemed a bit "eh" but overall it was still a great experience. Oh...I'm going to sound really old saying this, but the music was rather loud.

fWdzKIUo2zMxejzyUE2_tA.text: Def a really unique concept for a restaurant.  The menu is pretty expansive.  We went for lunch and there was a 45 minute wait!  It's so close to South Park Mall I feel it's probably rare that they are not on a wait on a Saturday or Sunday.  The menu offers such a wide variety of things from sushi, bento box combos, to hamburgers and shakes.  I love a good sushi roll, so I generally don't stray from that side of the menu.  My fiance had the turkey burger.  Amazing.  It was a typical burger with a goat cheese and sun-dried tomato toppings with micro greens that really set it apart.  He chose the sweet and spicy cucumbers as his side and they did not disappoint either.  I went with the Doug's filet roll.  It is topped with a seared rare filet and stuffed with crab, avocado, and cream cheese.  It was just ok.  I was hoping for something a little more wow, but it was a good roll.  (Different than your typical sushi).  They have a lamb roll and a bbq roll that I am dying to try, so I will be returning for sure.    The only con to this place is the crowds.  It is good and large, so the wait tends to move a little quicker, but the waiting area isn't conducive for large crowds (luckily the bar has lots of room).  I love the concept of this place and the menu for its sheer difference to the rest of the restaurants in South Park.  If you're going to go here, don't eat for the day so you can try a bunch of different things!  There is too much to choose from in just one meal!

OGdvda8b8t-i6DERVsOxVA.text: OMGOSH, one of my favorite places in the QC! Love their food from the bento boxes, sushi, burgushi (taste explosion roll will sweep you off of your feet and make you say "I Do!") & the specials are awesome! Lunch or dinner I'm there! Great crowd and great staff. I believe Wednesday is the half price wine bottle special and it's well worth it! Til we meet again Cowfish :)

IqgcYc6Sk9zAiQE07zuAMQ.text: I know this place is known for their Sushi but I wasn't in the mood and ordered the black truffle burger. OMG it was OUTSTANDING.  Cooked just perfectly with a side of onion strings. Next time I will get the sushi.

az7AuNl9-kEpz2uv94fFtQ.text: Cowfish burger bar will live up to expectations.  Everything we ordered was fantastic, and throughout the family we sampled just about everything.  Burgers are huge.  Sushi is great, and desserts are divine.  Cannot beat Cowfish.  Great service and a 5/5

qbq17CvHGSgeqIktV4YwvQ.text: This is our favorite sushi spot in Charlotte! We moved from Dallas, TX last year and have struggled to find good sushi in Charlotte until we found Cowfish. It gets quite busy, but the food is delicious!

HvJTMEZ8ci8hLaoVByHNMQ.text: This place is so exciting. This was my second visit and I cannot wait to go back. It's the kind of place where you have a hard time picking something on the menu because there are so many good choices. Because of this, I would recommend coming here for a birthday party or some sort of celebration and ordering off the menu to share. This time I enjoyed the firecracker sushi roll, which was delicious. The service was fast and friendly. My friend got the poke tuna which was also very good. What I did not realize is that, Cowfish has bento boxes on the menu. This might be a good choice if you're new to sushi and not really sure you want to order a entire roll. What you'll get with bento is sushi roll ( a couple selections made for bento), and a burger ( also a couple selections you can choose from). This way you get the best of both worlds!!!  The decor is modern, trendy, great for a date. They also have a large covered patio and bar area.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb Vindaloo Burger
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Tuna Nachos

tAAJgr4f8azIZAgqQ0BaKA.text: Ahi tuna nacho appetizer was bomb!!!! Salmon was so fresh. I LOVE the make your own roll option. Also ordered the North Hills roll. The coconut flavor was rich and went perfectly with the sweetness of the mangoes and crunch of the nuts. Service was delightful. A little pricey but the quality speaks for itself.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

2JoAI8wM_WD2dTGnf3zwyQ.text: First time at cowfish. Food was great and server Tiana was amazing!! Will definitely return. We took her recommendations and they did not disappoint!

vJ8wO_C90vPG8-EA1dzylA.text: I was pretty apprehensive getting sushi at a place that also does burgers. The reviews were good so I decided why not give them a try.  The inside does not look like any sushi bar I have been to which made me feel even more leery to try their sushi.  It has a Sports Bar theme with allot of Bar height tables surrounding a large bar area.       It was crowded the day we went and service suffered as the table set up and under staffing made things take longer than the should.  Our server was great but she had too many tables to take care of and we had to wait for refills etc much longer than normal.      We ordered the Sashimi Como platter,  Blackened Tuna roll, R&R Crab cake roll and Big Al's Tuna Appetizer.  The Combo platter and Big Al's tuna app came up first and wow was I surprised at how fresh and tasty the fish was.  Next came the sushi rolls and they were both unique, fresh and delicious.  Everything we had was very good.  Next time I am in the Charlotte area I will definitely come by to get some more tasty sushi!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Premium Combo Platter
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Tuna Roll and Riggs R&amp;R Crab cake Roll
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Big Al&#39;s Tuna Appetizer

L64_Gx0RlxcmY2KnqLXhuA.text: Came back today and wow- it was so good. The service was amazing and our food was especially good today. The Motherlode was yummy and my OMG Roll was the best one I've ever had. I highly recommend getting a side of pounded ginger sauce to go with it. Our server Allyson was so nice and quick even though it was busy and everyone was super helpful and friendly with our little baby. Two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Doug&#39;s filet roll and yellowtail and blue fin nagiri.
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Rangoon dip

ghaf8yQDe35fd8qB0lDhlA.text: I have always had pleasant experiences at Cowfish and have been going since they opened, however my experience January 5th of this year was exceptional. My friend was taking me to dinner for my birthday in which I suggested Cowfish because I hadn't been in a while. My family surprised me from Florida and was at the restaurant when I arrived. They had somehow concocted this entire plan with the restaurant and although there was going to be a wait, they ended up making an exception. My sister and friend said the restaurant was wonderful and helped with everything that she asked. Our server  was wonderful and the manager was awesome. They went above and beyond and I had a wonderful birthday. I will always patronize Cowfish because I always enjoy the food and service. My family said that when they returrn to Charlotte, they will definitely make another visit this restaurant.

JTeexwwz9W-HZF8X9eIoPA.text: Ate here tonight 7/3. Arrived around 8:10 and my date and I decided to sit at the bar as there was a 30 min wait for tables. After sitting at the (mostly open bar), we were not greeted, given menus, or had dirty glassware and napkins cleaned from in front of our face from the previous party.   After about 10 minutes, a male bartender came over, wiped the bar with a dirty smelly rag and tossed some menus in front of us. After taking our order at 8:25, that was the last we would hear from him for the night.   Our food, while quite tasty, did not arrive for 45 minutes.... we watched two other groups arrive at the bar AFTER US, order food, eat, and pay their bill before we received our food.   Our server (male bartender who I will not name) did not even come to close out our check without me asking him to do so.   Absolutely PITIFUL service. Not sure if this was because we were both in workout gear or what his deal was?? Sufficient to say, my date and I agreed that we will not return to Cowfish in the near future. There are much better sushi options in Charlotte.

9nzJ5bT6pyoBojY2E9Fhzw.text: Burger is good, fried calamari is sooo good.   1 star off coz of their service and sushi. Waiter who served me seems hasn't woke up that day..and sushi is just ok ok.  Anyways, it's still a good place to eat beside the mall.

pXpbLjQHGpeGCg_pBEp1ig.text: Are you kidding me? This place is ridiculous. My second time around and I have got to give the praise The Cowfish deserves. I mean, it is the best sushi I have ever had. It certainly is the best sushi in Charlotte. The OMG! Roll was the perfect blend of sweet while the R&R roll was the perfect blend of salty and spicy. They were both of the hook!! You may have to wait, but the wait is worth it. Man. So good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. OMG! Roll &amp; the R&amp;R, wow!!!

yDIrX8__TjM8Nwe8ntMp2A.text: Went to cowfish yesterday to celebrate mine and my sister's birthday. This is a great place for burger and sushi fusion. I got the screamin Korean chicken sandwich and it was okay. It was kind of dry and had too much sesame in my opinion. The fried pickles were great and I wish I had more! My sister got the island breeze and it tasted like cough syrup... but she liked it

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

HQyER8PE0tu3SktYVpAN7g.text: We had a party of five adults. We started off our meal with the fried pickles (it comes as pickles and peppers, but they did just pickles for us) -I must say these are the best pickles I have had at any restaurant; avocado tunatini - the boys said this was excellent. We then moved on to the main course of an avocado bacon burger with a side of bacon slaw cooked a perfect medium- yum; build your own roll of lobster, salmon, cucumber, avocado with white rice in a soy wrap topped with yellowtail tuna and a perfectly cooked medium rare filet - outstanding; California roll and a tropical storm roll - excellent; bento box with a California roll and longhorn slider that came with sweet potato fries, edamame, and tia cucumbers - excellent; bento box with a California roll and a regular burger, fries, edamame, and tia cucumbers - excellent.  For dessert we had the moose is loose - OMG this is a huge mound of deliciousness!!!!   The food overall was prepared perfectly and to order. The server "Cooper" was on point - a glass was never empty, plates cleared when finished to make room for the next, knowledgable and friendly.

PC7WBte33pGdTbw4fC7P8A.text: Cowfish is easily one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. The menu is super creative always making for a fun dining experience! The service is always consistent. My favorite thing to order is the bento box, since I never know what I'm in the mood for, it's perfect to get to have a mini burger, sushi, edamame & sweet potato fries all in one meal! Best of both worlds! Pro tip: Cowfish has the most entertaining bathrooms.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beyond the bento box

bFk-6yITo_kq796KUxdp1A.text: So good! Customer service was fantastic. Lots of check ins to see how we were doing but still allowing space to enjoy the meal. Would definitely come back if there was one close to where we live.

s0PeCLywIQnGF0w7_n4N3A.text: I cannot say enough good things about cowfish. The whole idea is just genius. My absolute favorite is the bento box that includes sushi, mini hamburger, sweet potatoes fries, and edamame. I have also tried the alcoholic shakes and they are delicious! This was my second time in Charlotte and all I requested was that I needed to go to cowfish again. The ONLY negative on this place is the wait. I did download the app which you can put yourself on the list if you are within a mile away from the restaurant.

GZdS4mYcFrwxtHUriZ0RPg.text: This place was awesome, I got one of the bento boxes and loved everything in it. You can customize it. My waitress was super nice and helpful. The restaurant had a nice feel and some awesome food concoctions. The bar was pretty well set up too! I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Korean chicken sandwich,cucumber, seaweed salad, sweet potato fries and roll (forgot the name but it&#39;s deep-fried, tuna and cream cheese)

H0fQNNOVmKLsitHMbUdj-g.text: Cowfish had a 45 minute wait to be seated on a Friday so we decided to eat at the bar which was expansive and comfortable. The decor is contemporary and fun! The virtual fish tank that displays your "sea animal" name and lets you know where you are on the waiting list was really cool! A net comes into the tank and catches your fish when it's your turn to be seated. Very creative!  We ordered a  mojito.  It was a standard mojito made with Bacardi.  We ordered two Burgushi Rolls - the Prime Time Filet and Lobster Roll and the All American Bacon Double Cheeseburgooshi.   The Prime Time  is a lobster and cucumber roll topped with seared seasoned filet mignon, pan-fried portobello mushroom slices tossed in truffle oil, green onions, and spicy mayo served with the most delicious side of pounded ginger sauce! Both of these rolls were incredible but the All American was my favorite roll of the night! This roll has seasoned all natural beef, yellow cheddar cheese, white cheddar cheese, applewood bacon, and red onion wrapped in soy paper and shoestring potatoes then flash fried. It's topped with ketchup, mustard, dill pickle, and tomato and served on top of a delicious sauce!  I really didn't expect to like it. I mean a burger pretending to be a sushi roll? :/   I haven't had anything like this before but I ended up falling in love with this roll! It was rich in flavor but  surprisingly well balanced! I can't believe it! Aaaaand it was served with seasoned fries which were soooo good!  For dessert, I decided to try one of their spiked milkshakes - the No Sleep Til Brooklyn. This milkshake has ice cream, Myer's dark rum, Kahlua, malt, coffee concentrate, and chocolate covered espresso beans! D***! They managed to put three of my favorite things into a shack (dessert, coffee, and liquor)! It was delicious!  I enjoyed my experience at Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar. Try it. You will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. No Sleep Til Brooklyn
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Prime Time Filet and Lobster Roll
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Prime Time Filet and Lobster Roll

30ClBG2jY01xz57o59TCIg.text: Burger...Sushi...Burger...Sushi...it's so hard to choose!  Not at Cowfish!  The first time I went here, I thought, "Ok, a Burger/Sushi place is weird, but I like weird, so let's do this."  It didn't disappoint.  Here's why:  1. Their menu is awesome.  Great app selection (I personally had the Crab Dip with wantons with a sweet Thai sauce...yum).  Love the idea of the Bento box so I can have a burger AND sushi (it's a lot of food and I highly recommend and you can swap out side dishes).  They have a pretty nice selection of sushi rolls, but the best part is the Make-Your-Own-Sushi menu.  YES!  Finally, I can get what I WANT!  However, I will warn you, it's a lot of choices, so you have to really have your head in the game to build your rolls.  2. The decor is cool without being over the top.  Cowfish feels almost like a NYC restaurant in Charlotte, just bigger and without the loud lounge music.  Great place to sit at the bar by yourself and have a drink/sushi.  3. The drinks are actually good.  I hate going to a restaurant where they have a cocktail menu, only to be served a bad cocktail.  I had the Skinny Gonzales and I really could have drank like three of them, they were so good (but I didn't).  Fun place to go after work or on the weekend.  It's not too loud so you can have a conversation.  My advice is to know what you're getting into and be daring with your menu choices!  You really can't go wrong.

_y9Qk8J4ekNmTF5cNn51uQ.text: What can I say that hasn't been said? Just check out the hundreds of awesome reviews.  Service by Duncan was excellent. We had a party of 7 and he was extremely attentive and helpful to make sure that we got what we needed.   I didn't order any drinks for myself but the other ladies said that they were strong. The food was very good. I ordered the bento fusion box and customized it. I forgot what roll I ordered (it was wrapped in cucumber) and it was just okay... the large size took away from the pleasure of eating it. The burger/slider I got was s Swiss burger and it was delicious! I wasn't a fan of the cucumber salad but I believe that it is due to personal preference.   Overall, no complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento Box
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento box

gfEj8EWMErIF-iYucYi1hg.text: I really like the food, but I do not think they should be "best known" for there sushi burgers since that is pretty disgusting. I also am in no way a fan of the bathrooms (which are one stall) because they have creepy voices coming through the radio. the voices say the same lines twice and I do not want to listen to men talk while I pee. The staff is polite and friendly which goes a long way for me because I really appreciate that kind of stuff. i think if you go make sure you have your wallets because that ain't cheap.

sem0e3A3H5f_S0mUOKrNLw.text: Have always had great food! It's so busy you should def make reservations. For a first timer the menu can be quite confusing considering it's a sushi and burger place. Very inventive but again, a little confusing. Highly recommend.

vUx93g724Qg2cuQuNMnHvA.text: The nacho is the highlight! The spicy tuna is really good. My sister really enjoys her truffle fries as well. The server is super friendly and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

pZEtEE25iyg5cwHFE7svZA.text: Great Sushi and great service.  Emory did a great job taking care of us for my daughter's 25th Birthday.

dVx_Ctr2himZJUhr4y4HIg.text: Love this place and it's choices. Always great atmosphere and food. No brainer for any occasion.

yO5RmNRtquruKCsrdQC9RA.text: OMG. The deliverance roll was to die for. So freaking good! I will definitely reorder it the next time I come (I like to stick to what I know)! I also had the cucumber salad and it was really good, too. My friend had the tuna bacon burger and went on and on about how good it was. I don't like tuna, but if you do, you should definitely order it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon tuna sandwich and seaweed salad! So delish!!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deliverance roll. Soooo good.

raPS5uu6VEhOvlozkwihgg.text: The "Waitlist" app is very misleading.  You can only join when you are within a 3 mile radius.  What's the point ? Overrated and substandard sushi  Update : The Cowfish management saw my review while I was dining and came to our table.  The manager was sincere in offering an apology on the disconnect with using their app  and offered a gracious and unexpected resolution. Gestures like these don't go unnoticed as a consumer and allowed to  me to reconsider my initial review and will continue to patronized this establishment.

MQPDpsZ9S1KeNkpMzlTvyQ.text: We had some business guests in from China so we tried a variety of dishes family style.  All were excellent.  We had some sushi eaters and some not raw sushi eaters (me included).  Even if you are not a sushi person, try this place out.  I can't wait to go back and try what appears to be some excellent burger choices.  We sat out on the patio and it was quite pleasant.

1e0j98JrFV-tqM8jlNG3Ug.text: This place is awesome! I had the bento box and it was delicious! Being able to have a burger and sushi at the same time is heaven. The place is a little noisy so I wouldn't take someone here on a first date, but if you want great food especially the burgers this is the place to be. I would definitely get here a little early it can be crowded at times. They don't take reservations, but it is first come first serve at the bar.

b2-iOge8C-2AT_HjnV9leA.text: I have been to Cowfish several times and I can't believe that I have not giving them a review until now.  It is usually busy and you might have a wait but it is totally worth it.  Bar and sushi bar seating is first come first serve so that could be an option.  In all the times I have been here I don't think I have waited more than 20 minutes.  This is the type of restaurant that if you are with a group everybody should be able to find something on the huge menu that will make them happy.  Several things to choose from, sushi, sashimi, nigiri, salads, burgers and sandwiches, fusion sushi rolls, bento boxes, burgushi, milkshakes, and several deserts.  Tonight me and a coworker started with the shishito peppers, they are served with a jalapeno lime infused oil, these are a favorite.  I ordered the NODA Hop, drop N'roll IPA, nice IPA with citrus and pine notes.  I ordered the chefs deluxe 15 piece sashimi, which includes fresh tuna, salmon, yellowtail, whitefish, eel, sweet shrimp, lobster salad, and octopus.  The sashimi is very fresh and this is the perfect meal.  My coworker ordered the grilled salmon BLT with sweet potato fries and raved about it.  I have never been disappointed at Cowfish!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chefs choice sashimi!

B7ehbd1xsN47CFM_i4QzyQ.text: This is a great consistent restaurant with a bit of a funky flare.  (Check out the bathrooms.)    The variety on the menu is also great for a wide range of palates- hamburgers to sushi and everything in between.    Also the birthday milkshake is sweet and delicious for anyone who wants to celebrate their birthday or un-birthday.

8DbwresMFEz01FsLmP-lIg.text: Oh my goodness this place is wonderful! We have one in Atlanta but I've never been so I made it a goal to go while I was in Charlotte and man am I glad I did! It's located right at SouthPark mall which is very convenient if in the area but also not far from other parts of the city. For an appetizer we had edamame with four different types of flavors (smoked, sriracha, sea salt, wasabi ranch) which were all very good! There are so many options to choose from and if you don't like what's already been put together, you can make your own roll which is what I did and actually came out cheaper than what i was going to originally order. You choose your fillings, toppings, base, and any special sauce to add. The type of rice and paper are free as well as some of the toppings. I ordered mine with brown rice and wrapped in soy paper filled with soft shell crab, tempura shrimp, cream cheese, and filet mignon--YUM!! And it was topped with sweet eel sauce. Unfortunately the kitchen ran out of brown rice but it was all good. The manager was so sweet and paid for me and my friends meals! How awesome is that?! Definitely appreciative. 10/10 id definitely recommend and I'll be visiting it's other locations ASAP!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

9iL8PAVtQ1lgXC4_sebIgA.text: This place never disappoints. Great burgers and sushi; how can you go wrong? I've never ordered anything that I was unhappy with. Appetizers, burgers, bento box, drinks . .  . All good. It can be really busy at times. Customer service is always good. Will keep coming back here.

knIEk6k8zvYel13qKJcZ6Q.text: Cowfish is fantastic. Be prepared to wait if you don't have a reservation as this place can be pretty crowded. Ordering To-Go food is really easy online. The Bento Box with a mix of burger and sushi is wonderful.

tiuADpdPdvgA8NiNpDQHzA.text: I absolutely love this place. Almost every time I'm in the South Park area this is where I eat lunch. The Mark's roll is probably my favorite sushi roll on the planet. They also have amazing burgers. I also recommend the bento box it's a combination of sushi and burger. Anyway you go you won't be disappointed.

Bo5vP8WQ075kjvsxjv0cBg.text: GAHHHHHH! Who puts sushi and burgers together?! WHO?! These geniuses! OMGosh!!!  THIS. FOOD. IS. AMAZING.  Our waitress gave us a full rundown of the menu and suggested her favorites. The menu is HUGE so it took a while for everyone to make a decision. Our table shared an appetizer of crab dip. It was delish! The thai chili sauce on the chips elevated the dish to the next level!   I couldn't decide between burgers and sushi, so I ordered both. BEST DECISION OF MY LIFE! MY WHOLE LIFE!  My bento box came with a slider, edamame, sushi, and cucumbers. For the slider, you can either choose the burger of the week or one of their other burgers. Note: the slider won't have as much on it as the traditional burger because ,well, it's a slider. Saying that, the slider was amazing! I'm not sure how such a tiny bite of food can be so food - but I have NO REGRETS. I was so upset that I only ordered one & contemplated ordering some to-go. The sushi was good also! My friends ordered burgushi (burgers + sushi) and they LOVED IT!  Overall, this was a really good choice & I can't wait to try the one in Atlanta.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento box

lEuRiy_MhFIMOQWb-rEUQw.text: It's a little pricy and the wait is usually very long (more than 45 min), but having tried most things on the menu I'd say it's definitely worth the visit.

AB0D8S3yhdyqb_PQuGR5vw.text: We have a Cowfish in Orlando at City Walk at Universal Studios and I love it!  So when I heard that this Cowfish is the original one, I had to try it out.    I went on a Wednesday evening for dinner with 3 coworkers around 5:30pm.  It was busy but not packed.  We got seated right away at a tall 4 top and our server was very nice.  She took our orders and was very helpful to those who did not understand the large menu.  This Cowfish is much smaller than the one in Orlando.  It was weird to see such a small place.    I normally get a burger of some type but decided to try a Sushi roll combined with meat = Burgushi.   I got the Prime Time Filet and Lobster Roll.  It was very good but I would have liked the meat to be less done.  I asked for med rare but this was more like medium.  Someone else got the Taste Explosion version while the other two guests got Bento boxes.  Everything was good and we enjoyed it all.   Atmosphere = 8   Service = 8  Food = 9  I also enjoyed a Bulleits and Bacon cocktail (one of my favorites!) and we actually had room for dessert.  I enjoyed the Apple filled won tons.  Yum!   Enjoy!

mH-qal_fUN4Yp6261bfGeA.text: Man what a good time i loved it here its good food and fantastic service I went with my wife and it was great our server Dasan was the best his energy was amazing like the food

iKBhGWam4STBXETlZBsxAA.text: The food was ok. We were seated outside which was the best part of the lunch. Our waitress Maggie wasn't the friendliest Because of the horrible customer service I  wouldn't come back. It was my husband's bday and her service was so terrible I didn't even order his dessert. We just wanted the check so we could continue our celebration where all customer's are appreciated.

LRbigXFhvmTF3q9Ajp8n2Q.text: Really enjoyed our dinner at Cowfish.   The food and drinks were excellent.    Private label Chardonnay was excellent and the best drink is what they call the itzy bitzy martini.   Champagne and Vodka with raspberry. So good.   Tried about 4 dishes and they were all great.  Will definitely be back

HBdWSweLzXPEbBrcwPPiXw.text: Possibly the most overrated restaurant in Charlotte.  This review is simple- I've had much better Sushi for much less $$$.    Maybe my expectations were too high.  The first time I went to Cowfish we waited an hour and half to be seated, and an additional half hour to get our meals.  That didn't bother me, it just made me think "wow, this place has got to be awesome if people are willing to wait this long".  I was wrong.  People are stupid.  This place is trendy so people THINK it's good.    If you want a trendy spot with better Sushi, try Nikko.  Again, I've had better Sushi for less money, just not in Charlotte.  Their cowboy roll is better than any of the "Burgushi" selections I've tried at CF.  FYI - the two star rating reflects price, food, atmosphore, etc... not just the food.  If this place was 20-30% cheaper, I'd give it 3 or 4 stars.

4CG3fcCDMOah78kgxpBLww.text: We came to Charlotte for a fun girls' getaway weekend and ate at Cowfish twice in 2 days. Best fried pickles I have ever had, the pimento cheese burger is amazing, and the sushi is phenomenal. Fun restaurant with great, friendly staff.

pUl-d6vu2Jl4B_RKb7aRWQ.text: Food it's great and friendly staff...if they mess up order the make sure to overly correct

Tdpf3B2lmFHTVnr0c3Em1A.text: Had a very basic burger and a specialty shrimp tempura roll. Both were delicious, absolutely outstanding quality. It's worth every single cent. I wouldn't recommend the Bento/Combo box. It's somewhat small/lacking in variety. Overall fantastic place to eat and the atmosphere is great for young people, which is a huge plus when trying to avoid the family crowds.

aaHdiwTixac-5FFYYWoYjg.text: if you LOVE sushi  this is the right place to come and eat . also they have a great place to try different dishes  recommended !!!

pMTFt3egEMJ7caQfnJNwww.text: We came back. Service was ok, our waitress was very nice and attentive. However the food was cold ,orders a bento box and my fries were cold. My daughter ordered a burger and she ordered it well done, but it was very dry and she didn't eat it.  So again great concept , different flavors something different to do.
