KdY8t83KRNCVyaji0bXWSA.text: We've dined here several times and the staff is great! In the last year we've had maybe two issues with our orders and the manager has always been super quick to fix it or credit our bill. They do get super busy so of course there may be a mix up here or there. Their food is excellent and high quality and the waitstaff is great!

4eLjlZZR_x8irivnbtupCA.text: Great place. Must go at least once! Great food, great service, great atmosphere.   Reasons I gave it 4 stars: first reason is that well there is always better somewhere haha.... Also, when we were in there tonight, there was group of 12 people that decided to scream and talk over each other. Extremely rude. However that I'm sure is not usual for this place. It was a great time. Would have been better if those 12 knew how to act in public.

U_pkI20vRPB3SnocSAd9ow.text: I always build my own roll and went for something different on this last visit.  I got the gobble gobble ooshi (Thanksgiving in a roll) and the Pennsylvania "sandwich" with an amazing blend of cheeses topped with French fries and some insane rice bun creation.  It was amazing.  We sat at the bar to forego the Saturday night wait list.  Service was fast and friendly.  Plenty of great sake selections.

_U4hTrF0fjJQVrF8nzX11Q.text: I really can't understand the rave reviews for this place.  Tried it a couple of years ago and hated it but since they have raving reviews, we decided to give it another chance last week because I was craving sushi.  First of all their menu is way too overwhelming. Its so much stuff on there that it takes forever to go through the whole menu.  Their sushi is more on the modern Americanized side rather than Japanese style sushi. I ordered a roll and a Yellow tail hand roll and my oh my, the yellow tail in the hand roll was sooooo thickly cut that I could not even bite it apart with my teeth. yuck. Sashimi is NOT supposed to be cut so thick as where you can not bite it in one bite more so not be able to cut it with your teeth.  It was so bad I didn't even bother to eat the rest.  My husband got the burger/sushi box thing with some slider looking thing and a sushi roll. They only thing he liked out of the box was the edamame and sweet potato fries. He didn't even like the burger slider thing and he LOVES meat.  Everything was pretty bad. We definitely will not be returning.

ZScPXn9W5w9XDz0LeRy4PQ.text: Fusion specialty bento box! This is a brilliant concept!  We stopped by for lunch while in town and I was so happy we did! First of all, the concept was brilliant. I am a appetizer type eater. I like a little of this, a little of that... and sushi can always fit in for me.  My burger of the week was delicious, with a spicy sauce on it and perfectly cooked. Also, perfectly appetizer sized and adorable. The sushi roll was flavorful and fresh... the presentation was awesome! I would definitely come back here to try the other meat-sushi combos! It was protein heaven! "Burgushi" is now something I wish every city had!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fusion specialty bento box!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sumo Elvis eating burgers... Classic!!

77ddQytZ2hONg1jCb2Agsg.text: Cowfish is amazing! The service is excellent and service is quick.  I will say if you are going for lunch, make a reservation or get there early. It does get busy.

CiljJjkElofBk01Hc94mXw.text: Had it last night- they never disappoint. The bento fusion box is the best thing on the menu! Get the mark roll with it and have them slice it in 5's instead of 4's it's easier to eat! Tuesdays $5 Delish martins as well.

d_7J8zRjSmsSlbvZMJIZng.text: Love CowFish! They have the best veggie burger I've ever had and their fried pickles are amazing!

6vnX-5XJKc3574bX4dJdCw.text: This place is never a disappointment. I took my bf here for the first time and he just fell in love with the crab and lobster rolls and my shrimp tempura roll. He loved it so much that he made me go back the next day and order two orders of the shrimp tempura to take back with him to SC. The atmosphere is really great. The service was..... ok. I'd rather take it to go but thumbs up to the food.

7_dEo8kj1AOCSj4AQ-QAjg.text: I love this friggin place! I love how you can customize your sushi as I usually get jalapeno with beets and mangos and mine along with something green. I just think that their selection and options are fantastic. The sweet potato fries are awesome, the cucumber salad is great. And their other location in Huntersville is also really really good. You won't be disappointed with this place. And if you're a vegan/vegetarian, they definitely have great options for us so I like to go with me omnivore friends because we can all find something good to eat.

yLltW7xxR8k0_t4piGIpUA.text: One of Charlotte's must go to places! Unless your in Raleigh or Orlando, visit them there. This location is the original. They found a great way to fuse sushi and burgers (yes I said that correctly). "Burgoshi" is what it's called and it's amazing! You can get sushi as burger or a burger as sushi. They also have spiked milk shakes! My favorite appetizer is the coconut crusted onion rings! I get the bento box often so I can get a little bit of everything - the daily slider, special roll, edamame, and a side of your choice (get the cucumber salad). Today I got a build your own burger for the first time and it was delicious! Do yourself s favor and make a stop here! You won't regret it!

nPqNqJxvRDTwHCJB3xC93g.text: To be honest, I do not understand the hype. It is a trendy restaurant, and the food is ok, but nothing I would wait for.

d2duO9NG9Zpa2mTe9Ry1rQ.text: I highly suggest the Lobster Spring rolls as an app. So amazing!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

jdHvtecSqWs6KWsPatFPRw.text: this place is awesome. I can't wait to come back to try other items on the menu. Been here twice after so many people mentioned it-- Was a great time from the ambiance (modern /hip feel) to the meal and drinks. Burgishi (sp?) roll was awesome. I was hesitant about the combo of burger and sushi, but actually the way they combine with the sauces and baking turned out perfect in taste!    Half off sake on thursdays and I'd recommend the 'pearl' sake; The apple sake was way too sweet for my likings.. The key lime drink was pretty fantastic. The pricing is what would be expected for a place such as this..can add up but was worth it.  A great/long bar area too but not much place to stand around it or linger.   The tuna appetizer was fantastic. The 'fries' appetizer was just too much and not that great but everything else on target. The different salads have been lovely, full of flavor too.  Oh, let me add (to address another reviewers comments), that cowfish definently isn't the typical authentic sushi place, so dont come expecting that; It is spin off of the typical items, likely unhealthy for some rolls, but definently delish! Im sure if you are health conscious, there are items on menu to keep with a diet.

xhhme_jFRZAg4PxwuwI8Iw.text: This is my go-to place to bring out of towners, and it never disappoints. It's a unique concept that features great food and service. They have a ton of options and servers offer great suggestions. Just be prepared to wait. After 7:00 it's almost always packed.

QEUpinpAjx3z-XKBuJrmjw.text: First let me say, the food is amazing.  Ahi Tuna Nachos rock my world and all of their specialty sushi rolls make for an interesting meal venture.  What gives this place, to me at least, the full five stars is the customer service.  When managing such an "in" place as The Cowfish, everything needs to run smoothly and have a great staff in place.  This was proved last night when the patio was full and the place was packed!  A minor glitch in the system happened when it started pouring rain.  Luckily most tables on the patio were almost finished and hussled out, but my friend and I literally just got our appetizer (the greatest nacho creation ever) and drinks (they carry Bells's!!!).  A few umbrellas were moved and we dined in the rain.  It was beautiful out and the patio was EMPTY.  Made for a great experience and the food couldn't have been better.  The management staff and a few different waiters came to check on us numerous times, braving the rain (which we both kept laughing at) and made it a memerable time.  I will definiatly be going back to the Cowfish, not only for some of the greatest sushi and such a GREAT menu, but for the ultimate customer service that is so hard to find.  KUDOS to the staff!!!

Ftm3c-mTVvhdAG0rvGHg2A.text: I can't believe I have not visited here sooner!! I loved the bar, the outside seating and the entire restaurant vibe.  I had the deliverance roll, the Greek roll, the burgershushi roll and the cucumber wrapped roll - all very good.  A great place to hang with friends and people watch.

N8mkuE9Lw3YkABuhCqtz7A.text: I heard a lot of things about Cowfish so my family and I tried it the other weekend since we were already in the Southpark area. We arrived shortly after they opened and were seated within 10 minutes of getting there. Our server was great. He was friendly and attentive. I ordered the nine piece nigiri and my husband had a roll. I can't tell you which roll he had because I don't eat rolls so I wasn't paying attention. We also had our 18 month old with us, so we ordered the Dragon Bites bento box for him. The Dragon Bites bento is really adorable. There are grilled chicken pieces, apples, fries and a cute little "sushi" dessert made from rice krispy treat and a swedish fish wrapped with a thin strip of fruit leather.  This came with a drink, too. I tasted his chicken and it was really good. My nigiri was ok. The sashimi was cut way too big. While some people may love getting huge pieces of sashimi, I don't. It's not nice to look at and even worse it's not great trying to eat it. My husband said his roll was ok - over sauced, but ok. Preparing sushi and sashimi is an art that few people master and accomplish so they can be called an itamae. I know this place isn't anything close to being a real sushi bar, but I was hopeful when I probably shouldn't have been, given the name and the fact that they serve "burgushi" (shiver).

vcufMMh91v3xpAbbgxBQ7g.text: Fantastic place!  Anything I've ever ordered here has been amazing from the burgers to the sushi....amazing!  The service is incredible--thanks to Marcus and his amazing staff for making my boyfriend's birthday (and his first time there, actually) an unforgettable experience!  We will continue to be regular patrons at Cowfish!!!

KeNhCFgMITC1a5LQJ1JwVA.text: Amazing place to hangout... Good food, Good ambiance. Little crowded though.

tuAHvj_XWZQXtiKJnLAE5Q.text: The food is awesome, but the staff  is amazing! A few of my girlfriends and I sat at the bar for lunch and cocktails on a Friday afternoon. Our bartenders, Steve and Jeff, were so charming! The food was amazing and those two cracked us up.  We had a blast and will most definitely be back for dinner looking for those two!!

v6w2KTSfp6UF1xm9ZJnvTg.text: Delicous martinis and food! Portions are plentiful for appetizers and main dish. Enjoyed the complimentary birthday dessert for a friend's celebration we were there for. Service got a little slow when busy, but overall enjoyed the atmospher and there was a wide variety of menu options. Hostess and serving staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Allow splitting of food and put them on separate plates for us. Overall a great experience and definitely will go back. (I highly recommend the chocolate cake).

TNIcj_xYaErNClLI--EE9w.text: Just ok, IMO. There is a lot better sushi in Charlotte.

SjClYBIDk6xMvMuIRAKUXg.text: Fantastic date night.  Wait was very long (1.5 hrs), but we lucked out with two seats at the bar that opened up immediately.  The bartender was one of the best, very friendly and attentive.  Crab rangoon to start was creamy and perfect with the fried wontons.  Burger sushi, miso soup, ginger creme brulee is a must.  Owner came over to chat us up.  Hip atmosphere, huge menu, and huge bar.  Definitely go here!

_-kWlqR_4Pyl6taeVb6nAg.text: I travel a lot for work and rely on yelp almost everywhere I go for dining ideas. Rarely am I let down by the suggestions of others here. Now for some odd reason, I was fully prepared to have my first big yelp let down here.... Maybe it was the concept that seemed so foreign, who knows? Looking back, I laugh at my initial thought process.   Sadly, my travels often have me traveling by my lonesome, which means a lot of meals where my dining companion is the bartender. Numerous times, I've gone to restaurants where the bartender is ice cold, makes no suggestions, and offers no input on the city I'm currently in. My bartender at cowfish - Jeff M - was the polar opposite of that. Dude was straight up welcoming, friendly, offered several menu suggestions; essentially what any bar owner should be looking for in a bartender. When he learned I was from out of town, he gave me a list of several other restaurants off the beaten path. It's a pretty intense list I was given... Bfast, fried chicken, bars, etc  Anyway, the food here is wonderful. I was a little reserved on the filet mignon wrapped sushi roll but it was a flavor party in my mouth; as was the Marc's roll. I'm only in town for a few days, but I look forward to going back and trying some other menu items!   Kindly bring a cowfish to nj. Thank you

In79IwpYK9qTQt_qpqO2kQ.text: Best sushi and burgers in town...great atmosphere. if you are looking for a nice evening, birthday celebration or whatever may the occasion be, this is the place!

IDahamcmBuctYmnWfCNO2g.text: I love this place! I didn't give it 5 stars, because there is always a wait. However anything worth having is worth waiting for, especially this sushi! It's the bomb.com and has a little something for everybody. You don't like sushi, no problem, they have burgushi! What is that you say??? Super cool, Americanized burger sushi. It might not sound too good but it's Amazing! While you might have to wait for a table, the wait goes fast and once you're seated the service is great! They also have these delicious garlic cheese truffle fries, that could be a meal by themselves. If you are a sushi fan, or you want to try sushi then you have to try The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar. It's also a great place for groups or date night. It's a super trendy place, with a great vibe and great food.

hFjOdg2ejOqTBpNs-wv3pg.text: I have yet to see this place without a line out the door-- and for a good reason, too! Creative, fresh, and absolutely delicious, Cowfish is worth the hour wait every time. And hey, Southpark isn't the worst place to wander around either!

RVtCpV82MPQfNj97azTBGw.text: Glorious combination of the flesh of a cow and the flesh of a fish. Everything is delicious! I'd highly recommend getting a combo in which you experience both types of cuisine. Also, definitely go for the sweet potato fries. They are the bomb.com!

RVOe5KJvN5gw_vc30f7yeA.text: Cowfish has delicious food. We had an excellent waitress too. However I didn't love the layout or decor. I also thought the hostesses acted like they were doing you a huge favor by letting you eat there. I've heard people routinely wait for well over an hour to be seated on a weekend evening. We went during the week and waited about 30 minutes, which is much more acceptable. But the food was great. The two of us split a burger and split a sushi item and both were really good. All in all, I would recommend this place, but apparently not on a weekend due to the wait.

k3uVGx90tIQvKYTPGjkZ7Q.text: Great concept and quality. You can make your own sushi and the burger options are incredible. So you can have a burger that feels like a sushi and sushi that takes components from a burger. Loved the Bacon Slaw. The absolute best quality of sashimi.

fb4ygYwV7B6ugHbFsMuoAg.text: I called for a reservation on a wed night at 5pm.  The message says leave a message for same day reservations. I made a 8pm reservation for five. After no call I asked about the status of my request. They said their reservations were full, but I'm welcome to come in and wait for a table. What makes you think I want to visit your place after getting blown off for two hours. What a waste of time. Go screw!

GXfeQ3OaNHQdchFD9j-7OQ.text: This is NOT a sushi bar, it is a (loud, dark) bar that has sushi. Not authentic it all.  No physical sushi bar. I got a feeling it was a bunch of North Carolina pathetic, posers trying to pretend they were in a hip, New York Bar.  SOOO LAME!  Ended up going to Sushi 101, great sushi there.

vnUALIrq2V70pVDkcCiqVg.text: Based on my experience there I would not go back again. Maybe we ordered the wrong things but this restaurant was simply not impressive. I like restaurants that are good at steaks, and good at sushi, but I guess it's difficult to be really good at both.  That being said, i'll probably be eating at a great sushi only restaurant tonight.

-63NpWyPPmOl6zIADyS7eg.text: Let me just say, this place may put a few pounds on you with one meal, but it is deliciously worth it! I came here with 3 other friends and we decided to try a variety of food, family style! We started with the tuna appetizer, crab rangoon dip, and sweet and spicy cucumbers. All were extra yummy. We also got a taste explosion roll for the table...and whoa...it was incredible.   I was full after the appetizers...  Still, I tried the fried chicken and kimchi Korean sandwich...Delish! The jalapeno burger...a little dry, but still pretty good. Cowfish bento box...the sweet potato fries were great, but I was too full to eat anything more...My friends enjoyed it though ;)  Service was slow, but it was a packed Sunday. I will return!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cowfish Bento Box

Xc18WTCBC_hhRbtwgGzf_Q.text: I really wanted to like this place after countless friends raved about it over & over again. The first time I went with my boyfriend on a date. We had to wait over 2 hours but we were willing to because of all the positive reviews. By the time we finally got seated, we were ravenous and ordered the Parmesan Truffle Fries. They weren't anything special. For dinner I got the Surf and Turf Burgushi. It took forever for it to come out and once it did, it was ice cold. I wasn't really expecting to eat cold, ground beef crumbles. At least my martini was delicious!  The second time I went was nearly a year later. Wanting to give the infamous Burgushi another try. This time I got the taste explosion. It was really quite plain and fell apart as soon as you picked it up since it's just crumbles of burger meat. Pretty disappointing. That said, the milkshakes are AMAZING. I had the No Sleep till Brooklyn which was an espresso and coffee infused alcoholic shake. It was the redeeming item of the evening.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Taste Explosion. Just okay...
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. No Sleep Till Brooklyn Spiked Milkshake. YUMMM!

qwrr6DHLv9Y9Drq0mLPWwQ.text: One of the best restaurants I've been to. Menu choices are unique and endless. Quality of food is excellent. Service was awesome even though they are extremely busy. One thing I think I would suggest is being able to make reservations. We have tried couple of times to go try this place out but the wait time is ALWAYS so long.

Yzb1QI7vj5wqikMht1w46g.text: I'd been wanting to try Cowfish for awhile now but put that on hold with the norivirus scare and such. Since it's been over a month since they reopened without problems and I got off work a little early yesterday, I was finally able to try them out. (And avoided getting sick lol)  The burger I got was pretty tasty and very large but didn't blow me away overall. I ordered the "Big Squeal" which is a burger topped with smoked gouda cheese, BBQ pulled pork, bacon slaw, pickles, lettuce, onion straws, and more BBQ sauce. I ordered my burger medium, and it came out at the correct temp but wasn't super juicy and could've used a little more seasoning. The bun was a little too small for the burger and wasn't that soft; it was definitely lost beneath the big beef patty, especially after soaking up some of the juices and sauce. The BBQ pulled pork didn't have a ton of meat on top of the burger, but the sauce added a ton of flavor, almost overwhelmingly so. The bacon slaw was very vinegary but didn't add much bacon flavor unfortunately. The onion straws added a nice crunch, and the smoked gouda was great on its own but was a little overwhelmed by all the other flavors of the burger. The burger was pretty good overall, but between the BBQ sauce, slaw, and 6-7 pickles it had a strong vinegar taste, which I didn't mind but would be something to look out for. Fair warning: do not order this burger if on a first/second date, it is BIG and it is very, very messy so you may look like a fool eating it. The sweet potato fries I receive on the side were average- solid portion, crispy, and decent tasting but nothing that would blow you away.  My server at the bar was nice, but I was a little surprised that my burger took over 20 minutes to come out once ordering considering it was fairly early and the restaurant wasn't very busy at the time. Overall the food was good but not great, service was pretty solid, and for $14 I got filled up on a huge burger, so just slightly above average for me. This place is a little funky as well with funny posters and fish tanks all around. I think that's the biggest thing going for it- you can get decent quality burgers and (I'm assuming) decent sushi at the same place, which is just a bit funky in itself.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Big Squeal with sweet potato fries
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Big Squeal- pulled pork, onion strings, Gouda, bacon slaw

bCsnZ4V4-J1ODW8fQFGdhQ.text: First time here; ordered the bacon truffle fries (insane deliciousness) and the black truffle cheese burger with edamame. I will be back to try the other burgers that caught my eye like the Mediterranean lamb burger and their sushi!

sIySpxmvXj_5TZnQTYLqLw.text: I truthfully can say that the service is outstanding and the foods are great. I tried crab rangoon and it was tasty. In addition, I bought rock shrimp but it was ordinary. Had a fantastic time! I would certainly return here.

1IOXI5IIHq8pzbGCItfBOg.text: I heard so many great things about this place. Finally got to try it out. I dont know why I waited so long. Went there for a girls night even though I dont eat sushi there was plenty of other options to eat. The crab wanton dip and calamari was amazing nice and fresh !!. I had a great the cbclt burger which was good. My girls had sushi and they loved it.  I would go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cbclt burger

unsFUbt-L4VYBxU_Xc5Rng.text: I had the chance to sample a burger with Boursin cheese (the first time I'd ever heard of that type of cheese) at #yelpgetslucky! It was delicious!! I can't wait to come into the restaurant for the full experience! Y'all are definitely on my list of places to visit! See ya soon!

_X1reKkoOtpvN4bb9QjL8Q.text: I have honestly gave up coming to eat the Cowfish. The food is great but the restaurant refuses to take reservations and wait times are insane. Once you sit (average time waited for me was at a minimum of 45 minutes) then you will enjoy a great meal with an average service. I think the restaurant should start taking reservations that way everyone can enjoy their meal. Waiting for long it is not a good way to enjoy the great burger this place has to offer. They have an app which you can use to place your name on the waitlist but the app is only available for Apple iPhone and there is no way to know how long you are going to wait. It is driven by the size of the fish. Really really stupid! And also by doing an app only for Apple, they are automatically excluding other customers to have the opportunity to put the name on the list as they don't take call ahead seating. tripadvisor.com/ShowUser...

dRUrpUynaLLPU3Z_IKccJQ.text: Asked a local about a good sushi joint.  I was recommended Cowfish but thought the name may leave a little to be desired.  Made the trip and was glad I did.  Told the waitress what I wanted but asked her to order one more roll of her liking.  She ordered "The Boss" and I would have to agree with her on that selection.  Thank you again

R1J5SebN7aJLFuC7dVKqAA.text: Start with the Coconut Battered Onion Rings. They are thick cut onion rings, battered with panko and shredded coconut. They taste great alone or with the chile pepper sauce.  I get the Nigiri-Sashimi Combo. It has an 8 piece California roll, 6 pieces of Sashimi (tuna and salmon), and 3 pieces of Nigiri (1 each - tuna, salmon and yellowtail).   It takes a long time to get seated on a Saturday night, which is to be expected (1-1.5 hours). If you give the hostess your cell number, the reservation system will text you 10 minutes before your table is ready. That leaves time to walk over to the South Park Mall.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is the Nigiri-Sashimi Combo. Life is good!

q6Nv0FdrzbH_Xbuzosr_eA.text: Just had a layover in Charlotte, a big favorite city of mine and based on Yelp reviews, I decided to give The Cowfish a try.  Very happy I did.  This has become my new favorite place to go when I'm in Charlotte.  I had a blackened Tuna BLT with sweet potato fries and the squid salad as an app along with their Mango Ice tea.  Tuna is sushi grade and was done to perfection with just the right amount of seasoning.  The sauce went very well with the sandwich and there was certainly no skimping on the fish.  I also watched the many different entree's being delivered around me and everything looked great.  They've got lots of great sushi rolls and If your a sushi fan like I am take a look at some of these photos other folks have taken.  It all looks good. Next trip to Charlotte, I know where I'll be dining.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Tuna BLT
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Squid Salad

W4ZP-JSZ2-WwsjDiIsdtPg.text: A great combination of sushi and burgers with an extensive wine and beer list. Definitely worth going to on a date or nice lunch out with people. There is usually a wait here, so plan to get there a little early. I love fusion theme combining the burgers with the sushi- very cleverly executed.

eF0pw89tGQq0uygUBueRMg.text: Visited from out of town and instantly wanted to try this place from looking at the menu online. I can't remember the last time I had such a fantastic meal!  Ahi tuna nachos were outstanding. Delicious blend of flavors. Got a Burgushi-- as strange as it sounds, was soo good! Also had the firecracker roll per waiter suggestion and was dead on with flavor.   If I lived here I would most certainly be a frequent flyer..  Still drooling over my dish!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

tnFI1u3p3JGHZkiapFPmJA.text: I'm all about the Jalapeno Popper Show Stopper! Only thing I've ever had here. Can't bare the thought of trying something else.

BNEpHc2nt9cE0S4ZsVP-5w.text: We went to NC for vacation and decided to come to cowfish after reading the Yelp reviews. Saturday night was a 2 hour wait so we decided to come back for lunch on Sunday. It was pretty empty at 11:30 but had a 15 minute wait by the time we left.  We had an amazing server named Brian. He was nice and attentive without being overbearing. Also the manager came over and told us that they are expanding with plans to open up some more restaurants in other states and DC.   The crab rangoon dip was very delicious. We tried the ultimate bento box which was a great mix of burger and sushi. We got the boss and tropical storm which were not only pretty but the fish tasted really fresh. We didn't love the taste explosion that much.  At the end of the day, the food was delicious, service was amazing and the concept is unique. People should give it a try.

O1NZZLXpOZ-2X3R-pZaLdg.text: This place is a MUST.......If you are in the area and like Sushi you must try this place!  The atmosphere is great, services was good and the people are friendly.   Just Go.

lvjJbCr7a6zboBtbcXRZPg.text: So far, the most interesting menu in Charlotte. They have standard sushi and standard burgers, but then there's these other menus that are absolutely wild. I really enjoyed it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

nCWMwlpZkr0b26OdgfFFFA.text: I recently moved to Charlotte and instantly fell in love with South Park, especially because The Cowfish is within walking distance from my home. It's a must try and the crab Rangoon is to die for. The best I ever had!! Oh and be sure to try the three drunkin elves as well. What a drink! Don't want to spoil the surprise. Just try it!!

ZTcpHiXxmBEqk5V1qSXMYA.text: Great food. Very busy and long wait for a Sunday night. Waitress messed up order but fixed it

RiOfnbSWgoBd954dPbTrMQ.text: Had a great "lunch date" with my 5 year old here the other day! They got us in and out in time for our appointment.  Food was fantastic and we sat by the fish tank which was great entertainment for us- they even fed the fish while we were there so she could see them eat.  Thanks to Drew the bartender and the manager Ron for a great experience! We will be back for sure!

Cum5M5U_g5ryApTxp5Cqhw.text: We went to Cowfish last night for dinner and were told that for a table for two, the wait was 1hr and a 1/2.  We went and stood next to a wall and had a couple of drinks while we waited. This was at 6:30 pm. At 8:45 pm we still had not been seated and left. The seating hostesses were flippant and rude and despite how good the food is, we will not be back!  Marcus and Gwen responded to me right away and wanted to make our experience right. Great follow up and genuine concern! Thank you for the great customer service and appreciation!

DPg_jVHIItCygvYTNiWJFQ.text: We were looking for a spicy burger and had the jalapeno burger and found it delicious but lacking in spice. So we asked for a special sauce from the chef. It came out AMAZING! Cowfish has officially made a repeat customer out of us. The only downside is the menu is too big.

e1jpJuRC6voikAyZn9Uw_A.text: Sushi and service were great.  However, the wait took forever for a Monday night and the type of people there were the "I have too much money to be polite to anyone" types to others and staff.  I would not hold it against Cowfish but I could do with more patrons learning some manners.

hFxuQmTpKnWnQ4Rx9hE-Yg.text: Love the burgers; sushi selection is good.  I've heard they have good milkshakes too!  Cute, unique restaurant.

VnvylzORnSULQmym1E6Yjg.text: Stopped by with the family after shopping @ South Park and had a great meal. I ate the Texan burger and my wife ate a combo type meal (filet with sushi). She loved it! Cool atmosphere but had the kids so only one drink type night. I'd recommend it for sure!

Alp8nZCVj1gqF6-brHu2MQ.text: I am constantly impressed by their customer service and amazing food. I swear they don't let anyone leave unhappy. How can you when the burgers are that good and the service is just fantastic! Thank you Cowfish!!

nyKN1H3q1hj7khHCBG2DhQ.text: Some of the best sushi in Charlotte. Very creative rolls, good service, & nice atmosphere. My only complaint would be there are maybe too many options? Not really a bad thing, it just makes it tough to decide cause it all sounds amazing.

HvE5Q2yTGEcFiovTt0x8Lg.text: I would have givin Cowfish only 4 stars for a couple of minor things that bothered me about coming here....but thankfully the food makes up for any negatives that arose. I've been here twice and both times it was packed like a damn sardine can. New Years night I was able to find a seat at the bar fairly quickly and to my pleasant surprise they've got an interactive  game screen set up where you can play games like checkers, connect four, and some other random atari type things on the table while you wait for your food and drinks. I don't remember the name of the martini that I ordered, but it tasted like cucumber and was very delicious and refreshing. The massive sushi roll, aptly named "Foreplay" and well worth the money and topped with fried oysters (yumm!), was the most amazing I've ever had. I would not order the fried pickles again. They were bland without any type of seasoning, and served entirely way too hot to eat in large bowl with 2 kinds of house dipping sauces.  Its been a few months since I was there but I'm definitely going back again because the food here is just too outstanding to stay away from.

kI_wZvb8_pUeSecuJ6d-Vw.text: all of the burgers were calling my name. but i went with the one that i've never seen before - the mediterranean lamb burger.   cooked perfectly, a perfect melange of tastes and flavors and spices and... awesomeness. with a side of sweet potato fries? oh be still my heart!  it was amazing. i really was interested in trying a combo, because, uh.... sushi and burgers? that's .... different. next time. this is a really really fun kitschy place!!!! mmmmmmmmmmm burgers! and sushi!

11w4eWDUazWrITBOAtYLxA.text: Great food.  So many options to choose from. Had the Ultimate Brento Bento box so could have a little bit of it all. Burger and sushi. It was all great. I think next time I will go with all sushi as it was very good sushi.

NIuH6GV-nNZF56RJzyh4Lw.text: First, I have to say, the staff here was fabulous! So helpful! I loved the options, huge menu of sushi, burgers, and Burgushi (burgers w/o the bun, wrapped in rice)! We tried a little of everything, cheeseburger, fusion rolls, burgushi fusion bento box. Even the kids were happy. Lots of personality, even the bathroom was interesting with crazy sayings piped in. Can't wait to visit again! I hear there'll be a second location opening next year...RALEIGH!

_gVmUbDaTuZrWgJI-YeF_g.text: Skeptical.  That's the one word I would use to describe my pre-visit thoughts on Cowfish.  I'm so tired of fusion restaurants.  Remember Limp Bizkit and Korn?  They couldn't do one thing well so they decided to go the fusion route and made a shitty mess (along with Creed) of the late-90s music scene.  Do you see where I'm going with this?  Always the cynic, I feel that fusion restaurants take the easy route and mix things together so they don't have to actually be good at something.  To me, fusion and heavy sauces can both be listed under the heading:  How To Cover All Your Cooking Sins.    Cowfish is different.  Cowfish is Led Zeppelin.  Blues/rock.  Burger/sushi.  Cowfish rocks.    I went 100% fish on my visit here, so I'll have to contribute a later review of the burgers.  I used to date a girl who said "if you're going to be a bear, be a grizzly."  Go big or go home.  Ginny and I got our grizzly on and went straight for The Motherload.  This enormous roll showcases every type of fish on the Cowfish menu (as well as a piece of rare roast beef).  The menu touted that "the presentation will blow you away."  They do not tell a lie.  The presentation was beautiful and I will be bold enough to state that Cowfish's fish quality is equal to that of Nikko's.  Prior to eating said roll, we considered ordering the tuna nachos but shied away due to the presence of rangoon sauce on the nachos.  Rangoon is a really fun word to say, but mayonnaise is quite possibly the most foul substance on the face of the earth.  Our thoughts changed, however, when our neighbors to the right ordered the nachos.  Delicious.  I try to avoid listing every last detail of a dish when writing my reviews (leaving me more room to comment on music and my personality shortcomings), so I'll simply say that you should try these nachos when you visit Cowfish.  But between this day and that, say "rangoon" as often as possible and thank all that is holy for not having to see Fred Durst on the TV anymore.

cGl3Mr-R9QPCSuCWkHJYSw.text: Awesome concept!! Love the combination of sushi and land.. I love my spicy tuna roll, but I tried the prime time roll with filet and lobster... Amazing!! Service was awesome and the outside patio was great!! Will definitely return!

zOycCdSyOJd8HX1TiHCOUA.text: Burgers and sushi were awesome.  Burgushi is kind of scary though- will try next time.

VqJ4ap9QOWnwF-xvEhq79w.text: We had a great time eating here with our kids while in Charlotte! It is always hard to find healthy kid friendly food while traveling and this place has it figured out. They have these great bento boxes that made the kids and us happy. The sushi and burgers were good too. Now we just wish you all would open one in Atlanta!

4mRIwb-d5-0ijSn8c9cB1Q.text: I've been here a couple times, and although it's a bit pricy, they have quality food and the portions are large.  For their burger, I tried the Hunka Hunka Burn'n Love, which was good, but make sure you like sweet before you order this one, because it's super sweet due to the Hawaiian bread, fried banana and peanut butter.   The seaweed salad was good and crunchy, but share it with other people at your table if you expect to finish it off and still have room for your meal.  The sushi rolls have been good each time, except the Yellowtail was VERY hard and low on flavor, totally opposite of all other sushi places in town.

EbXzDXVcrKi73Y329vLmNw.text: We stayed in the area for a long weekend. So many people told us about the Resturant the food was tasty. The menu was not just sushi but a variety of things. Beef, chicken and fish. While it does get crowded you might be able to find a seat at the bar that looks like it wraps around the place. The drinks aren't the greatest but the foods makes up for it. I can't wait to go back.

nAqe72uvHLrTV4qffgHO_Q.text: Cowfish was a unique blend of sushi and burgers!  We enjoyed our meals and would definitely go back! We were a bit envious of the table next to us though, as their server was very knowledgeable and explained most of the menu to them. We leaned in and listened to what their server was recommending!  We started with the Lobster and crab spring rolls. They were excellent! I love the cilantro pesto and the Thai chili sauce that came with it! My companion ordered the Cowfish Original Burger with a whole wheat bun. Which also gave the option to build your own! There are so many substitutions/ additions to choose from to personalize your burger! The options were limitless! He also got the crispy onion strings as his side dish. They were thinly breaded and crispy, very nice! But too much to finish! They left off the Cowfish sauce and grilled onions, so he was a bit disappointed about that! But still was a pretty good burger.  I ordered a "burgushi" which was called The Nature Boy's WOOOOO-shi BuffalOOOOO-shi Roll! haha! This roll included sauteed chipotle bison, fried green tomato, grilled onions and feta cheese rolled inside, then coated with crispy tempura flakes. The roll is topped with fresh green tomato, chipotle aioli, diced tomato and red onion, and thinly sliced jalapeno pepper. It was very different and excellent! I really loved the it! We had a good experience and would recommend it!

qqE0hvOe55Dknx84Ph-wQQ.text: Wait is usually insane and the inside can be pretty noisy, but other than that, no complaints! The build your own sushi option (what i usually go for) is perfect with plenty of options. And the fries are amazing! I can't wait to go back!

I9JESucvC51ddIIu810Eig.text: Great customer service, but okay food. They have a lot of different options for food and can be over bearing with that many options. The sushi was good but a highly priced.  They are a fusion restaurant but with all the different choice only a few were fusion. I got a burger and it was good however it didn't rest and all the juice from the burger went all over my plate so I couldn't even put it back on the plate otherwise the bun would have been soggy. Luckily I had a side plate for the sushi.   The manager came over to check how everything was. We told him we had just moved to the area. He was nice, chatted with us for while and even offered us a welcome to Charlotte shake. We didn't take him up on the offer as we were too full. It was a very nice gesture however.

EF7vgomJve-oa4oSgW4LnA.text: Amazing!   This place is now one of my favorite places. The service is impressive. Our server, Caryn, was top notch. Thank you Caryn.  The food is outstanding. The calamari are great. The edamame were excellent.   My niece had a simple burger, which she liked.  Caryn helped my niece customize her order.   We adults had the Riverboat Ron Roll and the Firecracker Roll. Both are so good and satisfying.  Besides being super delicious, the Riverboat Ron helps the Humane Society.   As if fabulous food and service were not enough, the place is very cool and hip.   There is also free WiFi available.   I'll definitely be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

tJn5psUUTbOCll4h3-zKdg.text: I've been to CowFish I don't know how many times any chance I get to go I take it. Everyone whom I've gone with loves this place. My favorite menu item is the Jalapeno popper show stopper burger (pictured) I love the name as well. It tastes exactly like a jalapeno popper! Also tastes just as good with grilled chicken. I've also tried a few milkshakes the rice crispy one is my favorite. I've tried the chocolate cake the moose is on the loose and it was just ok... the fried pickles and peppers are my favorite app. I definitely recommend this place. Can't say enough good things about it. The staff is amazing and very helpful if you have questions and want to switch things up!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jalapeño popper show stopper burger, fries and cucumber salad yummy my go to!

aQ3JYECrdP-KP9Eh2A-tqA.text: I have to say, when I don't get sick from the food. It is quite delicious. But after 2 out of the 3 times that I have been to this restaurant I had gotten sick, I'm ready to say it is by no coincidence. Maybe one day I'll be back to test my luck for the 4th time.

WS1mJ9sFd1nxgncLYXvi2Q.text: Really enjoyed this place! Fun environment in a great location. We sat outside and had a great time! Server was super sweet and attentive! Food was SO good! Can't wait to move to Charlotte to come back to this place! Highly recommend!

bFdunbw473LRW8oevsu5sA.text: Some of the BEST restuarant service you will everrrrrr receive!!! Anywhere in the world!!! By chance (I think based on sitting at the edge of the sushi bar by the kitchen) I had like 4 different ppl all helping and checking on me. All equally amazing, attentive (Becca, Paul, Brandon, Jess-Manager) and catering to my every need. I came for the Doug's Fillet Sushi Roll (AhMazIng) as I had been craving it all week. It did not disappoint. A waiter walked past w the Salmon BLT and fried pickles (I typically would never get fried pickles but so glad I did. The juiciness of the pickles is a lovely balance to the fried batter but not in a slimey way). It was all delish- salmon melts in your mouth. I will be back- again and again and again lol

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Doug&#39;s Sushi
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon BLT- medium rare

_q1fX7opYfUrOcvFpaQ_oQ.text: Looked up at Yelp and found this place outside the mall. The restaurant has an unique name and the decoration inside was very interesting. We ordered Spicy Poke Dip (Spicy tuna, salmon & yellow tail sitting on top of seaweed salad and pickled cucumber) as appetizer.  You use the wanton chip to scoop it up, and it tasted delicious. The dinner entree choices were Mediterranean Lamb Burger (medium rare) and  Fusion Speciality Bento Box (with Noursin Bacon Burger & Gitecracker Roll). The bento option comes with three sides, and we choose fried sweet potato, pickled Thai cucumber and edamame. Overall, it was a wonder dining experience. By the way, the Jessamine Green Tree was great, and they served it in tea leaves.

RTjybSsouc-GXG8SDB5FKA.text: Some of this best Asian Fusion around! We LOVE their sushi there, as well as their bar selection and their Asian- American burger selections. The service is always spot on, as well as the atmosphere. BE SURE TO MAKE A RESERVATION!!! If not, the wait can be upwards of two hours! This place is POPULAR! Everyone from trendy hipsters to folks wanting to have a romantic dinner visit this spot. If you're not impressed by the ambiance, then the fare will surely win you over. But we've never been disappointed in either!

_sITaFBGgWQ7cdg6QBR2Yg.text: My current favorite place in Charlotte. Crab Rangoons are amazing, Bison burgers are out of this world. Servers are 1st rate. Went for my birthday dinner this year. Probably my 4th time eating here. Our group of 6 ordered everything from Sushi to burgers, nobody came away disappointed.

nGpButNNkY7nOv9-nopDFg.text: This is my favorite place to eat so of course this is where I wanted to spend my birthday! Every time I go it's an awesome experience and the food is always amazing. On my birthday I had asked our server how much the cowfish tees were and he told me $10. After we were seated he asked what the occasion was and I said my birthday! He ended up giving me a free tee when they came out to sing happy birthday! It made my night! Side note: be sure to go on a Tuesday for half price martinis!

SY1N5u1kcfhI9rgT4AQ6tg.text: This is one of my favorite Charlotte restaurants. I've never had anything bad there. The burgers are good, the sushi is great. What more can you ask for?  The coconut shrimp roll (I forget the name) was one of my new favorite rolls. I also discovered that you can order a roll half and half so that you can try more rolls. The bento box is also one of the best deals and a great way to try a lot of different things. The parmesan truffle fries and crab rangoon dip are also awesome. My absolute favorite thing on the menu is the All Shook Up milkshake. It's peanut butter, banana, and jelly and it's the best milkshake I've ever had.   The big downside is that it's always packed and you will probably have to wait a while for a table unless you come during off hours.   All in all this is a great restaurant and you can't go wrong with anything you order!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. All shook up shake
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. What&#39;s shakin tuna bacon
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

LlkSyZPx84uMtCqXpkr9RA.text: My oh my, what a concept! I was intrigued as soon as I heard the name and knew we had to try it as soon as we arrived in Charlotte.   The place was already packed but we were lucky enough to find two seats at the bar. The restaurant from the bar looked modern and eclectic and I loved the bold artwork on the walls. The fish tank by the bar was quite beautiful as well.   After looking over their expansive menu of you guessed it, burgers and sushi (and more). We decided to try the best of both worlds by ordering a traditional sushi roll and a roll under their "burgushi." Both rolls were phenomenal and the burgushi, also served with a side of fries, was like no sushi we've ever had. Imagine a Big Mac in sushi form. Strange but in the best way possible.   Hands down, Cowfish Sushi Burger is a must try in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

0GfQ7YJDjWaxsGfz7O1xmQ.text: Burger or sushi? Why choose? How about some burger-sushi mashup ? During my stay in Charlotte, few people described Cowfish as one of Charlotte's attractions. I was anxious to give it a try.  I ordered the All- AmericanDouble CheeseBurgooShi (without bacon), and I wasn't prepared for a burger and sushi to be combined in this creative and, seemingly, crazy way.  The seasoned all natural beef was wrapped in in soy paper & potato curls like a sushi roll, then topped with ketchup, mustard and dill pickle. Honestly, I'm not sure if I enjoyed it as much as I hoped I would. It was overwhelming. Also, I'm not sure if I'll have it again- cool concept though.  Three Yelps.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburgooshi

pyfz9FOM4b3cO9gKIeIPHg.text: I would give this place a 4.7! But 5/5 is close enough.   The services is always great. Our servers are always nice to us and attentive.  The food is always consistent.  Things to try: Burger, marks roll, fries (regular and sweet potato), and spring rolls.  Drinks are always unique and tasty.

i8DOktYxV4wmoQ7HCj9mKw.text: Well worth the wait i think? lol.. So the reasoning for saying i think, is because the next day i had heartburn out of no where which i have never had before. It could have been what i ordered but i loved every bit of it! I had the American Cheeseburgushi roll. Sounds cool right? Well that's because it was. It was actually amazing the whole concept of a hamburger and sushi all smooshed in one a very unique idea and was worth every penny. My friend ordered the prime time lobster roll, when i asked her how did she like hers she said its amazing! Well there you have it. Sums it all up the food here is great and i especially loved my drink it was very refreshing a cucumber martini which on the drink menu its called cucumber tini. Something tells me all of the drinks here are probly pretty darn good.

RKSzVpfbK4EqONyUHUaFMA.text: One word to describe this place, "BURGUSHI"!  Such a crazy cool concept of a mixing a sushi place with a gourmet burger spot.   This is one of my favorite places to take friends when they come in town to visit.  For first timers I definitely recommend going for one of the bento boxes.  You get the best of both worlds with the slider of the week and a few pieces of a specialty roll. If you're feeling adventurous you can just jump straight to the burgushi which is where they use ingredients that would normally make a burger and turn it into a delicious sushi roll!  The only downside to this place is that it can sometimes be tough to get a table.  Which is just a testament to how good the food is!!  Tip: Half price martinis on Tuesdays!!! #YoureWelcome

W6XofDkQkPoaDyhUhmd_Yg.text: Do you ever have a craving for a burger but also want sushi?? Well if you do this is the place to be! We came on a Sunday around 12pm and it was poppin! The lady at the front said it'd be a 15 minute wait but had a table ready in 5 minutes.   We were sat near the door, so a little chilly (because it was in the 30s that day) but would be a perfect spot in the spring/summer time! The waiter was so friendly and patient with us. The menu has so many choices that it took us a little longer to decide! I wanted sushi but the burger of the week had bacon and it sounded delicious (It started with a B I'm sorry I can't remember the name of it!!). I wanted the lobster sushi roll but decided to go with the bento box. I was hesitant with getting it because I was afraid there wouldn't be enough food and the sushi I wanted wasn't one of the ones to choose from (although I'm sure you'd be able to get the sushi you wanted but I didn't ask!! Ask away if you want a different kind!!).   THERE IS SO MUCH FOOD IN THE BENTO BOX!!! Goodness I was surprised. Sweet potato fries were delicious, fried pickles were tasty, and the edamame was different but I liked it. I got the sushi with an avocado topping. The sushi was good but I wasn't the biggest fan of the avocado stuff and I like avocados. The burger was juicy and seasoned very well. Overall, if you can't choose one thing, trust me you will be happy with the bento box!! Oh and I almost forgot, we got the garlic truffle fries. Do yourself a favor and get the garlic truffle fries!! They were so amazing!   Finally, the waiter was super nice. Again, I can't believe I forgot his name, but I believe it was Joshua? He was great and made our visit enjoyable!! This place is worth a try if you are in the area or looking for a new place to try!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

prqnPJmlxk8nUsMM3yAAew.text: For some reason, the wait times here are often astronomical. I blame it on 1) the lack of similar options across Charlotte and 2) the vast number of trendy yuppies and consultants out and about on any given week night. If you have to wait more than 15-20 min, I don't think it's worth your time (but that's how I feel about any restaurant).   If you DO manage to snag a table, Cowfish is great! Their punny decor cracks me up, and the food is pretty good. I end up going with a bento box almost every time, because there are just so many options on the menu that I have trouble making a decision. At least the bento box includes a few options in one. Plus, the edamame & sweet potato fries are super addicting.

-C61F7l7OCSAhHifvUEeIA.text: This whole concept is very fun!  Crab rangoon dip - while it was good (especially the orange sauce on top of the chip part) - I think I missed the hype. An overall decent app, but I think there are others on the menu that would outshine ((side note: I LOVE crab rangoon - I will order them 9/10 times when on the menu). The slightly more expensive bento box is the way to go - the slider of the week was awesome, the sweet potato fries are delicious, the cucumbers have a little zing, the sushi was decent, and those were some of the best fried pickles I've had! I also tried the vanilla chai tea - very flavorful, and I love how they serve it! I will definitely be back!

sJSrti9evvY6jjEgVdI-mA.text: A little pricey but very good food and great service.  The menu was a little confusing, but the food quality is good. The drinks were good, and the server and manager were quick to correct the little things that didn't come out right.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great sushi

7P1fqddy_ShNsJbs_sATQg.text: Good food and had a fun time. The waiter was very helpful on what to order(this was out first time here me and my boyfriend), but loved the food and the atmosphere. Will come again!

njtljc3yPqRtP0hd6cLW5Q.text: I try to stop by whenever I'm In this area of Charlotte. There's something novel about eating a slider and sushi during the same meal, but it works...even though you can order just a burger or just sushi, I usually end up getting the bento combo that includes both, along with a salad, edamame, and sweet potato fries...a ton of food that I never end up finishing. I like the cheeky sayings on their chopsticks, and with their fun colorful decor.  Sure, it's not the most authentic sushi, but their fish is fresh, and their food is well made and tasty.  The bar is very comfortable to eat at, as a frequent solo traveler to Charlotte for business.

gJm5unFDQszHTSa3TTWbng.text: Amazing food for everyone!  The deliverance roll was delicious as were the blackened tuna nachos. Will definitely visit again. Prepare for a wait time though, but it's well worth it.

bRBJj7424w-Asn9II9_XOQ.text: After the outbreak it hasn't been the same. The food is always good especially the calamari but the service is lack luster which doesn't match the value of the food.

3Nxi5qcV60ajets4udqnnA.text: Great service  Love their food  Great prices comparing to the taste. Enjoying going there frequently

za0CLTpkbkpPJMP0_zabtg.text: The goat cheese salad is delicious but a tad bit expensive for its simplicity -- $17! The service was a bit slow for the amount of people at the restaurant though. Waitress and hostess staff were nice.

twlzbwLxA_UU1Ua2FeqxEA.text: This is our spot to splurge on great sushi! My husband planned a luncheon to celebrate Mother's day. My request after giving birth. Standards were kinda high for not allowed any for months, I was dying for some but sushi was amazing!!! Our waitress was also great. We had poke app, crab Rangoon app, sashimi, rolls and a burger. Tried others but not as satisfying.   I think there's another location affiliated closer to us but not as great, we would travel the distance to go back.

eoxrg3-YAH7fLyaua7ZMtQ.text: I like this place! I've been there a couple of times already and I've had both the burgers and the sushi, both are delicious and were prepared correctly. The service was knowledgeable and prompt, although the hostess thought she was fabulous but whatevs, great humor for the group! Overall, 2 thumbs up, I recommend, and will definitely be back!

5BNRQdr7uN3ZGybg4E8N3g.text: You can not say enough good things about this place! It's a happy medium for me and my husband he loves sushi and I love burgers. I think burgushi was kinda crazy then I tried it and I love it! If you haven't trained their truffle fries you have to go!

utJIb_og4-W5ziO34vhx_w.text: One of my favorite sushi restaurants in charlotte! I have been going there for years and all the sushi rolls are fresh and delicious. The apps are amazing as well from the tuna salad, the crab salad and the shishito peppers. There's two hostesses so they're always quick to sit you and the waiters are prompt and informative about all their selections. It's not as busy as it was years ago so to find a seat isn't that hard anymore. Definitely check this spot out when you have time.

YvNO_nmAsTjC_Z3uD-YAIw.text: Went here for a girls night out and it was AWESOME!! The waiting system and time was really efficient bc of the app and when we got inside out waiter was also great even though it was a very busy Saturday night. The food is amazing!! I enjoyed the different variety of food they offered and the portions are nice for the price. Every time I go I'm never disappointed and I always recommend my friends and colleagues to go there as well. If you've never been I recommend getting the app and saving your spot in like then go venture around the mall if you're going to go around a busy time but I've been during lunch time or other non busy times and I was instantly seated. You can also order and take it to go. I definitely recommend Cow Fish!

qgd7vEBRhHS2CDY6W2maVg.text: Pretty unique concept. Execution was not as high as I was expecting given good reviews. Busy place for later on a weeknight, and well sat to keep the vibe high even as the restaurant emptied out a bit. Good atmosphere, loud but not overbearing, lots of energy. Service was super nice, but disappeared at different times. It's nice to have some privacy when eating, but we sat with empty plates for a long time, and it took quite a while to get the check and pay. Food was good, but not great. My burger was undercooked, closer to rare than to medium. Well seasoned though, and the bacon was excellent. We had one of the Cheeseburgooshi rolls, kind of cool though more of a gimmick than an excellent dish.  Not great flavor, but just a regular burger in sushi roll clothes. We also got a normal salmon based roll, which was fine. The sushi seemed fresh enough, and well put together - no complaints there. Came with an aioli, which was an interesting add to sushi, but pretty good. Overall, good vibes, come here to enjoy your self and try the unique concept.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

qanPjq9uyJSJS_LdHhpCuw.text: Love this place. The truffle fries are my favorite. My favorite burger is the jalapeno popper burger. Every time I go I try something different and nothing has disappointed. Service, quality, price is all great. Sometimes depending on when you go there may be a wait, but it's worth the wait.

s_D8ShQpqTuIE99J5e1ZTg.text: Sushi Burger Bar. Sushi, check. Burgers, check... both are good... what is missing is the fusion of the two. I had to invent my own burger. I had them make me a burger and top it with California roll ingredients on a ramen noodle bun.  On another trip, spicy tuna on a burger. I'd love to see a roll with ground beef and topped with fish.

a7cAG6iWZ4fuBV7kpB6FfA.text: We always come here when we're in Charlotte. Great food, service, and ambience. Sometimes twice in the same trip. Don't miss this dining experience.

nCNyEznRrN1vy3RRhfLS2A.text: If you come at rush hour expect to have a wait. Once seated the service was excellent can't say enough about the attentiveness. Cooper was extremely attentive and made excellent suggestions. I had the sushi and the Food was very fresh. The only small ding I would give was the music was a little loud that resulted in people talking loud over it. I asked if they could turn it down some and they were very happy to. Once it was turned down you could carry on a conversation. I will be back and will recommend to friends. Put this place on your must try and be willing to experiment with your sushi!!
