e1_09c-y83yivSwWoIOPKw.text: Great food and fantastic atmosphere!! Went on a Wednesday so all wine bottles were 1/2 off. I had the fusion speciality bento box and can't wait to go back and try it again!

KC1E-GG1RohG046tbIaxIw.text: This place is fantastic! I highly recommend the bento boxes. You get a mini burger and a roll of your choice of sushi ( I always get the shrimp tempura roll) also try the milkshakes, they're perfect for sharing.

UexuaZ1rvWJb-Sh-rCA6dQ.text: This place has good good and caters to a diverse market. I'd recommend this if there trying to get your parents to embrace sushi, but if you try want sushi or burgers, there are better options here in South Park.

VDz7VD1LRVC3vUVdqkWD0g.text: Excellent atmosphere, they serve great variety of burgers and sushis, outdoor patio is always very relaxing, I don't come here that often but when I come I'm never disappointed.  I'll definitely recommend Cowfish. Next time I'm there I'll add some pictures.

VasopP1w6_TWQZQoS1_-ew.text: This place was great! Staff was quick and always checked on us. I also have the hamburgushi and the cucumber salad. So good!!! A little on the higher end price wise and we waited almost an hour for a table, but overall I will be going back for the amazing food!

fx9j1Jmh7u_pMJ0id9G-wA.text: First, let me say that my 3 stars is because I really do love sushi.  Real sushi.  So, I can easily see that if you're just a sorta sushi fan, then you're going to love Cowfish because you can throw it in your sushi-eating friends' faces and say you eat sushi, too!  Burger sushi!  It is a very fun atmosphere.  The waitstaff is very friendly.  Good music.  Even a cute graphic display to show your wait for your table (look for the big video monitor showing the swimming fish).  They even use your cell phone to text you.  As a beef eater, I'd say the food is pretty good.  It's not Ruth Chris, but it's a fusion between beef and sushi, so I did try the Taste Temptation, which is beef, tomatoes and rice, and found it decent.  Of all the things I had, they did have a really good crab and lobster shrimp roll for an appetizer.  Quite big and very tasty.  Also, had a great wine selection, definitely one of those more than full bar places.

3ULHi6OhYsgblr9bx2NPGg.text: CowFish is how can I say it ??? "The BEST of ALL WORLDS when it comes to a large variety of food types.  They have everything from Bison to Salmon. I mean EVERYTHING & where have you ever seen a SushiBurger? WoW is a great word for this place as far as food & AWESOME/COOL is a word that describes the decor (pictures) & the multi-lingual restroom statements which can catch you off guard however they are HILARIOUS . I find myself going to the restroom & taking my slow time in order to laugh a couple of times ;-) The only con I can think about is the LONG WAIT TIMES.. This place is SUPER popular & on weekends & any given evening or lunch hour expect a 40 plus minute wait for a party of as little as 3.. I'm a Pescatarian & this place is perfect for dinner with my husband & daughter because they eat all types of meat and me ONLY seafood.  Items we suggest as a family (some collectively & others individually ): Lamb burger - Medium Well Firecracker Salmon & Blue Crab rolls Lump crabcake with Fried Green Tomatos Classic CowFish Beef Burger Salmon Salad Calamari Several of the specialty rolls - Too many to list & quite honestly I don't know all the names I just do INI - MINI - MyNee - MO  Great restaurant with great service!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef CowFish burger/string fries , Lamb burger(swiss, grilled onions &amp; mushroom)sweet potato fries &amp; Lobster/Crab spring rolls

cqEWwtG45Xo5VHYGPWU3Lw.text: So. Many. Options!!! This place gets high marks for a really wide array of food options even if it is a little overwhelming.   It was packed when we arrived on a Sunday night but we got around the 1.5 hour wait time by stalking people at the bar. We snagged 3 seats together and my daughter played video games (embedded in the bar) while we looked at the extensive menu.  If you are gluten-free: THEY'VE GOT YOUR BACK. They know what IS and IS NOT gf and their menu is pretty clear. Any questions and they ask the chef.   We got burgers and make your own sushi. The food was amazing and the service was excellent! Great atmosphere, easy parking, and an overall great restaurant. Wish we had one in Atlanta!

S0MeLtjx-K1AndJ9gFsMoQ.text: Yes, I have been converted...Cowfish has officially won me over!   My husband and I have returned a few times since my last review and each time was a great experience. The most memorable one was when we brought our out-of-town guests for dinner. We wanted to take them to a fun place with high energy and that would stand out from any other restaurant...and boy were we right!  Our guests loved the variety and the fun, yet strange options of hamburgers and fish in the same menu. They were also impressed with the language lesson in the bathroom and the touch screens at the bar.   We ordered 5 sushi rolls to share. We had a slight issue with one of the rolls and immediately our server and owner took ownership and made sure that the one hiccup didn't ruin the rest of our dining experience. In fact, the excellent service made the night even more impressive...our guests were shocked at how caring the service was! By the way, they make their roll slices pretty big...if you want more bite-sizeable, ask for them to cut it into more pieces.  You have to make sure to get a spiked milkshake for dessert...the chocolate one (can't remember the name) was by far the best one! Yummy!!  If you want to impress your guests, Cowfish is the way to go.

0HZWZuTyqgqwsQmA14SSBA.text: It's still a treat to come to cowfish, but the service was a bit disappointing my last visit. Waited at the bar for our table, per usual decent wait procedure, and took forever to get anything. We had 6 people in our group this visit, and 3 bartenders were in front of us, very busy. But not even a "hello, I'll be right with you" occurred.   Once seated, I think the waitress we had was new, or at least I hope she was, because getting the right utensils and sushi dishes was a struggle.   Another thing is, the menu has not changed much either as of late, which I thought was part of their concept. Of course they have some home runs on urge menu that shouldn't be touched, but I was expecting some new things.   I will be back and hope for better service and maybe try something new!

9Wbli-ecWMFG6jHZk7BPJQ.text: Enjoyed the Big Squeal burger that's topped with fried onions and bbq. Many choices on their menu. Someone in our party ordered the burgooshi- awesome choice!

WWWRdzWpiW2sZyz4Ch1sLg.text: Let me tell you I have been to two of the three locations of the Cowfish, Orlando, and here in Charlotte.  What can I say but outstanding.  Very rarely do you see me give any place five stars but this place gets it.  Just like the other one the food is amazing! The service was top notch, granted we did go in before the dinner rush but still the service was amazing.  For appetizer's we ordered the Tuna Poke appetizer. It was really good a bit too salty but really good otherwise. We also got the Lobster Egg rolls, let me tell you Amazing in a word, Absolutely amazing.  Flavorful not greasy, real lobster definitely worth getting.  My friend got A jalapeno burger it looked great.  I ventured out and got the Prime Time Roll, lobster and prime rib  on the Burgushi roll.  Was very good, not quite as good as the Taste of Explosion roll but still good.  My friend got the Godiva kiss spiked shake and it looked awesome, and I got the Banana vodka split shake, it was good but a lot of vodka in it.    overall please go here, they are amazing and service, food and quality always on top of it!

8DHTHuCHVApa95BxRsGwTQ.text: I was skeptical after hearing the name, but WOW great food, drinks, and lovely atmosphere with GREAT music.  Walked in around 7pm and it was packed (not surprised). My friends and I stood at the bar until a few seats opened up, the atmosphere was very inviting and not too crammed. Our bartender was quick with our order for drinks and food. Regardless of how many people were there, he took the time to make sure we were enjoying everything and even help set up our first ever Sake bombs... I wish we got his name!   Food was unbelievably good. Three of us shared two appetizers and were pretty full! We had the lobster and crab spring rolls, and the ahi tuna nachos. So fresh and flavorful.   I wish I lived down here because I would go to this place every weekend if I could, thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster and crab spring rolls yummm

f0n88CuZIj5iE64WefZGJw.text: The Cowfish is centrally located in the South Park Mall. I've been to this place three times and was never disappointed. The first time I made my own sushi, which was alright, because I really know nothing about making my own sushi. The next time I had the bento box with California Roll, which was really good. The sides of thai cucumbers and sweet potato fries were delicious, as was the mini burger. My boyfriend had the Jalapeno Popper Show-Stopper, which he enjoyed a lot. The next time we were there he ordered The Nature Boy's WOOOOO-shi BuffalOOOOO-shi Roll, which has bison meat in it and he loved that too. I had the Heavenly Veggie burger which was delicious. So all-in-all, I love this place and think it's a great place to have in the Queen City.  Although if you are going here on weekends, make sure to call ahead since they have long waits.

dVM-qUZabbzs9ez4jbbKMg.text: This is my first visit here. There are 15 of us here for a b day party.   Heres the skinny  Fried pickles are good.  Crispy bagel roll is good.  But my burger was hella awesome good.    But heres the thing.  If the majority of the table orders cold food, dont you think hot food would be cooked last and not left in the window to die?    My burger was luke warm at best but I was starving and not about to send it back.     That really is my only complaint.   I got the jalapeno  burger and seriously it was really good.  I just wish it had come out hot.

eWukN3ioqefphvxYLU7ygQ.text: I was EXTREMELY reluctant to try this place initally. Sushi and burgers? Eww! Wrong on both counts. The first time we went I was cautious and ordered a burger. It was something with truffle cheese and grilled shallots that literally brought a tear of joy to my eye. This time we got sashimi, a Boss roll, saba nigiri, and a spicy yellowtail handroll. Three different kinds of tuna and two different varieties of hamachi made me very, very happy. Then apple wontons for dessert just to keep the smile on my face. All was excellent, and I will definitely be back over and over. My only complaint: it is cold as hell in there. Bring a sweater.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Get. In. My. Belly!

LgPZglXky3Yx7mJT_XAyZg.text: Amazing fun place. If you are looking for a twist on Burgers and Sushi!  Our server Kassy is amazing and friendly

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burgushi with truffle bacon cheese fries
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burgushi
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Georgia Roll

WgupdTU6Rw9E0PwcwWp9Pg.text: If you love eclectic food, this is the place to go! The waiter was welcoming and very knowledgeable of the menu. He informed us of different substitutions to get the best experience of their wide variety. The manager came by to thank us for coming in and gave us a coupon for $5 off $20 on our next visit since it was our first time there. Try one of their box meals on your first visit. It'll allow you to try something from their burger selection, one of their sushi rolls, and three sides. The atmosphere is unique and I'll be going back soon!

mHxq5Y6GQEAC-qKQbNzxgw.text: 2.5 stars.....  Sat in the sushi bar area, at the bar. Cool touch screens built into to counter tops, except they don't work very well at all. Still pretty cool.   LOTS of staff about, except they are all cleaning and not really paying attention to customers.  It took a WHILE to get an order in, couldn't get my check in a timely manner, didn't get my tea refilled....this actually became pretty amusing, then frustrating. It was after traditional lunch hour. (I arrived about 1:40 pm, and the efforts of the employees present were spent on doing everything except looking after me.)  Ordered the lunch special bento box w/burger, which also took a while to receive. HOWEVER, it was really, really good.  So, my experience: Kitchen - "good" -- Service - "Lacking" -- Cleanliness - "good" as I witnessed a LOT of cleaning going on around me, and not-so-much attention to getting me in and out at lunch time.  I will go back when I have lots of time for lunch, and will revise this review if I experience better service next time.

j4oQHHCmw3o1__Ihg2Jzcw.text: This place is awesome!! I've been to the restaurant a number of times (would come more often if I were closer) and it has always been a real treat. The food is delicious and very creative. I usually try to get something new off the menu when I come since there are so many options and everything I've had so far has been delicious. The restaurant is always busy and has a really cool/live vibe inside. It can get loud with the music and all the people, but it sets for a fun environment. I would highly recommend this place if you're in Charlotte.  Food Rating: 5/5 Service Rating: 4/5 Ambiance Rating: 4.5/5

i8n_TZ4iSSuvzdripP56cg.text: This is a really cool place with lots of different and delicious food options.  There are so many potential burgers you can choose from and customize, as well as lots of sushi options.  Aside from the burgers, the highlight for me was the Taste Explosion roll.  It is extremely unique and lives up to its name.  The downside is that this place is normally very crowded, so your wait is long and they will cram you in like sardines.  To avoid eating dinner with complete strangers, I would recommend asking to sit out back on the patio.  The great food (and options) here is worth coming back despite the crowd.

0IycCOZQpS2Ox_J1MjOUzw.text: Went based on reviews and location and we were not disappointed! Fantastic innovative food, reasonable prices, wonderful service. We have absolutely nothing negative to say. A great experience!

uywpZSXJhO5eW4AqJNIwCw.text: The trendy place to be but its really good food too. I get the bento fusion box with Marks roll usually. Plenty of food and it's a perfect combo, four pieces of sushi and a slider burger of the day.   If there is a wait walk all the way around the left and follow the bar. There are sometimes open seats at the bar you can jump in for quicker service.  When you're done you can walk over to Cheesecake Factory for dessert.

IFoA7P4-UdKTXSo2v1PQSg.text: This place is the best of both worlds.  It is the quintessential surf and turf restaurant.  We were fortunate enough to try a number of the "sushi" dishes when they were testing them out at Eez in Huntersville.  My wife and I finally made the trip in to town to try it out first hand and we were amazed.  We tried a couple different things and couldn't find any flaws with anything.  The only downside is that you should be prepared to wait or try to hit it at the right time.  We lucked out and got a couple spots at the bar after 10-15 minutes.  The wait for a table was pushing 2 hours.

KELy0j41UgDfmrB-pbv-mw.text: I got engaged here in 2012. This is our favorite place in Charlotte! We always go halvsies and split a burger and sushi. It's a must everything we are back in Charlotte. There is usually a wait if you are going in the evening (they need a second location, I vote Ballantine.) but I assure you it is well worth it!

M0ulnHWZbGIv7mDoQBP5sA.text: I love the concept of combining the offerings of sushi and burgers (unique!) and also coming up with creative 'fusion' dishes to blend the two. The menu is extensive and has tons of different categories of options. The sushi is mostly tempura stuff, the focus is not on fresh raw fish. And, after taking my chances on midwest/non-coastal area sushi and living in the bay area for a bit, I've become somewhat of a sushi snob unfortunately. SO decided to go for their bison burger (sans buns, it is gluten free!) They also had tons of other great looking beef burgers, a lamb burger, etc. I love that their meat is antibiotic/hormone free.   The bartender who took my takeout order was super friendly and checked with the chef to make sure the meat wasn't seasoned with any gluten, etc. which I really appreciated. I got it with pesto and avocado, and got the cucumber salad on the side. The portion is great, the burger was delightful - perfectly cooked and SO tasty! Would definitely come back here.   Note: the hostess (or whoever picked up the phone that night when I called at first) was really unpleasant. I asked about gluten in their bison burger, pesto, etc. and she kept waving me off saying "I don't think so, I'm sure it's fine." That is NOT what a gluten intolerant person who gets very ill from eating gluten wants to hear!! Finally, after sounding annoyed, she said she'd go ask someone, and then promptly hung up on me. Ruuuuude.

d782S7iRg4sESZgYSqPLHA.text: As you read the other reviews on his place, I'm sure you noticed the 4 and 5 stars.  Let me tell you that they are WELL EARNED.  When in Charlotte, you MUST try this place.  It is so unique.  Who ever heard of burgers and Sushi?    I've had a lot of cheap Chinese food in my life and thus a lot of crab Rangoon.  Their unique take on this Chinese restaurant standard is nothing less of incredible.    The portions are huge.  I'm a big guy and I usually finish my plate.  Not here. LOL!  The staff is extremely friendly and the atmosphere is cool.  If you can't tell, I was blown away by this place.  I wish we had one in Atlanta. Right now, it's only in Charlotte, NC.    Ok, I've said enough. I won't write a book about it but if you are thinking about trying this place, DO THAT!

oKJw1PG3WVVYmhKPcgvtpw.text: We came for a late dinner so there wasn't a wait but the bar seemed about 70% full and there was a  nice number of people still sitting and eating.  Our waitress was great we told her it was our first time and she literally went through the entire menu... I was a bit hesitant to stop her b/c I could have just read the menu but she was in a groove so we let her continue.   I asked for the Mango Iced Tea. The description made it sound delicious but she did warn me that it's not "sweet" tea lol...  she recommended that if I like Mango to try the Mango martini (I'm sure it has another name but that's the gist of it) so I ordered one  of those while my friend ordered a beer.   I thought this place was a good balance between sushi and burgers seeing that my friend isn't a big fan of sushi and I was on the fence with the burgers. I decided on a Burgersushi entree! I had the Mary Had A Little Lamb roll .... The description sold me lamb, feta, olives, capers cucumbers all rolled up into a delicious "sushi" roll! WIN WIN WIN  I do admit the presentation could have been a little better but overall the roll was very yummy!  I will be trying this place again , I would like to try the regular sushi as well as the bento box which was a combo of sushi and a mini burger !

_g9qsd3iDX5_btPqBDp1GQ.text: Incredible place! This has got to be the largest sushi restaurant I have ever been too - so many creative rolls & dishes. And it's not just sushi! Burgers and burgers they refer to as "Burgushi" which is a fusion of a burger and a sushi roll. I can't even begin to capture the essence of this place, other than the sushi bar surrounds the entire interior of the restaurant with a large freshwater tank as the focal point.  Since I don't want to demolish the uniqueness of what they do here is a snip-it from their website:  "The Cowfish brings to the world the first restaurant focusing on offering both the best sushi AND the best burger in town. Fresh, innovative and delicious, the sushi segment of the menu is a unique balance of traditional and unconventional. All natural, creative and hearty, the burgers entice with fresh ingredients and bold flavors. Spiked hand-spun milkshakes, premium sakes, craft beers, wine and 10oz exotic martinis round out a huge bar menu that is sure to please. The Cowfish aims to offer something for the entire family. Scrumptious appetizers for sharing, entree-sized salads, homemade desserts and a fun kid's menu are joined by our signature creations that we call "Burgushi"! A cutting edge fusion of burger and sushi, burgushi items include sushi rolls created using burger components, and pick-up style sandwiches created using sushi components. If you can't make up your mind, try a bento box to sample a mini-burger along with your choice of sushi roll and three tasty side items!"  I had my regular yellowtail sashimi, then a very creative & tasty roll and I absolutely could not pass up the chocolate cake shake... and I'm so glad I didn't.  This is right down the road from me so I plan on becoming a regular!

5XDoCOOmCmF1X-pzBKZFJA.text: While spending a week in Charlotte for work stuff, and after yelping sushi in the area, we decided on Cowfish. The place was super packed for a weekday evening and the wait times were long if you wanted a table (if you sit at the bar you can get a seat in a few minutes).  Their menu is ridiculously huge (and not just in physical size).  There are so many things to choose from-- Sushi- check! Burgers- check! Burger sushi rolls-- check! Sushi burgers- check!  You'll need about ten minutes to read through the menu and ten more to try and figure out why "burgushi" sounds so good. I ended up ordering/splitting a few of their fusion sushi ("burgushi") rolls and a few more traditional rolls. The rolls are pretty big and I was quickly full.   The restaurant started to slow down around 9:00pm (not as many families hanging out) and the bartender was able to slow down as well and chat and make suggestions of things to do and see in the area. As well as talk about his favorites on the menu.   If you're in Charlotte, give this place a try.  They have something for everyone, the staff is great, and the decor is really entertaining and cheeky.  And while "burgushi" may sound really weird... It totally works.

vdq5wkHPNJNTgwYXFIxY8Q.text: Probably my friends and I top go-to restaurant. Amazing food, friendly service, reasonably priced, short wait time for the food, and perfect for any occasion! Wish they'd start taking reservations, but nonetheless it's worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon poke bowl.

Utmyq0gLgSV0ac97sHMiqA.text: The waitress and staff were over the top friendly. The food was delicious.  The atmosphere was fun. Highly recommend this restaurant!

h7QgZCn_leUqAYC7ZyDG0w.text: Not impressed with the burgers or sushi. we went because of all of the hype. I've travelled all over and eaten in many different place so I have had my fare share of exceptional dining and this place is not at the top. I say it mediocre. Innovative ideas but the food lacks flavor. Just BLAH.

RNQSL8XQLmVYP4OoFvvYoQ.text: Love, love, love this place. The location is great, the ambiance is great and the food is heavenly.  I don't eat meat and I love the Bento boxes, but the servers are always willing to make substitutions for me.  The sushi is yummy and you get a lot of food for the money.  This place can please everyone if you have a big group.  Plenty of options on the menu.

KGmZblCfDIfbaoqTLk2cKQ.text: Amazing place. Got a burget with fried egg on top last week for lunch with my hubby. My mouth was watering . It took a little while, but they were busy. It was well worth my wait and well worth rhe money. The best burger I have ever had hands down. If you are in that area , definitely check them out. You will absolutely love it. Great customer service and great food!!! Will definitely be back soon. Thank you

hInd8CQ5r9Pi6zBuC3iUCw.text: Checked this place out with my friend on New Years Eve. The place is pretty small, and we had about a 15-20 minute wait. Once we were seated, service was great and friendly. The sushi was delicious and presented well, and the prices weren't too bad.   The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because the tuna wasn't as fresh as I like. However, I would definitely recommend this place and I wouldn't hesitate to come back the next time I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spider Roll and Spicy Tuna Roll
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

AFzgdTJELK4AR5Q2j3DUTw.text: If you're looking for an awesome fusion restaurant with an imagination that rivals Willy Wonka's, you've found it!  Special treats include: the creative names of their dishes and rolls, sitting at the bar and being entertained by the fish in the beautiful aquariums and going to the bathroom to hear the lessons in speaking various languages including "redneck." :D  I've never been disappointed by any meal there. The Bento boxes are always a great choice. The edamame and Thai cucumbers can't be beat. Don't forget to save room for dessert...the Moose on the Loose is decadent and a True chocoholic's delight.  The Cowfish is always hopping so you either have to go early for dinner or lunch. It's well worth the wait, though!

HhoD9CshxJS_Vi18rSWSBw.text: It is rare to find a restaurant that is consistently helpful in regards to food allergies. We at Parents of Allergic Kids have heard from many of our members that Cowfish is wonderful in how they handle food allergies. We have heard they take it seriously from start to finish. Thank you for taking such good care of our community.

PIO4uHZZZCALgcMeK5gV0Q.text: This was a great find.  Interesting mix of gourmet burgers and full sushi menu options.  I've had the black truffle cheese burger and the Boursin Bacon Burger, both blew me away.  Hands down, the best burgers I've ever had.  Plenty of side choices to include fries, fried pickles, edemame, to name a few.  Besides the delicious food, the best thing about this place is the service, it's the best in the business.  Will continue to come back every time we are in South Park.  Be prepared for a wait at lunch time on a weekend,

Is-zXV4dm1G1wjhVKlRjkw.text: How many places do you know that serve sushi, burgers and burgushi (combine them both) in one restaurant? Exactly, none...for that reason Cowfish deserves a 5-star review. They back it up with their great food, menu and service. Been here at least 10 times and it's safe to say I've tried a lot of menu items. I usually sit at the bar because there's always a wait when I get there. Bartenders are knowledgeable and quick with their service.   As for the menu. The sushi is really good. Not as good as some specialty sushi restaurants around town, but the rolls are unique and large. Recommendation...ask the rolls to be cut in 10 pieces vs. 8 so they are more manageable. The burgers are really good. This is my favorite part of the place. The Green Monster burger has avocado, pepparjack and jalapenos on it! They're also at least 1/2 pound...big! Choice of sides are abundant, but sweet potato fries are usually the norm. On a recent visit I went with the Ahi Tuna burger, which was very tasty and had a nice Asian slaw on it.   But for something unique and light, go with the bento box...definiately for lunch. Comes with 5 sections. Small (4 piece) roll of your choice (think there's 3-4 options), a mini burger of the day, sweet potato fries, edamame and cucumber salad. A little bit of everything for those that can't decide because the menu is so BIG.   My only two complaints are 1)the menu itself, as it's so big. Everything Ive had on it has been good, don't get me wrong...you just need a solid 5-10 minutes to look it over, hence the reason for multiple visits and 2) PBR tallboys are $5. From one who loves PBR, this is just a laughable price. I look forward to enjoying the large patio when the weather is warmer. This is the new hot spot of the Southpark area and it's well deserved.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Green monster burger

7Q2m4P6dN9VZ4ZhzqyOQ1A.text: In short, great atmosphere and good food. Very contemporary and I really enjoyed the Crab Rangoon appetizer. Took one star away because the wait for food was a bit extended.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quite tasty, I must say

xU9hG6EgvdL0K2j_lBxqCA.text: Came in on a Friday evening around 6:30 and was told it would be about a 45min wait, which that was expected. We were seated in less than 30 and had an awesome server named, Chris. Ordered the crab and lobster spring rolls which were great! I got the dynamic duo burger and my girl friend got the burgooshi box which was also great!! I'll be back soon!!

Gtg8es4DNoQyHakkB7af5Q.text: Never thought I would be a fan but guess what I'm sold!!  This is a creative fusion. Only downside is the wait at times and a little pricey. But this is a must.

zRdlQpwMulduvn35WwkR8w.text: Just delightful and the milkshakes take me back to the 50's  Hamburgers great

5LfTFHDLmmQJ7DbaoHxgeA.text: On a recent visit to Charlotte, a friend and her husband picked  me up at CLT to take me to my hotel, and we decided to get a bite to eat before they dropped me off.  They told me about Cowfish and how good their sushi was as well as their burgers and milkshakes.  Granted it was a Friday evening, and it did not seem to be overly crowded, so I was not expecitng a 90 minute wait.  But it gave my friends and I a chance to sit and catch up as we waited.

ZFFutYy8r7IC34asAaiVHg.text: Put simply, it may be the case that the Cowfish is overrated. Located next to the shopping mall underneath an apartment building (I do not want to be associated with people who live in apartments basically on top of a mall. Ick.), the Cowfish restaurant seems wildly popular. It has nearly 500 reviews in the solid red-orange range of four stars. My wife and I couldn't get a table at 4:30 on Jan. 1, so we sat at the bar.  Here you can get sushi, or burgers, or a combo of both. I guess this means your health nut friends and your obese unhealthy friends can all get together in one restaurant! For that, Cowfish, many kudos. In fact, more restaurants should be heading in this direction. And for that, you deserve four stars. Below is why I knocked it down a notch.  Step inside the bathroom and you hear automated recordings of a man and a woman taking on a faux North Carolina hick, redneck accent and spewing off a number of homespun axioms. I wish I could remember a few, but they were things like, "Don't pee on my back and call it rain!" and they were repeated ad nauseam. It was truly difficult to bear. The next reason Cowfish drops a notch is simply due to its service. It took forever to get a food order, and when we did, the food arrived fairly quickly. I ordered some edamame and sushi. The edamame was good, and not too salty. The sushi was also good: spicy tuna and vegetarian rolls. They were wrapped pretty well, you got a good piece of fish in there, and it tasted fresh.  On the walls are the paintings that are humorous take-offs on famous paintings or art. Some seem mildly offensive or distasteful. One of them is an Asian Mona Lisa. What? Another is a rendering of Picasso's Guernica, which depicts the German bombing of a Basque region during the Spanish Civil War. It's a pretty gut-wrenching painting of a solemn topic. But in the Cowfish's rendering, all the character, people suffering and fleeing from a Nazi bombing, are COWS. It's just not in good taste. Granted, some of the painting are actually funny.  To top it of, after I paid, my server started awkwardly joking with me as I fiddled with my phone. "I know you want to dance," he quipped to the loud pop music pumping in the background. It's okay. Go ahead and dance." Where was all this attention when I wanted to order a meal? I managed a polite, if feeble, grin, and got the heck outta there.

8v-JpOdpj2-jIwoc7nK29w.text: I checked yelp for a good lunch place and found this. I ended up bringing about 12 people with me. The staff were nice even though we came without a reservation, and kept adding people to our table.  The menus are huge. I had trouble looking at one without knocking anything over on the table. Also, I'm short, and we were at a high table, so that could be part of the issue. The dishes also have some annoying names. "Screamin' Korean Chicken?" Really?  The food is fine, but it is definitely fusion. Don't look for authentic here! I had the hamachi (yellowtail) topped with a slice of jalapeno and ponzu sauce, plus a roll. The roll was fine. It was all fine. Just not memorable. The atmosphere and the crazy menu were more memorable.  But I'd go back. It's fun, and the quality is fine.

jblO_gpdc0lJjEHMEpbtqg.text: We have been many times and it's delicious every time. I just hate that they don't take reservations and the wait at peak times can be upwards of 2 hours. Grrrr. We've learned our lesson and will go at off peak times or just won't go at all.

FGXvRu2ZO4ss3YAdfk7i3g.text: Delicious! Despite being another Asian fusion based restaurant, the fare offered more than made up for this entry into the market. A bit crowded, but that is to be expected. The burgers were robust, and filling in the American fashion; one will need to loosen their belts on the way out.  The appetizers were briskly brought to the table, and after a brief appreciation of the presentation, consumed in  a similar fashion. I would return to this establishment.

Qz_A4LRr8XfArfeiLKlXVQ.text: We always enjoy this place. Food is good, love watching the aquarium if we sit at the bar, and outside seating is nice. Sometimes the wait is long, but that says something about its appeal. The artwork is fun and even a trip to the restroom is interesting, where you can hear phrases in English, Japanese, and Redneck.

D-fA6islk90aSatqZx0xhQ.text: As soon as we approached the door, the hostess opened the door for us and welcomed us in. I will say that unless you have an appointment you may have to wait a while to get a seat. The decor inside was really cool. I really like the huge fish tank at the bar and the funny pop posters on the wall. They even have an outdoor patio if you want to eat outside. It was a bit pricey but the food was very good. I definitely recommend this place, especially if you like sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Some of the funny posters on the wall.

ISkfBzjAnmprMHwDXC9U4Q.text: Oh Cowfish, you make my heart smile   Why you ask?   1) Great service with a nice mix of friendliness, enthusiasm and food knowledge  2) The color red. Red makes people excited and hungry. I like the mind games you play on me Cowfish.  3) They offer Bento boxes for a reasonable price. Don't know if you want a burger or sushi and not completely cold on the burgushi idea? Get the Bento! Comes with the burger of the week, choice of limited selection of sushi rolls, edamame, sweet potato fries and cucumber salad  4) Fabu drink specials. All sake is half off on Thursdays---including the sake sample which was only $6 for five varieties.  5) They put goat cheese on their burgers. Goat cheese = love.  6) Interesting sushi combinations that will please any sushi lover out there  7) Two words-spiked shakes  8) Getting a spiked shake for free when they made one too many  9) Sign up for their email list and you get a free appetizer coupon along with other special offers  10) The vibe and the artwork....modern/pop culture/comic   I went to Cowfish for their soft opening and tonight was my first visit back since then. I love the Cowfish since I am a fan of the sushi however this is not a place I would go all the time for sushi. It's a bit pricey for my liking but if you want a nice meal in a hip atmosphere, this is the place for you. Be sure to make reservations--I went tonight and thank God we had a reservation--we heard that the wait was two hours.....on a Thursday night....in Charlotte. They are obviously doing something right.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento Box
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mark&#39;s Roll

Pjqhb1BemLqpFlNjcjWnWg.text: My husband and I have visited this restaurant twice. Both times the food was incredible- we loved the burger and sushi bento boxes. However the second time we visited, two of the four of the people in our party got horrible food poisoning (November 2014). Since then, we have not returned and it's a good thing because there were even more instances of food poisoning at this location in 2015. We would love to return but will not risk it. Hopefully management can do something to fix this!

2X_OLeyWVV2sah2CDeCNXg.text: Sleek, modern, funky fresh and hip pretty much sums it up. From the Warhol inspired Godzilla painting to the burger "king" who I always found creepy; the decor is contemporary, atmosphere is live, and service is fabulous. Our waiter, Walter is a master of his trade.   Prices are surprisingly affordable and if the name wasn't a dead give away - yep this place also has an eclectic menu. From the Burger bento box, to filet oscar roll to the Arnold Hamandegger burgah. It's all good in the hood. Fish is fresh with some traditional, some make your own and the ever so present specialty rolls.   One point I must touch on is when the server brought out our food, she asked if we wanted anything else? I happily obliged and she had no qualms when I put in an order with her rather then our waiter.   When we let our waiter know it was our first visit , he had the manager come out to introduce himself, greet us, and offered a free appetizer for the next visit.   He was either:   1. Very personable, takes pride in the business, and delivering a great experience  or   2. Recognized my pretty lil' face from Yelp and wanted to bribe me ;)  Before you leave, make sure you make a stop to the bano. Just as the crazy name implies, you will hear an even crazier recording of a phrase in English, then translated in redneck and lastly translated in Japanese.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Squid salad

HJAuSm4oChbyYTiwrSN5lQ.text: Excellent service and food!  Mediterranean lamb burger best burger I've ever had!  All of family very happy with food.  Daughter and wife had sushi which they said was excellent!!!!

QD4h2KsAo4emq_eXHw_8RQ.text: Okay, I'm a bit f a sushi snob, especially when it comes to quality.  The presentation here is great and the whole fusion thing is okay.  But the grade of sushi is not exceptional.  It it were, I'd give it 5 stars.    Ironically, the burgers are fantastic!  If you're looking for a great dinner place with an urban NY type atmosphere to take your spouse or date, go for it.  But if you have clients who you want to impress with premium quality sushi, go elsewhere.  BTW I really haven't found a place in Charlotte that fits the bill.  I'm from Los Angles and Seattle, you just can't beat the sushi restaurants there.  Bottom line, the rolls, burgers and the fusion stuff is all great, but you'll be disappointed if you want premium sashimi.  I'm dined here about 6 times now and each time tried various type of sashimi as well as other items.  It's constantly good, but again, it's not premium grade sushi/sashimi.

ilC8yTr9Iv063gbZpccOhA.text: Ahi Tuna Nachos Arnold hamandegger Happy Man.  This place was outstanding. I walked in and they told me an hour wait. I looked at the hosted and she said "believe me its worth the wait." Thankfully some ladies at the bar were getting up and made my wait much less. Unbelievable flavors, unique interactive waiting and great crowds.  Nice work

MXxLdvPeL-8gjDWmUk79eA.text: My husband and I had dinner with my sister, nephew (10 yrs old) and two kids (3 and 5 yrs old)   at Cowfish yesterday. The wait for an inside table was about 20 minutes. During the wait we looked through the menu which was extensive! If you can review it ahead of time online that would be best. Once seated we ordered and received our food quickly. Everything was great EXCEPT the martinis were WEAK especially for $12 drinks!   The burgers were amazing and the sushi combos were good too. (If you like gyros try the "Mary Had A Little Lamb" sushi rolls.) The kids menu was also surprisingly well rounded and had plenty for picky eaters.  The bathrooms also had weird excerpts of "learn a language" audio playing that were confusing to say it nicely...smh LOL :)  Overall it was a good experience we would recommend to anyone visiting Charlotte.

kK8OqPzvK6m4JeHOewQMSw.text: I have now been to Cowfish several times, and I must say that it has been well worth it.  It's a great place to meet friends after work.  The crowd does tend to build the closer to the lunch and dinner hours that you get, but if you arrive say an hour earlier than that, you are sure to get the stool or booth of your choice.  The sushi is superb and of the highest grade.  The only con I have is that their individual portions are a bit on the large side, and those of you who don't want to stuff your face with every bite may want to either cut them, or perhaps just ask for smaller pieces.  Either way, this is one of my favorite places in the area!

dfQOVF5efgpOnIIU5wQV8g.text: In an alternate universe there will be more crazy fusion restaurants like this...fried chicken and pie...lasagna and hibachi...mole and milkshakes...ok maybe not. BUT, Cowfish does bring together two of my favorite foods - sushi and burgers and does them both surprisingly well!  Since I've only snacked on hubs' burger, I'll focus my review on apps and sushi. Let's get to it...  1) The scene: Super cool looking restaurant - very pop art-ish with custom sushi/Warhol esque paintings scattered on the red walls. Also, a huge bar and overall big concept (they took the Counter's space & the old Grape space - this place is magnanimous). Tons of tables in the bar area and general dining space. Make a reservation - it shall save you time!   2) The staff: Sharp, knowledgeable and friendly on both accounts I've sat down for a meal here. They are able to walk you through the gigantic menu and help you focus on a few things that catch your eye.   3) The menu: Huge. I mean Cheesecake Factory huge. Almost bordering on so large and detailed you can't take it all in. Think apps, burgers, burgushi, traditional sushi, creative sushi, make your own sushi, milkshakes, desserts, oh my.   4) The food: De-freakin'-licious. A few things I've really enjoyed here... -Crab Rangoon dip: Just as you would imagine, but better. Not for the dieting kind: fried wonton crisps, drizzled with sauce and dunkable in the crabby rangoony dip. Yes, please. -Tropical Storm Roll: super fresh, delicious and huge. *Word to the wise, if you want to actually fit a piece of a sushi roll in your mouth, ask them to cut the rolls into 10 pieces instead of 8. Trust me...your jaw will thank me. -Mango Tango Roll: Yummmm. I love just about anything with mango and this creative mixture is delightful. Plus - jalapeno! Nom. -Fried pickles: Tasty and crunchy with a delicious dipping sauce.  -White Diamond: Normally I shy away from panko, flash fried rolls but this is pretty flavorful! I may ask for a bit more heat next time, too.   5) The prices: Honestly, pretty reasonable prices considering how much food you get to indulge in! Plus, the.sushi.rolls.are.huge. And the apps are pretty generous in size. Sharing is caring...share a few rolls with friends, you'll have plenty of food to go around.   I also noticed that their lunch menu looks pretty slammin' and reasonable! So that's my long winded review of Cowfish. I really adore this chic fusion eatery and can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango Cado

cA8qFHTt8sxMeraMZN85yg.text: Super fun concept. Everything is very flavorful. I wish we had one in Ohio so I could try more things!

zZ8iES9FHQRqqpRxflXvtw.text: The Sushi was alright. the burgers was much better. but the wait isn't worth it.     Pros- Cool place and good service good burgers.   Cons- Pricey, mediocre sushi and potential long wait.

VDljl6b4Tsvvr_HJO4AFeQ.text: I know a lot of people like nice and long reviews. Well this is one place that I can write 5000 words on or I can just get to the point. The Sushi is Great , The Burgers are Great, The Drinks are Great. And most importantly if you follow me you know I have a thing for WiFi, and they have that as well.The choices of toppings and bread selection for creating your own burger is outstanding, you have so many choices of meat to go on the Burger as well. This is one place that if the waiter did take forever to get to your table, you wouldn't even notice because you will be looking at the menu for a while trying to decide what you really want. It has been a few weeks since I last stopped into Cowfish, but writing this review is really making me Hungry!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

d7YbwVnfB6Prqtu1BDqaxw.text: Cool place and atmosphere with great service!  From the get-go I was worried by how large the menu is (cue: Gordon Ramsay) but I thought maybe they're good at it all!  My boyfriend and I both got the bento so we could try a little of everything.  The boyfriend says the sushi was "good", and I agree, everything we had was good.  Not great, but good.  I'd come back with a group.  It's a good spot to socialize and with all the menu choices, there's something for everyone.

eQLFx5FCGBM7c4CFgjrECA.text: I love both sushi and burgers!!! If you are looking for a place to have one or the other or both, this is the place for you!!! You can't go wrong eating inside, outside or at the bar. You will be well served. I started off my Valentine's Day dinner with 2 appetizers. The lobster/crab spring rolls and calamari were both delicious!!! They also take pride in the presentation as well. I was in the mood for sushi but decided to get a burger for the main because of my seafood appetizers. Too many awesome burgers to choose from!!!! I ordered the Texas Burger with the jalapeno bacon and other mouth watering toppings. This place forces you to come back because if it wasn't hard enough choosing what you want to have for dinner, the variety of desserts.........Find out for yourself!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

ibPA9M4e2hE8RMuFtlH7-w.text: Traditional sushi guy here so I have not tried the burger sushi fusion burgers but the last time I was here, I did try the California roll wrapped in rare beef.  I loved it.  The sushi here is great, they have a nice local craft beer selection and the staff is fantastic.  I definitely recommend and hit this place up every time I am in the area.

Gyy0PzBbpLGWXhi2FmKTCA.text: We are out of town and stopped in because the description of the place sounded interesting. Needless to say, it was DELICIOUS. I ended up getting the veggie burger and couldn't have been happier with it. The patty is made in-house and it's topped with spinach, onions, roasted red peppers, and avocado. Yum! My boyfriend got a chicken burger and he said it was delicious as well.   The ONLY thing I could complain about were the fries. They have thin "shoe-string" fries that just aren't as satisfying as thick fries. But maybe that's just me.   In any case, the food and service was fantastic! If we didn't live so far away, we would definitely come back again!

bkyGKoS_ZZ-rmexa4kO8Mg.text: The food was great; service was excellent! I ordered the Mad Mango-Cado Roll-- it was very fresh and perfectly sweet with the spicy mayo on the side. Highly recommend it!!! Sat in the heated patio area which was very cozy and comfortable. I was celebrating a birthday, so the staff surrounded my table and came out with a huge gong and mallet instrument and a thick slice of vanilla cake with a brownie underneath, layered in whipped, vanilla mousse that truly made the experience special.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mad Mango-Cado Roll

VWo8yn71Hetuqs-krPhtVg.text: Let's start with dessert... The flourless chocolate torte was amazing! The raspberry drizzle paired nicely as well as the honey sesame topping! My meal: -Started off with a glass of the Cowfish Cabernet. I didn't feel like it had enough body, so I upgraded to the most expensive Cabernet option which I was very happy with.  -For appetizers I shared the Spicy Poke Dip and the Seared Sesame Tuna. For someone unaware what poke is, it is not a dip. This means it was diced spicy salmon and tuna over a bed of seaweed salad. The presentation of the Seared Sesame Tuna was lovely and I loved how it also included seaweed salad! -I then shared the Spider Crab roll (non-raw option) and the Pinky Swear roll (fushion roll). The Spider Crab roll was okay, but the Pinky Swear was great! Will definitely be back to try the Burgushi!

XOJlu5JClvB67L71JWk9KA.text: Waited about an hour on a Saturday night which is expected. Server was super friendly and awesome. We sat outside at the patio in the middle of winter and it felt great thanks to the awesome heaters. Our server also offered to adjust the heaters if we were too hot or too cold. Highly recommend getting the bento box! The Sushi is really good, you probably should get two rolls. The milkshakes were a perfect touch! 10/10 recommend this place! If you are in the Charlotte area stopping at cowfish is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

tlMRz5eJElhRGjdqx9g_vQ.text: What a fun concept!  Strangely enough, my husband and I had gone out for sushi only a couple of days before hearing of this place..and he had asked why no one makes meat sushi.  Enter Cowfish!  Everything we ate was really delicious...we got a burger, some burgushi, and the Motherload sushi plate.  Yum yum yum.  Fresh and tasty!  The decor was fun, it was a nice atmosphere in general.  I think it's funny that they have one employee whose purpose is to open the door for customers.

YL6rIGGlaqZi5Ke78S-THQ.text: This place has fantastic food and a great drink selection. The only negative is the long wait time to get a table. But the food is good, so what would you expect!

vLfjtuP7vz3KkJoDd8-KcQ.text: GM and staff are awesome!  GM sat down and spoke with us since we were out of town and gave us info on the area and told us fun things to do!   Would recommend to anyone!   Thanks again!

BdIDSmDZcbkB_XcOjeK5hA.text: Wow. Went twice this trip to Charlotte, because the service and food were so good the 1st time on Sunday, We went back yesterday. Not only was the food amazing, but everyone down to the man who sat us we're 10 out of 10. It was like each table, was the only table there. Such great service!!!! Our server Jamie, was absolutely amazing and took such good care of us! The manager (who is a Dolphins fan, I cant remember his name) came and spoke with us multiple times, like we we're old friends. This Cowfish is doing something right, that restaurants need to try and be like. I walked out and said I had to make sure I reviewed this place just to make sure they knew how great they were, and how we will be back every time we are in Charlotte. THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!!!!

aoGtuUPWWGdmKNGexqPrGA.text: The quality of the food is excellent, both sushi and burger meals.  The Jalapeno Popper Stopper (something like that) was AMAZING and they have the best fries! My husband got sushi and loved it. Service was good!  Fun atmosphere, they have a great patio. Well priced.  The Marshmallow Milkshake was to die for!!!

ufPXMu7RpdD8s96gL2PExA.text: Who combines burgers and sushi? This place. And it's just as amazing as it sounds. Try either some good looking sushi, craft burgers, or go for the burgushi menu - a combination of the two. Everything I tried was really good, and for first timers you gotta go burgushi and try this eclectic combo

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bun (rice, crab, and soy paper fried) with filet, French fries, and yummy sauces inside. With a side of amazing fried pickles

aA0ywLG6s8_45gg0PRahbQ.text: Have friends or family from out of town? This is the perfect place to take them to!  I don't know why, but Cowfish always pops up in my head for a place to take my friends/family from out of town to. And, they all liked or loved it!   Place - trendy, hip, fun, and casual. On a busy night, which seems busy every single time, it gets loud. Be aware though, the wait is long after 6pm when they do not take reservations.    Service - good to great. I have had great service, but then I have had good. Overall, they get you what you need in a timely manner.  Food - they have something for sushi and non-sushi lovers. So you have your burgers (which I am a fan of of Swiss burgers) and shakes (love love LOVE orange dreamsicle). I like their sushi specials, like their Mad-Mango-cado Roll that has shrimp tempura and avocado is alright (had better). When I first stumbled upon here, I would get the 'Cowfish bento box' - mini-burger with 4 piece of sushi rolls, in addition to the sides of edamame, fries, and Thai cucumbers.  I like the atmosphere and the cheap sake bombs. I would get sushi from another place though....

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp tempura roll - safe to order!

2OyEaaxhZRzlxtLJsE2ZBw.text: Had another really terrific meal here last night and highly recommend this place to anyone.  However, beware they have stopped taking same day reservations and even on a Tuesday night there was an hour plus wait.  When I called they did let me do a call ahead seating so our actual wait on site was reasonable.    We started with the crab and lobster spring rolls which were presented vertically, pinned together at the bottom with nice sauces. The portions was HUGE.   Next we ate the "Motherload", a plate that included 2 of every fish in the Resturant! Yumm.  The firecracker roll was also huge and very fresh and tasty. We had a couple other specialty rolls and left the place begging for mercy as we were stuffed.    Oh yes, and Tuesdays "fancy" martinis are 1/2 price... The bill was $89 for dinner fans drinks for two tall guys.  Go enjoy this please. It's great.  Last time there we tried a burger slider plate as an app and it stood out with terrific favors.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster crab spring rolls
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The mother load

nLgMBO0NfbngDyHtTWF5Uw.text: Excellent food and excellent service.  I came her on a Monday night. There was no wait and we were seated immediately (party of 3). The first thing I noticed was the decor; funky and satirical. It wasn't loud but it wasn't quiet, somewhere in between.  Our server was Brian. He was great! We had never been to Cowfish before and he took the time to explain the menu and provide us with a few recommendations. Their menu is extensive; from vegan and gluten free options to create-your-own sushi rolls.  We started off with signature cocktails; Skinny Gonzales, Moscow Muleshine, and Buleits & Bacon. Wow! They were delicious and strong. For our entrees, we had The Big Squeal (burger), The Miss Moffitt (sushi), and the Mark's Roll (sushi). All of us had a bite from each meal and the reaction was the same....Oh.My.God. Everything was delicious, every bite bursting with flavor.   We will definitely be going back!

nNJHx0SoEf37bA4IwKDN4Q.text: Excellent food with a fun and diverse menu.  There are probably a few too many options and can be a little overwhelming. Nevertheless, we has the truffle fries (yum), the burgushi filet and lobster roll and the CBCLT burger.  Very tasty!

NkREaeN8iEXmcF36B9DjCw.text: The first time we went here it was better than the rest. We sat outside, it was beautiful out and our waitress was amazing. But recently when we went the food was mediocre and everything was full done when we asked for medium. They have gone down hill since the first time we came here and they don't take reservations either so be prepared to wait, normally longer on weeekende.

iHbs_e1QXuBpdiIF9bql7g.text: This place is always slammed. Great food, greats staff, and great drinks. I've been here several times in both large groups and dinner for two. I've always had a great experience and the food is very much worth the wait.   TIP: they only accept a certain number of reservations, so get there early.

k_LS0-bdCoIiTJGo8XbWBQ.text: I've been here quite a few times and it's one of my favorite sushi places. Warning, it's hard to find parking and inside it can be packed, so don't be surprised if you have to wait a while for seating.   The bento box with Mark's Roll is my order to go to. This is one of my favorite sushi that is exclusively from Cowfish. As a side note, you can mix the side dishes in the bento box if you don't want the given sides. Definitely, a place you would not want to miss!

et929hAJpTTyZeLUmMY1_A.text: We visited for lunch on a holiday weekend. I had the R&R crab roll and my fiance had the angry lobster roll. We shared the lobster and crab spring rolls. Everything was delicious. Our server was so attentive and helpful. She packed our leftovers on ice! This was my fist time here while visiting Charlotte but I definitely wish there was a location up north. I will definitely return whenever we're in town.

Br_y9udX3lyPlpCG4mfdgQ.text: Man... this place is badass!  Where else can you get a fantastic burger and some well prepared sushi?  Only here my friend.    I came with a buddy and sat at the bar. We both had burgers, I ordered the black truffle burger. The only thing I can say is... oh good god yes!  It hit the spot. It was massive and I couldn't finish it but I really really wanted to.   The bartenders are on it!  Good work from all of them, great team.   The have some decent beers on tap, couple good ipa's.   If you haven't dropped in. Do it!!

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

88hbfwDaDftzhafhjSezrw.text: Not sure why I've never checked in here. We love this place. I'm not a sushi eater so the other options are what excited me. I ordered the burgooshi the first time we went...LOVED IT!   They also have something called the Angry Lobster. LOVED IT! I'm not sure if they only have it on the menu several times a year or not. I just know that it was on there that time, and the next time we visited, I saw that they brought it back on their Instagram, so we were there!  Their sliders are AMAZING! They make you want a platter of them.

Bh7WP8rPLykLeT3QSa-8XA.text: The food was great and our waiter was terrific; however, it took over an hour for our food to be served after the order was taken. The table behind us also had a long wait and, when they started complaining, two different managers came out separately and fawned all over them but not a word was said to us - I guess the squeaky wheel really does get the grease.  Our waiter, Matt, kept our glasses full, made sure that we knew that he was monitoring the kitchen for our order and arranged to have our appetizer comped. The delay wasn't his fault so his tip wasn't affected by it all.  Overall we will probably give this place another try because of the food quality and Matt's service.

H5loaQEksrehiqhdcAk-rQ.text: We have been loyal customers at Cowfish and Eez for years, but tonight was the worst experience we've had as dining patrons in 30 years. Our waiter, Adam, was in a hurry and tried to stack every single plate from our table of three. Not only did he drop the plates onto the table, into my lap and onto the floor, but the soy sauce covered my entire lap down to my feet. He acted like it was no big deal and didn't even apologize. We rushed to get paper towels and napkins to clean everything up, including the mess on the floor. He then brought us our check and we mutually decided we were not going to give him a tip - He didn't help clean up and never once said sorry, even though I was covered with food and soy sauce down to my shoes. After we paid, said thank you, and walked out of the door, he chased us out of the restaurant yelling at us until we got in our car! We certainly NEVER expected this treatment from a restaurant of this caliber! We will absolutely never be back.

H7qX5-bY_zQUjzUG04qBOg.text: I love this spot but be careful if you have food allergies. Took friends and clients there and (it was late) but they def weren't paying a ton of attention to the gluten sensitivities although normally they do. Don't pass over the milkshakes Note: they follow up and make sure to correct any mistakes (which inevitably happen). Their attention to detail and customer service is top drawer.

bXSp-eeSwi1StfIziINyaQ.text: I've been hesitant to eat here since the food-borne illness Norovirus years ago. Since this location opened, I've visited three times.   I'm glad to see Cowfish bounced back!   Holy Batman! I'm a fan of Cowfish again!! I came here a few years ago. The food was okay....   I recently came back with the Yelp Elite squad. Then for dinner and drinks with a friend, the food and service was AMAZING! You can't go wrong with the Lobster and crab egg rolls!!! The added sauce is to die for!! I've also tried the wonton dip, which I hate sharing!   I wouldn't recommend coming Thurs-Sat, it's busy during dinner (hardly any tables available). Which isn't a bad thing! I hope this business continues to thrive!

1WmxTzFQR6R8c5qIxujcFw.text: Awesome place for couple's who can't agree on what to eat. I LOVE sushi. My bf can't stand it. However what guy doesn't love a good burger? And they have both. Best sushi I've ever had. He loved his burger and milk shake. Shrimp appetizer was also a hit for us both. The staff was attentive and friendly. They also had no issues with accommodating my bf's food allergy. Don't miss out on this place.

c1NUEewnrO7q53_rnJMiXA.text: Came here for lunch on a Sunday around 12:30 pm. There was a 15 minute wait for a party of 4. The hostess took my name and number down and when our table was ready, we got a text.   The menu is a little overwhelming with so many options, but our hostess helped to guide us to a few highlights. We ended up ordering: two burgers (The Texas Longhorn and the Arnold Hamandeggar - both were SO delicious and the portion sizes, generous - a half pound burger to be exact!), a burgushi (The All American Bacon Double Cheeseburgooshi - which was also yummy, but the flavors are more Asian than American), and a bento box (The Fusion Specialty Bento Box with the Firecracker roll - This is a great way to sample some of the sides. I loved the firecracker roll but you don't get to fully experience their REAL specialty with the bento box - their BURGERS). Their sides are close to perfect (Get their classic fries or sweet potato fries, or for lighter fare, try their edamame and grilled vegetables with their amazing burgers).  The service was excellent - our waitress was friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. The interior is casual and playful with bold colors and witty posters.  We loved this place first and foremost for their delicious burgers. Can't wait to come back during our next visit to Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Arnold Hammandegger with a side of sweet and sour thai style cucumber (would go with fries next time!)
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. THE ALL AMERICAN BACON DOUBLE CHEESEBURGOOSHI (served with a side of fries)
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Texas Longhorn with a side of sweet potato fries!

pKpmNEWlHBO34KQytKKmzA.text: Oh gosh !! This place have good food and good servers ever. Every time I go there, I always get the best of the best service. Actually my server was the best. We go here very often never had have one bad server. Um... nice .      My family is happy lol .

Kp4sCWLYnmKdhSLfidcvYw.text: There were some good things about Cowfish but the meat on the burgers we got were not seasoned like at all. Not worth the $14.

F_wQDU3tr1wnHVkXntd6Qw.text: Meet a few friends out and about and decided to check out Cowfish. Some of our friends frequented this location several times before so we went with their recommendation.  We ordered a few appetizers but my favorite was the calamari and the Ceviche was great too. We ordered a few of their signature cocktails which were great but the specialty ordered drinks had to be remade since it was to sweet.  Overall, we had a great experience and the staff was very attentive. The food was great and the drinks for our taste was a little weak but the flavors were there.  I would highly recommend a visit and we'll definitely be back again.

yRf9hUhrzexRdK0WGUvcHg.text: First about me: I travel extensively and eat out at least 4 X a week. I love to cook and love food, you can rely on my review. This restaurant is fantastic, my only complaint is that the service level is inconsistent. A very large menu with great choices, have tried a lot of dishes and all were great.

x9P5qm_8NGi4ONdxKd-jjQ.text: Leon was our server and he was incredible and catered to our every need.  He was very in tune with our allergy concerns, made suggestions, was very attentive, and had a great personality. We also were visited by two managers who made it their mission to make sure we were extremely happy.  The burgers were amazing and the bento boxes were delicious and had a lot of variety.

SMdGVCHXpisy-fjtRs5S_w.text: always come here for birthdays lmao. little pricey but wayy worth it.

i4u7l6NOPBF3R1UrTDMH8g.text: It's been.. Wow, 7 months since I wrote a review?    My wife and I moved to Charlotte in January and we have been told by our new friends here that we MUST GO to The Cowfish at some point.  Looking for something to do for our anniversary tonight we decided now would be a great time.  Burgers? Sushi? Both at the same time?  We were intrigued.  This is a really cool spot.  The staff is very fast and friendly and the decor is unique.  There is indoor and outdoor seating and while the Southpark area is gorgeous, we opted to sit inside.  We started with the parmesan truffle fries and they were INCREDIBLE.  Bacon, cheese, the usual suspects.  The fries were shoestring style and there was just enough topping not to make them soggy.  For dinner I had the "All-American Bacon Double Cheeseburgooshi."  So basically it's Angus hamburger meat, cheese, ketchup, mustard and your typical burger fixings inside of a soybean sushi sheet and then flash fried.  So it's presented like sushi but when you eat it, it tastes like a cheeseburger.  The disconnection between the visual and tasting the food really messes with your head.  It was delicious though!  My wife had a "build your own" turkey burger and fried pickles.  This is where the staff at Cowfish really stepped up.  My wife doesn't eat beef.  Not for any ideological reasons she just doesn't care for it.  When our food arrived my wife received a very, VERY rare beef burger instead of her turkey burger.  We're not ones to make a scene.  We know working in food is a tough job, so she politely informed the waitress of this.  She apologized and the right food arrived promptly.  No worries!  A few minutes later the manager came out and asked what happened.  We explained and he apologized once more, comped her meal and said dessert was on him tonight.  The apology and replacing the food was sufficient enough, but it was really above and beyond for him to do the rest of it.  I only regret I forgot the manager's name because that was top class stuff.  We finished with "The Mousse is Loose" which I thought was going to be a glass of chocolate mousse.  Instead we got this giant slab of two brownies with chocolate and vanilla mousse on top.  It was UNREAL.  It's everything you want in a chocolate dessert.  The Cowfish is awesome.  Great food and service.  We will be back as often as we can.

BecxZ1-LS1yHL7ZU1HysDQ.text: Warning for takeout orders:  I placed an online order through the website approximately 4:00 on a Friday a few weeks ago, paying online with a card as is required.  At 4:30 I arrived to the restaurant to pick up and the bar tender was entering the order into the kitchen as I arrived. He was very kind, but let me know it would be at least 20 minutes for my burgers to be ready. Unfortunately I couldn't wait another 20 minutes for my food so I asked them to cancel the order, and was told I'd get a refund of my money.  Almost 2 weeks and multiple phone calls later, I still haven't seen my $50.  It's unfortunate because we love cowfish! I've been coming here for 6 years, maybe longer. We've heard they're having some problems right now and it's impacting customers waiters etc, but this is terrible customer service.  I probably won't be returning here, despite them having good food, because it's not worth the headache. I'm a graduate student so missing $50 is a big inconvenience for me.

It is kid friendly; but I feel it is a great treat to eat there as an adult. Keep up the great work and good food. Also, thanks for the birthday cake surprise! Delicious mousse cake! What a treat!!

wOvkJrAx15fp9ACNncbiDw.text: Q:A cow and fish can fall in love- but where will they build their nest?  A: AT COWFISH!  Cowfish is an amazing fusion restaurant filled with surprising flavor combinations that will leave you wanting more.  The photo you see here is the All American Bacon Cheeseburger  Burgushi (burger served sushi style) and it is definitely worth a try. Above the delicious food (grass fed beef btw) the atmosphere and wait staff is incredible.  Our waiter Earle took time to go over the expansive menu and ensured we had a pleasurable dining experience.  My only regret is not coming here with a larger party so I could sample more of this unique and exciting menu.

6-ClrGblZRpwokffEPjAkw.text: I've been going to the Cowfish for a number of years.  This is one of the places I always try to come to at least once when i have to come to Charlotte.  Not only do they have great sushi, but they make awesome burgers and some fabulous shakes. I highly recommend at least once going for the Burgerushi.  This is what I think makes them unique in their sushi / burger fusion.  I have eaten here a numebr of times and I still yet to think I have ever had a bad meal. Their tribute to Ric Flair (The Nature Boy's WOOOOO-SHI BUFFALOOOOO-SHI Roll) is probably my favorite of the Burgerushi, and what I will have friends try to get an idea of what Cowfish is about. If you want a tasty shake, then you can't go wrong with the s'mores. In short, so many great things to try on the menu, I always find something new to go after whenever I am back in town.

hj72cSJ4a9TENIpPuaC9XQ.text: Delicious! I loved the random theme of burgers and sushi. Our server was great! To start we ordered a bottle of red cowfish wine and the tuna nachos. Very tasty. 5zm-iAXIKTvmiiugxT-gLw.text: Every single time I've been to The Cowfish it's been a wonderful meal and a wonderful evening, but tonight was something special.   A few months back my best friend Chris and I were lucky enough to be part of a Yelp Event at Southpark Mall that included a visit to The Cowfish. It's an absolute favorite of ours and through talking with the managers organizing the event we were offered the opportunity to be some of the first to eat the Gobble Gobbleooshi this year. Any chance to eat some delicious food is a welcome one so we settled on tonight, gathered our significant others and the four of us headed out.   We arrive around 6:30pm and are quickly seated. Our awesome waiter Leon welcomed us and quickly got our drink orders. The manager Anthony stopped by and mentioned that head chef Rifali was going to come by to say hello before our meal. Sure enough, master sushi chef Rifali Almunir comes out and welcomes us and says he wants us to try a special sushi dish before our meal. He comes back a few minutes later holding a beautiful plate with two small bamboo dishes garnished with edible flowers. He explains this is a special hamachi (yellowtail) tasting dish. Alternating pieces of fresh cut fish  and marinated orange slices served with a wasabi yuzu sauce. Now I'm really not a sushi person, I just don't appreciate raw fish as much as others. Aside from specials like the Gobbleooshi I normally get a burger when I go to The Cowfish, but this was pretty good. Super light and sweet, the more refined sushi palletes at the table said it was some of the best they had ever had. We thanked him for the special treat and told us he would be back with the main course.   It was finally Gobble Gobble time!  If you've never heard of it the Gobbleooshi is a seasonal specialty of The Cowfish only available in November. Its essentially an entire thanksgiving dinner disguised in the form of a sushi roll. Turkey and green beans in the center, stuffing instead of rice, flash fried sweet potato straws on the outside instead of a seaweed wrap with gravy and cranberry sauce on the plate and each piece topped with a fried green bean. Savory with a touch of sweet. Soft inside and crunchy outside. Its unique and odd and wonderful. We split two of the big rolls between the four of us and our plates were left clean. Delicious.  Just when we thought things couldn't get any better Leon came back a few other waiters and a massive piece of "The Moose is Loose." At The Cowfish you get a free dessert on your birthday where everyone comes out and does a silly song, but it's my wife and mines first wedding anniversary tomorrow so I suppose they thought it was a similarly worthy event. I believe I mentioned it in my previous review but The Moose is essentially a massive piece of cake with alternating layers of chocolate cake, chocolate mousse and whipped cream mousse and its absolutely amazing. The perfect way to end a meal.   The more I think about it the more I think The Cowfish truly is my favorite restaurant in all of Charlotte. The staff are always on point, the food is always delicious and I always leave happy. Thank you to Leon, Andrew and Chef Rifali for a wonderful evening and I look forward to the next time I visit.

But dessert and the service is why I have to give this place 5 stars. I've been craving (pregnancy) a chocolate chip cheesecake milkshake (something Cookout used to have. You know with the cheesecake pieces. Mmmm it was so good. I digress.) I asked the server (who was great) if they had a cheesecake kinda milkshake and they don't. When the General manager asked my mother and I if everything was good, I told him it was and it would be great if they offered a cheesecake milkshake and he said he can make me one. Whaaaaaa!!!! He said, "We can definitely do that for you. Absolutely!" I asked for some Oreos to be added and he said he can get that done as well. The server came in time to say, "you never say not to a pregnant woman or you'll get a sty" He's had 2.   My milkshake was brought only a few minutes later after I ordered and he gave it to me for free! Happy birthday to me! I know it's not my bday.   Chris is dope. Talk about superb customer service and making sure the customer is happy.   Thanks Chris!

tGzmeuSFc-c0HlMfLNBvyw.text: Creative menu, delicious food! I tend to like the sushi better than the burgers I've had there. You definitely need to make reservations way in advance or try going for lunch instead. Service is perky and helpful. My only complaint is that because there are no soft surfaces to be found, the restaurant is extremely loud and hearing your waiter or dinner companions can be a challenge. Also, the seats are not comfortable at all. My biggest recommendation is the Tuna Nachos Appetizer. It is not what you think. The Deliverence Roll is also really good. I also enjoyed the Tom Kha Ga soup on a separate visit, which is good if you're not especially hungry as the portions of everything else are huge.

2N_bKEYLpSBh2IcyrKX5IQ.text: Food and service was excellent.  We ordered two specialty bento boxes and a lamb burger.  My husband loved his lamb burger and the option to have seaweed salad as his side.  The bento box was a great sampling of many things...one mini burger, 4 pieces of sushi roll of your choice, edamame, a delicious slightly spicy cucumber salad, and sweet potato fries.  In my opinion, the prices were very reasonable for the quality and quantity of food you receive.  If you're not prepared to spend $12-15 for an entree, then stick with the drive thru...you will not appreciate the cuisine.

06kh14DPHhhTjw0zeDUJAg.text: The food is really good here. I have no complaints about the service. The burger combinations are enough to satisfy nearly any person's preferences. The beef is great. I have no idea about the sushi, but from the crowd, it must be well received. The management knows how to encourage people to come back [with a free appetizer card on the first time there]  Cons: The cons of this place don't have anything to do with how the restaurant operations, so I can't take away stars for that. However, the place is big, and it fills up quickly. As hinted to via Andrew H's review... the clientele are a bit lacking. It seems that this is more of a place to go and be seen, not a place to go and be social. From my experiences, people at the bar were more interested in entertaining their friends than enjoying where they are.

Raj9OUfgKrbTbrDa4Ng4Kw.text: What can I say, all the positive reviews are warranted. Only negative would be timing it so you don't have to wait forever to get a table. Weekend dinner time, ugh! Great food though, and have had great service. Enjoy!

OC8t_lYPLIA1j_05oGR67g.text: Outstanding food and service. We waited a half hour on Monday for a table, but so worth it!  Loved it

Yzd8iZFrA0f9jX1c2yT3AA.text: I came to the Cowfish opening day by accident.  I was visiting family in Charlotte for Thanksgiving, hopped off the plane and sought the Counter for lunch.  Low and behold the Cowfish stood in its place.  My brother, husband and I decided to try it (since we were there).   The restaurant decor is Japanese modern, but not zen; imagine red on the walls and Japanese comic book themey, and oh yes Cowfish in the aquarium.  This review does not reflect the sushi menu, since we all ordered burgers- myself a veggie burger concoction (not as is listed on the menu), my husband the CBCLT, and my brother the Texas Longhorn.  Long story short, it was the best veggie burger second to Burger Bar in Las Vegas; my husband rates his, best burger EVER!  A year later my husband and I still rave about this place and we plan to go back when we're in town.
