Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Rangoon appetizer
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Long horn burger with jalepano bacon

WIuuasvmSmGGnfYxQDINVQ.text: The best burger and sushi bar. I love all the rolls and bugushi. The jalapeno popper show stopper burger is my post flight go to bite!

73pTgp9Ybq7BSTNL3vuCyg.text: Great food and great sushi , if you are looking for something different then this is the spot

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Tuna Roll
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken lettuce wraps

ak5-oNHK7I1UfhvONioVVg.text: Love their sushi! We always go and sit at the bar area and are usually pretty lucky in finding two seats open. It can get extremely crowded in the restaurant, as it is a very popular spot. Wednesday are half price wine nights, which is always great!

SYEbQI0hCqNmEvNMhVhxWA.text: Love it. My girlfriend and I always make a point of going whenever we are in town. The burgers are awesome, and the sushi is fresh. Not to mention the booze shakes are pretty good too. Admittedly, there is a bit of a wait, but it's worth it in my opinion. The service is always great.

BSTTeRU1Ij1CIFuztqILIQ.text: Thursday evening - they don't take reservations or call ahead unless you're within a radius (but how would they know where you're located when calling??) - and we get a 30 minute wait with a pager and a text message to follow "our fish" on a TV (as it gets bigger and floats to top, you're closer to head of wait).  So we sit at the bar, completely ignored for quite a while, with bartenders and barbacks walking past regularly and everyone else around us that's been served is getting checked up on (and doesn't need anything).  Finally get a girl to get our order and they've run out of an ingredient and is gone without any word for a loooong time, where another bartender now has deemed us worthy to check in with 3 times even though we have already placed our drink order.  My knobby knees drink was very good, my friends was not balanced well with gin and other components and was kind of gross.   We settle up at the bar as our table is ready and we're not feeling very confident in this place.  MORGAN redeems the night!! She knew the menu very well and offered great suggestions, was very attentive and had an awesomely enthusiastic attitude. I honestly was not a fan of the burgushis that were more like sandwiches in floppy fried rice bread patty thingies because i felt they were super messy and hard to eat - not for lack of taste, but my sushi rolls were all around fantastic!   So in review, bar was not a highlight of my evening, food and service at table were amazeballs, I highly recommend the knobby knees drink and seriously waaaay too many birthdays for one evening.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dions OMG roll
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The prime time, filet &amp; lobster roll

TGB9AaWOtNEV7p6HykPzPQ.text: I have been here twice and both times I was thoroughly impressed. Let's start with the appearance. I love the decor. It's trendy and modern and most importantly it is clean.   Both times I have been it has been jam packed and loud but not overwhelming. This wouldn't be the place for a quiet romantic dinner but is perfect for hanging out with friends or family. I had to wait a little while but not too long. Around 30 minutes.   The food itself is scrumptious. Calamari, sushi, burger, and edamame were all spectacular - not to mention gorgeous.   The service was fast and efficient and our waiter was friendly. The food didn't take very long to come out and our drinks were always refilled.  The price is reasonable and you get quite a bit of food for your money. I would certainly recommend anyone to go try Cowfish. It's a interesting experience and I don't think you will be let down.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Make your own sushi roll, burger with cheddar cheese, and edamame instead of fries.
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Name and logo.

bH0GcXZg3OSsfQQbuvB3wA.text: Went to lunch for hubby birthday. I did research the menu before we came since it is HUGE. the place is nicely decorated and kinda fun. The aquarium is something I could sit and look at for hours while the fish play and chase each other. I especially like the little Cowfish, too cute.  there was a long wait for us, but I didn't mind. I didn't get to check out the touch screens on the bar but maybe next time.  they also have a really big patio that looks inviting.  I noticed several staff who were dressed in a "management" looking way and that was expected but I have to say that a lot of the servers looked a little rough, some needed a shave and a hairbrush!   on to our experience. there was myself, hubby and 13 y/o daughter. we started with the crab Rangoon dip. lots of crab in here! and it was very nice I admit, but I would've preferred not to have the sauce on the chips since it made them a little soggy. on the side would have been better.  we had a really nice server who pointed out the highlights of the menu and she was training someone who could have been a little more enthusiastic, but was nice enough.  next we tried the fried pickles, now I have had some great fried pickles but these missed that mark, they were a thicker cut thus the breading doesn't stick on them well and they weren't the crisp kind of pickle. although my daughter was in heaven since it has been a very long time since she has had any.  instead of ordering separately we ordered 3 different rolls of sushi and shared: volcano roll- very spicy and is not for the faint of heart spicy tuna roll- very nice but I like the spicy aioli on top not inside, but was still good crunchy shrimp roll- was really good has some tempura fried shrimp in it.  we surprised my hubby with the typical song and dessert that restaurants do, he was thoroughly embarrassed - mission accomplished.  the dessert was a enormous serving of moose on the loose. it was way more than we could share and oh so good and chocolaty!  we did not finish everything and ended up taking about 1/2 home and we all were stuffed beyond comfort.   cant wait to go back and try a few other menu items

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Right is volcano roll (spicy!) bottom is spicy tuna roll, top left is crunchy shrimp roll
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The moose is loose and oh so yummy
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried pickles

5UrfbWSDIjiC54_QEjC4bQ.text: Good Food Here!  We started with crab rangoon dip - a great intro to the meal...along with half price martinis (on Tuesdays, Wednesdays 1/2 price bottles of wine).  Main meal was the Nature Boy (burgushi) The Boss and Marks Roll (sushi) - all were delicious.  We topped the evening off with milkshakes (of couse) - I got the Smore while husband had Caramel Espresso - get the S'more you will be glad you did.  This is easily the best milkshake that I have ever had in my 43 years!  While this was my 2nd visit to Cowfish, it was a first for my husband and we both loved the food and service was fantastic.  Nellie was extremely knowledgeable in talking about the menu items and highlighting her favorites - thanks Nellie!  Also, the host stopped by to say hello and to see how our evening was... a very nice touch that is greatly appreciated.  We will be back :)

cOrCwEM1Db6tkoPoEtgxuQ.text: Went with my wife and daughter,  It was our first time and made the mistake of telling waitress we would take "first available" seating. We thought it was a table vs a seat at the bar. Well it was that plus a third choice, sitting outside on the patio in 90 degree heat with 90 percent humidity. The glasses of water on the table were sweating so much there were puddles under them.  It was uncomfortable to say the least.  Anyway the food,  I ordered a Tropical Storm Roll (sushi) The menu describes it as: California roll topped with 3 layers of fresh sashimi (tuna, salmon and yellowtail), then topped with Japanese cream sauce, sweet brown sauce and sriracha. Each pieces is then covered with multi-colored tobiko (flying fish egg) for a fantastic presentation. Served with a side of wasabi yuzu dipping sauce  Even though I read the description, I underestimated this roll. When they say three layers of fish they mean it. The pieces of sushi were so large with the fish on top you had to deconstruct each slice because no human (a snake maybe) could get their mouth opened to fit a piece of this roll. Which was super flavorful.  There was no sign of sriracha sauce but plenty on the table so I added my own.   Upon walking in the door we were quoted 45 mins for a table and I would have walked out by my daughter had her heart set on this place. Good news was that the wait was closer to 15-20 mins. Hostess probably lost a lot of business with those bad estimates, but hey it got me seated faster!  Price was reasonable and I would surely return.

XPhEQ_-0zLfdNtqxDVs61g.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! The only downside is there are no reservations, so if you go during peak hours, you'll have to wait, but there is a bar to get a drink and a solid amount of couches to sit in. Great food and drinks with plenty of options. There's something for everyone!

r8RNrA0QkX_zFyIDKmVHsw.text: Bleh. Worst bison burger I've ever had. It tasted like a frozen pre-made patty. Definitely not worth the price.

4OE8AVm2Gj3twhRHjhVfpg.text: I've been a repeat customer here for a few years. It's a high end joint with a specific customer in mind. Sushi and burgers, with a mixed up selection of menu options. I love their sushi and they have a great selection of items. The staff is great and friendly.  They get really busy at times. I've never had a bad meal here. Portion sizes are large. 2 people could share a burger and and an appetizer easy. Come here to be treated right. Check out their online menu, before you go. They have lots of options, and specials. I recommend the marks roll or the blacken tuna roll.  The truffle fries are amazing and huge order, I mean HUGE! I love the borsin burger and the mushroom burger truffle aioli on the side.  Nom nom nom good.

prJfkNC2GdKM70WPERcLEA.text: Outstanding food, service, and beer!   Bison burger is legit and the blackened tuna roll was incredible. Will definitely return.

rtoFUfqqjFKGBHxk8BP-bA.text: Nice guys. Love how you take reservations for some and not for others. We called in and were told no reservations... But as we were waiting a man walks in with a reservation.   Are you people kidding? Shame on you for lying and for being so stuck up and rude.  Won't come here ever again and will be sure to recommend that folks stay away.

ckKar6UccNqhpW-xyjUbZw.text: Great place!  I had the black truffle cheese burger which was the BEST burger I've ever had. My wife's sushi roll was absolutely fantastic.  Service was outstanding.  Our server really knew her stuff and was pleasant and attentive without being intrusive.  We will definitely be back.  I wish they had one of these in the University area, so we wouldn't have to go so far, but not even the time will keep us away.

CaMKgByGKtv_wNoShkQA6Q.text: Amazing as always.  Had a martini and the glass was chipped. I didn't care, but brought it to the waiters attention just so he could throw the glass away when I was done.  He ended up bringing me a brand new glass and taking off my app.

Bx4lfsZQgRTZ8tBDL2bd0Q.text: Place was excellent on all levels. Great atmosphere, great food, great service. I'll be back.

KS8Yg8LuBXPXErRtHTMlGg.text: This place is great!  Such an interesting mix of foods.  I ordered one of the combination boxes with a small burger and part of a sushi roll with edamame, sweet potato fries, and some cucumber.  It was A LOT of food, and pretty reasonably priced.    Also, the Crab Rangoon Dip really is AMAZING.  One thing I didn't love, it was pretty busy and service was a little slow.  I understand that you are really busy but it was a Tuesday night and it sounds like they are ALWAYS busy so they should be able to handle it by now, in my opinion.   It was fun to sit at the sushi bar and play with the interactive menus and the games.

Bwd7lEVGzzCD7LRBoR0Rzw.text: Took our daughter here for  her Birthday.  I had been here before and I knew what to expect as far as ambience.  It's loud and upbeat.  It's not a place for low key celebrations. My husband and daughter enjoyed the Sushi.  It comes in extremely large portions.  They over ordered but they were happy.  I ordered the burger that had pimiento cheese, fried green tomatoes, and dukes Mayo. It had butter all over the bread and to me that is a turn off right away. The fried green tomatoes were absolutely awful. They looked like they were filled in and no green tomatoes.  They looked like they had been frozen fried green tomatoes.  I took them off. The jalapeno bacon was really  good.  They put a huge amount of Mayo on the burger which was literally gross. I ate part of the burger and had chest tightness.  Really!   I guess I should have known that this was really going to be so bad for me, I shouldn't have gotten it. Why 4 stars?  Sushi was great.  Service was great.  It was fun until I had to get up and walk around because I was miserable. I would get a lighter meal on my next visit although I ate very little of this meal.  If you are a sushi eater, go for it.

d5pIxfW5vmmTj2-6xgI0Qw.text: The Cowfish is THE place to go in Charlotte, assuming you are willing to wait for a table. Almost every day of the week there will be a wait, sometimes upwards of 90 minutes. If you do manage to snag a table, however, prepare yourself for lots of delicious food that you won't be able to completely finish.  The sushi is great, as one would expect from a higher end sushi restaurant. The burgers are great, as one would expect from a burger bar. The blend of the two is exceptional. Cowfish has a section of their menu titled "burgushi" which is American-Japanese fusion of sushi and beef or pork. Everything on the burgushi menu is excellent, however I would really recommend trying the Doug's Fillet Roll.  Also, check out the bathrooms while you are there. Inside you will be treated to a language lesson where you learn to say strange phrases in English, Redneck-English, and Japanese (I think).  As a side note, I swear the fish tank behind the front bar is populated with the cast of Finding Nemo.

LavukKu_Kb65EhvE8d0jnA.text: Quality dinner with a side of Ric Flair. Wooo!

QCN5ARmOh1h86xLPqZELsw.text: Awesome. Do yourself a favor and sit at the bar. Great time!

URfFdOi9DBJQWdP6ptHbxA.text: Awesome combination of burgers and sushi! First time I got a bento box with a burger slider, sweet potato fries, and sushi ... super yummy. Give it a try!

t0Sl5gYpsAtRJUp-XKxLtg.text: We were recently in Charlotte and decided to try this place.  We were a little hesitant since the restaurant offered both sushi and burgers - 2 very differing cuisine types - however, this place succeeded in both.     We ordered a burger, sushi burger and regular sushi roll.  The sushi burger takes a little bit of getting used to but once you do, it's delicious.  The first bite is a little strange because you don't normally expect the flavors of a burger with rice but the second bite is a pleasant one.  We can't wait for them to open the Raleigh location and will definitely be back.

I4QOnShyi11FP91-sN_PoQ.text: Super good! Had the mediterranean burger and had them add kalamata olives! Rock on!

Hfshw5XokzAKP8ZdZ7QoZg.text: I was skeptical about this place...took a look at the menu online and decided well it's worth a try since it is reasonably priced.  We got there at 7 pm on a Sat nite..it was crowded but wait was only 30 min!! (PS no reservations can be had til after 9pm on Sat walk in traffic only).  We were lead out back to a warm and toasty patio setting.  Kept watching the food being brought out..huge portions.   We still decided to do two appetizers..what were we thinking???  Anyway the crab rangoon dip is to die for!!!  The coconut crusted onion rings were excellent.  Odered a bento box with a cowfish slider of the week and sushi.  Best burger in a long time and the sushi was delish.  PLEASE OPEN IN RALEIGH!!!

L-uH1vyKEe68bPrE6eirLA.text: Cool place and delicious food.  Got sashimi and a salmon skin hand roll.

TNA9NNvJtj5H0WoPwPqMkQ.text: Husband loved the Hunka Hunka burnin' love burger. Sushi was scrumptious! Even the kids loved it!

_jbO3iZBVfcmpjYscAlPjg.text: Great sushi and great burgers. Cowfish really gives you everything you could want. I suggest deciding on a few entrees that can be shared between everyone to sample some of the variety of dishes they offer. Also, if you are a big eater I would recommended an appetizer to supplement your entree. I left wanting a bit more, but still satisfied. I highly recommend the blackened tuna roll, its the perfect blend of flavors in nicely presented roll. Definitely worth a try if you are into sushi or burgers or both!

-K_H-9Hjx7jrXq7ksIMabA.text: Very enjoyable dinner!  The service was excellent, the food was tasty, and the prices were reasonable. Manager stopped by after he heard it was our first visit and gave us a $5 coupon for next time, and there will definitely be a next time.

OYCRFPz-X10tP9MSZnp9wA.text: Arrived at 5:30 on a Saturday evening and had a 45 minute wait (they don't take reservations). Very crowded and loud, so if that's not your thing, try elsewhere. Our waitress was very slow, and often times difficult to locate. I had to wait 10+ minutes for a refill. I'm not sure if she was new or what the problem was. (She did ask the grandmother and small child next to us if their meal would be on the same bill). Cocktails were excellent, as was the appetizer (HUGE portions). We had burgers. My husband loved his, but my pimento cheeseburger didn't excite me. I've had better (try Block & Grinder for an excellent one). I'm not eager to go back anytime soon. If they're going to be that busy, they should consider a larger space or opening up another location.

BWKqLohZ44uCmhjOd6xbZw.text: Everything I have ever had here has been good to excellent. The portions are enormous, so after factoring that in I think their prices are very reasonable. Burgers are very well done with lots of interesting combos. Sweet potato fries are fantastic. I like their sushi but have only ordered it a couple times.  The rolls are gigantic so one is plenty for me. The salads are by far my favorite. I got a Greek salad with fried feta and it was so over the top good it's the only thing I will ever get at lunch going forward. It was perfectly dressed and was of course huge. If I could split it with someone it would be the perfect!  Also really like the Asian chicken salad. So very good.

pVqWXcPiqG6MtEPGQ9O1zg.text: Great food.  The burgers were amazing.  The server was friendly and I have zero complaints there.  I probably wouldn't hurry back to Cowfish for one reason only.  I couldn't hear myself think in that restaurant!  It's crowded and cramped, and conversation was pretty pointless.  I'd rather find a good restaurant with a great staff AND a reasonable amount of space to interact in!  If you don't mind a loud restaurant, then I can highly recommend The Cowfish.

2NN9yO04-wRjvWQLHxZpcg.text: very good food, but the #1 cool thing is the "bento box" for kids that comes with a rice krispie treat (sushi rice) with a swedish fish (sashimi) wrapped by fruit roll up (seaweed) for dessert.

z9f4rE5UY4NRd30lmI_Swg.text: I FINALLY got a chance to check out Cowfish! Saturday afternoon and the place still had a 15+ minute wait for a table. Lucky for us though, we were able to find a bar(ish) table down the left side of the restaurant in front of some of the Sushi Chefs. This turned out to be a treat that helped take our dining experience to another level.  Our waitress was Caroline and while I wouldn't have thought it on first impression, she turned out to be an awesome waitress. Attentive, informative, and able to roll with my quirky humor. With Caroline's help we were able to navigate the extensive menu and settled on the crab Rangoon dip appetizer along with the Turfin Surfer Roll and an amazing roll we were able to put together from their "Make your own" roll part of the menu.  This is where sitting in front of the Sushi chefs comes in. Rafali was the key guy behind the counter that absolutely hooked us up. With some fresh slices of the absolutely fresh beautiful tuna he had behind the counter, to his insanely good Jalapeno sauce (which I'm stealing by the way...ha!)  paired with his fun, friendly attitude, my fiance and I had an absolute ball here. Long if the short is.....can't wait to go back.

XGUnf4xv6XQPT30KcsoYWw.text: I like the Benton box..... I usually get the vegetarian box. I on Wednesdays for half off bottle of wine. I go kinda late like 1 or 2 hours before closing so my service is not always great but the food is good and I really like their options. Great girls night/date night place

0kTQeDIi03GhJtvFzOpBlg.text: Great great place.  You can really tell there is a buzz going on about this restaurant when you had to wait for 1hr for a table on a Wednesday night!  The hostess was very accommodating though and totally looked out for us - so it wasn't like my friends and I got neglected.    Now, I did not have the pleasure to go to the counter, but my friend Chelsey was describing the old set up, but it looks like Cowfish took the idea and added and edited to get this great fusion/unique restaurant.  The bar wraps around the entire restaurant so it can seat a ton of people - not really sure if you could just walk up and plop down [since we were waiting on a table] but it looks like you could.  As it turns out one of my buddies is a server here so we were lucky to sit in his section and he walked us through the menu... which was a novel.  And an exciting novel at that!  There were so many things I wanted to try on the menu, it seems like you can go here probably 20 times and order something new... maybe more.  We put an order in and eagerly awaited our food.  The wait for our table actually worked to our advantage since we got there a little early for dinner, but by the time we sat down we were starving and primed for a good meal.  The food came and it was beautiful to look at.  I of course took pictures so I probably looked like a freakin' tourist, but it was well worth it.  Everything tasted delicious and it was a great first experience [hopefully the first of many].

F-D3U0UOmRbIUFHQ0FXmKA.text: The short version (out of 5)  Flavor: 3 Originality: 5 Presentation: 3  There a few restaurants that have sushi and burgers on the same menu. I can't think of any that combine the two to make a burgushi.  Quite innovative in the preparation. The rice is pressed with crabmeat to form the "bun" with the sushi elements the middle. Can't say it would be something I would crave but it is different in terms of texture and flavor. It would be something I would recommend people try at least once.  I also tried the Elvis burger. Fried bananas, bacon, and believe it or not peanut butter. If its good enough for the King right? The first thing that hits you when you bite into it is indeed the peanut butter. It is lathered in there serving like a congealed glue holding the sweetness of the banana and the crunchy saltiness of the bacon. And then you get to the familiar taste of beef. It is quite a combination of flavors but can be "heavy" in taste to some. Not something you would eat on a daily basis though or else you'd want to end up like the King.  On a side note. If you have kids, I would recommend against ordering the chicken nuggets. They seemed overly processed and had the taste beat out of them. Very bland considering tofu had more flavor than these. I guess kids might not mind.  Overall, an intriguing place worth trying once.

2k76VAyqPRsiGHn7bTBtMg.text: Amazing food!    Good for sushi lovers as well as non sushi lovers.    The crab dip is a great appetizer.   The bento box offers you a good mix of everything- a little burger, some sushi, and some sides.   They also have some awesome specialty rolls- the fillet mingon roll was amazing!    The only downside is that there is no reservations.   I guarantee its well worth the wait though!

UlRzI8WeRdsi4KNwP20K5A.text: Sashimi review only:  I had the 7 piece chef's choice, which consisted of 3 yellowtail, 2 white fish, and 2 salmon.  The presentation was beautiful--banana leafs draped over a bed of ice with the fish arranged on top--but the fish was nearly frozen, which prevents those delicate flavors from melting on your tongue as sushi should.  That said I could be coerced to go back but I wouldn't order the same thing.  At a restaurant that has menu items such as "The Motherload" and "Taste Explosion" it's probably a safer bet to abandon tradition and go with something with a bit more flair.  After all Rick Flair is credited on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Iceshimiq

C_SzLF2S9qgFYytQVDoRNA.text: Excellent food.  I was content to initially order a Philadelphia and a spicy tuna roll. I was chastised heavily by the gal behind the bar who, to her credit, convinced me to go for something more unique to the establishment.  I ended up splurging for two of the rolls that were around $20 each. I thought to myself that $20 for a roll is excessive, but as it turns out, these rolls are massive so it's not an entirely unfair price.  The rolls were excellent. One came with a side of poke (pronounced po-kay) tuna (Tazmanian Devil) and the other was great as well, The Boss.  Definitely give this place a look, but expect to spend $25-50 per person if you're going strictly sushi and want to try their "sushi fusion" items.  I waited a solid 25 minutes after ordering my food to get it and it was freezing freaking cold in there, otherwise I'd give the joint 5 stars.  I didn't try a burger and I am not enthused with the idea of trying a burger with sushi.

hx7iO1VA9uq4azZJhjg1yQ.text: Okay, let's start with the obvious; The FOOD is Frickin AWESOME. Period. Staff are great as well. So, why did they get 4 and not a 5 you ask? Because, their long waits suck so bad. I know, they are soooo tasty that soooo many people come that they get soooo backed-up that I give them a 4 and that is NOT FAIR! You are correct, my 'lil friend, life is not fair! Long waits suck, especially at places that serve GREAT FOOD! Did I mention that the food is Frickin AWESOME??? But, be prepared to wait...a...long...time...to...be...seated.

Oq9kWXcPZz602gE-xyT85Q.text: Best meal in a year. What did I have a year ago? Cowfish. Ever since my first time at Cowfish, I was jonesin' for another taste. I love love love everything about this place. Unfortunately, I live in Los Angeles so I have to wait til I'm in Charlotte a couple of times a year. I drive my husband crazy chanting Cowfish Cowfish until we arrive.   First, the awesome atmosphere... The place is buzzing with positive vibes, friendly staff, chill cool decor, nice lighting, overall hip chic ambience. It's a perfect spot for me and hubby because I love sushi and sashimi. He won't touch the stuff. He's a meaty meat meat guy. Cowfish has the best of both.   I ordered a gorgeous sashimi combo with huge fresh cuts of fish that were beautifully arranged on a bed of shaved ice complete with a banana leaf and an orchid. I felt like I was on vacation. It was delish! Hubby had a grass fed angus burger smothered in some craziness. Loved it. We shared an order of coconut battered onion rings which are outstanding with the tangy spicy sauce they are served with. I also had a yummy crisp pear sake which our awesome server stopped to fill every time my cup was empty almost by magic, no matter how busy he was. It was rather impressive I must say. What really blew me away was how he really went out of his way to try to accommodate us. I had a strange request which is I really enjoy chili oil and chopped jalapenos or serrano chilis when I eat sashimi. Although they do not use chili oil there, he emerged from the kitchen with sesame oil and the chilis even though I had already said it was no big deal not to have it. It says a lot about a server who is willing to indulge a customer in a random request no matter how busy he was. I'm not sure how to spell his name but it was pronounced Gin, like the drink. I think he deserves a shout out for being so accommodating and friendly.   Obviously, I highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for a unique twist on the typical sushi bar with excellent food. Can't wait to go back in December. In the meantime, maybe consider opening a Cowfish on the west coast??

jgozgtpfnCH8lMiZU1oWrw.text: Love the ambiance... And the fact that the truly mean Burger is a plus...   Known for their sushi box (which come in a wooden box if dinning in) their Bison Burger was pretty awesome...  Also, a couple of peeps in the group got Cake Milkshake (both Van and Choc) which looked so good it almost had the whole table ordering them... Too bad people where "watching" what they ate...  Can't wait to go back...

McANNy8CZWuq42-DpDbBAg.text: A WOW experience. Very great space. We had a very informative bar tender and he suggested some great things to eat. Everything was impressive from the food, the prices and the decor. I wish there was one in Ohio. I'll be back the next time I'm in Charlotte.

BqaL9tmUAyHwf3DMkdy4VA.text: Saw this on tv as one of the top 15 burger places in the US. The burger did not disappoint. Would visit again when in town.

4LOkCzr0eGurolu11nGyoQ.text: Cowfish is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! I typically go for lunch though I have been for dinner a few times. Their burgers are sooooooo good and the fried pickles are amazing. For a first timer I would recommend fried pickles and burgushi, because really, how many places can you find burgushi?! The taste explosion roll is my fave.  I have yet to have something on the menu that I didn't like.

kmr-2RdN0GcTOTupOX61ZA.text: I go here too much and it is always so good. A little pricey but amazing. Doug's roll is the best. I usually build my own roll as well. Their sauces are on point and their meat is so fresh! Stray from the seaweed salad it's from the grocery store :/

r1ZEroL4cSSUf7QaUl4wAA.text: I was looking for a burger joint out in Charlotte, and came across The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar. This restaurant caught my attention since I saw my two favorite words: sushi and burger. Sushi and burgers are my two favorite types of food, so I decided I had to check out this place.  I came for lunch and the place wasn't too packed. Decided to ask the bartender what to order since I didn't know what was good. He recommended the "What's Shakin' Tuna Bacon Sandwich" so I went ahead and ordered that. One thing I noticed immediately was that they had a great selection of beer. I told the bartender I was visiting from California, and he told me to try one of the local brews that they had. I have to say combine sushi and burger was an odd combination, but my sandwich was delicious! The sandwich had seared ahi tuna, applewood bacon, jalapenos, and it was served with spring roll wrapper filled with sushi ice. My sandwich also came with a side of sweet potato fries which was cooked to perfection! The local brew the bartender recommended was also very refreshing! (Forgot the name)  If I ever go back to Charlotte, I would definitely check this place out! It has an extended menu compared to a regular burger joint. If you do not like sushi, they have salads, burgers, sandwiches, and rolls. The bartender that was serving me was ecstatic to help me out when I was troubled by the menu. He gave me a great recommendation on the beer and my sandwich.  The place seems relaxed and chilled. Besides the food, many people were there for drinks!  (Happy hour) Besides beer, they also have wine, mixed drinks, and sake, which is rare at a burger restaurant. Finally, this place is not overpriced as you expected. If you are in the area, you absolutely have to check this place out!!

g2RYrIGd9_XKuu4BN-ntbg.text: Very very good food. Prices on their rolls are steep but this part of Charlotte is pretty nice so if they can get it, why not. The Boss roll was very good and they all look good!

uaK1RefZEYii6Qh6twaBJg.text: Good experience just way over priced for what you're getting. Go to a real sushi spot for sushi, real steak house for meat. Little little pieces of steak and lobster in a sushi roll isn't worth 25 bucks and isn't better than some fresh salmon nigiri.

FacHzXv2AZHsPgbWRk4Qjw.text: The atmosphere is awesome and the food is better.  If you're looking for a quiet dinner, this is not the place to go.  It's also a bit on the pricey side, but everything I've had there has been great.  The fusion "burgushi" items are particularly good.  The menu is always evolving so the experience is always fresh.  The service is good enough, especially considering how busy they are.  One complaint.  There have been times when trying to place a take-out order was way more difficult that it should be.  It's so loud there that the staff can't hear the order properly.  Other times, it took 10 to 15 minutes just to get someone on the line.  Other than that, it's a great spot.

KkNVfVB6KI16Ozyg0fk4Bg.text: This is my go to/celebration place! Love it! Tuna nachos and the lobster crab spring rolls OR any of the sushi.  Delicious!

XYvefKImb6V0JscdjaCPCg.text: Today was the first time I ate here and I really enjoyed the "Fusion Box" for lunch.  Even though it was really busy, we were taken care of quickly for our lunch hour, which is a huge plus!   The Fusion Box comes with a slider, sweet potato fries, cucumber salad, edamame, and a sushi roll.  I loved it all - it was too much for lunch, so I brought the leftovers home.   I think the concept is different and fun.  I would definitely go back!

Hy9td33KeMaHdD4K4Eh98g.text: We were seated promptly on their heated (and I mean HEATED - one of the serves thankfully turned the heater broiling us off) patio.   Our server was friendly, but almost too friendly.  There's a line between polite conversation with your guests and just constantly butting in.  We knew what he was doing the night before (spending a lot of money on alcohol), what he was planning on doing today (drinking, and spending a lot of money on sushi), his favorite brewery, what the staff do when they hang out, the list goes on and on. We basically knew his whole life - I was there to catch up with good friends, not the server.  The star I'm taking off is for this.    I ordered a milk shake (caramel espresso something or other) it was not my cup of tea - but that's mainly because I found it way too sweet.   Also got the Mediterranean lamb burger (picture attached) - I cannot stress how GOOD this burger was! I never order burgers at restaurants because I'm usually disappointed but this was great. Lamb burger with feta cheese, capers, cucumbers, tomatoes, lettuce, and tzasicki sauce. Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mediterranean Lamb Burger - delic!

JCsXmWjscefVV0WT2DakPQ.text: Had a business lunch here - I had the Tuna Nachos - or whatever the heck they call them! In any case, you get large strips of lightly seared tuna on chips with an Avocado and something else that is like a nicely spicy Aioli - made for a nice lunch time snack (after eating a rather large and filling breakfast earlier in the day).  The decor in the place is cool and quirky!  Service was excellent! I'd love to come back here again and try most everything else on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

_sakf3IjLi4P9RKPuYxaJg.text: We always enjoy coming here. We love their crab dip and lobster and crab spring rolls!! To due for with the Thai chili sauce!! So sweet! So yum! The server, Andrew was very friendly and attentive as was the manager. They definitely want to make sure you have an enjoyable experience which is why we continue to return! Burgers, sushi, its all good!

6SYN0MEH8TkZwQDUfF4BuQ.text: Fun and energetic place with really good food.   The APP-ie's: Crispy Calamari "T & T",  Tuna & Avocado-tini, Parmesan Bacon Truffle Fries and Spicy Poke Dip are all worth trying depending on you and your taste.  Burgers: All of the burgers are made from 1/2 pound of all natural beef, that were humanely raised and no hormones or antibiotics. They are prepped and cooked pretty much too perfection.   Sushi: Kids love all the sushi here, every thing is fresh and made to order.   Burgushi: fusion of burgers and sushi! Open your mind as your experience these originals.  While these are good and kids do really like them, it is really different and fun. May not be for everyone....

leTTbggc74V21glgD6iCEg.text: This is such a great concept and such great food! My go-to order is the bento box because you get a little bit of everything ;)  The tuna nachos appetizer is so delicious too.   You really can't go wrong.

OWoDq82bGJjBqk47T6ioaw.text: Ok this is the ultimate fake sushi!  Since I eat sushi like a "mi trang" person, I love this place!  It's American food rolled into a sushi.  The concept of the restaurant is very straightforward merging Japanese and American culture.  Like shrimp Marge (Marge Simpson in a shrimp body).  A: The Nature Boy's Woooooooooooshit buffalooooo - it's an explosion of flavors in your mouth.  Spicy so be warned, that last taste of jalapeno really gets you.  It is exactly what you'd expect a burgushi, a burger in the form of sushi rolls.  B+: Dougs Filet Roll - pretty straight forward with the filet mignon, it's like eating a bowl of rice with cut up beef in a roll.  Overall, the food was ok, but the presentation and concept was fun.  Service was great!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Marge bring fished out.
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sake with Dogfish head
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nature boy and Doug filet roll

qskgmjYWNDNTI9L_gArdCw.text: Whoever thought of this restaurant concept is a mad scientist genius and I want to shake his hand. I can imagine sitting around one drunken night and pondering "What if we combined gourmet burgers with...sushi!." It's crazy, but it really works.  The restaurant itself is your standard chic eatery. It's classy but not memorable, besides the bathroom where the radio teaches you to speak several languages (it's weird and you have to see it!). The alcohol menu is several pages with numerous options for beer, wine and cocktails. The food menu is so long that the server spent five minutes trying to explain it. This could be too much, but if you're with a picky eater, the dozens of options are greatly appreciated. There literally is something for everyone.   There's a full page of creative half pound burgers ($11-$16) and another two pages of sushi. Then it just gets outrageous with burgers topped with sushi or sushi made out of burgers. It all is very fun and unique and I'd love to try the many combinations. After a delicious app of raw tuna nachos (tortillas with sushi grade tuna, guac and salsa) I decided on a bento box. But of course it's not your standard box. This was comprised of a mini Texas cheeseburger, a full order of fries, a specialty sushi roll (I chose the spicy Firecracker), thai cucumbers and edamame ($18). It was a ton of food and very good.  For dessert a Grasshopper minty milkshake was too thick at first but perfect after a bit.  The food overall didn't blow me away, but the concept did and it was still very tasty. This is the perfect restaurant for groups and I wish they would open one in my home state!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Raw tuna nachos
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best bento box ever? Sushi with a burger and fries

fbgywbiI4CQTq9k4dd4_Rg.text: Really the best part of coming here is to get the crab rangoon dip because it's all kinds of delicious. The burgers were good but in my opinion if I'm paying $16 for a burger it needs to be out of this world and these didn't live up to that. I've had a better burger for half that price.   Service here is good, but always seems to be a wait either to sit down or to get the food.   Pricey but still good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

lal4fvhZ-t5s3wUOIQLPyg.text: I'm going back!   No bother that it's 45 minutes away.  No bother that it's overly priced.  This is a good time with fun and delish food!   Get the app but don't worry if they fish you out before you arrive... you'll understand when you see.  Get the other app... itizersr!   Leave time to relax.    Don't sit near door in winter though.   Cold draft.   Instead, the porch is enclosed so opt for that.    GM good guy...  meet him.   Going back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster and shrimp rolls- even more yum than they look!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Riley&#39;s bento
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Build my own sushi

nccli363lc8sswcBje1ctw.text: I LOVE Cowfish! Everything I've ever had here has been fantastic! The bento box concept is a dream come True for indecisive people like me - it lets you try a little bit of everything. Personally, I can never decide between the Asian cucumbers and sweet potato fries - so yummy!   Pro tip: if you get a bento box, be sure to request the sauce (aioli?) that comes with the sweet potato fries because it's delicious and won't come with unless you ask.

g65DI_fX4b1gK4WMQegaxw.text: This is the best place in town in my opinion. It was so delightful to see a place where both sea creatures and land mammals can live together in harmony without any conflict. I really appreciate fish and cows being able to come together to form the perfect meal. 10/10 would recommend. Only complaint is that there is not a real live cow in the building. I mean they have real fish so it's kind of discriminating to not have a cow also. :)

1c947I9oe-3O4RH8PFJs_Q.text: Was alright, went for lunch and nothing special. Pricey compared to some other sushi places.

1D-TYmiXDsm-KcAJEKYn-Q.text: Interesting & unique menu    The chefs are really creative with the burgers & sushi menu items.   What is great is there are great entree choices for non sushi people & vice versa.    The staff are very friendly & make the evening meal an experience.    Overall the burger I had was very good & unique.   It was the lamb greek influenced burger was full of flavor.    Family with me praised the sushi.

ZWb8fYai7NGFO467e_1Bhw.text: Will definitely come back here. The food was delicious. I had the BBQ sushi roll and my husband had the burger sushi roll. Great concept to the originals. Want to come back and try some actual sushi. Only downside was we had an order of fried pickles and lonely jalapenos got slipped into the batter. LOL I was lucky one to find it. My mouth was on fire. But I won't hold that against them. The food was too good

mF7u1bR4Ib9f8CcmpHx1Hg.text: This. Place.  I came here on a friend's recommendation, and I am so glad this is where I ended up. This place has good sushi, good burgers, and what they are known for: Burgushi. They have so many creations of sushi ingredients in burgers, as well as burger ingredients in sushi. This was a sushi night for our group, so we got a few normal sushi rolls (which were delicious omg, we scarfed them up so quick). We also tried a burgushi that was essentially a sushi roll made with beef, pickles, and other goodies before being fried.   It was definitely unique and tasty! I tend to lean more towards normal sushi for the taste since it tastes fresh and healthy (for the most part). Eating this burgushi, it totally felt like a heart attack in every bite. So if that is what you are into, then THIS is for you.   I can't wait to go back and try more items on their menu, though!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burgushi with sweet potato fries

d2D1ds_y1qLagqECf9IK7A.text: We ate there this past Saturday and the food was excellent and came out in a timely manner!  The staff was very attentive and the managers came by our table as well to make sure everything was going great!  We also had a birthday girl with us and celebrated her and gave her a huge piece of cake!!

ZpUMJcWNgNp4cdg_EZFlmQ.text: I came here again after not thinking much of the place. The managers reached out to me and sent me a gift card to try the restaurant again.  I feel this is extremely important as a manager to actually care and reach out to customers to see what they can do better.  I admire this quality and feel very special and good that they took the time to do this.  My lunch experience today was excellent. My waiter was very pleasant and friendly.  Service was quick and satisfying. My food was really delicious, the quality was wonderful and attention to detail was amazing.  I'm so glad I got the opportunity to try again.  The crab Rangoon dip is an absolute must try!!! Huge portions of everything, come hungry!! Thank you Cowfish!!

kAOKTpXUG5hn10rGHkb4yA.text: This place is awesome!  Great sushi-burger fusion, and they do both extremely well. Highly recommended.

ptoOVuUtyupWsnxtGVtTNg.text: Food is pretty good, decor is nice.  The service is usually slow and it's a bit loud inside.

Kw9oLS7lZvu0zUvbPm4tRw.text: Why can't you have Beef & Fish? This place is worth my money. Every time. They never miss. They understand tastebuds and mixing flavors and texture to create a new culture of a menu. The Sweet &Thai Cucumbers are my fave.... The truffle fries makes sense with anything on the menu. The service is great! The Bar wraps the whole interior of the place and have Salt water fish tanks with little weird lookin fish in it... some really do look like a combination of a cow and fish... cute though! Sushi???? Take your pick... That's what COWFISH do! Every roll is to perfection. The only think I don't like about this place is that there's not enough TV's. If they did have more and bigger, I would sit and eat there atleast 3times a week.

kfifYjXsAMR90Z19ptW67g.text: I stop by this place every time I drive through Charlotte. Highly recommend ordering one of their bento boxes--that way you get the best of their burgers and sushi together.   Always busy, but I usually get a table pretty quick, and they'll always let you drink at the bar while you wait.

ZIFe3Gdeq88_aj_zrkbuYw.text: This place is difficult to get a same day dinner reservation so I tried it for lunch.  It has a very unique menu. I went heavy on the Tuna dishes.  Right now I will give it a 3.5 and after I revisit and try some more items on the menu I will re-post. Definitely worth a visit if you find yourself in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

iPCnDhE5lHa34zpugY83XA.text: A solid go-to with out of town company as there is nothing like it! Great food, staff is knowledgeable about their huge menu, and service is solid though tending toward slower.  Make sure to tweet at their signature roll.

lLp8mfiyLIHYj-9QvDNmGg.text: This was my first time here (I rarely venture out to South Park). I have to say that the concept is amazing. The best burger ( longhorn) I have had in quite some time. The place was packed. The hostesses were extremely efficient. They found us 2 seats at the bar area so that we would avoid the wait. Then it just got better. The very busy bartender helped us navigate through the menu ( it is a little too much ) like we were her only guests. When she wasn't there , the other bartender was refilling our drinks. Great teamwork. Even though a manager never made it by to check on us, we saw several managers working hard making things run smoothly.    The burger was delicious but it was under cooked and the fries could have been hotter. Completely opposite of the fried pickle appitizer. They were perfect! The miss on the burger and fries still did not stop us from telling people what an awesome place it is. We will be back and I can't wait to try some of their sushi!

NoFup4HPRbANBfCPj-9WbQ.text: One of the best new hotspots in Charlotte. Can I say my favorite appetizer is the Avocado & Ahi Tuna-Tini!!!!!!!! It is one of the best ahi tuna appetizers I've ever had! The taste is like heaven in your mouth! Aside from that, you can never go wrong with the crab rangoon dip and the blackened ahi tuna tacos!   For main course, I love the Fusion Specialty Bento Box. It gives you a taste of both the burger and sushi, which is the whole point of trying a restaurant called Cowfish!   I also love the decorations of the restaurant. There is really cute artwork hung on their walls that makes it look funky and yet modern. It is definitely a unqiue concept to try and a fusion food success story!

cAvIEEgcf_9XIzQupGDLyA.text: Amazing tastes... Awesome flavors Cowfish is one of my most favorite restaurants in Charlotte

H4HvG4IHrV5rWFRA-T0WBA.text: Had the fried pickles, turkey burger, and thai cucumber salad. All were really good and would order them again.  Previously I've had the cheese burger and veggie burger. Everything I've had here has been great.  Haven't tried the sushi yet though.    Great spot to eat outside when the weather was nice. This past weekend, we went on Sunday for lunch. A few more children there than I preferred.  Ordinarily, it's not a the kind of place that people think about taking children.  The Japanese-Country language translations in the bathroom are hilarious.

qWr3Ob3i6PyGUaoeRiCxgQ.text: Expensive but great good and wonderful service. I believe our servers name was Samantha and she was so helpful and kind. She was able to make some great suggestions for us having never been there before. Definitely, definitely go for the blackened tuna nachos. MELTS IN YOUR MOUTH! I got the bento box deal and was slightly disappointed by the mini burger but that's my fault for not being overly adventurous after having those nachos. Their martini menu is awesome as well. Lively environment and fun place. We didn't mind paying a high price for such an awesome experience.

nd-Mz1lFJndWCOrAkvgkiw.text: We have been looking for a sushi spot since we moved back.  Cowfish has been mentioned multiple times, it was about time to try it.  Funky menu.  menuPretensious trendy crowd, nothing short of what you would find in South park.  Plenty of wine choices.  Food was good, not great.  Kenny and Kelsey were fantastic servers, Jay not so much.  He was more interested in talking to the female employees than he was taking care of the customers.  We will be back but not in Jay's section.

p676JmUbpYaIO6ixP0Y1Sg.text: Went here with a friend, we ordered 4 items and shared and everything was phenomenal! There is so much on the menu to choose from, can't wait to go back and try more! We ordered Boursin Cheese Burger, Crab Ragoon Dip, Mark's Roll and Apple Pie Wantons!

SpCeIZmpd9dciteYaVeoSA.text: I took my wife and 14 year old daughter here tonight on their recommendation as they had eaten lunch here before and really liked it. To start there were two hostesses, one seemed friendly but the other was a complete boob, mumbling into her headset and then to us. We had to ask her if she was even speaking to us...0 personality. The wait was about 15 mins so we sat at the bar for a draft and a wine cooler. Service was great at the bar. We were seated outside as per our request. Service was not so good. I know they were busy as it was 7 pm on a Friday night but you shouldn't have to go without water or drinks for 15 minutes. We started with the crab Rangoon appetizer, it was delicious.   My wife had the Bento box and was quite satisfied with it. She said her slider was the best part. My daughter had the spicy crunchy shrimp and also loved it. I had the Bison burger.......never again. Maybe it would have been better had I requested it cooked well instead of med rare. It was gross and quite a mess on the bun. Now don't get me wrong, I can usually eat anything, but the ingredient combination on this burger were not doable. The side of fried pickles were pretty good.....but not great. During this meal we saw every other member of wait staff except ours. Other tables got better service. Even when she cleared our plates all of our glasses were empty.....she didn't notice.  We later ordered a grasshopper milkshake......eh....it was ok. That's when we decided to ask for water. I would have ordered another beer too but was never offered one. I can't really say if I'll ever go back but I would like to try the sushi. I'm convinced this place has an absentee owner or they were on vacation because no one would have a hostess like the one we dealt with. We watched her seat a couple with a child two tables away from us and as the woman seated her child this hostess stared at her as if she was soooo annoyed, it became comical to watch her facial expressions.

zbEpFDj0mCbpdZqlAhqovg.text: This is the first time Ive been back to Cowfish in 2 years.  Upon entering it appeared they do not allow the hostess to leave the front of the restaurant unattended. Unfortunatly after 4 min. no one would come and seat us. 3 pm and no other customers waiting. She finally grabbed a waitress and had us seated. Communication breakdown is more or less what I felt. I did notice two managers on the floor and plenty of wait staff. The service was good and food as always did not dissapoint.  Just need to work on the inital awakward wait period. BTW the hostess was not the problem here!

bmuP9HI9BBQs9VgxSbl3Fg.text: This place is so good!!! HIghly recommend build your own roll. If your party is small sit at the bar to avoid the wait on their busy nights! Yum will definitely be going back!

DhtuIO5n90qy2-260OEu5g.text: Delicious Bison Burger!  Just wish it was a little bigger.  :D

HSAI2ZYtpPny6rZlBpGKxg.text: I haven't been to Cowfish recently but I just want to say that they continue to do a great job. I visited tonight and had a very good experience. Great service, very nice sushi, somewhat OK wine but overall a very good experience. Cowfish will continue to be my Southpark area go-to restaurant.

Una8ds0MFPOGwvur7D4MNQ.text: I know a lot of people who say, "a burger place and sushi?! Not so sure!", however once they try it they are hooked! I've never had a bad experience there except for wait time- they don't take reservations. So, it can be a 20min wait or an hour! But, they have a rather large full bar with whatever pleases you, so grabbing some wine passes the time. Really great place to go on a date or double-date or hit up after work to unwind. Chic, posh, hip, intellectual crowd/atmosphere.

AAsO8uMmmu_BpezR6P7BJQ.text: Best sushi I ever had. You can never go wrong with the "firecracker roll" !! I will definitely come back again.

bn-zNhzryHFn8k7F45KpuA.text: Was such a fun place! Had tried to have dinner here multiple times since moving to the SouthPark area but there was always such a wait. Was able to get a seat at the bar one night when my brother was visiting, and it was great! We split the crab Rangoon dip it was delicious! I got a burger while my brother got a sushi and mini burger tray and it was such a cute presentation. I don't think I would wait hours to be seated, but I would come back to try some of the other fun options on their huge menu.

c01OMWGh4p3dMuiVncSoUA.text: as ridiculous as the wait is on the weekends, it's worth it!  I don't think I've ever eaten or drank something here that I haven't liked! a couple dishes have really stuck with me because they were too delicious to forget.. like the seared sesame tuna, and the truffle fries! Among the fusion sushi specialties, I'm not even going to attempt listing all the good ones, because I've never eaten a bad roll here!  The concept of this restaurant itself is great; there aren't too many places that serve up the sushi - burger combination! The ambiance is neat, and the staff very friendly. But not everything about Cowfish is praise worthy. There are a couple negatives in addition to the long wait times. the menu is ridiculously extensive, and therefore confusing! and... the prices are kinda crazy too (specially the sushi.) The burgers & sandwiches are decently priced, but can't say the same about the sushi, appetizers or drinks. Probably not a place to go to every other week, but definitely worth visiting at least a couple times (like i said, the menu is too long, and one visit just won't be enough!)!

H9EKaazgzyggaK5L9KV8Uw.text: Favorite restaurant in Charlotte.  Food & service is always the best.  I've had 90% of the rolls on the menu and have never been disappointed once (I didn't like the Birkenstocky roll, but maybe if I was Vegan).  The burgers are surprisingly delicious as well considering I think of Cowfish first as a sushi restaurant.  I usually go with the Foreplay roll, I've never seen another sushi restaurant use fried oyster.  The Ahi Tuna Nachos are a must-have appetizer for me.  This is a restaurant I feel like you HAVE to take out-of-towners to.

wOzmmJdzWjr3mlPlN_AjFQ.text: Love to eat here!  My fav item is the WOOSHI roll.  Service is great and food delish.  I always bring my out of town business associates here.

dvbjmBhfvPBMnBDeFigiDA.text: Amazing bison burger; very tasty and well cooked all the way baby! I had the vanilla mint chai tea and let me tell you that will be my go to. The crab Rangoon was delicious and paired nicely with the chips and chili sauce; def recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

m0w4UgCaCOWsQzuQj4y1lw.text: So darn good! My husband and I were in Charlotte for a short time and absolutely had to come here. The food was delicious, service was great (Caryn made our time phenomenal) and we would absolutely come back!

ETB4fdIZ1KqeOCOQ-R9pmQ.text: Always our household favorite.  Very very good and kid friendly.  Aioli frys are top notch.

4ASd3GSBhonm78CfULsg1g.text: This place is great. They have an extensive variety of food options. They have bar, table, and heated/covered outdoor patio seating.   Sushi is great. I didn't have a regular burger but they looked great too. I had the veggie burger which was really really good. SeasonL Vegetables were fresh/good too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

VTcp-jKrRYJ9CgoyZh3GxQ.text: I never thought I'd have a burger and fries with sushi and edamame in the same bento box. After this experience, I realized I've been missing out on an interestingly tasty combination. Sushi was great, my slider was yummy, and the alcoholic shake we had was delicious! Parking was a little challenging (there's actually a structure outside of the restaurants building) and if you are able to, sit at the bar to avoid the possibly long wait. They serve the full menu at the bar, at least during normal business hours (I'm not sure if it changes on weekend nights or something like that). Please try this place while in town, you won't regret it!

7y2thv1dHcBiUBW6D_tuKw.text: Been here twice now and have been very happy both times.  The menu is pricey here but the food is very good.  We tend to stick to their sushi options and the fish was very fresh.  The drinks are excellent and the environment is fun and unique.  The staff seem happy to be there and all have treated us wonderfully.  Be forewarned they do not accept reservations.  You can download their app and, once you're within 3 miles of the place, you can put yourself in queue.  As with most places like this, they get very busy Thu - Sat so be prepared to wait if you're going 7p-9p.  There is a ton of shopping in the area (including a mall) so, if there is a long wait, you can always run errands while you wait.

ffVUJvsRGGNghIf7_mOZQg.text: I love their shrimp tempura. I'm not a huge sushi person , just a beginner but everything I tried was pretty good and always super fresh. Never had a bad experience here . It gets busy during the evenings and the weekends.

5U1LjMz_-Ghg9JrfPDdl0A.text: Interesting riff on sushi.  Great staff who was super friendly and attentive.  Rolls are on the larger size so one is a solid meal!

AoZ8XsokBlPyOTA03WbM-g.text: Cowfish is another ho-hummer. The sushi is probably top three in CLT but the burgers are nothing special and the decor is starting to look tired and shabby. This is one of the many restaurants in Charlotte that was exciting and new when it opened quite a few years ago now, and just hasn't remained interesting. I now go about once every few months when others in my group insist on going. I don't think I'd ever eat here if it were up to me. For the money, there are more exciting choices, including Baku just across the street. For a burger, I'd rather walk over to the mall and spend less for a better burger at Five Guys.   The place also bursts at the seams with kids, which is not ideal for a restaurant this expensive.   One of the worst problems with this restaurant is that, as far as I can tell, it does not take reservations. That inconvenience factor, alone, takes it off my list unless I'm trying to eat at an off time.   Best things on the menu when you go are the Blackened Tuna Nachos, Firecracker Roll, and any of the milkshakes. Those items are why I give it three stars instead of two.   I'd avoid the burgers and salads. And they do this hot mess they call "Burgushi," which is a disgusting combination of burgers and sushi. You should never, ever get that. Absolutely vile.

_k-p1guJtLaeCYfUvdGtwA.text: Cowfish lived up to the raves I have heard. The sushi tasted fresh and I loved the option to create your own roll.  My husband's burger was delicious. So many options the menu can be a little overwhelming, if you have a minute before your first visit take a look.  It's a great place for a fun meal.  Service was friendly and helpful. We didn't need to ask for a refill. We will happily return soon!

CFDidIZhi_GXtO4EzvXV6Q.text: Great food as always!! Tropical storm. Soft shell Crab sandwich!! Delicious- have to ask for it since it's not on the menu!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great Sushi! Great service! Great Burgers! Great Place! The storm sushi roll!!

tPT_i8yfnaX8OAL7CRGHTQ.text: Menu is big and a little complex. Service is great, even though the place is crowded. We had a 45 min wait for lunch, but were able to score two sits at the bar. Highly recommend that if 1 or 2.   Food is good, had the bento box to try both burger and sushi. Didn't disappoint.

VaJpD-OHF1M7lWzDyQi_4Q.text: Great eat. I'm a regular but have had two instances where service left us in the restaurant for hours and appetizers came out after entrees.

JYhBwgiSJTOaF5w8VA6gCw.text: Sushi and burgers   together is a magical idea!!!!    I highly recommend the fusion bento boxes. The portion is huge and you get to sample a little bit of everything.  As a tip, you can substitute out sides on the bento box!!! The firecracker roll is amazing.  Cowfish doesn't take reservations but when you check in at the front they take your phone number and text you when your table is ready.  You can grab a drink at the bar or walk over to crate and barrel why you wait.    The patio is amazing out back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Edamame
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fusion box
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

AU_tvlzmGgQXQYQf_tcaFQ.text: I'm just don't understand the love affair with this place.  I've been a few times now but I'm always underwhelmed by it.  Is this concept so amazing to people that it overshadows average food?  Do we just keep hoping the food will be amazing "the next time"?  I guess it's just me because each time I've been here it's busy.  The sushi is ok... it isn't fabulous.  The burgers... they're ok...not even great.  The service... hit or miss though we did charm some smiles from our server at this last visit but ??? What am I missing here (besides better food and experience?    I tried the bento box and the mini burger (it doesn't qualify as a slider) was very dry; the philly roll was also dry and the only thing I really tasted was the cream cheese in it.  The sweet potato fries were good and I had a few bites of the cucumber salad.  I wasn't paying attention that it has edamame.  I can't eat that, but again...underwhelmed.  My sweetie got the turkey burger which he said was meh.    Now the decor - I'd give that 4 stars with the cool graphic re-imaginings of more famous paintings; the fish tank - those are always nice.  I can't in good conscience give it 2 stars just because I think it's meh, but meh it is to me and I'm pretty sure I've tried it for the last time.

Kf0ZN3tDr3A6vESLX_sTiw.text: Love Cowfish!  Vibrant bar with delicious burgers, sushi, appetizers and a lot more (spiked milkshakes)!  There is often a wait because it is worth it.  The outside sitting is great too.

NeBYQ6BpinMQSiI0y1raSA.text: I really loved my first Cowfish experience. I happened to be in the area, craving a veggie burger--little did I know what a big deal this place is! It was about 5:15PM on a Saturday night; we waited an hour for a table. They have a texting system with a grace period of 10 minutes so they often encourage people to wander around the mall while waiting. We did just that.  This place is loud, so be prepared. They fit a lot of people into a not-so-big space. It's not overcrowded, but it's not exactly roomy.  Our waitress was lovely and guided us through the menu. There are SO many options, which they understand, so they give you a lot of time to peruse. I started with the house side salad, which was a pretty good size. The ginger dressing was exactly what I was hoping it would be! Delicious and refreshing.  I had the Heavenly Veggie burger, which was quite good. I'm not sure if I'll call it the best in CLT (still have many veggie burgers to try before claiming that) but it was great. Their chipotle mayo or whatever it was was delicious. And the sweet potato fries were great. I also tried their regular fries, which were delectable as well.  I couldn't resist trying a milkshake and got the smores. MAN OH MAN was this a great decision. There was marshmallow throughout the shake (fluff??? who knows) and it was just so freaking good. My only problem was I truly felt like I was going to explode from fullness at the end.   Having had a glass of wine, side salad, burger, and shake, my individual total was around $30. It's not cheap, but I will happily pay that for this burger and shake experience. Plus, it's a fun atmosphere. I look forward to returning soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. SMORES MILKSHAKE
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie burger with sweet potato fries - YUM

S2YYH8Nv6nYdZodtDCCp7g.text: Have dined at cowfish many times over the years and it is always consistently great. The food is fresh, the staff is friendly. They have a great menu with a wide range of options. Favorites include the veggie burger, build your own burger, the cabbage salad and definitely the truffle fries! Also their Moose is Loose cake is incredible. One thing they could improve upon, however, is the cleanliness. The last time I dined here, our waitress was visibly sick and wiped her nose every time she walked away. We requested to move tables but this was definitely an eye opener for us.

YsyT0XueWhzbn6oO7KP4wA.text: After two years, it's time for me to give Cowfish what it deserves: a higher star rating. 3 stars is no longer enough. For my most recent visit, I met w/friends.   Because we had a long wait, I sat at the bar before my friends arrived, and had a Cracked TOPO. Such a small drink that packed a punch. One glass was enough. Then I ordered the lobster egg rolls. I noticed that the price has been increased. $15 is too expensive for an appetizer of Two egg rolls. Nevertheless, I keep ordering it. It is filling if you want to not share and order it as an entree.  Everyone left full and happy. Service was great, as the waitress was patient while we figured out what we were going to eat. Food was served quickly. I had the Firecracker Roll. Eel is the new kani. They had burgers. The sushi here is delicious. Everyone left full and happy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Boursin bacon burger w/ sweet potato fries
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thundering herd bison burger

RqkHplfW0_5gUd6kX16CuQ.text: Came here on a whim on a Wednesday night and it was fairly crowded. We were told it would be a 45 minute wait. We had no where else to be so we stuck around. We were seated outside on the patio. They do have outdoor heaters, which is nice, but the ones nearby weren't turned on until the very end of our meal.   Started with the lobster/crab spring rolls and they were amazing. More please.  I ordered the grandma burger (can't remember the name) but I know it had pimento cheese and bacon. It was pretty dang good. My friend also ordered a burger and had no complaints. He even finished the rest of my burger that I was unable to finish.   I wanted to try dessert, but I was too full at this point. Next time.

DiYMDersLOHXTIAaiyWgfQ.text: The food here makes me feel like I won the lottery. Who ever created this place deserves the noble peace prize.

8cxlHaCCSmBsA-l1Hgvlhg.text: Interesting concept. Burgers and sushi together. Pretty good service but the place was loud. Sliders and bacon sushi are an interesting pair.

xhrTGovqtkWkqzO0SqNbtQ.text: So delicious. I didn't partake in anything on the burger menu but the sushi was legit. Interesting concept and extensive menu. I'll be back!

ob40ZjGdX5S2TlS7s1GlQQ.text: Excellent service and the food was delicious!! Try the bento boxes if you are a first-timer.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

7kvsqjnqG-ZJwR_OtWtlJQ.text: Everything was delicious. The tuna nachos was the best thing I've eaten in Charlotte! Kelsey was a sweetheart! If you're indecisive get the "bento box!"

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Get the tuna nachos! One of the best things I&#39;ve eaten in Charlotte! And if you&#39;re indecisive, get the burushi! Kelsey was a sweetheart.

SMkNZ9htSt10EaeTUJ53LA.text: Excellent, delicious variety.  The chef will adapt your choices to your taste.   Great customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seared tuna nachos

IS8wPMjc53vTWZ4lrj-r4A.text: Our server, Leon, was great. Food came out quickly, everything was very flavorful, and fresh. The menu is so unique. Can't wait to come back!!!

eKof8oBSoKUXHm9IvxenqQ.text: Cowfish always have excellent food. However i am not sure what I did wrong but I always feel so intimated by the hostess. I am here with my family with kids and I am extremely polite but she just stared at me and talk to me with her back facing me and no smile. However the family that comes after me, she gave them a warm welcome with a smile. This happens all the time.

98b6XsSRAdrS7oVApCpOmw.text: Fun & up beat atmosphere. Great service.  Parking is an issue being in such close proximity to the mall.  Creative menu items. Incredibly martinis!

w0TI06HYNHcGCYtWtevQww.text: I'm visiting from Los Angeles and decided to stop by here to grab some lunch. James was incredible!!!! The service he provided was out of this world, so many wonderful recommendations and made the experience so much more unique. Now for the food.....wow! Must try the deliverance roll it was very unique and delicious! Thank you for such a pleasant experience!

ggzcInCDMdZiV9kgOu-5tw.text: Awesome unique menu of creative and the standards of sushi plus some incredibly delicious burgers made from top quality beef.  Oh, and burgushi.  Yep, sushi with a beef influence like one inspired by local celeb Rick Flair - The Nature Boy's WOOOOO-shi BuffalOOOOO-shi Roll.

rHC7WS4kY6fzHZeAWRnBkQ.text: We went here for a date night on 1/2/2017. First, being a Monday night, we were a bit surprised with how busy they were. We ended up finding two seats at the bar though. It took awhile to be greeted and get drinks as the bartenders were pretty deep in their conversations with each other. Once we finally got to order our drinks, we ordered our food. I've only eaten here once before and it was a few years ago! I was disappointed to see that the cucumber side is a lot smaller than it used to be! It used to be an appetizer (or something) because in the past, it was enough to feed 3 people and was served piled high on a plate! Miss that! Anyway, my husband did the create your own sushi and I got a burger. Our meals were good but the service and drinks weren't. I ordered a cosmo that I could barely drink because it was so sour and I would have asked to have it remade but again, we were barely spoken to. I remembered it as being a fun, friendly place to go and enjoy but it seemed to be lacking this evening. Not sure if we'll be going back or not.   Ps- parking is scarce. Park in the parking deck and walking is the best option.

ppXYFY4765nH06dLM7kLrA.text: Although the wait to eat here can be excruciatingly long and the price of their food is on the more expensive end, cowfish has really awesome and unique food! The blend of sushi and meat is definitely something that I didn't think that I would like, but it's actually very complimentary and delicious. If you are going for dinner, definitely go early. If you go at a normal dining hour (past 6:00), you will probably have to wait 2 hours on a weekend night. Going for lunch is also a great option since there aren't a lot of people either! But if you do have to wait, you can always go shopping at the mall right across the street! They also have super awesome decorations of movie and musical posters spoofed up with cows and fish- super cute.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing. Korean sliced pork and fried kimchee on top of a burger-- tastes amazing! 5/5 stars
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento box, get to try a little bit of everything!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Surfin turfer roll. Literally the best thing ever.

zyG8yVaEBbPnj78yK47Qsg.text: Sat at the bar because of the wait but the service was good, the food was awesome and the cocktails were on point. I would definitely return or recommend

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

tRPRT2Y5r-ipVmEpIzdzHQ.text: OMG, AMAZING!!!!! We couldn't believe how good the food was and how creative the dishes were! We had the crab Rangoon dip, which was basically a deconstructed crab Rangoon. Then we had: The Nature Boy's WOOOOO-shi BuffalOOOOO-shi Roll "The Prime Time" Filet & Lobster Roll The Cowfish Bento Box The Turfin Surfer Roll  Sooooo wish there was a place like this near me. Miss it already. If you're in Raleigh or Charlotte, you must try this place!

JEExozQyGXgUR7dThVJmrw.text: It's been phenomenal every time I've gone! Both the burgers and sushi are amazing! I can't wait to try the burgushi!

RoZ521aDNMSpM3TrUorvWw.text: Cow fish is a unique experience. We had a wait at the bar prior to being seated outside. They do a text msg thing to those waiting and you can track your fish so you know how much longer your wait is. It's fun!   We were told by a few colleagues to try the bento box as a first time guest. We did and shared different rolls and truffle / sweet potato fries. Food was very good, rolls and beef alike were well prepared. And it's pretty fun to eat sushi and a burger at the same time!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento box

hCucxrZ-MkJlwfqLRkE1tw.text: Great great place. We went on Saturday nigh so my review is a couple days late.   We had a 45 minute wait( which was unusually short according to other people waiting) which is not bad because they text you when your seat is ready. So you can visit the shops around the restaurant.   Started off with the tuna nachos and they were freakin awesome!! We had decided to try the burgushi even though the burgers and sushi looked amazing around us.   I got lamburgushi and my wife got dougs filet roll. Dougs fillet was the way to go though. I got a yellow tail roll just to try some sushi and it was absolutely perfect.   Great service and good food. Probably should expect a wait. It's first come first serve at the bar. Next time I'm just going to get a burger because I really wanted one after I saw a few come out.

H7x0Jzugj5a98kMdfLgfvw.text: There's always a wait but they have a large bar area if you don't wish to wait. Try the Parmesan fries they're very good. Sushi and the turkey burger are amazing
