Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Appetizer fries

320lFiDgxBQp1T-iWMT44Q.text: With the exception of having to wait a good amount of time every single time, the food here just far supersedes the wait time and it's totally worth it. I've only had the burger with ham, bacon, and egg on it with fries, but I would keep coming back just for that time and time again. Great ambiance as well!

h9DAKR9YWyMp-kdC8AQBWQ.text: This is a crowd pleaser when I have people in from out of town since it has a lot of different items and can accommodate nearly anyone. Personally the box is always best so I can have a little of everything but I've enjoyed their salads and burgers and sushi and my cousin loves the milkshakes. I do think it is a bit overpriced for what they offer but it's honestly probably because of the area.

VWmgJ-TjTa2k1yskaOUfXA.text: I had to come back and update my review based on the exceptional customer service I received from Jen after posting my review. She contacted me regarding my concerns and reached out to resolve the situation. I will definitely come back for another visit for a redo!

H9q-w-o0Xhx9NiijPvRfHQ.text: Service here was on point and everyone was so friendly! From taking our order to refills and boxing up our food. Perfect.  I only gave 4 instead of 5 stars because I think they could do better with the food for the price. It wasn't bad, it was actually creative. As long back as they hold back on the salt, everything else was good.   Btw, outdoor seating is awesome. Even if it's a bit hot, there's lots of fans that'll make it less uncomfortable.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Parmesan-Bacon Truffle Fries: a bit too salty for us

coL3HCT5E_FHgKsB1LvBOQ.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here on our drive from Folly Beach, SC to Pittsburgh, PA. We absolutely loved it and wish there was one closer to home! The bacon truffle parm fries are a favorite. We loved the unique combinations of burgers and sushi. I had the Texas burger and Mark's sushi roll. The BBQ sauce for the burger was so delicious-not too sweet with a little bite to it. The sushi was equally delicious. My boyfriend got the lamb burger and The Boss sushi roll. He liked it so much he ordered another box with the Jammin Burger and Pinky Swear roll. High quality fish and high quality burgers! Our server, Rob, was outstanding and did an amazing job of making the very large menu less confusing as well as offer us wonderful recommendations. His service was spot-on.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

i02ubfffzdPd2_IYQY6-2g.text: Fabulous atmosphere, appetizers, drinks and sushi! The bento box is perfect for the person who wants to try it all! The kids bento box comes with a tattoo and a Rice Krispy sushi roll! The kids absolutely loved it and can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

V3gfl7CaJ503Bv_-Bqy3mQ.text: I've been here twice and have loved the food both times. Be prepared to wait a long time on a weekend night, grab a drink at the bar or go with patient friends. The appetizers are fantastic! We even tried an alcoholic milkshake (I was skeptical on how good it would be) but it really good!

1UYaNQRDKGBtTzLir6A06g.text: Why can't we have a place like this in Greensboro? At the suggestion of a friend, my daughter and I dropped in to the Cowfish for lunch. I was a bit hesitant only because I'm an adventurous eater and love sushi, however, my daughter is a no-fish, no-spicy, no weird combo kind of girl. Cowfish fit us both. We both got the Bento Box. She had the shrimp tempura roll and a regular mini slider in hers. I had the Firecracker roll and the speciality jalapeno cheese double burger in mine. She loved her meal, though she said the cucumber salad was too spicy for her. I loved everything about my meal. The sushi was excellent. I thought the 4 pieces would be small but they were huge, to the point I had to cut them in half. The burger was a good sized and perfectly cooked slider. I like spicy so I liked the salad. And the edamame was plentiful. Also, I got regular French fries and even though I'm not a fan of fries, these were good enough for me to bring home the leftovers.  I also ordered the ahi tuna "nachos." Don't let the word nacho fool you. It's more of a crispy cracker with their (incredible) crab Rangoon dip, avocado, and beautifully seasoned pieces of fresh tuna. It was excellent, fresh, and refreshing.   We were pretty full so we did some shopping. But before we left we headed back to try their milkshakes. Any place that has marshmallow in a shake has my business. I ordered the Smores and my daughter got the Cake Shake with chocolate cake. Hers was sweeter, like cake and ice cream in a single sip. I could even taste the frosting from the cake. The Smores shake was rich in marshmallow and graham cracker flavoring though neither overpowered the other. Towards the end, I got a lot of chocolate syrup so they could tone it down just a bit on that. We got our shakes to go but that didn't stop them from being presented very nicely. They were, to put it simply, pretty shakes. Pretty darn yummy ones that is!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ultimate burger box with firecracker roll and jalapeño burger slider.
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ahi tuna nachos

D3x5vpVZFx-r69TQ3-GwDw.text: Looking for something to impress my daughter but also take me outside of my normal dining desires. I came across Cowfish... And thought... Well, here we go. Burgers and Sushi... Really?!?! I will either love it or hate it... Nothing in between.  LOVE LOVE LOVE! I have never found a sushi that I could say that about. The Mad Mango is perfect for someone that really doesn't like the raw options. I also loved the seared tuna nachos. My daughter and son in law also enjoyed their choices and are still texting each other how great the whole experience was. We all left with a warm and cozy happy feeling inside and the wish we had a Cowfish in our hometowns. So... You need to come to Greenville, SC, San Diego, CA and what the heck... Let's add Florence, SC... PLEASE!

CQb5_FjRaSP8NedatlJuQg.text: I went for lunch on a Thursday with two friends. The menu looked exceptional, with so much variety. The appetizers (crab rangoon dip and tuna poke dip) were devoured quickly. We all had bento box lunches that included a mini burger, sweet potato fries, cucumber salad, edamame, and a sushi roll. The little burger was out of this world and now I wish I had gotten a full sized one! Meat was flavorful and fresh (the waitress told us it was grass fed/organic). Sushi was good and so was everything else in the bento box. I wish the sweet potato fries had been crispy, but they tasted good.  I usually do not comment on the decor (I go for the food), but it was very nicely decorated and modern looking with really cool pictures and objects on the walls.

Lr8KeSLDY7q16E9IGxOFDA.text: Amazing food awesome service would return for sure. The bento box was amazing. Try the truffle cheese fries. Sushi was okay but the burger was best.

dkky39Ka5ZG0BNq-f4EBhw.text: The food was great however the reason I'm giving 4 stars are for a couple of reasons: when we first got there the hostesses told us it would be a half hour wait so we decided to order drinks from the bar (spiked shakes) I got a text saying our table was ready within 5minutes. My boyfriend waited at the bar for 10 more minutes and our drinks were still not done finally the bar tender said she'd bring them to us when they're done. They came and had goo dripping all down the sides of them we had no napkins. Our first waitress was super nice and then they changed waitresses mid shift. The next one forgot about us because we were sitting there finished for 15min then she ran out to our table in a panic saying "are y'all done?" Besides that the food was actually very good. My sister and I substituted the burger in the bento box for a veggie burger and you can substitute the sides for an extra 0.50 cents each.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

Pg9zNk64qEr7zLjCG0ZSug.text: It's a burger! It's a sushi! It's BURGUSHI!!!  I know who would've thought this combination would work? And it does!   I ordered the What's Shakin' Tuna Bacon Burgushi:  Ok I'll admit when I first saw this I was underwhelmed. Just some iceberg lettuce too much bacon (is that possible?? I pulled out 5 strips of bacon.) finally you have a layer of yellowtail tuna. But then... Then I pushed it down & took a couple big bites...The favors were explosive. Tuna was boldly seasoned. Bacon provided that burger comfort. Lettuce was fresh & laced with their special sauce. To my surprise the spring roll wrapper they used for the "bun" was stuffed with rice & crab. WOW

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Compressed my Burgushi together and all the amazing flavors complimented each other so well! Way better than it looks
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. What&#39;s Shakin tuna bacon Burgushi! Soooooo much bacon
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster &amp; Crab spring roll... Good but nothing crazy good like the Burgushi

Tr7dTH_qDJVw9IjcjVbUXg.text: I knew that I would have a great time at The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar from the minute my wife and I walked in.  As someone growing up in the Northeast, I had heard of this supposed "Southern Hospitality" in myth and legend throughout my entire life living in the cruel and cutthroat suburbs between NYC and Philadelphia and accustomed to eating meals in restaurants with gruff wait staff that cannot hide their sense of derision. But no longer will I have "Southern Hospitality" in my myth-list under the Lochness Monster and Bigfoot! My wife and I could not have had a more pleasant experience with our host Scottie (major props for his recommendations, followups, and friendliness that made us feel as though we've known each other for years), continued with Jamie with his SPOT-ON service throughout our entire meal.  Speaking of meal, everything we ate was delicious; we started "traditionally" with the "Double Salmon Roll". As a fish lover, the balance of the smoked salmon, fresh salmon, and creamy avocado was a very tasty combination. That being said, I was especially happy that the rice of the sushi (in my opinion, one of the key differentiators between mediocre and GOOD sushi) was cooked to the perfect done-ness.  The wonderful eating experience continued with our entrees. The better half ordered the "Fusion Specialty Bento Box" with "Mark's Roll". First, the best way to describe "Mark's Roll" is to think of a Philly Roll that comes from, as (in)famous chef Guy Fieri could describe, a Philly Roll from FLAVORTOWN USA. The bento box itself was DELICIOUS; the mini burger was the juiciest slider I've ever had; sweet potato fries were such a great balance of crispy, salty, and sweet; the Thai cucumbers were so fresh and refreshing and such a great counterpoint to the other heavier sections.  My choice of "The 4-S" was decided when Jamie, our waiter, described the creation of the "bun" on the 4-S "sandwich" - Soy paper wrapping imitation crab meat with rice SMASHED in a panini press. How could I say no to that?! Despite my impulsive choice we were, yet again, very pleasantly surprised with the dish itself. Essentially, it is small steaks of tuna and yellowtail topped with a crisp and bright mix of greens and peppers, all "sandwiched" between these 2 "buns". The pleasure of eating this sushi sandwich goes FAR beyond the pure novelty of this concept; the flavors and textures certainly lived up to expectations.  Our coda to the meal was the "Fresh Berry Tall Cake" with the ice cream on the side (curse our intolerance of lactose!). Honestly, if there was a "worst" part of the meal, I would probably rate this course as the least-best, BUT please do not misunderstand - the dessert was still delicious. This cake, plus a cup of the Jasmine Green Tea, was a wonderfully sweet and soothing way to end a wonderful meal.  Though our time in Charlotte is quite short, and the aim was to try different places every day...The Cowfish is making it very difficult to keep that objective. Who knows, we may be back for more before the end of the week.

VUB3ZBir9rLdUUjDys1iZQ.text: Came here on my layover in Charlotte. To be honest, I was a bit skeptical about this place because the fusion of burgers and sushi sounds quite bizarre and I'm not a huge fan of Asian fusion in general. I was delighted when Cowfish ended up being surprisingly delicious. My gf and I both ordered a bento box, which was half a roll and a specialty slider with three sides. My bento consisted of: half of the Tropical Storm roll, Dynamic Duo slider, sweet & spicy Thai cucumbers, sweet potato fries and bacon coleslaw. The sushi roll was scrumptious, fish was really fresh. Loved the look of the colorful tobiko. Slider was also tasty and the perfect size, any bigger and I would not have been able to finish my bento. It had juicy braised short rib, sweet roasted garlic and tomato onion jam on a Hawaiian roll, it was divine. Enjoyed all the side as well, devoured everything. Yummmm!  What made our visit memorable was our server Cameron. He was so sweet and friendly! The menu was overwhelmingly big and he took his time to answer all our questions despite being busy; the restaurant was packed. He also gave us a few recommendations on what to do in Charlotte, since we were tourists. Not only that but he also hooked us up with a fresh berry cake because it was our birthdays. Such a sweet heart! Needless to say, we really really loved dining at Cowfish.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Postcards.
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

1nwHU7MsyF1IRTSlSxdSgA.text: I don't give out 5 stars easy. This place is off the chain. I built my our roll with lobster, salmon, avacodo and topped with yellowtail tuna and filet. One of the best sushi I have ever had. I knew that adding filet to sushi was going to be big or was going to fail, I don't know if I can ever have sushi with out filet on it now. Oh yeah the wife had a burger and my son had a bento box with burger and California roll which they all liked.

nPkfkXR4CXQwWB8W7Y5TxA.text: I have A LOT of food allergies. It's been difficult and somewhat depressing going out on dates (restaurants) with my husband. Cowfish worked with my allergies and our waitress Katy was phenomenal!! I high recommend them!! My food was delicious too!

sFWnAJmMlKoQT4PBx7IF_w.text: This place is awesome whether you eat out or dine in. Definitely try the crab Rangoon. And all their sushi rolls are delish! Great place for dates or just hanging with friends.

GiyXJDEG2AkXDJFDaLYHmA.text: This place was surprisingly good!! I'm a real foodie, and I literally travel to eat. I've never expected Charlotte, NC to be a foodie place. I wanted to check out Cowfish because they had so many reviews with great ratings. Yelp didn't disappoint!   It was a slow early evening, so we sat ourselves at the bar. First, the service was amazing! Our waitress offered us samplings of the beers on tap. I actually ended up not getting one but our waitress didn't mind at all. She was great!  We took a really long time to order because there was so much on the menu, and everything sounded so good. I ended up getting the 4-S burger, which was seared tuna and yellowtail on a bed of sprouts and salad with spring roll paper stuffed with rice and kani as the "bread." I've never had spring roll paper stuffed with rice and kani as "bread" before. It was pretty cool! I have to say though that if you ate the whole "burger" as is, you won't taste much of the tuna and yellowtail. I actually deconstructed it to eat just so I can taste the flavors of everything! A spicy chili soy sauce dipping sauce was served with the 4-S burger. I got a side of fried pickles. I asked for a dipping sauce for the fried pickles. Our waitress gave three different sauces - ranch, sweet chili, and horseradish aioli! So nice of her! Ranch was definitely the best sauce for the fried pickles. I really enjoyed their fried pickles!  Overall the food was great and the service was excellent! I would definitely return to try other things on their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

sKvESBXCpYRtFEgQjKC4ww.text: I was in town for business and met a friend for dinner. I should mention, I worked in a restaurant for 5 yrs, am a foodie and take my reviews seriously. My friend, is culinary school educated and has been a chef for 11 years. We know service and we know food.   This was my first time at Cowfish after hearing rave reviews from my friend if their burger rolls aka "burguishi".  The restaurant was busy and no seats were available at the bar. We waited about 30 minutes for a table. While people watching we saw a few patrons with children which was off-putting. I honestly would not bring a child here unless they were over the age of 10. It's just not the appeasable scene.   We were seated by the manager whose friendly candor was very much welcomed by me & my friend. I wish I remember his name, but he is the type of person that gives you a good impression and gets you excited.   Unfortunately, our assigned waiter was far from savvy as the manager we met. The waiter appeared rushed. So much so that in his haste he failed to listen each and every time. I requested hot green tea. He informed me they don't have green tea, but a citrus one and mumbled. It wasn't until he left that I realized he was gonna bring me iced tea. NOTE: A hot tea patron and an iced tea patron are two different classes of patrons. When he returned with the ICED tea, I informed him that my intent was for a hot tea... He directed me to the page FULL of hot tea options. My friend took the iced tea as he had initially ordered water and I drank the hot. At this point, I was NOT impressed by the waiter. My friend was not convinced my upset was valid.  I ignored that the waiter referred to the special rolls as "entree rolls" suggesting a single order would satisfy. Two rolls per person is the standard, but there's no need to argue to someone who clearly was unfamiliar with the menu & the fate in general. We ordered our meals.  My friend wanted the large tuna roll that he has seen being ordered. The waiter unfamiliar with the menu or the popular items was unable to direct him and never asked his colleagues. My friend ordered a roll similar to what he thought was the popular one and modified it by switching the fish. He requested spicy tuna instead of salmon but was informed they only had tuna and spicy is via the mayo. :/ This is where this place began to lose my friend. I ordered as well. We previously ordered an appetizer which was very similar to Bonefish's bang bang shrimp.  The meals arrive, we begin to eat. We notice the tuna he requested never occurred and the salmon is still present. We alert the nearest server who was yet another manager and the waiter arrives as well. The waiter, although he wrote and spoke as he wrote the modification was very defensive that the order was not right. No apology did we receive. Instead of having him finish the wrong dish and bring a new one, the roll was removed. He sat and starved as I ate and another replaced about 10 minutes later.  Still, no apology not did we get the..." Let us treat you all to a drink or a shared dessert". Nope nuffin. And for that, they completely lost my friend.   We finish our meal & get the bill. The iced tea was charged to us & no courtesy deduction of anything was made. Me being me, I leave a decent tip with a note for him to not be hasty in his service and to listen, apologize, satisfy & thank. Upon our departure, we run into the manager who seated us who asks how we enjoyed our meal and we reveal, honestly.  I hate to give bad reviews because the place is great. It an fusion and the clientele is blended and trendy. I'm not sure if the server was having an off day, is new or is used to waiting tables at Sonic, but I just need someone to pull him aside and teach him the right way. During our table side chat, we discussed how this guy was so clueless and would probably be embarrassed if we were to reveal who we were and what we knew.   My friend moves to DC so I'm less likely to partake this location with him again, but I would go again if I had the chance. If ever presented with the same waiter, I would walk out. No second chances with that one. Sorry, not sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

hpQHrJCByqfDsllrfnT6Mw.text: I love Cowfish! They have the quirkiest restaurant and everything I've tried on their menu, so far, has been absolutely delicious. I definitely recommend the Mediterranean Burger and the seasoned fries are so good! If you have diet restrictions there are tons of ways to switch the items around especially the burgers. The customer service is excellent and everyone is so nice there. It's bound to be busy during the evening and especially weekends but if you go for lunch it can be much quieter. If you're in the Southpark Mall area I suggest you stop here for a meal!

-nL0_U0AFHI1DNnNIJXO-g.text: Went here while visiting the area for a move and loved it. Food was excellent (I had to go with the Nature Boy). We went on a Sunday and seated right away. Our server was very nice and helpful with suggestions. The manager also came out to say hello and welcomed us to the area. Really enjoyed the meal and the evening there.

ZtoPYh-E_XWAPAI2hQY3Dw.text: Recently ate dinner there had a wonderful sushi option the North Hills Roll. Just wish it weren't so expensive or I would go more often.

GTE_mMzgzKQwvpW0NGjRug.text: Visited Cowfish on a Sunday afternoon around 2:30. The service was pretty good, the only issue that I had was that it took a few minutes to get a menu and for the waiter to come over. I settled on The Arnold Hamandegger with Vegetables for my order. A few short minutes later my order arrived and it looked great. I will have to say that this was one of the best burgers that I have ever had. I will definitely be back!!

xSxYgNzWb1Bn4m2B6Nv6HQ.text: I have been to Cowfish a handful of times.  I can't believe at this point the wait for a table is still ridiculous.  It gets frustrating to wait that long every time unless the food/ service is amazing.  We came here so that my husband could try it since he's never been.    There is a massive menu of both burgers, sushi and even salads, sides...  that makes it easy for most people to find options.  I'm a vegetarian and had no problems.  The food does always taste good though.    What is unique about Cowfish is that you can order something you've probably never had like the burushi or alcoholic milkshakes.  The experience would be much more satisfying if the wait wasn't so long (the bar area is always full too).

etD2x2Jy4lSUVuJaQuYOkg.text: We were a large group & it was everyon'e's 1st time there.  Service was remarkable!  They traded out alcoholic beverages for anyone who did not care for theirs.  No questions asked.  Accomodated special requests perfectly.  Presentation was great.  Timing for such a large group that had both a combination of raw & cooked items was right on.  The menu is so extensive with rolls that you don't see anywhere else in the Fusion specialty section be warned that it could take a while to decide.  Overall ambience is pretty noisy & having to really speak up so the person next to you can hear you.  Reservations are definitely recommended.  The mgr provided 2 free appetizers - the sweet & spicy thai cucumbers & the Ahi tuna tini.  Both appetizers were fantastic!  We had a couple of sushi virgins with us who gobbled the Ahi tuna tini.  It was phenomenal.  The rolls are so large that definitely have them cut into 10 pieces.  I had the Nirvana & the blackened tuna roll.  Both were a-ok.    The Blackened tuna roll was a lot of rice & expected more fixings with how it was described.    The Nirvana roll was the better of the 2.  The caution here is that it is whitefish so if you aren't in the mood for fishy taste compare it to being in the mood for a more gamey meat option like quail than don't go with the Nirvana.    Everyone had different items & everyone was in sushi heaven! We will definitely be returning!

Tm3favt7AhlHhm95ULsLqw.text: After hearing lots of buzz about this place I decided to give it a try, I arrived around 2:00 on a weekday afternoon to find the place absolutely packed with only a few seats available at the bar. I decided to go with sushi instead of a burger and the Eel Dragon roll was quite large and tasty, don't know if it was worth the $17 pricetag...  On my second visit i decided to treat myself to their top-tier sushi/sashimi combo, and i must say that it was amazing and beautifully presented. It was well worth the pricetag on that one, but you don't want to eat bargain sushi anyways.

UiVHMMrnPf5LXCSEZxeZVA.text: Now here is a new winner.  Great presentation and great food.  The noise level is a bit high, but I understand they have some fixes coming for that.  The menu is very extensive and original.  Service levels are high.  The technology on the bar (built in i-pad like devices) is very original -- and it works.  Eat your lunch while reading the newspaper beneath your plate. Or play a game while waiting for the food. Decor, and the entire concept are fresh, and to top it off, they have their own shuttle bus from the mall to the out-parcel where they are located.   Parking was open very close to the restaurant the day I had lunch there. So that was a plus over competing places as well.

YqMO5lQMgAdleoaIVUPItg.text: Great bento boxes at lunch!  Although I am never able to finish them. I recommend the bento box because you get a slider size of the "burger of the day" and huge sushi roll with three different sides!  The crab Rangoon dip is a yummy appetizer.

r0Stjt-uNMFXQBMDU608lg.text: I ate at the Cowfish and had a great experience. My waiter was on top of things, and he did a great job of explaining the menu.  Overall the menu was a bit pricey, but i enjoyed the food. I ordered the Southpark Roll and the Doug's Filet Roll.  I've had the filet roll at Eez and they were identical.  The only real complaint that I had was that I ate by the door and it seems like every time a child walked in the door, the staff allowed him to hit the gong. My friends were startled by the gong as it went off about every 5-10 minutes. That was quite annoying.  Other than that, I had a great experience.

mmk6GG-JyaqVFKvZg3QsBQ.text: Sushi and Burgers, what an awesome idea! I love the beautiful saltwater tank at the bar. It has 3 or 4 cowfishes in it which are really cool. Even in the restrooms, the soundtrack playing is a "learn how to translate Japanese to Cowboy phrases" CD. LOL, very humorous idea!  This place always has a lively atmosphere and their sushi is really good and fresh. My favorite item is the Blackened Tuna BLT. It is an absolutely glorious burger. Ive probably ordered it 4 times already. With one of the times that I ordered it to go from the bar, the bartender forgot about it and it ended up getting cold. I did end up waiting close to 30 minutes for the order but even without asking, the bartender placed another order for the burger, gave me free soft drinks at the bar, and comped my meal. This really was the icing on the cake for this place. Highly recommended.

AUNr__yO-tFccAAYxE5g0g.text: Finally got my first official taste of The Cowfish last night--and loved it!   We didn't have a reservation, so we sat at the bar. Normally that might mean terrible service, but the roving bartenders were all super attentive and extremely excited about the menu.   We ordered the Spicy Thai Cucumbers (those are not to be missed, seriously delicious), the Thai Mango Salad (not fantastic, not terrible...), and because I was insanely hungry and also super curious about the menu, we ordered a sandwich from the Burgushi menu (the Alaskan "Turkey" Sandwich) along with two sushi rolls, the electric eel roll and the dynamite roll. The burgushi was FANTASTIC, and I chose the seaweed salad for my side (huge portion, yay!), which is one of my favorite things on the planet. My husband devoured the electric eel roll, which he pronounced spectacular -- and it was gorgeously plated. The dynamite roll was good...the sushi pieces are a little bigger than I prefer (practically impossible to eat without cutting in half).  All in all, I LOVED this place and I will absolutely be back. Maybe tomorrow...

sNLqCY2g61LA9NnkKVqikQ.text: Don't believe the hype? It really is as good as they say. My only issue is that they don't take reservations so in order to get a table, you have to wait 2 hours. But if you don't mind waiting somewhere else (the bar will be full too) until your table is ready, I recommend the filet sushi.

GSyT4xaS1Ag99gLL69iQXA.text: Well I think I just ordered wrong here so let me tell you what not to do. I got the Tuna Bacon Sandwich, which has the "buns" made of basically sushi rice. And it was way way way too much rice. Like I was just eating a bunch of plain dry rice.   As an appetizer I did try a roll and I remember it being good, but that memory was overpowered by the crummy burgushi sandwich.

0C_sMAsfl0YKCABZRrTfBA.text: Great food and great service. There is always a ridiculous wait for a table but we love the creative menu, so its worth it!

2CBw4ROakitkPGrDNdX5Hg.text: Best Burgers in town..the appetizers - wow... make sure to order a tuna nacho, those are delicious. Service was a bit slow but I guess they were busy.

t5DOh4E3v5x58cFqRV5o8Q.text: I was hoping for more flavor from the sirachai edamame. The little lamb roll and straight up nigiri sushi was wonderful.  Worth the trip

C2a6IuhD8vQXDRfw6QDU0w.text: Love it here!  I like getting the bento box with a variety of the burger/fries and the sushi/edamame.  Perfect for when I can't decide on just one item off the menu!

Vers3ASMPzZl7k1rBTTCYg.text: Great Ambiance, Courteous & Helpful Service, Good Food at Great Price. Had a lazy late lunch here and was pleasantly surprised with the warmth of the staff. The place and some guests tend to get a little loud but that's alright. Good fun.

-9LG2e55GbOmt43ma_1zww.text: Even though the wait times during peak hours can be daunting, it is absolutely worth it!  The "Burgushi" is as good as advertised and the bento boxes are always a good fallback.  Local beers on tap, too!

DLbIxWXHVRH7zzZ4jGa_AQ.text: Go here, go here, go here!  Cow or fish you will enjoy the selection and meal.  I had the 4S and have never had a sandwich like it in my life. Hard to explained but something for everyone and all will enjoy. My side was the spicy cucumber salad (not to spicy) which was a great compliment to the sandwich. Cool place.

VVl4e04COprID5HIKoZ1ZQ.text: Charlotte's most reviewed restaurant--I wanted to see what the hype was all about! I'm all for trying new things, especially burgushi.  The restaurant is located right outside the mall in a little strip of businesses. A few parking spots are available in front of the restaurant.  Based on the pictures from other reviewers, I decided to go for The Taste Explosion burgushi. For those that are unfamiliar with burgushi, it is a sushi roll with burger ingredients inside.  First bite impression: burgushi is really good! You kinda have to get past the idea that you're eating a slider in the form of sushi though. A couple bites later, I thought to myself "meh." Initially, I was enthralled with the idea of sushi and burger combined, but maybe my expectations were too high? It's a unique idea that works, but I was not that impressed in the end.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Taste Explosion
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

dWmka8NKP-BGSiGC5Pj81A.text: The concept of this place is pretty brilliant! Burger bar, sushi bar, full bar? Don't mind if I do. As someone mentioned the menu is kind of outrageously large and that usually means lesser quality and a slower kitchen. I appreciate a restaurant that does a small menu phenomenally.  It took about 15 minutes (3 stops by the waitress) and finally her recommendation before I placed my order. I ordered the original cowfish bento box with a Philly roll, slider, sweet potato fries, edamame, and cucumber salad. The sweet potato fries were delicious and the cucumber salad is literally (the original definition, not the new ridiculous one) the best I've had at any sushi bar. Everything else was pretty basic and the service was pretty slow. They messed up my sister's order. My friend and I were nearly done eating by the time she got her meal. The manager brought it out and comp'ed it.  We ordered dessert too! A tower of lemon pound cake, ice cream, whipped cream, and berries. It was amazing. The three of us couldn't finish it! After dessert we waited for our check. We were chatting, but after 30 minutes or more we had to ASK for our check. The atmosphere was nice and maybe I'll try going at a less busy time before I make a final ruling on the service. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Towering dessert
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento box
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

8Nb-nYHCGG3wjQPLZL9f5Q.text: Ive been here twice. Once with my sorority sister and another time on a date and it is THE PERFECT DATE LOCATION! The food is amazing, the ambiance is perfect and the staff is just so nice!

lnfk9yskczQEo2oTMhzJSQ.text: I think you can see from the number of times I've checked into this place that I love it hear. It's not just the food, it's the staff too. They're sweet as pie. :)   The food is great too and the location is awesome. I know the wait can be long, but you can get a text and go to the mall. That's what we do.   Now for food if you are a sushi love the rolls are huge. So thick you almost can't get them in you mouth and rolled tight! They also amazing nigiri plates, and burgers for non sushi eaters an then there's the filet mignon sushi roll. Yup and yes you can have that stuffed with lobster. So yeah, I come for the food stay for the friendly and fast service. It's a big ol bonus! :) time

o9BmCxLzVNnSaWQRjKp_0Q.text: Delicious ! Very cool modern looking inside and the outside seating nice and simple . Seaweed salad was simple and good . The sashimi platter was delicious , all the pieces were so tender and tasted fresh . The peanut butter jelly and banana  shake was the perfect way to end the meal , it sounds overwhelming but the flavors were just right . Also had one of the baked rolls , can't remember the name but was yummy . This place is clean fresh and delicious ! I will return . Prices are reasonable as well .

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Appetizer spicy shrimp over slaw  !! Order this it&#39;s beyond good .
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sashimi platter

eelNogiZzQmYEksWN4TTCA.text: Burgers and sushi at the same time?! Cowfish is definitely a one of a kind place.   The wait was STUPID long and they don't take reservations. When we first came in, we were told the wait was about an hour and a half. Since we went all the way out there just for this restaurant we decided to kill time at the mall nearby. When we got back, they told us it was another 45 minute wait! A lot of people were coming and leaving as soon as they heard the wait.   Everyone I was with ordered something different, but most notable were the Parmesan Bacon Truffle Fries that my cousin ordered. It was more than enough to share, and it had cheese all over the bottom of the bowl. Ooooooo man! I ordered the Mad Mango-cado roll, and although it wasn't anything extraordinary, the serving was perfect.   Bottom line: Although the concept is great, I probably wouldn't return to Cowfish if I'm ever in Charlotte again.

odX0ifsJoZ9aoBDEC7rb7Q.text: Love the variety and atmosphere! Great place to go when you are getting together with friends of different food preferences.

VVraPP5jRkm0WKbhVlvsRQ.text: Just simple sushi you can get at other places. People make a big deal about Cowfish but I think it's too overpriced for the food they serve.

VqL9ixVULhmFSxhlIusHnA.text: Cowfish has been bookmarked since they opened. Luckily, I was out with friends that also enjoy sushi so we decided to make an impromptu visit.  I LOVED it!! We ordered 3 different rolls (Blackened Tuna, Mad Mango-Cado, and Mark's Roll) to share and I enjoyed them all!  The Mark's Roll was my favorite!  The restaurant was very clean and the service was very friendly.  However, I am giving a 4 star rating instead of 5 because although the service was friendly, it was a bit slow and our server completely forgot to bring our appetizer.    Hands-down...the best sushi that I have had in Charlotte. I can't wait to go back!

Knj9lgHbmESP3Uq0Yn3Cog.text: Place was pretty solid and unexpected in a city who calls Nascar it's home.  great combination of burgers sushi and a fusion of the two.  The rare  filet mignon and lobster sushi roll was some of the best sushi I've had.  Waitress was trying to get rid of us.. probably because the lady next to me offered me the rest of a bottle of wine, which on certain days is cheaper than 2 glasses.  be prepared to wait for seating or just try the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy explosion roll
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Angus burger and portabella filled
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster, rare filet, tempura asparagus, shallots

AWP0Lex25JIh-jN3-xGMYg.text: The menu is overwhelming however the waitress was nice enough to give us a good summary of what's good on the menu. The burgushi is AMAZING. You must eat it!,I got the pitsburgooshi sand which and the bun is made of kani and inside of the bun is rice! It was delicious. The bento box was also super filling. The blackened tuna roll is spicy but in a good way! Oh and I would suggest going to eat at odd hours because this place can get packed.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The cucumber mintini
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The ultimate brento bento box
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seaweed salad and pitsburgooshi sandwhich

VE3HJCI1TbpgEcsU71IzBg.text: I really liked this spot. Food was probably a 3 star but service and environment were 5 stars. I'm in Charlotte pretty often and feel a lot of places here are a bit overrated. Maybe it's a 3 star but for Charlotte it's a 4 star.  Stick with the sashimi grade fish and burgers. The burgushi isn't that great, maybe I'll try more of those selections in the future. The lobster and crab spring rolls were great and reminded me of the pappadeaux rendition.  I did enjoy my greasy and overly topped (good thing in this case) jalapeno show stopper burger with fresh otoro and saba sushi on the side. The Saba (mackerel) was very good and the burger with sweet potato fries was good as well.  My party thought the service was great from top to bottom even though I heard mixed reviews about the food. Mostly the burgushi seemed to be in question.

Xf5gmYBYRAYOnh2Tig262w.text: Nice wind down, date night, great ambience and vibe also. The food, flavor, atmosphere was very pleasing, presentation of the food was Excellent. Offering something for the whole family. The shop was both clean and tidy, having plenty seating. The hostess/ waitress was attentive at all times, and very knowledgeable about the drinks and menu. Staff members there greeted us in/ out when we left. The food was more than filling, loved all the dishes thus far. We will certainly be returning soon and would recommend this facility. My husband and I loved this place Im sure everything is a must try! Good relaxing meal, no pressure by the staff to hurry up. Parking may be a issue, for us no problem that day.

8BvOSkyaCI653LqT8hIA_w.text: First visit to Cowfish & absolutely loved it!! My daughter had the All-American Bacon Double Cheeseburgushi roll and I had The Nature Boy's Wahooo-shi Buffaloooo-shi roll both were perfection! Even my picky eater enjoyed his mini burgers and is asking when we may go back.   And if Burgerushi isn't your forte their menu is packed with other delicious options!!

E21LX2wAzgbrmRK84viu9Q.text: Been dying to try this place and finally stopped in for a quick lunch. Service was fantastic. They open the front door for you when they see you coming - nice touch. I sat at the bar and the service was great. So many different items to try on the menu -will be back. Much more laid back than I thought it would be!

7J4fyZ5ucIyVlelbnNby3A.text: If your one of the lucky few who doesn't get sick from the neuro virus then the food is actually not too bad. They don't take rezzies so getting a table in actually pretty tiring and makes you very hungry when your standing outside sweating - not a bad strategy for a restaurant, touche cowfish. Now do better about the wait times.

EYdmBDbe2F2NChSnUnsQ0w.text: Got a recommendation at work to try out this Charlotte restaurant. So glad I did!  I tried the crab rangoon app like everyone recommended, it was as amazing as everyone before me has said.   I also offered the Jim Bean spiked milkshake, it was delicious, but very filling, as you would expect.  I also ordered the specialty bento box with Mark's roll, Mark's roll was by far my favorite thing I ordered!  I sat at the bar, the place was packed on a Tuesday night. The bartender always made sure my drinks were full and once the placed died down a little, came over to chat a little.   I think anyone visiting Charlotte should make an effort to check out this foodie dream restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Speacialty fushion bento box with Mark&#39;s roll
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jim Bean spiked shake, delicious even though in freezing in Charlotte!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trying to find the cowfish

Zo7W0edeSQRXcdfaD0QdzQ.text: The customer service, attention to detail and outstanding food sets Cowfish Restaurant apart from other establishments in Charlotte, NC (South Park).  After my wife and I had a less than stellar dining experience a couple of months ago; we decided we would not return. Surprisingly, we were contacted by the management and asked to come back and give them another opportunity and we took them up on that invitation. Our dinner meal on our return was outstanding and we have placed Cowfish back at the top of our restaurant choices here in Charlotte. Cowfish exceeded our expectations and we thank them for their EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE and GREAT FOOD. This was authentic Southern Hospitality as they take pride in insuring every customer is satisfied. I love their huge juicy BOURSIN BACON BURGER, but don't leave without eating their sinfully delicious FRESH BERRY TALL CAKE dessert. We will be back soon.

74h238RyLxN8SxCeJREDlw.text: I was so disappointed that after waiting on hold for 15 minutes to order food at 430pm on a Saturday finally someone picked up. However they put me on hold again    Also you have to pay a service fee to order online. Forget this place!

-QUVnwYkfAOjFTr3iFsUVw.text: Delicious sushi! Lots of variety. Good drinks. Great for lunch and dinner! Full bar. Also they have coupons time to time on GroupOn. Would recommend.

Ah5e1DHqdijmPTrxy-_jWA.text: Mehhhh...this place just wasn't for me...from the crowd, to the loud club music to the menu.  Had the Mark's Roll.  It was just ok but kind of made my stomach hurt later.  They don't have miso soup.  I always have miso soup with sushi.  Their menu has a lot of fried food and just generally unhealthy items.  Apparently I am a purist when it comes to sushi.  The menu was just a cluster f of items from all over the board.  I wouldn't go back because there wasn't one thing I liked about this place but that's just me.

dAR0EGhBnHvk8YKwX4_jOw.text: This place is fantastic. It had so many great looking options I most definitely need to go back for more. The food is truly unique and quite delicious. It is reasonably priced for what you get. I highly recommend this place. I'm not sure if they take reservations, but if they do, I would recommend making one if possible as they get pretty busy. Oh and the service is really good, especially for being so busy.

anpqAZv0C6OvsholavWZNA.text: This place is so fun! The wait can be long, but it's totally worth it. The bar is first-come first-serve, so just squeeze in there and have a martini and an app if there's a wait. The Asian Orchid martini is my favorite; it's fruity but not too sweet. Get that and the Avocado and Ahi Tuna-Tini. It's amazing! I always get the Tropical Storm Roll for my main, it's got everything you could want on it. I love that they offer brown rice for their rolls.

Mz9vEVC7ydwXDOZGeSGcLQ.text: SUCH good food!  I love this place.  It is pricey, but probably not considering the area.  They have some good beers on draft, but that food....great burgers!  I love the turkey burger.  The burgerushi is so much fun!  My brother in law had the deliverance roll with pulled pork, it looked amazing.  The service is always wonderful, all in all great atmosphere.  Oh, and you can bring the kids!

iof7zhhQXIzelnX_IMGZ6A.text: Is this place worth a two hour wait??!! IMO no it isn't.  CF is for those who are novices at eating sushi and want to typically get something less adventurous.  If you can get in without a long wait then you are golden.  I can't really comment on any of the meat dishes as I have only had their sushi.

RA9nSMkaD2IFH8q9_Eg4Gw.text: Great food, great selection as well. Can sometime be a bit of a wait but is worth it. Food is unique & creative and so are the cocktails/sake.   Tuna nachos were yummy, rolls were different but tasty as well. Skinny martini a was also very tasty!  Would def come back and also recommend to others as well.

n0MpZR0fR33CroRhG5wTKg.text: Great food, great atmosphere, a bit pricey but hey, who can really afford to eat out a lot these days? I say, if you're going to go out to eat, treat yourself to something you couldn't find anywhere else.   The food was fantastic: creative, fresh, with a twist. I really enjoyed being able to have some fun sliders along with my traditional nigiri and sushi rolls.  The service was solid, polite and attentive without being annoying.

DJ496suSNjC3mw9OPytfkA.text: Fresh sushi, awesome fusion, service ok. Loud but lively.

14Sf938LsLHmY2JDWKzzDA.text: By far the most amazing burgers in the Charlotte area.  The meat is like heaven in your mouth and the various styles of burgers will keep your taste buds very happy.

eqs0TO4WPMutiEk-SbYxgg.text: What can I say other than "GET THERE NOW!!  Jamie was our server so make sure you ask for her.  She was awesome and made out first experience here perfect. The Green Monster Burger (with an added flair from Jamie) was perfect.  We also had the Tasmanian Devil Roll...basic but really good.  Don't forget dessert...get the Fresh Berry Talk Cake.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The dessert after!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The dessert!

o88D4TTmtfARkdP8DS-f6w.text: I finally had the opportunity to sit down at a table at this place! Being so busy, I always sit at the bar. Cassie, our server, was fantastic! She walked me through the menu! They made my burger just how I wanted. I recommend the bison on a Texas toast bun! The radio played great songs and the scenery is nice!

W6P750WsTteaUzabIIvtbw.text: Cool spot, but service was unattentive to say the least - and it takes a lot to bother me....I'm sure it's not generally like that though.   Unfortunately, I don't recommend the bento box either. I like burgers and I love sushi but it didn't occur to me that at a place like this, you really just need to choose one or the other - doing half and half simply leaves you unsatisfied.  Overall rating: meh  I was excited too. Oh well.

z7ligzFlTtWhPo7XopC5ug.text: I'm always here because I work in the complex and it is amazing! the Lamb sushi roll is unreal and the sushi is always fresh. Recently I've been ordering the Ahi Tuna Salad which is also a delight.

-G1zPdsPNT4RjKDn7606JA.text: Avocado and ahi tuna-tini: absolutely exquisite! Fresh cubes of raw ahi tuna and chunks of avocado marinated in tangy ginger dressing. A must order for an appetizer! Burgushi is delicious and such a neat presentation: try the What's Shakin' tuna Bacon. Very much recommend dining here!

zKle00pkpmibvJZ065JlmA.text: It was my last meal in Charlotte this go 'round, after another extended 5-day weekend visiting my parents, and I knew I really wanted something different before leaving. Having eaten my fill of Southern style specialties while staying at home with them, my radar began blinking frantically when I did a quick search for new (relatively) places in Charlotte since my last visit. Having worked in the area for many years selling wine I had already been to most of the more unique spots in the city, and then I stumbled upon what surely had to be a typo...The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar? Ummm, what? Then, my mind flashed to my last trip here over Christmas and some shopping that was done at South Park mall. I recalled riding past a place with a burger and sushi on the awning, and my immediate reaction at the time was a similar "what the hell?" Well, nothing more had to be said. I didn't even have to pull up the menu to know this would be my destination for lunch.  When we arrived at our destination, which you would likely never find if you weren't specifically looking for it, it was a bit past prime lunch hours (somewhere between 1 and 1:30), but the restaurant was still surprisingly hopping for a Monday afternoon. I passed up the chance to eat outside, as you have no idea what the patio space looks like upon entering. This was a mistake, not because the inside was bad, but because after I saw the nice large patio adjacent a beautiful fountain I really wanted to be eating out there. Sitting inside did offer a vantage point of the strange and humorous wall art, half mocking half embracing the fusion of burger and sushi, along with an enormous fish tank and easy access to our server. A quick trip to the restroom revealed another of Cowfish's oddities, a foreign language "learn to speak Japanese" track playing, combined with what could only be described as "learn to speak Redneck" version. Hearing the cute little J-pop voice followed by Cletus was certainly a shock, and I made another visit before leaving just to make sure I wasn't hallucinating (and I had to rinse an obscene amount of grease from my beard).  The real reason for coming here though is obviously the strange mix of food offered on the enormous menu. First are the appetizers, some of the best meal starters I've seen offered. This isn't your typical "hey let's fry something or add cheese to it" type of appetizer. They're all well thought out and incorporate a breadth of flavor profiles. Then you've got a page full of burger options, followed by several pages of very creative sushi rolls, and finally their signature item, a combination of burger and sushi they've deemed burgushi. It sounds like something the bumbling idiot Fabio from Top Chef would pronounce, but the concept is actually quite appealing when you see the menu descriptions.  I began with a couple appetizers, hoping my mom would assist me in eating them so I would have room for a burger, and the "Mother Load" roll, which features a piece of every fish on their menu in one hell of a creative presentation. I wound up eating both of them by myself though, so I had to cut out the sushi. I started with the blackened Ahi tuna nachos, which are wonton chips topped with crab Rangoon dip, pico de gallo and avocado and some seared tuna. I thought the quality of everything in this item was superb, although the crab dip definitely overtook the flavor of the tuna. It really benefitted from just a few drops of added Sriracha to help balance all the flavors. Next up I dove into the Caribbean summer rolls, which have boiled shrimp, lettuce, mint, mango, cucumber and chive, and when combined with their spicy peanut sauce they were actually some of the best spring rolls I have ever had, anywhere. The size was huge too, definitely worth the $9 price tag if you're debating which appetizer to order.  In between the appetizers and our burgers came the only real faux pas of the meal by Cowfish, and that was actually delivering our burgers just minutes after our appetizers had arrived. I had eaten literally one and a half of the big nachos, and not even begun on the rolls, when both our burgers were brought out. I decided not to complain and just go along with it, mixing bites from everything at once, but then I bit into my burger and realized that the medium rare I had requested was actually medium well, and produced no juice whatsoever. This I had to say something about, and it was promptly remedied by the chef, and comp'ed off the ticket by the manager.   1) Businesses take note, that's how you take care of a customer.  2) Yelpers take note, that's how you correct an error without bitching about it and deducting stars.  As for the actual burger, I went with the Arnold Hamandegger (self explanatory), and when properly done was wonderfully juicy, with just the right amount of egg yolk seeping over the bacon and ham. The "Cowfish sauce" was pretty tasty too, and the sweet potato fries were cooked perfectly.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Arnold Hamandegger: Beef burger topped w/ cheddar, Black Forest ham, fried egg, applewood smoked bacon, grilled onions
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. wonton chips topped with Crab Rangoon Dip, spring mix, homemade pico de gallo w/ avocado, and sliced seared rare Ahi tuna

HsP62-RAvhDOAdnEs0a0_w.text: We've been here before and the food was AMAZING and we couldn't wait to get back to Charlotte to go again! We went today, and the food wasn't at it's prime - however the customer service was SUPERB. Both our server (Camille) and the manager were extremely apologetic and accommodating and because of them we will definitely be coming back! Thank you!!!

SMW2m-yu7Wcr3wzBACOrMA.text: One of the most unique restaurants in the United States, and that's not an exaggeration. I've never taken a bite of a burger before and thought, "I wonder how this would taste with sushi ingredients." Conversely, I've never eaten sushi and thought, "Man, this would be great with burger ingredients." And that's really the magic of the Cowfish. It's innovative eating at it's finest, one that will open your mind and better yet, your taste buds. As a kicker to the crazy menu, they have handmade milkshakes (including some with alcohol!) that will be a perfect dinner wrap to your dining. A must in Charlotte. Enjoy!

r34m4Bbvyouv1TqY_E9m0Q.text: I went here with my husband a couple months ago on a Sunday for lunch. There was no wait so we were excited having tried to come here before but the wait being well over an hour. My husband got a burger and i got a bent box. The sushi was ok but the real star was the mini burger. Next time I come I will just get a burger. They are so flavorful and just delicious. I am a fan.

L-8N4yjaKPuK-5UZ6gXiqg.text: Sushi was really good but a little overpriced (likely because of the location) from what we are used to.  The burgushi (sp?) was not the best, the expectation does not meet what your taste buds experience.  The presentation is awesome though and it's in a great location.  Cool outdoor seating area and a good bar selection.

7HwamEoGKA12KJAB2oPXvA.text: Honestly, I just don't understand the hype over this place. I was so excited to try it, so my husband and I tried to go on a Saturday... The wait was three hours. So we went else where. I few weeks ago though, we went on a Tuesday. We still had to wait a bit, but it was not a big deal. We both ordered the bento boxes. We want sushi and burgers. There was barely any real food! The burger was smaller than a slider and you can't even get a full roll. It was full of edemame and some weird cucumber salad. Needless to say, we were both hungry when we were finished. The waitress didn't seem surprised that we were still hungry-- that should be sign #1 that you're not providing enough food! When we got out bill, we were shocked at the receipt and really wondered why it cost that much... Keep in mine we only drank water. Needless to say, don't order the bento box--- it is just full of snack type food and is over priced!

dJ_9MOmqEhtF6D5z0On-lg.text: It was a little hard to find at first, but I'm glad we did. This is my favorite place in Charlotte. We were told to order a burger only if you were VERY hungry. I did just that. The portion was huge. I couldn't finish, but it was delicious. My favorite thing here was the deliverance roll (barbequishi). Again, it's a lot of food, but I've never seen or eaten anything like it. It is great. I will recommend this place to anyone visiting Charlotte.

Ig8sbX5IyzRQyV_c1LPC5g.text: I looooooove this place.  It has ousted Cajun Queen as the Jessica M's family favorite restaurant.  The food is amazing, decor is vibrant and fun (not to mention the "translations" in the bathroom - HILARIOUS), and staff is so friendly and attentive!  This is how every restaurant should be.  Packed on a Tuesday night, so you know it's good!  Must try the tuna nacho appetizer.  DEEEE-LICIOUS.  This was my birthday dinner pick, and it was all I could have hoped for and more.  If you're wondering - if you tell the server it is your birthday, they'll bring out the 3 layer pound cake/ice cream dessert with fruit and it is amazing.  The birthday song is pretty clutch, too!  We had our 2 year old with us and we got him one of the kids' bento boxes - so adorable!  Two sliders, fries, a cute little sushi rice smiley face, and a drink - perfect for the wee'un!  All in all, a fabulous dining experience.  I can't wait to go back!

BWmST0btBaLRcDIE8w-FHg.text: First off, I love sushi and I love burgers. Combining the two...what a novel idea! My wife and had plans to try Cowfish on recommendation of a coworker. We didn't make advance reservations, so planned to go for lunch instead. I hear the wait at dinner without reservations can be 2hrs+. We waited about 10 minutes on a Saturday and sat at the bar while waiting for a table. This place has a really cool atmosphere. My wife ordered a sushi roll - the "Neon Deon"  with mango, coconut, and avacado...one of the most different (and awesome) sushi rolls I've tried. I got the "Burgushi" Burger+Sushi...it was a mix of burger ingredients and sushi ingredients - also excellent! The service was attentive and fun. I would highly recommend this place and we'll be back. Just be sure to make reservations in advance, especially for dinner.

RlLMciULSXJXavYkJx3r3w.text: I am a big fan of this place. At first I thought the whole burgers and sushi thing was weird and stupid. But I was so wrong. The food is delicious and the restaurant itself is very cool. Love the old westerns mixed with godzilla and kung fu movies! I also like that the sushi bar has the interactive screens built into the bar, but they definitely need upgrading or tweaking because there are way to many bugs. Playing memory is fine, but their pac-man type game isn't very responsive. But - you're not there to play games you're there to eat and this place excels at that.  I'm only giving it 4 stars because the dirty martinis my boyfriend and I ordered weren't dirty at all, I don't think they had any brine in them at all. The next time I came I had to order it "very" dirty and it was fine.

T9Du1wt9nlHRJZ-POYQ6_A.text: One of the best restaurants in Charlotte for burgers and sushi!  Endless sushi options, its like a work of art on a plate!  Great atmosphere.  Very busy but its worth it.  Ask for Tripp as your server when you go, he is the best!

hFpaGSraJ2iDzkrPKsrexw.text: The bento boxes are fabulous!  In fact everything we order every time we go is great and I am very picky. Tripp was a very attentive server too.

jbrwKoK7tvATsuPkYzgOSQ.text: I too tried the "Doug's Roll".  I was a bit hesitant becuase I really wanted sushi and wanted to try one of their special rolls. But, I talked to the server and he said burgushi was the way to go.  So I tried that and man what a good decision.  Very flavorful and somehow the beef (which was raw-similar to steak tar tar) seemed to melt.  The rolls were large and really worked well with wasabi and soy.  The server was very helpful.  My mother who only eats california rolls got the Boursin Bird which is a chicken sandwich with boursin cheese.  I tried that as well. Very good but the burgushi was where its at.  I would like to go back because the menu is so large (which is both positive and negative its a bit overwhelming.)  My only negatives were it was freezing and we were placed right under a speaker that was blasting music.  But that also kind of made it fun, just couldn't really talk.  Hope to be back soon.

PVaC2LMgscuGSTpLVOzcXw.text: Maybe it was because I had a take out or ate in the car, the food was okay.  I ordered the Fusion Bento with Mark's roll and roasted peppers and goat cheese burger.  It came with sweet potato fries, cucumber salad and edamame.  I liked the burgers, but Mark's roll wasn't very special.  I would have loved to eat at the place, but I was running late for flight back to Los Angeles.  If I have a chance to go back, I would try again.

9l4IvE-nWavZSr_wz01v8w.text: I'm already a fan of eeZ, and the Cowfish is eeZ younger cousin, so I knew I would like it. I also knew I would like it because it's the best of me and my girlfriend's world b/c she loves sushi and I love burgers and milkshakes. The ambiance and the atmosphere is very chilled and laid back. The Rangoon Crab Dip appetizer is to absolutely die for....when we order this and it's a large group, I usually just order like 2 or 3 of these b/c I usually down one by myself. I think I had the best burger I ever had in my life, the C.B.C.L.T.....I can't even put it in words. The service is always great, but the only reason I can not give it 5 stars is because it is always too packed, waiting for a table can take up to an hour, this location doesn't take reservations due to it's popularity, and last but not least, the Southpark snobs that frequent this place get to me sometimes with their "my s*** doesn't stink" attitudes they like to dish out. Besides those extremely minor things, this is a great restaurant.....4 stars

vv1GqGhoOeHayWu4drodPQ.text: The sushi and burger combinations are amazing. The sweet potato fries are very good, but cucumber side I could have done without. Very good service overall.

iXzop6dmOk1VLWuTzuyNrA.text: I visited Cowfish for lunch with a friend a couple of weeks ago and was initially overwhelmed by the menu, but the waitress was super helpful and extremely patient while I mulled over the options.  I finally settled on the Tropical Storm Roll Lunch special with the Seaweed Salad.  I can't believe I've never had seaweed salad before!!!  It was so good that now I have had it about 5 times from various places in the past couple of weeks.  Anyway... the sushi was wonderful!  The fish tasted very fresh and the wasabi and ginger didn't taste cheap and generic like most other places.  After our meal, the manager/owner? came out and spoke with us and invited us back.  Very pleasant experience.  And again, the seaweed salad... best I've had... crave it all the time.  I went back a couple of days ago and had the same thing along with the avocado and crab summer rolls.  They were delicious too, and the fish on the Tropical Storm roll was cut so thickly I couldn't eat the pieces in one bite, but had to take 2 or 3.

DnINZ1m_oQ2DgUNa44btnA.text: Yum! I'm a big fan of the bento box. It's pretty filling and full of a variety of good flavors. And if you're a whiskey drinker like me, check out the Not So Old Fashioned,

BzxvrQSUThMyMT7ORsNU6w.text: Non-sushi food was great, service was AWFUL. My husband & I went to the Cowfish for lunch on Monday 12/27. First, the hostess screwed up our wait for a table- took down our name, told us to wait 20 mins, then couldn't find out name, told us to wait again, then told us that our name was not lost but on the list the whole time. WTF? This ordeal took 20 mins on a Monday afternoon- hate to see what would've happened on a Friday night.    Thankfully, 2 seats were available at the bar, which helped end our discussion with the hostess. Un-thankfully, the bartender/ waiter was a total prick- because he wasn't paying attention to us (kept looking over our shoulder to someone/ something?), we had to repeat our order 3 times (even pointing to the items on the menu) before he got it right.   We ordered the coconut battered onion rings as an appetizer, which were divine. Too bad our bartender forgot our request for plates for the onion rings because there were coconut crumbs all over the bar. He was a little annoyed that he had to wipe up all the crumbs. I ordered the sushi nigiri combo with wonton soup. The california rolls didn't taste any better than what you get at the supermarket and the dumplings in the wonton soup were still frozen on the inside. The soup broth was luke warm. My husband ordered the cowfish original burger with fries. He said it was good, but he's had better at other restaurants.   During the entire meal, our bartender never refilled our empty soda glasses and wasn't around during much of our meal. After sitting around for 15 mins with empty plates & empty soda glasses, we had to ask a different bartender for the check. When our original bartender finally showed up with the check, he was not happy at all when he saw our living social coupon. After the coupon, our bill was $2.38. He practically threw the bill at us with a scowl on his face- no smile, no thank you, no "come back & see us next time." I guess he's not a fan?? We still left him at 15% tip on the entire $32.38 bill, which we feel he did not deserve. Will we go back to the Cowfish? No, even if there's another living social coupon. If I want to eat a frozen wonton in lukewarm soup, I'll do it at home. If I want mediocre sushi, I'll go to the supermarket.  If I want a burger at a sit-down restaurant with excellent service, I'll go to Big Daddy's and gladly pay full price.

inXv3CvYynp-Ltr_jm-Qig.text: Excellant sushi and burgers but the spicy cucumber appitizer may be my favorite.  Just make sure you plan your visit to Cowfish since they do not take reservations on Fridays and Saturdays.  Either get there REAL early or plan to wait a loooooong time for your table.

V2ceYCc01qvFIfu1D2Oy1g.text: I was pretty impressed by this place.  It wasn't what I was expecting at all.  It was a swanky sushi place with a funky vibe.  If I had to use one word to describe it: Creative.  No doubt the sushi rolls were unlike anything you'd expect.  And, the sliders were mouthwatering.  I recommend the tuna nachos... I'm still craving them a week later.  If you're looking for a place to go on a second or third date, you've found it.  Everything on the menu could and will start an interesting discussion.  "What do you think pesto and tomato would taste like on a tuna roll?"  Exactly.  You have to try it to find out.  They also have a good drink menu and an enormous bar so if you're like me and prefer to have a casual dinner with lots of drinks while sitting at the bar... this is it!  However, there were a lot of kids the night that I went so refrain from profanity and too much PDA.  Although, no offense to those with kids, that didn't stop me ;)

Hl3F1M8ekoNTxcSFMAuBkg.text: Foodis okay but hire more wait staff. Tired of waiting.

gJw-2L7Rkai07Gd-eMLDsQ.text: We love Cowfish, sushi, asian fusion dishes, burgers and even what they call Burgushi, which is basically meat in rice and other sushi type ingredients and sauces, but very good indeed! We usually go on a weekend when it is very very busy, however each time they tell us it will be an hour to an hour and a half wait and each time it hasn't been more than 45 minutes. I'm certainly not complaining about a shorter wait time, be sure about that, but my fiance and I have a theory that they do that to keep the "buzz" about the place. Like they are sooooo good at what they do, they want you to know it takes that long to get into the place. It's either that, or the hostesses aren't very good with time management! Really, the only negative is that every single time we are there, we always get seated on the patio (in Spring or Fall, we don't mind at all!) and always at the table right by the door with people and waitstaff constantly going in and out, the trash being dragged out from the kitchen to the dumpster etc. While we affectionately call it "our table" now, it isn't in the best spot and we saw plenty of tables open inside on this cold blustery night (the patio IS enclosed and heated in winter). Now...we aren't in the "beautiful people" crowd and thus our 2nd theory about the place. Now onto the real good stuff...their spiked milkshakes are uber yum. My fiance gets one for dessert every time we visit. His favorite is the one spiked with Jim Beam. This most recent trip it was our anniversary and we casually mentioned it or they overhead us talking about it, so at the end of the meal, the waiter said "Happy Anniversary, your appetizer is on the house". How cool was that! And said appetizer was the Lobster & Crab Spring Rolls, ohmigosh, so delicious! On a previous trip we have had the Blakened Ahi Tuna Nachos, which are awesome  as well. We had 2 rolls this time around both recommended by our waiter, Mark's roll and the Foreplay role (has oysters in it) and enjoyed both very much. The menu is very large, take your time to go through it all. Burgers are also delicious and totally worth a try. Staff is friendly and very knowledgeable, great service. If you live in or are visiting Charlotte, The Cowfish should certainly be on your list of must try's!

cHsvotIQSB0me4EP6x-VUQ.text: Following recommendations I made a reservation and was glad I did.  Business was brisk on a Thursday night.    I arrived at 5:40 for a 6:00 o'clock reservation, and found a parking spot right in front of the door.  This was a sign that it was going to be a good night.  It was half price Sake night - a carafe of Fuji Apple Sake was a great starter while I awaited my friends.  We were seated promptly when everyone arrived.  Our waiter was very knowledgable and helpful explaining the extensive menu.  One guest and I decided to split the Caribbean Summer Rolls, and I am glad we did, otherwise I would not have been able to eat my dinner.  I chose Filet Oscar Roll from the Burgushi menu, while another diner chose the South of the Border Roll, the third party in our group went for the Moriawase dozen and was glad she followed the waiters recommendation to start off with the dozen and if she wanted more he could increase it to the double deuce.   Everyone enjoyed the food.  Desserts were ordered to go.   My apple pie wontons were alright, but probably would have been better if I weren't so full and could have eaten them there while they were warm.  A nice touch was the owner coming around to ask us about our dining experience and to hand out cards for a free appetizer which are good until the end of 2011.   I like the burgushi concept.  Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar is definitely on my list of favorites and places I would go on a date or take an out of town guest.

rAuhCRhCdDyyTf0n5qYBCA.text: We were visiting Charlotte NC and found this great place. We had lunch there and had an great meal. You must try the coconut onion rings. The burgers were just cooked perfectly. When we go back to Charlotte, we will make this the 1st place we stop.

IlAEEnXgshCp1-CYL02-2g.text: Worth the wait (or sitting at the bar). This place is busy and for a good reason. If you can't decide on what type of food to eat for dinner then you've come to the right spot. You can have sushi, burgers, cheese fries, fried pickles, and so much more! And they have meals where you can do a mini burger and a small sushi roll. It literally cannot get better than that. Because we were super hungry and wanted everything, my husband and I ordered the truffle bacon Parmesan cheese fries to start. Best French fries I've ever had in my entire life. And it was a huge serving. We felt super fat for eating all of them. Then we shared Granny's southern pimento cheese burger with fried pickles & Mark's roll (sushi). All I can say is that it was all amazing. We ate so much that we could barely walk out. I can't wait to go back and try all of their other menu items.   From a hospitality standpoint, everyone was extremely nice & even though we sat at the bar, our waitress was extremely attentive. Bar seating is a great choice for a party less than four. It's really wide so there is plenty of space for food and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Granny&#39;s Southern Pimento Cheese Burger
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Parmesan Bacon Truffle Fries
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mark&#39;s Roll*

0MdCWnR_LcOQDqsrZAKNmQ.text: Maybe the best sushi in Charlotte. Always fresh! I love that they are willing to make any roll wrapped in cucumber. This is where I take all out of town guest... there is something for everyone and the quality is always great! Especially for the price. My only complaint is that it is SO loud in the space....

dLGsyc8HJSlgmCpQAulY_A.text: Great little sushi place for lunch that offers a wide array of sushi dishes, burgers, craft beers and pretty amazing tea.  One of the few times I decided to go for tea vs beer and was pleasantly surprised. Tea was super strong and loose leaf filtered, sugar was natural honey.  They have a collection of lunch dishes that are plenty big enough to make most people full, eg. sushi roll that's big enough for 1 haha.   Unique little location that's directly across from stellar shopping. While you're in check out the cowfish hanging out in the aquarium in the front bar!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vanilla Mint Chai

nvT8S-FMHJBen8DaPpGxyw.text: I saw this place on-line and was totally confused by the concept of a "Sushi" and "Burger" establishment but to my surprise the concept worked. On this visit I tried a burger, it was huge, The granny's southern Pimento cheese burger. It was Pimento cheese, fried green tomato, red onion and more, I selected the sweet potato fries as my side and received a nice amount of fries, well seasoned and cooked perfectly. The place was fairly large, customer service was adequate, not super cheerful or anything but professional and helpful. My order took a while but it was worth the wait.  Note, the sushi that others in my party ordered did look pretty good, I think I'll try the sushi option on my next visit.  Overall enjoyable lunch!

o4bfPYu_RzW6BRLv9x4o2Q.text: Cowfish is one of my favorite places in Charlotte to eat and one that we frequently visit. We usually start with the crab rangoon dip.  I'm a sucker for all crab rangoons and their take on them is one of the best. Sometimes I get a burger here. The veggie burger is really good.  I love getting the Asian salad here.  The peanut ranch dressing really makes this salad.  I don''t eat a lot of sushi but everyone I've been with who has had it said that it was great.  The milkshakes are also very good here and a great way to end your meal, if you actually have any room left for it!

fusdQwNuTs04vvv4idwdAQ.text: Nice location and staff. Onion rings probably the best I've ever had. Cobb salad not so good.  Burgers excellent! Motherload sushi was overpriced a bit

XsGRQ7d2yns5c0jdPS_Cug.text: Second time here and I  have to say the service was about as bad is it can come.  Waited about 10 min for a server to acknowledge us after being sat. When she finally came by, we ordered our beer/wine and appetizer. The appetizer came a few minutes later. Our drinks and napkins finally arrives right as we were finishing our appetizer.  We then ordered our our sushi, she repeated every roll back and I had to correct her on one. I then had her confirm the order by reading the list of my phone before she left. After the order came out, we informed our server that one roll was wrong. She apologized and took the tool, only to come back just to tell me that she did not have that roll written down. We then went back over exactly what we had done, with the correction and all. She then admitted that she made a mistake. She said "thanks for keeping me in check"???? It then took another 30 minutes to get the corrected roll. Then she dropped the bill as if nothing was wrong. Did not offer for us to talk to a manager, or take at least the toll that took an hour off the bill.  Luckily Andy, one of the managers came by and asked how everything was, so we explained. He was very nice and did what he could salvage what was to be salvaged of our visit. Thank you Andy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

nVbKs3D0aGjEhmoq5BjSFg.text: This place never disappoints. I live in Rochester NY but every time I visit my friend in Charlotte NC we get food from here. Also attended the one in Orlando FL also amazing! But this time around I wanted to try something different since I couldn't find the sushi roll I was addicted to. I had the blackened tuna roll and honestly when I saw the hostess put a super raw looking sushi roll into my bag I panicked because I'm not a fan of "raw" or fishy sushi. Let me tell you that was the best sushi roll I ever had! I can't stop thinking about it!  Crab Rangoon dip doesn't disappoint either!  I totally recommend this place for dine-in or take out. But it does seem to always be busy! Obviously for good reason!! You go CowFish!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Tuna Roll*

ksrtfK6Ta6fbCyRGWtfRtA.text: I've been here a few times with my coworkers for lunch and I've enjoyed the experience every time.
