If you love sushi then this place has a wide variety to choose from, as well as the option to build your own roll. The bento boxes are great for if you love burgers and sushi and want to get a taste of both on your night out. I also highly recommend you try The 4-S Sushi Sandwich if you're looking for a chance to try a unique twist while still getting the chance to enjoy the flavors that come with eating sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Rangoon Dip
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fusion Specialty Bento Box*
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The 4-S (Sear-Iously Sensational Sushi Sandwich)*

u4zeFfelQ4z_ZIPg974w4Q.text: Cowfish hosted an Elite Yelp Event that I attended and boy did they know how to show us a good time! The food was plentiful, nice variety, wonderful service and great leadership. The place was packed already, but Cowfish accommodated us beautifully. Now let's get to the food:  Blackened Tuna Nachos-yes please. Very simple, yet tasty with a slight kick of heat.  Lobster and Crab Spring Rolls-nice crunch and tasty filling. I would order these on a regular visit.  Tuna & Avocado Tini-this was my least favorite item of the night. The tuna chunks were just too humongous and with the avocado, the dish was way too soft. It needed a texture intervention. A texturvention. It also lacked salt.  The Burgers-they just came out on trays and I tried one that was available. It was super tasty.  Overall this was a great experience and Cowfish showed up and showed out. They offer a cool concept, check them out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

hcrwXpFaxgwvXitqSygSMA.text: I went to Cowfish for lunch with a friend. She ordered sushi rolls and beer. I ordered a crazy expensive turkey burger. The turkey burger on the menu was an Apple Berry Brie Turkey Burger. I wanted a Turkey burger without cheese and with lettuce, tomato and avocado. The waitress suggested that I get a Bare burger that was plain and add the toppings. Seemed simple until I received a bill that was almost $19. I didn't realize that there was a Turkey substitution charge of $2 and that didn't include the toppings. It was a great turkey burger but I am disappointed in the price and the waitress for not communicating. I will not order that again. Way too much for a simple turkey burger and why should turkey cost so much more anyway. I paid more without the trimmings if the original menu option.

g6mpfdu62SRTxI10WxTXwA.text: Very long wait even after having a reservation. The hostesses were wonderful. The food was pretty good with the exception of finding a piece of hair in my sushi. The server (who was wonderful) and Manager took care of it right away- they replaced it and removed it from my bill. Great service overall! We'll definitely return.

s96PA_RuRT13_DIDs8j6oA.text: Holy cowfish this place is GOOD!!! My husband and I currently live somewhere where satisfying sushi is hard to come by and a cool vibe is even harder to come by so you can imagine our excitement when we discovered Cowfish. Our meal started with  shishito peppers (the best!) and edamame, transitioned into sushi upon sushi, and ended with a key lime pie shake. Okay, now I'm salivating just reminiscing about it. From start to finish we thoroughly enjoyed every bite!! Can't wait to travel back to Charlotte to try some of their other items.

LjIjYGB25MHztB08uys2tw.text: I've been to Cowfish before and was super pleased and I still loved the way all my food tasted this time. However my mini burger was supposed to cooked medium well and it was definitely a medium temperature. If this is something that bothers you just asked to get it fixed but mine still tasted fine so I kept mine. That is the only complaint I have from my two visits. Everything else is Truest authentic and well made. The crab rangoon dip is a MUST appetizer. The chips are actual wonton wraps with the typical wonton sauce drizzled on top. It's so good and never lasts long! Overall I had a great experience and will still be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Rangoon Dip
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The 4-S &#34;burgushi&#34; with parmesan cheese fries

I0Z_cyNRllVup5IcFd8Whw.text: This burger sushi combo location makes the best of both! We started with two cocktails, berry champagne martini, and a wasabi Yuzu martini! For our appetizer i ordered my favorite: tuna nachos. They have their cream cheese crab dip and guacamole, and I can't not order!  For our entrees we ordered "The Roll that love built" and the Mediterranean lamb burger. Service was very good too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The roll that love built - proceeds go to the Ronald McDonald House
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side of Seaweed Salad
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mediterranean lamb burger

y_vqAPeFNGtivZA9t4SR0A.text: This place has something for everybody! Sushi lover or not! Ton of options, where you may get overwhelmed. Try something different.   We tried the lobster crab spring rolls which were a large appetizer which chunks of crab and lobster! Amazing!  Then I had a spicy tuna roll, delicious and fresh along with a seaweed salad. Hubby had the all American cheeseburger which is a sushi roll of cheeseburger. He looooved it! Fun fusion style food.   The drinks menu is just as endless! And I kept eyeing up those adult spun milkshakes which looked to be a meal in them selves.  Definitely will be back and during the week the have specials on drinks.   Many people have mentioned it's a popular area and you will wait. Put your name on the list, sit at the bar and have a drink and an appetizer and Time will pass. We ended up eating our dinner here because it cleared our quite a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

AEqJBHdYS4QaLwpdRtGpVg.text: Awesome food with fantastic atmosphere! Our server Jordyn is very knowledgeable and gave great recommendations. The wait was on the longer side on a Saturday night - hour plus. I would recommend downloading the app to get on waitlist while going shopping at the mall.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The 4-S (Sear-Iously Sensational Sushi Sandwich)*

uuU7sUdvnh3qpbfg-BQ6Eg.text: This restaurant is very recommended if you like variety! They had something on the menu to please everyone! I loved the pulled pork bbq sushi very great idea, the presentation was nice too! The spring rolls/egg rolls from the appetizer menu was really tasty! Very nice atmosphere !

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled Pork Bbq sushi (not listed on the menu as this name)

e6UzEPRFffCIHUxKZoDaMg.text: We came here for Mother's Day because I had been wanting to try it forever. The wait took forever. Once we were seated we ordered a California roll as an app, a kids plate, a burger/sushi box combo thing and a southern sushi roll that had pulled pork. App came quickly, however it wasn't rolled super tight so it fell apart. Our kids plate and combo came out together and it was all delicious. I feel like the combo could have had a little more food but since we had an app we got full. The waitress made us aware that she forgot to put in our other roll but the kitchen was on it. Well. We finished eating. We waited. We waited some more. And we waited some more. I was annoyed by this point. The manager brought the last of our food out and we told her we were full and didn't want it. She offered to box it but we said no thanks. We weren't mad, we just weren't hungry anymore. She ended up comping the entire check for us minus the alcohol and apologized several times.  Because of her making up for a mistake without having to ask and the food we had being really tasty--5 stars, more if I could. I wish all restaurants had this type of management. It goes a long way and we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The kids burger
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. A combo box split in half
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

RfS3PqFGpxjTi8UnManvpQ.text: Yum!  We loved everything, the burger, roll & especially shakes!  We didn't have a reservation, so had to wait to be seated for about 20 minutes.  The food was slow to come out, but well worth the wait.  The service was fantastic!

fhYYbVIPz929GZUDJJic6A.text: Allow me to preface this review with two things: first, I know sushi and Japanese food very well and second, I have dined at San Francisco's fabled Kyo-ya when it was still around--and this was when it was widely regarded as the finest sushi in the Western hemisphere. So I don't balk at expensive sushi in nice surroundings. I do however have a dim view of pretense and trying to just charge high prices because of a trendy atmosphere and a clientele who seem not to know any better.   Other reviewers have described Cowfish as "fun" and maybe it can be, but to me, not so much. It's over-crowded and the waitstaff rushes you along yet when it comes time for the check disappears as if sucked into a time warp. My sushi was ok, but just ok. Not impressive, not innovative by a long shot. Typical Americanized sushi for girls in their Vineyard Vines shirts and their boyfriends in boat shoes. It was like the Abercrombie of sushi. And the chocolate torte dessert I ordered was pretty awful and rather gummy--plus overly sweet for a flourless chocolate torte.   If you're shopping at South Park Mall and want sushi and a friend wants a burger, I guess come here. The other options around South Park aren't much better (the cafe in Nordstroms however is good). But their version of sushi is very mundane and their service lackluster.

IeUu6bRsD5z5-J4PGNcyIg.text: Love the food its awesome!. Great service, my waitress always checked if we needed more drinks.

pwmbLI3a5zrXLTpPb0FtxA.text: This is my go to place for sushi. For those who don't like sushi, the burgers are fantastic. My kids enjoy the bento boxes and that makes it a win for all of us!

7kqvTX3eo6D2kukXCANTtA.text: This is one of the only two sushi restaurants in Charlotte I will eat at. The sushi rolls are always very fresh and tasty. Every item on the menu is absolutely delicious. You will also never complain about the servers. They are great! You can now add your name on the waiting list with their app. I do this or just walk in and snag two chairs at the bar for dinner.

xuoZNKhNY4aPhd2fh-Pzig.text: I wasn't super impressed with Cowfish. I mean it was good enough and some of the items I ordered were delicious. But overall it just felt like it couldn't decide between burgers or sushi. So neither could I...  I got the Bento Box (sp?) so I had a little bit of a taste of a few different things. A few small pieces of a California roll - which was not that great, a mini burger slider - which was pretty delicious, some sweet potato fries - also not that great, and edamame - which was just normal good edamame.  The thing that I will suggest, if you find yourself at this restaurant by default cause a friend wanted to go, is get the Crab Rangoon Dip. I've never had this in dip form before but it's about time someone did it. And this place did it well! Warm, great dip and perfectly done "chips" with just enough sauce. Definitely the best thing I had there. But I got tired of it fairly quickly. I'm sure the big portion is meant for more than two people.

gVCZIw8lJN6KO1FGhDtzNg.text: Cowfish is a great place to have dinner. Whenever you go you should expect to wait. The sushi is pretty good but I believe it's a bit over-priced. You're pretty much paying for the social spot. It's a fun low key place with a cool atmosphere. It's definitely a place to check out. I don't believe it's worth the 2 hour wait they have sometimes.

zlIL7hX02LEx0e9idA-bVA.text: Not the best sushi I've ever had, but it definitely hit the spot. Enjoyed their Big Al's Yellowtail and Tuna and Avocado-tini appetizers. Also loved their Spicy Tuna Roll. Spicy tuna is one of my favorite rolls, so I order it at every sushi restaurant I go to. Usually the tuna is diced up into tiny pieces and mixed with some sort of spicy mayo sauce. At Cowfish, the tuna wasn't diced up, and I think I actually prefer it that way! I probably wouldn't order their sashimi again though. It was good, but not the best quality and the pieces were sliced too thick and big (which can be seen as a good thing to some).  It was a little weird to me to have both sushi and burgers on the same menu, but I think they pulled it off as well as possible. We tried the All-American Bacon Double Cheeseburgooshi. It didn't have any raw fish in it, or fish at all for that matter, but it was all of the components of a cheeseburger in the shape of sushi. It was pretty good.  I couldn't decide which dessert I wanted to get, so I ordered two. That was a mistake... they were GINORMOUS! I enjoyed their chocolate torte, and my husband preferred their berry tall cake. I thought the pound cake in the latter was a little dry, though the multiple scoops of ice cream helped with that.  I would definitely come here again. Make sure you take a look at the cowfish in their tank on the way out!

4wg5KDqeT0pu30dGC7Dg6Q.text: Food is always great!! Be sure to try the truffle fries and the apple berry and brie turkey burger, my favorite!!

hjO23NGUxN_dAuMYxHAQHw.text: Was there for dinner last week with some friends. Lauren was our server and she was very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu and offered some great suggestions! The food came out pretty quickly and we smashed it. Love the crab dip!! I will definitely be back next time I'm in the area!

07WgxCPWsyxBBkwDj_KhUg.text: I love Cowfish. My favorite option is the bento box. A little bit of sushi and burgers plus all the great sides.

QqtW9gI_H278Qcon84uyIw.text: The food was good as usual, but we arrived and they said the wait time would be 20 minutes. We ended waiting for an hour even there were multiple available tables.

ALVkpPvy2v4ozO38gbsWbw.text: Burgers and Sushi in the same establishment?! Sign me up! Going in, I knew this place would either be amazing or a terrible decision for my stomach but I had to try it. Glad I did! Although it's probably making Japanese sushi chefs everywhere cringe, this American twist on sushi tasted amazing.   We visited mid day and were seated immediately. The waitress gave us a full rundown of each section of the menu, which was an extensive variation of burgers, sushi, and BURGUSHI(we will get to this later). To start, we order the crab Rangoon dip which was delicious. The chips had a drizzle of Sweet Thai chili sauce. Everyone at the table loved it. Next up I chose the Brento bento box which came with 2 burger sliders, 4 pieces of one of their specialty roll sushi, and your choice of 4 sides. I upgraded my burger sliders to add some pulled pork on them and chose the firecracker roll for sushi. Those were legit some of the best sliders I've ever had. The flavor that they were able to achieve in the sliders were great. The sushi was amazing and super fresh as well. The Brento bento box was a ton of food and I was stuffed after it.   Of course we also couldn't come cowfish and not try their Burgushi - which takes the traditional sushi roll and adds some red meat items instead of fish. Others at the table ordered the nature boy roll with bison in it so I sampled it. This roll was a complete flavor explosion. It was so good we almost ordered another to go. Now I'm going to have to go back a try all of them! Definitely a fan of this spin on sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Rangoon dip

5y72cdxXDQHqSrLIeVsP_Q.text: The overall atmosphere is perfect, very relaxing with great music to accompany your meal. The menu is a bit overwhelming however, the staff are extremely helpful when trying to decipher what to order. I ordered the bento box specialty, the burger was a smoked Gouda burger with barbecue sauce and bacon; excellent. The drinks are also great! I love this place I'd recommend to anyone looking to try new combinations.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

4g9bXEfrQtpcGquxG1Yi5g.text: It's was great amazing the bento box had all these different flavors of food. the moscato was to die for. The bar waitress were sweet

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fusion Specialty Bento Box Amazing

o6K289IAHkf57L5SfKbjMA.text: This place was really cool !   Fun place. This is my first time staying in Charlotte. I always drive through but never stay. Cow fish is a cool spot to go.  It is family friendly but more adult oriented I believe.  There is plenty of parking in the parking deck with just a short walk to the restaurant.  We went on a Monday night around 7:00 pm and still had a 15 minute wait for first available.  So we sat at the bar and had some libations.  Once seated we were greeted within 5 minutes. We freshened our drinks and looked Over a VAST menu. This menu is awesome.  So many sushi options but also so many more things to try.  The burgers are awesome. The appetizers are great. Deserts are insane.  I had a HUNKA HUNKA burger !  Google that and prepare to be amazed.   The place was above average cleanliness. Bathrooms were clean.  Our server was great when she was around.  We didn't see her for about 30 minutes after our food came.  Anyway ... overall a good visit. This is the kind of place I would take friends from out of town to show them we have a cool place to eat !   Stay calm and yelp on !

EpbGPuQbV__njgWu4itPQg.text: Way too much going on here. If sushi is what you are craving this is NOT the place to go to. I must admit... I am a sushi snob and the grade of fish has to be high for me to give a restaurant a decent grade. The burgers were tasty, but nothing I haven't eaten elsewhere. Overall... I'd say the food was good but I will not be returning... 40min. Later, my friend has explosive diarrhea after eating at this establishment...

97kEaoBNIuFdDT_5SziBdQ.text: I love the concept behind this restaurant and I've eaten here once before and loved my experience.   I suppose this is why I was so disappointed with my experience today.  We were excited to find 2 open seats at the bar on a noticeably busy Saturday, however when we sat, we were met with a brisk "what can I get you guys?" from the female bartender.  No "hello," "how's it going" or any other greeting of any type.  We had to ask for a second menu, as we had just sat down and hadn't had the chance to even look yet.  Once we did get orders in, it became immediately apparent that our bartender was either a new hire who was overwhelmed by the volume, or extremely irritated and not afraid to show it.  As our visit progressed, another gal came behind the bar with her and helped wash and put away dishes.  We soon learned that the original bartender must have been toward the beginning of her shift and came in to a messy or understocked bar.  I know this because she and the other girl were openly (and rather loudly) discussing how upset and frustrated they were.  When she came back for our food order, it was "you guys know what you want?" ... again in a very curt tone with a dismal expression.  I also watched her greet other guests the same way, sans any greeting or pleasantries.   My "No Sleep til Brooklyn" shake and Boursin Burger were delicious, and toward the very end of our visit when we asked for go-to boxes, her attitude improved, and this is the only reason the rating is still a 3.  I don't like to post negative reviews, however being in a service industry, I don't appreciate going to a place to spend money and also leave a tip, just to receive sub par and unprofessional service.   The vibe ruined our meal and we ended up taking over half of it home, just to clear out more quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

xnCR71OQlIHgZRblbgwoEQ.text: So if you love sushi this is your place.  If you love sushi but you have family that does not then this is your place.  The spice tuna poke was sooo good.  Shashimi was Great.   A bit of a wait on a Tuesday so you know it's good.  Service was slow but it seemed to be just our waitress. She had more tables than the rest

0paBBvNZtYdT3kVu8ig_2g.text: So the place is always been clean and very well put together. The food is usually always good for the most part. They have an absolutely amazing crab dip, also the sushi is really good and the milkshakes are fantastic. Out of the hundred plus times I've been here, there have only been very few times that I didn't enjoy it. Also sometimes very loud, but still give an A

jKm8oIZjDbLfXSjFanaMeA.text: Ok, this was not my first time here, I like the food and the concept, but today our order took longer than expected... way longer. The point though is that the staff was nice and honest enough to tell us the real reason instead of making up excuses, and even when we never expected it or asked for it they took care of the ENTIRE bill. I was just worried the girl who took care of our table didn't get in trouble, they didn't have to do that but They were so nice and apologetic!  So they said: hope you want to come back some time and I say: WILL DO GUYS! That attitude is priceless and I still love the food

fkDCQEtr3q0IFJzKpmURkw.text: I didn't actually get to eat here.  The wait was over an hour so I gave up.  This places was packed - watch out for wine events because everyone comes out here to get lit up.  Make a reservation if you can - you really really need to.

tGpUypKvRU3oOGd-HkoQgw.text: We were trying to find a place to eat after being at Carowinds all day on a Sunday evening. We had tried another restaurant and had an absolutely terrible experience, so quickly Yelped nearby burger places. The thought of burgers & sushi sounded very intriguing, so we visited. This place was great - it could be casual or a bit fancy just depending. We all got burgers and some sushi and it was all delicious. One person even got a milkshake, which was amazing. The service was fast, great atmosphere, and delicious food. We would definitely visit again

hD6q2yskyFhmSVV55q8_ZQ.text: This is a very interesting restaurant. The sushi and the burgers are great. Get there early or expect to wait. The hostess and servers are very friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great sushi!

LruIadrXkSURqUjmrFBhjA.text: Before I set foot in The Cowfish, I had every reason to have high expectations. I wanted to love everything about it. I should have loved everything about it. However, love is a bit too strong of a word to describe my experience.   The place was packed when we arrived, so we took our pager and wandered around outside until a table cleared up. In addition to the pager, they ask for your phone number. They'll bombard you with annoying texts as you wait. Lesson learned.  The wait wasn't bad, and we were seated in their covered patio/leper colony area. The walk there was treacherous; the floor inside the place was all oily and slippery. After making it to our seats in one piece, we were promptly greeted by our server, who was very thorough in her explanations and attentive in her service.   There's a great selection of beverages, from hand-spun shakes to beer and sake. Two people in my party ordered the hot ginger tea and were impressed. I stuck to beer, and the last in our group ordered a sake sampler. All of the beverages were good.  We started off with some edamame. Paying $6 for a frozen steam-in-bag pile of edamame irked me a bit and set the tone for many of the menu items: they're way overpriced for what they are. For entrees, we ordered a variety of things, including a burgushi roll (Doug's roll), a burgushi bento box, a roll/sashimi combo, and a sushi roll. I enjoyed my Doug's roll, which was flavorful and really unique. It was not worth the price. The other menu items were fair at best. The rolls fell apart easily because of poorly cooked rice. In general, it was a really lackluster experience.   The Cowfish is great in concept. In reality, it was a place that served a vast menu of creative but mediocre and overpriced sushi. If this is the best sushi place that Charlotte has to offer, I feel bad for this city.

ZK16v0-8AJF6SakZAd5ILA.text: Good food, very busy place usually.  Sushi is a little pricey, but it is good quality.  Overall atmosphere is nice as well, though can be loud at times.

aLs8F5bsXrNm9UspK49knA.text: The mini burgers were dry and missing toppings.  The sushi was grocery store quality at best. The sushi rolls are large but bland. Pictures are very deceiving because this stuff was such bad quality.  This food simply did not taste good and was over priced. So disappointed. Not going back.

zygriYuTjirhavcuaf4Eqg.text: We went on New Year's Eve at 6:00pm.  Our server was very nice and helpful.  The food was delivered quicky and was delicious. We ordered a burger and Sushi!  We tried two of the special cocktails, I was partial to the Thai Basil Hibiscus - delicious!  Will definitely go back!

vNzez6zQruNEtszevNIofw.text: AMAZING!!! I got the bento box, which comes with a mini burger and a sushi roll as well as 3 sides, for $16. While expensive, it was totally worth it- the food was delicious and we have leftovers, which is always a plus. Would highly recommend if in the Charlotte area.

4yFJMefWFYmF6u0tgRYTUw.text: My favorite place to go for my two favorite things, all at the same time!!!  Their burgers are to die for and sushi is amazing!  I will always go to this place.

24zaoTju9ajn6D3zUWC3Jg.text: Awesome service, not a big sushi person but did try the taste explosion burgerushi. It was awesome. Not too hot. Just the right amount of heat. My bride got the Swiss chick. She said it was alright. (She wasn't in a burger mood this evening.).  Tried the parm truffle fries. They were ok. We will be back to try something else off of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Swiss Chick
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taste explosion rolls
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Parm truffle fries

qP2RdXvzKUn4fC85N6s5cQ.text: Not much left to say on Cowfish that has not already been detailed. My favorites are the truffle fries - truffle makes pretty much any dish a stand out. A best bet at lunch is the bento box -try the kids version too- less pricey option but almost as much food.  I feel pretty darn eh about the burgushi.  Pass.  Get the ahi tuna nachos or seared tuna sandwich or salad. Really can't go wrong with any burger here. Most sushi rolls are fried and gigantic. Not really anything wrong with that- Cowfish is an indulgence not a place to stick to your diet. Speaking of which- spiked milkshakes or just a milkshake- get it to go because you will be stuffed. Service usually is on point- even with large groups. I have had my birthday celebrated at Cowfish twice and it is consistent and always delish.

glIHPp_DizJGIk-nt5LcSg.text: Such a fun spot. The Bento Box is my go-to. It has the best of everything there! My fiance and I also tried the crab Rangoon dip the last time we went. It was seriously yummy.  Just be forewarned- if it's someone's birthday, you may be shocked when they ring the gong!

dQmQ5apUC1QtZ95LCOKLdg.text: Visited Cowfish as we have many nights before. Burgers are good lots of different choices. I had the CBCLT and my husband had the Taste Explosion. My burger was a little over the Medium-Well preparation that I requested. My husbands food was at the correct temperature. I usually get the sweet potato fries, usually they are hot and good to go. Last couple of visits they have been cold and on the verge of being soggy. Burgers are avg $12-15 and the sushi entrees are about the same. Good for a casual dinner out.

ypvJbVXeiKAbBOR5owwqRA.text: Long wait for an underwhelming meal. Burgushi was good, but only thing for which I'd consider returning. Not a standout in my book.

3tjJJEJpId3Y25xYSmlj3A.text: Hideous noise levels inside, but great burgers and good service. The Jalapeno Popper Show Stopper was a big hit for me. I enjoyed every element of it, from the brioche bun to the perfectly cooked (medium) beef. Even the fried jalapeno"bottle caps" were obviously fresh made. Hard to go wrong with the food here.

z4bz9XZAB530Qs0R8CbDMA.text: I love Cowfish. Was first introduced to it at their Raleigh location. Since moving to Charlotte, it has become my go to when I want a delicious dinner out. Bento box is definitely the way to go, you get a little bit of everything and can mix and match however you want.

prpleXEEd2YQph_WSGNgXg.text: I go to cowfish frequently and have always had a good experience. I never get the sushi, so I can't attest to that but the burgers and the drinks are delicious. Highly recommend their version of a moscow mule, one of my favorite drinks of theirs!

upiBrNbrOE24i2Knrx8RDA.text: First review, go easy on me.   Cowfish is a unique place where you find a mix of interesting taste combinations. I never thought you could actually mix a burger and sushi, but they do it and its actually pretty tasty. Although its in South Park the atmosphere is not stuffy and business or elegant. You can go in dressed down and still feel good. I recommend trying it at least once.

ht1xOHxJKbzAGJUtwq2PzQ.text: Overrated to say the least. Their menu is so overwhelming and if for some reason your brain tells you that burgushi might be good you better not listen. The taste was terrible but the texture triggered my gag reflex hardcore. I should have listened to the waiter when he said it was weird. That was an understatement.  Also you might end up waiting forever since they don't take reservations.

0V8qWbe1n4wj3OWmMbtNHQ.text: Yo, so I'm cruising around Charlotte and wanted to find something to eat, had a friend recommend this place and I was blown away!  First off, it's a pretty popular place so if you're here on a Friday night with a party of more than 4, expect at least a 40 minute wait. Cool thing is, they'll text you about your wait status just in case that little vibrating thing.   When you're seated, notice the decor behind the sushi station. I thought it was the cutest thing with their attention to detail. This place is a fusion between sushi and burgers so you'll see a mix between soy sauce bottles and ketchup/mustard bottles.   Now, I took some of the advice of my fellow yelpers and started with the crab rangoon dip. Now, I can't say i'm a master of crab rangoon, but it was pretty awesome. Nice texture, i like that the deep fried chips had sweet and sour sauce on it for some added flavor.   Since it was only my girlfriend and I, we opted for a burger and a sushi plate and shared. Ordered the blackened tuna roll and also the jalapeno-popper-show-stopper (say that 5 times fast) burger with a side of sweet potato fries. What was cool was that since we were sharing, waiter went ahead and have the kitchen split our meal into two plates instead of us having to do that awkward "Can I have an extra plate and knife please" routine. So props to you my friend!   The burger had jalapeno and the waiter did say it was spicy but that's because he doesn't do spicy well, but I didn't think it was spicy at all. The burger was cooked medium-rare (how I love my steaks and burgers) and the jalapeno added a nice kick but nothing too spicy. I would say if you can handle hot fries, you can handle this without a problem.   As for the sushi, decent. I can't comment on how great it was or whatnot because I think I liked the burger more and that the sushi just didn't stand out in my opinion.   The fries though, solidly deep fried with a pinch of salt for flavor. This is legit sweet potato fries right here, none of that BS sloppy, limp fries once it gets to your table. These are still piping hot and crispy. I loved them.   Don't be scared of the menu (I know I was when I first saw it). There's A LOT of stuff to choose from. Just ask your server for recommendations and I'm sure they'll steer you in the right direction.   If I was in the area again, definitely would try this place again.

3cCgFnMVfb4teJ6Eb30KFA.text: The Cowfish is not your average sushi place. They specialize in total original and one of a kind sushi and burgers. Some of their classics even infuse a mixture of burgers and sushi. Everything we had was so fresh and the service we received from Jonathan was superb. The presentation of the meals we had were exquisite. we were only able to sample four meal choices and were very pleased with everything. My wife and I left completely satisfied and very full. I would definitely recommend the Cowfish for a great night out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double salmon roll.  Smoked salmon inside rice rolled in dried seaweed then covered in Scottish salmon.  So delicious!!!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Classic tuna nigiri
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scottish salmon nigiri

RH3t3r9xtvDCYFm04s0gXQ.text: Be careful!! I had lunch here last week and became very ill. 2 of the 3 people I went with also got sick. Really really sick... The news is reporting that they have sanitary problems but I think it might be worse. I spoke with the health department today and they said so many people have gotten sick in the past two weeks that they are recording everyone's name and address to communicate with the victims.  In short, I won't be eating here again. The fact that this is going on and it has gotten this bad tells me it's a process/mgmt/staff issue. It will take time to resolve. This was not just an outside case of a few people getting sick.  The news reported 2 days ago that at least 50 people got sick, now I'm betting that number has to be well over 150

kwdzSfYSJk_3-WJNHxRe6w.text: The food is just AMAZING!! That's all there is to it...you have to check this place out. LONG waits sometimes and VERY busy, especially on the weekends. Always go back to this place when I'm in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Clean plates!!!!!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. More appetizers &amp; sushi
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Appetizers &amp; sushi

rBhqSbVw4o4CXHXXLuNOjA.text: The menu. Wow the menu. It was overwhelming but I think we figured it out. I got a bento box with a Krystal size burger and a tuna roll, but they have more ambitious burger-sushi fusion items on the menu. I liked my sushi. My brother liked his burger, but I'm not compelled by the sushi-burger combo. Still a great restaurant.

MoyBMTLf9zowKXFoqoqirA.text: I absolutely LOVE this place! This has been a regular on my must go to list whenever im in town (which is often due to business), its fairly priced and the food quality is amazing!  Two of my favorites are their Orange dreamsicle milkshake and their crab ragoon dip!   if you dont order that your missing out big time!

w71wwsrGkmZNF6hrKzyWYg.text: Was here the other day with my girlfriend on Friday. The waitress was very attentive and kind. I truly love their food every time I go. This time we ordered the Crab Rangoon Dip, Edamame, and the Specialty Fusion Bento Box. Which is perfect, you get a mini burger included in your bento box. I have been here on more occassions then I can count and this place has never disappointed.

VSEXr4aYNcdUANYyNQYgTg.text: First timer, came by on a Thursday at 5:15pm, wasn't seated till 6pm.    Reservations are hard to come by too, as it's voice mail only, and you only find out the morning of if your reservation is accepted.  They need to get on OpenTable or something.  Not sure what they can do about their seating issues, but have to take one star off for that one.  Our server, Brian was friendly and very helpful.  He recommended a nice chunky unfiltered sake that scratched my itch for the night.    Felt like something unique, ordered the filet oscar roll from the burgushi menu.  This roll was great, except it was too dry.  The filet everything inside the roll was fine, it's that the crab cake on the top combined with the rice made it difficult to chew and swallow.  Eaten separately, removing the crabcake from the filet mignon, portabello mushroom & asparagus center, it was fine...  The traditional sushi and sashimi was great!

dijJA3SYKiw0gKc_yl27lg.text: Such a cool place. Very trendy and makes for an excellent date spot. But be prepared to wait if you go during prime dinner time. You can sometimes get seated faster if you are willing to sit at the sushi bar - depending on how long the wait is I would maybe opt to go that route (especially if there is a sports game you want to catch while eating).   I have had both their burgers and various assortments of sushi (rolls, sashimi, and nigiri) and they are all very good. As the name suggests, Cowfish is good at two things: burgers and sushi! You won't be disappointed with either!

8kAN-WcC7fGzKQ_DyDO4Rg.text: I always get the cowfish bento box, and it never disappoints!! The mini burgers and sushi are delightful. It's hard to choose between burgers and sushi from their extensively delicious menu, so this is a nice little combination of both!

FyX0UkIG8atLnN-k7Zo3ZA.text: I always yelp out a location when visiting a new city.  Out of all of the places in Charlotte, this is the one that stuck out to me as something I needed to see.  Being from LA, we have a much larger selection of places to eat and I just thought this was niche for Charlotte.  I have to say that overall I was disappointed.  Sigh.  I was hoping for so much more.    I went there on a Sunday night.  I was worried about it being busy, so that's why I choose Sunday.  The location is chill, right in the middle of upper class shops.  Parking was a bit of a pain - but we found a spot in the lot.  The service was...well....not really there.  The menu is huge.  WAY too huge.  Why offer people so much?  Just doesn't make sense to me.  It took over 20 minutes to make a decision and I'm telling you I still didn't make it all the way through the menu.  The waitress kept telling us the "top picks" - well then why not just have the "top picks" as your menu?  It was so overwhelming and confusing.  Also part of the food selection process is the overwhelming amount of ingredients.  Like how many things can you shove together that possibly haven't been shoved together in another meal.  I found this hard - too much information to digest.  Figuring out which taste pallet to go for was too difficult.  So I stuck to the burger.  And what I thought would be simple - the black Truffle burger.  Now....I know my truffles.  KNOW them.  Intimately.  But this burger fell short.  It was suppose to be a truffle explosion in my mouth - the menu promised:  beef burger topped with black truffle cheese, roasted shallots and truffle-infused sauteed mushrooms. Served on brioche with leaf lettuce and roasted garlic aioli.  What I tasted when I ate the burger:  An overcooked burger in grease with mushrooms and maybe some truffle oil drizzled on top then a soggy bun.  The brioche would have been good but since it was soggy it didn't taste right.  The fries were way too much for a serving.  The waitress did her best to try to pump us full with drinks - must have come by every two seconds trying to get us to try another drink - but once the food arrived and she realized we weren't drunks, she never came back to ask how the food was.  So very disappointed on that note.  Once they realized we weren't there to drink I feel like the service really dropped and they just wanted us to move along.  Shame.  So overall it was not the experience I was looking for in Charlotte.  Next time I am in town I will try another Yelp selection.

vUYx49d5MTBNccp3w052vQ.text: I'm quite late with this review, as I was Cowfish on June 2nd. We hosted a baby shower here for about 20 women.  We had the event on the patio area in the dire heat.  Initially, we thought that we would have had more space for our party and nature of the event, but we were kept to the tables and chairs set up. However, the mgrs. were willing to accomodate by bringing over additonal benches if possible.   Our waiter was more than helpful. For whatever reason, we were given one waiter for our large group, so he was constantly getting this and checking on this. He was as attentive as he could be for the large crowd. I would have liked another dedicated server to ensure that no one was without drinks, plates were being cleared, etc.   The food was great, as usual. We had a lot of options that were shareable platters for our event. None of them were too pricey either.    Overall, I like the restaurant and I would patron it again. However, if a private room or the entire patio could be used for an event, I would look at them again for hosting an event.

nUxbQYsN10aODniKffpGpA.text: Sat at the bar due to wait... World cup was on and place was packed.  Wait for service at the bar was beyond abysmal.  I mean truly so.  I got a bed sore on the bar stool.  That said, he was friendly and helpful when we had his attention and the rolls, though abnormally gigantic, we're delicious.  The sake recommend was decent and reasonably priced.  I've been before and I'll go again.

aeVAfztLlKtl2Q3JqJwURQ.text: I have been to Cowfish a couple of times. I love the modern atmosphere, and although there is almost always a wait for the table, I appreciate the fact that the bar offers the full menu. So if it is just you and a couple of people you will most likely get lucky by catching seats at the bar.   The Sushi is okay. The flavor is good, however you don't get that taste of freshness that I always love when eating sushi.  The burgers are good! I am not a very adventurous person when it comes to my burgers, but I enjoyed reading the descriptions of all the different and odd burgers they offered there. I got the BBQ burger and it was very good. (Better than the sushi in my opinion)   The drinks are excellent! I always end up getting the spiked milkshake, it is absolutely delicious for anyone with a sweet tooth.  Service is average. However, it should be better for the amount of money that you pay to eat there.  I have seen a few families with small children there. In my opinion this is not much of a family atmosphere. However, some people obviously disagree with me. I just find the food and the overall ambiance a little too mature for children.

64eJrL3RVEF2hIgNUnZ0yw.text: We received tremendous service while sitting at the bar during our visit to Cowfish. Besides our bartenders, the rest of the staff was very welcoming and a pleasure to be around.   Our bartender recommended The Boss sushi roll, and I found it to be quite good. My party enjoyed the ambience and would love to visit again.

3Jts5kdvIV-0mce8yMVVUg.text: First time visiting Cowfish. Fabulous! My husband eats sushi but I do not   Get to find a place that caters to both of us! Be sure to ask for Caroline!  Awesome waitress!!

Otx3bKSDv2Y_khnCGY57_g.text: Took a large party of 10 people and had a long wait as expected about 1.5 hours.( they dont take same day reservations). out group had been trying to get together for weeks to get here and it was worth it  The Appetizers We ordered their Crab Rangoon Dip & Crispy Calamari. The Crab Rangoon was fantastic as was the Calamari. The sweet/spicy sauce they use is put on the plate and the Calamari over the top So I had the waiter bring a side of the sauce because it wasnt enough)  The Entrees I ordered the CBCLT which is a Beef burger, sharp cheddar cheese, thick cut applewood smoked bacon, white cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato and onion. Served on brioche with our signature Cowfish sauce. Honestly may have been the best burger I have ever had Even better than a Kobe Burger in Tampa last year. It was juicy and just fell apart in your mouth. for a side I ordered the onion straws whch I wouldn't order them again (I like em but they are always so greasy, don't know why I try) but their shoestring french fries were great.  My wife order the Taste Explosion Roll which is Seasoned natural Angus ground beef, applewood bacon, fresh jalapenos and spicy cream sauce inside of a sushi roll coated with tempura flakes. Each piece is topped with marinated Roma tomato and pepper jack cheese, then baked to perfection. Drizzled with cashew cilantro pesto to finish. She loved it..for me I though it was good but for the price and what they give you I feel you would be better off with their normal Sushi which was a whole roll.  All in all this place is fantastic and will def go back...expect a wait if you dont get a reservation. The place does die down after 8:30 tho on a Saturday ...so go early or late.

HypM6z15S9_NcmpcxtM7Ow.text: Sushi meats American protein is the best way I can describe this! It's unique, can serve variety of cravings, great location, and awesome food. If you are a foodie and enjoy trying new things, definitely a Burgushi entree is the way to go.  Spicy Togarashi Shrimp - good large serving appetizer that serves 2-3. Sauce drizzled on it was plentiful but not overwhelming. Good spice added kick but with some Asian slaw and it could easily be thought of as salad with spicy shrimp.  Surf & Turf Roll - Ground beef on top of a traditional sushi roll - Yes. Roll had cream cheese, tuna, and salmon so it felt like a sushi roll but the ground beef made it feel more feeling than when I normally eat sushi. The roll was glazed with a sauce that gave it some additional flavor but made have been a little excessive (as with most specialty rolls at sushi joints).  This restaurant stands out around all the chain restaurant neighbors because they offer something different and new. Give them a shot.  Definitely looking forward to my next Charlotte visit and The Cowfish!

bNRqCxPHSYAwRdFyu1l9mQ.text: This place is amazing!  There was a wait but they keep it fun with how you can track your wait time.  The menu is huge - so many choices.  I went with the burger sushi fusion menu - a bit out of my comfort zone but I was glad that I did. It was so good!  There is something for everyone on this menu.  I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

2uj2R0qNUM7D__k3vu-jTg.text: Dude. This place has it ALL!! Amazing food, awesome atmosphere, perfect service. It doesn't get better than The Cowfish.   Cocktails...So.Delish. Ahi Tuna Nachos...off the hook.  Crab Rangoon Dip...you'll slap yo mama if she touches it. Sushi and Burgushi...innovative flavors, fresh ingredients, leaves you wanting mo fo sho! Burgers...melt in your mouth flavor. Dessert...the Berry Tall Cake is Uh.Mazing. I really can't say enough about this place...they really got it right...this place is TIGHT!

ZoZwFdKIyZMDpIhhS4-i0A.text: This place is "as good as it gets" as the 5-star rating suggests!  We eat here every chance we have and have NEVER been disappointed!  The food is hot, plentiful, inexpensive for the quality, and DELICIOUS EVERY TIME.  My favorite is the CBCLT (or something like that) which is basically a great cheddar cheeseburger with all the trimmings.  I love the sweet potato fries served with the horseradish aioli.  My husband loves the fine onion strings but also asks for the horseradish aioli. :)  Our favorite dessert (although I must admit we can't get past the deliciousness to try any other...) is the Triple Berry Tall Cake.  Be warned... it is HUGE!  Moist lemon pound cake with premium vanilla bean ice cream, fresh whipped cream and berries.  It always tastes so fresh and "summery"!    This is our favorite restaurant in Charlotte and we have been to MANY.  We recently took our son for the first time (he is vegetarian).  He ordered the vegetarian sushi (not sure of the name) and it was delicious, also.  We all loved it.  He is taking a date back for a birthday celebration this Friday. It was a hit!    My friend loves the Pimento Cheese burger (served with a fried green tomato on it) served with fried pickles.  She is so stuck on it she has never tried anything else! It seems whatever you order the first time has a hold on you here! :)    Be sure to try the Dreaming Tree (Dave Matthews Band) Cabernet Sauvignon!  Also, be forewarned about busy times like Friday and Saturday.  Many times there is a 2 hour wait if you go right at dinner time.  Try going in mid afternoon! Oh-oh, I shouldn't have told you that....

fvFn1x3WZ45O91aRQeSZSw.text: So I have been wanting to try Cowfish for what seems like forever, and finally made it there the other evening. My friend and I decided that if we were to go, we would definitely go on a Tuesday as they have there $5 10oz Martini Special. And lets just say that did not disappoint. They have some interesting Martini's going on here, but I started off with the "Chocolate Dipped Fortune Cookie" Martini which contained an Amaretto and Bailey's combo with a hint of vanilla vodka and my friend started off with the "Magnificent Mango" Martini which contained Mango liqueur and vanilla vodka. Both were excellent!!!   We advised the waiter this was our first time at Cowfish, and he went thru the whole Menu (as it is pretty large) and informed us of "what we need to know" to get thru and understand the Cowfish experience.   We deiced to start off with the "Crab & Avocado Rolls" Appetizer which are crispy spring rolls filled with lump crab meat, fresh avocado and tomatoes & Served with cashew and cilantro pesto..... This went perfect with the Martini's!!!   Now as for the Entrees I'm not a big Sushi Eater, so I was definitely on the "Cow" portion of "CowFish" and my friend was all about some Sushi, so she ordered the "Fish" portion... LOL. So I can't really talk about the Sushi here in this review, but I will talk about my Burger. So I ended up ordering the "Shroomin' Swiss Burger" which is a Beef burger loaded with Swiss cheese and sauteed mushrooms. Served with roasted garlic aioli, lettuce and tomato on a brioche bun. And my Side that I ordered was the Sweet Potato Fries. I have to say... this was alittle piece of Heaven!!!! The burger was cooked to perfection, and the Sweet Potato fries were just right.... definitely not overdone.   In between our delicious meal it was Martini time again, and we decided to switch it up this time.... I ordered the "Cheeky Monkey" which contained Malibu, Midori, Cointreau, vodka, pineapple, cream, fresh lime and my friend ordered the "Orange Rush" which contained Orange vodka, Apple Pucker, with splashes of Sprite and sour. Again both were excellent, but I think I may have preferred the Cheeky Monkey just a little bit more than the Chocolate Dipped Fortune Cookie. Also noticed that others who ordered the Fortune Cookie Martini actually had real Fortune cookie on the side of the Martini glass, which is a nice touch, but Mine was absent when it came to my table.   But overall I was very pleased with this place. The atmosphere was great. I definitely recommend reservations if you wanting an actual table as there aren't that many. It seems most people sit at the Bar because its HUGE, and goes a long the entire restaurant. Also loved some of the artwork on the walls!!! I will definitely be back!!!

Bg3-4iP8SrnBzT08MDffjQ.text: Holy Cowfish Batman!!!  I stopped in here with a friend earlier tonight to try this place out.  Come to find out there was a two and a half hour wait on a Thursday night?!?!?!  Luckily we were able to grab a couple of seats at the bar and we didn't have to wait.    Just so happens that all Sake is 1/2 price on Thursdays so my friend ordered a bottle and I decided on a glass of white wine that was ok.  The Crab Rangoon dip appetizer is superb to say the least.  Since we were both feeling sushi we decided to split the Moriawase Double Deuce which consists of an 8 piece California Roll, an 8 piece Spicy Tuna Roll and 6 pieces of Nigiri (1 each - tuna, salmon, whitefish, yellowtail, shrimp and kani).  It was all very fresh and tasty!    After we were done we decided to walk next door to Zink for a quick drink at the bar.  To our surprise the bar was basically empty except for Ric Flair and his 20 something girlfriend....Woooooo!

nqTq_Bgcd9Y4OfUYUgPb3Q.text: Delicious but way over priced and extremely hipster. I'd been hearing great things and put up with over an hour wait to eat here. I still recommend but I'd try to go at a slightly off time.

nZJjW33tFw8nEpVcBICQ-g.text: We went to Cowfish this past Sunday night and arrived around 6:30 PM.  Who knew that on a Sunday night in Charlotte I'd need a reservation?   Our party of seven waited 45 minutes for a table.  Everyone was very nice, though, and even the manager apologized to us for the long wait.  I think the problem is that Cowfish has a huge bar to sit at (and I mean HUGE; it starts on one side of the restaurant, wraps around, and continues for miles down the other side) and not a lot of "large" tables.   Now I know, though, so I won't be caught off guard in the future.  I've never seen a restaurant in Charlotte so busy on a Sunday night, that's why I didn't think to make a reservation.  At any rate, I loved looking around the restaurant.  It's come a long way since it was The Counter.  The walls are painted a deep red and extend high up into the warehouse-like black painted ceiling.  The bar (which I mentioned earlier) takes up a lot of space.  If you're a couple, it makes a great spot to sit, talk, eat, and drink.  Any more than two people, though, and conversation is probably difficult.  The giant paintings on the red wall are humorous knock-offs of famous art pieces or pop culture icons.  Burger King getting dissed by Wendy?  "Fine, have it your way."  Classic.    Our server (very friendly and attentive) explained the menu to us.  If you thought the menu at Cheesecake Factory was a book, check out the menu at Cowfish.  You need about 20 minutes to look over everything just to begin to narrow down your choices.   Since we had waited so long for a table, we started with the Sticks, Sweets & Strings -- regular fries, sweet potato fries, and onion strings.  For $5, it was incredibly huge and plenty for sharing with a large group.  Plus, it all tasted so good.  While we waited for our table, I noticed a group of women who had HUGE sushi rolls on their plates.  Their diameter was the size of my wrist.  So when I saw the Fusion Specialties section of the menu featuring "entree-sized sushi rolls" for more money than the hamburger entrees, I assumed that's what they had ordered.  I finally decided on the "Mark's Roll" - fresh tuna, jalapeno, cream cheese, kani and scallion roll, coated with panko and flash fried, topped with Japanese cream sauce and sriracha, and served with ponzu dipping sauce.  Everyone else ordered burgers.  When our dinners were delivered, I was quite disappointed to find that my entree-sized sushi roll was no bigger than a larger-sized sushi roll at another restaurant.  It wasn't really "entree-sized" when everyone else got a HUGE, stacked burger with fries.  Don't get me wrong -- it was delicious, but I'd stick to getting a couple of the cheaper sushi rolls next time or else a big, thick, juicy burger.  For $10, they looked like quite the value.    And, speaking of value, the kids' meals are about $5 on average.  There is a wide variety of choices for kids, and the meals come in bento boxes where every little cubby hole is FILLED with different foods.  The kids even got more food than me!  I'm looking forward to going back to Cowfish (despite my smaller meal) because there are SO many things to try on the menu (there's even a wide variety of salad entree choices), the prices are very reasonable, and the atmosphere is classy, yet casual.  I'll just remember to make a reservation next time!  (Or sit at one of the many, many spots along the lonnnnnnnnnnnng bar.)   And, yes, there really is such a thing as a cowfish.  And you can see them swimming in the giant fish tank on the other side of the bar as you walk in the restaurant.

B5nMs0hyStuDxaavh9g9gQ.text: So I think it's high time I review The Cowfish! I do believe my friend and I came here about 5 times a month every month last year!! Seriously when he finds a restaurant he likes he sticks with it.  That being said the wait time here is uber ridiculous.  We found that if you show up between 9-10 you don't have to wait though lol.    Neither of us is a big fan of the giant specialty rolls they have as we tend to like less fussy sushi. So every week (usually Wednesday) we'd go in and order the same thing.  The Moriawase Double Deuce ( 6 pieces of nigiri, spicy tuna roll, and substitute the spicy yellow tail for the California roll), we'd also add another spicy tuna or spicy yellow tail and occasionally a bagel roll. Their spicy tuna is my favorite spicy tuna roll I've ever had in Charlotte. Everywhere else serves it minced except for cowfish and minced fish to me is kind of gross lol.  We always start with the minis of the day (miniature burgers) and generally either Saki or martinis.  Their martini selection is really good and they make a great dirty martini which is what he likes. I go for the specialty ones myself.  Personally I really like their sushi and their burgers are VERY good.  The fried pickles are great as well and you'd think it would be a hard thing to mess up but many restaurants in Charlotte do!    Now we rarely have enough room left for desert but on occasion we get it, or I should really say that I get it and take most of it home.  I have a weak spot for their Fresh Berry Tall cake.  I mean a serious, I will go here and wait 45 minutes just so I can get it, weak spot!! Honestly it's nothing out of the ordinary.. all it consists of is lemon pound cake and vanilla bean ice cream layered and stacked 3 deep (of each layer). Then it is topped with fresh strawberries, raspberries and blackberries. However the lemon pound cake is to die for and for whatever reason completely resonates with me.  Just one of those things :-) I generally like to order it sans ice cream and take it home so I can have a slice of pound cake for desert for the next three nights!  Service here gets a good 4/5 rating. There have been a couple of misses but they were usually new. Otherwise the waiters tend to remember us and our order (we include a lot of substitutions).  Lately though we've been opting for another sushi spot but after writing this review I may have to reinstate the Cowfish ritual!

OwdTTOwvZDSqG9BL7Oxo_A.text: Unique concept, but I just don't understand the hype.  The food is just ok.  I have never been blown away.  The service is typically pretty good.  There are just way too many lines for this place, when you can check out so many others across Charlotte, with better food.

QuFhmkPPrYAWkKfGyHvQdA.text: Do you like giant hamburgers? Do you like fantastically fresh and creative sushi? Do you like a page long craft brew list in the $3-$4 range? Do you like a giant picture of Japanese Elvis watching you eat?   If so, then Cowfish is for you.  If not...we probably shouldn't hang out.  We showed up on a Saturday afternoon and there was about a 25 minute wait so I can only imagine what dinner sans reservation would be like. The servers were all super friendly, from the bartender who brought our drinks and stopped to shoot the shit about one of the brewery's that he had info on, to the waiter who scooted in with the ladies next to us when taking their orders "so I don't have my butt all in anyone's face". The atmosphere is funky and filled with great pop art, but not so swank that i felt out of place in errand attire.  But enough about the frills, you care about the food right? We got a small edamame, which was by no means small ($4), and split three 8-piece Makimono: the spicy tuna roll ($7), the volcanic roll ($13) and the dynamite roll($13). All the fish was very fresh and generously cut. I'm curious to try their burgushi, which is a fusion of land ingredients and sushi form, or sushi ingredients and burger form, depending on what you pick. There was more than enough food to keep us both full until late in the evening, so you get what you pay for, but the menu does get a but pricey if you aren't bargain-conscious (read: cheap).  Cowfish is by all means a great sushi place to go for an occasional lunch treat or a special event, but I'm thinking for normal sushi nights, I might stick a little closer to home (and budget).

a7xXWnfsXD9kutwTGzNsOQ.text: Came back for an awesome ladies lunch. Jon, our server, was about as good as it gets- friendly, professional, and extremely knowledgeable about the menu. All of his recommendations were spot on!   Tried the Doug's roll which is burgushi - excellent and something very new for me.   The Boss was also tasty- albeit a little pricey at $19 ( but expected for a higher quality sushi...not your take-out Japanese joint). I particularly liked the ponzu with this. The presentation was beautiful - fresh flowers and everything.    My absolute favorite was the tuna nachos - not your typical nacho but I would come back for this alone.   We opted out but on Sundays they have $5 mimosas and bloody Mary's, which was a great deal.   I felt that they really earned all 5 stars this time around!

HudQGu0_oZxQfzCQI6vRIg.text: Great place for a mixed party (sushi lovers and non-sushi lovers). I love both sushi AND burgers so I'm drawn to the Bento Box - you get the burger of the week, fries, sushi roll, edamame, and pickled cucumbers. The only downside is they are ALWAYS busy and usually a long wait involved. But it's worth it!!

3tvktA_6QJvT2EZGg2XYGA.text: Hmmm, I'm just split on Cowfish. It's a very nice restaurant, love the theme, the bar, the area, the mood......but the sushi is just as bad as Eez, so I'll have to steer clear of that if I decide to return......I really want to like this place so I probably will return. The onion rings and crab rangoon dip were pretty good. The burger squirted me with grease as I bit into it, but it was rather tasty.  The drink menu is extensive and it would be great if the servers were able to sample the drinks to at least recommend a favorite or 2, but I understand they are forbidden to try drinks.....even on their off days.......with that said, I tried the Cheeky Monkey, pretty good but could have used a bit more pineapple juice.  3 stars overall, I'm quite disappointed in the sushi and the service seemed to want to rush you out.......

Sw6uV9vMrbW4CJrx8qhkvw.text: Fun Southpark Sushi.  Eclectic menu.  Reasonably priced.  Normally pretty busy

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

OFIBtADBQsYKQw-y0FasHg.text: Honestly, the deciding factor to try The Cowfish last night was the fact that they serve food until midnight. With the time of our arrival being 11:30pm, I was not expecting the level of service and quality of the food to be as exceptional as it was. We arrived about 11:30 and were fed and happy and out by 12:05. Not even once did we feel rushed. The food came out quickly and it was very tasty.  Every interaction with the staff there was exceptional. Our server explained the menu and made great recommendations. From the time we walked in until the time we left, we felt welcomed. Everyone was so friendly. And our drink glasses never got empty. They were on top of our refills before we realized that we were close to being out.   Many places bill themselves as "Asian Fusion", but this place truly pushes the "fusion" boundary and explores some fantastic combinations. We found that (unlike many places) the more complicated the sushi/burgushi, the more delicious it was. Be forewarned that each roll is very large. One roll will fill you up easily.   Here is the run-down of what we ordered: Sweet & Spicy Pork Potstickers : Slightly spicy balanced with a slightly sweet peanuty sauce. Different and delicious.  The Taste Explosion : It's like a great burger in sushi form. This was one of our favorites.  The Boss: This was a complicated roll that was fabulous.  Spider Roll: very delicious, the crab was cooked perfectly.  Spicy Tuna Roll: large roll, simple and wonderful.  Needless to say, we ordered waaaaaaay too much. We just had the leftovers for lunch and they are still delicious!   We will definitely be going back soon to try the items on the "Burger" side of the menu.

Ss9ILiZaj0Ri7XqMNIJjgg.text: FANTASTIC!!!  I heard so many people rave about this place and I am now a raver myself.  The hostesses that greet you to the server and every helper are so professional, friendly and knowledgeable.  Super clean, awesome ambiance and food is delicious.  Three of us started with the sweet and spicy thai cucumbers which put a little salad on all of our plated with awesome flavor.  I had a vegan soy roll that was out of this world.  Can't say enough wonderful things.  :)

5PzrfsdClyKipu3La3F20g.text: Ok!!  So I was going ot give this place a 5 star but taking away a star because....  of this. We check out this place a few weeks after is opened. By the way FABULIUS PLACE EXCELLENT CONCEPT ITS GENIUS I TELL YA!!!    However, the managment made a critical mistake thye were so worried about packing the people in but didnt worry abut or think about the service and the manpower cna sustain the people thye packed into the plae so my service was HORRIBLE..  Which was a HUGE DISSAPOINTMENT. Never the less I thik since they are almost over there opening stages and got all the kinks out I am defitnely willing to go back and give it another try because honestly they shouldnt worry abut people not coming ot the establishment I mean come on this menu is GENIUS!!    One thing that I thought that was funny and annoying at he same time was the restroom would play a CD of random quotes from different languages. its pretty funny.  Ok off of my side note now on to the food.   1. Sushi:  AMAZING..  However I feel they need to have more traditional sushi not this americanized CRSP with jalapenos and cream cheese its gross to be honest but whatever to each their own right?    2. Burgers: Awesome!  The jalapeno bacon they put on the burgers are really cool and tasty.    3. Drinks: Good wish they had al ittle kick to them but I like ,my drinks strong though.

7FvXhwu3bZBQN2yXa4FxtA.text: So good!  Was in Charlotte for training and came back when I was in town again! Wouldn't miss it!

3lpvsFcfsE_lR9u60MVvdA.text: Cowfish is quite an interesting place.  Had to wait 45 minutes for a table for six.  Not  problem as we went to City Tavern for couple drinks.  Cowfish has an awesome feature where they will text you when your table is ready so you can explore the expansive South Park Mall it is located next to.  On my first and only visit I had a bison burger with sweet potato fries.  I was impressed with the quality of both items and with the variety of toppings available for burgers.  Others in my party ordered Bento Boxes and sushi.  The Bento Box looked awesome and had a unique variety of items.  The sushi looked and tasted awesome but is definitely overpriced.    We went (and you should go) on a Thursday for half-price sake.  We split several carafes and also each did a sake bomb which is always a good time.  I will definitely be back to Cowfish.

CMGjAu34wZIW6wrLH8fIZg.text: This review is for Sushi only. Personally if I go to a sushi bar I wont order anything but sushi. The person next to me did have some kind of burger and it was huge and looked really good. If your a sushi lover and If you have ever been to EEZ fusion in Birkdale village(SAME OWNERS) and enjoyed it then you will love Cowfish. The sushi at Cowfish and EEZ is the best around. They have the freshest sashimi and the biggest and tastiest rolls. In addition to the sushi you have to try the crab rangoon dip. The dip may actually be better than eating a crab rangoon itself. They drizzle a special sauce over the fried wontons to start and you can eat the wontons plain the sauce is so good. There sushi bar is pretty cool as well. They have screens on the bar that you can play all kinds of games.   I could really care less but the only drawbacks about the restaurant is that the bathrooms are extremely small. One bathroom is for only one person at a time. The parking is a bit limited as well. Unless your lucky and find a spot in front of the restaurant you will have to park in the garage. The garage is about a block away. They do have some good sake's. If you a sake enthusiast however then the sake list seems a bit more limited then what EEZ carries. But for being in a new area like South Park the list may grow as they develop and learn the clientel that will come in.

znF5zePfrPP1PfeZyhbMGQ.text: Yelp brought me to Cowfish.   Overall, service was spectacular, beer was cold, and the food tasted good.  However the burgushi, texture was just very weird.   Ground beef and sushi rice was too much,  cool concept and next time i'll try it non fused.  I can't say enough about the service.  The bartender saw that I wasn't particularly thrilled and wanted to replace my meal immediately.    If you are in Southpark, try it.

WiZ-VJ-BvlPcsaU26ba4jw.text: Loved the bento box with a small slider, fries, a couple pieces of sushi, edamame, etc. Fantastic fusion of food that appeased my Japanese and American heritage. :)

rozuL9k9EH7U-lNHFzALjQ.text: I would have given Cowfish 5 stars, but the wait was almost unbearable! A friend of mine had asked to go to Cowfish for her birthday.  We tried going once before, but the wait was so long we ended up turning in our buzzer and eating else where.  This was a Tuesday evening and yet it was still packed! I didn't make reservations because I thought with it being a week day the wait would not be as long......epic fail! We were told the wait would be any where between an hour and an hour and a half! We actually ended up waiting and hour......so my suggestion is to MAKE reservations!   Once we got in, the electric atmosphere quickly helps you forget about the long wait.  If it's just you and a date, you can always ask to be let in and sit at the bar, but for that extra special feeling, I would suggest getting a table.  My date and I were seated at a small cramped table in the corner.  Our waiter Mike was very pleasant and efficient.  I ordered the Bagel roll, and an appetizer of Chicken Satay.  The bagel roll is great fro those who can only take so much sushi.  It's lightly cooked salmon, rice, cucumber rolled in rice and covered in sesame seeds.  The Chicken satay is great....the best thing about it is the celery salad/garnish that it comes with.  The celery is cut into fine slices and there is a vinaigrette spread over it....delicious!  The service was so fast....we got our  sushi rolls, prior to our appetizers, but no complaints here!  All in all, the Cowfish is an interesting spot, definitely a date destination.  From the cool decor, tasty food, to the weirs Rosetta Stone language lesson that plays in the bathroom......the Cowfish is one of a kind!

rloM_45lqRU6iZPDnezIoQ.text: I am updating my post from before- we have been back at least 3 times and have had no issue with kids at the bar.  I am very happy we can enjoy cowfish again!  The food is great, however forget about sitting at the bar without kids! They allow kids to take up valuable bar seats which is rather annoying.  I will gladly drive another 10 minutes to O-Ku in SouthEnd where I can eat with grown ups and enjoy a more mature atmosphere.  Will not go back unless they change their policy of kids sitting at the bar which unfortunately is not illegal in NC.

tILW_6mpr720JBX8DPLb8g.text: We have had the best food and service here. My husband loves the little sushi burgers. I love the unique menu items, it's nice to go somewhere that has a different palette experience! If you haven't been, they take very good care of you.

RVuRyqZWUlGhQQE_GWKs4g.text: I've been here a few times and it's always a neat place to take out-of-town guests and especially those that aren't use to the raw in sushi. Their menu is huge so if you're a fan of burgers, sushi, salad or even milkshakes, then you'll be set.  The "Burgushi" bento box selection is usually my go-to as you can sample a small sushi roll, a slider-size burger, and sides (sweet potato fries, edamame, and cucumbers). They even have 3 selections of bentos.  This visit I tried the all-jalapeno everything burger. A pretty good sized burger, tasty, and mine was cooked the way I wanted it, but my friend's slider was way too pink for the medium-well she requested. Must be tougher on smaller burgers without overdoing it.  I would return to share the experience with guests, but for the price you can go to a better place that specializes specifically on burgers or one specifically for sushi.

kErKuuYTVJAaQNiCJWyUMA.text: For all of the raves I've heard about this place, I was not too impressed after dining here. There is always a ridiculously long wait and the food is subpar. It's a unique concept to combine American food and sushi, but I wasn't a fan. The menu is overwhelming and pricey for average quality food. The ambiance and decor is neat, but I probably won't return.

Yzc78cv7NJoMy1XvEQDjzQ.text: I think this place is more hype than anything else but it's still a decent place to grab lunch or dinner.  I had twice attempted to eat here on weekends during the holiday season (which was a big mistake) and was greeted with the news that there would be at least a 45 minute wait for lunch. On my third attempt, I went in March 2014 on a Friday afternoon around 2:00 and there was still at least a 20 minute wait. I chose to wait since I was a meeting a friend and had already completed my errands in the mall.  As you wait, you can watch your name inch up to the top of the list on a large projection screen that's supposed to simulate a fish tank and you also get sent a text.  I ordered the neon dion roll and was very happy with the flavors and taste. My friend ordered the bento box that included a slider (of her choice), sushi roll, cucumber salad, and other sides. Personally, I thought the bento box really gives you a bigger 'bang' for your buck and the cucumber salad is delicious!

ykH-LgkWUIUR7Xhs3iAQ7w.text: After an 1 1/2 wait for our table; yes, it was Saturday night, so, to be expected.   We started with the Bacon truffle French fry appetizer; very tasty.    I ordered the Blackened Tuna Sushi Roll, my husband ordered the  Bison Burger and our daughter ordered a California Roll and fried pickles.    Overall, it was good, and a fun atmosphere but a bit pricy for a french fry appetizer, fried pickles, a burger and 2 sushi rolls.

xaqzoGzjVjQdaA_l2SJ4Aw.text: A-FREAKIN-MAZING! What a delicious, trendy, and innovative place! I wish there was one of these in ATL and Houston!  Seriously the fusion of tastes at this place will make ANY Foodie Yelp!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Filet mignon on sushi? YES PLEASE!

7CWzIdspCIQ_IpoCSog1vw.text: Visited many time, nice place.. good location and good Manu. Service is okay, nothing's special but nice place to spend time with friends.

M6Xw8pTxHeYTI_odY1yrPQ.text: Have been to cowfish numerous times and love it every time! The food is really good and there is both amazing burgers and sushi so everyone has something to eat. They have good drinks and typically have good service. I recommend going early or putting your name in and going to the mall as they do not do reservations and the wait is usually atleast 30 mins. Will definitely be going back here.

lK-Jw9qm-AVdDUx2_28THQ.text: Great service! Our waiter Tucker was very helpful and very cheerful! The atmosphere was great, love the unique decor! The food was great, the prices are a bit on the high side for the amount of food you get. I got the mushroom Swiss burger with fries, $15 is a bit steep for the size and amount of fries. Others in my party both got the bento box, the portions of everything was a bit small for the high price, and the mini burgers were over cooked. Other than that we were very satisfied, the menu is huge! Will go back!

AtsSTcg_H1ZXvA6-B5i_Ww.text: I loooove cowfish but I'm also broke cause of it. Food was soooo good! I want to go again. But I'm broke.

STGNGtX7mBLGuf-9Y0BKLA.text: The food is incredible. The service...even better. Having a child with food allergies is always nerve wracking. There are very few places that have made me feel at ease like Cowfish. After listing my daughter's allergies to the server, together we were able to figure out what to order for her. My husband's and my food came out first. We were told our daughter's food would come out shortly after. It came out a few minutes later as promised, but by the chef himself, who explained to us how it was cooked to ensure that no cross-contamination happened. There was even a tag on her tray that said "allergy," so that extra caution could take place. That was something that we really appreciated and don't take lightly! Thank you Cowfish

x7ZC4gY6MvOgNda5WIMNIA.text: I'm no stranger to this place. The sushi here is always fresh and consistent. If you don't like traditional sushi they have chicken, pork, and BBQ in some rolls. They specialize in Burgushi (Burgers and Sushi). If you can't decide on just one, ask your waiter what is the burger of the week, pick your favorite sushi roll, and order a bento box. You will not be disappointed. Tell the manager Chris I sent you

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Crunchy Roll

bJfV1eb5v8TCr2PI13UQ3g.text: This is an interesting concept, you can eat sushi or you can have a burger. Both offering are complete and sound (also few, very few, vegetarian options).   On the sushi side, this is so far the best sushi restaurant in Charlotte (having been here about 2 years and having tried many). Fish taste great and properly sliced, and the chef inventions (ie specialty rolls) are interesting and tasty.   On the burger side, properly cooked, a good variety of options (incl meat), makes this restaurant beating many burger-only restaurants available all over Charlotte.

iahH94_iDEo1SftuEQJhSw.text: I struggle with some fusion concepts.  The idea of burgers and sushi sounded odd and outside of my comfort zone.  It came as a pleasant surprise that Cowfish manages to serve both and do it well.  We had a little of everything for our table.
