9dr30_ddIkzHFEjgjGQOTg.text: Always a good experience. The only downside is the long wait for a table almost regardless of the day or hour. Definitely recommend and suggest the Longhorn Burger.

6VClzEBF5r_J7YHsTnT-IA.text: This is a fun place to visit. Last time we went we tried the crab dip, it was pretty food. More chunks of crab would be nice. We always love getting the shishito Peppers, my all time favorite pepper that for some reason most restaurants don't use. The bento box was fun and everything was very good. The Korean chicken sandwich was a huge disappointment. There wasn't enough heat, I didn't get any. I added sriracha to it. The condiments were almost nil as well as the kimchi. The spider roll was pretty good, a little fishy but nothing the wasabi couldn't cover up. But the last roll was aesthetically appealing, but not edible with the shrimp with the shell and tail on! The server was nice, accommodating. The music was terrible, absolutely.

ksX8q_GXfIVeLmRKf8Yw0A.text: Cool place.  Like that you get a little bit of everything in the bento box.  Sushi was decent, but the slider and sweet potato fries were pretty fire.

4tDLF1H4cE-Fyd8iOf_LTw.text: We waited about an hour on a Saturday night for first available table (arrived at 6:30pm).  They don't take reservations.  There was plenty of room at the bar and your notified by text when your table is ready which is great because you can walk around and shop nearby if you want.  There is a big screen that shows all the characters of people waiting in a fish tank and then your character gets scooped out when it's your turn.  Gotta say, it was pretty cute and we were all high-fiving when we finally made it out of the tank and to a table.    First available for us mean sitting outside in uncomfortable chairs on a plastic wrapped patio under a heat lamp so... yeah... so much for ambiance.  But after waiting for an hour, we were just ready to eat.    We started with the shishito peppers with bonito flakes and the blackened tuna nachos.  The nachos came out really quickly but the peppers ended up coming out pretty much with our entrees.  The peppers and nachos were both tasty apps.  For dinner, our table went with a range of both sushi and burgers.  Everything was delicious.    I don't know that I'd necessarily come back here but it's mainly because it's just bombastically loud and chaotic and had a big wait.  But overall, it's a fun restaurant and a great option in South Park.  My husband loves burgers and I love sushi so it was a win win!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi premium combo platter

v89VKcTo0HzfCE7NFRzI_w.text: So far my experience with cowfish sushi is that I don't think you're likely to go wrong no matter what items you select. I've been there a few times, and mainly stayed in the appetizer and sandwich sections of the menu. The calamari, lobster/crab spring rolls, and onion rings, were all great... The jalapeno burger, and the Boursin burger (1/2 lb) were big, juicy and dripping with flavor, but if you're a lamb fan, (I am) you owe it to yourself to get the Mediterranean lamb burger. It's head smacking good. As far as all those good reviews on this place? They're on the mark...

Rp7HM8V2mPEZkmxW9-HRCw.text: Yum. Yum. Yum. Holy Yum.   One of my favorite places in Charlotte. I often save this place for when I would really like to splurge because I often want several things off the menu. The menu is HUGE!  We often find ourselves here for date night, birthdays, or when I have out of town guests because there is something for everyone.  My favorite thing to start with is the Crab Rangoon dip. So good!  Next is your hardest decision yet- burger or sushi? Both are amazing here, which is difficult to pull off and Cowfish has done just that.  If you can't decide go with a bento box. It has edamame, cucumbers, a burger slider, and a sushi roll. Just enough food for one person and not too much food to where they have to roll you outside. They also have burgushi (a fusion of a burger and sushi). I've never had this, but I have had a family member have some and they were very satisfied.  You will be satisfied with any burger, really. And any sushi roll. Have at it.   The place has great cocktails, craft beer, and even spiked milkshakes, so you will not be disappointed with drinks. I have had one of the spiked shakes and they are delish.   Lastly, get the s'mores milkshake. Just do it. It is incredible. I never spend the money on dessert, but it's so worth it and I get it every time I am here. Just a tip: they are one of the few places to still do free dessert on someone's birthday, so this is why we often find ourselves here on birthdays b/c they will sing and bring the birthday person cake.   There is almost always a wait, so plan ahead for this, but it is worth it. The earlier you go the better usually.  It isn't terribly expensive, but I often spend $50- $75 after you get drinks, appetizer, food, and dessert. This is why this is often a splurge for me, but so worth it.   This is the only place in the world that can get shut down for Norovirus and people are ready to bang down the doors the second the professional cleaning is over and they are back in business b/c the food is seriously amazing lol. Way to go.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy tuna, dragon roll, mushroom roll

rwTkoUdrFGPteVcARvqcDg.text: First trip to Charlottes. All of our dishes were great. A few vegetarian options. Onions rings were best I have ever had.  Burger-Sushi Fusion - it works.

FNH488EkXlPDAq104RmLjw.text: Love this place. I fancy the patio. Fans and a great view. The food is delicious. Sushi is bountiful as are the burgers. Take your time and share a dish with friends because its a lot of food.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kimchi Chicken

KJAuwOwoHqZuUo0GkHc9Ww.text: Cowfish never disappoints.  Went here today with 12 coworkers to celebrate my new job.  We were seated immediately and service was remarkable. The food was delicious as always. I'll certainly be back

5sBOq30GDoVJ6A5XCxyo1w.text: Never been to a more diverse restaurant! This place was awesome and a new experience for me. I went with the bento box just to experience a few different things and nothing disappointed. Will def be back.

BMuUZfgwDtqaiCfHjFWlyw.text: Absolutely loved Cowfish. Family thought I was crazy as I raved about the fries. They were just the way I like my fries; perfectly seasoned, hot and crispy on the outside while soft on the inside. And the "burgushi" was also sooo good. I had the Nature Boys woohoo - with bison, jalapenos, feta and green tomatoes. The flavors meld well together and it just works. Cowfish had been on the list for awhile to try and I'm glad I finally got over the 40 minute trek to try it. You won't regret it!

xIo1h1zThk_6v40y74wR-Q.text: Enjoyed the veggie burger, my fiance loved the dynamic duo burger! Fries were delicious! Will definitely go back and try sushi next time!

W3tXco9kr9qIzc1mLpOOTg.text: It's a novelty place and fun with a group.  Visitors love it. Would I come here otherwise?  Nope because I know better places to get burgers and better places to get sushi.  But hey, even I have to admit the little bento box with a mini-burger and sushi is pretty darn cute.

U7Y6jJlVfxFwhooW9cysCw.text: Sushi will never be the same again... This place is always packed so get here early or come at an "off" time. Great sushi - cool culture/environment. Funky burgers and tantalizing toppings that will almost require a stomach pump. A "Must try" in South Charlotte.

gWmjR8dO0x4fHxxtnc7bIw.text: We visit every time we come to Charlotte NC.   Love the Kings Row and Aui Tuna

SgpUrsOdImrrlbjhP7k7dw.text: This is an update to my previous review from 6/13/2011 - It's only fair to point out the Cowfish had a representative contact me after my previous experience to apologize and recover my business.  I was impressed with their sincerity and effort.  Furthermore, I've been back since this review, along with many friends, and the experiences have been great.

FczxdJ8GhOnUC1rYQNx_7Q.text: CowFish is just amazing all around. Food and atmosphere are simply perfect and the drinks are typically what you would expect $3+. You really can't go wrong with both the sushi and the burgers, so just take your pick. We usually get the bento(has sushi and mini burger) box to get a mix of both and the sides are refreshing as well. Definitely a must go to if your in the Southpark area!

z2wqsfLhBJ-MPaDkyWG6sw.text: We visited for my daughter's 12th birthday as we wanted something different. Both of my children  (8 and 12) loved the restaurant. There was a reviewer who rated her experience 2 stars and as part of the review claim the restaurant isn't for children under 10 due to it not being the "appeaseable scene". I'm not sure what this means. It really depends on the behavior of the child, as no two children will behave the same.Restaurant itself is dark. Almost too dark to read the menu. The noise level is pretty loud so children fit right in. There is a bar that goes along the length of the restaurant but I'm not sure If this means it's not adequate for children. There is a really neat kids menu including a bento box that my children loved. My daughter actually was not a sushi eater prior to our visit. She refused to try it. She had an appetizer with us and loved it. They both had shakes which were awesome. This to me indicates the restaurant is geared towards family style dining.Restaurant is pricey in my opinion and isn't something we will do all the time but it was a nice change and the food and service was great. Wait for a table was long, come early as our wait was close to an hour. We will definitely visit again.

76181E1nFew_2XiSXbDyTw.text: The service here is always atrocious.  The food has, over time, become quite mediocre and they regularly botch your order now. It's very noisy, and you will wait for at least an hour, even on weeknights. I ordered vegetarian rolls once and was served a roll with crab. A co diner sent something prepared incorrectly back, and they used the same piece of grilled tuna to remake the plate and brought it back cold. I have had it take so long to get drinks that all the ice had melted and watered it down by the time it got to the table. Best for lunch and if you sit at the bar.

nL7BdLkGuZgYz33Y95FmxA.text: I live @TheResidence so happily found The Cowfish after relocating from Miami Beach in January. The menu, ambiance, and staff rock! I know the wait is long but there is always take-out. The truffle fries are a game changer. Good luck in Orlando -- SouthBeach needs you.

mgdokqbxDJPXvQyu4P7znw.text: Avoid unless you just want to hang out. Def not a 'good' dinner place

HOR-TyMVUYc6Gpkwo8bxYQ.text: Burgers were amazing as usual. The Lamborgushi roll is fantastic. Excellent service. Get their early because they fill up fast.

EGJGNBM7cw9xywaSioKPGA.text: You can tell the owners put a lot of thought on their food, and presentation. I loved the wall decors!

DeO6zqwE8bEcqLZ2QFet1Q.text: Everything about this place is great other than the wait! It's almost always packed, even at weird times, but the food is unbelievable. They put in interesting twist on sushi as even those that don't like raw fish will enjoy with different types of beef and other ingredients used. They also have a make your own roll where you can put almost anything you want in it and not pay too terribly much for it. All around great place to eat!

tizkBhE_MTAomOXjQMMWKw.text: I split the firecracker sushi roll  ($15) and Hunka Hunka Burnin' Love burger (single patty) ($11). The burger came with fried pickles with a great, crunchy batter. The cowfish sauce is like Big Mac sauce, but with a mustard base instead of ketchup. I got there early on a Friday night and was seated early waiting for friends. The waitress didn't come by very often and check on us, and we waited quite a while to get the bill and our change back. Oh well.. very clean and the food was excellent. I personally wouldn't wait more than an hour but it's probably worth it.

WS6uZMrBw48hrW0LW10IFQ.text: 6 of us were in town for a business event, we travel a HUGE amount and all agreed this has been one of the most memorable places all year so far.  We all shared what we ordered so each could see just how good it really was. The Blackened Ahi Nachos were incredible! We were going to order a second plate, but then the real food came.   I ordered The Green Monster Berger- Best. Berger. EVER! Coworker doubted me until I let him try it. I had so much of everyones appatizers, I could not finish the burger. When the server came to take the plate, my coworker about jumped on the plate for my remaining bite.   Several had sushi and one person even made her own sushi roll...nobody was even remotely disappointed.   Once we were stuffed to the gills, the server suggested a desert- of course we had to try the Spiked Milk Shakes...4 of them so we passed each one around the table (seperate straws for each person)  this will be a destination for every visit I make to the area...no question

dfjKxww9hnWdqhIrUo-82A.text: The burgers are better than the sushi. Had the pork BBQ roll...it was interesting and tasty but wouldn't get it again. Bison burger is nom worthy. Turkey burger is nice too. Only ever had the sweet potato fries as a side, they don't disappoint. Prettily solid place near the mall, generally a wait for a table but worth it

RLCPnCDqdsWDlJiOS6mmeg.text: Very Cool Place. Nice Vibe and ambience.Sushi and other stuff. Funky ,good food,and usually a joy. My last visit the food was not as up to par as usual. But I will chalk it up to an off day! It is my go to joint of choice!

4PkBhe4UouwIfX4sbzR59g.text: The best food and huge portions. We even had a horrible server and the manager corrected it by sending us a gift card and apologizing. Always a very cool atmosphere.

hwET1SAPjMawFiORcDyJdQ.text: Sushi was great, service was quick. The... burgushi was not that great.  My friend didn't finish her burger, but said it was ok.

TDJSdaFAuR5eGk3ume93sg.text: This is a restaurant that flaunts its stuff in the face of convention. Its menu is a mile long and paved with flavorful pabulum. It's like an enormous treasure map covered with X's. And the real secret behind the goodness? The wait. Something about standing around for an hour waiting to be seated makes the food taste twice as good. So don't be bitter about the line; it's there for good reason.  Cowfish is the perfect "couples" restaurant. It's not particularly romantic - the constant stream of people coming and going prevents an intimate ambiance - but burgers for him and sushi for her? Sheer brilliance. At $25-$40 for two (closer to $40 with drinks), it wouldn't threaten to cut too big a hole in your wallet if it wasn't so addicting.  Like I said, the menu is big, but you find your niche by the second or third trip. My niche is the burger menu, and my go-to is the most counter-intuitive meal on a menu filled with bizarre creations: the "Hunka, Hunka Burnin' Love." This Elvis-inspired burger features two half-pound beef patties (though I tend to request just one), two slices of applewood-smoked bacon, fried banana, and a big gob of peanut butter nestled in a sweet Hawaiian roll. My friends tend to cringe when I tell them about it, but trust me, one bite and you'll be saying, "Thank you very much." Here's a tip: substitute one of Cowfish's home-ground, Chipotle-seasoned bison patties for the beef. It'll cost you $4 more, but the Chipotle adds a nice, spicy kick to offset the semi-sweet peanut butter/banana combo. Burgers come with a generous side item, and Cowfish has some of the most savory sweet potato fries around. It'll take several trips to fully explore the burger menu, but after doing some extensive exploration myself, I'm sticking with the Hunka.  Since there are literally hundreds, if not thousands, of sushi rolls to choose from, I'll go ahead and and mention my fiancee's favorite. **Disclaimer: she is a bit of a health nut.** She goes straight for the "Build-Your-Own Sushi" option, selecting seaweed and brown rice wrapped around generous portions of Ahi tuna, mango, and avocado. I don't care much for sushi, but I dig that roll. From time to time she'll order a Bento Box, which features a mini-burger of the week, and if we're really hungry, we might order the "Avocado & Ahi Tuna-Tini" or the "Blackened Ahi Tuna Nachos" for a starter. **Second disclaimer: we like tuna.** Their spiked shakes are indulgent, but be wise about dessert. Chances are, you'll already be full.  Lastly, I would be remiss not to mention the bathrooms. As soon as you walk in, you'll hear a series of voices overhead. First, you will hear someone say something in proper English. Then, you will hear the phrase repeated in Indonesian. Finally, you will hear the phrase re-told in redneck dialect. You'll walk in and wonder what on earth is going on, then you'll walk out saying things like, "Jim Bob's more nervous than a cat in a room with a room full of rocking chairs!"  There may be restaurants in Charlotte with more privacy and less wait time, but there are no other restaurants quite like Cowfish. I give it five stars and a hug and a kiss.

hmmlpXNF8zN2d401VGlxMA.text: Burgers! Sushi!! What a genius idea!!! I've been wanting to go to this place to see what all the hype was about but really who doesn't get excited about burgers & sushi IN THE SAME PLACE!! I finally convinced my wife to go here instead of her all time favorite, Pinky's (also a good spot!) but we've been there only a hundred times lol. We started out with a Skinny Gonzales to drink which was tasty and surprisingly stronger than expected. Then we had the lobster & crab spring rolls for an app, definitely a must try! I don't remember tasting much lobster but I did demolish it. I was hungry and the flavor was impeccable! We decided to get Bento boxes so we could try out a little bit of everything and switched up on the sides a bit as well as the burger because I don't eat beef. So with that being said I had a mini chicken sandwich (screamin korean chicken), truffle fries (no bacon), Dion's OMG! Roll, and thai cucumbers a sh*t ton of food and I have no complaints! Everything was great!! Servers were also very helpful being that I'm the most indecisive person alive. I gave then 4 stars because we ended up paying $88 for two drinks, one app, and two bento boxes... that was a little steep for the type of restaurant this is if you ask me. I would definitely give them a try if you've never been though! Although your pockets may suffer, you won't be disappointed with the taste!

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

O7RLw9WctoIgM_B3E7Wyew.text: There are only a handful of moments in my life that I can look back and say without question "I experienced greatness". A trip to cowfish is almost always one of those moments.  I can say without a doubt that this is my favorite restaurant of all time.   The service is always top notch. They know their stuff and my drink is always full. I'm never left asking "Where did they go?" If something goes wrong (and it rarely does),  they make it right. The management makes their presence known and they seem to support their staff well. I can tell real training and effort goes into the hospitality of this wonderful place.  There are so many things to pick from on their menu but here are my personal favorites:  For appetizers on the regular menu, it's a three way tie for the crab rangoon, the parmesan truffle fries, and blackened tuna nachos. The parmesan truffle fries work really well if you have a large party. The fries come out in what looks like a mixing bowl, they're tastefully covered in a delicious white cheese and have just enough luxurious truffle flavor. Their crab rangoon is like a deconstructed version. What would normally be the filling is served as dip and the wontons are fried and treated like chips. There's a hint of heat and sweetness dressing the chips and when you combine that with the crab, it is heaven. The blackened tuna nachos is what you order if you want to impress someone. The appearance alone is an artistic statement. Underneath a little bit of greenery, the tuna is seared beautifully. The large bites of fish rest in top of creamy avocado and crab rangoon.  A special mention goes to the Head Chef Rafali's special hamachi tasting plate for being the most gorgeous thing that I've eaten. It was a beautiful mix of sweet, tangy, and umami. A True masterpiece visually and on my pallet as well.   One of my favorite entrees is not on the Charlotte Cowfish's regular menu anymore. That is The King's Roll. I would say I'm sad but I can still order it. It is tuna, kani, jalapeno, and cream cheese roll flash fried in panko then topped with a loose Kani, masago, and sriracha salad. Dip it in ponzu and soar. My favorite still listed item is The Prime Time fillet lobster roll. So if you can't decide whether you want a lobster roll or filet mignon, you can skip comprising and get both with this bad boy. It comes with the best portobello mushrooms on top. Looking for a non sushi option? Try the chipotle bison burger, just don't be one of those monsters who orders it well done. Medium well is as high as you should go with this one.  Dessert. Eat the moose is loose. If you can't eat it, get one to go. If you can't get it to go, give it to me. The tall chocolate cake/brownie with layers of mousse is delightful and fun. It's a good way to finish an already spectacular evening.  Cowfish is the best and most consistently spectacular restaurant that I've eaten at. I think back to all of my visits over the years and I can't think of a single time where I left feeling disappointed.   Cowfish is a treasure and I look forward to continuing to share this place with my friends and family for years to come.

HRkc01fm12LC-OYjajr3zg.text: This wasn't my first time here but Thursday's customer service experience was worth a review.  We dropped in for a quick dinner and the waitress was extremely helpful.  She made a few suggestions that enhanced the meal as she was attentive without being bothersome.  I wish I could recall her name!    We had a sushi meal with a massive dessert and it was well worth the calories!

bqhtPGywyXXxpY0HIeVTOw.text: Cowfish was so good.  One of the best spots I've been to in Charlotte.  My wife had a burger, I can't remember which one.  IT was perfectly cooked and delicious.  I had the bento box with Sashimi.  The burger special was southwestern themed.  I enjoyed the burger and the sushi, but the cucumber salad was one of the best salads I've ever had.  Can't wait to return.

XYQtYo0HhPcgvU0QJ4Cevw.text: Cowfish is a place that I bring people who are not from Charlotte. It has something for everyone. Sushi and burgers!! One of the few places that has this combination and both are really good.   I recommend getting the bento box so you can get both and you get three sides. It is a lot of food and you get to try a little of everything.   Their atmosphere is very nice and has a ton of great art work on the walls. The restaurant has an indoor and outdoor area.   The parking here can be a bit hard to fine. Worst case scenario you park near Dillard's and walk over though.

6_v3nwk_PzNsQFp0FSHMkw.text: Been trying to talk my wife into coming here for years and now she loves it.  Had to drive into Charlotte today to go to Walkers Drug Store and pick up eye drops for my upcoming cataract surgery. While we were here, decided on lunch and she let me pick the place so I picked Cowfish.  After we got there, she enjoyed the rather eclectic decor.  Very light on bright with a whimsical atmosphere.  I mean where else would you see an Apple logo made over into a burger.  Menu is rather extensive and varied.  Long list of custom burgers, equally long list of Sushi and a trove of Asian Fusion  Specialties.  My wife loves Spring Rolls so she chose the Lobster and Crab Spring Roll off of the Appetizer menu and paired it with Sweet Potato Fries as well as a Martini since I was driving.  I was going to go with a Mushroom Burger till she suggested one of the Bento Boxes.  Here was a chance to try multiple items across several different cuisines.  It ordered The Cowfish Bento Box which started with a mini Cheeseburger, 4 Pieces of Sushi ( I chose the Philly which is Salmon), Sweet and Spicy Thai Cucumbers, Edamame and Sweet Potato Fries.  My wife enjoyed the Lobster and Crab Spring Rolls although there were a little rich for her taste. I was surprised that she ordered that since she is not a big lobster fan.  She did however dive into the Sweet Potato Fries which is one of her favorites.  For my Bento Box, the Mini- Cheeseburger was very good and was a great way to start off the meal. Each piece of the Philly Sushi topped with a dab of Wasabe  was excellent.  The Sweet and Spicy Thai Cucumbers were interesting. Was not sure of first bit rather or not I was going to like them but by the time I finished, I loved the texture and contrasts in colors. The Edamame did not do much for me since most that I have eaten were very tender and these were hard.  Sweet Potato Fries and my wife's favorite and not mine but still they were good and by this point, I was getting full.    Portion sizes are huge.  Servers are very good and very attentive. We never lacked for anything from the time we walked in and were seated till we left.  Will be back

URtVouwGiADiIo983ZASQg.text: This place was great for me and my husband! He's a burger and fry guy and I love sushi, so this place was the best of both worlds for us. The burger and sushi were both really good. They also have "burgushi" - a burger/sushi roll - we didn't try it but definitely plan to if we get the chance to eat here again.   We went early in the lunch hour on a Friday afternoon and there was plenty of seating available. The service was good, which added to the positive experience. Our appetizer order got messed up and didn't come out before our meal, but the manager came to our table to explain and handled the situation very well.  Overall we were very pleased with the experience and would highly recommend this restaurant.

Our waitress was changed and service picked up quickly. However, what's memorable here is the imaginative food combinations and presentation. We got the crab and lobster egg roll, sushi, and bison rolls. Yummy! We can't wait to come back and try more!

It was so fun and the best combo of great sushi, burgers, fries, milkshakes. I mean, what more do you need?! Our table had almost something from the whole menu and everyone loved it. We will for sure be back.

A6AejuM4nilQQlbNbQPyWA.text: So now that I'm doing a keto diet (lost three pounds the first week over Thanksgiving!), we ended up back at Cowfish and here's me looking for low-carb options. Well, Cowfish accommodates and in spades!  I chose the Cobb salad with blue cheese. It was massive. You know how so many salads are more lettuce than "stuff"? That was not the case here. I was eating chicken and cheese and blue cheese and olives and bacon and cucumber and avocado all throughout this salad. And with this much food, I ended up only able to eat half of it. Just an impressive meal here.  My daughter, also doing keto, went with the Hamandegger Burger, hold the bun. A huge patty with plenty of cheese and two large pieces of crunchy bacon. Lettuce and onions and again, huge. She also subbed out the fries and got a seaweed salad instead. Delish!  Great keto-friendly options here at Cowfish and I'm so pleased that we headed back here.  [Review 10080 overall, 1666 of 2018.]

FrsR7f-4m7_20qw70QUo6g.text: I was pretty excited to try this place, having heard about it in the radio and word-of-mouth. Also seeing that it was a 4-star yelp review, but unbiased - I came to make my own opinion.  Location: tough parking curb-side, but there is a deck and a short walk to it.  Ambiance: Pretty trendy, they got fun pop-art posters with a twist, full wrap around bar and tables. A little noisy in the front, but the back tables are casual  Food: It's a place to get your american grub - burgers, and your japanese staple - sushi at once. For that I always get the Burgoushi. Which is a Bento box that comes with half of a selection of specialty rolls and a slider version of their burger. The menu states it's only the burger of the week, but you can pretty much chose any burger, if you ask nicely. It also says they serve it with sweet potato fries, but I always ask for regular. The seasoning is quite tasty. Thai cucumbers and edamame are also included  As for the half-roll I always chose between the Mark and the Firecracker.  For the burger my top pics are the Texas Longhorn, the Shroomin Swiss or the Black truffle cheeseburger.   Appetizer: I never get around ordering the Crab Rangoon dip. chips are crispy, dip is creamy. Party next to us had spring rolls, they were huge and looked and smelled good too. Maybe next time!  Drinks: Bamboozeled shakes. No sleep till brooklyn is the best. One word: KALUAH!  Even though these recommendations are my favorite, I do not want to say that they are they best out there. If you want a good burger, i've had better fusion or non-fusion at burger places. If you want sushi, there are other sushi places in town.  But they definitely have their leg up if you want both, or some of your people in your party don't want sushi, but want to hang out while you still get your sushi fix.

REQlbj9XJsxN1BNbWDN4KA.text: This place never disappoints!  Although service is often slow it's always worth the wait.

V1hYRxsyhN6FEXuSi5CnRw.text: Updated--We had a wonderful dinner here with kids and sushi!!  I had the Deliverance roll--pork bbq flash fried in rice and seaweed and topped with onions, bbq sauce and fried potatoes like shoestrings but thinner like toothpicks! Amazing flavors of southern bbq and savory pork! It's called burgushi--truly unique and delicious!! I love it and order it every time!! My husband had the bento box special of burger slider and California roll with edamame and fries.  The kid's menu was awesome for my friend's selective eaters--Chicken fingers and mac and cheese.  Kids had a blast!  Tip---definitely make a reservation. You can do the cowfish app and put your name on the list when you're within a few miles of the restaurant.  Great service and delicious sushi and burgushi!!

82YlCNKsddp2EIFdEgPaoQ.text: I'm not gonna lie, we really wanted to love this place but we were pretty disappointed. The location is great, especially if you sit outside. Ambiance inside is also beautiful. Service was also wonderful. We were a bit disappointed in the food though.   We ordered the fried calamari which was pretty good. We ordered the "Mother Load" because we didnt want a huge meal, but wanted a "sampling if some of our favorite selections" including the "chefs selection of premium sashimi." The sashimi was the most disappointing. The "premium selection" happened to include shrimp and octopus. I'm sorry, but that is neither sashimi or premium. Poke was good, and the Boss Roll was decent, but honestly if no one told us we were eating filet mignon, we would have no clue.   I did enjoy my saki flight though!  For us, the price and menu description did NOT match the value of the food.

lKPvhgsoYRYJNl9UT3eRww.text: Being a vegetarian, I'm always on the lookout for good vegetarian burgers. The heavenly veggie was honestly the best one I've ever had. It tasted so fresh and I liked how they included a variety of vegetables including edamame. Will definitely be coming back for this burger! I loved the overall atmosphere in the restaurant, and it's a great weekend lunch spot. There can be a bit of a wait time, but you can add yourself to the waitlist if you are within a 10 mile radius, which is super helpful.

qNMuY5F3-Fhr6DSnQ3SJrg.text: Been to Cowfish many times in the past and really enjoy it.  I live in the north part of town but try to catch a meal here when we are close.  I really like the concept as if you want Asian/sushi you can get that but if you want a good quality burger, you can have that also.    I have tried many of the dishes that they offer.   The sushi is really fresh and the portions are insane.  The burgers are good and the lamb burger is my favorite.  But they have one item that I love and it is the Gobble Gobble Ooshi.  Basically think thanksgiving dinner in a sushi roll.   It is heavenly.  The only drawback is that it is only available during the month of November (through thanksgiving).    Service is good as they always are attentive and make sure that you don't want for anything.    This is a great place
