BxofD3V39oKt4pqMFNLzxA.text: Updating to five stars. Can't go wrong with a bento box! Pay a little more for the specialty box, because those rolls are delicious.

YbcnMIchLcEsT2pZS3LV1Q.text: Have you ever had Pulled Pork "Sushi".  It's A M A Z I N G This was for all meat or fish lovers, hence the name "Cow"-"fish". My family of 7 went, some liked meat and hated fish, but some loved fish! This was a place for everyone. Other dishes on the table, but not pictured was the crab rangoon dip, cheeseburger sushi and edamame. Everything was delicious and you can definitely expect us back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork sushi!!

5Dx2-ZjuUB6YuohTD6KI2A.text: Sliders were delicious, the sushi very good, the teas yummy, though a bit expensive. The kids meal was healthy and generous. We'll definitely be back.

Xl9tjMcvvMw6GC_hXdDDXA.text: Great service! Cool menu! Cold beer! Sushi was better than average but not worth the price. Try it once.

iidDsp3faIfF3tvQB1CUVg.text: Awesome food!  Great kids meals, and the veggie burger is amazing!

gvrY9LfcGG1heXDdcQbAOw.text: This place is amazing!!! Great concept and the food is out of the world. Not to pricey and you get a lot for your money. Try to make a reservation because it gets busy. Nice selection of alcoholic beverages!!! Definitely a place everyone should try!!!

G8cQ99gkMBCrk9QS07gy6w.text: I have visited Cowfish a few times and sushi is OK and Burgers leave much to be desired. The incredibly long wait time for dinner makes this a less than desirable experience

SXWBuP2Xb0jaPWIA2uZaXQ.text: I love this restaurant! So many different options of great food, and the sushi is the best I've ever had at any restaurant!! Great location, service , and food!!

c7vHtirHCrGAUHHpzXCdSQ.text: We had a great lunch at Cowfish on our visit to Charlotte. Although we had to wait an hour, there was enough in the area to keep us occupied and the hostesses were willing to text us rather than carry around one of those buzzers. Once we were seated the server was quick and friendly. The menu is huge, but we quickly decided on a few items. My boyfriend got the seared tuna BLT and I had a mix box with a sushi roll and a burger. We also ordered the fried pickle appetizer -- so good! We'll definitely be back next time we're in town.

hSIrn1sBb7TSMYNSqnm0lA.text: Awesome....the first stop for great sushi and the burgers are very good too....service was top notch too! Ask for benjamin ...awesome service

pFTGhwm5T71MCGqaqdoU5A.text: We went to Cowfish at 6:00 on Sunday night.  We were greeted at the door and were informed that the wait was between 30 minutes and an hour.  This seemed a little odd for a Sunday evening.  After we placed our name on the list, we made our way to the fountain to pass the time.  The first thing we noticed was the patio had many open tables.  It looked like they were short staffed that night.  We ended up waiting for 45 minutes for our table and were seated on the patio at a table that was open for our entire wait!  Our server was helpful and courteous and summarized the long menu for us.  Overall the food was fine.  Cowfish will not be at the top of my list when dining in the SouthPark area.

Ugt-6pnu_m6rLhSVJ-x3hg.text: The sushi hear is pretty good....not the best....but the service makes up or that. I recommend the ahi-tuna-tina served with avocado in a martini glass. That and the Crab Rangoon dip make a great appetizer. Try the Neon Deon or a twist on your usual crunchy roll. It is a coconut shrimp with Cajun spice roll. For a raw roll the Tropical Storm is yummy. It has three layers of assorted fish with masago on top. Also, our food came out fast which is always a plus!

dndlm0vv0s4kJaVYa87Wrw.text: I will never go back to Cowfish based on my experience, and I wasn't even able to try the food. My friend and I were looking for a great patio restaurant to enjoy the warm spring weather. I arrived first and was greeted at the hostess stand with an instant "we're on a forty-five min to an hour wait". Well, ok, I guess I'll just have a seat at the bar and wait. My friend had not arrived yet, so I people watched a bit and noticed that not only were there few guests waiting for tables and an empty bar, but there was also a fairly empty restaurant. The bartender explained that the waitlist was so the kitchen didn't get overwhelmed. So you're going to make me sit in your lobby- not spending money and possibly losing guests, because you don't want me to sit at a table- spending money and possibly very happily waiting with a drink and a spring breeze so the kitchen can keep up? I have worked in the service and hospitality industry for 15 years, I understand how wait times and staffing works, but an hour wait when I can count 20 people in the lobby/bar area and over 10 open tables? My friend arrived about 20 minutes into my wait-time and asked if I had remembered to request the patio. I had not, so he went to the hostess stand to amend our reservation and inquire about the long wait in an empty restaurant. He asked if the wait list applied to the patio and was told that they don't take reservations for the patio. Ok..So we just seat ourselves? Please remove us from the waitlist then, we'll go sit on the patio. We were handed menus in response so we walked back and found a nice table in the shade. We also found a patio of about fifteen tables with only the back section nearest the restaurant seated, the rest empty. Again, we questioned the hour long wait time with so many empty tables. Our server was very sweet and greeted us instantly, taking our drink order. We were then greeted by a gentleman manager who explained that we would have to be moved because he needed our table for a large group. We looked at all the empty tables and asked where he would like us to move. He explained that we would actually be put back on the waitlist, because the patio was full. Ok.. Why is it full with so many empty tables available and an eager and obviously bored server who had greeted us instantly a moment ago? He explained that it was a staffing issue, new restaurant, still working out the kinks of staffing.. blah blah blah.. dinner is on me tonight for the inconvenience. Our server arrived with drinks in hand, confused about why the manager was speaking with us. She then offered to pick up a table, because she had another table about to close out and would be able to take care of us at one of the unstaffed tables nearby. We had no interest in a free dinner, we just wanted to sit somewhere and have dinner. We looked to the manager who brushed off the suggestion, then demanded who had seated us at that table in the first place, the hostesses knew that he had need to seat a large party there. We explained the conversation that we had had with the hostess at the front, and the manager exclaimed that his hostesses never would have said that we could seat ourselves and which one was it, because she's just lost her job. Seriously? Again, you're putting your staffing issues on the guest? Well, she did say it, and I don't think it's necessary for her to lose her job over it. We'll just go across the street to Upstream if you need us to wait any longer. The server again suggested that we would be fine at the table next door, but the manager at this point seemed so focused on being right and disciplining his staff that he ignored her suggestion and we started walking to the exit. By the time we had gathered our things and reached the door, the manager and hostess in question approached, with the hostess in full denial (not to blame her, as the manager had already threatened her job). The manager then called us liars who had seated ourselves. Yes, we already told you we seated ourselves, but how do you think we got our menus? At this point, we were done arguing with this manager because it just seemed to us that he wanted to be right more than he wanted to make the situation amenable and display a little hospitality. Never again will I walk through those doors. I will not give my time and money to a place with exorbitant wait-times and ill-managed staff.

Q5r-FH_zX17MBXCb_zl8qg.text: ah, i remember the good ole days when i was able to walk in to the cowfish sans reservation and get seated in a reasonable amount of time.  if last thursday night is any indication, it looks like that kind of a lark won't be happening again soon.  when a joint demands weekday reservations, you know it's hit it big.  around the time the restaurant first opened in the space formally occupied by "the counter" and "the grape", i was somewhat concerned that a restaurant with this kind of concept would not catch on in an economy with high demands and sullen creativity.  in this instance, i'm more than happy to be wrong.  the combination of sushi and burgers isn't the first thing one thinks of when trying to make suggestions for dinner, but i've got to admit, it sure is memorable.  alas, i've also got to admit that the burgers are much better than the sushi.  after trying several different rolls and an assortment of burgers, i feel pretty confident in saying that nikko on south boulevard still retains the queen city sushi crown.  the fish on the caterpillar roll at the cowfish was not as fresh as it could have been, the nigiri was just okay, and my moriawase double deuce (sushi combination platter) did not compete well with my husband's boursin burger.  it's not that the sushi sucked - it's just that the burgers stood out more.  the only exception to that rule appears to be the make-your-own-sushi roll.  my veganish friends fell in love with their own vegetable concoction that was surprisingly awesome, if i do say so myself.  the sweet potato fries rocked, and i fell completely for the blackened ahi tuna nachos . . . even as i write those words, my mind drifts into a momentary recollection of their avocado-laced deliciousness.  i'm convinced that the individual who first paired tuna with avocado must now be a chef in the kitchen upstairs.  in terms of burgers, i've really enjoyed the aforementioned boursin burger, loved the cbclt, and thought the mediterranean lamb burger was fabulous.  the vibe is solidly modern at the cowfish, if a bit quirky.  i think the owners thought they needed to embrace as much odd as possible in a joint with such a unique concept.  visit the w.c. and hear the strangest malarkey in an array of languages . . . making you tilt your head and think "wtf?".  honestly, i thought it was just as charming as the cute rendition of "guernica" arranged on a bloodred wall (complete with the requisite "cowfish").  save for one occasion at the beginning where it took an absolutely ridiculous amount of time to receive our food, the service has been very solid.  on that occasion in question, i will say that one of the owners came to our table to personally apologize for the delay.  i always wonder why it is that other owners/managers don't showcase the same level of concern - it absolutely makes a world of difference.  hell, we went back (with ten other people) . . .  . . . and we will definitely go again.

IWwYLpGaVM2MrcdBUgqpQA.text: ive spent a lot of time in charlotte. this is the best restaurant in the city hands down.

xUJHlwYVUSGJNwMYavxmdQ.text: Great food, great drinks, great atmosphere. The outdoor couches made the long wait a pleasurable experience.

K-PD-jW4fw7iKLU0Q9oOEA.text: I would have given this restaurant 4 stars for food, but the wait was so long, and the service was so bad I could only give it 3 (at best)  I went with 3 other people, two of whom would probably not even give 2 stars.  I had the Bento Box, as did one of my friends...the food was good, not amazing.  My other two friends ordered a variety of things off the copius menu...it too 3 tries before our server got their order right,  In the meantime, 2 of us were done eating.  There was no attempt to offer a free dessert, comp the appetizer, or even offer a free beverage for the trouble. We will not be going back.  PS: Parking can be a real problem in that area...compound that with the long wait (no reservations) and it's truly not worth it!

AbycyzZ2rcRapDyu0g_5Pw.text: Great service, Great food! I love fish but my fiance does not, so this place was great.

k0wGWWm5F9qYqn7lKAE5Zg.text: We decided to visit Cowfish for a special occasion on a Sunday afternoon, after some very strong recommendations, about 1PM. The wait was to be about 30 minutes and we were notified the table was ready about 20 minutes later. After we were seated, the waitress visited the table promptly and took our drink orders. The noise level in the area we were seated was very, very loud, significantly distracting from our enjoyment. The waitress came back a few minutes later and took our food orders. This is when things really broke down. A full 35 minutes later, after not seeing her for quite a while, we flagged down the waitress to ask about our order. After saying it would be a few minutes, she turned and quickly left. Almost 10 minutes later, our food arrived. Cold. With a comment that there were too many people in the restaurant! The food was OK and could well have been very good if it was served properly heated.  There was little concern for either the wait or the cold food. When the place is jammed with a long wait, it appears they really don't have to care and clearly didn't. Could be just the place for you, not for us. Just a warning....

H31nib3kyTISVzgjahQLAQ.text: This was a very cool unique place! Awesome service and delicious food. We had the ahi tuna appetizer which was so-so. I have had better ahi at Outback. I had build your own sushi which was great for the price. A friend got one of  the boxes which has the burger of the week and a choice of three types of sushi. She loved hers, also. We also tried one of their milkshakes... YUM. It's hard to mess up a milkshake though. Overall: great atmosphere, unique choices. Would definitely go back.

oUC5wVevU62w6KNF6v3Hlw.text: Incredible. Astoundingly good. Amazing in every way. I really wanted to dislike this place, because how can any restaurant in CLT be worth a two hour wait? But it is...it really is. We went on a Wednesday (after refusing to wait 2 hours on a Saturday), and it was 1/2 price bottle of wine night. Oh my. Good wines, at half price, Im in. For dinner, I had the Boursin Burger, which was so good I literally could not eat it fast enough. Best burger ever. Really. My husband had sushi, and he is a sushi novice, so he cant compare it to much, but he really liked it. We skipped dessert (I drank my dessert, did I mention bottles were half price) but desserts going to other tables looked good. If your curious about this place, try it, you wont be disappointed. The food is worth whatever wait you encounter. Yea...the hostess was kinda bitchy and the crowd was your standard Southpark crew, but I rate places based on food. If you want the best damn food in CLT, head to Cowfish.

I8JuMNhuwUmUcCkzV8O90A.text: This place is simply AMAZING and one of my new favorite spots in town. The food is delicious and exquisite, plus having a huge selection to customized your sushi roll, for someone like myself or anyone that's trying sushi for the first time this place is the perfect place to go to. Cassandra was our waitress for the evening and her recommendations were literally on point, but also someone that truly went above and beyond to providing me a superb 1st time experience and guidance as well. From bringing me multiple choices of dipping sauces to even giving me some great and well executed tips to create my roll (pulled pork, ground beef, tomato, filet mignon and applewood bacon) she literally understood not only what I wanted but literally how I wanted my roll to taste. And, she recommended the blackened tuna nachos which are a must have! The texture is on point and it is simply juicy and extremely delicious, you will be doing yourself a disservice if you don't try this savory treat. Also, I enjoy the fact the manager (Chris) came to our table and spoke to me and my girlfriend abour our first time visiting the restaurant and about my first time experience eating sushi (my girlfriend has been to other sushi places and she couldn't stop raving about this place). Not only was I impressed but it shows a great commitment to delivering a superb experience to their customers and the quality of service they are trying to deliver and I hope it continues. Overall, hands down HIGHLY RECOMMENDABLE not just to those that are sushi lovers but also to those trying it for the first time as well. This place with everything that it has to offer won't let you down.

hkob1JzbApXvO0X51s3QJw.text: Popular place where everyone can find something they like on the menu.  I've been here many times and never realized I didn't review it. The concept is as odd as the name suggests. Cowfish...    You can get a bento box of sushi (really good) and your friend can be having a burger and milk shake.. it's great when you have friends who don't eat Sushi or don't want it and you are really craving some...  Everything is great quality, but be warned when I say it is POPULAR, I mean you will have to wait to be seated on key nights.. and at lunch time.. but it's worth it.  I find the parking situation for all the places in this center a bit annoying too, but it doesn't deter most people.

i-gCAZlDGdUHx2olzMI2jA.text: Who knew that burgers and sushi could come together in a way that makes you want more.  Awesome service.  The menu is gigantic and can overwhelm a first timer but our waiter offered outstanding suggestions that were all spot on.  The Boss roll was very good but I can't in good conscious call it a 5 star sushi place... the mix of the menu is what will keep me coming back here when I'm in town, but what makes this place great is how they mix the flavors.  Individually, the burgers and sushi would be good but not spectacular.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blacked tuna nachos

nQ-JhMcoDgEAN2sBrMdYjA.text: The food here was amazing!!! The wait was a little long (30-45 mins) for it being at lunchtime but it was completely worth the wait. I would come back here again in a minute & I've already started spreading the word. The service was wonderful. My only problem was deciding what to eat first when we got our plates.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The CowFish Bento Box

KBQ6SNyNJpMJDEUUiONJBw.text: Came to Cowfish for their infamous Rangoon Crab dip since a friend had been raving about it and it did not disappoint.  From the outside, Cowfish looks rather small, but there's also a huge patio on the side.  The vibe is an interesting fusion of American and Japanese tastes.   I got a kick out of hearing Japanese translations of American slang in the bathroom over the intercom.    For my entree, I had the "What's Shakin' Tuna Bacon Sandwich."  It had a really interesting "bun" made out of grilled spring roll wrappers filled with sushi rice and flatten into a square.  The "fusion" items may be a little too over-the-top and simple may be best.  Cowfish also offers make-your-own sushi rolls so you can completely customize everything.  My friend made a tuna roll with thai basil which turned out to be a really good and surprising combination.

5Qq183sJPdprdcvUCXph_g.text: burgers and sushi. weird combo, I know. but delicious. their sushi is good but there's lots of good sushi in Charlotte, so I stick to the fusion specialties here. the tuna bacon sandwich is he best. it's always cooked well and I love the rice and crab "buns." it can get a little loud inside but that's the norm around here. time it right if coming on the weekend or a Friday night. they're always busy!

513piXw2RnUL6XpHYLWWrg.text: This has to be one of my new favorite places EVER. Their sushi is to die for! I also had the fusion bacon burger which was incredibly unique and delicious. And their spring rolls were also out of this world! This place is the thing sushi dreams are made of!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spring rolls
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Not a great pic (I was too excited to eat), but this is the Mad-Mangocato Roll.
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy in my tummy!

wvibLQbZ22fraj36sgw90g.text: So I have heard so much about his place. Like every one swears by this place so I had to give it a shot. We sat at the bar and service was attentive but somehow slow, they were busy so we understood. After long review of the menu I decided on the surf & turf roll. Sounds delicious right?! False. It was dry and flavorless. I had to drench it in sriracha to numb my tastebuds because I was so hungry & refused to not eat a sushi roll so expensive. The worst part is the manager told us "it's not even that busy for a Saturday lunch" so you normally anticipate more people and now that you have less I still get shitty food & mediocre service. I gave 3 stars because my boyfriends food was alright and the ambience was appealing. But I still don't think I will be back.

feVD7114pOaKH_NHaewXKg.text: Well, what I read was all accurate: great food, service and fascinating food combinations!  I had the Surf and Turf Roll, which had filet on top of a lobster roll.  I was actually a little disappointed, but the portion was HUGE and the other roll I had (shrimp tempura) was fantastic.  I'll come back again and get some other craziness!

8mK_C6rlamK5KwGDbhlClg.text: Awesomeness between a brioche bun!  I was totally excited to try this place...with so many awesome reviews and pictures I was just knew I was going to fall in love! And this place did not disappoint!  We went on a Saturday afternoon, they had a small wait but offered immediate seating on the heated patio. We opted to sit out on the patio, and it was really nice! Very comfortable and warm, which was a pleasant surprise!  Our waitress greeted us immedietly, and gave us our menus. Those menus are ridicilous! I had no idea where to start....but when in doubt...start with a cold glass of beer! I selected the Purple Haze-which was light bodied with a hint of raspberry. It was very refreshing and delicious!   Now back to that awesome menu...I decided to try one of the amazing burgers. I chose the The Jalapeno Popper Show-Stopper- cool name right?? Well it's an even better burger!   This burger came loaded with jalapeno-infused cream cheese, jalapeno bacon and fried jalapenos. Served on a brioche bun with jalapeno citrus aioli, lettuce, tomato and fresh sliced jalapenos.   WOWsers!!! I chose to sub the beef patty with a veggie burger and that was an awesome desision! It was packed with several different beans, cranberries and delicious veggies! That jalepeno cream cheese was heavenly...and fried and fresh jalepenos together was a wonderful combination for the burger. It has a nice kick with each bite!  If you love a little bit of spicy this burger is for you!   There are TONS of sushi options and other burgers that I'm looking forward to trying...so I'm sure to be back very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Jalapeño Popper Show-Stopper...with a veggie burger
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Jalapeño Popper Show-Stopper burger

YYotgjb4ameVmlDM8BiWuw.text: The burger that I ordered was perfectly cooked!  Service was great and the patio was nice and breezy, even in 90 degree weather.  This is definitely one of my favorite burger joints!

hC5mevUOWvZNEkYcPT2jbQ.text: Good sushi restaurant, and a great place to go if you have someone in your party who won't eat sushi and prefers a standard American burger: unadventurous eaters can be happy here.  The music is too loud indoors for pleasant conversation, but that seems to be the standard these days no matter where you go.  The food is excellent; I love the make-your-own-roll sushi.  I am also extremely fond of the lobster spring roll appetizer, which is to die for.  The service has always been polite and reasonably swift.  That said, the ladies' room is EXTREMELY unpleasant-- it's clean, but while you're in there, a loud, jarring, mocking recording yells at you while you try to use the facilities.  I will definitely go back, but I won't use their restrooms except in the case of a dire emergency.

2eDTP1Uo2ZQvCw4B0EJfFA.text: The name is interesting in itself "Cowfish," as it hints that it serves both steak and seafood.  I was in Charlotte for business and my BF and I wanted to come here as it is the most reviewed restaurant in the city.  We specifically went for sushi, although they have tons of menu items to choose from.    The restaurant is very large with a full bar.  It's located next door to a mall and right off a busy street.  We dined on a Monday evening and was overwhelmed with the menu.  This place has everything from burgers to steaks to sandwiches to sushi, including their infamous "BurgSushi" creations which fuses burgers and sushi together.  They have sushi with burger meat inside, and they'll make a burger out of sushi ingredients.  However you can imagine to mix burgers and sushi, this place managed to do it.  We started off with an enormous serving of calamari which was pretty average.  The sweet chilli sauce was not a great dip to go with the calamari.  If the restaurant could get their hands on a chipotle aioli sauce, it would be game over.    I ordered the recommended Taste Explosion ($15) which is one of their BurgSushi items, made up of Angus ground beef, applewood bacon, jalapenos, spicy mayo inside, coated with tempura flakes. Topped with tomato and cheese, and drizzled with pesto.  It truly was a taste explosion. Something very different and unique, and delicious at the same time.  My boyfriend got a couple of "normal" sushi rolls which were also delicious.  I sipped on a China Blossom martini which was also delightful with the meal.  This was a wonderful place to grab dinner no matter what you're craving.  This is the perfect place for a group of people that have a wide range of palettes.  Unlike most sushi restaurants, if you don't like sushi, you're not just confined to a bento box which is great.  Definitely would come back again if I were to find myself back in Charlotte for work.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burgsushi and normal delicious rolls
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Huge order of calamari
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burgsushi &#34;taste explosion&#34;

7ngo-Fe3GijvlBofzOE5PA.text: This used to be a favorite place. It has decreased in quality while increasing in price. We got the fusion bento box and the edamame had no salt, the cucumbers were soggy as were the sweet potato fries. The burger was good it they included a miss moffit when I ordered a marks roll. It used to be packed crowded but it wasn't. Lost the novelty.

bqqf1GM7yFX-RO799Tr3fA.text: Thought the bison burger was good, but $16 seemed a little high.  Loved the kid's meal Bento boxes - that was the winner of our lunch time visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thundering Herd Bison burger
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kid&#39;s meal - so cute and tasty

klk3vhHj-TwsMOwYilpIKQ.text: Update: Management reached out to me in response to this review.  I did not have a bad experience at Cowfish, but I appreciate them following up with me and wanting to make sure their customers are happy.  Great customer service! ----------- I enjoy the Cowfish, this has been a frequent stop mostly on business travels or to take a client out to dinner.  I stopped in recently on a Thursday evening (early evening about 5pm). Service was friendly, I sat at the bar.  Food was ok but not as good as usual.  I got a little creative and ordered off the Burgushi menu, where I should have stuck with just sushi selections.  Had a mix of mini burgers and a spicy sushi roll.  I added some nigiri tuna which was quite good.  Overall I give the visit a B or B+.  Could be since I was there early they weren't quite in stride for dinner service.

YgTRvJuD8Y0icK0hnlJYPg.text: I was hesitant on posting this but I have to.  This place is very unique with the menu and a nice variety.  The waitress was very helpful with her recommendations and explaining the menu options.   The crab dip was decent but we could do without the overloaded sauce on the chips.  My husband had sushi which he liked and I had bourgoushi (not sure if I spelled it right).  It was different but nothing to write home about.  Basically pieces of a cheeseburger wrapped in a tater tot and cut like sushi (photo attached).  Here comes the issue... we ordered desert as it was my birthday celebration. The table next to us with about 5 ladies started to panic and packed all their things to rush out.  I asked one of the ladies what was going on and she said it was a mouse.  We were dining on the patio.  I don't eat with mice so I left as well and waited out front for my family.  I asked my husband to get the check and desert wrapped to go.  I told the hostesses up front and she laughed. She said "oh that's mr. Pickles and he lives back there.  There is nothing we can do about it. The manager knows."  What!?! You are ok with mice around your restaurant?  Will not be back.  Sorry.  The only thing the manager did was give us coupons to come back and get $5 off of $20 spend.  Thanks but no thanks. Any restaurant ok with mice near guests eating will not have my business.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

TtYhrw-VJI5GpwC3LmjuVA.text: I need a place like this at home. My girlfriend doesn't like sushi and I love it. We would be able to come here and she could get a burger and I could get some delicious sushi.  On a Saturday afternoon this place was packed. There was about a 20 minute wait when I arrived, but luckily there was a single seat at the bar that I was able to grab, skipping the line. I was greeted quickly by one of the bartenders and handed a menu. He grabbed me a glass of water while I hunted through the large list of drinks.  I landed on The Hershey Swiss spiked milkshake ($10). Its a chocolate shake with booze in it. What's not to like? It was delicious and a nice change from all the beer I had been drinking through the week.  The menu here is quite large. Take a great burger place that has tons of options and mix it with a sushi place that has a healthy choice of rolls, then add some specialties that make this restaurant unique and you can start to see how the menu can get long. Now we're not saying its like reading War and Peace just to get a meal here. The menu is organized and clear, you just might have to get the server over to help narrow down your choices.  I went with their "Burgushi" specialty and chose the What's Shakin' Tuna Bacon Sandwich with a side of their Thai Cucumbers ($14). The sandwich was a blackened seared rare Ahi tuna, sliced up and was topped with bacon, tomato salsa, jalapenos, and slaw. Their "bun" is cool. Its rice and kani (crab) wrapped in rice paper. Its then grilled to give it a texture like you would expect from a traditional bun.  The sandwich was great, though a little messy. The bacon gave the sandwich a nice crunchy texture to go against the soft tuna so you don't feel like you're eating a sandwich of mush. I didn't really get any flavour from the tomato salsa or slaw, but there was some nice heat on the back end from the jalapenos. The Thai cucumbers were excellent and had a nice spiciness to them.  For $30 including the tip this was a great weekend lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. What&#39;s Shakin&#39; Tuna Bacon Sandwich and Thai Cucumbers
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hershey Swiss spiked shake

MUj9dD0xeE49VAO3PAMKjg.text: Yeah, I'm a few years late to this party.  Try the "Cody Beef Sammich." It's a half-pound burger topped with jalapeno-bacon, bleu cheese, and truffle cheese on a toasted ciabatta bun." It's perfect.   This place is cool, they serve huge portions, and the service tonight was impeccable. Nadia killed it.  We enjoyed the crab rangoon dip the vanilla cake milkshake and Wifey had a Bento Box combo thing-a-ma-jigger (with a Burger slider, sushi, and 3 sides) that was amazeballs.  But that Cody Beef Sammich... I'm tellin' ya, it's what gourmet burgers dream about being when they grow up.  I mean, it's different and kitschy, but I probably wouldn't become a reg.   Hands down the most annoying birthday humiliation song thing ever, complete with, I shit you not, cowbells and a gong.  Whatintheeverlovingcraphellwasthatallabout?!?!  The wait was 30 min on a Friday night, not as bad as the reputation, so that was nice.  Jennifer is right, trendier-than-thou, and more than is necessary.    .

xuUxj3J79Rgl7VNMh8sYgg.text: This is a nice addition to the South Park area. Food was great and the service was good. It's a great place for groups and foodies. You can get a great burger or some delicious sushi all in one. I went in a Friday night. The place was packed and at 530 there was already an hour wait. The place seemed clean and the atmosphere was warm. Probably will return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento box
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey burger
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

V65PZlfOpZezO-4acSm6BA.text: First timer falls in love!! Sooo wasn't really sold on the idea of a burger and sushi place and the menu was a bit overwhelming. Kristen went over each section and we were able to make some great choices.   For an appetizer we had the lobster crab spring rolls... #Amazing. The presentation and the flavor was perfect.  If it's your first time I highly recommend the Bento Box it has sushi and a burger along with some of the signature side items.   Absolutely loved everything about this place including the art on the walls! See you soon CowFish.

iJLHClsEYahiO0XD99sQ3A.text: First time here, and it was great. There were three of us, one that did not like sushi.  The menu provides so many choices for sushi and for those who do not like fish at all.  The food was great, the sushi was so fresh, best I've ever had.  The service was great and the staff was courteous and attentive.  The vibe, for a Sunday evening, was impressive.  We would go there again anytime.  Highly recommended.

F6uedCYf841vUArnicfABw.text: Beano box was good and very filling. But what you fill up on is the sweet potato fries, cucumber salad and the beans. All very good.  The mini burger is good but it is tiny. The crab (cooked) sushi is really good.   It was loud for us on a Sunday at lunch. Concrete floors make it louder. Lotta pots banging and the noise level was too high so you had to speak very loud to hear your guest. Would have been so much nicer if they would have designed it so materials would absorb the noise level.  Maybe we will sit outside next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mediterranean Salad
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Asian chicken salad
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beano box with raw fusion sushi

Q7fzFIKtl6cIFBLn3aXOuQ.text: This is a Charlotte treasure. Incredible menu, that can be a little overwhelming, but take your server's suggestions. Everything I've had here is delicious. They make same-day reservations only, so be sure to call ahead. Otherwise, you will be waiting...

EasaLgY8Im1Fm1BtEMC2pA.text: It's pricey, but it is worth it. This is easily the best place to eat in South Park. It gets a little too hipster at times, but the sushi is outlandishly creative and delectable and the burgers are manly, monstrous, and cooked like nobody's business and the beer selection is a cornucopia of mind-shattering awesomeness.  Want to try a bison sushi roll created by Ric Flair? Cowfish has got you covered. If you're not interested in that, you may want to check your pulse.  Again, be prepared to pay and be surrounded by snooty, hip, white people. The "experience" doesn't do it for me, but the downright artistry of the delicious food more than compensates for the other customers.

UTG158tRSh8RLV8Z3t2WIw.text: The best of both worlds.  I love Sashimi but my husband is a definate red meat eater.  We had wonderful service with great recommendations from our waiter.  It was almost as good as the Panthers game earlier that day.  The restaurant was packed yet everyone was full of smiles.

vcNVv5DD9iVJXvKJTuAj0w.text: Decided to try this restaurant because we saw other reviews on Yelp. Very glad we did it was well worth the 50 minute wait. They do not take reservations but that's okay we didn't mind waiting. I myself ordered the onion rings which were absolutely wonderful. I also ordered the house salad and the CBC BLT burger and it was delicious. Other gifts I was with ordered the bento boxes and enjoyed it very much I would definitely recommend this restaurant to other people.

xsXYmrOLcdAwh_xDdBcd8g.text: This place is killer! The edamame is the most I've ever had and for only 7$ the yellowtail jalapeno dish was fresh with a unique taste. You have to go here !! Epic! And drew the bartender is killer. He made me to bartenders choice cocktails and I loved em both!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon Manhattan
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Thai cucumber salad !
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. One of the biggest and best rolls ive ever had ! Tropical storm

KIKRXK8N9AV3RN7DYEuUog.text: This is a very hip place with great food and a cool atmosphere!  Expect to wait (we waited an hour and a half at the bar) but enjoy their "pending guests" software while you do.  You'll be texted a unique cartoon fish when you check in and can watch your fish float around a virtual fish tank. The bigger he gets, the closer you are to getting a table.  The food is good but their menu is a bit large and overwhelming.  The Lobster and Crab Spring Rolls are a delicious appetizer. Try something different here and you'll likely enjoy the unique blend of favors.  They offer traditional sushi but, unique to this place, their sushi-esque options (Burgushi) are what we always go for.  The rolls are large enough to share so, if you go as a couple, split a burger and a unique "sushi" roll.  We enjoyed The Primetime Filet and Lobster Roll and CBCLT burger.  It was a ton of food for two people.  This restaurant has a large outdoor seating area and, if it's not warm out, they'll have the plastic curtains down and heaters on.

0ETcTEXgILzdjDhG8XITZw.text: One of our favorite places in Charlotte. The CBLT burger is my favorite burger in town.   The sweet potato fries are perfect. Be forewarned--- the burgers are BIG. You could almost split one order for two people.  Last time, I tried the bento box with sliders. You get a very tiny portion of high-quality ground beef, with lighter Japanese fare. I did not leave engorged, and it was the perfect amount of food.  My wife gets the 'build-your-own' sushi, which is very consistently good.   I love the ambiance, which is very Not-Southern. My only 'beef' is that it's damn near impossible to get a table at peak dinner time. We come early (before 12n) on workdays to grab a table. Service is usually prompt and speedy if you avoid the weekend dinner crowd.

8StIXjmaHLeRLVXzOuThDA.text: I know, I know.  Technically I'm not supposed to review a place where I have a "relationship" with the restaurant...but c'mon. It's not like I'm married to any emploee... I have a sushi roll named after me here. (The Neon Dion, seriously my favorite roll.)  I went through a period of time where I dined-in or got take out 3 times a week and know their stuff...so I MUST write a review!  Since there are SO many reviews here so I'll just put in my 2 cents and tips.   Make reservations EARLY.  Yes, there can be a 1 to 2 hour wait...even for the bar.  But there's a reason why.  The food is fresh, eclectic, and WORKS.  The service is also spot on. If you have an issue with a menu item or if it's super busy and gets delivered to the wrong place, someone will find a solution for you, and do it graciously.  Marcus and Alan take great care in who they hire and keep a good staff.    Do not be intimidated by the multitude of choices.  Ask your server what he/she recommends, and I promise you'll be steered in the right direction.   SUSHI: The rolls are ENORMOUS.  (The prices can veer toward $20+ but you'll get what you pay for.) If you're cutting carbs, or just prefer a little less rice, order brown or "Light Rice".  I also suggest getting your roll cut into 10 pieces, so you can fit each piece in your mouth a little more comfortably.   Bento Box is really the way to go to sample it all and get a FANTASTIC value.  A tiny slider of the day or classic slider, a smaller 4 piece version of a regular roll, or "specialty" shrimp tempura/Mark's (deep fried w/tuna + cream cheese) roll, edamame, sweet potato or regular fries, Thai cucumber salad (which is sweet, tangy and crisp) and   The spiked shakes are creative and a fun alternative (Cold Cactus: ice cream, silver tequila, creme de menth, whipped cream, chocolate shavings? WOAH Nelly!)   Check Facebook and their site for updates on specials like $5 martini nights and any special promotions.    I could write a three-part series on the Cowfish, but instead, I say, JUST GO!  You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. I asked my server to &#34;go crazy&#34; and create a roll not on the menu out of his fave ingredients. NOM...

kXyd19AATX3El-s2xabpGw.text: Great place for good food at a reasonable price considering the neighborhood that it's located in. They offer some excellent burgers and sushi plus sushiesque burgers for those interested in fusion foods. It's got a trendy and modern flare. The major downside to this place is definitely the wait. There was an extremely long wait for the restaurant and our group could've sworn that friends/"familiars" of workers at the establishment were being seated ahead of us. We waited nearly 90 minutes to get seated.   Aside from the wait, the food was excellent. I the Hunka Hunka Burnin' Love burger and must say it was awesome! The food was so good that I ended up eating half of my coworker's burger too. Be sure to order the sweet potato fries and fried pickles! They go great with the burgers.

LyEeNHwTQlwd3i3bs6ymPA.text: I want to like this place. It's reasonably creative, the space is nice, and there's an outdoor alley type place where your can sit on couches and have a drink while you wait to get seated.   Still it's just not that good. My burger was pretty tough and just didn't really add up to more than the sum of it's parts. On the other hand, the quality of the fish they use for sushi is pretty solid.  I've been twice and it'll probably be enough for me but it's still worth a look.

JebB0a3VJFEugNfTYBXMgg.text: Why bother reviewing The Cowfish? After all, everyone else and their grandmother has reviewed it.  Well, my 4 stars are for the food.  We walked in late the other night and the hostess looked incredibly confused that we wanted to be seated at a table instead of the bar. But apparently she wasn't able to seat us?!?  Hopped on two stools at the bar and ordered glasses of water. Food was simple: Parmesan truffle fries with bacon on the side, a Neon Dion roll for the Mr, and for me, the green monster burger with their veggie burger instead of beef.  The fries were impressive. As in...we ate them all unapologetically.  It was probably my third time ordering the green monster with a veggie burger, and this time I asked for the bun on the side. Didn't want to miss out on even a forkful of the action. As a side, I went with the cucumbers.   Let's just say that I looked like a quasi-homeless person scooping burger and cucumber into my face with reckless abandon. It's just so good.  So sure, go to The Cowfish. But don't freak out if you have a half-hour wait because it's so popular. Also, don't freak out if the service is a bit nonchalant. Ultimately, the food is solid.

wyz_Z6JWD2iWoKwrvE07Cw.text: Perfectly good meal with an interesting menu and friendly staff. Given the whole health / food safety issues they've experienced in the past year or two, the place has still kept chugging along and is a worthwhile spot to check out.

UFOrts18M6_HfyrtasKQfA.text: I was really skeptical about this place but sat through an hour and a half wait at prime dinner time on a Friday night since my roommate insisted. I'm very glad we waited. The food was delicious (not sure if that was partly because we had to wait for so long). We ordered the 3 mini burgers appetizer and the burger of the week was a blue cheese burger. For entrees we had The Taste Explosion Roll and the Foreplay Roll. Everything we had was delicious and is some of the freshest sushi I've had. My favorite was the Foreplay Roll. Definitely dine late (9:30-10pm) to avoid such a long wait time if possible. It's a very unique experience and worth trying at least once.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Taste Explosion Roll
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Foreplay Roll
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mini burgers of the week was a blue cheese burger

7r_SwJDT_3MEDm7ir5X1Qw.text: Returned for a business lunch. Great service and delicious food. The crab Rangoon wonton dip appetizer is delicious.

Vov9Kwu5NDr9mkBPWTginA.text: Wish I could give it 3.5 stars. 4 for the burgers, 3 for the sushi. I got the bento box style meal which was a nice way to sample a bunch. With this, I got the burger special of the week (jalapeno cream cheese, a jalapeno, and something else). This was quite tasty, but I didn't understand why they cream cheese was a blob on one side of the mini burger instead of distributed more evenly. The sushi was quite...meh. I chose the blackened tuna roll. It was trying too hard and didn't quite hit the spot. The guacamole on top was just weird. The cucumber salad was tasty, but more pickle flavored. Edamame was well cooked, but again the chef just tosses a ton of salt in one place. I chose sweet potato fries which were quite perfect! I'd definitely return for another burger, but would probably avoid sushi in the future though I wish it wasn't so over priced. Beer selection is nice.

65GlFu7znD_DJQjp597Z8w.text: Delicious, sweet atmosphere, friendly staff, I LOVE Cowfish.  Start with the crab rangoon dip.  Thank me later.  I like most of the sushi here, I haven't ventured into the "burger-ushi" yet - but plan to someday.  I usually get one of the specialty rolls, or the bento box best of both worlds!  Cowfish has a really fun feel to it, and if you go to the bathroom you can learn English, Spanish, and Redneck phrases!  I have never been disappointed in anything here.  But don't go hungry, as they usually have a wait - no matter what time you go.  Really though, that's a good sign.  You can have a drink elsewhere, wander around the mall, or day dream in Crate & Barrel to kill the time.

gR0MXVS5ajvftzOnbbKbQg.text: I got the variety box and it was so delicious that I ate the entire box in one sitting!!! It had sweet potato fries, a GLUTEN FREE slider, four sushi rolls, cucumber salad, and edamame!!! Yum!

kDsEoeBYOwiPmP_bGsABQg.text: Yummmmmm. Sushi is delicious, burger is too. Can't wait to try more varieties. Good portions, fun environment. A great place to take visiting friends/family. Wait staff was great. The only think I wasn't crazy about was the milkshake.

WOcEJfQAmtgV2qXz_cSF3Q.text: I came in right before closing, I know SORRY. I hate when people do that. BUT, they were more than gracious. seated me and my date with a smile. Food was great, as well as the drinks. I can recommend this place without hesitation.

Z-41caRlMLUL59ffjB0RIw.text: One of my favorite spots.  I've not been here and didn't have to wait, BUT I assure you,  this spot is worth every minute.  I try something new everytime and I'm increasingly satisfied.  It's a sushi lover's dream with cool eclectic vibes.  My only complaint is the location and that's merely a non factor.  If you haven't been,  you're doing yourself a disfavor.

YVY6RKvNKNg7vSyFI3Z5tw.text: A must visit when coming to Charlotte NC! Great burgers sushi and milkshakes. They have one of the most tasty veggie burger we have ever had. There unique beef burger combinations will be frustrating in deciding on which one to choose.

lcjKHsSyRqJ_wYqB-khG_A.text: Cowfish is one of my go to restaurants here in Charlotte. I love the variety of choices and the atmosphere. Waitstaff has always been super friendly.

1QNaw5GRusLc03GXVvY9sw.text: I finally got to TRY COWFISH!!!!  I've been dying to go here once I was in Charlotte and by golly was it the best yelp recommendation ever!!   The sushi was spot on! the burgers were huge and the apps! ahh I want to go back again!!  The  specialty rolls were huge and great for their prices 9 huge maki pieces that can be for a meal; however, my fat self ate it was an app hehehe.   The staff was super nice, you can tell they love what they do and they enjoy working there... and you can def tell they love the food there. I don't blame them!  The pricing was not bad at all! for 1 tempura roll, 1 specialty roll, the lobster and crab eggrolls, a bento box, and the jalapeno popper show stopper all for only $72 not bad at all!   I would def recommend you people to come here when they are in Charlotte, it fun, its good, and youll enjoy what you order.   Can't wait to go back to Charlotte just for this place... or Orlando, because a new one is being built there now.

xOawlJTZhWtsy7GD4ZVFxw.text: In town visiting friends and had a fantastic evening! The food was amazing especially the crab Rangoon dip! Service was good and enjoyed sitting near the fountain. The birthday bash is pretty cool too!

3Z7cJMXQmR0JoFhJi1CS5w.text: I can't believe I've never written a review here, this is one of my most favorite restaurants. It's dangerous how close I live to it, I have to pretend it's not there. Yesterday was the first time I'd tried anything other than the sushi or burgushi and was, of course happy with my meal. I think I could eat sushi everyday so for me to order a burger instead was a tough decision. I had the lamb burger, it was awesome! Sushi wise, the Southpark roll ( I think they've renamed it) and the Georgia roll are my favorites....I've never had a bad roll there and have tried many. This is my go to spot when friends come in and aren't as lucky to have one close to them.   Pros:  Fresh sushi Creative menu Great tasting food...sushi/burgers/burgushi  Great drink selections  Trendy atmosphere Heated patio  Food portion Etc...  Cons: (nothing major)  Sushi prices are a little high...but fresh and very tasteful.  The wait there is still long, which from a business prospective isn't a bad thing....it's crazy to me that as long as the place has been open there's still a hour wait at 7 on a Tuesday night. They should have more call ahead/reservation options.  Parking

o9cBSpD3Cu777zQTy1AMTw.text: Cowfish is a great atmospheric concept. Significant bar, patio, and menu.  This place has transformed from a Charlotte Flavor-of-the-Month to a Southpark standard in just a few years. It remains a destination where everyone smiles because they are so happy to be sitting there, and has ridiculous wait times. Ridiculous.   In case you are unfamiliar, we in Charlotte tend to lose our minds over new establishments. We get excited about each of the six "Grand Openings" these places have, and we flock to them salaciously for a few months before we either:  a) lose interest  b) realize we don't like them, or  c) realize we don't like the people we keep seeing there.   Often, these establishments crawl off to die upon this occurrence.   Due to the nature of such establishments in such locations in this town, I wondered when the luster would fade on Cowfish. It hasn't. People are still waiting an hour and a half to sit down at 5pm on a rainy Tuesday.  What is truly great about Cowfish: The menu. It is extensive and very well-designed, replete with fun names and several regional specific ("Pittsburgoo-shi Sandwich," "Georgia Roll") and local-themed ("Southpark Roll," "Foreplay Roll") items.   This menu is pages and pages long, containing a variety of burgers, sushi, sandwiches and salads. The focus, as the name says, is on burgers and sushi, and for one page, they are combined as "Burgushi." Regardless of his legal status within the county limits, WWE personality Ric Flair is featured in the Burgushi with "The Nature Boy's WOOOOO-shi...Roll".   Among the burgers, "The Arnold Hamandegger" is a mammoth construction with meat and more meat. A half-pound beef burger with cheese, ham, egg, bacon and onions on it. Took me a few days to finish. Came as advertised, was delectable and not good for you.  Bento Boxes are a great choice - you get sushi (choose between several rolls), a mini-burger, edamame, sweet potato fries and Thai cucumbers.    If there's an issue I wish to discuss, it's this: Cowfish's specialty rolls are just so heavy.   The sushi chef seems intent on overloading these. If it doesn't have a creamy sauce or cream cheese in it, it's fried to a degree or has something fried on it or in it. And five or six of them have jalapenos. Jalapenos?

2VrzAEXtnXI_FqzZ7x9sLQ.text: Awesome food! We loved it and it was so great for the kids too! I had the cheeseburgergucci (I think I spelled that wrong but not looking at the menu right now) and it is the coolest thing I have ever tried. Very unique and so tasty! We will be back ...

A7Ga6G2qJ111ezoHG4vC6Q.text: We came in at 6:30 and were immediately seated outside. It was a beautiful evening and the atmosphere was great. The patrons dress ranged from shorts and a golf shirt to slacks and dresses. You will feel comfortable here!  For appetizers we had the crab rangoon dip and the seared steak tataki. I loved the dip and my wife did too. The seared steak tataki had steak, scallops, yellowtail, and tuna that was seared on the outside and raw on the inside. Not my kinda thing, bit my wife LOVED it.   For the entrees I had the taste explosion roll (on the advice of a  fellow Yelper) and my wife had the filet and lobster roll. We both ate until we thought we'd pop! These were great choices, but beware, her steak was again seared on the outside, rare or raw inside. That's something she loved.  David (complete with a handlebar moustache) was an EXCELLENT server. David took the time to explain things and make recommendations. All of his advice was 100% correct. He even had the chef make a few alterations at our request. He is fast, friendly, and knowledgeable. Ask for him!

rMRRlyLUghZbXlViEfDIIg.text: This was a great find. A unique combo, burgers and sushi, but they do a phenomenal job in explaining what's what. Chris and Kelsey were super friendly and knowledgeable. Let us try all the various drafts before we decided, Chris also gave us a bunch of other spots to check out in the area and throughout town, plus potential neighborhoods (told him we were considering moving here). Started with burgushi the buffalo one... Let me say, WOW. Absolutely delicious. After that, I had the jalapeno shooter burger while man friend had the hunka hunka (bacon, peanut butter, banana). Both were tasty! I wasn't sure about fries or coleslaw, they let me split, thanks for that! Turned out I prefer the bacon coleslaw, very good. He had the sweet potato grid and said they might be the best he's had. Overall, loving this place, they're opening one in Atlanta by Perimeter Mall. Can't say enough good things about the experience, other than thank you for the great service and food!

r9le6eAJRp5hkWz0k6TzJA.text: Amazing Menu, Delicious Food! Love the Turkey Burger with Brie & Cranberries for the Fall. Hubby Loves the Sushi.

_kViF30dcD6CmwvHV-qG9A.text: First off - didn't catch the waiters name, but best waiter I have had in the past year, easily. And I eat out 3-4 times a week due to work travel.  A little chatty, but can't fault the dude for going all out.  Anyways, started with shishito peppers and spicy poke dip.  Both were great, and when we ran out of the wonton chips, the waiter brought us some more.  For dinner I had the Thundering Herd Bison Burger and my gf the Honey, Brie Mine.  Both were also very well done and I thought the combination of toppings was well proportioned so I did not end up with any flavor that over powered the others.  I will be coming here again, gonna try some of the sush next

6E_-0XihK7ztFwNNuZwI-A.text: Yum, yum & more yum! Fusion Bento Box is my favorite - I get it with regular fries & the mark's roll.  Tuna nachos - AH-MA-ZING!!!! Martinis are awesome too & only $5 on Tuesdays!  You'll love the decor - so hip & inviting.  The service here is phenomenal; from being greeted immediately, to the wait staff, & the timing of order to table.  Check out the bathrooms & learn a thing or two in foreign language!

XzQJAEk1vNiN5umFLaLqcw.text: Not only is this one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte, it's one of my favorite restaurants period. Great location, amazing menu, original decor, and the service is spot on (in my experience). I love the sushi here and usually go with the sashimi or nigiri but the fusion rolls are really good as well.   This place is always busy and there's typically a wait but the food is definitely worth the wait. Fyi- they don't do reservations.

7p29m31BNSwK4sgitmgkjg.text: I have eaten here several times, most recently for my birthday. I am not a fan of the burgushi, but that is just a personal preference. It is still a unique, innovative concept. They serve one of the best, if not the best, burgers in Charlotte. Their decor is cute and trendy. I love the celebrity inspired fish tank screen while you are waiting for your table. For my birthday, they gave me a complimentary chocolate mousse cake that was on point.

OtnG20pBvOJSLIIpVu3TaQ.text: Here is a GREAT Burger!  First I'll start at the beginning!  Or at least the beginning of my first meal here!  I was so hungry I wanted to order some food just so my brain would function well enough to order the rest of the Meal (maybe a Burger)    Near the top of the menu I saw the Onion Rings, noticing they were "Thick Cut" I was tempted to get them anyway because they had a "Panko Coconut" Batter (I did not order them this first time).  As hungry as I was I would almost say it was a miracle that I read enough of the Appetizers to see one called "Sticks, Sweets and Strings" so I interrogated my Great Waiter about this and he told me that I could skip the "Sticks" (which are plain Fries - Probably a great move - I would rather write 5 star reviews than any other).  Great suggestion!  These Sweet Potato Fries were the BEST I have eaten up to this point in my life!  The Onion Straws (super thin sliced and lightly battered onion rings) were the BEST Onion Straws/Rings I have had in a Restaurant! !! !!!  The Burger was Excellent!  I ordered it Medium Well (I think and I think the Chef was reading my mind though I did not meet the Chef until he brought my Burger to me).  Here is your flavor clue and it should be a BIG Clue: I intentionally ordered this Burger topped with only Red Onion, Pickles and a Bun in order to TASTE the Burger!  If a Burger is GREAT it should be able to "stand on its own" this one Stood well! !! !!  Incredible Flavor and PERFECTLY Cooked, an EASY 5 yelp stars!  Onion Straws (now my "Onion Ring" list won't be so lonely) an Easy 5 stars!  Sweet Potato Fries: Best I've eaten so far... 5 yelp stars!  Fried Pickles, hummm maybe 3 stars compared to the other food here.  Cowfish looks great and the service is excellent!  I did not pay attention to the prices until it was time to pay and I was expecting my bill to be more, so I checked it (everything was there)!  For the Volume and Quality this is a GREAT VALUE! !! !!!  That is why it is easy for me to say I will eat here again and soon!  If you are in the restroom and you want some restroom humor you will probably get some if you are in there long enough to wash your hands and you can ignore the signs, (well maybe pay attention until you get where you are going) though the signs are pretty cool too!  Where they need help:  The Desserts could be Much, MUCH more creative!  Cowfish has put so much Creative Geniusry in the first part of their menu, the choices for Desserts and Coffee make it easy to pass!  I bet most people need an excuse for Dessert (NOT me) though I'm not ordering Dessert just for another photo.  It has to be good and I expect something Totally Unique from a place that has used their imagination so well on the mains!  Minor Point: If you have never had Masala Chai you may enjoy this one.  What they served me was very good tasting Hot Spiced Tea and better than what most Indian restaurant call Masala Chai, yet what Cowfish calls Masala Chai is a far scream from what I have experienced as truly great Masala Chai.  Even so, what they served me had great flavor for hot tea.  Tiny point:  the BBQ sauce was good (I had Three small dishes of it), though I expected it to be as good as everything else!  This is a tiny point to me because this is not a BBQ joint, though I did put it on my: Sweet Potato Fries, Burger and Onion strings!

Ou_Aoxu5HD235OTGDAvR0Q.text: Love the concept of burgers and sushi! You can't go wrong with a burger, yet the sushi may be questionable. Crab ragoon dip is a must try!

78QhDAARe12LvudeHWvTkw.text: Great spot. The food is tasty and the menu is almost overwhelmingly extensive. A perfect place for sushi lovers and seafood skeptics to live in well-fed harmony. Waitstaff is friendly and accommodating, and willing to make you anything your heart desires. Tip: try the "burgushi" if you want to try a little bit of everything (mini burgers and sushi).

eFE1b-sYUN4vMbXa7ta5Ow.text: A solid 3 stars.  While shopping at Express in the nearby mall the sales assistant suggested this place to eat at. The concept is great who doesn't love burgers and sushi? Located near the mall and in a very nice area Cowfish is an ideal place to grab lunch or dinner.  We had no wait but we got seated towards the back where all the kitchen commotion was. A bit loud and not as aesthetically pleasing as the rest of the restaurant we dealt with it. Our server was a bit cold and not as hospitable as other places we visited in North Carolina.  We started off with appetizers. The seaweed salad was nicely presented in a glass and was tasty. The Parmesan truffle fries was huge! The portion was more than enough for three people. We couldn't even get halfway through the fries. The truffle flavor wasn't there and was overpowered by the bacon bits. I also got a salmon skin hand roll which isn't too different from any other Japanese restaurants.  My group also ordered two bento boxes. Each bento box included a slider of the week, sushi, sweet potato fries, edamame, and a cucumber salad. The slider was less than stellar. Too much goat cheese and not enough of everything else. I felt like I was just eating cheese. The sushi was alright not anything out of the ordinary. The sweet potato fries were outstanding though!   If i'm ever in this area again i'll probably make a trip back to this place. But don't consider driving far just because the concept is alluring.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

OaG3p2Dk6nHEh6lQS5ewHQ.text: Good combination of burgers and Sushi, great environment and good service. Tuna is excellent.

wwFbtj6JfdNMKltYkOEK2A.text: Many Gluten Free options and they are up to find an accommodation for food allergies. Great place to visit while in town!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salad and sushi....plus a burger!!

gNBv4pdhrrLIwuc5RmbIQg.text: This is hands down one of the best places to eat. It's more than just the food in my opinion, it's the experience you have there too! Such and amazing environment. To start off we had the truffle fries and wow they are so addicting. I also had the The All-American Bacon Double Cheeseburgooshi which I was skeptical on but holy moly it was amazing. Don't forget to check out the huge aquarium with the cute cowfish in it!!!

Cp0J8T88Ed76E7sBjAfMHw.text: This place is awesome! Our sever josh was awesome. I ordered a cheeseburger with Mac and cheese and spicy tuna sushi. The burger was cooked perfect and flavor was on point. I did cancel the sushi because it didn't come bout but he brought it anyway on the house which was great. Definitely will come back

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy tuna
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese burger with Mac and cheese

5m6vv1pchWyYRHXnLNdMHA.text: My family and I moved from New York to Charlotte about 9 years ago, and coming from a city full of great food options, we were looking for good places to eat in Charlotte. The Cowfish was among the first restaurants that came highly recommended by residents of Charlotte. We went there multiple times in the beginning, and we always left happy and satisfied, from the great burgers to the interesting concept of Burgushi.  However, time has not been too kind to The Cowfish. The last three visits have been underwhelming, and the last visit I made is what caused me to update my initial review. During this visit, I ordered the Thundering Herd Bison Burger and had Parmesan Bacon Truffle Fries as an appetizer. I will begin with my thoughts on the fries.  When the fries arrived, the cheese had already somewhat cooled down, meaning that the fries were stuck together. It was way too chewy and rubbery in texture, which is how cheese is when it isn't hot and melted. Yes, I could have asked the waiter to warm the fries up more, but the food shouldn't be served like this.  Concerning the Bison Burger, I ordered it in Medium-Rare because that is how I enjoy my burgers. However, this burger was too undercooked in that the burger was falling apart in my hands. The taste of the meat was similar to what I have tasted from a Kirkland Signature burger that was microwaved. The burger was very rubbery and overtly chewy.  I didn't order a Burgushi this visit, but I did order this dish last time around. I was disappointed because the meat tasted like over cooked ground beef used in fast food tacos.  I don't mean to complain and rant about The Cowfish with this review. I still enjoy their dessert options very much, and the service is consistently amazing. Plus, the ambience and decor of the restaurant is very unique, with the right character to fit the American-Japanese fashion vibe. I am just explaining how the food tasted, and that there are many better (and cheaper) options around Charlotte if you crave burgers or sushi. This is probably the only place where you can have both. So, the choice is yours, but my choice would be to go somewhere else.

FLTLLOoMLm6vsschrrxxqA.text: I went there at the beginning weekend of and this time I was so disappointed with my buger and the fries. They weren't good at all. Even after they brought me back some fresh fries they still weren't good. The 1st order was cold and tasteless the 2nd was hot and hard. Maybe it was because they were changing shifts. Not sure just didn't complain after the 2nd fries came to the table.  However I really appreciate the management reaching out to me and having concerns about my order not being up to their standards. Thumbs up for prompt attention. I'm hoping my next visit will be like my first visit there.

VUNK6WfHHLUWYxxqxIw36A.text: Been wanting to come here forever.  Great food however..... Design of restaurant is weird kitchen and bathroom are hear each other.  Unfortunately oil and water don't mix I slipped on the way to ladies room manager Chris was very annoyed with me only adding to my embarrasment. I received vm  from  corporate office saying that this is perhaps a coaching moment.  Not sure if thats how I would decribe this situation. Can you coach an entire company on professionalism and courtesy?   I have left her 2 seperate messages over 5 days and the Corporate rep has not returned my calls.  I'm really am at a loss for words on how horrible they treat paying customers?  I HAVE NEVER FELT SO DISRESPECTED!!  INSULT TO INJURY WOW!

Q0vUZbBMKPybwmUxBeOP8g.text: One of my favorite things about this place is the virtual aquarium that indicates your place in line while waiting. How inventive and fun!   I wanted to like the food, but only the crab dip was thel most memorable dish of the evening. The lobster roll was ok, and the burger-sushi hybrid was just a tad too oily for my taste. My dinner companion also wasn't terribly impressed with the burger. Our server was awesome, but not quite enough to make up for the food. That said, I will definitely still come back and try other dishes. This place just seems too fun to give up on the first try.   Update: I love that their Marketing Director reached out to follow up on my review. I am liking this place a lot more, and can't wait to come back to try other items on the menu when I'm back in town!

QegTgcY6i1mDfcqdtLgYfw.text: Really unique concept. The food is delicious. Try the burger sushi roll. Great combinations of flavors. We have had the onion rings which are gargantuan!  Giant rings of crispy breaded onions. Yummy sauce for dipping. Cocktails are quite good as well. Service is efficient and friendly. Weekends are very busy and you can't check in on the app until you're a certain distance from the restaurant. The bar is open seating so we usually scout it out and sit there. You definitely want to try this spot near Southpark.

aMn9YM7oDcs_GklAWBj77Q.text: Extensive menu, & the food never ever disappoints. I only wish they took reservations bc it's always so crowded

VDdpnjo8EvCwZgKOgbGETw.text: Cowfish has the potential to be something really special but it just falls a little short. And, I can't quite put my finger on what the problem is... (Helpful, I know.) I'm not sure if it's the humorless staff or sterile location by the mall. The fact that they make you wait 20-minutes for a table despite 10 empty tables within view. Or, maybe it's the super creative and appetizing menu descriptions that don't quite match the food you're brought. I dunno. It could be a little bit of all of that. But, moral of that story is, I always go in excited, with high hopes and leave slightly underwhelmed.   On my most recent visit, I ordered the sashimi - nigiri combo. A decent deal at $23 it included 8-pieces of spicy tuna, 3-pieces of nigiri (tuna, salmon and yellow tail) and 6-pieces of sashimi (3 salmon, 3 tuna). It was good. Incredibly fresh fish! But, lacked some creativity or pizazz. Ted got the short rib burger. I had a taste and liked it -- it had something sweet in the mix, maybe figs or dried cherries? He wasn't super impressed. Fries were cold.   All in all, I wish Cow Fish would find a way to kick it up a notch or two and impress more. It really could be the perfect combo for me and Ted -- I could live on sushi and he is a total sucker for a good burger.

4uhZAgxfYlIFDAGgteaQWA.text: I love this place excellent service and great burgers and sushi. The bento box is the best

swcF85Vi5QOBxJfiibUA4A.text: I love cowfish! Sooo good. Went yesterday and the first time our order came out wrong (no biggie) , and they were super apologetic and fixed it without hesitation ASAP, even the chef came out to apologize- and let us keep the dish that came out first. Awesome customer service and awesome food. The spider crab roll is my fav!

EADClYJbrdep-57kx9PYqQ.text: Busy Saturday caused a little wait but was soooo worth it. No reservations available.  We had truffle fries, onion rings, crab dip and edamame appetizers.  We dined on the all American cheese burgergooshi, pulled pork and salad. Everything, including our server Nicki was excellent.  The only disappointment is that we do not live locally to return often. Enjoy!
