2RWV-oHsWgC8A711lbqWfw.text: This place has great burgers, of many different variety and choices. Can satisfy everyone in your group! They had different sushi and nice option to create your own for both burger and sushi. Had great drinks here too, alcoholic and milkshake.

HL7_zPAZS7dTQNeJhVNfFA.text: I've been to The Cowfish 7-8 times over the last 3+ years.  If I lived in Charlotte, I would eat  there much more often.  The concept is unique and they've managed to pull it off very well.  I'd rate their regular sushi as good but not great.  Their burgers are VERY good.  But where they really shine and offer something you can't find anywhere else is a combination of these foods- the burgushi!  I can't get enough of it!  I waited til my third visit to try it, and I wish I had ordered it from the beginning.  I can't really describe the burgushi well enough for it to make sense, but just try it!  It's delicious.    The service I've gotten here has always been good.  I can't recall an occasion that I've had any issues with it.  The servers are typically friendly and attentive without being intrusive.  The prices are reasonable, particularly for the amount and quality of the food you get.  Highly recommended if you get a chance to try it!

k1zARBzy5VgaPYLYGLyYig.text: Food and drinks were great! Definitely coming back. The seating at the bar was a little strange, the seats are mounted to the flor far away from each other and there is no way to move them. It gets loud in the evenings so I wanted to be closer to the person I was with so I can hear her. Hope they will rearrange the seating

Lm_8HEBRepecAnSF5aJ1fg.text: I had a wonderful time at cowfish today, I had the all American burger and the crunchy shrimp tempura roll and a glass of champagne. Everything was delicious and the customer service was impeccable I hate that I've never dined in here before but after today I will be eating here again!

uBLyMv2It9nkyKBtg5Rggw.text: This is one of the best places in Charlotte!! I've had probably most stuff on the menu and I've never been disappointed. I don't eat fish but it's still one of my favorite places.   I would recommend the turkey burger or the cheeseburger burgushi.   Whenever I have people in town, I always take them here!!

pEqMYECaP7zmAORD0M0ZLQ.text: All I can say is WOW!!!!   My husband and I have been DYING to come here and see what all the RAVE is about. We both have crazy busy schedules and it's hard to find time to get together. Today was my husbands birthdah and we decided that if we went around 4:30-5, the wait wouldn't be so bad! And I was RIGHT!!   Upon arrival, the doors were opened for us and we were greeted by a few employees. We were seated right away and were so excited! Our server was Jordyn/Jordan. I don't know which way it's spelt but SHE was wonderful. She had a great and friendly personality. She was ready to help us in any way. She let us take our time to figure out what we wanted to order. During our time there... we had a few other employees come to our table and ask how everything was and making sure we didn't need anything. That is great service! It wasn't too much and it was greatly appreciated.   We got a few appetizers. My husband wanted to try the calamari and I wanted to try the fries with bacon and truffle sauce. My husband ordered the Bento Box for his meal and I ordered Sushi! Not your average kind of sushi... see, I don't eat seafood or much meat. It depends on how it's cooked and what it is. I have always wanted to try sushi but without the fish. Which I know may sound ridiculous but I was feeling left out. At this restaurant.... you get to PICK what goes in it and they have other options like ground beef and pulled pork!!!! I was SOOO excited to finally get to try it! I asked our server if it was okay to order some things even if it sounded weird!! She assured me that they don't judge and it's whatever I would like, they would make it happen! At this point, I was super excited. In my sushi... I had... pulled pork, bacon, cream cheese, mushroom and avocado. And OH MY GOD!!!!!! It was amazing!!!!! My husband loved his food. I loved mine! It was a great meal for both of us.   I can't wait to come back here! I know there are other things to try, but I think I just found my new spot that accepts my sushi handicap!!! Thanks for making this experience such a blast! Now I finally got to see why this place has such great reviews! Highly recommend and we WILL be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

wMXTW3yFAQ1WJWpWBDOTSw.text: When I first moved to Charlotte 6 years ago, Cowfish was the jam! It was a unique restaurant that really stood apart from the others - 6 years later I think that's still True, even with all the new places that pop up daily. Each time I come here, the service and food has been exceptional!   Although I've never tried the burgushi, their sushi is top notch! My favorite hands down is the typical storm. It's so fresh and at around $20 - it's definitely filling as the roll is HUGE! Im also a sucker for the bento box. It's the best value, plus you get a mix of options - a little 4 piece sushi roll, mini slider, cucumbers (which are to DIE for!!), sweet potato fries and edamame. You can't go wrong for just around $12-$15! You can also substitute your side - including friend pickles, bacon coleslaw, veggies, seaweed salad or regular fries!   And if you're looking for something different to start off your meal- you gotta get the crab rangoon dip! It's so delicious and served with light wanton crips and a sweet/spicy glaze.  Overall you can't go wrong with anything here - from the burgers, sandwiches, sushi- they have it all. And tip- 1/2 off wine bottles on Wednesday - dining or bar area!

gdw2FncRbwoLxaFughO0cw.text: Our first time dinning here.  We so enjoyed the food.  Amazing Sushi and burgers!  My wife, daughter, and I all agreed this will be our new "go to".  Also, a big thank you to Jen for the kind appetizer.

4ob37dZlwXEgEuheUN8iAQ.text: I've never heard of this food combo at a restaurant so I was a little skeptical, but it ended up being amazing! The menu is overwhelming with how many food items they have. My recommendation is to try the sushi, a burger or slider, and the burgooshi. This way you can try a little bit of everything.  We ordered the bento box so that we would get a taste of multiple menu items. The bento box came with a slider, 4 sushi pieces, sweet potato fries, edamame, and cumbers. The slider was so good and it made me wish we ordered a whole burger. Th Mark's sushi pieces were good, but not my favorite. Everything else in the bento box was great!   We also ordered the bison burgooshi. The concept is unique to have non sushi food in a sushi roll and it was a success.   The TNT sushi roll was our favorite. It has great flavor and tasted fresh.   We have heard the wait here is very long on weekends so it is recommended to go on a week day.  Overall, great service, great food! Save room for a milkshake because they looked delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Nature Boy&#39;s Woooooshi Buffaloooooshi Roll*
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

mR4IEqHSoqoakQz_30JM2g.text: After seeing a pic of their "Burgushi", I just had to have it...so here I was again!  I hit this fun, hot spot for a late lunch (2 pmish?), and surprisingly, there were still a good number of people there. Still, there were a lot of good, empty seats. Yet the hostess leads me to a seat in the back, right next to the cashier stand, next to the swinging doorway to the patio...not to mention right beside a group of loud, giggling teenagers. *SIGH* Just the worst possible seating for someone like me...who prefers to be AWAY from doorways and super-loud people lol! This is such a pet peeve of mine at restaurants. I get it if there aren't any other seats available, but why lead a customer to the worst seat when there are plenty of good seats open?!? I truly don't get this...and it truly ticks me off. Still, I was determined not to be a Bitch, so decided not to ask to be reseated in another area...though I did ask for a booth.  THAT aside, I decided to go ahead and order the much-anticipated "The All-American Bacon Double Cheeseburgooshi" with Truffle Fries.  First of all, KUDOS for the sweet presentation of the Cheeseburgooshi. It's also such an ingenious idea! I mean, how can you NOT love this?? Well, here's the deal. As much as I love the idea, the name and the look of this Cheeseburgooshi, it didn't quite live up to it. Meaning, it just didn't taste as good as it looked. The bacon and the beef just didn't taste that great...and there were barely any cheese (if at all?) in it, though a heavy sprinkle of pickles. As the for the Truffle Fries, it didn't taste fresh. In fact, it was barely warm. So sadly, the meal was disappointing...though I did manage to get some great pics for the Instagram lol! Next time, think I'll stick with Sushi or Burger...not a combo of both (though it sounds so cool!).  Despite the hefty price points, I couldn't even finish eating all of the Cheeseburgooshi and the Truffle Fries...so decided to order a dessert in its place. The dessert I chose was the comically named "Chef Dave's Not Factory Made Cheesecake" (What a slap in the face for Cheesecake Factory lol!)...and thankfully, the Cheesecake was really good. Super-rich and flavorful. I loved the sprinkle of Coconut flakes, but didn't love the Raspberry sauce. If only they had this Cheesecake with Blueberry sauce instead...  The service was OK. The waitress was friendly enough, yet not super-attentive. I had to ask another staff member that happened to be walking by for an Iced Tea refill.   Overall, I can't say that the dining experience was great. The food was good enough (though a tad disappointing), but honestly, it was just too annoying having to deal with the doors opening and closing every few minutes, the giggling teenagers next to me...and the waiters/waitresses walking back and forth in front of my table to get to the cashier all throughout my meal. *UGGGH*   For some reason, something seems to be amiss with Cowfish and me. As much as I love this restaurant, there's always something that gets in the way of all-out enjoyment. For more than three occasions, I had to ditch the line due to the long wait. Then, I had this one occasion when my supposedly fancy, sixteen-dollar appetizer came out looking like a sloppy mess (though the management was really good about compensating me for this!). And now, this super-annoying seating situation (and other disappointments). I hate to do it, but I really can't rate this experience more than three stars. :\  No matter, I'm not going to give up on Cowfish just yet. Hopefully, sometime in the future, I'll actually get everything I want from this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheesecake
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburgooshi w/ Truffle Fries

aCz8IIdi4vVt6xScolkytQ.text: First time at Cowfish! I decided to go for the full experience and go for the cheeseburger sushi. It did not disappoint! Great flavor, awesome sauces, and the perfect blend between Asian and All-American. Served with fries... I've had better. Overall, I'll be back for the food! The service was just okay...had to end up asking another server for a refill. I wasn't impressed with our server..he wasn't horrible, but I wouldn't describe him as attentive. Head to Cowfish if you're looking for a neat fusion restaurant with great flavor and a huge menu!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger sushi from Cowfish. Served with fries

i1FPqUxi7T2FOAp7tMJZaw.text: One of my favorite sushi restaurants in Charlotte. Great portions, decent prices, always fresh fish. Usually go for the Sashimi deluxe with a couple of rolls and a couple of apps. Favorite appetizer is to Togarashi Shrimp. Nice and crisp and the sauce on top is just delicious and you get a nice little salad underneath the shrimp.  The Lobster spring roll is also very good. Sashimi pieces are nice and thick. They also give you fresh wasabi with the sashimi dish, which is awesome.   I've tried a number of different rolls here as well and they've all been consistently good. Favorite os the rigg's crabcake roll.  Service is generally very good.  Management always has a great attitude.  This is our goto place for Sushi.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sashimi deluxe
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Riverboat Ron Roll

3hosWFdYap-6LLHT2nUxWw.text: Been years since I ate at Cowfish, but I should have made this place more of a priority! Great service on Father's Day Sunday, delicious food, and colorful atmosphere that was a nice escape from the heat outside.   I went for their bento box and they obviously know they have a good concept, as it was just the right balance of flavors. I'm not a big buffet fan, but the bento box is like your own little version of a buffet...or a conglomeration of small plates, whatever suites your fancy.   We also ordered the pickles and peppers appetizer and both were perfectly fried! Gotta appreciate quality pickle chip fries, as it is easy to have them be soggy.   Our waiter could have been an intimidating figure - 6ft and built like Dave Bautista, but he was the most welcoming, attentive person one could ask for as a waiter. This guy likes staying in good physical shape, but he clearly cares just as much about making sure you have an enjoyable meal!  Don't let the parking turn you off, there is a deck with plenty of spaces just a few steps away. Good job Cowfish.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fusion Specialty Bento Box*

JhxrCCTtAG0UaC2Q76sJCQ.text: First time there for dinner. While waiting on a table, I ordered a Sangria which was not on the menu. The nice bartender said she could make one for me and she did. Took a sip, and thought great! Well, our table was ready so I turned in the barstool and knocked the full drink over and the glass broke and drink everywhere.   Another bartender came over asked what the drink was and made another one. He was so nice about the situation. He even brought the drink outside to our table. The server outside was amazing as well. Very professional and nice!   Burgers were great amd the crab rangoon was excellent!  Will definitely go back soon.

xEH7VES7vsURW5CWQfrQuQ.text: Incredible experience unlike any restaurant I've been to. Really interesting flavors blended together, cool creations and awesome-looking presentation. HhozHHuE6C_q9X2vUbUfQw.text: I love this place! First time reviewing but I frequent this place. Sushi and burgers, what's not to like? Two things you must try, calamari and crab Rangoon dip. I love to get the bento fusion box because you get the best of both worlds. The portions are good, especially the apps. They have a kids menu and it s spot on. It comes with desert. I love Mark's sushi roll. It is crunchy and tasty. When we come we usually get Mark and he is really good.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fusion Specialty Bento Box*

tbh1jt-jRSaevugVDUJzbw.text: The menu has something for everybody from burgers to sushi and appetizers  I had to come in and try the cool menu. The atmosphere is contemporary and modern. I ordered the Arnold hamandeggar the country ham complimented the burger really well. The meat was cooked perfectly. I thought the service was friendly and prompt. This would be a place I would frequent if visiting southpark

O0Ct2rtoaiJdryTbJLLoLw.text: This is now my second favorite restaurant in Charlotte right behind Good Food on Montford.  I've been going more consistently lately and the quality is outstanding even when I got takeout!  The display  and food presentation on all dishes are beautiful and the value is great when considering any decent dining establishments in the area.  Mo go to is the burgushie roll and good luck finding that anywhere else in the world !  The shakes are incredible and so are the cocktails.  Truly innovative and in my opinion still underrated!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento Box
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burgushi

dpKQIwvFKWmhTxqbqPVGaQ.text: The food is amazing! If you get there and there is a wait, try to find seating at the bar because it is first come first serve.   We had the lobster and crab roll as an appetizer and the all American bacon double cheeseburger burgposhi roll and the mad mango cardo roll. The rolls come in 8-9 pieces. You will be super full. The food was awesomely delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster &amp; Crab Spring Rolls
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mad Mango-Cado Roll
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mad Mango-Cado Roll

UEA2aIEDsyzckRuJtJDOaQ.text: Sorry to be the party pooper, but this is not our style or preference.  An interesting concept:  the marriage of a hamburger joint with a sushi place.  Their menu is a work of art.  Regular array of sushi and sashimi and some good combinations, esp those that are non-seafood.  Like the vindaloo lamb sushi roll that my wife had.  Of course, she did not like the seaweed wrapper inside, so put that aside.  But otherwise is was acceptable to her.  The burger list is, likewise, very cleaver.  All are half pounders and they do have a full pound offering that is like the "hunky dunky" or some such name.  It is a GIANT burger.  I had the black truffle burger and it was good, but too rich for my ancient taste buds.  Understand that this place was very crowded.  Our son suggested that we git in by 5pm.  We did and had to be seated out back in the tented patio area.  The dining area was mobbed!  Judging my the very high ratings, the under 50 year old set, especially the 20 - 30 year oldsters, find the crowded eclectic menu and setting to their liking.  It was too much for us.  The noise level drowns out any conversation at your table and sitting in the wind tunnel formed by the tented patio location open at each end, plus the roar of the multiple ceiling fans, made the meal an ordeal.  And...due to the crowded to overflowing mob of eaters, the kitchen was punching out the meals at a good rate.  What suffered was the fried potatoes and other to-be warm sides which arrived lukewarm and soggy.  They sit too long to be picked up by the hustling wait staff who do a great job but as you walk by the pick up window of the kitchen are quite a gaggle awaiting their orders to deliver.  But they do a good job.  Special kudos to a male busser who was a dynamo in clearing tables and carrying two arms full of dishes, etc. through the twin doors leading to the interior.  He would use his elbows to open them and he did so without dropping anything.  Sweat head that he was, he was the star of the constantly in-motion support staff.  It was a birthday for our daughter-in-law and I took on the just under $200 bill, which included $8 for her birthday dessert.  And so much for the banging of cymbal and drum accompanied staff serenade. Do it at home.  We were laughing all the way home as to how so many found this crazy eating environment a wonderful experience.  But we apparently did not get it and Cowfish does.  Give this a try and see for yourself.  They do a good job, A-OK, for what they do and offer.

oA0tXietSsubXscv5FugSw.text: My husband and I dined at Cowfish for the hire time and this may have been my favorite visit. Our server, Alex (Alex Davis, I believe), is phenomenal and really made it a great evening.   We each ordered a local craft beer and Alex was helpful in making selections. She allowed us to take our time as we decided what to order and was happy to give recommendations when asked. I had the Miss Woodbury role (I believe that's what it was called) and my husband had the specialty bento box. We shared a side order of seaweed salad. Everything was delicious and fresh. We can't wait to bring family here when they visit!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

E4Lm239JMl-fx7tA2SIpdg.text: Amazing joint with outstanding food and service. This is not a place to be missed while you are in Charlotte. Very comfortable atmosphere with generous indoor and outdoor seating. The menu is extensive enough to satisfy every palate imaginable. The only ding was that our dish of calamari was a bit over cooked and when the waitress noticed that we were not eating it, she took it back. Several minutes later, the chef delivered a fresh portion for the 5 of us along with an apology and said it was "on the house". What a great gesture and a True reflection of the high standards found here. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Calamari
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

pDPcxCmFYEY9Ji7BkXRB8A.text: Sooo first things first this location is not in the mall it on the outside of the mall near a hotel. We have been to other locations before and this one was on par with others. The food was fresh, and delicious! I got my favorite bento box with the volcanic roll and we had the crab ragon dip as an app! Only lost a  Star cause the food took longer than expected.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fusion bento box

Qmwp5BPuyK9Pfl2AYEny9Q.text: I have been here a couple of times and have always had a great experience. It's always been a wait whenever I come lunch or dinner. Today was my boyfriend's first time and he loved it. We came before I had to go to work so for faster service we went to the bar. I had sushi and he had a burger. Great sushi and great burgers. The ingredients are a1 and the service is good even when they are busy. We are always checked on by different people not just our server. We got the Crab Rangoon dip. We ate it to the last drop, if they made these in the store I would definitely buy it. I haven't got a dessert here yet though, that is the next thing I need to try, I always get super full before it. I will update my review if I ever get there lol. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Without Jalapeño on top
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cute random postcard they give you with your receipt
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Boyfriend&#39;s Burger

srUoFnI-Ca1eUffDA3_VEg.text: Ok let's get real... this is a burger place (remember Counter everyone???) that turned into a sushi place because the burgers we no good.  Now all of a sudden it the best sushi in Charlotte, HA!!  If they can't do burgers I'm gonna pass on them for my sushi.  I was unimpressed and the place is not by any means a bargin.  I refuse to mention other restaurants in reviews but there is better sushi to be had in Charlotte.

jaNMzYel1hREPySKX45PSQ.text: My favorite place to eat in Charlotte. Bento box is perfect for the non-adventurous type, and they have a wide variety of rolls for those who want something unique. Also - they leave the bottle of water on the table - a very underused concept for people like me who drink 5 glasses of water with every meal. Would highly recommend for a standard date night or with a small group. There are sometimes long waits for a table but bar seating is solid as well.

W-QN_lfrVgLShuesjpUEuA.text: this is my favorite restaurant and one of the only reasons i miss charlotte.  please bring the cowfish sushi burger bar to nyc!!!!!

fpI4lKvQySuPrfOlwhv5nw.text: Lives up to the hype! I recommend one of the Bento Boxes so you get a nice sampling of sushi and burgers!

_KcUK34Ik3oniNE-nKZ_1w.text: What a unique Asian Fusion restaurant. It combines two concepts: sushi and burgers. Burgushi. I tried the Fusion Bento Box which had a mini burger, sushi, sweet & sour Thai cucumber slices (I loved this), edamame, and sweet potato fries. Someone else ordered the Texas Longhorn burger, which tasted quality. Service was quick and very friendly! The interior had fun things to look at all over the walls, and the bathroom smelled like vanilla. Definitely worth another visit. It's good for young adult groups or even for dates.

BXDr-CaOyvI5jcRMA4n8cg.text: We have eaten here a few times and the food has always been great. That said, the service has always been consistently lacking. We sit at the bar every time and the servers behind the bar are inattentive, and not good for service, but like I said, what keeps us coming back is the food.

x3nqDe7q4HQfYULLIvBJGw.text: great. phenomenal food. in the mood for sushi? in the mood for a life changing burger or milkshake? no problem! they also have healthy alternatives such as a chicken avocado sandwich which by the way is so good.  a must try is the spring rolls they have to offer.. completely different than normal but amazing! 5 stars hands down isn't enough for cowfish.  Check out their location in Raleigh if you are ever there.  really cool atmosphere in and around the restaurant!

Nl7I8OgbyHBnO1UAF05YTg.text: It is seriously amazing. Although we had to wait a godawful amount of time, they truly made up for it in service and delicious food. Minutes after putting in our appetizers they were on the table ready for us to enjoy. We had the coconut onion rings and crab rangoon dip. SO delicious and the onion rings were gigantic! Our server was very nice and funny and attentive. He noticed we liked a particular dipping sauce and brought more without being asked and even packed some in our to go boxes later that night.  All the menu items seemed so interesting and delicious it was hard choosing. I had the longhorn burger with fried pickles. You can really customize your burger exactly how you want it: bread, cheese, meat, toppings, sauces. I recommend the wasabi mayo. They also have build your own sushi. We had the berry cheesecake and orange ginger creme brulee. The brulee was to die for. So full of taste and such a big portion! Great fun place! If I'm ever in Charlotte again I will definitely go back!

96SDaeUevZwzJn7k2D8XiA.text: It is hard for a place with a diverse menu to be OK.  Harder to be good.  And really, really, hard to be great. Cowfish has done it.  I have been there twice and both meals were fantastic.  Can't wait to get back to the East coast to hit it again!!!

ElpRmU0q5nC03cnvfD5zww.text: Good for sushi, bad for burgers!  I ordered the green monster done medium(slight pink).  this burger should have been full of flavor, but it was dry as could be with little flavor.  I mean this thing had avocado, jalepeno, pepper chipotle dressing and no FLAVOR!  Plus it was super dry and barely warm, not sure how someone dries out a burger done medium with pink in the center?  I suspect the burgers are pre done and finished off when ordered, YUCK!  Also the calamari was really chewy.  The sushi was great though, but its pretty loud in there.  I am disappointed this is what replaced The Counter burger joint.

lkND5wHM8IMUKFBAA6g91A.text: Great food.. Try the green monster lamb burger

86q80NVAdZBTMAt3fv0VYQ.text: Perfect restaurant! Has a mixture of food to satisfy everyone. Burgers are great and the sushi is fantastic.

wfoHfjwP3ehptfyNVLXKAQ.text: OMG!  FInally a place that caters to both sushi and burger lovers all under the same roof - service was best I have experienced in a long time in Charlotte.  Food - out of this world.  Love the interactive screens in the sushi bar - makes ordering a drink fun!  Don't miss this place!

NO7TEFy-diFckiMEE1fioQ.text: There are nights in the restaurant business when things don't go well - this was one of those nights. First, the bar mistakenly charged us for the wrong tab - a bill $10 higher than the right one. Then the martini with blue cheese olives came with peppered olives. After asking the bartender to find out what went wrong, he either ignored me or forgot.  Food was fine and the table wait staff was good.   In the end, complaints were met with words but little substantive action. Will proably give them another chance based on food prep but a repeat by the bar and the management will result in a significantly more negative review.

t1o5uwEd9CgRoGeredhz-Q.text: I was a big fan of this place when it was Counter Burger and was excited for the burger/sushi combination and apparently so were a lot of other charloteans as the two times I've walked in there its had a one and half hour wait.  The first time I walked out as I was with a large group, but the second time I was just with one friend so we ponied up at the bar to eat.    The menu is huge with a burger, sushi and burgushi ( a combo of both) options.  The bartender took the time to walk us through the menu even though it was crowded which I really appreciated.    We split the Green Monster Burger and the Mother Load sushi platter.  The Green Monster was delicious and they did a great job of cooking the burger to medium (what most people think as medium rare).  It had creamy avacado and fried jalapeno slices. Great combination of hot burger and cool avacados.  I would go to this place just for the burger!    The motherload sushi platter was great, it was a good sized portion and the fish tasted very fresh.    Great place, I'll definitely be back.  (it didn't hurt that Ric Flair sat next to me)

ECvEVgWf-yOpXHGlxEzwCg.text: Worth the wait for a table.  This is our go to restaurant when family or friends are in town.  In fact, my mother-in-law tried to reserve a table on her way up after eating there the last time she visited.   Fusion: Surf and Turf must have.   Torn between a burger or some sushi: Fusion Bento Box.  Appetizer: Ahi Nachos.   When it starts to warm up, make sure you sit outside by the fountain grab a couple of IPAs from the bar and eat some sushi.  The service matches their quality food.

xyBiCPLyAzzj7KmlXUHBvQ.text: Very nice atmosphere, food is ecclectic and delicious. I tried seeweed salad for the first time and LOVED it!!

13I_9brxFYX9qMATD8lI7Q.text: I've been here a couple of times so far and this place gets packed so I highly recommend making a reservation. You can't go wrong with anything you order. Everything is amazing and of good portion. Service is friendly and knowledgeable. I highly suggest you use their restroom too. You're in for an educational treat :)

uJBfFPdZTJq0VS14YbF2KA.text: Very unique menu with a lot of great options for those who like seafood and those who don't. For someone who does not like sushi, I loved my Cowfish sushi roll.

ivxcjcCNfYwOz_QuQP5ozA.text: Rarely do I write reviews but I've been to Cowfish twice now and I think it's warranted. 4 stars simply because with the sheer density of the menu I'm not sure I've have the total picture of what this places has to offer, but I am a big fan of what they're trying to do.   Atmosphere: It's a good sit down spot that attracts a sophisticated crowd without being stuffy.  On my second visit they had live music outside, the guy was pretty good and did well known covers.  If you're going in the evening make a reservation, wait times can be horrific, 1hr+. Weekends you might be able to walk in and dine.   The food: The menu is MASSIVE.  I'm talking 11 point font, double-sided, 10 page menus.  If you're the type that likes to return to a place and sample from all over...well it's not happening here unless you bring friends and share.  Which brings me to the topic of this place being a fusion eatery.  Thankfully both the sushi and the burgers are good. I enjoy sushi and like to eat it frequently.  I am not however, someone who says sushi doesn't exist outside of *insert the name of a city in another part of the country*.  Throwing that out there in case someone says the sushi at Cowfish isn't "real sushi."  I haven't tried the "Burgushi" - it's Burger elements placed into sushi or the sandwiches with sushi elements placed into them, although I've heard good things.  The various rolls I have tried and the house burger (which you can customize the daylights out of) were both good.  I suggest the burger as a nice standby for friends that aren't quite ready to dive into sushi beyond a piece or two.    All in all:  It's a great place for anyone who loves sushi or burgers or for someone who is trying to get their burger eating friends to try sushi.

gxXmBQbJb4oISX5HcFuXmg.text: Pretty good sushi, high prices and really loud environment. Its also super packed most of the time. The Bento Box is not bad for someone trying it for the first time since it gives you sushi and a burger plus some sides.

5QIufMsg6JyZgH3sV8eSnw.text: This is one of my favorite spots!  The customer service here is amazing!  On Friday & Saturday nights expect at least a 1.5hr wait. The sushi is very fresh and the burgers are so good!  The Bento Box is a great deal, very filling. I usually get the ultimate brento bento box which includes a double mini burger, roll of sushi, sweet potato fries, Thai cucumbers and edemame!  I have never had a dish here that wasn't delicious. Hands down one of my favorite places in Charlotte to eat!

KW54HmGnV45a2rt6RyMfBA.text: Let's get one thing straight: I am not a big throw-around-5-stars kinda gal. To be 5 stars, you'd got to be tip top. Top shape. Top of the mountain. King of the Playground. Etc. Etc. And The Cowfish? Well let's just say that it's got serious potential to possibly send every other restaurant in town out of business and cure cancer. IT'S JUST THAT GOOD.  After coming here a few times on a few different nights, I have yet to find anything I don't eat, see or hear that makes me go "Wow...". From the service (Channon is one of the managers and went above, beyond and around the corner to make an order right for us one night), to the decor (so Japanese/modern/fun/dark/chic/simple - if that's possible?), to the food (Shut the Front Door Good!), it's just a fact that The Cowfish is really just that good.  Reservations are only accepted for 1/3 of the place, so they're hard to get but I've never had a problem strolling up to the bar and getting a seat. If that's not your thing, they encourage you to call ahead and get a feel for the wait time. Whatever it is, though, wait. It's worth it :)  We've tried the Summer rolls (4 to an order, with a few great fried chips plus a savory, light chili sauce for dipping) as well as the Crab Ragoon dip and both were top notch. So good you will consider ordering them as meals the next time you come in!  The Burgiri is just an orgasm in your mouth waiting to happen. So just try it and thank me later, OK? The actual sushi rolls are the freshest I've tasted in Charlotte - between the basic rolls (cali, philly) and the more complex specialty rolls, they're beautiful, well constructed and amazingly flavorful. A tip would be to ask the waiter to have it cut into 10 pieces - the rolls are a bit too big otherwise to fit in one bite!  I have not had the milkshakes yet, but will make that my priority when I go back (again) tonight!   Ah, it's admittedly hard for me to write this review - can words truly fail me? I believe so - the moral of the story is go. Go try The Cowfish. Run, Drive and Speed towards in as soon as you can.

Q49_HW7Sog8Z6R9GT0AMxA.text: The Cowfish is a very unique restaurant that incorporates sushi and hamburgers. You can order sushi or burgers depending on what you prefer, I feel that this option can help those who don't like sushi (or never tried it) a chance to try it again. The sushi itself is very good, but it's a little on the pricey side. This is an excellent place to take someone who's unsure about sushi, but if you're looking for a lot of sushi at a reasonable price you can find the same quality of sushi somewhere else at a cheaper price.

QOhLiZPT97wMrLBGL0xJnQ.text: I love Cowfish! Just a heads up though, there is often a long wait for dinner on the weekends.

f4g39PrQT2lGHtHkRpopeA.text: My entourage (or was I part of the entourage?) decided to stop by The Cowfish for more food after the Yama yelp event.  I vetoed, but then no one ever listen to me :p So to The Cowfish we went.   Instead of being disappointed by their food again, I went for the $5 martini special as my entree.  The chocolate dipped fortune cookie martini was GRRREAT!  It was recommended as one of the stronger ones, and I was pleasantly impressed.  The presentation was cute, with a fortune cookie on the rim.  And 10oz was a good portion. I tasted a bite or two of the Arnold Hamandegger burger, and a few pieces of miscellenous sushi.  I have to say, their burgers are better than the sushi.   We're now back to 3 stars... a-ok, all because of the martini and the burger.

gF4XDRMHBRIsOrtY1OCRTQ.text: Amazing food. Love the combination of sushi and burgers. The bento box is definitely the way to go. Only gave 4 stars because it's pretty pricey.

xYalBdoNUE-1U66K5enU8g.text: The first time I came here I did not have a good experience.  I won't go into detail, but ya, didn't stray too far from the bano the next day.  I had their big sushi platter with burgushi and other chef's choices.  The second time was better.  I got the mid-grade bento box.  I like the sushi, burger combo and it had some nice sides.  I like the cucumber salad the best.

He4vEvvx5Mt7yLMmzasJlg.text: I had the top three sushi rolls at the sushi bar. All three were amazing and the service was excellent. However, I recommend you get your rolls a little smaller than they come they were a little hard to eat

VA9BPiKlXiEVroreum96iQ.text: Awesome place for lunch or dinner!  Gracious sized patio allows for great patio dining on a nice fall or spring day.  The taste explosion has become a staple for me here but I most recently tried the tuna bacon sandwich for lunch and was amazed.  It's a little tricky to keep from falling apart but otherwise perfection.  The interiors are full of what I would liken to Warhal (sp) type artwork and really cool in my opinion.  Another cool thing is the huge fish tank that actually contains 'cowfish', really neat!  So why not 5 star? I'm a pretty simple person in general and if I had one suggestion to give it would be lessen the choices to choose from on the menu.  Too much to look at and really overwhelming to me.

2M_P_2oG116BnwfOtbuyEQ.text: The burgushi is awesome. Definitely recommend the Taste Explosion roll. It's named appropriately since the varying flavors hit your tongue at different times. Fun to sit at the bar too. Energy in this place is great.

OMKJTWdtL8N3mpbIltlCmQ.text: After living in Charlotte for a short period of time, I haven't had the opportunity to visit many local businesses. But let me say this: Good luck to all of the restaurants out there living up to the awesomeness that is Cowfish. Yes, it really deserves five stars and my "Woohoo!"  The decor of Cowfish (including an image of a fat Elvis in a kimono eating a burger) is trendy, cool, and fun, just like the items on its menu. Both the food and drink options are fairly extensive, plus there are daily specials . I opted for the turkey burger, but let it be known that it wasn't the run-of-the-mill kind. This burger, presented on a whole wheat bun, was topped with brie, cranberries, and applies. Fancy shmancy and healthy!  Oh, and before you leave, make sure to take a tour of the boys or girls room. If your meal failed to do so, at least the audio from the restroom speakers might make you smile.

UTpg2su36QGAk9Qf9yU8Jw.text: The sushi and maki rolls were average. The burger was pretty tasty though. The concept of burgers and sushi is a fun one but it would be less gimmicky if the quality of the sushi were better.

nVZS7_lwHkvU17Dut6-k7w.text: First off it's just an awesome concept! Had their version of a bento box and everything was delicious! The beer selection is decent enough and the speciality cocktails sounded very good. I will definitely have to try them when I go back!

WC8wuvEEjTKje9MnxpZQjQ.text: Best sushi place in Charlotte! I always take my family there when they come to visit. It's kid friendly and the service is great. There aren't many places around that have an Asian cuisine in addition to American. The dragon roll is my absolute favorite.

vo8D6_I49TlR1Qh5WEetCw.text: As it was my first trip to Charlotte, my boss treated me to the Cowfish for lunch on a Saturday. It is located right next to South Park mall on an intersection so you won't miss it.   The restaurant is spacious with some interesting artwork and paintings. My personal favorite was a painting of a Chinese Buddha with a Elvis face on it.  The restaurant is famous for both their burgers and sushi, especially the fusion of the two, and the name is? wait for it...."Bergushi"!   Coming from an Asian background, never would I have thought sushi and burgers would go well together, so I had to give it a try!!!  I ordered their popular Bergushi-- "Taste Explosion"! The plate had sushi rolls evenly spread out, topped with different sauces with a hint of pesto on top. The rolls looked like as if their were fried, but it's actually the tempura crust (which is deep-fried).   First of all, the dish looked amazing, and as I put it in my mouth, the taste LITERALLY EXPLODED in my mouth. The burger meat with different veggies and a layer of bacon wrapped around by the tempura sushi rice, The beef, sushi rice, celery, carrots, onion, bacon, pesto, slice of tomato...etc, all come together and bust in your mouth!! I'd say the name of the dish is incredibly fitting.  Overall it was a very, very enjoyable experience, I definitely had a "foodgasm." Can't wait to go back again!!

lnI39n_SfChppH_w6a5bJA.text: Run of the mill higher end sushi joint. They did have some interesting combinations but overall pretty good food.

xxRHJaKlJAF7-h41SWD2NQ.text: Burgushi ! What a concept !!! But this place is always crazy busy :( hated the long wait out in the cold. Next time I'm getting a reservation.   Wednesday's they also have 1/2 off bottles, so make it date night you won't regret it :)

85QrG0v5DUBKQWUgn_KBbw.text: Awful awful awful. You'd think that a restaurant at southpark mall would be a little better. Terrible, slow service weather you're at the bar rail or a table. Food is not that great, I ordered burger sliders that came out so rare they were basically bleeding out on the plate I ate half of one and feel nauseous now. Way to overpriced. Save your money and go somewhere else. I really wanna like this place but it has disappointed me too many times.

PSL1-Vma2cTIi4hEplcL-w.text: Hands down one of the BEST places to get sushi in Charlotte. I always sit at the bar because the wait is so long, and we consistently get amazing service!!! I typically do the custom sushi.. Edamame, Fried pickles, sauteed veggies are all good starters. I promise the Fried pickles taste like a cheeseburger!! Apple wontons are a win as well for dessert! I live in Huntersville, and it's well worth the drive to South Charlotte.

-DgqQfmZbe_fQZbYFJkvog.text: I've been to cowfish multiple times and it has never let me down I usually get a bento box because it has the most variety, the sushi tastes fresh and delicious and the sweet potato fries are thick like steak fries and those are delicious too. The burgers have amazing flavors and the beef is nice and tender. If you're in the south park area you should definitely take a trip to cowfish cause it is soooo worth every penny!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento box with and ez rainbow roll

i0-pv0pT9EiGGlci9a3w2A.text: our fav family place - usually one if not more's request for a birthday dinner, and a place we take visitors and family in town.  Fantastic burgers and sushi, things you won't find elsewhere. Highly recommend

WHdVazwcOHKrwphGgzr0Lw.text: Up to the hype!...come prepared to wait for a table. Kind of annoying to see a bunch of of open tables while you wait to get a table...but they base the wait time on the amount of staff and being able to serve you not the amount of tables. Sushi is on par with the best around and so are the burgers. A bit on the expensive side, but worth the cash as the food and service warrant the extra $$.

O_GfMC1-4WTlueYFfoAnuw.text: Love this place! Other than the long wait, it never disappoints. Everything is delicious on the menu. Some of the best burgers I have ever had.

vYOMWF1sa9EHIYBrCRD5Zw.text: This place was AMAZING. My boyfriend and I had a layover in Charlotte so we decided to stop by. We sat at the bar and ordered the black ahi tuna nachos, the firecracker and prime time sushi rolls as recommended by the our bartender Kelsey. Very glad we listened as everything was delicious. We cleaned the plates. Besides the food, the service was also five stars. From the hostess at the front, Kelsey (bartender) to the manager, everyone was so genuine and made our dinner experience wonderful. Will be recommending this place to everyone I know and wishing it was in DC! If I ever have a layover in Charlotte again I will be coming back :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Cowfish!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Decor -
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black Tuna nachos

SHQNLVkl_bL67YZF0OLhIA.text: Asian American sushi burger fusion - what a wonderful idea! I was skeptical, but it really works. I had the taste explosion burgushi - DELICIOUS!! And, don't forget that Wednesday night is 1/2 price bottles of wine! (Thank you for that tip, fellow Yelper!) We had a large party of 8 and everyone was very delighted with their food. We got varieties of burgers, appetizers, and the burgushis. Everyone was thrilled. Two people in our dining party are regulars and swear by the place. Our server was wonderful and very attentive. One thing we noted - the cheesecake was not overly sweet. This was a delightful surprise!  Can't say enough. It was great!

zAebpPN3HPUdWNPSGHNyuA.text: Recommended by Urber driver.  Sushi and burgers with a great wine list, you have all you need. Place is packed with a 30 min wait at 8 PM. Shasmi 3 piece chef choice fresh and excellant. Firecracker roll is great but the Blackened Tuna roll will sliced Jalapeno blows you away!! Awesome will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice bar

8A8MpdM5lDkZTvQX6ILZ6w.text: Great experience. It started with the wait staff and worked its way through the food. We started with the Spicy Poke Dip, very good. Then we shared the Premium Combo Platter. Between the two, more than my wife and I could eat.   Will come back again, the best compliment I can give.

IHSvSVcuvslUmbhgYE9-Jg.text: We've always liked this place, even though I thought they were crazy with a burger/sushi restaurant concept at first.  But it works!  The food is good, the menu has something for everyone, the portions are large (for those who like that) and the flavors are generally very good.  We've been hooked on the bento boxes and tend to get those as we can't make up our minds for a single item.  The bento boxes include a slider, sushi, Asian cucumber salad, edamame and sweet potato or regular fries.  My only criticism is that the sushi chefs sometimes lack the necessary fish cutting skills and cut the fish too thickly (sorry, but in the case of sushi, bigger is not better).  But Cowfish is a solid choice with consistent quality.   The large rear patio is also a great dining option.

1Sm1_2ZHgpz0kzHFC6K0WQ.text: My favorite restaurant hands down- if you haven't had you you must. This place is also really good if your new to sushi!

3px84S0nPZx5xo0CRkzhHQ.text: 3rd time here. 3 times poor service or food quality. I think it's all back of the house. This time, fire alarm went off for 5 minutes, under cooked sliders, over cooked eggs, over cooked chicken, a burger half well done the other have medium rare and cold food. But at least it only took an hour to get it.   A shame menu sounds good and when they execute, it can be good

6w3-S8aDxhhdeIzjMTrWnQ.text: Cool place with good food but over rated. Been there 3 times and it's been consistent in food quality. Long wait, crowded bar...for me I can find a better bar, better burger and better sushi too. But not  all in the same place, so if you need sushi and burgers at the same time,  this is the only place I know of in Clt. I like this place in spite of the yuppie crowds that frequent it. Service can be slow but food is prepared well. I would go back.

BrOoCIB2v4t0cDXa2r3aWA.text: OMG you have to try the crab ragoon dip, it's amazing!!!! I had the veggie burger which was delicious, definitely recommend.

vWx57z02FaP6s95pQtlI4A.text: Their menu is overwhelming...in a fantastic sort of way. Having lived in Los Angeles for some years now, I wasn't quite looking forward to trying out a sushi/asian fusion joint in Charlotte. My parents insisted it was good so my husband and I gave it a go. I have to say that the fish tasted fresh and all our cut rolls were very flavorful and densely packed with fish and other misc ingredients. I recommend the tuna martini and any of their special rolls. My husband got the sushi burger which was probably about 3/5 stars - tasty but nothing out of the ordinary as you would expect from the description. The bento boxes are a great way to try different items if you like variety, and the quality is up there. I especially liked the thai cucumber salad - I even ordered two.   Give this place a try. It's one of the best asian fusion restaurants in Charlotte so far. The only drawback is the long wait time...at least 30 mins even on a Sunday night at 8pm.

kZpwTvhbuX8rKfXkSFzuaA.text: Moo-(don't know what sound a fish makes so I am making a kissy face for sound effects, or water splashing?).  I have been going to Cowfish for over 2 years. It is the perfect spot for taking your visitors when they don't know exactly what they want. It's even better for the "weirdos" (no offense) who don't like sushi but could go for a burger. It has the best of both worlds and even options for veggie heads.  This time was a tad different because we were given a pet fish to watch "grow" as we waited. The premise was that when the fish got big enough it was then "caught" and our table was ready (a pic of our fish was uploaded, Mackerel Jordan). For those of us that are easily amused, it was very entertaining.   As promised, after a 20 minute wait (be prepared to wait AT LEAST an hour if you come on a Friday/Saturday evening) we were sat on the back patio. Despite the fact that it was quite warm outside, we thoroughly enjoyed our meal:   Appetizer: crab rangoon dip (it's like a crab wonton undone its warm gooey-ness is absolutely delicious)  Burger: Porky's Revenge (Half-pound beef burger, pulled pork, smoked gouda cheese, onion strings, bacon coleslaw, BBQ sauce, lettuce, pickles, brioche bun) OMG da BOMB for pulled pork lovers like me!  Bento: The Ultimate Brento Box (A combo meal featuring both burger and sushi, including a double-stack version of the featured mini-burger of the week, sweet potato fries, Thai cucumbers, edamame and the guest's choice of a 4 piece premium Fusion Specialty roll [Firecracker, The Boss or Blackened Tuna Roll]) It is perfect (not the perfect size for everyone as it is a small portion) for that person who wants the best of both worlds!  Sushi: Bagel Roll (Smoked salmon, kani, cream cheese roll battered and flash fried, topped with sweet eel sauce) Honestly, cream cheese on ANY roll is amazing, you won't regret it!  No I didn't eat ALL of this by myself, I shared a "bite" with everyone! And no I didn't drink THIS time but, last plug I promise, the Cheeky Monkey Martini was great! Seriously, no one regrets Cowfish (well your wallet might hence the four stars, check out prices before you come)!  Thank me later,  You're welcome!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bagel roll: Smoked salmon, kani, cream cheese roll battered and flash fried, topped with sweet eel sauce. You&#39;re welcome!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The crab Rangoon dip is my go to favorite for an appetizer! It is absolutely amazing! You&#39;re welcome.
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. This was our cute little guy was our waiting &#34;fish.&#34; He kept us company while waiting to be seated.

qZIdZxFWX5p6Ww9S7lu_8w.text: Not a fan of their sushi. (Bricktops has the best in Charlotte) but they have amazing calamari, their tuna nachos are sooo good, and I love their Oreo milkshake, it's a fun atmosphere. But not worth an hour wait so get there early or go for lunch! they don't take reservations!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oreo milkshake

MvpzwbTKELxaKzMZerY55g.text: Cowfish's customer service manager got in touch with me after this review, and refunded my meal.  Thanks, but I'd rather that you guys replace the $450 purse your maintenance guy ruined with spray paint.

8ANQKpVoWSRfVdDzaYRWwQ.text: I decided to go here with a friend after hearing rave reviews from everyone I know who has visited.  We went here on a Wednesday night, so it wasn't very crowded, as I have heard it can get on the weekends. We sat outside, and immediately were greeted by our waitress and she took the time to thoroughly explain the menu (and that the rolls are entree sized)  after we told her we were first time visitors.  We got the edamame and crab rangoon dip as appetizers, and they were amazing!  They were brought out relatively quick, and did not disappoint.  As far as entrees, we got mark's Roll, the volcanic rolls, and a few others.  They were rather large as the waitress has told us (I even ended up taking some home... and I NEVER have leftover sushi lol).  They tasted really good, but the volcanic and mark's roll were my favorites out of what we had.    All in all, it was an excellent experience!! Another thing that contributed to my rating was the attitude of the staff.  They were all very helpful, and available (which is a big deal with me).  Even the manager Kevin came over, and it wasnt the normal "how was your meal?" And then off to the next table.  He actually took the time to ask us about details of our experience,  made some recommendations for our next visit, thanked us for trying it for the first time, asked about our service, and really seemed to care about every aspect of our dining experience.  It really takes a lot to impress me with service, and this really stuck out to me.  So i am glad that I tried it, and will definitely recommend to anyone visitng Charlotte!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Edamame

8F8y1rWyKmmyOqiyPv8oCQ.text: Went for the first time, my food was delish, I would recommend this place to sushi lovers. The Calamari is THE BOMB, so good!!! I love Mark's roll too

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great sushi

ZkpnryjvMVB60H0Ug99wIA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! The food and drinks are awesome. I love the overall atmosphere. And the service is always great.

iTjgqZYW0heew3kpOomJMw.text: I love this restaurant! I've been here a few times and never had something that I didn't love! There can be a bit of a wait, especially if you come on a Friday or Saturday night. But they have a great outdoor area! Our service was fantastic and our waiter was very attentive. He left water at our table but always noticed when we were low and come and refill our glasses for us. I'd recommend any of the meat sushi. I've had both Doug's filet and the bacon double cheeseburger sushi and they were both very good. Their regular sushi is good as well but not anything I would rave about. Milkshakes were also really good but big so I'd recommend splitting one.

HUl0A0moXugt9WgqKhpJ2g.text: Excellent customer service and even better food. I had the premium bento box which featured the Local Yokel burger and the Crab Cake roll. Sooooo delicious! Best burger I've ever had, no question.   Cool vibe/environment for being located in a mall.

c6O8zhps5L6E9RLoXvefAQ.text: Concept is unique but strange, it's basically a fusion of sushi and hamburgers.  Yes, it's just as strange as it sounds.  I tried their bento box which included the slider of the day and sushi options, and my buddy ordered just sushi.  We both felt that the sushi was average and the slider was a bit dry.  We offered their top selling appetizer, the crab dip, and there was very little crab and a lot of mayo and/or sour cream.  Service was great, atmosphere is like a chainy sports bar.  Would not repeat if I was craving sushi or a burger.  Didn't buy into the concept.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

d90d6SfuibjJ4YJG8zrlIA.text: Giving this place 4/5 o lay because my food was not all the way hot. But everything was an amazing first time experience.  Food: I ordered the Bento box with jalapeno burger and philly roll. The fries were ok and the cucumber mix was really good. Everyone at my table ordered the same thing with different burgers and sushi. Also my daughter ordered the Mac and cheese, which had a cute set up.   Waiter: I love great customer service. We had a large party so everyone was accommodated. And we had 4 small kids- what a task.  Atmosphere: I could see this as a date night, place to meet singles, family restaurant or possible solo mission. Really nice bar selection and tv's.   Most importantly the concept of burgers and sushi typically wouldn't sound interesting but give it a try, you might be surprised like I was.   Thanks for reading!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kids Mac and cheese
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mini jalapeños burger with fried philly
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ginger martini!! Really good if you like ginger

EOg7O0JdH6CkPYRnIGc3sw.text: I have a difficult time with places like this.  On one hand, the food is pretty darn good and yes I'm a fan.  On the other hand, I hate paying the upscale price for food when I don't have to.  This is one of those upscale places where the food costs more than I prefer but apparently I paid for the quality I received.  The sushi roll I had was pretty good and filling.  I can't remember what I ordered but I know it was near that bottom of the menu and with tax, it cost me $18.40 or so.  I can say the roll was so big, it was easier to mix my wasabi and soy sauce in the dish and pour it on my roll than to dip my roll in the wasabi and soy sauce mixture.  I figured I'd need to stop elsewhere afterwards to get some more food because of the price but once the roll was consumed, I was satisfied and full.  This is one of those trendy food joints I'd visit on rare occasions.  If the rare occasion arose and this was an option, I would visit without hesitation.

SJHAvBe1ZFHfwdUZlz9Mjg.text: Don't be deterred by the strange sounding combo of burgers and sushi! The way they integrate the raw (sushi) with the cooked (burgers) is masterfully done, and more importantly, DELICIOUS. Now THIS is how "Asian Fusion" is done!  Service was also outstanding -- thanks to Jamie and Scottie in particular for making our visit exceptional! We wish we lived in Charlotte so we could be frequent fliers here... Cowfish will just have to open a location in the Northeast!

32DFmAdV7gGgdpbaKRxLHw.text: This place is amazing. It's my go to when I'm in the Charlotte area. There is usually a pretty long wait since it's so popular but if it's just a couple of people your best bet is to find a spot at the bar. My husband and I have gotten lucky twice now and arrived as soon as someone getting up. The service is fast, the drinks are good and the sushi is to die for. I would highly recommend "Doug's Roll" it's a surf and turf type roll that has blue fin tuna and rare filet mignon. Give this place a shot. You won't regret it.

cBFT0QXJ-rKIKVhsO51FZw.text: Decided to give the Cowfish another shot and it was definitely worth it...  This time, I had the Bento box with the Taste Explosion roll (Ground beef, bacon, jalapenos and cream sauce inside a roll)...  It wasn't as spicy as I expected, but it was a solid roll... I think I'm still partial to the Deliverance, though... lol The sweet potato fries were super duper hot which was fantastic... The vegetables and edamame were just as delicious as I remembered... The burger was pretty good as well... I have learned, however, that I do not like cream cheese on my burgers... lol  The boyfriend came with and was incredibly impressed with his Pittsburgoo-shi sandwich... Filet mignon with pastrami, fries, multiple cheeses and red onions with a Dijon sauce...  The bun?  It's made out of sushi wraps filled with rice... Crazy... I guess it was frickin awesome because he didn't offer me any... lol    The service was great... I think the server's name this time was Steven... We had cool seating, next to the bar which was great because we could watch the game as well... Fabulous.  So it seems the first visit was not a typical experience... Looks like they put themselves back on my map... Way to go, Cowfish!

lCt5FQFc81VDYmvRwOYN4w.text: Amazing, great rolls of every variety you could imagine.  Wait staff is very attentative.  Highly recommended, you will return again.

MmHz7C-lfk1n9kT37QT3kg.text: I happened to be in the SouthPark area around lunch-time last week and decided I had a hankering for some yummy Cowfish. I went for the fusion bento box and was very pleased.  For my slider, they were happy to sub a turkey burger instead of the beef.  The burger of the day was some sort of concoction with jalapeno pepper. IT was perfectly seasoned and grilled. Yummo!     Also included in my bento box was a serving of sweet potato fries which were perfectly seasoned & cooked.  The other compartments included Edamame, cucumber salad, and 3 pieces of Nigri sushi. The Nigri included Tuna, salmon, and shrimp with a small portion of pickled ginger and wasabi.   All of this deliciousness can be had for $14... well worth it in my opinion!    On the day of my visit, I was there just after the lunch hour rush, and because I was alone, I chose to just sit at the bar. The bartender was very helpful and attentive.   I really wish there were a Cowfish closer to my home & work in Ballantyne!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fusion Bento Box

SZSFNn8B3EEVyTW5aTwtWA.text: I'm not a huge sushi person I do admit, but omg the burgers and fries here are sooooo good! Fun place for a drink too!

T_Yn6Oid5cN8kXlL9weSmg.text: This place is amazing. Hubby suggested we try Cowfish again after a subpar experience at the Raleigh location. So glad we did because this experience redeemed my previous visit.   We arrived around 4pm on a Saturday and were seated right away since the patio had quite a few open tables. We order the Crab Rangoon as an appetizer since a lot of fellow Yelpers suggested it and boy was it amazing!!! We had that along with some cocktails and it was truly an enjoyable dinner. I ordered a bento box and my husband ordered the yellowfin tuna. We were both pleased with our selection and left as happy campers. Will definitely return here when I'm in Charlotte again.

8eMbdhig5SyxA_1CNd-yaQ.text: Hamburgers and sushi on the same plate? Signed me up. The sushi is top-shelf. Burgers equally as good. Great atmosphere and attentive staff. Always a wait- plan accordingly. Probably $$$ rather than the $$ listed here.

jJSO_HMln3kRkq3tX44T7g.text: i came here for one purpose and one purpose only, i wanted fresh sashimi since last week Mai Express Japanese restaurant tried to pawn off smoked salmon as fresh salmon. Beach what?!? Shame of them! ANYWAY, i yelped "sashimi" and since i was already in South Park Mall this restaurant came up. Of course i do my visual reading of image after image and decided, yup, this is it.   Upon arrival it was before the dinner rush i wasn't quickly acknowledged but maybe they thought i was waiting for someone. No, I was there solo. I have no friend out in charlotte but i do have class so yay me and my "just me" seating arrangement.   After being seated my waiter took care of me throughout my entire dining visit. I ordered just the 9 piece sashimi and man, it made up for the mess that Mai Restaurant dealt me. Presentation itself would be good enough for a few stars but since they had fresh sashimi and good service, 5 stars it is! I'd definitely hit this place up again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The 9 piece sashimi

xtV1Dgd-IJqwnu238hgoAA.text: Eeeks. Me thinks not.  Sorry, but if you know your sushi/rolls, I wouldn't come here. The well known crab ragoon appetizer on the other hand was pretty good.  The herb fries? nah..  Roll I ordered? eeesk.  The manager took the roll off of the check, which I appreciated it, yes you cannot make every one happy, but I expected a lot more than squished rice on a rolls. I am very picky on how the rolls are made, and how much of a pressure is being applied when you roll the rolls. (No pun intended)  Will I go back? Probably not, if I ever do I will be ordering a burger most likely.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Closer up
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Looked good until I tasted it..
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Not worth it. it&#39;s regular string fries..

A4p0xbDXuN7K-Og_QBWBgA.text: Favorite spot for crazy fresh sushi! Nothing ever disappoints us and servers are extra knowledgeable and suggestions are spot on.  Sit at the bar, beats 20 minute waits, waits are common and if just two of you, hit the bar.  I never can remember names of the rolls, but go off the normal path and you will be impressed.  Appetizers are great, nothing but happy faces in this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rolls are phenomenal!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Appetizer served well chilled with a bit of heat!

ypH9e32mRODnKbcE9mzWPQ.text: When I travel for work I like to check out the spots the get talked up. I saw several reviews and the Levi was interesting so I figured why not? Great idea. I wish I had more time to go back and try their other strange burgers.   I got the burger with flambe banana, peanut butter, bacon and cheese. Personally I loved it. Flavors were so oddly complementary. I should note I make smoothies regularly with bananas and peanut butter, if you don't really love them try a different one ;p  Aside from great food the atmosphere was excellent, the beer selection was great (I had Wooden Robot's Chocolate Stout) and my waitress was very attentive and actually hung out quite a bit and shot the shit as I was there late and by myself.   I'd definitely recommend it to any burger connoisseurs who want some odd but excellent combinations.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 pound Hunka! Beef, flambé banana, peanut butter, bacon, cheese. Win.

Yqye_VeXpmcRPoYQwLf0kg.text: I came here for one reason and one reason only... the Nature Boy's Woooo-shi Buffalooooo-shi Roll!  I don't care that it may not be traditional sushi.  I'm a Ric Flair fan, and once I knew this existed, I knew I was going to search this out in my recent trip to Charlotte.    I'm a dork that way.    Anyway, I can't speak to the rest of the food here.  But that roll was tremendous.  Great chipotle kick to the bison meat, great construction to the roll, wonderful flavor all around.    I may never eat it again.  But I'm glad I got to eat it once.  WHOOOOOO!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. WHOOOOOO

CiWpS9KGocUj1zIiYoX6jw.text: I try something different every time I go and have never been disappointed. The burgers, 1/2 lb. not including whatever marvelous concoction comes with it, are incredibly juicy and satisfying. The sides are fresh and delicious. Try the bento boxes for a little less meat, but a "whole lotta" taste! The bento boxes include one artisan mini burger, choice of sushi, and several sides of choice (my favorites are the sweet potato fries and edamame).  My little kids love the food and atmosphere too.  To avoid long waits, come at off-peak hours (11-11:50 AM; 4:30-5:30 PM)

FTfXoDTDUtKJEstnVkcL8A.text: Let me start by saying I love the food at Cowfish and so I was really disappointed by my last experience there. I went to Cowfish with a friend and ordered a bottle of white wine. The wine came out lukewarm, and when we asked the server if she could bring out a colder bottle her response was that "They get feedback all the time that the wine is not cold and that was the best she could do." Later on we saw a table visiting with someone who had a birthday. It was my friend's birthday dinner, so we told the server while my friend went to the restroom. The server simply said "Oh, that's nice." And didn't do anything special for my friend. She couldn't have forgotten we told her since we asked to cover the bottle of wine as something for our friend's birthday. Overall, we felt like the server was very impatient, had a negative attitude, and was not willing to do anything extra. Again, delicious food, but room for improvement when it comes to the wait staff.

gpTs3GX-9xqNCqG0z8VdKQ.text: AWESOME! Burgers are fantastic and sushi is great. Try blackend ahi tuna nachos and ask for crab Rangoon dip. Stellar service - no Reuben on menu but mom really wanted one so they created it. Download their very clever app and you can get on the wait list before you arrive. Our new favorite place for lunch and dinner.

1VsifjDCniwMCQ6lOtL77w.text: Hostess is way too snotty. Menu is way too big. Servers are way too rushed (they really wanna' turn & burn your table). And food is way too pricey for what you get. Will go back if someone else reeeeeaaally wants to go, but otherwise - will feel belittled and rushed for less money somewhere else.

tzjQNNytw6_-1xh-NgDJ4Q.text: Went to Cowfish in South Park area, for the first time last night, after hearing rave reviews from friends, including a Sushi Chef in Cary NC.  I have to say that I was not disappointed and was impressed with the food and the service.

XY8zl1171UCVTQ9bagH9mA.text: the place is very good...I am not still a fan of Sushi. I tried three dishes in one night! But I need some work to get into Japanese cuisine style, I guess! Will try later again and correct the rating..

NtIchI91YyXrah-vhNQCxQ.text: We stopped here before heading to the mall.  Our waiter recommended the bento box. I tried the bento box with the blackened tuna roll. The roll was good. The burger was excellent, the roasted red peppers and pesto were very flavorful. My wife had the sesame tuna. Great presentation of the food. Service was fast and our food came out very quick as well. We had tried to eat here for dinner the previous evening but it was busy with over 2 hr wait. I would definitely eat here for lunch again.

d6wDyKlRv8bLE2L-l3nBEA.text: Excellent sushi, one of the best in the area. I will always choose sushi over burgers so no comment on how those are. Unique sushi choices if you want to have a creative meal. Brilliant concept. We got the kings roll and the R&R - both excellent. Crab was not the best quality, although you cannot expect more from a non-coastal city. The wait is always atrocious because they do not take reservations. Got a vanilla cake milkshake as a togo dessert and it was decent, still not as good as cookout ;)

mET6OARojbpx13gkdzpRrw.text: I guess 3rd time's the charm! I put in a reservation for 6:45 on a Sunday after getting convinced to come. We were seated right away, food came out right on time. At first I felt the drink prices were a little high but they are ridiculously strong. And depending on the day they have pretty decent drink specials.  Our server Steven was an awesome help and tipped me off to some great things on the menu, along with being super friendly. I noticed that they also have hired more people to clear plates, and refill drinks, I like that. I'm inclined to think that the bad service last time was just a fluke and it seems like they do listen to customer concerns.   Definitely recommended and I plan on returning often here for my sushi fix as it is super fresh!

6th3BLNSELQNV-GFKv4eBw.text: I saw the concept of sushi and burgers and was instantly intrigued. Two of my favorite things! The wait clearly told me that people felt the same way. I ordered the Fusion Specialty Bento Box. It included a roll of my choice (Mark's) and the slider of the week. Food didn't take terribly long to arrive despite being so packed. The slider was average. I enjoyed the gorgonzola spread it came with but there was hardly enough on there to truly comment on it. The patty itself was decent, but not spectacular. The sushi roll was good. I really like inside-out rolls. The wasabi mayo added a good level of heat but I could have used with more fish. The sides were also mediocre. Sweet potato fries -- while tasty, not very creative. My friend got one of the hybrid rolls with beef inside and cheese on top, coming as a recommendation from the waitress. I guess being used to the coolness of raw fish the warm sushi was a strange sensation. They use chopped beef which kind of falls apart in your mouth and the thick fry breading makes it difficult to eat more than one or two.   Overall, I thought service was helpful and patient with us. We were a pretty indecisive bunch. However, I found the restaurant misty kitschy and probably not somewhere I would frequent. It's definitely a place to visit once but the food is not that interesting in execution.

zfg5ZXS04CTLVwdsrKo1vg.text: I love how unique the menu is. I'm usually not one to stray from traditional burgers, but the combos here are enough to entice me outside of my comfort zone. The pimento cheese burger, lamb burger, and bison burger are all tasty detours from the norm. It can be a bit noisy and crowded (at least the times I've been there), so take that into consideration if a quiet ambiance better suits your mood.

BiJROa8vJrejJijyZ1JZkw.text: Alright, so we've been back several times now and it really has grown on me. i've now had the burgushi (Taste Explosion Roll) twice and it is really good and honestly is a unique mix/"explosion" of taste with beef, jalapeno, cheese, bacon, spicy sauce, inside a sushi roll with a Roma tomato on top. i can finally feel like a cool sushi eater without holding back my gag reflex or pretending i enjoy the texture of raw salmon in my mouth. Don't forget to ask for 10 pieces instead of 8. Last time i nearly choked and seriously burgushied all over the table when i started laughing right after shoving the huge roll in my mouth.  The appetizers we've had have all been good. My favorite was the potstickers which i don't see on their online menu at the moment? The crab rangoon dip was also good and the Sweets, Sticks and Strings seem like a steal for $5 to split.   Sidenote: We also really liked the wanton soup that was not available today unfortunately.   We got there just before the lunch crowd and enjoyed the closed in/covered patio with heaters. They definitely have a great outdoor space come spring. We'll definitely keep coming back and if you're visiting us from out of town, start studying the menu because we'll be taking you there before you leave.

W1MXSbKSsn-pRXX3UNd5Rw.text: Had lunch at 3pm today. I had the Swiss chicken sandwich with onion strings as my side. Very good, sizable portion. My wife had the Ahi Tuna salad which was very  good. Martinis were well done, red wine a bit too warm. Good cheesecake, huge slice.

YTj727TJJ4Dw7c45A_Xirw.text: Awesome food!  I got the Truffled Cheeseburger, and it was possibly the best burger I have had!  My husband got a miniburger sushi combo, and he was impressed by both, and will order the sushi roll again.  Best sweet potato fries i have had anywhere, and the Tomagoshi shrimp were very tasty!

V51OB1eJ4ZEBjhNPjPYQEg.text: Amazing! Had the Surf and Turf (beef inside the roll with seafood on top) and Ahi Burger. The beef/sushi fusion is so tasty and a cool concept. Great sauces and good service!

vqibdNLvlIZipSJHCbj7Pw.text: Fun atmosphere, good food, though often difficult to get a table.

k6ftUj0MhQtdidzFnzeMtw.text: I live in the land of creative restaurants and this was just too much for me.  As a single diner I loved it because of the touchscreens at the sushi bar that allowed me to read the NYT while I ate. But the menu was overwhelming a la cheesecake factory style. I think the idea is amazing, but they should scale the menu down and focus on improving their food (which was good, but not great).

69N92aaLj9vDcmaF12kqxg.text: My husband, our 1 year old, and I  are in the area visiting my brother and his family this weekend. We decided to eat here Friday night and it was a huge mistake. Every one of us that ate sushi with shrimp in it have been violently throwing up with body aches and stomach cramps since around midnight the night we ate there. I'm so mad, it's been a nightmare. I would give this place zero stars if I could!!!

U3PV3FzQOG2xoP15D4JCwQ.text: After giving it another chance, my wife and I went back. Instead of waiting 2 hours for a table, we selectively chose to wait for a bar seat. After 20 minutes we got one and this time the food was great, not just good.

QXRLvDQszU-zONGWUlrDkQ.text: I went here with family back way back during Christmas time.  I love the funky atmosphere when you walk in.  It was a busy friday night so we had to wait for a table.  This gave us a chance to get a few drinks at the bar, they had a good beer selection.    We were sat after a short wait and really enjoyed the calamari appetizer.  For an entree I ordered the the whats shakin' tuna bacon sandwich.  That was a DELISH! The bun was filled with Kani and Rice.  Made for a great sandwich sushi combo.
