I had also tried the suchi roll my brother ordered and that was also delish.    I never tried the burgers but next time I stop I will probably give them a try.  My 3 year old daughter really enjoyed the chicken tenders as well.  Which says a lot considering she is the pickiest eater.

UNA1vu3-EdPXZOl87Njwcg.text: I have been here twice so far, and I love looking at the cowfish (which I didn't know was an actual fish) in their aquarium. I had great service both times-- the waitresses were very sweet and accomodating. I really enjoyed the Spider roll, but not a big fan of the Burgushi (burger and sushi combined-the flavor was quite strange). The second time I went, a homeless dude walked into the restaurant and blatantly stole a bottle of wine and a 6 pack of beer from the bar...and there were customers and employees right there! Some waiters stopped him as he was trying to escape...it was so bizarre... Nevetheless, I would definitely be coming in again for their great food!

wMpymQQExoTKAUfkDHWhLQ.text: My husband, daughter and I visited Cowfish for the first time on New Year's Eve around 5pm. We were greeted by the host opening the door for us and the hostess sat us right away. We had Chris as our server and after mentioning it was our first time here, he took the time to explain everything on the menu and recommended some of his favorites. It was starting to get pretty busy in the restaurant and we really appreciated Chris taking his time to explain the menu to us. We never felt rushed. After placing our order our toddler's food was brought out pretty quickly (thank goodness for that because kids don't like to wait). My husbands and my food was brought out within 10-15min. We both ordered a bento box and it was fantastic! The cucumber salad is to die for. Also, we ordered a PB&J sandwich for my daughter and they rolled it up to look like a piece of sushi-super creative and she was excited to eat it. Before we left the manager, Christie, came to our table to introduce herself and ask how our meal was. She said she heard it was our first time and gave us a coupon for our next visit. Although the restaurant was super busy at the time, Christie took her time to speak with us and ask us about our visit. You can really tell Christie and Chris are passionate about people and where they work and we will most certainly be back again soon. Hopefully to have Chris again as our server! A fantastic experience all around. And super clean bathrooms! Thanks Cowfish! See you again soon!

qaYZHYaq205AgdRgR8c3RA.text: Ventured into Cowfish for dinner on Tuesday and had a great experience.  It was bustling, especially for a Tues night, so we had to wait 15 min for a table.  It was a good time to do some people watching and peruse the environment.  The decor is polished and hip - could fall on either side of the casual / fine dining line.  There is a huge fish tank, good lighting, and interesting - sometimes comic - art on the walls.  The crowd was young, lots of 20 somethings versus the business dinner crowd.  As for the food...  There is a huge menu and it is slightly overwhelming.  Their sushi rolls are giant, eclectic, and are pretty good.  I shared some sushi with my dining mates and then opted for the bento box - which basically allows you to sample the highlights of their menu.  It included a little burger (tasty), sweet potato fries (very good), sushi (delicious), a spicy cucumber salad (rockin), and some edamame.  Great meal!  Plan on spending approximately $25 per person with food and a modest beer.  Not too bad for good atmosphere and fun food.  Our waitress was friendly and helpful in navigating us through the menu.  There was an error in one of our sides and a little delay in it coming out - though no complaints from us - so the manager stopped by to apologize and comped the bill.  Outstanding customer service!

8rBlUDxnHOzCv6ml0WQreA.text: AMAZING SUSHI, so good I went twice on my first day visiting Charlotte. The Crab Ragoon Dip is amazing, I've had crab ragoons, but nothing like this.  The Dion's OMG Roll was to die for and you will literally say OMG once you try it. The mix of tempura shrimp, mango, and coconut is incredible.  I also had a roll topped with Filet Mignon, which was great. The only bad part about this place is that I live in Florida, so technically my bad. A MUST GO PLACE IN CHARLOTTE!

FE5hc98PpGvf7QucipnGsw.text: This place is outstanding. Whether you are getting sushi or burgers, this place never disappoints. If you are going for lunch or dinner on a Friday or Saturday make sure you get reservations. The wait is long. Order the motherload...it will not disappoint

TldNc2WpH3AfATd9tUH2JA.text: Our sever Kevin was Great! He was very excited about the food which in turn makes me excited! They have one of the longest greetings due to the lengthy menu and make sure you know what they're all about. I personally would not be able to do the speech they have without stopping for a water break!   We came in last night tried to call ahead and get a reservation but they had stopped taking them at the time and said they were not on a wait at that time and to head on in. So we had planned that if it was crazy busy and a long wait we would just go somewhere else in the area. Lucky for us we got right in and sat on the patio!   Kevin had recommended the Ahi tuna Nachos to start so we did....they were kinda whatever, bland, Tuna was not very good and they stuck plain (not dressed) micro-greens on top a huge pet-peeve of mine! We then ordered the rest of our meal I started with the spinach salad with a warm bacon vinaigrette it was ok. They then shortly (1min later) followed it up with our entrees :(  I had the Shroom Burger with grilled onions on a brioche roll...was ok. the Shrooms had a very strange taste to them just different. I did however trust Kevin again and ordered them with the Sweet Potato fries and they were excellent just as Kevin said they'd be!! I tried my sisters (Tracy D.) Sushi Roll Mango something that was good. My BF had the Bento Box, again just ok.  So I would say we had an OK meal nothing special and nothing that really makes me want to go back either. Kevin said they are the hottest restaurant in Charlotte right now...but are they??

7nDPGNGHg4tR0UmquAqF5g.text: Burgers, sushi, Burgushi, alcohol, milkshakes, and milkshakes with alcohol = LOVE. This . Place.  King's Roll, The longhorn, Capicola High-Rolla, + mini's = pure Win.  I also loved the decor and the recordings in the restrooms - very clever. I won't spoil it for you, just go wash your hands before you leave and listen carefully. :)

B_3kt7VCIsnOFLgy9Hb52g.text: Awesome concept, great food, friendly staff. I will return.

nm18YFO89YBK-hPUFb-4XQ.text: Love this place, the bar drinks are a little overly priced but I drink kettle one so don't really expect them to be cheap... Service has always been great although the host staff never too friendly .... Otherwise excellent variety would have to go there many times to check the entire menu which entices is to go back .. Over all enjoyable experience ....

vDBJWR4GpJoxRQ1SI3Y2eA.text: SOOO GOOD!! A wonderful atmosphere and fun place to hang out and grab amazing rolls or a few apps. They always stay busy so I do recommend calling ahead!

_pMD0NF0bNZrD-8-7JfVsQ.text: My favorite place in Charlotte. I love the food and can't wait to try out the Raleigh location when I move there. You have to try the bento box if you go!

5vemzP3K5zIamTuJgal43g.text: Been here three times now. Burgers and sushi aren't bad, good at best. Paying for the atmosphere and location not the quality of food.

iHmsR192XIvFd58cah-6MA.text: Service was wonderful and the food was even better!! I am in Charlotte for a conference and scheduled dinner here for myself and a group of colleagues. All had great reviews especially for the sushi. I recommend this establishment to anyone wanting a great environment with class and tastey food. I will return here in the future!

vEpBLzBFlWrkvfbOEsG-zg.text: First time, I had sushi and was not impressed. Second time, I had the lamb burger and was very impressed! Tonight I had the hoisin ribs which were flavorful, but too salty to go with fries. I'll order them again, I'm sure (a good deal at $10), but I'll get a side of steamed rice to go with. We'll definitely be back.  Also, this place is kid-friendly with cocktails!  My 2-year-old loved the PB&J "sushi" rolls on white bread, $5.

ifWND3hBsPI4KrA6W1cDIQ.text: Good place, usually pretty crowded. Im not as huge a fan as some people but I would recommend it. I've had both the burger and sushi offerings and enjoyed myself each time.

rpAIEZlWEGs5LtSasXjLtA.text: Three words of advice if dining here on a weekend night: make a reservation. Because my group did not, our wait was 1:45 as relayed by the hostess. We hoped she was bluffing.  Nevertheless, my first impression of this burger-meets-sushi-and-more place was positive. Service was prompt and attentive despite her responsibility for several other large tables, and the atmosphere is lively and casual-hip, if not a little loud (but again, it was a weekend night).  We loved the blackened ahi tuna nacho appetizer, and my entree--eight Miss Moffitt's rolls--was enough to have me leaving full and happy. More words of advice with regard to the latter: not for the dainty eater. These are gargantuan rolls, and unless you go fork-and-knife you're going to have to be comfortable with no-shame facial contortion and chubby cheeks.  One of my dining companions loved his C.B.C.L.T. burger, and I was eyeing the Green Monster before opting for sushi--perhaps worth a try another time when I'm in the mood for a patty.  Oh, and the menu is a novelette, so you'll probably need a little time with it as a newbie diner.  The wine menu was average, though the specialty drink and dessert menus had some interesting selections--so maybe next time (when I'll be sure to make a reservation).

H4Fftf6o_TEAc9zK75dUPA.text: This is a cute little hip Asian fusion spot!....we had the firecracker roll which was okay....The tuna nachos were great!  I really wanted to try one of the burgushi rolls....maybe next time. Our server was great....thanks jasmine! I would definitely recommend this place to someone......and i would come back!.....p.s....very impressive beer selection!

vytpV4VqIwm_b4yeH2f7PA.text: So I don't normally give out five stars, but really, what the hell do you have to compare Cowfish to?  Nothing.  There is nothing out there in the Southeast that I know of that is coming even close to this place.  Being from Atlanta where the burger craze is in full swing, this place puts some of our burger spots to shame.  Did I mention the sushi is bad-ass?  I mean, even if you know of a place in Charlotte to get better sushi, or burgers, or milkshakes, or Burgushi (doesn't exist anywhere else, seriously), or tea, or cocktails, or good wine, you can't get them all under one roof like this place does!  Was only in Charlotte for a couple of days, and I had to come twice just because I would have felt bad if I came here any less..  The menu is huge!  It would take you at least a couple of years dining  casually at this place to even try half of the menu.  Burgers I had were great and cooked perfectly.  Sushi rolls, although expensive, were awesome.  Burgushi, was strange but good and I would try it again.  Milkshake was tasty.  Didn't have a chance to try the "adult" milkshakes that contained booze, but I'll have one next time.  Seaweed salad was one of the best I've ever had.  These guys are booked pretty solid for dinner, best bet is the bar if you can't get a table.  Less crowded for lunch, but not by much.    In a great part of town that had a great little community.  Man, I didn't realize that Charlotte was such a foodie town, I'll be back for sure.

KOl_2zrQ5ZAzsvksR1SusA.text: Outrageous food! Very clever.... But the awesome review is for the customer service. My boyfriend and I came in one night...we are on a road trip and they knew how to make us feel so welcome ! Thank you so much!! Best customer service I've had in a while :)

s6C41nOTetHqWCH3kOqRpw.text: Wow fabulous burgers my sister loves the sushi I highly recommend it the appetizers were good even know there was no sushi for  appetizers the burger had onions and mushrooms it was great the sushi wasn't to fishy so I really enjoyed it

ksERszpeyGFC2_yzKtuRQg.text: The crab rangoon dip is worth the trip. Try and get there early, they get full quickly, and don't take reservations.

qRBDUV6621CEDoPwNVVKXw.text: An absolute gem, if a bit hard to find nestled behind Crate & Barrel. We were delightfully and tremendously surprised! VERY busy at 12:15 on a Saturday, but we wanted sushi, and were immediately seated at the sushi bar--rather than wait the 30 minutes for a table. My ONLY complaint was the level of noise in the restaurant, amplified by no ceiling. But that was the only negative. The selection is large on the sushi & sushimi menu, and the wait staff were ALL most friendly and very attentive, without being in the way. My wife had a Queen City roll, which was so good she neglected to let me try it...no matter, as my King's roll was huge, incredibly fresh, and produced a mouthgasm for me. My O'Douhl's non-alcoholic Amber was ice cold an served in a frosted glass...the perfect accoutrement for the very spicy--but certainly not hot, by any stretch--Kings Roll. We split the lobster & crab spring roll for an appetizer, nearly too artistically presented to eat;  but we somehow managed and these 4 spring rolls DID NOT disappoint in the least. Funky and cheery atmosphere, just too noisy for our 61 year old ears. However, way above excellent foot and service...absolutely worth finding around the Crate & Barrel. Go, please go!

CELbrkqHu3N7ysapsak0OA.text: Great food.. def worth every penny.. got the burger that had pulled pork, fried onion crisps, and bbq sauce. No cheese or slaw.. great meat quality and taste!!! 5/5

Qi-XB0OYO1aHywnHstwgjQ.text: Love this restaurant. Great atmosphere, fresh sushi and the burgers are delicious. We had an amazing server and her name was Iyesha! Make sure to ask for her:). She was super attentive and really helpful with suggestions!

52Tl5tLniq0ybdwVAssjxg.text: The staff were incredibly friendly. The wait was long but it was worth it. The sushi was really fresh and yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The crab dip was on the house!

krrqnPW5FCmMYClo9BkJLQ.text: We've been going to Cowfish since they opened and they have gotten progressively worse on the customer service over the years.  First they didn't take reservations, then they did take some reservations if you called in, then they had a few tables in OpenTable, back to no reservations, now to this stupid fish tank thing that doesn't tell you where you are on the list and is no where near accurate on their app, based on their description.  The food is fine, but that's it, it's just fine.  It certainly doesn't merit an hour and a half wait.  I would equate them to a TGI Friday's in terms of quality of cuisine and atmosphere.  If you want real Japanese cuisine, try Sushi Guru, Yama or Baku across the street.  10 times better and not this trendy, whitewashed BS they're serving.

ZZIvuE-uzMyaeylh1QLvzg.text: We were inform of a 35-40 minute wait, It was actually more like an hour wait but once we came up to ask them why it was taking so long, they gladly took us in right away! We were seated out in the patio, I like how they have heaters out there SINCE it was COOLD that night. Our server was very informative, and nice. He answered all our questions and even made a few reconditions(-: I ordered the Salmon Salad, my mom ordered the Dino OMG roll. Best salmon salad ever! I loved the vinaigrette that came with it and how my salad wasn't completely drench, and the cream cheese balls that came with it gave it a nice touch! (Salmon however was a TAD dry but that's okay!) I also tried one of my mom's roll and it was gooooood. Overall great food=great experience! Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu items!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

39SMgxzRolY-AB4ZOOIz-g.text: My absolute favorite sushi place.  Try the tuna nachos, incredible.  Marks roll is my favorite fusion roll.  Gotta try it if you are in town. So good!

khss5qeapHQd4GnVcu3vLw.text: So I've been coming here for the past five years. It is hands down the best place in charlotte to get sushi. Being from Hawaii, it's nice to find some good fish all the way in the Queen City. I have brought people here for their birthdays, lunch dates, and the occasional drop in for my craving for sushi.  I've never had something here that I haven't liked in the past five years till yesterday. Don't get me wrong it would have been good for someone else, just it was a little to much fusion for my taste . It was some of their newer rolls they had up won't say the names cause I don't wonna bash the place I love.  Next time I'm sticking to my usual the bomb ass tropical storm rolls, and spider rolls oh and that new roll they have the ... lobster boss  roll I think or the angry lobster was so freaking good they obviously did something right   FYI if you if it's your birthday there you'll love the gong.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

_K2oyOBCVYUKMGP5vN1vSg.text: Awesome setting, great bartenders, and amazing food. I was lucky my night there, the place attracted a fun crowd! I had "The Boss" sushi -delicious!

GCrkrmjlj4zX0lfAQdw3Mw.text: I went to Cowfish for the very first time a few weeks ago after hearing about it and I have to say I was really impressed. I should have reviewed before now but at Christmas Time, things are busy and free time is slim. I came on a Wednesday night and I didn't know it was 1/2 price bottle of wine night, that made the wait for 2 people go up to 35 minutes. after reading other reviews it seems to be the norm around here. however, you do get a text sent to your phone incase you were to go sit in your car away from where the pager can reach you.  Super Clean Restaurant, One of the cleanest I've been too.    The menu is expansive and everyone you bring will be able to find something they enjoy.  I was told by a friend that I needed to try the Crab Rangoon dip. HOLY COW GUYS. NOTHING Compares. It is AWESOME. The chips have the red sauce on it that you normally dip Crab Rangoons. I will order this Every Time!  I didn't try the Burgushi, I got regular sushi, and it was on par with some of the best I've had.   My 3 Cons are 1) I had to wait as long as I did with Clean tables in sight. NO RESERVATIONS 2) It's pretty loud, louder than I expect a sit down Restaurant to be. might have been the half price wine ;-) 3) It's Rather expensive, the Waitress said normally a person would get 2 rolls to fill them up. 2 Sushi rolls (Marks Roll and Soft Shell Crab Roll ) Cost me around 32 dollars. Great sushi, Less than Great Price.   All in All, Good Place with Great food, but I'll only be there when someone else wants to go.

JYi1IfuuJc1G1r6lY382iQ.text: Sunday, February 4th, was our first time at Cowfish. The atmosphere was pleasant, the food was great,  and our waitress, Iesha was very attentive to our requests. She gave suggestions when asked.  She was not too talkative as some waiters/watresses are. The customer service is amazing.  We even received a coupon to take $5 off our next visit.  All in all our first experience was great! Thanks to Iesha, this restaurant gets 5 stars from us.

JsVAEViyNd5N0mWh7MUfyA.text: Having recently moved to the Charlotte area, I was determined to give this place a try because so many of my friends absolutely raved about it...and boy was I not disappointed! Although we waited close to an hour to be seated--mostly due to poor planning on my part and failure to call ahead--the overall ambiance, friendly staff and delicious food and drink made up for it. If you're not very adventurous or a huge raw fish fan like myself, then I would highly recommend getting the North Hills Roll, which was so fresh and flavorful. Who knew that mango on top of coconut shrimp tempura rolls could be sooo good?! I was really impressed though several days later when I realized I'd accidentally been double charged for two dinners and called their customer service line, where I was promptly assisted and even sent a very generous gift card in the mail for my troubles. Although a minor inconvenience at the time, I was very impressed with their proficiency and speed to correct the server's error, while also retaining my business for future visits. I will definitely go back as a result!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

LIeRa8aCS5b8pKcsScuE9Q.text: I've been putting off writing this review because I can't decide if I like Cowfish or not.  After having almost a week to let my thoughts process, I would have to say that although the product is fresh, I wouldn't consider Cowfish a True sushi spot but an Americanized version.  I also think overall Cowfish is lost in its trendiness.  The first time we attempted to go was on a Saturday night and showed up to an hour and a half wait.  Cowfish doesn't take reservations so we decided not to wait it out.  We later showed up on a Weds night and there was still an hour wait.  We eventually managed to grab 2 seats at the bar and just made it a night there.  The items we ordered were Blackened tuna nachos, Southpark roll, and the King's Roll.  I have to say I really liked the tuna nachos, but they aren't sushi.  The King's Roll was the better of the two rolls.  I asked if they had miso soup, and sadly, they did not.  The wasabi was also the squeeze kind that is never hot enough.  The part I didn't like was it felt much more of a bar scene than a restaurant.  When I went to Nikko, I didn't downgrade them for the club atmosphere, because it really didn't interfere with the meal.  Definitely not the case here.  People were everywhere, especially hanging over me while I ate.    Overall, I think the food was fresh, if not what I would think of as sushi, but the scene will make me think twice before returning.

8IP019yQpRgiXBq_erwOIA.text: I love everything about this restaurant. Has food for burger lovers and fish lovers. My favorite meals are the bento boxes with sushi a mini burger, salads and sweet potato fries!

2pQreWSHGnEJyAtayK24bQ.text: This place has amazing food. Starting by a super unique brand and concept to its fresh trending ambience. Great restaurant to hangout with friends and grab delicious sushi burger combos with local beers. I always reserve 10% of my choices for a pescatarian choice now and then, and this is one of my favorites. Being new in town and while exploring Charlotte's sushi options I came across with Cowfish Sushi Burger, went in more to just explore as I'm always  skeptical when "land and sea" meet, as one or the other always tend to not be good. However, Cowfish surprisingly carries great lean, grass fed local beef burgers and awesome large fresh sushi creation. Best is they accommodate your choice to vegan and or gluten free. Super great customer service, staff is ALWAYS friendly, excited and seemed to love working here. The latter makes a big difference for me as who want bad vibes in their foods. Their fried calamari n octopus, is a must appetizer! And if you are visiting for the first time I recommend going for a combo box as you can pretty much taste and have a bit of all and customize  conveniently and to any dietary restrictions. My family and I now LOVE this place and it's one of our first choices in Charlotte. I highly recommend CowFish and make sure you step into their restroom, super creative sayings through speakers and pictures.

E_iNMIraualPQa9tk1o9pQ.text: I was reading reviews trying to figure this place out and when I finally ate here, I figured it out (haha).  On their menu, they have burgers and sushi (standalone, no fusion). But then on one page of their menu they have burger/sushi fusion, where they will wrap a meat sushi style.  We tried that as an appetizer, and then I ordered a bento box (spicy tuna roll, edamame, sweet potato fries, plus a burger). I would come back. Service was excellent; management continued to check with us to ensure we had a good experience. (Though once or twice is good enough, no need to check with us 4 times!).

uRVH9Q_4YQCpfYfVPbiuWg.text: This is a great place to eat at for great sushi of any kind. They even have a burger sushi! It's great! I enjoy the atmosphere and is always on my radar to stop by. The service is by far the best and I've never had a bad experience. If you like sushi this is a for sure spot to visit.

ME6aZI6t-lziBY2WIQ-XGg.text: Warning:  Do NOT sit at the bar if you want to order food!  First visit, made the mistake of taking bar seating because they were busy and it was first available, had to ask bartender/waiter for everything, even to take our payment after waiting 10 minutes.  Food was pretty good but not amazing.  I had the Crab Rangoon Dip with Wonton Chips for an app!  Now this was delicious!  Dip and Chips were warm.  Chips were drizzled with sweet chili sauce...Mmmm-mmmm!   For meal, I had the Ultimate "Brento" Bento Box.  This comes with 2 mini burgers aka sliders...you get flavor of the week, mine were bacon cheeseburgers, sweet potato fries...these were tasty, Thai cucumbers...aka homemade sweet pickles made from English cukes-they were delish, steamed edamame and 4 pieces of a premium fusion specialty roll...I got the firecracker, it was good!  I had draft Birdsong Jalapeno to drink.  You must visit the restroom even if you don't need to...trust me on this one, it will put a smile on your face, you'll need it if you're sitting at the bar.

h_Bved2BLKpDqwrH8oJSLQ.text: Usually very crowded, but great food.  As a vegetarian, I have many options on the menu.  The veggie sliders are shockingly amazing!  One of the best burgers I've ever had....ever!  You can also create your own sushi without fish and bento boxes without any meat/fish.  Lots of great options for everyone.

KbJSPkov_GWIwnKLtXqJog.text: The service was awesome and good was unbelievably good!!!  We order the crab Rangoon dip (which is a must), spicy crunchy roll and the cheeseburger roll!  So good!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger Roll and Spicy Crunchy Roll.

J9Gz3G1Qs_bkfROyPR_YNg.text: I'm confused as to how this place gets so many good reviews. I guess it's all about supply and demand. Let's just say if you are accustomed to eating in cities like LA, Chicago or NY, set your expectations low.

At04IjpuEtD6Nx6fYilflQ.text: We had a party of 8 today and they figured out how to make us fit.   Loved the crab ragoon

ucA5o4euWvGfFoGpcNDPLg.text: Me and wifey had to come back again and we were not disappointed. Service was good and food was just as good as always. All the times I've been here I've never tried the burger's surprisingly. It's always been chicken sandwiches and Sushi. This time I tried a burger and it was the bomb. The burger had a slight chargrilled taste to it that was just right and not overpowering. Cowfish has some of the best French fries in the business, we get them as appetizers almost every visit. Give them a try, you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

Del99F3yUuINXlYKkFNJ-g.text: At first, you will resist- how do these things go together?  Trust Doug, our exceptional bartender, as your guide and he will not disappoint!  To the drinks!  The Moscow Muleshine got the ball rolling, which was perfect to celebrate the impending summer, and paired well with the extremely (filling) enjoyable Avocado & Ahi Tuna-Tini.    But I simply said to Doug 'surprise me'.   First course - the Thundering Herd Bison Burger, an excellent blend of lean bison and jalapeno seasoning affixed with avocado was, by a mile, the BEST buffalo I've ever eaten.   The side?  Of course Doug would not be daunted- it was a SPICY Snake in the Grass cocktail with a Riggs Roll-essentially a tuna infusion with appropriate accoutrements !  The finale?  Apple Pie Wonton. Paired with Buffalos & Bacon cocktail as an amazing finish.   Always ask Doug (the bartender) what to eat- you can't go wrong.   Excellent Service Great Ambiance

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is actually Jonathon, who was posing as Doug. Don&#39;t ask for Doug, you&#39;ll only frighten and confuse people...

Fp5BhipwSqBCJsael-Oqgg.text: OMG! We traveled to Charlotte a few weeks ago for a few days and ohhh how I wish I could go back just to stuff my face out. Service was great! Food amazing!  We had a Parmesan truffle fries (for appetizer) and a roll that literally change my life with Fillet mignon and a firecracker. Too bad I wasn't as hungry as I would've love to be at that time so that I would've tried more things from their amazing menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ufffff
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. insane  Filet mignon. This roll changed my life
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rolls...  Filet mignon and firecracker (I think)

suCig0hwMgrlWtsW45BJnQ.text: All I can say is WOW!!! This place blew me away! My family and I visited Cowfish on a Sunday night before attending a local concert. Although we had to wait 30 minutes for a table, we were able to enjoy the restaurant's positive atmosphere and unique artwork from the bar until we were seated. One of the waiters even noticed us admiring the art and was nice enough to give us a few postcards of some of the paintings. That, my friends, is a prime example of quality service!!  For dinner, my brother built his own burger, my mom got the Dion's OMG! Roll, my dad ordered the Screamin Korean Chicken Sandwich, and I ordered Mrs. Woodbury's Fresh Find sushi roll. First of all, let me say that I have never seen my family so quiet during dinner. And this wasn't a bad thing!! The food was literally so good no one wanted to stop eating in order to speak! My sushi roll was so fresh: the salmon was buttery, the side of fresh tuna poke was delectable, and the avocado was incredibly creamy!! It is by far one of the best FRESH rolls I've had. Almost any sushi roll that has tempura or cooked fish in it can be good, but it is hard to find a completely raw roll that stands out, and this one sure did! I also had a piece of the Dion's OMG! Roll and literally...OMG!!! The name describes it way too well. The coconut shrimp gives that roll such a unique flavor! It's safe to say that my taste buds and tummy were extremely happy!! I'm not even embarrassed to admit that I am planning another trip out to Charlotte just so I can eat here again. IT WAS THAT GOOD! Don't miss the opportunity to try Cowfish!! Great atmosphere, unique menu, friendly staff, delicious food, and creative artwork= 5/5 stars!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mrs. Woodbury&#39;s Fresh Find... One of the tastiest sushi rolls I&#39;ve ever had. The salmon is so buttery and fresh.
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dions OMG! roll is phenomenal
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The screamin korean chicken sandwich and side of cucumber salad... Really delicious

qyqxvQHr9dJfJskYpl6tlw.text: Had my engagement party here and it was fantastic! The staff was excellent and very kind and the sushi is excellent.

nctIhIErB-PrsgaBi43x-w.text: Jamie was an incredible server!!  He shared with us his favorites and had great recommendations.  We were very pleased with the service and his amazing attitude!  will visit again

qTAhu5m2uvtzHKVh38e9YA.text: What a fun concept! I was really craving sushi so my husband and I didn't do the burgers and stuck to two of the large fusion rolls, a seaweed salad "martini" and three pieces of nigiri. Both rolls were great, definitely pricey but worth the cost. Really interesting combination of flavor and texture in both and nice presentation. Friendly service, fairly quick but it was also a bit empty. Some very fishy smells in the back near the bathrooms (like spoiled fish not sushi) were the only things making this less than perfect. But I'd definitely go again!

0FqkHv06TU3WjJlzDjsdRg.text: Because of the creativity of the restaurant, I would recommend giving it a try. There are not many "bur-gushi" style places in Charlotte, or in North Carolina for that matter. The food is very unique, and that's what they specialize in. Since my initial visit, I have actually moved to Raleigh, where I will be testing out the other location.

4PGTOcuR0-GFtswsQqTmgQ.text: Freaking love it I will come back again and again unless I get the urge to go across the parking lot to get Cheesecake Factory. We always get the bento box or the burger sushi roll. They are a little slower than most of the other sushi places and a little more over priced

67vFdckF3QG9Avad4Bqz9A.text: Oh the legendary cowfish. I have been dining at this restaurant at least once a year since it opened, and every year it seems to change just slightly. When I say change, I mean that people from the queen city more and more come to realize that this place is as close to a foodie fusion place as it'd ever get in Charlotte.  The very first time I came here was back in 2009, that was when they used a school bus to deliver orders. I thought it was a super cool concept, I had even read about it in the local magazine. At times I would show up at this restaurant and the manager would have daily huddles with his team of servers right before the restaurant open. I'd say great business mindset. Service is everything and they seem to have had it right. The interior decor is very matching of the name, everything had some kind of cow and some kind of fish resemblance. Aferall cow fish means a burger and sushi place! The bar is a nice area with a cool blue back drop. The presentation of the food was nice, their burgers are stellar. Price is around the $10-$20 range for an average dish.  The last time I was at this restaurant, It was late December 2014, by then it seems it had became the "IT" place of Charlotte. The wait was now around 1-1.5 hr just for dinner on a weekend. They ask for your number and you can track the status of your wait on a cute website with a fish. That time we never made it in to the restaurant, we ended up eating at upstream instead, however, if the wait wasn't so long, we would have definitely preferred dining at cowfish.

3qenlkh76NKuxERz2zNn0g.text: Love love love love! Definitely come here one night. Amazing food and service. We enjoyed the tuna nachos. Must try !

7DIpnrxUPTwgcvGnoVoigA.text: God, I love Cowfish. Been here twice since moving to Charlotte and every time, they meet my expectations.   Cool, rock-n-roll type atmosphere with a nice patio. The service has always been good, just be wary of what time you come in, there's usually a huge line.  Now, the food. I love the idea of my two favorite foods being served in one restaurant and fused together. Burgers & Sushi. Yes!! Why is this the only place doing this??   My most recent trip, I got the 4-s. It's a sushi burger. It has rice buns with sashimi inside and some sprouts. We also got two other rolls, one had coconut shrimp inside and mango on top and the other had fried oysters inside. Both were fantastical.   Already dreaming of my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The 4-S
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

RKJRrfz0OxAVsKdsQT7jhw.text: I cannot believe I have not reviewed cowfish! Before moving to charlotte I asked a native for recommendations and when she said "Cowfish" I instantly asked "Cow... Fish?" assuming I had misheard.  This unique restaurant flawlessly blends land and sea in an innovative way.   The wait time here can be completely ridiculous, with wait times constantly above an hour on weekend nights, but if you go early (before 6sih) during the week you should be fine. The crab spring rolls are delicious and come with a great sweet and sour sauce to dip it in. If you are a sushi fan I would recommend the The Boss or Miss Moffit's Roll (obviously I am a tuna lover). If you are feeling mildly, but not completely, adventurous the bento boxes are a great compromise, where you can try the burger of the week, sweet potato fries, sushi, edamame and the thai cucumber salad. I don't care for the cucumber salad and they will double up on edamame instead if requested. If you are all in for the fusion experience, I liked the Taste Explosion Roll or the Turfin' Surfer Roll. Both those rolls were rather large and I ended up cheating and using a fork and knife.  The menu can be a little intimidating the first time you go, so I would recommend reviewing online beforehand.

Evhlp7OmjARgyb871U6kJw.text: If you think burgers and sushi don't go together, think again! I was skeptical at first, but after one visit, I am now a huge fan! "Burgushi" is not just weird to say, but tastes like a perfectly cooked bacon cheeseburger in bite size . The atmosphere was eclectic, but great for families with a heated patio complete with lounge and play area for kids that doesn't distract from the experience for those without kids.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. All American &#34;Burgushi&#34;
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rigg&#39;s R&amp;R
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. If you like crab Rangoon, you&#39;ll love this CR Dip!!

CKNfqtJlLulBS3u-XIrPog.text: This has to be one of the most interesting restaurants out there. We started with the Crab Rangoon Dip which was great. The Wontons had a sweet thai chili sauce on them that put a touch on the appetizer that made it something really special. I ordered the Deliverance Roll. It was a barbeque sushi roll topped with a bacon slaw and a heaping pile of onion straws. I had no idea what I was getting myself into. It was so much food. I could only eat three pieces. My wife ordered the Fusion Specialty Bento Box. It came with the burger slider of the day which was a bacon cheeseburger with gouda cheese. The bento box came with sweet potato fries that were perfectly crunchy and salty. It also came with edamame that was cooked extremely well and salted to perfection. In the Specialty box you get to choose between four different sushi options. She went with the Firecracker option and it was delicious. It had a tiny kick of spicy to it but was not unbearable by any means. All in all, this place is one that will be getting a lot of our money in the near future.

oCL4J6IhFl-7d6HKrjhBIA.text: Super impressed. The fusion bento box has a little bit of everything. The firecracker roll is one of my favorites. Who knew that a mini burger plus sushi would pair so well together?

-hOQz7cK-9vnWoubmRrptw.text: I was pleasantly surprised. I know that sounds strange, being that this place has such amazing reviews. But even with all the positive feedback, I still had my doubts. Burgers and Sushi: do those really go together? Plus, on the menu online they didn't seem to have many vegetarian options. However; once I finally made it there, all my doubts went away!   This place is amazing, great food, and unique pairings. Their veggie burger has a homemade patty, and their sides seem simple, but are made so unique you wont recognize them once you've ordered. I got onion rings, and they were fried in coconut batter and tempura, then dipped in horseradish. Asian inspired diner food: amazingly creative.   Great service, great food, great location. Why would I ever complain?

h9BWqcFs0N-OdzIu4wrd6w.text: THE BEST SUSHI IN TOWN!!!!  I love love love this place, and I am a True sushi lover.  From their appetizers to their entrees, all is super fresh and so good.  The tuna avocado-tini to die for, it comes in a martini glass.  The burgushi is amazing...my favorite and the best one in my opinion is the taste explosion roll.  From the fusion rolls, I would recommend the north hills roll....taste so fresh.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

broMjP4TuHxBsTQTe2MAFA.text: I love this place.  The sushi is amazing, very high quality (with matching price tag).  Their "burgushi" sushi made with beef hamburgers are very unique and tasty.  I have been coming to this joint regularly for years, and will continue to do so.  The Raleigh and Charlotte locations are both great.  I don't hand out 5 stars on Yelp often, but this place gets 5 every time.  One of only two downsides is the price...with a bottle of wine, I have never walked away from dinner for two for less than $100.  However, half priced bottles of wine every Wednesday is a must.  The other downside is there is usually a wait, but it's always worth it and you can get drinks from the bar while you wait for your table.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mark&#39;s Roll with 2 pieces of tuna and 2 pieces of salmon nigiri....$27

13n8yaMQHPeqr1ysPnDQkA.text: interesting place.. i would go ago... sat at the bar as i just landed in for a business trip.

8bJ_LZYdApaRKRwdLKq3YQ.text: This is an interesting place.  Their menu is a small novel with plenty of options for meat and fish fans.  We started off with the Seared Tuna Nachos, very tasty and love the idea of each nacho chip being carefully stacked with the ingredients mentioned on the menu.  All 5 chips are fresh and topped with goodness.  My girlfriend and I split our main meals; I had The Green Monster, sounded great on the menu but there was no flavor to the meat, no salt, pepper, garlic salt, nothing.  The ingredients the flavorless burger had stacked on it didn't offer anything either, I could only taste the jalapenos.  My girlfriend's choice was the Taste Explosion from their Burgushi section, lots of flavor, however very heavy and wouldn't choose it again if I was the only one eating it.  Although heavy, the Taste Explosion is definitely a menu option I would get again to share.  Minus the burger, good spot to check out, there's something on the menu for all.

-ssZ9ArZ4i0CMarGOgZX7A.text: Food was fun! Interesting. Not a sushi fan so I can't speak on that. But the burgers are great! Wontons with Rangoon dip was good. Onion rings were good. Spiked milkshakes were delish!

DqekV-LpyWOY67qVDk-r8w.text: The sushi was fresh, but the selection was limited as is to be expected I suppose if you're not on the coast (especially the west coast where the sushi is unmatched). Anyway....the sushi was delicious and they had white tuna which was very tasty. I definitely feel that this is one of the best sushi places in Charlotte. When we ate there it was a very busy night so we sat at the sushi bar. Fun with touch screen games and menu ordering options, definitely something different. The server was certainly a bright spot of the experience. She was so friendly and outgoing and was on the ball with service and any help we needed. One shortcoming was she was very unfamiliar with the menu and any seasonal and fresh fish they currently had in stock. This is probably not her fault as the restaurant is new and apparently very busy, I think she may not have received the proper training. No worries though, because her wonderful personality more than made up for it, and she made a great recommendation for a roll. It was the Rising Sun roll and was scallops on the inside and yellow fin tuna on the outside topped with masago and tobigo......Delicious! I highly recommend this place for an excellent sushi experience.

_tAzTZ66GDMfY57okBNGeQ.text: The seaweed salad and the 2 rolls I had were very good. The place is a bit loud and on the pricey side for Charlotte.

J5mTjdnjKgQBYJccDVwagQ.text: Great sushi and burger options. Went here for New Years with a group of 5 and the service was great! Wonderful atmosphere and friendly staff. Love this place!

9vUZHQON-2RP-KHPWgpgUQ.text: This place would get a 5 for atmosphere and food. However, we waited over 2.5 hrs for a table! Luckily, the owner took very good care of us and we barely paid. Fun place. Would like to go back when it's not a crazy Saturday night. My advice, MAKE RESERVATIONS!

NcL63oJLg0r__OG-fF6m6Q.text: Stopped in for lunch today.  Didn't have to wait at all which was nice.  Place was busy but not packed or crazy.  Server had major attitude which wasn't fun (she obviously could not be bothered to do her job) but the food was good.  The onion strings were AMAZING!  Cooked exactly right.  The hamburger brioche bun was toasted perfectly although the meat was somewhat overdone and could have had more flavor than it did.  I liked the choices of toppings which was nice.  The kalamata olives were pitted.  I think that some slaw or a pickle could have been added to the plate.  Again, the server just did not want to be there and made it very apparent.  I would recommend eating here for a lunch though.  Being from Seattle it is difficult for me to eat fish in a land-locked city though so I'll be sticking with the sandwiches and burgers.  I had signed up for email as others have mentioned but have not received any coupons whatsoever nor was I offered anything during this experience.

RguFU_AFMoPbmuMi6JVXeA.text: As a frequent visitor of the Charlotte area, I searched all over yelp for a Saturday night recommendation. We decided on cowfish based on reviews and local chatter. In terms of ambiance, waitstaff, etc, this place is five stars. Based on what we had for dinner...two stars is gracious. We had the most helpful server and followed recommendations---crab Rangoon dip and the taste explosion burgushi.  We also ordered a firecracker roll. The crab Rangoon dip is ok, but the portion is huge and almost offensive..it would carry its novelty better if it were paired down. It's rich, it's gooey, it's overkill. The bergushi....what can I say...it's like eating a burger in a sushi roll. Sticky rice, melted cheese, hamburger. Ick! It's novel, but Its just wrong. The firecracker roll was the best thing we ate...the presentation was gorgeous  our waiter did us a big favor and had the roll cut in 10 pieces rather than 8 . Loved that tip. Perhaps we ordered wrong, we wanted to like this place...its new, its a fun concept, but the food was less than desirable.

IKUQMtM3_670rHG3DByvtA.text: After hearing multiple raves from reliable sources about The Cowfish Sushi l Burger Bar, it was tops on the list to review. Having been twice, and both times with small kids, I've been impressed with different aspects of the SouthPark eatery. But seriously, the best part? Both visits have included Ric Flair spottings. WOO! NATURE BOY!  When I first heard of Cowfish, I was expecting more of a Sushi Samba vibe, but I was happily surprised by friendly rather than pretentious servers, water served on tables in glass milk bottles, and a tongue-in-cheek mood provided by the piped in Japanese-to-English translations of American colloquialisms in the restrooms, and the more obvious comic bookish canvases of fast food icons discussing burgers hanging beside Warholesque representations of sushi. There's a sense of humor here, and it is served up with a side of contemporary, innovative fun.  The place is bigger than it looks at first glance, and the menu is a tad overwhelming. On the first visit, I errantly chose the The Tuscan Turkey Burger. It was average, though the server mentioned it would be a little drier than a regular burger, which should have tipped me off to choose another option. On the second visit, I chose The Cowfish Bento Box with a slider and veggie sushi, and I realized why so many friends swear by Cowfish. There was more than enough food, and loads of different flavors that easily satisfied. Sushi is as well-presented as it is delicious, and the kid's meals include a happy face on the rice detail.  During the first visit, the service was exceptional. During the second visit, the service was good, especially considering it was Father's Day lunch, when they were busier than usual. Outdoor seating feels oddly cozy, especially since it overlooks highly trafficked Sharon Road, and umbrellas and fans make warm weather pleasant.  So, will I return to The Cowfish Sushi and Burger Bar? Does The Nature Boy say "WOO"? I'll be taking my coupons I get by signing up on their website, and making a reservation, though. They are always busy, and the wait times, especially during prime dinner hours, are daunting.

gObJ-7MhsRM5qhBtTEUhQA.text: This is more of a trendy place to be seen rather than your regular sushi joint. It gets busy often so I highly recommend calling ahead to get an estimate on the wait time. Also, the busier it gets the harder it is to hear whoever is sitting next/across from you being the place has no insulation for sound buffering. Food is good [not wonderful and there are much better sushi take-out options close by] and a bit pricy but that's what one expects when hanging out at a hot-spot in Charlotte. Try the bento boxes.

sw0HlvJKtIsekFXRnAe6UQ.text: This was a great place! I had the jalapeno burger and my husband had the spicy tuna roll. The service was exceptional.

SgXpT9V5xretS8BgcmKUvg.text: Very neat place, I was really impressed by their awesome selection of burgers & sushi.  Baker, our server, was extremely helpful without being pushy or overbearing. Knowledgeable about the menu items and checked on us pretty regularly.   Apple pie wontons are delicious!! Although they are a bit difficult to consume after having eaten way too much food...   Awesome selection of teas, sake and other alcoholic drinks. Sushi was some of the best I've had in charlotte, very fresh.  The outdoor seating was awesome, great view.  Will definitely go back here!!

S39fPd5pw5-TtN4SfVNfOA.text: Not a big fan.  A bit over hyped for me. Food is OK, but nothing special.

4vOYJKCeO9B4Fatk0MxRrg.text: Fantastic restaurant, great service, great location. Menu is extensive and sooo hard to choose what to have when you eat there.  You have to try the premium combo platter - just be a little adventurous!  Highly recommended if eating in the South Park area.

OOfe8uj5507KJe6lyI4DkA.text: Got to rate this one top of the heap.   Quite the experience... Food was fantastic and portions were very acceptable. I don't think it was expensive, rather in line with what you would get at any place that serves sushi.   Actually, HONESTLY, I walked out of there thinking I got one hell of a deal. The food was ROCKIN! The service was too.   We tried some of everything being as we are from out of town and the menu was just too incredible and outrageous to pick one thing to eat...   You definitely need reservations, and don't hesitate to look at other peoples food as you are walking in - The presentations were tip-top, as was ours when the food was served.   You don't like sushi? There is plenty of traditional choices that looked out of this world... Want to "hang" with the sushi crowd but not eat fish? Get some filet and portabella wrapped in a roll - you make the rules.    Bottom line - You'll leave impressed and craving more.

aFaFZpX6EevvjQkdXSsoNw.text: After reading raving reviews for this restaurant I was pretty adamant this was the place to stop by in Charlotte, and the entire ambiance of the restaurant is very modern and unique with parody movie posters of cow and fish making a name for the restaurant. So we were naturally excited to try out their dishes. We started with thr fried calamari and while the sauce has a swt and sour sauce tangyness the overall taste was very salty. It was so salty that while i was chewing on the calamari I also chewed bits of sea salt along with it. Moving on to the main entree we ordered the cowfish bento box which is a combination of sushi, cucumber salad, swt potato fries, roll of your choice in my case california roll, edamame and a mini slider. While the selection varied it was again very salty. The california roll was mediocre, the edamame again salt chunks, swt potato fries a little soggy but okay and the cucumber salad I barely touched because I wasnt sure what it was suppose to taste like. However the mini slider bomb.com so I guess the winner here is the burger and surprisingly it wasnt salty or soggy but had just enough juicyness with savory and soft meat. I would stop by just for the ambiance and also because its kid friendly but would only order a burger instead of any sushi. The wait staff was very prompt and quick to accommodate the children overall its not a bad place but also not amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cowfish bento box and ninja nugget kids menu

u-LRnJNDI94ZXSWqUV42RA.text: The fact that this place is routinely listed as one of the best restaurants in Charlotte is a joke.  To have this listed with Charlotte restaurant royalty (McNinch, Good Food, Mimosa, etc) could not be more off.    I am guessing you can tell by now that I am not a fan.    To begin, the menu is comically big, whenever I see a menu that long, it automatically is an issue.   For the traditional sushi rolls - the cost/value is all off.  17 bucks for a sub-par tempura shrimp roll does not seem right.  Fusion rolls, I had the BBQ, and the bbq was not tasty and the roll seemed forced.    I guess  lot of people like this place, but for me, it is not any good.

Gx1UzTdqop-nan05Dkv7Mw.text: Wonderful atmosphere and creative great food in a good area. Eat outside on a summer night.

AF3F8e7cVzC4ixAz1FOuFw.text: This place is brilliant...great sushi, delicious burgers and a wide variety of alcohol.  This place definitely gets busy but definitely worth the wait.    The staff is always very pleasant and they really care about your visit and food.  I appreciate the fact that manager always makes an effort to say hello and ask how everything is.  The "boxes" offer their not so mini-burger of the week, 4-pieces of ur choice of sushi, cucumber salad, edamame, fries, etc.  They put a lot effort into their burgers creations although the burger itself could have a little more flavor.  The sushi has always been made to perfection.  They have regular seating, sushi seating, and bar seating.

8xxnBOX1Muui0qckipS3aQ.text: Being a loyal fan of The Counter, I felt betrayed when it closed and this crazy fusion restaurant called Cowfish (what is a cowfish anyway?) took its place. Apparently, I am a weak-willed women because I eventually gave in to my curiosity a couple of weeks ago and decided to give it a try.   My boyfriend and I arrived around 9 o'clock and were shocked to see a flock hungry patrons sitting outside, beepers in hand, waiting for a table. We went inside to put our names down and were very impressed with the interior of the restaurant. I am not really one of those people who pics a restaurant based on the design or how 'cool' it is but this certainly worked in Cowfish's favor.   After our number came up and our beeper started flashing, we were taken to our table and greeted by one of the friendliest waitresses I have ever encountered. We told her we had never been there before and she proceeded to guide us through the very large menu, answering any questions we had as she went.   We proceeded to order the blackened ahi tuna nachos for our appetizer and we each chose the bento boxes for our entree. When the nachos arrived, I was in awe of how big they were. The 'nachos' are actually fried wontons and they are topped with their crab rangoon dip, pico de gallo, avocado, greens, and delicious ahi tuna. I took my first bite and literally fell in love. The tuna was fresh and all of the toppings tasted like they had been sliced and prepared to order. We scarfed them down in minutes and resisted the urge to place an order for more.   Our bento boxes arrived soon after finishing the appetizer. I was amazed to see a huge selection of food with very generous portions. The box contained their mini burger of the week, the bib, which was served on a brioche bun with cheddar cheese and chili. The burger was tasty and fulfilled my desire for the comforts of The Counter fare. We moved on to the sweet potato fries (crispy and well-salted), Thai cucumbers (really delicious), and edamame (pretty standard). We saved the sushi roll for last, I selected 'Mark's Roll' which was spicy with jalapeno and siracha and very well-made. My boyfriend had the rainbow roll which was not as good as my roll but still very good.   We had a great experience at Cowfish-- great food, great service, great atmosphere. I have been back since then and will continue to come back for fabulous food.

erKjd037jkGKOcbBv9K5rQ.text: The menu is fun with creative and beautiful rolls. They were great about substitutes for my crab allergy. A little pricey, and I'd avoid them on Friday/Saturday night when there is a ~1.5 hour wait.

oxyrXR6contlVU-cEGAceQ.text: I went very plain Jane when I visited by only getting tempura shrimp with an America cheese style burger so the food is not what's to be complained about. The service was very mediocre. No one asked us if we had visited before so my guest and I were a bit confused about the menu. We were passed off by one server because he said his shift had ended but he continued on to help the people sitting next to us. The server he passed us to only checked on us once. I was just not impressed with the service at this establishment.

leDPTJ7mIWm2lysdM7Q18g.text: The food was great and I would say reasonably priced. The service was exceptional. Our waitress was talkative but not overbearing and knew the menu inside and out. The dishes she suggested were delicious and although I like to try as much of the menu as possible I think I've found a new favorite and go to dish. I would have given this restaurant four stars because they don't seen to take reservations but the food and affable employees make dinning there worth the wait.

V8DrjLU0eu69P6BFa8MxpQ.text: Amazing bloody marys and sashimi. I order there combo sashimi and then some rolls thinking they would be small and simple. Nope :) the sashimi had huge chungs of fresh fish ready for me to attack. Great service and awesome food. 5/5.

G54BrkxKRA9RfRfqhK2spA.text: This review is long over-due. I was there months ago BUT I just made my Yelp account and this is my very first review. I clicked on Cowfish to review it months after being there. Went out of my way. That alone speaks volumes. So let us rewind to December of 2012 when my boyfriend got a really fantastic job offer in Charlotte, NC that would force us to relocate from Massachusetts. After a lot of soul searching, I gave in to this venture and came to Charlotte the weekend before Christmas for a house-hunting trip. I was prepared to hate it. I anticipated hating it. Before we left, my boyfriend let me plan us our first date in Charlotte so I made us reservations at Cowfish. The menu was fantastic. Not only was our food delicious (and beautiful to look at) but it was reasonably priced and there was SO MUCH to choose from. You can't make a mistake but there are pages and pages of really exciting food options. Moreover the restaurant itself is really gorgeous and clean and such an appeasing atmosphere and their staff are all really nice and accommodating. Usually there is always one drawback to a cool restaurant with good food but they've really got it all going on. They really made Charlotte look good to me. I'm glad that was my first impression. Cowfish is now one of our more sentimental special occasion restaurants. We were back a few weeks ago to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. Fried pickles and coconut batter onion rings? Hello, lover.

Uu62Qw_nArCwgssttC8YTA.text: Waiting 45 minutes for a meal, is usually a BIG problem for my impatient husband!! Boy! Am I glad his attention was easily diverted last night, because it was worth the wait!! We ordered 2 bento boxes and 2 burgersushi rolls ! Mine was perfectly cooked steak wrapped around perfectly rolled sushi! The combination of wasabi pickled ginger and steak..., is amazing!! Who would have thought!!  Go try Cowfish as an exercise in thinking outside the box!!

gT3cTt2PhTefsv9cbEu8rQ.text: Love this place. Fun atmosphere, good service and great food. What else can I say. The only negative is that it's hard to get a table during peak times, but that speaks volumes...

6YEkymw6C8uEtQd7EoatCg.text: Amazing food!    I've been there 2x within a week during my visit to Charlotte!  Love this place!   Need one in Los Angeles, CA....  Please open one!

vzolBjv4KjOj20Pa2BNOpw.text: Went here with some friends and this place was great!!! I had a burger called the Hunka Hunka which consisted of beef, peanut butter, fried bananas, applewood bacon and a brioche bun. I was really surprised. This burger was awesome and had a unique taste that really works. If you are looking to step outside the norm then this burger is it.

n_o2XcnV42q8kTJ9eB0TMw.text: Delicious, charming, and chic.   This yelp review is based off the Yelpy Hour that Cowfish so graciously hosted. Lemme tell ya, you need to call ahead for seats, at least on a Thursday night. This place was PACKED. 35 minutes for a table. Good thing us Yelpers had a reserved section.   Plate after plate of different, yummy food was brought out, so I got to have the sushi, burger, and extras.   Sushi: To DIE for. They had such interesting fusion! Normally I like to go traditional, but I'm glad I got to try these new favorites. I can't really identify any of the roles that I ate for free besides the obvious salmon or tuna laying across the top, but they were all great. We actually decided to stay for dinner after, it was so good. We ended up getting the Tuna Nachos, and the Motherload.   Those tuna nachos... damn. They make my mouth water just thinking about them. Very large, flat nacho with rich, creamy crab rangoon dip spread over it, some greens and spices on top of that, and then tuna sashimi on top. So, so good. The only thing is that the seasoning on the Tuna (which almost tasted like ginger), while good on the tuna, seemed to clash with the rest of the crab rangoon/chip ensemble. That wasn't a problem for me, since I merely ate the sashimi first, then delved into the chip.  The Motherload is a $23 sushi platter that has all the fish on the menu. When we ordered it, the waiter assured me that this was not for sushi beginners, and we might see some stuff we hadn't previously discovered. I love your deeper, untraditional Americanan sushi, and was excited. However upon receiving the order, it was pretty much all normal stuff on there. Delicious yes, but normal. Delicious rolls with white fish, tuna, salmon, and fillet, topped with flying fish roe. The sashimi consisted of a few slices of octopus, a very large sweet shrim (my favorite), and sliced scallop (second favorite). The scallop was topped with salmon roe. There was also a tempura-fried prawn in a spring roll with peanut dipping sauce, which I am glad to say, also came with the head on the plate (gotta love sucking out those prawn brains! ... I may have scarred my dinner partner for life in doing so, though.). All in all delicious, but I think pretty standard sushi fare.  Burgers: I don't know what they were. Little sliders that were flavorful, covered in sauces and condiments, different veggies, and were very juicy. Delicious.   Extras: Fried pickles: they were there. They are what they are: good, but nothing to write home about. Chicken skewers: platter of very flavorful and moist marinated chicken. Not a huge chicken onna stick person if there's sushi around to be had, but these were great little noms.  Edamame: Lightly salted, gently steamed, and delicious  Drinks:  My vodka collins was always refilled, and though not extremely flavorful, very strong.  Got to try some 'carbonated' sake. Usually a stickler for traditional warmed plum, this was actually pretty good, very fruity. Glad I got to try it.  I'm sitting here, writing this review with my mouth watering. I want to go back. Nay, need to go back. And since it's bound to happen since I have another Living Social deal, keep me posted for an updated review!

7Db3Z3BK83XVfFkmqczQ1A.text: Great concept. Loved the lamb burger and spicy tuna. Decor was cool. Packed on a Thursday evening. Young crowd and lots of females

QzwZaGT5iKjGzxZtNqzndg.text: I absolutely love this place! I had heard about other friends of mine dining at this restaurant, which is why I decided to eat here as well. My boyfriend and I eat out a lot and I work in the service industry, so when I go out to eat I expect to get the same service I would give and although, the waiter service wasn't the best (probably due to it being saturday - which are usuallly packed) but the food was impeciable! Although the presentation wasn't the best, My boyfriend and I finished both of our plates.If you are planning on eating out, this is the place to go! Great food and concept!

LbZvfFRQ2cRkHg_QqdE28Q.text: Went for lunch and it had a great atmosphere, food and vibe. Go before 12 or it will be very busy quick!

4xPkiQEjQ_fZzDAbeMQoqA.text: Went with friends for lunch with a living social voucher. We all got burgers and every one loved them. Burgers were large, flavorsome and there were a lot of interesting options. Now that I am confident in the place I will be trying the ahi tuna burger next time.  The secret surprise was the kids meal. It was peanut butter and jelly sandwiches rolled up like sushi. Very cool, and makes the little one part of the group ;).  I would go back, and potentially try the sushi.  It was a little pricey and service was very very friendly, that may or may not be to your liking.

afpKvDtoJk8MN6QkJO5EzA.text: Very unique but you have to know what to order (for your tastes) to make ensure you aren't going to waste your money.

UJB4Zc22XE3VWEt4s3E8NA.text: Loved The Cowfish before, love it even more now.  Went in for a ladies lunch yesterday and after a very small mix-up with the bill, my meal was comped.  The management was apologetic and charming over the incident even giving us all free appetizer cards for our next visit.  I was pleasantly surprised by the generous gesture and frankly, they had me at free lunch.

W-m8sMuq4izlaYZwVo48RQ.text: This place is great but the wait is just awful. You pretty much have to eat with the senior citizens at 5.

X68YD-W4KPnhwT8jaIsq0g.text: Its Good, pretty pricey but I understand it is South Park. I have spent some serious money at this place, so I cant say too much bad.

cktj8_73waXAz8LMmqy1cw.text: Words cannot simply express how we feel about their food. Everything we have had there so far has been incredible.  We are moving soon to Raleigh and lucky for us they are opening a location there.  I think we would still have traveled to Charlotte for a taste of their delicious food. I highly suggest their chipotle bison.

CHg4TDbvWiD01dG9yE3tjw.text: this would be my third visit to The Cow Fish and it seems to get better each time. They are not afraid to experiment here which is the draw of the place. You have to take your time and read through the long list of choices and descriptions. sushi rolls are the fattest around town and priced comparably.  Would get a five star on quality alone but "The Cowfish" somehow manages to get a 2 person bill up over $50 every time. Maybe that is my problem.... One of the best in South Park.

Mti_EVmmo0Ahv2Jz1G-Ypw.text: Brought some employees to lunch here and had a pretty good experience. The service was excellent, but one concern is the menu being HUGE. I appreciate when a restaurant commits their talents to a few specialized dishes, but I also understand the need to appeal to the masses. With that being said, everyone with me loved the food. One had oneof their rolls that looked absolutely delicious and immediately made me regret my decision of just ordering a burger... which wasn't bad, but just not that great (Big Daddy's burgers are better). I will go back again, but get the roll or some sushi instead.

gMykdX6DF4ZQNlWczyk-5g.text: This place is interesting. Packed at lunchtime, I was able to sit at the bar. Since this is my first and possibly only time I'll get to Charlotte, I asked for recommendations (something special to the house). Got the Taste Explosion Burgushi. Sounds odd, mixing burger with classic sushi rolls, but it works! The dumplings to start were just right too. I'll go back for more if I get the chance.

I8CMTEA1FZ9O5D28bFlOMQ.text: Cowfish is one of my favorite restaurants. If you are new or visiting Charlotte, this is the place to go. Their food is absolutely decadent and the staff is top notch as well. If you get seated with Leddon you are in exceptional hands! He is very attentive to the table's needs and has a great memory of his customers. Experience with him is always far beyond 5 stars.

Ir7wYza0QN_HuccYFok-9w.text: Took my other half here for my return trip. I again had the Caribbean Roll app, and he had the crab rangoon dip- both excellent! Our main course was burgushi- I went for Dougs' Filet Rolls and was soooo very happy- they were as rare as I like 'em! He had the What's Shakin Tuna Bacon and I heard nary a complaint. Hell, all I heard was his moans of delight! I may be jealous!  Our desserts were awesome as well- we had chocolate in all its glory, mousse for him, cake for me. Neither of us could finish, but oh, what an effort! Sadly, the beer I wanted was out of stock, so I was forced to try another selection, but oh happy day-it was very, very good! Terrapin is now on my short list of breweries to look for. The service was quite good, very attentive without being intrusive. Our waiter was training another who was "following" and if the newbie paid attention, he'll be *just fine*, too. This time, we were seated at the other end of the restaurant, near the patio doors. Thankfully no one in their right mind wanted to sit out there, so no opening of the door and arctic blasts... but this is obviously an issue that needs to be addressed. This is the sole reason this and the last review didn't get 5 stars. My advice? Go thou hence, and sample.

07UN-Zlc82nJCBOulBAPwg.text: Amazing place. The Ahi Tuna martini is my favorite, but everything I've tried is good!!

XE0DvKtHYpFj8cv6LIeNFw.text: Soooooooo Good!!! But it gets very packed get there early

L5_mn9GGmHHUnj1Y5eU7gw.text: I was blown away by the thoughtful selection of sushi with memorable combinations. I've had sushi all over the world and some of the rolls here had me doing a double take. A friend had one of the bento boxes and they liked the variety.  The drinks are inspired too. Great service.

j3M6B1K9EMHDRFHbT9xTdw.text: Well it was interesting to say the least.  The calamari was cooked perfectly and I love the sweet chili sauce.  It was a little clumsy being on the bottom of the plate and not a dipping sauce but I can get over that.  We ordered the burgerushi.  I am not a sushi fan but my husband is that is why we ordered it.  Since it was a"burger" I was expecting it to be at least warm.  It was not it was not stone cold but not warm either.  The dessert was fabulous.  I would go again but order something different.

FAq8a8MbLwAE4OPhfp5wVQ.text: I learned more about Cowfish during the Summer Yelp Elite event. Burgers and Sushi all "rolled" into one concept?! How genius! Two of most peoples favorite food loves at one location.   During the aforementioned Yelp event we were gifted ten dollar restaurant cards to ensure a return visit. How pleasant. A ten spot doesn't go very far at the CSBB, but it was much appreciated.  On this trip, my girlfriend and I enjoyed a nice edamame app followed by a couple different specialty sushi rolls. Delicious indeed!  Roll on over to Cowfish today! Ha ha ha ... Roll.

OOvgchKCyvo8socxMDWsJg.text: I absolutely love Cowfish! This is my first time here and I felt it was absolutely necessary to share the phenomenal experience I had. First and foremost, our waitress Tiana made the entire night perfect! She was so kind, friendly, attentive, and went above and beyond....all while training another waiter, I believe. Tiana recommended we start with the tuna nachos and OMG! They were soo good! She also recommended our drinks and they were strong but extremely tasty. We also had the fiery dragon roll and it was great. I'm so happy Tiana was the waitress we got because she really guided us through the menu and made the night so fun. We will definitely be going back, and hopefully we get her as our waitress again.

z5P7XusFjuPcnDL9vOIBQw.text: I arrived at 1230 and its busy for a monday, but a lot of ppl are off for the holiday. I checked in and I was told it would be just a minute before I got a table. The first table I was directed to was right by the door leading out to the patio, so cold air came in every time it open and shut. I was quickly moved to another table that was better but underneath an air vent....it is February right?????  My new server introduced herself and told me that she will be right back. I'm still waiting for my guest, so I'm okay. I did notice walking by the sushi prep area smelt fishy, and anybody knows if you walk in a place and smell fish that's a No-No.... has me nervous to get any Seafood from here today.  I browsed the menu waiting for my guest, because it's been awhile since I've been here. My guest arrived and let our server Brittnie know that she was a newbie. She did a great job explaining the menu and how we can tweak it to out liking. We ordered the fusion boxes. One slider, one roll, and 3 sides.   We did experience a delay in our food coming out,  but they sent a free appitizer our way. Nice!  Britt did tell us that there was some deep discounts on wine due to changing to a new wine list. We humbly declined.   Overall my friend is ready to bring her bf back...maybe for a double date!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. My final bill was different than what I signed for by a trivial amount and I told them it was ok. They sent me this. So sweet. Thanks guys!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Closer look at my rolls, no rice!!! Didnt miss it at all!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. My fusion box with my slider, spf, cucumbers, seaweed salad, and my sushi rolls

ZZyKa2sFh-VeYVdMLCmMfg.text: Wonderful!! I had the Cobb salad and DH had the Boursin burger and fries. I also had a Skinny Gonzales margarita that was tasty and strong but hit me later. I will def be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

FNfrPi-h_rtT35tLroQ9Xg.text: Went for dinner with a friend cause I had been craving this for weeks. I didn't want anything too heavy so I simply ordered the crab wonton dip and house salad. The dip was mediocre, which was kind of disappointing. In my opinion, the batch I received had wayyy too much cream cheese in it( or at least that's what it tasted like) to where it was overbearing and made my stomach hurt. The salad was good of course cause I really don't think you could mess that up. I pretty much washed it all down with water and settled with the marshmallow crispy treat milkshake. With that and the great staff that served us I still left with a smile and will come back to fulfill my craving.

kNU8lIEGMoyusqv-mCFC0Q.text: Great sushi and burgers. Great place to for sushi lovers and non-sushi lovers. :)  Fun place as well ... great atmosphere!

CW5drF9d5DsMjTICU0FqRg.text: One of our fav spots in Charlotte! Super fun atmosphere and I love how I can enjoy sushi and my sushi-despising husband can get a burger! The bento boxes with both are a nice choice, too! Kid-friendly with more of an adult feel. Something for everyone!

2DZu53VQCxD3iFD8H-qbGQ.text: My favorite place to eat I love their Sushi and their burgers be aware they are not good with the meat term I like mines medium so I need to ask for medium rare. The service it's good all the times.   Update: I just went yesterday. The Crab Roll was amazing and my Mango-Cado sushi roll was delicious. My fiance order his burger (Bison) the term was perfect and the service as usual very very good. Staff friendly, attentive and very diligent.

t8dRcM3UF7_FLj8NDcx1kg.text: "Extremely impressed" is how I'm going to start this for you. When I walked into Cowfish they had a great vibe going on. It is low lighting, ample walking space, but most of all it smells great. Once we walked out to the patio, I was over the moon. They had market lighting, great comfortable seating, and there is an outdoor fountain which really creates a fantastic ambience. But would you really want to know about is the food? I had a great sampling of the menu, and every single one of the items was flavorfully and thoughtfully composed. I was trying to decide what I was going to get seconds of, but I was so stuffed and full and content that I had a hard time going back for more. Talk about a first world crisis. I had the privilege of trying a strawberry milkshake, which I am not usually a fan of fruit milkshakes, ever. However their strawberry milkshake was delicious and perfect. It didn't have a artificial flavor to it, it had big pieces of strawberries in it topped with whipped cream. Overall my experience at Cowfish was a massively positive one, and I am counting the days until I can go back. Well, I might be counting the minutes until I'm not full anymore, because I am officially stuffed and satisfied. Amen, hallelujah, praise The Cowfish.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burgushi
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spring rolls

oi9X4Y5ywcBTXsELyyoxog.text: I will start out with the fact that our food was delicious. However, the service was subpar. When we arrived, we were told approx. 30-45 min wait, but that turned into almost an hour and a half. When we were seated, there were at least 6 empty, clean tables around us.   Our server was nice, but forgot my side as well as refills. It seemed that he, as well as the other servers were stretched extremely thin. If I were in town again, I would opt for a to go order if available.

F4lU90av6jxS_9C-mN5smg.text: Very excellent food, loved the cooked sliders that comes with their bento boxes. The sushi was well prepared and the appetizers were great as well.

mz31w8754BqXRe_GhhOfTg.text: Just meh. The sushi and other asian fare is really good, but the acoustics in this place are terrible!
