If you want to communicate with those you are sharing your meal with, avoid this restaurant. If you are fighting with your dinner-mate(s) and wish to not hear a word that comes out of their mouths, pick this place. I won't go back due to the noise level.

Ik9Gn6NB8_Owui0o7hTJpQ.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! Everytime I come here, it is packed! Best thing to do is to download their app, so that way you can put your name on the waitlist when you are within a decent radius of the restaurant. They do not take reservations.  The food and service is on point! I am vegan so I love that they have alternative options like the veggie burger which can be substituted on any burger choice. They also have veggie sushi too. The bar has lovely drinks, half off martinis on Tuesdays! I have never been disappointed here, the eclectic options on the menu allow this to be a worthy destination restaurant in South Park!

wXhfo_eQnaeEvOIcuH49Gw.text: Food is very good and it's loud ! I had the lobster and crab roll and they were crispy and delicious and the presentation is excellent. I got a side of the parmesan bacon fries  and they are rich and tasty.

7p0pbIjunabkfFsVaP03_A.text: Cowfish, hands down... Best Sushi spot in Charlotte! I strongly recommend you go if you haven't! They have something for everyone! Also, I've noticed that a lot of the panthers are big fans of Cowfish as well! One of the players and his family sat at a table next to me! Awesome to see! Great drinks, great food, and if you're looking for exceptional service, request Tiana! She's Ahh-Mazzzing!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Truffle Fries Yum Yum!!

PBCwXdL4ByrOCWSScLEgnw.text: This place was great. Had the All American Cheeseburgushi roll and it was so good and different. Was very surprised by it. My wife got the Prime Filet and Truffle fries and she loved them.   Also, some of the Carolina Panthers players and coach Ron Rivera were sitting right next to us. That was a plus for my birthday.   You will love the food, drinks, boozy shakes and wont be disappointed.

P1yNXh-jLPOsXnk7kVM5Vg.text: Great service! Amazing food! Fun atmosphere! My food dreams came True with that bento box! It was everything I never knew I always wanted.

ugqHd9sN0aZ2NRV9WmF5_A.text: Definitely  trendy place near SouthPark mall, but and there are other places I prefer nearby like Yama and Rusan's but it is still a nice place to take people for "event sushi"

KlckwXgPTWSlJCb2CQSqqA.text: Alas, Cowfish seems to have gone down hill. I am giving it 2 stars because the sushi is still good, but here is a list of the problems we had last night: 1) False creation of a wait by the hostesses--there were at least 20 open tables and we were forced to wait for 30 minutes; 2) we ordered calamari appetizer;  it came to the table without plates or silverware; 3) I went inside and requested plates and silverware from the manager, 5 minutes later I requested them, and subsequently received them, from our waiter; 4) appetizer is consumed but neither the individual plates, nor the calamari plate are removed from the table;  5) I put dirty plates on the empty table behind us;  6) dirty plates remain on empty table throughout our meal; 7)sushi takes about 30 minutes to arrive--strange in uncrowded restaurant; 8) sushi is not made with soy paper, as requested, but we are hungry and want to eat; 9) my husband and I are sharing rolls, but no new plates are brought to the table--we flag down the waiter to request clean plates;  10) oops--no small bowl or ramekin for soy sauce--we flag down the waiter again; 11) we retrieve a dirty plate of ours (still on the table behind us) for my son's edamame pods 12) dinner is over and we have to remind waiter that it is my son's birthday (after previously notifying the hostess); 13) Birthday presentation is lackluster, at best, and my son is disappointed; 14) I am disappointed that Cowfish has fallen so far--judging by the number of empty tables at 7pm, I am not alone in this assessment.

2sOVInSdgpGS5t0HozAu5Q.text: First time here. Never heard about it and never seen it until recently. It's behind it or in front of the South Park mall depending on where you are coming from. It's casual but in a swanky place. Came in after my facial next door at hand and stone massage(awesome facial:see hand stone massage review).   The server was nice. I asked some manager or who knows who she was that was passing by for some honey mustard and she looked as if I asked her for her social. I guess it wasn't her forte but she brought it anyway. I went to thank her but she was gone before the honey mustard hit the table lol. But besides that I loved it all.   The server/bartender was very attentive(except when I wanted some hm). Food was delish. I think our food was about 30 something. Def worth it. I love my burger(I ordered the build your own burger). And the sweet potato fries were good. I don't get the fusion part of this restaurant but whatever the food was good. I would Never get sushi at a burger place. But that's just me. Who cares what I think.   Wasn't much of a crowd. It was pretty empty actually(maybe three other people) but it was midday on a Wednesday. Food came out pretty quick. Facilities were clean. Everything was pristine. Love the area. Good parking. Parked right out front. Will go back next time I go back to the massage spot next door.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love grilled onions. Yum.

ur2mA4IE8oYLriaMLTbkEg.text: The rolls were nice and fresh and the house salad was awesome. Had a lemon vinaigrette and would definitely recommend.  I also had spicy tuna and TNT maki. The menu was insanely big - filled with things like burgers, sushi, bacon coleslaw??? What a combo. They even have meals that mix the land and sea in unexpected ways. The bar looks pretty well stocked and with lots of wine varieties. I'll have to go back for dinner.   I will also mention that the hostess and the bartenders were incredibly friendly! Definitely worth a visit, despite the eclectic mix of land and sea animals served.

_3yLFHiE52vpuGxXiDB5mg.text: I love how this place is so quirky on purpose. They have great food, fairly reasonable, and great staff. This is great family place too. We bring our kids out here all the time. They are very accommodating. They are also great about birthdays. We have had 5+ birthday celebrations here. We love sitting on the heated patio too. Definitely go for the savory burger or sushi and then wash it down with a spiked milkshake. Their sweet potato fries and fried pickles are some of the best as well.

5r7s238cXsYQUDYNCLaxCA.text: I was finally able to give this restaurant a shot after trying several times. The wait is consistently out of control. The menu was very large and a bit confusing. I would rate the food as average and over rated. I tried all the bragged about favorites including the crab Rangoon dip, explosion roll, and lobster and crab spring roll. The best thing about the meal was the OM copper brew. Good service once we finally got seated though.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Explosion roll

EXDrxbOmgtoBKdAwrjtReQ.text: Okay I had heard good things about this place but their burgers are AMAZING. Literally the best burger I have ever had. My husband got the Squeel and I got a regular with avocado--- oh my god incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;The Squeel&#34;

bTQIGBMVl2b2Lsvk05rG6A.text: Sushi & Burgers...what a great combination! There is something on the menu for everyone. Since I'm a vegetarian, it's hard to go to restaurants and find good food options but Cowfish definitely had that covered. I created my own sushi roll with all kinds of veggie options and their sweet potato fries were THE best!  It's in a great a location as well. I've heard the wait is usually really long (1.5-2 hours) but our wait was only 20 minutes so it was perfect.  I'm not from Charlotte but my friends are and they eat at Cowfish all the time. Next time I visit, will definitely make it a point to eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Built my own veggie sushi roll...yum!

CqLeF8EgnJSLNRt9ugCTFQ.text: I'm in the service industry myself. That being said, everytime I order hot tea there the server rolls their eyes. I get that hot tea is a pain but I don't roll my eyes when someone asks me for loose leaf tea at my restaurant because it's my job. I'm a huge tea person, so this is one of the big reasons I go there. Also, I feel like their sandwich platting could be a little neater but everything is delicious, so it makes up for the sometimes sloppy presentation and grumpy service. I'd recommend it, I'd just warn my friends of the burnt out servers.

1q2fiDdoKQHJPVUGR5Ln6g.text: I know my wife (Wendy N) has written reviews about this place, but, since she writes from a sushi lovers perspective, I decided to write my own review from the burger side of the house. And, frankly, the burger side of the house is superb. There are several preconfigured selections available with a wide array of toppings and add on items. There is also a build your own burger with an almost dizzying array of choices for buns, meats, cheeses and additional toppings. Personally, I like a half pound burger on their brioche bun with apple smoked bacon, pepper jack cheese and lots of their cowfish sauce. Other choices for meats include turkey, bison and veggie. And what would a good burger be with out fries? Which are always cooked to near perfection.   The wait staff is uniformly excellent. Pleasant, knowledgeable and attentive. To date, after several visits to this establishment, I have yet to experience even an unpleasant moment. If you need the perfect blending of burgers and sushi with a full bar thrown in just for good measure, this is the place for you.

pEylMLMz9FzpvaAxJgOWAg.text: We moved to Charlotte last year, and so many people have recommended Cowfish that it has become repetitive and annoying.  We finally decided to give it a shot, if for no other reason but to avoid the "you should try Cowfish" conversation in the future.  We called on a Thursday to book a reservation for a Friday dinner, but were disappointed to learn that the restaurant does not take reservations.  We went on a Friday, but my wife took too long getting ready and by the time we got there, the wait was two hours.  Carol gets grumpy when she is hungry, so it wasn't going to work.  We ended up going to Taco Mac and having a nice meal.  After the two failed attempts, we decided to go to Cowfish Tuesday at 2:00 pm. Third time was a charm! The boss gave me the go-ahead to leave the office early as long as I promised to try the surf-n-turf roll.   When we walked in, we were immediately seated and provided with menus.  Day-drinking is the spark that keeps our marriage alive, so I ordered 2 cucumber mint-inis.  They were good, but not life-changing.  My wife commented on how small my cucumber was, so I ordered a China Blossom for my second drink.  We hadn't received silverware yet, so we ordered appetizers we could eat with our hands.  The edamame and fried pickles were delivered to our table too quickly, as if they had been sitting in the kitchen ready to go the entire time.  The fried pickles were decent, but the edamame shells were extremely difficult to chew.    It was a chore to read through the entire menu. I broke my boss's promise.  As good as filet mignon smothered with wasabi sounds, I had been having nosebleeds all week and didn't want to ruin another shirt. Nothing on the menu looked good, but we figured that we may as well try and order something to hold us over until dinner. I went with the Arnold Hamandeggar burger, minus the cheese, eggs, ham, and bacon, and Carol ordered a slice of cheesecake.  Mid-way through the third cocktail, I needed to use the restroom.  The waiter directed me there, and his instructions were clear and accurate.  However, the country slang coming from the speakers in the bathroom was distracting and I returned to the table without washing my hands. Thankfully, the waiter had finally provided us with silverware, and our dinner had arrived as well. The burger was very under-cooked and did not have the toppings to compensate, so Carol and I shared the cheesecake. Our first experience at Cowfish was poor, but we will consider trying it again if someone gives us a gift card.

avaBH4vosnk8Zcuv2WUDrQ.text: Excellent menu and service. Visited here while visiting with family last night; we had an excellent experience at Cowfish. With Kenny as our host; he quickly gave us the short story version of the 10 page menu, offering suggestions to satisfy everyone at our table. Service was prompt and attentive without being pushy. Food quality and presentation were very good. Too full to enjoy desert at the restaurant, we took a few home with us to enjoy later with late night coffee.  Being from out of town, I won't get the chance to return anytime soon; but my local family is sure to make this a frequent choice in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spider Roll
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sashimi Plate

GS3Eo4FJ9S_1BxFR52lO9Q.text: I've been here a few times and you just can't go wrong with anything. My server Dallas was exceptional. The sushi was some of the best I've had in Charlotte. I feel that for the quality and the location their prices are reasonable. The huge iPod on top of the bar was so much fun! My bf and I played a ton of games together on it. The one negative I did see was that the chairs at the bar are super tall and made of stiff wood. Those chairs are made for giants so try to get a table instead.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. This was the lemon cake,vanilla bean berry dessert. So good!

O3FDeTb0zK9pHMHOc04yAg.text: The only thing preventing a 5-star rating is the fact that they don't accept reservations and my wait is always at least an hour. Otherwise, I love everything about this place. The food. The drinks. The atmosphere. The quirky photos on the walls. The outdoor seating. The fact that it's located near the mall. All of it. I always get the Ultimate Bento Box because you get a little of all the best: burger, sushi, cucumbers + more. Yum.

3ffApMDY7h-QyCsdImyKWA.text: Cold Miso Soup, Horrible Service and this is not REAL Sushi Rice.  Come On, it's not that difficult to Provide Quality Food and Service,

2BXJpDvmw3KTpoSMjQl1JQ.text: Superb food quality and topped with awesome friendly service. If you are looking for a different style and or twist of food, this is the place.

baEEdZNmn4xkk3PtfjpOxw.text: The Piitsburghushi Burger is one of the top 5 best things I have ever put in my mouth. Which is saying something since 3 of the things on my top 5 are body parts on my girlfriend.  Speaking of my girlfriend, she order us a order of the truffle fries and I was not disappointed. Also, her sushi was amazing. I forget the names of the rolls. Sorry, I was busy with the Pittsburghushi.

YXGAO3ALPUDfOoVLBGTaOw.text: If I want over priced sushi... I will come here!   There is always an hour or more wait...  I mean I get the hype of sushi and burgers all in one place but it is seriously not worth the extra money for subpar taste.   I think the reason this place is sooo popular is because it's the location, right outside South Park mall   However, they have rockin desserts and it will be the only time I come if Cheesecake Factory doesn't get me on the way over.

fZzQt60TVH3gW0lkkSzskg.text: Last night 6-22-16, we went here for my friends birthday party. We had a party of 20 people. We didn't wait long for a table at all. When we sat down, we waited for everything with a few other issues.The manager addressed right away and apologized for everything and made sure the rest of the evening was excellent. And...even served cake at the end. She went over and beyond with great service and we had a excellent dinner. I had the doug filet with seaweed salad great selection. Thank you cowfish and staff for your service and acknowledgement. -elsie (yellow dress)

i5YeD8-ExEl-b6WQgQlSeA.text: OMG...this is my first time ever dinning here, and boy was it a Pleasent surprise!!!! .....hold on....it must be someone's birthday because a Japanese guy and 4 of his co workers just walked pass me hitting a big gong!!!!     Back to my review, this place Is wondrtfull! It's contemporary setting is the icing on the cake.....By the way, for Pete's sake, where else can you order a nice juicy cooked to perfection burger AND nigiri and/or sashimi???? I'm in love!!!! JUST GO ALREADY!!!

0AuvJazXMhuY6CWNZltwXA.text: Enjoyed the appetizers especially the truffle cheese fries. Had a good IPA. The Brento Box was filling. Would definitely recommend.

rpcHMthyjkcR3kpjiE7kdw.text: It was my first time tonight and I was impressed! Volcano rolls with Parmesan truffle fries....... Delicious. The menu was slightly overwhelming at first but the server was an excellent help in figuring out what I would like. They also have great drinks and an awesome beer list.  We were sitting outside and as it started to get more chilly the managers were on top of it, making sure everyone was comfortable by turning on heaters and shutting off the porch. Great atmosphere and food!

af3SLyqs6D1C2x4GuL-4mg.text: I decided to try this place after seeing all the great reviews on yelp and I have to say, you guys were right. Their food is great, their prices reasonable and the environment is really fun.   I've been here a few times but I keep ordering their bento box because it's just that good. Their burgers are good and so is there sushi. My husband ordered the Screaming Korean Chicken sandwich and that thing was the size of his face. It was also really tasty.  I highly recommend the Spicy Togarashi Shrimp for an appetizer because it's amazing. They're lightly battered and have the right amounts of sauce on them, all served over a delicious bed of greens and ginger dressing.  Give this place a try if you're looking for burgers and/or sushi but get there early because they fill up fast.

DTaXEhdTKkaWi48Bjs_daA.text: ambiance a+ menu is really cool and innovative this place is just way too overpriced and overrated. the sushi is better at most other places in charlotte. the drinks are, however, really good even though they're overpriced. the service isn't usually bad but the food takes forever to come out after you wait forever for a table during busy hours since you cannot set reservations. i stopped going after the 2nd health scare incident (that i know of) because the price and flavor isn't nearly enough to risk

HO11qpV6H-9kBmrGr-dROQ.text: Absolutely the best place we had to eat in a long time. Highly recommended! Very picky about sushi. Super fresh and tightly rolled (properly). Burgers are fantastic first burger ever I didn't put ketchup on nor did my husband...and he eats everything with ketchup. Fried pickles are the best I have ever had. We like hooters pickles these are 1000% better. Mostly because they are thicker and fried to perfection. We are just driving through tonight but will visit Charlotte again soon just for Cowfish! Oh and FYI the area is really nice.

hF9TM3wzGSE1nLu_LFmG4Q.text: Cowfish has been a staple for us for the past few years. It's great location, atmosphere and unique menu also make it a great place to take out of town guests.   The combination of burgers and sushi is something I'd never seen before but it works great. The best part of the menu, other than it being huge, is that basically everything is customizable. You can create your own burger with 50+ options and you can do the same for the sushi.   Last note, expect a wait. Whether you go Monday for lunch or Saturday night, you will be waiting. Though the restaurant is fairly large, it's quite popular and almost always packed.

EbVFqyXrNKISZAxES7tokw.text: My husband and I came here on a mid afternoon date for an early dinner on Sunday. I know we are late to the game, but this was our first time coming here after being told by countless friends just how good the food is. Wanting to avoid the crowds we arrived at around 3:30 and were seated after about 5 minutes. We sat down at a combo booth/table and our waiter Chris came over right away.   For the 2 of you who might read this who have never been the menu is exhausting. There is just so much to choose from you can get lost. Chris was very patient with my husband while he worked through the pages. I knew I wanted a burger, so I got the CBCLT with just the cheese and bacon, and the grilled veggies as my side. My husband got the spicy yellow tail small roll, and we got the Parmesan truffle fries to share.   The Parmesan fries were excellent. The burger was excellent (although I did have to ask for my bacon, but they were great and very fast getting it over). But what surprised me the most was the grilled veggies. They were cut into strips of zucchini, yellow squash, green onions, and yellow peppers. So good!!  I think next time we will have to venture into the spiked milkshakes and split a burger but a great experience, we will definitely be back!

VXHVNXSJPdoD7vLvogoWXw.text: I"ll make this nice and short. Went here on a business trip and sat at the bar with a friend. Very interesting electronic menu/display they had for everybody at the bar, something i've never seen before. We both ordered a burger, sushi as an appetizer, and dessert.  The appetizer was nice and fresh (I eat a lot of sushi so I would know). And I like how it came out on a leaf, with ice underneath it, to keep the sushi cool. The burger came next and that was mouth-watering. Fries were decent, and their fried pickles are excellent (try them if you haven't before!). The dessert... oh man, was this good or what. The chocolate mousse cake I believe.. was spectacular.  I would definitely recommend this place, but make sure to make reservations 1-2 weeks before you come if you come with a party of 4 or more! Otherwise, try your luck at the bar.

h5bSZdPKX8tEVwgSIoSILA.text: Seriously. I love this place!! I only gave 4.5 stars because if you go at a normal time to eat dinner be prepared to wait 2 hours if you have more than 2 people.   That being said, I've never had a bad meal here. The sushi, the burgers, the fusion, delicious. The togarashi shrimp is a favorite of mine. If you've ever had bang bang shrimp from bonefish grill it's similar but better. The sauce is light but still spicy and the asian slaw is soooo good. I also usually get the Granny's Southern Pimento Cheese Burger.... something about getting pimento cheese and a fried green tomato on a burger is just sinful. So good. I don't necessarily have a favorite sushi dish because everything I've tried has been really good. I also got a milkshake that was the icing on the cake. I literally had to be rolled out of here the last time I went. It was gluttony at it's finest. Would definitely recommend.

xqJHOQF1hgr_PwCfUC4IIg.text: Love me some Cowfish! The entire menu here is awesome with page after page of options. Best sushi roll hands down is the Nirvana roll - highly impressed by that combo. But there is plenty of other options as well. Can't decide between the burger and the sushi? Get the burgushi... that's sushi on a burger. Or what I call a genius invention. Yet no matter what you order, ask for a side of Cowfish sauce. Great with beef entrees.   Stop in on Tuesdays for half-priced martinis. The key lime pie martini is my favorite and comes with a graham cracker rim. Smooth, cool and not overly sweet like I expected. And I sometimes savor in the alcoholic milkshakes. Will they get you buzzed? Not at all but they're a great way to end a meal and perfect to share.   And extra tip, join the Cowfish email club before you go - once you join, you receive a coupon for a free appetizer. I recommend the crab rangoon dip... plenty for the table and it's crab rangoon as a dip... that's #winning right there.   This place is always busy - which lets you know it's worth the wait - so I'd advise calling ahead and trying to stake out a spot at the bar.

YVtrcLgujVcYnua6qpEh3g.text: Horrendous service. When I eat sushi, I spend minimum of $120 for myself. Do yourself a favor and go across the street to guru

7vk5WyuWfyQW7U1x1Yb1sQ.text: Dined at Cowfish 6/18/2016 against the advice of a friend.  I would say the sushi (avocado roll) was the worse/poorly made sushi I've ever eaten to date.  I have eaten better sushi as a quick lunch meal from Publix and Harris Teeter. The best part of the meal was the parmesan fries, the burgers were so-so, both mine and my friend's burger orders were incorrect but the wait staff were nice and quickly remedied the situation. Will I dine there again?  I doubt it.

FXQvjB16iUALBwpUNlR-mA.text: I can definitely see why this place has such a great rating!  We visited the Cowfish on a Sunday night. It was well worth the 45 minute wait for a table! Our server was awesome! He went over the entire menu (which is HUGE) to make sure we didn't get lost of confused by anything. He brought us our drinks (which were mixed very well) promptly. The food was so delicious and served to us in a very timely manner (Even though the restaurant was very busy). Overall, awesome experience and we hope to go back when we are in the Charlotte area again!

tQtxLrAJmxz8DltD0TNbwA.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE! I would live here if I could. I love the servers and the food is absolutely delicious! I would definitely recommend the truffle bacon parmesan fries.

BU4T3B9JN-3w3dKhnMIXag.text: Try the burgushi!  I got the tuna and bacon "burger" and the bun was made out of the most delicious crab infused rice wrapped in won ton like wrappers.  It may sound weird but it was amazing!  The thai cucumber side was also good and had a nice kick.  I wish they had more locations!  What a fun, tasty concept!  Can't wait to return and try the rest of the menu.

lxbsv-rBRhB8aGpTKO__ag.text: Being from New York City and having tried many different cuisines I was definitely impressed. We ordered the truffle fries, nachos, and fried pickles as our appetizers. The truffle fries were delish, but I mean you can never really go wrong with truffle. The fried pickles were pretty good and the nachos were semi decent because of the avocado. I ordered the fusion box because I couldn't choose between a burger and sushi. I was definitely satisfied with my choice. The specialty roll that came with the box was very good-little spicy and very flavorful. The mini burger wasn't bad but not the best I've ever had. I usually dont like sweet potato fries but they were very crispy and good. I also ordered a spiked shake ( the no sleep til brooklyn) and it was a nice tasty way to cool off!   As far as service goes, I was very impressed with our waiter. We were in a large group and he brought all of us separate checks which is pretty unusual in New York City so I was appreciative of that.   My only warning would be to NOT sit outside on a very hot day (which is every night during the summer in good ole charlotte). Everyone basically ended up packing their food because it was way too hot to eat anything.   All in all, it was a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fusion Box

QrEaOEmKI0j_56V3vMb1vw.text: What can I say other than I LOVE COWFISH! One of the best restaurants in Charlotte. A great place to satisfy your raw fish and burger cravings all in one visit. The menu is extensive. I personally have a love/hate relationship with the menu. There is almost too much to choose from and you can do some serious damage to your wallet there. Also, be prepared to wait for a table. There is always a wait but the bar and bar tables are first come first serve. For as many times as I have been to Cowfish, I have NEVER been seated at a table. We usually go straight to the bar to begin our Cow and Fish experience.  This last visit ,we had the Ahi Tuna Salad (YUMMO) as an appetizer. The fish literally melts in your mouth and the seaweed salad is seasoned perfectly. Note, seaweed has a very unique texture. one I happen to love but if you are one of those who can't handle squishy, crunchy and slimy all in one bite, perhaps the Ahi alone is more your speed (and there is nothing wrong with that, just sayin)  My husband and I both had Bento Boxes. I feel this is a good lunch choice. A little beef, a little sushi and some extra yummies added in the box. Who knew Edamame and Sweet potato fries would taste so good together.  Because we always sit at the bar, I can't comment on the wait staff but the bar staff is superb. Very attentive, knowledgeable and because the bar is always heavily staffed, you will get very fast service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cowfish Bento Box
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ahi Tuna Salad

lrL9BLWammN7oYvWA89iQw.text: Cowfish had some very unique food with a great atmosphere. However they do not take reservations. I have been there three times but have only dined one time. The wait was over an hour long every single time! I would typically go to the bar while I wait, however theres no space at the bar during the wait. You can watch the little fish that resembles you on the waiting screen for an hour and a half but it gets boring quick. The food was well above average but certainly not worth the wait. The Mexican place next door is a solid plan B if you dont feel like waiting all night.

ZSqlcH-S6bqHeaz_nZPimw.text: Saturday night, arrive at 6:30. 1.5-2 hour wait. Ok no big deal. An hour and forty five minutes later we were seated outside in an "enclosed" patio area. I say enclosed because the zippers that sealed the panels were not secured and allowed ample amounts of the 38 degree wind to blow through.   Not only did we wait nearly two hours to eat in the cold breeze but we repeatedly had trash cans and carts pushed/pulled inches past our table on its way to the dumpster which we were conveniently located next to.   Could go on and on about the poor management and empty tables that could have had guests seated but didn't. There are far too many college dropout hipsters running the restaurant and not enough people with restaurant knowledge or experience.

Be-NJJgwyc8g6Bx-XqthWQ.text: This was our third time at this restaurant and I'm still disappointed at the over hyped food. My Screaming Korean chicken patty had no salt, too much kimchi, and unpalatably thick rings of red onions that were cut with a heavy, untrained hand. The other burgers on our table were under seasoned too and the fries were unmemorable.  If you want a better burger, head to Bad Daddy's.

CUjc3xa6rsggYDKTKH5ujQ.text: I ordered take out. Got there was greeted with amazing customer service. It was already waiting for me. I can tell good customer service when I see it. From opening the door, to leaving. Impeccable.

baLZhAz2L9MaweXpLBphTg.text: Went here with some friends/coworkers last year. Food was good and you won't find plain food here, for sure. The menu will challenge you to try something different than what you are accustomed to. Burgers are great and the fish/beef fusion concept is cool, although I am not a fan of sushi. Atmosphere was pretty loud, the seating space was relatively tight, kind of reminded me of how many NY restaurants are set up.

cdzuZmTxMBPtwf9xucYa4g.text: One of the top 5 sushi joints in #CLT.   - The tuna nachos are amazing - Bento boxes rule - Great sushi rolls and funky variety

lINxB1dJRDYPxxLIjHJaow.text: My husband and I had lunch here today for the first time. It was a great atmosphere with very friendly staff and the food was very, very good. We will definitely go back.

-aTi9LPv_pmj0rD_VJ8lOw.text: Sushi and Burgers? Only in the South! The food here was delicious but there was a very long wait for a weeknight!

fZAYQVzk7tcMa-rXJIT2ng.text: Pleasantly surprised.  We went for lunch and the selection was amazing  and quite different but a bit overwhelming.  Our waiter Nic new the menu thoroughly and explained it all and even suggested some great    We shared a lobster and crab spring roll which was delicious and I got the pastrami burger which was equally delicious    I got to witness one server meeting with the owners to do his final test   He had to explain the menu as if explaining it to a customer.  It is my understanding they go through a lot of training and studying and it sure shows.  Our glasses were never empty and the establishment is very clean.  It"s got a great patio to sit outside but we chose to stay cool inside.  Definitely check out the menu online before going so you get an idea of the kind of food they have

_hb96d9hQTdkbOwll45FNQ.text: Food and service is great!  Perfect place to go when you're craving sushi with friends who don't eat it!  The burgers are great too!

IrHTxQ501-ZO1XTlz7eLKw.text: I've never felt the need to write a review until tonight. Wen't for one of my best friends birthday, and we got the best service. Jammal, the server, was absolutely amazing and definitely the reason for my 5 star review. Recommend 10/10 :) Will be coming back soon.

zOdPmM3K-m-T35xckQJJuw.text: Well, I finally made it to Cowfish.  I believe that this was my 4th attempt with the first three being shot down by the long wait to get in.  That's the problem with either not having time to wait or being starved and needing to go somewhere else less busy.  Anyway, I had planned to be at the restaurant shortly after they open on a Saturday morning and that proved to be a good idea, as they were packed and a lineup for tables had formed by the time that we left.    The wife and I split a seaweed salad, a bison burger and a couple of sushi rolls.  The menu here is huge with all the options for sushi, burgers and everything in between.  The burger had some nice chipotle heat to it and was very enjoyable.  The sushi rolls were huge and were "fusion" rolls called tropical storm and the south park roll.  They were basically sushi rolls with layers of sashimi on the outside.  All the ingredients were fresh and had great flavors including the smoked salmon, tuna and yellow tail.  The service really blew me away here, as our server was very energetic and explained the menu thoroughly and expertly.  Overall, it was a great first experience for me at Cowfish.  It was a solid 4.5 stars but I will keep it at 4 for now and likely return and upgrade to a 5.

KKZbzO9yUaO7Ntp-RX3ymQ.text: A restaurant with great Yelp ratings serving SUSHI in Charlotte I was pleasantly surprised. I did not give this place a 5th star for one reason always to crowded. 5 stars for taste, ambiance, creativity and cheap prices on drinks. I love how they have burgers in a sushi place because there is someone who always hate sushi in a group of friends big plus.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

0RkL15NHskErrAVYZW7ijA.text: Not sure what is about me and my food, but it never fails, something goes horribly wrong.   Was in there yesterday for a late lunch, I ordered the Seared Tuna Nicoise salad and a glass of the Caymus (or was it Caymay) chardonnay.   The chardonnay was incredible subtle hints of fruit and a creamy finish.   Then came the food... They brought out the seared tuna appetizer... did not order that... asked one of the bartenders what this was... it was not the salad so he took it back... then the original bartender came over to apologize.. fine whatever, but could you please ask the kitchen to put the herb dressing and ginger dressing on the side. He said sure and walked back to the kitchen...   Ok, still waiting... finally it comes out. The salad looked lovely and fresh-really beautiful. The dressing were good (not great), but what ruined my lunch was the tuna... a piece was put on my plate that you couldn't even knife through.. WTF, this is the second time... If I had put that in my mouth, I would have lost it... I am so picky about my sushi... REALLY... the first time this happened with the salmon and now the tuna...   Ok, so Meghan, the ultra cool manager was not there, instead it was some shitty manager. I brought the cut of meat to his attention, he apologized but reluctantly.   That really blows... he blows... do I really ever want to go back... probably not. Well at least not for the sushi... I know better than to order sushi so far from the ocean.   Sorry Cowfish... your sushi grade fish blows. Or your staff for allowing that on a plate (TWICE).

bBlufLD6--cRLMotxhw18g.text: Good food, a little over priced for what it is but a ton of variety. If you go on a Thursday or weekend night, be prepared to wait if you haven't called ahead.

4jryx3as9J3K673RDsGjKw.text: I love getting their sashimi platter - since they get such high turn around, their fish is always pretty good. When I eat sushi there, it's hit or miss - sometimes the rice is good, other times the rolls are over compressed and the texture suffers. Also, they sometimes under-season the rice. the The burgushi, although interesting, is not great.

RB6uDep-9RuD6__BbE25ow.text: If you are looking for a fun playful sushi restaurant Cowfish is the place to go. I have been to the sister restaurant Eez in Birkdale Village. When I heard the owner was opening a new restaurant I had to try the place out.  Remember if you are going to Cowfish to expect a long wait and if you cannot accept that than go early or choose somewhere different. The wait is well worth the delicious food and drinks offered. I ordered a Manhattan from the bar as we waited and this drink was definitely worthy of the cost. It was a very deliciously concocted and as per Manhattan the Maker's Mark was not weak.   To start dinner we ordered the crab rangoon dip which was amazing. In hindsight we did not need to order this app but it was delicious nonetheless. We the ordered a sushi roll each. Having eaten at Eez we knew that the rolls here are huge but once again little did we know one of the plates was massive! We ordered The Motherload which would have been perfect for my boyfriend and I to share. It had so much fish and was definitely a great value. We also ordered another roll that does not come to mind but we loved everything!  I would definitely recommend The Cowfish however if you live closer to the lake or just want sushi check out Eez by the same folks and you will not be dissapointed.

5CCIDkzOFwO_zQl8z_BkKg.text: We had a great experience and delicious food. I love sushi and my husband loves meat and potatoes so this is the first sushi place that offered the best of both worlds. We are looking forward to returning! I didn't post pics only because everything we had was already posted and you just can't go wrong with any of it. Enjoy a festive cocktail as well.

ZvNSuZ3aOeCe_pj5h2yV4w.text: OK I can say enough about this place the food has been consistently awesome everytime we go. The Truffle fries are out of this world they have a Parmesan Cheese sauce and Bacon on there is nothing the world better then that combination. The sushi i have had has been very good and i tend to order something from the menu everytime just so i can try something new. I also always order a burger because i Love to try something new. I am fat guy so that is what i eat so much. My wife always gets the Bento Box with something different everytime as well. This is a go to spot if we are down in South Park and My wife doesnt like going to the same place twice because we are new to the area and are supposed to try new places all the time. I pretty much have to beg to go here but she never is upset after one of there really good cocktails.

VUarQLEB4TnZOBM8WhSc1g.text: The food was amazing, the service was amazing and the portions are fulfilling! This is a good option not only for sushi lovers but also for burger lovers. Don't skip appetizers they're really good

mRiVSCPeFoksz1SXuWB2Wg.text: I don't think there is a better dinner value anywhere in Charlotte than the Bento Box at the Cowfish. A yummy roll, a little burger slider, those great sweet potato fries, and my favorite - the cucumber salad! What more could you ask for???  I also really liked the different 'flavors' of edamame and the seared sesame tuna appetizer is delicious!  The Cowfish is always reliably good. And on a nice evening, there's no better spot than the patio.  The Cowfish is also always reliably packed, so be prepared for a wait!

HsxJMjCe9RSM739-JZ8wcw.text: I've now recommended this place to friends who visit Charlotte because my family lives there. This place is hip and trendy for a reason.  I arrived and was told it would be 45min. to get a table. Not happy about that, but we decided to wait. I ordered a glass of wine (which was good) but honestly, the bar staff are not friendly. Train them please, management.  Once we sat down, our waiter was pretty consistently checking on us for the rest of the evening. And this place was slammed. Service was impressive.  I'm most impressed by the variety of the menu. Every kind of roll you can imagine, and sashimi to die for. The nigiri was good, the sushi was good. The portions were cut a little too big (even after I requested they be cut smaller). I've seen this problem on several reviews.  But we didn't have one bad thing at the table. I'll go again and again.

ObMfpQssm1UbuYBPyd7fLg.text: The bison burgushi was pretty good but several pieces in I was just thinking about how much better the experience would be if I was just eating a bison burger. I had one of the tuna specialty rolls as well and it was excellent. Portions are very large. One specialty roll is enough honestly.

00mBhIiH2qEbs5EbEHaNlw.text: I went there for the first time last night and my server was SO sweet and patient with us on our first visit. The food was BEYOND fantastic and the peach sake is great! We will definitely be returning soon!

_Kg32U8WpuMtJO7kL32YdQ.text: Went to this place last night for dinner with some friends and it was fan-damn-tastic. Service was prompt and even though they initially told us it would be a hour wait we somehow got seated after about 10 mins of milling about at the bar area. The interior of the restaurant is very large with a central bar area and even though it was a Tuesday night it was packed out.   For a appetizer we all shared a plate of calamari and it was prepared very well. Maybe a little heavy on the batter but it was neither over cooked or under cooked which sometimes seems to be a challenge for a lot of restaurants. For my main meal I had a tuna burger and it was the best I have ever had. Side of fried pickles.  I can't really think of a bad thing to say about this place. The meal was all around excellent and at around 25$ a plate (app&main) it's well worth it if you are looking for a dinner night out.

Gla_RVUkk0Y3Zq4xTUAP-w.text: I think cowfish is overrated. There is always a long wait, they don't take reservations and there are way better sushi restaurants in Charlotte.  I do like the concept though, because if I can't make up my mind, there is always a way to get a little bit of both (the bento box is my hero, and is what I've ordered both times I've been to the cowfish because I get a little bit of burger, a little bit if sushi and I don't have to pick one or the other). Their sushi is fine, the burger is fine and I always leave satisfied.  Only three stars because I just don't think it's worth the wait.

kDHlA2jcoAu9ixrbeHDG2g.text: We love Cowfish so much that we go every Saturday. It's the only place in town are two picky toddlers make "happy plates". The bento boxes are unreal and the service is always outstanding. The manager almost always stops by our table to say hello and today we had Iyesha who was quick to bring the kids' food out first and made the kids laugh. Love this place!

L5d4rpdRDHWy0pHsCAVp2A.text: Came here for lunch after hearing they do gluten free sushi.  I'm very sensitive so it is always a gamble when trying a new restaurant for the first time but the waitress was well trained and knew exactly what I was talking about. They don't have a separate gluten free menu but all the GF items are clearly marked.  They also brought out gluten free soy sauce for me (always a bonus).   The only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the prices.

JTY_ZF1RTuEGpApoxLYg1w.text: So busy on a Sunday night! There's was an hour and fifteen minute wait but I got lucky enough to grab a seat at the bar. I ordered the tuna nachos and it was so delicious! However the bartender was so busy that I waited almost 30 min before I was able to order anything.

C8LzaFCsYMcz3xjbetn5IA.text: I thought it was really good food but the service   and the burger I ordered was extremely juicy and perfectly cooked and If you are looking for a funky little joint In Charlotte this is the place for you

dVs1ai6YyIJS4hB1fAen3Q.text: 5 Stars and excellent food!  I have been wanting to try Cowfish or awhile and finally went. I went around lunchtime and made a reservation the day before. They take reservations 11-6, so if you plan to go in that time definitely call the day before because they tend to stay very busy. We chose to sit outside which was nice, plenty of tables, and it was covered as well.   For an appetizer we had the onion rings, very good! They come is small and large sizes, the large had about 7-8 huge onion rings, the dipping sauces are delicious as well, esp the sweet chili sauce.   As my main meal i had a fushion bento box. Complete with sushi, a speciality mini burger, edamame, cucumber salad, and sweet potato fries. They give you plenty of food, i took home leftovers  Overall great experience, i will be back! They have a huge menu so lots of options!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. onion rings and bento box with specialty burger and rainbow roll

6YTBWDxNqOaPrRi9VoV07Q.text: Had the worst experience here!!!!! Server was not attentive at all, we had to wait on our drinks from the bar that were watered down and we got our appetizer 2 minutes before our entree. The burgers were over cooked. We asked for medium, but we got them well done. When we asked what temp the server put in, she said well done because she "assumed" we wanted them done well. I had such high hopes for this place.

yyQUOBmBQdEuGS_SMbyboA.text: This menu is INSANE. We were in town for the weekend and decided to stop by. Did I say the menu was INSANE already? There are so many things to choose from, so it was a little overwhelming at first, but everything was amazing. The service was friendly. Drinks (bloody mary especially) were SO good. I wish I had one closer so I could even attempt to try the entire menu!

q9IDUM3FU9NA3oWVyfEbFw.text: Highly recommend if you are anywhere near the Charlotte area.  This place should have something for every type of eater out there and all of it is fantastic.  Pair this with a great staff that works really well together and you have a unbeatable combination.

qhe4YpZjEoIhE9XjHdkk9g.text: LOVE this place! My boyfriend and I come here all the time! Best fusion spot ever! Definitely try out their parmesan truffle fries, they're so addicting

8ZazmEecC4AKlhhqyBfrkQ.text: grrat place and great food  we went me and my friends service was fast and friendly and food was tasty

gWzJgTPdd8h1rcrE_6MoAw.text: Very nice setting and a good restaurant to be at with family or friends. The food is good and they have good sushi options. Our order took more time than anticipated, which was fine until half way through my meal I noticed my dish contained bacon. Being a vegetarian, that's the last thing you want to see on your plate, but I just set it aside and told my waiter. The manager came to the table and apologized, and I appreciated that. I still like the place and would surely go back! mistakes do happen...

GZi2FkPxtFWZOly8HcaBlg.text: "Hey, you got your burger in my bento box!"  "You got your sushi in my hamburger!"  The Cowfish is a brilliant restaurant concept that marries the red-hot gourmet burger trend with always popular sushi and other various Asian(ish) food styles.  The prices are a bit high and the service is pushy, but the food is creative and it tastes pretty good too.  You can get a bento box that features a half-roll of sushi, a burger slider, and generous helpings of a few sides.  Mine was $14 and came with sweet potato fries, edamame, and some sort of pickled cucumber and onion salad.  Our server tried to talk me into ordering two full-sized entrees instead of the bento box because it would be more food.  Well, duh.  Two adult sized entrees will be more food, but it will also be twice the price.  And I can't imagine who would remain hungry after polishing off one of these bento boxes.  They are substantial.  The sushi roll was well prepared and fresh.  The slider tasted okay but it wasn't anything special.  It came topped with jalapeno and a spicy sauce.  I also sampled one of the regular, non-sushi full-sized burgers.  It had bacon on it and tasted pretty good, though not particularly memorable.  Passable but not craveable.  Our server kept trying to get us to order extra sides and more expensive items.  I understand that this is part of the job and that a higher bill means more tip money, but gee whiz... this guy was overkill.  After a certain point you've just got to let it go and leave your diners in peace.  I really, really love this concept.  The execution was decent too, although I think the burgers could use a bit of refining.  The prices seem too high by about $2-3 per dish and the service borders on rude, but I would return if I were in the Charlotte area again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fusion Specialty Bento Box ($14)

ik8EkFSwBMcebpLbRfkfig.text: Met a friend here for dinner on a cold, rainy night.  We were seated on the patio which was quite nice due to heat lamps.  My friend ordered a bento box, which came with sushi, a small burger, sweet potato fries, edamame and a very delicious cucumber salad.  I got the Birkenstocky Shiitake Maki.  It sounded so flavorful from the description, but the rolls were bland. Service was good, and this was a good halfway to meet my friend.  I will return, but next time I will try a salad or the veggie burger.  I heard that the burger is spicy with loads of tastiness!

N0krnT94pbTokf-9btQq0w.text: The best combination of both worlds for Sushi and Burgers. Always get the crab dip for an appetizer. Always tip your waitress or waiter.

SlMroolS2CPixi4PACv9Fw.text: I love cowfish, but I always tend to order the same thing, the All-American Double Cheeseburgooshi which is still my favorite. The most recent time I was there I decided to try something new, Doug's Filet Roll. It has filet mignon, so I assumed it was going to be warm like the burgooshi. I was surprised when it wasn't and I honestly didn't like it. The server noticed and immediately offered me something else. I love how attentive the waitstaff was and the manager even came over to apologize, which wasn't necessary because I did order the roll. Cowfish really cares about their guests.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. All-American Cheesburgooshi  To.Die.For.

upFViLH1vJy_vYqCDdESwQ.text: Not only is the food great at Cowfish, but they are amazingly accommodating for people with allergies. I was dining with someone who is severely allergic to soy--this means that burger buns and cooking oil are both risky areas. The staff was very attentive to the allergy and they even put a special label on her burger to ensure that it was soy-free. Such a good experience! PS: if you can't decide what to order, get a bento box.

swj4BAVjun0ShZYStS49KQ.text: OMG!!! This place was worth the drive from Columbia,  SC! The food was some of the best I've ever had. Graham was awesome and every suggestion was right on! First time but certainly not the last!!! Scottie, manager, made sure everything was great. Wish we had one in Columbia.

qZ3utNIzNUj0Oh_aixl0UQ.text: This was my first time here and I decided to try the burgushi. As a traditional sushi lover, I thought this fusion was very interesting! I was hesitant on getting it rare so I tried it as a medium rare. Next time, I'm going to try the rare a go!

D1pCH_VxwFbGwFjV6SCcwA.text: I cannot say this place was as amazing as I had hoped. Especially after my colleague and the gentleman at my hotel were raving about it.   Was the food good? Yeah. Was it amazing? No.  I got the two time roll (I believe that's what it was called), some edamame, and we shared some nachos and had a glass of wine.  Like I said- good, but not the great or amazing meal I was hoping for/expecting based on expectations that were set.   Service was great- hence the 4 stars, but that's the best that I think I can do.

3Y12PiLU4gyJBKjQCe1myA.text: Cowfish is the BOMB! I love the food, the drink, the service. Everything! My boyfriend loves their burger and I truly enjoy their rolls and even sashimi even though I am not a sashimi or raw meat person at all. The white tuna fish is awesome!  We got 2 combos and 1 "made it yourself" roll. One of the combos has a mini burger, some edamame, cucumber salad, sweet potato fries and four pieces of The Boss roll. The other has some sashimi (tuna and salmon), shrimp tempura roll, nigiri (salmon, tuna and white tuna). The "made it yourself" is fried calamari with jalapenos with tempura crumble and spicy mayo on top. I also got a mango mojito which was not bad. The price was a bit high though.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Made it yourself roll with fried calamari and jalapeños with spicy mayo and tempura crumble

3jCCMlX2k20rhCaxB2YFJw.text: The couple times we've been here the food has been amazing! The drinks are on the pricey side but everything is well worth it. Be prepared to wait a bit. Would highly recommend for a date night!

BIgMFM8ZL7D7RaUqZn911A.text: They have Amazing burgers.... So creative, and yet so good.... Really delicious. The meat is gmo and antibiotic free. Which, really adds to it.  The traditional sushi, however, was just okay. Not anything different than you would get anywhere else.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon burger.... Legit... Too legit
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bison burger....

SR-sxWlZpG1juwYohSG-jQ.text: I have to say I was a bit disappointed last night, Sunday. The wait lasted about twice as long as they said it would but since it was my daughter's birthday and she picked it we waited. Once seated and our order taken the waiter came back about 20 minutes later to say they were out of Veggie paddies, which is what my daughter wanted. 20 min9, really. It was busy but still. Anyway, it just wasn't a very good experience for her.  We will be back but be ready for a not so great experience. Oh, the food was ok. Not as good as past meals there.  Update : I'd like to thank the management for responding to my post. I was very impressed with such a timely response. As I stated I will be back. One bad night is not a reason to not return. Thank yoy.

aG4PCcAsoBrqxihOrpDSnA.text: This place is so much fun. I have been here multiple times for different occasions. Most recently I brought my nieces here when they came to visit and they loved the atmosphere and the food. Since one of my nieces doesn't particularly like seafood or sushi, while the other is a pescatarian it was the perfect combination. They both enjoyed their meals and we had a great time drinking 1/2 priced wines, since it was a Wednesday night!   My top choices are the calamari, the avocado and tuna martini and the tuna nachos! The waiter was also super patient with us since we wanted to order each course and enjoy it since we were in no rush. Although there was a wait I genuinely did not feel rushed out the door.   I will definitely be returning and enjoying more sushi soon!

IXpU07yRa-deM4vM7pG8_Q.text: Friendly staff and management. The food was perfectly prepared.  Great fusion bento box option and sushi was top notch.   Only downside, they switched our beers at table, but all beer is good beer anyway. I'd definitely come again!

KLNgMbgHuJ-1zWn4wEplGw.text: Had a great experience here. My cocktails were incredible. They had friendly staff. And my burger was to die  for.  Went on a Saturday night and had a very short wait. Will definitely be back!

7g2C-lLujJHYL4hUDzcy4Q.text: I was in town for business and had a great experience at a Cowfish in Orlando, so I figured to check out this location (turns out that the NC Cowfish is the ORIGINAL! Who knew?).   I got a seat at the bar, ordered a drink and two sushi rolls (Brian was a phenomenal bartender and host and provided some great recommendations - I had this "scallop & steak roll" that will no longer be on the menu, and OMG, when it hit my lips, it was heaven). I ate everything, and while I could have eaten more, I'm happy I stopped myself short of a food coma. Even the manager Scott came up and said hello to check in.  Great establishment and great customer service. Whenever I'm in town again, I will be back!

NwFri1OKBxHj8uZX229xyg.text: I absolutely love this place. I'm not really sure how anyone couldn't fall in love with Cowfish. They have it all. Sushi, burgers, milkshakes, sake... they even have fried pickles! Yes, a sushi joint has fried pickles and they are damn good.   First thing you need to know: there will be a wait on Friday and Saturday nights. A long wait. At least an hour. You may even wait on a week night. Scope out the bar. Grab a spot if you see one. Or, put your name on the list and walk somewhere else to have a cocktail or shop while you wait. They do not take reservations.   Specials:  Mondays- 1/2 price cocktails Tuesdays- 1/2 price martinis Wednesday- 1/2 price bottles of wine Thursday- 1/2 price sake  The food: you can't really go wrong with anything here. There's a TON of options on the menu. You may get overwhelmed looking at it. Take a deep breath and dive in to the deliciousness.  I love to order the fusion specialty bento box. I go with whatever the slider of the day is. The sides are delicious. My favorite is the cucumber salad.  Apps: do you like crab rangoon? ORDER THE CRAB RANGOON DIP. It's a deconstructed crab rangoon and it's delicious. It's worth noting again... the fried pickles are damn good. Big Al's Yellowtail, Tuna Nachos, parmesan truffle fires... all fantastic. Your biggest problem here may be narrowing down your order.   Super unique and always worth the wait. This is a great spot for girls night or date night. I love to bring out of town guests here.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Parmesan truffle fries
