1GEf64Caq5tG6_07ITK4qQ.text: Had wonderful service and amazing food. Bear experience in Charlotte. Great wine as well.

Hkg5iOMJAOAu3VHykfaTHw.text: We typically come here once a year as the food is usually pretty good. This year the food was not that good and very inconsistent from our last trip. The service was perfect as usual but the food quality wasn't what we are used to.

45-JojCY9w7FtvIQWrptPA.text: Great place to eat.  Service was also very good.  Our waitress checked on us often to ensure we had what we needed.  We got the bento dinner which was great as well as the BBQ pork sushi roll which we were hesitant about but it was GREAT!  Certainly recommend this place for good and good service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

DEiyw3g3ZIiZC0Mh2JMcwQ.text: Amazing!! This place seriously has something for everyone. Tonight, I tried out the build your own sushi and was not disappointed! Very cool being able to have it made exactly as you want it.  Service is always great, everyone is is friendly!! Their outdoor patio is still open and covered with space heaters as well - the perfect spot to hang out for a while.

gigisROFhFaLsEXuLX3PtA.text: I've heard this restaurant mentioned endlessly since I moved to Charlotte over a year ago. Back then I wanted nothing to do with sushi, so I just brushed the recommendations off even though this place was said to have amazing burgers. Fast forward to the present....I've been dragged kicking and screaming to a few local sushi places, so now I enjoy eating it unlike before. One afternoon after shopping at South Park, I decide to give it a shot.  It was early afternoon, and the only seats available were on the enclosed heated patio. My daughter and I enjoyed the decor, really fun to look at. The menu is very huge! I had an idea of what I wanted to order after looking at other people's Instagram dinners.   I couldn't restrain myself, which meant I ordered way too much food, but I loved everything. Daughter and I shared the lobster rolls which were smashing! We both had burgers and I ordered firecracker sushi. I went back and forth between eating a huge juicy burger and delicious sushi! I had no self control. My daughter just shook her head at me. I've eaten at 12 other burger places locally and this one is my favorite so far. I see why it is always packed, I can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummiest sushi
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Arnold Hamadeggar

Lk8apCP_prOj_zc0D6CCOQ.text: Excellent sushi and service. We had such a great time. I highly recommend stopping in if you're in Charlotte!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

WudcOUqVEZNQ12ntlk0G3A.text: I've been here several times, trying something new every time I've returned, and I've loved everything. The service is excellent and the food is too. The only thing I don't understand is why there isn't one in my hometown-- and also how people could give this restaurant less than 5 stars.

h9Ap4bQxZYQUa1Y5ykUAow.text: Went here for our anniversary lunch. Very good. Grabbed the Bento box and enjoyed a slider and some sushi  Good draft IPA and sampler sake

E5uIOYai8sz6mBaECQ8Hdw.text: I always have a great experience and meal at Cowfish. They have more unique and tasty options to cover any diet, preference, or hankering.  The food is fantastic and they have the best, cool and friendly servers.  My favorites:   Lobster & Crab Spring Rolls Crab Rangoon Dip The All-American Bacon Double Cheeseburgooshi The Nature Boy's WOOOOO-shi BuffalOOOOO-shi Roll Blackened Tuna Roll  I consistently get great service and a great meal at Cowfish.  #lovecowfish

3G3lPzJ_9fwEG1gdJIF_gw.text: Thank you brittnie for being our 1st waitress here. You did amazing at going over the menu!! I loved it!!!! It was told by a friend to come and try it and it was exactly what she said it would be!! We will return in our travels and tell friends!! We had three rolls and beers to match. (Well crown royal and coke too).... thank you !! 5 STARS!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

v2CdqcfLbmJQLBOJ1NJOCQ.text: Cowfish is an incredible restaurant. It's one of those places, when you have friends come in from out of town, you can't wait to take them to.     I can promise you it has menu items that you won't see anywhere else.  That alone makes them special, but the quality of their eccentric menu is what really sets them apart!      Starting with their famous "Burgushi" which combines classic burger-esque proteins like ground beef, steak and BBQ into a sushi roll.  My favorite is the The Nature Boy's WOOOOO-shi BuffalOOOOO-shi Roll (Sauteed chipotle bison, fried green tomato, grilled onions, feta cheese inside, coated with tempura flakes. Topped with fresh green tomato, chipotle aioli, diced tomato, red onion, jalapeno pepper).  It definitely lives up to it's namesake!  I have tried all the Burgushi's and enjoyed every one of them. If you are taking someone for the first time, try to get them to at least split one Burgushi with you.  Appetizers that are must orders: 1.  Crab Rangoon Dip and Blackened Tuna Nachos.  Both will change your life...trust me!  If you are looking for a really solid traditional Sushi roll, I recommend the: Mad Mango-Cado Roll (Shrimp tempura, kani inside, coated with tempura flakes. Topped with mango, avocado and sweet eel sauce. Served with a side of spicy mayo) This one will work for event the pickiest of sushi eaters.  If you are in the mood for a burger, you can't go wrong with any of them, but I particularly like the:  The Texas Longhorn  (Half-pound beef burger, cheddar cheese, onion strings, jalapeno bacon, tangy BBQ sauce, lettuce, tomato, brioche bun)

lzYBiUCsKmtaB0PwzMo1iw.text: I want to write about the good things first, then why I did not give it 5 stars.  We were seated outside on the beautiful patio that was lit with plenty of fans.  I was never hot and really enjoyed the outdoor scenery here.  We also have a toddler, so the outdoor patio was perfect for our messy eater.  I ordered our son's food first, the kids' mini burgers, and I must admit the kids food was pretty good!  I also ordered the spiked shake, 'no sleep til Brooklyn' (for Mom).  It was wonderful and I loved it!  Coffee, rum, chocolate, espresso beans, whipped cream, ice cream, yum!!!!  Must drink if coffee and chocolate are your thing.  I love sushi.  But I decided that the Cowfish bento box would be more bang for my buck.  It was pretty good, the mini burger was the best.  I don't like French fries much, but the sweet potato fries were delicious.  I am an avid sushi eater, and I thought the spicy tuna was ok.  Not bad, just not the best.  However, my teen daughter and husband really enjoyed their sushi, as they both eat sushi as much as I do.  They both ordered separate rolls, and theirs looked very good.  The presentation here is great as far as the food appearance is concerned.  I did not give 5 stars because we had a 45 minute wait.  However, it was dinner time on a Friday night.  Also, we waited a long time for our food.  I made a point to order our toddler's food first because he was starving at this point.  Luckily I had some crackers for him.  So expect a very long wait to eat.  But that is typical for good places on a Friday night.  I would come back earlier in the evening with small kids.

B9NGpYiYfzfxsdvMTyXCFg.text: I don't give five stars often. This one deserves it not necessarily for the taste of the food, which was excellent, but for the creativeness! Cow fish? Exactly, beef and sushi, not just on the place, but combined in the sushi! I only wish this was in my area. If I am ever back in Charlotte, I WILL return. Don't let the descriptions scare you off. Try it, you'll LOVE it!

tYljiBOSO_5kE4tRTlJ95A.text: That's a lot of food!  Admittedly, we order apps (in retrospect - not necessary). The deconstructed crab rangoon (dip) was a hit - especially with my daughter. Very good chicken satay and cucumber salad. I was boring and ordered a cobb salad - fresh, simple and exactly what I wanted. My husband had Porky's Revenge - a burger topped with pulled pork. Thumbs up from him on it. Yes, it was as big as it sounds. Leftovers for days.  One thing that was off was the wait for seating. We were told that there was no wait and yet were handed a pager. We ended up waiting for 15 minutes - all the while the the hostess(es) kept saying there was no wait, that they just had to get menus??? Very odd. Otherwise the service was good.

5Krz9A4HuoB8scJt2qndjg.text: it takes AGES and AGES and AGES to be seated and even then the food is so so and drinks over priced. It is incredibly noisy. Good location and the decor is 'funky' but that's it for this place. I live around the corner and out of towners love thgis place but that's because it's a 'happening place'.

6rd8fSVwUqgNbp_T36w-bw.text: Whoaa...meat in a sushi roll????  I had the 'Lamb-Burgushi' roll and it straight up blew my mind.   From now on, when a server asks me how I'd like my lamb prepared, I'm going to say 'rolled'.  Aside from the great menu, the server was cool and knew a lot about sushi and all the other concoctions they had to offer (including the drinks).  Only downside is the noise.  There's a lot of racket in this place.

xwnKjBu6YBHwMp9i4Ko8cA.text: OBSESSED with this place. The food is amazing. You cannot go to Cowfish without getting the Bento Box. They have great take out too. Wonderful prices for even better food.  Only drawback is that they dont take reservations and even on a Tuesday this place is slammed pack (there was a 2.5 hour wait for a part of 3) making it incredibly noisy. If you are lucky, try finding a spot  at the bar.

93Sdy3ouYH6iu8M_pr3mHQ.text: Wish I could make it here more often.  Interesting menu and honestly a really fun place to eat. I have enjoyed everything I have ever had at this restaurant. Worth the visit

EIr7r60VArtKOzzXbz5CTA.text: Sushi and burger bento box was delicious. Christopher our waiter was great. Charlotte brewed Ginger Gold cider on drafter was yummy. Overall amazing first and not the last meal at The Cowfish! Definitely coming back. A little something for everyone.

uxOVOAKCW4OSdJsERgke0g.text: Yummy Food. More of a sports bar type of place though. Not my kinda thing, but would go back with friends for drinks and dinner. Go for lunch if you are in the area. Hard to get a table during dinner hours.

3C5QqXf5uG9R1aRZnH5hKQ.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte and by far my favorite sushi place. The fish is extremely fresh and there are very unique combinations on the menu.  If you don't like sushi, the gourmet burgers are actually fantastic.  No matter what you have, wash it down with a birthday cake milkshake, its amazing.

fSmyEHVPA1RjCCyJVpj9vw.text: This place wowed me when the waiter said my veggie burger can be pan-seared and put in the oven & not on the same grill as the meat burgers.  It actually tasted very delicious and can't wait to go back and make another veggie creation.  However, if you are a strict vegetarian I would stay away from the fried foods (I didn't eat any fries) because it is fried in the same oil as the fish and other meats. I would recommend making dinner reservations a couple of weeks in advance because sitting takes some time during the weekends & nights.

nA_dhZRkESdEI8jKK0-EDA.text: Went for the first time a week ago, heard a lot of great things about it, thought it was expensive but really it was reasonable priced, food was great, just took forever to get a table even tho it was a week day, but I guess it only means they doing something right.

ywsFwegZ2aguFS8EwS1OEg.text: It's been over a year since I have been here, but I used to eat here all the time, back when I worked in the area.   The menu--creative with an extensive well-thought out selection  The sushi-- very good; clever flavor combinations; one of the better places to get Sushi in South Charlotte (South Charlotte and downtown are really the only areas to get sushi, as far as I'm concerned)  Interior-- clean, modern, trendy. The tone is casual/fun but still very fitting for the more upscale Southpark audience and myraid of working professionals in the area.  Overall, I think the restaurant's concept works. Would definitely recommend.

F8ljQ4qRDuMROz0p7hhoJg.text: Great sushi selection. New and clean restaurant. One tv at the bar which could have been better but a place I would recommend. Outside seating looked very nice.

nrPXCQBSU4Xckw3n626sUQ.text: Meh. I mean, sure, if you're into 2-hour waits on a Wednesday and expensive, mediocre sushi, by all means go for it!

DoUGRXuW53PM8R-ZAJQdpg.text: Visited for the first and NOT the last time last sunday.  Loved everything about this place.  The food was good, the $5 Mimosas, the location, the waitress....everything about this place was redonkulously good.  Had the Hi-Five (or something like that) sushi and the lettuce wraps. The menu has lots of options for everyone which is cool.  My goal is to try something new everytime I go!!  Yeah Cowfish!!!

YQSz25NVagEDN-5Ks5yBgw.text: OH. MY. GOD.  This place was soooo good. It's expensive, mind you, but the quality honestly begets the price. Some of the most unique and cool burgers I've ever seen. The sushi was damn good, and the "burgushi" were just amazing. It tasted like a little bit of everything at different times in its consumption. As it was, I got a burger, one friend got sushi, and another got burgushi, so we could try a little bit of everything. No one regretted their decision. My burger was really big, juicy, and 100% delicious. So they've got that down.  Also, there's so friggin' much on the menu to try, that if you had the money to come back time and again, you could always try something new. The menu is huge and the staff helped us navigate through it, make recommendations, etc. It was almost daunting in its size, which isn't something that happens often, I don't think.  There is no restaurant that serves food quite like this. Go for the uniqueness alone, and leave wholly satisfied by the strange, exotic, and wholly awesome food combinations you just ate.  But, uh, leave with a little bit of a hole burned in your wallet too. ;) However much it may be worth it.  PS (edit addendum): If you need to use the bathroom, do it--there's an audio track that plays in there that teaches you phrases in English vs Redneck vs Malaysian (I think?). Highly amusing.

_0uLHBpZVrfRLB0HaKSgoQ.text: I was in Charlotte for work and luckly I had a car to be able to venture out to places not near my hotel.  I ended up at the mall and walking around trying to find something to eat that wasnt a chain and I found Cowfish.  The name of course drew me to the place and who doesnt like the thought of burgers and sushi?  I walked in and it was really busy so I asked if I could sit at the bar.  They were prompt with getting me a menu and a drink.  It was my first time there and was a little overwhelmed with the menu but had to navigate it myself since the staff didnt offere to recommend or help me navigate through.  I really wanted a burger and a sushi roll but when I asked my waitress she said it would be way too much food so I decided to have a "texas" burger.  The wait wasnt long and the food wasnt bad.  After mid-way through I told myself I should have gotten the sushi.  My only complaint was the staff at the bar.  I had 3 different people waiting on me and had my diet coke only filled once.  My main waitress didnt talk to me much as she was too busy talking to the guy from L.A. next to me the whole time!    All in all it wasnt a bad experience but I suggest if you want a little more 1on1 time with your waiter/waitress you better wait for a table and not sit at the bar.

rPTCi61uvgssdko7wt5UFQ.text: This place is awesome!! Dont be fooled by the weird sounding combinations.  Everything is fantastic!!!  The food is delicious and the staff is very friendly.  This is a great place to go the is different from your everyday restaurant.  The crab rangoon appetizer is phenom!!!  My biggest complaint about this place is they dont take reservations so I dont go that frequently.  I despise waiting to eat and theres always a line (guess that means they are doing something right).

b46sR-aX41X7fDT9KbheJA.text: Sushi is pretty good, all their other food is a little overpriced but overall not a bad restaurant. The eel was exceptionally good.

AsRT9Xi1hFsZUh2WXmGgcQ.text: It's a pity this has to be rated so low because honestly if they executed the food that is on the menu better it could be great. Everything looks wonderful on the menu, and some things look truly interesting, but they arrive pretty but lacking. Costwise it's not at all out of line, if it were well executed, and you get a surprising amount of food when it arrives (which unfortunately isn't a good thing when the food isn't great).   I split the lamb sushi roll with my tablemate and it was the best part of the meal, though the tzatziki was bland. With a bit of tweaking (stronger flavor and fresh herbs) could have made that dish spectacular instead of just good. The lamb itself was well seasoned and the other ingredients worked well with it.   My main meal was the 'ultimate bento' in hopes of getting a sampling of what the food could be, but it wasn't so ultimate. It had clearly been sitting around waiting for a while (it took forever to get it) which did the food no favors, but it was poorly executed to begin with. The sushi roll was soggy (probably from the time sitting), which made for a miserable experience since fried calamari had been in the equation. The calamari ended up a soggy mess in the middle of the roll. The slider was very poorly cooked (one patty was cooked to death and may have even bounced if dropped, while the other was medium and actually spot on), the pimento cheese that was supposed to be on it literally was a smaller dab than my fingernail, and there was just a single soggy shaved pepper on it. The sweet potato fries were no better than what you'd experience in a cheap restaurant, which was also unfortunate since I really like sweet potato fries, but the sitting I'm sure had a lot to do with that as well. The cucumber salad was good, though realistically it couldn't have ever made up for the rest of it.  Overall I'd say save your money. Spend it somewhere where the execution lives up to the description on the menu.

xzFnyEKcIV8cxz4xOIKvrw.text: What can I say, this restaurant is one of my top 3 favorites! The menu is amazing! Love the Georgia roll, and they also have a steak roll with filet mignon and lobster! To die for! You will never be bored or disappointed with this menu. There crowded on weekend nights so make sure you get there early and put your name in. The service here and wait staff are excellent! I'll be back many, many times!

rvfPsHILDa0LavuEBFe5yg.text: Great place. The burger sushi is awesome for someone that doesn't like normal sushi . It is a little pricey however I would certainly recommend it.

iowjy2kw1fqOhajsjk4u7g.text: Cool atmosphere, neat setup, one big square bar. Menu a bit overwhelming, will take multiple trips to fully sample. Creative apps and very well presented. Need to visit more to truly appreciate! Also, don't forget to enjoy a flight of sake, great way to figure out what's your fav.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sake sampler
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

LXmj0eVj1jv7WeHQ10zA5Q.text: Fusion restaurant that tries to bring together sushi and meat. I have to say they've done a very good job and Charlotte definitely needs more restaurants like Cowfish.  I try to order a different dish every time I go there and most of the time are very much satisfied with what I order. Burgushi is a dish that I remember standing out from the ones I've tried.   Remember to schedule an appointment before you go. They get very, very packed. They do have outside seating. Always could grab a few drinks at bar while you wait on your table ;)

vL0bsEbgbYg-CbKw9SNaYQ.text: Got to try Cowfish during their soft opening a few weeks back and I was blown away. The freshest sashimi I've had in Charlotte can be found right here!   Came here with a group of girl friends so I got to sample a bunch of dishes. First, the appetizers: Crab rangoon dip was rich and full of chunks of crab a delight to dip into with the fried wonton skins. And the Blackened Ahi Tuna Nachos - also topped with a bit of that crab rangoon dip - had a great cut of slightly seared tuna on each wonton nacho, yum.   Second, the entrees: I got the Motherload sushi platter (of course the most expensive thing on the menu) and the pieces of sashimi were, again, very fresh, and the sushi roll was damn tasty. It also came with a spring roll whose accompanying peanut sauce came in a martini glass-esque container. The presentation was pretty awesome, mostly because I wasn't expecting such a gargantuan amount of food. I got to sample the mango tango roll, which was great with fresh jalapenos adding a kick to the fresh mango topping, and the grouper entree, which I wasn't a fan of because it was too heavy and not flavorful enough.   Now, third, and finally, the dessert: Creme Brulee was very nice, but the chocolate cake was better-than-your-last-boyfriend-at-his-best good. Man, no one spoke as we shoveled fork fulls of decadent chocolate cake into our mouths. Damnnnnn. Okay, I'm done, I swear. Gooddddd. Okay.   Decor was modern and hip, lots of post modern pieces of art depicting sushi/fish/cow in some form. Hostesses were great in getting us seated. Bartender was helpful in recommending a good beer. Waiter was definitely trying hard to get everything right and was super friendly. Only thing might be that the menu can be a tad overwhelming because there are so many choices, but that's it.   Great date or dinner before a fun night out spot.   Oh Cowfish, I'll be seeing more of you.

4blqKafwhbQ28TEfOueEnw.text: I had the chance to visit this place a few months ago with a friend of mine and I ordered the veggie burger. I admit a veggie burger is not the most exciting of items on a menu but I do appreciate when restaurants have vegetarian options available. The veggie burger itself seemed to be an inhouse made patty instead of a reheated frozen boca patty or something. It was very satisfying!  The rest of the menu had some very good options as well and even has some crazy sushi burger!  The decor/atmosphere is very good and would make for a nice place to take your date for a nice meal.

ABRhoUpcLAn1Flaz2sImxA.text: DELISH! Went on a Sunday afternoon for lunch after reading all the positive feedback.  The wait was less than 15 minutes which was very impressive since the place was packed. This gave me the impression that service was fast, but that's not the case (more on that later).  We started off with the crab rangoon dip appetizer which took about 20 minutes to come out. It came out hot, fresh, and wonderfully tasty. We decided to try burgers since we aren't big sushi fans. I had the boursin burger. The burger itself had a great flavor and the meat was sinfully tasty. It came on an onion roll which was very fresh and soft. It came loaded with delicious grilled mushrooms and onions. Here are two things that really downgraded the food. 1) the boursin cheese on the burger was horrendous and gritty and 2) it took almost 45 minutes to get our entrees. I sent the burger back and tried it with swiss and it was much better.  But the remake took 25 minutes to come out so I took it to go. I also had a side salad with ginger dressing. The dressing was the best I've had in a while.  If they could speed up service this would be one of the best restaurants around.  But it took us over 2 hours from the time we were seated to complete our meal. That's a bit excessive.  However, the food was very good.

7StJ7cMghLhC7xwwecTdRw.text: Be prepared to wait for a table when dining here!  Great-tasting, unique food!  They mix sushi and steak - literally!  Drink specials are also great.  Loud atmosphere (which is the only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars)

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Porky&#39;s Revenge&#34; burger - burger topped with pulled pork, slaw, etc.
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi topped with filet

VN0lTYMN5SeRY5nom9QmsA.text: This place is amazing! We ate at the bar because it was jam packed but well worth the wait.  I had a salmon blt that was out of this world! We ate the chicken lettuce wraps as an appetizer...YUM!  I could go on and on just get off the computer/phone/iPad and go eat there...NOW

UN3yyxplw7iRh-LLY2-CAw.text: I absolutely love Cowfish! Besides the wait that you sometimes have to endure, it is such a fun and delicious experience. Even when you do have to wait, they have an adorable system where there are a ton of fishes on a screen and the closer you get to being seated, the bigger your fish gets.   My favorite rolls are Mary Had a Little Lamburgushi and the Taste Explosion. Other favorites are the lettuce wraps and definitely the parm truffle fries! Delish!  Make sure to try and visit on their half-off martini nights. The cucumber-tini is phenomenal. This is definitely a fun place to take your friends/family visiting Charlotte!

LrmFDzyTviKaiMTpDf-VYg.text: Always great.  I get the bento box that has a smattering of everything.  I always order regular fries instead of sweet potato.  On a couple of occasions the fries were cold and the manager brought out a huge hot portion to make it up to me.  Love it here!!!

v3RxVxlXgmasBZ0mNsaZ1g.text: LOUD, & greasy food (if you're not a sushi person, and I'm not). Haven't a clue what all the "hoopla" is about! Staff is very nice though.

Daxx_w0dq0vriu6_pje6Ew.text: The Burgers are BIG & WONDERFUL! The sushi is FRESH & DELICIOUS! The decor and atmosphere is unique!  Only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is purely based on the lack of seating when you are waiting, the constant wait, long wait times at dinner, and sometimes the servers are spread a little too thin to be as helpful or attentive as preferred!

SlcJ1kDabxoM5fI_o--z3w.text: Um, this is absolutely GENIUS. A little off-putting at first (I mean, who really thinks of eating burgers AND sushi at the same time?), but if you just give it a chance, you will be blown away.  First off, I loved loved loved all the wall art & decor (my personal favorite was the Cowfish version of the Wicked poster and the gigantic bento box behind the bar) and the food definitely exceeded expectations.  Our table shared the Blackened Ahi Tuna Nachos which was absolutely delish! That's really saying something too because I am not a "seared tuna" eater. For my entree, I had one of their "Burgushi" bento boxes so I could get the best of both worlds perfectly portioned with a mini slider and pretty much your choice of a sushi roll. I ended my meal with a Shake Crackle & Pop milkshake made with vanilla ice cream, Rice Krispies and marshmellows - yum!!  Overall, absolutely satisfied with this restaurant and would love to go back the next time I'm in Charlotte!

Hxy3MPLY3mKmNgZ_uxqXXw.text: This place is awesome!!!  Regardless if you like sushi or not you need to give this place a try, though a plus if you already love sushi.  I've been to severeal sushi places all over the country and this place by far as the most unique and appitizing menu available.  As the name states, CowFish is a sushi bar specializing in both seasfood and meat sushi both raw and cooked.  Their menu features many standard sushi combinations as well as many new and interesting items too.  As well there is a large buger and other sandwich menu for those who enjoy their food cooked.  I'd definately recommend getting reservations as the place was packed at 8pm on a Wednesday, but luckily I got the last available bar stool.  The drink prices are typical for the area and the food is on the higher priced side, but well worth it.  Two things you must try are the Filet Minion sushi roll and one of the (3) sushi burgers which feature a bun made of sushi rice and such.

NZa5PWDiuFDPEGf9zeizdg.text: UPDATE:  If you are looking to not have to wait a long time, probably not a good idea to come here on the weekends for lunch.  We waited 45 minutes for a table.  Nonetheless, our out-of-town guests loved it and this time we got the bento boxes and they were filled with so much food, it was awesome!  In love with the giant bento box on the wall.  Made my whole day.  The menu is interesting with a combination of burgers and sushi dishes and what they call "burgushi" where they combine the two.  Let me warn you in advance, the prices here are high for what I expect to see in Charlotte, comparable to New York prices that I am used to from living up North.  The tuna nachos were AWESOME.  Gotta try them.  I split a surf and turf burgushi with my husband which had beef topped with salmon and tuna.  Was disappointed to find out that the salmon and tuna were cooked, but still a good dish, just not what I was expecting.  Topped off my lunch with a smores milkshake.  YUM.  I've only been here for lunch and heard it's crazy town for dinner.  If you can get a chance to stop by on a weekday for lunch, probably the best time to enjoy the menu without the long wait.

l9ZKYpcnG0KC_nXf1RW0kQ.text: Ok, now the niche of this restaurant is what Los Angeles is desperately to "cool" to try  The menu is explained to you and leaves you with a plethora of options to customize your dining experience.   Burgushi: Who the hell would have ever thought? I didnt try it because I absolutely fell in LOVE with the Turkey apple brie and cranberry burger which I F$&ked my mouth with twice on my last visit. Its unbelievable to witness the flavor that will burst into your mouth and nearly knock you out of your seat.   Fried pickles - my FAV for several reasons but most importantly that I didnt spend the next 5 min extracting vegetable oil from them to eat.   Design your own sushi roll = BRILLIANT concept that I have YET to see in any other metropolitan area.  The only thing that disappoints me is the location. I mean after all, location is everything and this wonderful gem seems lodged in the gregarious blunder also known as the south park mall. Where people are just bred differently.   All in all I promise to visit this place each and EVERY time I return to Charlotte no matter what.  P.S. Make sure you wash you hands and LISTEN to the overhead messaged being played. Nothing says HAPPINESS like a little humor before you leave..

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey brie cheese, apple and cranberry
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon

zVqF5l6q1RmOpnZ0EbFhNQ.text: My burger was delish!! The freshest burger I've ever tasted. Super juicy and tinder!!! The burger bun was soft and fresh!! The garlic fries were also yummy!!

6BrYfwcl8PUvzj3slwWyGw.text: All right, let's get some things straight from an unbiased point-of-view:  this is not a real sushi restaurant, this cannot be the best restaurant in Charlotte, and there is nothing healthy on the menu.  It is a concept restaurant teetering on the edge of being a theme restaurant, the menu is incredibly overwhelming, and the food is heavy handed.    All that aside, there are great items on the menu, but it needs to be thinned out a little bit.  This would have been two-stars if it weren't for the fantastic bar setup and one of the best milkshakes I've ever had (rice krispy concoction).    I really wanted to try the "amazing" sushi, and I had very high expectations.  I ordered the Motherload, which offers no place for bad sushi to hide.  The roll was way too thick, loaded with cream cheese, and only tasted like the sauces and cream cheese.  I want to taste the raw fish.  The sashimi was also cut thick, which works fine for scallops and some fish varieties, but not for octopus, eel, or shrimp.  I did love the sauce with the summer roll, and the "no rice" option worked well to remove some of the weight.  The wine list is well thought out, and surprisingly well-priced, and the touch-big screen games built into the bar are absolutely genius (frog game conquered)!  I struggled not to order burgushi, but after seeing all the massive piles of sushi covered in red meat walk past, the guilt of my decision faded.  I once had a surf and turf roll at Wolfgang Puck's in Orlando that was perfectly poached lobster with thinly sliced, rare fillet on top w/ seaweed and ginger/siracha sauce that was perfection.  Sushi should be light, flavorful, and artistic....Cowfish is miles from that.  I've got to add that the two "classy" girls sitting next to me at the bar made an episode of Girls sound tame...and no, the two guys next to me were unfortunately not gay.

ift2DiJl_ZvUAACca_ZvGQ.text: This place is indeed A-OK. The only reason why I say this is because sushi and burgers is not at all a novel idea and can be found everywhere on the east and west coast. Also, the food is decent, but a tad pricey. With that said, their burgers are AMAZING, and have a great spice to them. However, the sushi is par at best, which ultimately makes me think of this place as a nice American spot.   The interior design is by far the most impressive aspect of this place (see photos), otherwise a decent spot for dinner and I'll probably be back sometime relatively soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Excellent interior design!

w3FSlV_Xx8qndT9VY4TtmA.text: This is my first time posting a review on yelp, after eating at cowfish I knew I had to. Loved everything about this restaurant. Atmosphere was very unique and enjoyable, food was amazing!!!!, and prices were fantastic especially for the quality of ingredients and cooking that they present. Unfortunately we're out of towners, but are so hoping they set up shop near us SOON!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wonderful berry high cake 2share 4only $7! vanilla ice cream, lemon cake, and a raspberry sauce that forces an audible &#34;yum&#34;.

EgCGa5tw3Kxgj4iuwQMX-w.text: Well, this is different. Went here on the recommendation of a friend as it sounded pretty interesting, and man am I glad I did. Got here around 7pm on a Saturday night and there was a 2 hour wait, so make sure you get here early. Thankfully I found a seat at the sushi bar and sat down immediately(perks to traveling alone I guess!). Ordered almost immediately, food was out in a decent amount of time. Started off with a local beer which was good, wasn't a fan of the tall skinny glass it was served in though. Ordered the taste explosion roll, BBQ pork roll, and the Pittsburgh sandwich. All three were pretty good, but the taste explosion was my favorite. Next is a toss up between the Pittsburgh and the BBQ pork roll. Overall a really good unique place that's worth checking out! A little pricey, but worth it none the less.

KTB44ExjTyZxdFxC6xRTaA.text: What kind of a sushi restaurant has no bottled Japanese beers? This one. No attention to detail. Waiter served drinks with fingers on the rim of glasses. He cupped the sake glass in his palm with rim upside against his palm. I would have given a lower score but the place is really clean.

E3qcxT6UfQI_zS9oEFU68g.text: The food is great! I've had so many things on the menu and never been disappointed. That being said.. the margaritas are literally some of the worst I've ever had.

4rUaDvQDsyL8Uvaxhc-xFQ.text: When I heard such a place existed I was ecstatic.  The idea of sushi and burgers, probably my two favorite foods, co-existed at this restaurant, was more than I could handle.  So when I traveled to Charlotte we made a point to stop here.  The decor is very clean, and bright... maybe bordering on kitschy.  Our server was very friendly and funny.  Unfortunately, after ordering we got passed off to another server who we pretty much never saw.  I understand why the handoff needs to occur sometimes, but never like it.  Our food took a while to come out.  One of the rolls were forgotten so it came out after our burgers and was never really eaten.  We both enjoyed our burgers a lot.  Unfortunately it was a few weeks ago and I can't really remember the specifics.  The onion straws were delicious.  There is no doubt about it... this is a burger/sushi place.  The concept is amazing, but I think they could focus more on the food and less on the "look at us... we're a crazy burger/sushi place."

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. That pretty much sums this place up.

NdUoPvcSJ6EiOkWzqphVhw.text: Awesome!!! I love this place for lunch or dinner. I work from home and head here for lunches and sometimes do a little work. The staff and management take great care of me and are always polite and considerate. I feel lucky to have a great sushi place so close to my home! Great job!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yes!!!!

iwGmkk5LHHkG6voEJoLH4Q.text: This is easily my favorite place in town. I've always had amazing servers who are on top of things, while also managing to be so friendly and personable. But more importantly, the food is always on point. Burger-sushi fusion is such a fun concept, and I've never had something at Cowfish that I haven't liked. I got their crab-lobster spring roll as an appetizer and it was amazing, but my favorite entree is their deliverance roll-- it has pulled pork and lots of other goodness on it.

XR_KsqE4vLFqo0ZP-ic54w.text: The restaurant is overall very nice! Although the waiter spilled coke on my dress by accident, but is food is good. The mango roll is very good and taste explotion burgushi is special, too. I personally perfer the original sushi instead of the burgushi which is too American...

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. taste explotion burgushi

MjXWVu3Rt2wQYl-Z7lr3FQ.text: The staff was so welcoming and friendly.  They suggested things to do in the city, let us know how to use the light rail and were so incredibly nice.  The sushi was super good and the burger too!!  The bar selection was really good.  The atmosphere was super cool.  Will definitely come back when we are in town and we hope they come to Richmond.  Chris, the GM went above and beyond. Thanks for your hospitality Chris.  Michelle was a very good waitress and made sure our drinks were always full which is a huge deal for me!!!  Thanks guys for an amazing experience!!!  Xoxo!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger, custom sushi roll and philly roll.   Philly roll was soooooo fresh and good.
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Rangoon Dip---DELICIOUS!!!

20hG1msMpaRvAIb-_-7jxg.text: This place has very good sushi and burgers. My favorite sushi is definitely the Mark's roll. You have to try it if you're there! If you get a burger I highly recommend the sweet potato french fries! My only gripe is that they don't take reservations, but maybe that's for the best. Just make sure to go early and expect a wait. We went on the weekend and had about an hour wait. Probably very little wait on weekdays. Def give this place a try!  Oh, I almost forgot. Leave room for a spiked milkshake. :)

tCVm86rSqxZr7Wo08p1wcw.text: I've been here a couple of times, and just have not been able to come away happy. Cowfish has a cool interior, as well as the wait time and higher price you would expect from a restaurant in South Park. Which is totally fine and as expected.  I have them another shot after they re-opened (for the second time) after their rhinovirus scare. It made sense that their lines would be shortest, and their kitchen would be cleanest, after their recent shutdown and extended cleanup.  That was correct, and no one in my party got sick. Indeed, Cowfish was about half full, and I was able to get in and seated immediately.  On my last visit, I was disappointed with some of the burgerushi, but was really impressed with some of the sushi. I was determined to stick with the sushi, which was fresh and delicious.  I'm not sure what my waiter's name was, but it should have been, "10 minute minimum." Because every single thing took at least 10 minutes. It was at least 10 minutes until someone came to my table. Again, the restaurant was hall full.   I am unsure if I have ever had someone take my dinner order after my appetizer had arrived. I am certain that has never happened after the appetizer had arrived but drinks had not. At least, before my recent visit to Cowfish. Pretty certain Chilis can manage such basics, but somehow a place that goes $50/$60 a plate cannot.  I am done complaining about all the waiting I did during my 100 minute long dinner. How is the sushi?  The sashimi is my favorite in Charlotte. Their sashimi is easily the freshest, juiciest, tastiest I have had in this town. Nothing like a big bowl of their fresh fish on ice, especially when it is fantastic fish.  The rolls are good. I would not say better than a number of other sushi joints, but good. Inventive. A little weird (I think mine came with burger sauce or something I didn't try).  I really wish they had better service, because they could potentially be better than Baku, Pisces, Yama, or a number of other sushi restaurants. But my last visit was a disaster, and their sushi is not good enough to make up for their prices, wait, and service.

QuqsadZdGkqZeTXpQ9XcUA.text: Whenever I'm craving a burger and some sushi this is my spot!  I'm here quite frequently and I don't think I'll ever get tired of it. If you are planning on going on a busy night, which is most nights for them, I suggest try out their new app where you can put your name on the list while you're on your way there to get a little bit of a head start on the wait list, this place can be busy!  I love sitting on the patio when its not too hot, on the colder days they have it heated and enclosed, it is nice and cozy I would recommend sitting here if your looking for something a little quieter.  The service is always good and the servers really know their stuff so feel free ask for suggestions!  Since I'm a regular here I do have my go to options, I always and will forever go for the calamari it is fan.effin.tastic. I've had a few of the other appetizer options but nothing seems to compare to the calamari! The pork belly burger was my absolute favorite but found out on my most recent visit that it was taken off the menu along with a few other items. I was a little hurt but ordered the Texas longhorn burger in its place and it was beyond satisfying. I love the side options that you're able to choose from, I'm a fried pickle type of gal and they are always great, the dipping sauce that comes with them is sooo good! As for sushi I've been enjoying the fiery dragon roll on my last couple of visits and its been nothing short or delicious, I love the sauce that comes on it, the jalapeno, and the tuna/eel combo totally sold me on this roll. They have a great drink list filled with signature cocktails, sake, and beer. I have had a few of their martinis that I would totally order again and again. I haven't had anything from here that I wasn't too fond of and I always look forward to getting my burger/sushi fix here!  Thanks for being consistent!

UF76BK9LndyRqNTAfMMzcA.text: People come here for the novelty. The food doesn't really meet expectations, but it's fun to say you went.  We ordered the coconut onion rings to start, and the small which was four pieces was very large and for $4 a good buy, but ours had problems. Incredibly greasy and one of the rings was the outer portion of the onion which you shouldn't have been used.   The blackened tuna nachos came out next. A great concept, however it's a big mess. You lose the flavor profile of the individual components, aside from the crunch of the chip, the crab rangoon dip, the avocado, the tuna, they are so similar in texture you don't really know what your eating. I would have preferred a dish with all the toppings on the side you can dip into and taste.  The Pittsburgoo-shi was actually the highlight of the dinner.  It was inventive,  flavorful, the prime rib was juicy and the 'bun' was terrific. On the side we had the Thai cucumbers which were light and refreshing, with a kind of smoky heat throughout, just was great.    Incredible service! Our server, Jasmine was attentive and friendly, helping us through the menu (it's kinda crazy how many things are actually on there). She checked in often but without being overbearing. Food and drinks came out very quickly. Two apps and one entree came out to under $40. Would I go again? I'm not entirely sure. Wishing I'd stuck to Burgushi menu entirely.   5 star service, 3-star food, 4 stars for creativity.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;small&#34; coconut onion rings

J2bG718r0yTKLqdinirhDA.text: I love this place! It's in a super convenient location near southpark mall. Kids are welcome, and they have food that kids love (my niece was bragging about her rice crispy treat topped with a Swedish fish wrapped in fruit roll up to her brother). And, the beer and wine list is lengthy... oh yeah, and the sushi is BEAUTIFUL AND DELICIOUS!  My table shared the doug burgushi which was tasty, but didn't quite taste as close to an American filet mignon meal as I thought it could. We then all shared our bento boxes, rolls, tuna nachos. Our server was awesome, and we had a blast sitting outside on one of the first nice days of spring!   The main negative with this place is that they don't take reservations and there is typically a long wait. We waited for 60 minutes on a Friday. (to be fair, I think it's because it was GOOD Friday, but still... 60 minutes is a long time!) If you're traveling with just one other person, your best bet is to hover at the bar or sushi bar and grab a spot there. If you do that, you don't have to wait too long.

FjvRNDUgkjHWgCOqBanq8A.text: This is a great place to eat. Our waiter James knows the menu in and out.If you wanna burger then go to Cowfish.If you want sushi then go to Cowfish.If you want both then you can get Both.5 stars Will come again

Xp3vKVWVyvJo8OMghB6yYw.text: My friend and I went to Cowfish to celebrate out bdays, in case you don't know it, if it's your bday, couple of Cowfish staff come and sing a Happy Birthday song to you and it's pretty cute. Although they no longer have "The Taste Explosion" on their menu (which was my absolute favorite), they do have a lot of options to choose from. I would recommend sitting at the terrace if the wait is not too long.

DntbbR5gCOLpjVCt9koOdQ.text: My boyfriend and I had dinner here on a Monday night at about 7 30. We waited about 20min at the bar while picking out a couple beers we were made to feel very welcome. Our server was very sweet and made great food suggestions. We had a sushi roll for an appetizer and burgers for entrees, the lamb burger is amazing and the veggie burger is very flavorful with a compliment of literally a pile of sweet potato fries. The place has a great vibe and SO many options, highly recommended. A+++

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

1PNcjc1jd2k-VrObVqoVwg.text: I love the atmosphere of this place, but they fall short in so many other places. We went here for dinner last night and we were highly disappointed with both the food and service. We had to wait 15 minutes for a table to start, which is absurd considering there were no less than 8 open tables. We were just a party of 2. We decided to wait at the bar, which is where we should've stayed. We were finally seated, it took our server a few minutes to come greet us. We started with the Lobster and Crab spring rolls, which were fried a little too long, when we brought this to our server's attention he told us it was to make sure it was crispy. We of course never finished those. We asked about suggestions from the menu, the server's response was "The most affordable way is to make a meal out of one burger to split and an appetizer." Now I don't know if maybe the fact that we were dressed in jean and t-shirts made a difference, but to assume we needed to eat affordably was very insulting to say the least. We decided to go with a burger and a sushi roll. My burger was cooked closer to med well rather then medium. I wanted to complain, but our waiter only seemed to be interested in flirting with the table behind us. My friend's sushi was okay at best. To sum it all up, we didn't enjoy the appetizer, main course and weren't even offered dessert. We left feeling total unsatisfied. My friend said that experience was out of the ordinary and I should give them another try, but after that experience I think I would rather not. I would rather dine without judgement and assumption of my ability to afford my meal. Word to the wise, don't dress down or comfortably if you want to dine here.

m1_ASTiypTXkLNRRtKyGBw.text: They don't take reservations. So no matter when you go, the logistics of getting seated is an absolute mismanaged nightmare. What? You can grab a seat at the bar? Be prepared to fist fight someone for a spot. They do a True disservice to customers by not taking reservations. The wait is typically above 1.5 hours for dinner. Bring protein bars in order to survive. Or better yet, eat before you go out to eat. I offer a few stars because the food is good and the customer service is 5 stars. Outside of that, I wont be going here during dinner again given the long wait.  In terms of customer service - they are receptive to feedback and have apparently tried to take reservations in the past. They did not have success. There is an app you can leverage to add yourself to the wait list (must be a half mile away), and can do some shopping at the mall while you wait.

A7n6uhZZMqIatH6rexI0KQ.text: Going to have to go with a OK place to eat. There is always a wait and always a problem just trying to get a seat, Once waited for over an hour just to fine out they needed more time. I was kinda over it after that. Service is ok... I mean you would think it would be amazing with all the food scares this place has had..I would find another source of sushi income with this place.

o4gNqBssvZMupgDWx6Ok5g.text: There are so many great things about this restaurant and it's staff. I took my now wife on our first date here, our first Valentine's Day and then many others days for date night or celebrations. We visited again after we got married and the staff and manager gave us an amazing surprise after dinner to celebrate us getting married. Very generous and thoughtful of them to do something. I can not say enough wonderful things about this place. From their amazing food, sushi and burgers, very friendly and respectful wait staff, amazing/talented chefs, to their very kind and generous managers. If you want a meal that you will remember with a staff you can't forget, you need to go to Cowfish. They have made my wife and I a customer for life.  If you haven't guessed by now, I would HIGHLY recommend going here for dinner!!

MMIfkOHxkGC4_Q2lrGmk8w.text: I stopped in here solely based on the unique name My travel partner and I differ on our food choices so this seemed like a good mix. This place had it all. We sat at the bar to be seated quickly but that never effected the service! The food came out quick, and I took the servers recommendations, not to be disappointed.  Delicious.  Cassandra and Allison both tended to us while hustling behind the busy bar.  They were wonderfully personable and a pleasure to be served by. I only wish I lived closer to come back again.

nUFbSWrj49Shhga06AwRTQ.text: This is my favorite place to get Sushi ever!!!! The food is phenomenal! I have to take one star because the service last time was less than stellar and super slow even though there was a light crowd and the waitress was unfriendly and short, and i had to ask another waitress for a drink and boxes and I did not leave a tip. Usually I tip 20-30% pending on the service received but that warranted 0. However, let's get to why this is one of my fave places in Charlotte and why you should go, thee food!!! The sushi is ALWAYS fresh and amazing. My favorite is the Mad Mango-Cado roll and the cheeseburgooshi! They offer sushi and burger options that are really cool in name and ingredients. I have had their milkshakes both with liquor and without and I recommend trying them both! Particularly the Rice Krispie treat milkshake and the island milkshake with rum. Please stop in if you can, it's amazing food and usually great service! One of the top places in Charlotte!

FRvugiGFvPouOyxV1GnoiA.text: Wow... What a concept. Who would've thought burgers and sushi on the same menu would work, much less BE AWESOME!?!  Brief background - this is a sushi restaurant + burger spot + bar, all of which on their own would probably be good. Nestled in a larger shopping complex, this spot is remarkably big, with indoor and outdoor seating available. The menu is overwhelming, so do some research or, if you're like me, opt for the bento box.   As noted, I opted for the bento box which gives you a combination of burger elements, salad, sushi roll etc. Its a bit much as I've never had sushi and burgers within the same meal, so be prepared. I'd strongly recommend 'The Boss' though, so check it out.   My only issue with this place is the menu - its really large and quite overwhelming as everything sounds great. That being said, I also say its an opportunity to come back here and try many more items. Also, not sure how sustainable such a large menu is, especially if you want to be "great" at either sushi or burgers, so I'll keep that in mind as I try other places on my business trips.   Also, I recommend calling ahead or somehow finding a way to get a table during dinner hour, as I've been told its fairly difficult.

tqzvj0QkNS7FtgIqi8lkzQ.text: I don't eat seafood so I have to say that I was worried about finding something on the menu. I was pleasantly surprised to find a wide array of options to choose from. The menu is extensive and has something for everyone. We came around 8-8:30 on a Saturday with 11 people. They don't do reservations which isn't the most ideal, but we were sat within 20 minutes. We sat outside on the beautiful porch that had fans to keep us cool.  Our waitress, Kristen, was outstanding. Dealing with a large party like ours is not an easy task and she fulfilled every request in a timely manner. When our wine took a little longer than the rest of the drinks, she made sure to apologize. We all had separate checks (the worst, I know) and she split up the bottles of wine and appetizers with ease. She was such a lovely server!  As for food, the combination of sushi and burgers is odd, but allowed each person in our party to order something they liked. For drinks, I split a bottle of the Pinot Grigio, which was good. I appreciated that it was brought out in a chilled container to keep it cool outside. I split the jumbo onion rings for an appetizer. The 5 jumbo rings were very delicious and definitely big enough to split! For my entree, I had the "Burgooshi" which is basically a burger and some cheese wrapped in rice and potato strings and flash fried. It was very delicious and super filling. We didn't have any room left for dessert after everything! Next time I'm in Charlotte, I will definitely make an effort to stop by again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burgerooshi- their take on a burger served as sushi! Yum!

yUULCqlirOruXTpFBBfwlg.text: Cowfish is a great place to eat the burgers are outstanding and the sushi is even better. Moderately price and an awesome bar. From time to time I've gotten slow service there though.

NnAQlH58WqJmlq0tF3vU_A.text: Super fun concept that surprisingly works! Sushi was fresh and delicious. My friends got the bento box and loved the burger/sushi combo. Sounds strange, but we loved it!

6bIUxxvmgh5QerPetL_FuA.text: Incredible food and service. I'd had an amazing experience at the location in Atlanta, and my high expectations were again met. Would recommend to anyone coming to Charlotte. Server was attentive to our dietary restrictions. Heavenly Veggie burger is a must whether you're a vegetarian or not. Sushi is also insightful, with incredible flavors and unique combinations. 5 Stars again, Cowfish!

G5i5LBZXZWB9b5fOPFLpZA.text: LOVED The Hot Stoner, great kick from the Thai chili! The slider in the fusion bento box was perfectly cooked and I couldn't get enough of the sweet potato fries! Would definitely recommend the fusion bento box if you want to try a little of everything, the portion is just right.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fusion Specialty Bento Box with Firecracker Roll!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Hot Stoner (with a Thai chili frozen in the ice cube!)

etvXHpwAWxHb3wvUIcbkWA.text: Amazing food and great service! Excellent choice! Will definitely come back and recommend to friends.

n81iqwC9nPUK4M_wQU05bA.text: It is one of my absolute favorite places to go to in Charlotte. I LOVE the food and LOVE the atmosphere. This is definitely a place I recommend many of my friends and family to go to. Even after a little confusion on my boyfriend's order, the customer service was excellent!! Lauren was absolutely great and took care of us. I would definitely love to go back and have her as my server.

9cjQ2rH_EsAIOI5ifmUKfg.text: Service was great. Ambiance is real nice. Good location. Food is good too (I guess that's the most important). I don't eat seafood at all but I LOVE burgers. I'm always left out when my friends order sushi, so this place was great for me. I orders two rolls with beef and bison and they were pretty good. It was fun to get these rolls, but I'll probably just get a burger next time.

oeKjbWSRwDxWW_g5KGhFIQ.text: Always a fan of this location when I'm in the area. I had the all american and my coworker had the bison roll. Both were very delicious. I actually enjoyed the seaweed salad better than I have had in other places. It was nice and crunchy. Bad part was that it stuck in my teeth and I was sucking it out the rest of the evening until I made it to my floss. lol. If you are looking for somewhere outside of the box sushi I highly suggest that you try Cowfsh.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. All American with seaweed salad

X_LdvZl_EfkdEFSyAkVu9w.text: Huge menu and friendly staff. Hamburger sushi type stuff is cool. Had the pork burgushi and it was good just too much sauce as it over powered the dish. Had the sushi sandwich which was just eh and also had the nacho appetizer which was great. Would go here again to try something new.

MvJkZYNGpqQbH7Pafmgvdg.text: Always a great place for a business meeting. Consistent, nice atmosphere and good service. I always order the same dish. The Smoked Salmon Burgushi. Oh, and I start off with the Blackened Tuna Dip.  I like the Burgushi much better than their sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

FAr7i2KWnt9DNcsgkMEFFA.text: A super nice place to have a girls night or a date night! This place is a burger/sushi fusion place with lots of different options. The food is delicious but expect to wait a while since this place is popular. I highly recommend getting one of the bento boxes so you can have both sushi and a burger for a good price. Now the best thing about this place is the spiked milkshakes! Each one looked good but I got the "no sleep till Brooklyn" one which has  Myer's Dark Rum, Kahlua, ice cream, malt, coffee concentrate, chocolate covered espresso beans. It was simply amazing!

N2y1_Uk3egGtG9uSK2wBJg.text: Wow...an unexpected combo but I loved it!    My coworker had a bento box of a slider, fries, sushi, and edamame.   He loved it!  I went a more traditional route of sushi, but with a twist.  They offered a list of ingredients from which you could build your own sushi roll.  There must have been 50 ingredients to choose from!  I landed on calamari, carrot, cucumber, mango, brown rice wrapped in seaweed (they had a soy alternative!).  It was delicious...I ate every last bit of it, and it was only $10!!  Dessert also delivered.  I had a greek frozen yogurt shake ... vanilla spun with mint chocolate candies.  Dynamite!  Waitress, though sweet, was slow, inattentive, and distracted.  I am usually patient, but the place was nearly empty.  She was talking to some guys at the bar a lot of the time.  I was late to my next meeting as a result.

qo8JliExmvidk2eLJBg0Ww.text: First tip: download the Cowfish app and get on the wait list from home. We did that while we were at the mall, and it cut our wait time (by a little). Saturday night is no joke at Southpark - it's always so busy, but if you can be patient, you'll be happy you did.  We ordered the crab Rangoon dip as an appetizer, and it was amazing! Creamy and crabby with crispy and crunchy wonton strips. Mmmm.  We split a "Brento" Box, two mini burgers, 1/2 sushi roll, 3 sides. Honestly that plus the Rangoon dip, I felt so satisfied!   So of course we ordered a shake to go. Also delicious.   Overall, Cowfish is great! The wait time is monstrous, but I think the idea of this place is really unique. I'll have to try again during lunch one day.

7k5QqH9X7A5Z8GdWyx9kEQ.text: Okay wow. I have eaten here a ton and I forgot I had never written a review! My boyfriend and I simply love Cowfish! It is one of our favorite spots around Charlotte, and a plus for us is that it's close to home! You cannot beat the unique vibe and menu that they offer.   You will feel the good vibes from the second you arrive, they always open the door for you and the staff have without fail been a group of friendly and helpful individuals. Now, to all beware, dinner time and ESPECIALLY weekend nights: you will wait!! BUT! It is worth it and you will not be able to deny that. They have a pretty good system in place, I believe now you can add your name to a list via an app before you even get there. They provide corn hole out front to entertain you, often times you can slip into a spot at the bar, and they really do move and try to get you in as quickly as possible. The reason for the wait is just because they do not accept reservations. If you want to sidestep this part of the experience, lunch is ideal for you.  Now, once you are seated, prepare to read the novel menu. Don't overlook or skip over something because it sounds like it won't work or you think it won't taste good--this is a place to try new things and your taste buds will be rewarded for you bravery, I swear! They also have a wonderful cocktail menu and their hot teas are delicious and budget friendly. For the low price you get more servings of tea than I believe a human can consume in one sitting. (My favorite is the vanilla mint chai)  I personally love their outdoor patio. They have fans and/or overhead heat lamps, whichever season you are dining they are ready for you. They have the tables, a cozy seating area with couches, and a fun game section with a life size connect four...fun for both adults and children alike.   My favorite menu item I recently have become obsessed with is the grilled salmon salad!! It is absolutely huge and has the best combination of flavors. The sesame encrusted goat cheese just makes it even more heavenly and I could probably eat a whole plate of these little lovelies on my own. You of course need to eat some sushi, it is consistently fresh and well made. I have yet to try a milkshake here but it seems like they are a hit and I constantly crave one every time I look, I am just waiting for my conscience to lower its guard so I can order one someday :)  So get yourself over here, we all know half of Charlotte will be Christmas shopping at the mall anyway, might as well swing by and enjoy a great meal before leaving the area! Enjoy :)

XqHEdM2auLPEFL02iQgTKQ.text: This was my first time eating @ Cowfish.  The food was delicious: we had the calamari appetizer and it was fried nicely and was atop a tasty Asian sauce (a little bit  of spice may have added a great touch).  I had the bento box w/a very tasty slider, the best sweet potato fries (perfectly crispy & salted), & a fresh side of cucumber salad.  My husband had the burger & loved how juicy & tasty it was & how it was cooked just as he ordered.  My son's sushi variety was fresh & oh so yummy.  Also, the server was kind & attentive.  Cowfish is a must & I think you will not be disappointed w/whatever you choose!!

qJMWzMS6zzDCULW21vEofg.text: First time trying this spot when I went to Charlotte for business. I think it is a brilliant idea putting sushi and burgers together. It's very clever and unique. The best part of this spot is that the food is delicious. It's not like one of those places that seem cool but food sucks. Also their drinks are very well made-strong and delicious. Definitely get the burger roll. It's not like anything you can get anywhere. I forget the actual name but it's a burger made in sushi rolls - don't worry it's cooked! Also for the drinks... if you like spicy stuff get the hot stoner!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The hot stoner

LlbuGn0vt7-rhBbekOzEhA.text: Wonderful experience from beginning to end. This location is clean & trendy & full of life. The food was fresh and tasted great. I ordered a dish that had sushi and a burger sampler on the same plate... talk about a nice surprise !  My family truly enjoyed it and that is the most important factor - if they like it, I love it. Service was awesome and I recommend you visit if in the area. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

UvmhWBpKn1JMgiffImoI3g.text: This place is really really good for a fusion type experience.  I have been a few times and enjoy the bento box the best although wandering the menu and putting in a few special rolls was great too.   The bento box special is my fav with the Mark roll. The portions are just the right size so you can eat the burger, sushi roll, cucumber salad, and edamame without being stuffed but still plenty.    Lunchtime on a nice day can get :20 a: :40 wait. I've not been at peak dinner times.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

L_h55OnqiPpw6Nz16mLC_w.text: Absolutely LOVE cowfish! The shroomin Swiss Burger is my jam! Costumer service is always great, on a slow day or a slammed pack evening.. great all around vibe too to bottoms!

haOgYtQ9z54EJTtlzslzUA.text: I came here a few times as a teenager (and as a much pickier eater) 5+ years ago and thought the food was just alright. I was in the area again and decided I'd give Cowfish another shot now that I have a more adventurous palette. I ordered Mark's Roll and the person with me order the Jalapeno Popper Showstopper burger. The roll was just enough food and was definitely high quality fish. It was a little bit expensive for me ($15.50), so I docked a star, but I definitely don't regret it. The person eating with me said his burger was "much better than he thought it'd be." Our waiter (Gabe?) was very attentive and friendly. I'll definitely be back to try more sushi rolls in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mark&#39;s roll.

mN6WKeWG2cKHTMUc7KtiwA.text: The most beautiful sashimi bowl you've ever seen!!!The staff was friendly & efficient, even laughing at my husband's jokes! The food is exceptional & the fish is fresh & flavorful. Always a hit and a must do when I am in Charlotte

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

iU0iLpeg335FOBkVo8ZpHg.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. My wife & I just moved to Charlotte, and had family visiting this weekend. We had lunch here once before and thought our visiting family would like it. All of us left raving about how great everything was. We all shared the tuna nachos and they were incredible. I had a bento box which includes a burger and half sushi roll. They were very easy to work with on substitutions (if you order it, you'll see why this is such a good thing). My wife had a couple sushi rolls, which were amazing, my mom had the lobster rolls, which are more like a tower, even my 7 seven year old loved his kids box, which was way better than most restaurants bother doing for kids. The waitress was great, the atmosphere was really clean and inviting. We got there at 4:50pm on a Saturday, just before the dinner rush began, which I would suggest, given the stream of people that started right after us. We haven't had a bad meal since we've been in Charlotte, but this place still stands out as amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento Fusion Box - Dion&#39;s OMG Roll, BBQ burger, parmesian fries
