fBy2drIqmzcAWQwWGUFO2w.text: This was my second time coming here to this location. Still as busy as the first time but they got us in within 20 minutes. We both ordered the burgersushi (burger made like sushi). It was really good and it was plenty of food for the both of us. The service was fantastic, our waitress remembered giving me a coupon from over a year ago. I do recommend you trying this place out. It's a little pricey but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

zc46s2vmg4N6A6LI-oyzqA.text: Cow fish has wonderful eclectic and American food. My kids even like it here! My son has a peanut allergy and they take it very seriously there. They are always able to accommodate. We really enjoyed the burgooshi, which includes burger and sushi. It's amazing!

kvwspA0dErnjHxB4ueYErg.text: Interesting but not sophisticated food.  The idea of combining bar food and sushi is good, the food itself only ok.

307ELGc2MFvCPpL8DIBJPg.text: This ain't your daddy's sushi spot. Cowfish is one of the must-eats in Charlotte. If you're stopping through town and you don't chow at the Cow you might as well just keep on driving. They have a lot of options and variety on the menu. You won't know what to try. The burgushi is a go-to attraction but even the traditional sushi / sandwiches are can't miss items.  The walls are lined with dope artwork that is really funny. I've tried pretty much everything on this menu and it's all worth it. It's a little pricey so come prepared to spend some dough especially if you're drinking alcohol.   They have great specialty milkshakes as well. Hillary Clinton may not have won but at least we can take solace in the fact that Cowfish still exists in a cruel world where people are marching with tiki torches in the street.   Go try this before North Korea nukes us!

O_1GNhjbGT6WBfcksgOMwA.text: Food and atmosphere was interesting. Everyone was satisfied with their meals. Calamari and wonton dip was a hit! Once the food arrived, it was difficult to gain our waitress' attention. Make sure you download their app to get seating, or plan on a long wait to get a table for dinner

WcVGT4cuimmKVArEFNlnVg.text: This place is hands down AMAZING.  We went to North Carolina as a day trip and decided to look up a restaurant to eat with good yelp reviews, and let me tell you....we were not disappointed. Everything from our appetizer, main courses to desserts were absolutely amazing.   What I loved most about this place was the diversity in their menu.  I eat a plant based diet while everyone else eats whatever.  A lot of their food options are made from scratch at the restaurant. I ordered a veggie burger and the presentation was so amazing that I honestly wanted to place it on a mantle instead of eating it.    My daughter ordered a box which consisted of slider burgers, and a sushi roll option, she select led the Phili roll and it came with a side of edamame, sweet potato, and a salad.  She could not eat the salad.  My daughter in law ordered the same as I did but she ordered a salad as her side while I opted for grilled veggies.  My grandson was able to order his favorite, chicken tender and fries.  It came with a rice crispy treat and a gummy fish.  The milk shakes were great, our server Joe was SUPERB and knew the intricate details of the menu.  The restaurant is decorated in a bright (not to bright) but appealing decor.   The only bad thing I could think to report is that they do not have a location in Charleston, SC (hopefully the owner/mgmt. reads this hint).   We will definitely plan another day trip just so we can return for lunch / dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

T_QaBsquJlzAQd5bbCrLfA.text: Excellent twist on sushi. Cowfish is kind of a neat concept. Of course they have really good sushi but they also have a decent line up of burgers, and even what they call "burgushi" which is basically beef done in a sushi style roll. They also have other meats done in sushi style rolls as well such as turkey and even bison. I gotta say it's definitely an interesting experience. All in all it's done quite well. They even have "adult" milkshakes which are delicious, though very filling. I'd urge you to make a separate trip for a milkshake, as having one with or after dinner might be a bit much for most. All in all I recommend cowfish to anyone, especially those who want to travel a bit off the beaten sushi path, it's well worth it.

juJYJWZVLiHrwzYgkwbaPg.text: Cowfish management reached out to me regarding my review and asked how they could improve their service. I want to commend them for this and appreciate that they took that step. After hearing about some of the negative things that happened while we were there, they sent us a gift card so we could try them again. My husband and I returned and unfortunately we encountered the slow service, inattentive server, and mistakes with our order. However, I want to this review to reflect that they attempted to make it right and I think that shows what a great company they are, even if its not my cup of tea. Thanks Cowfish!

ZurTPMigiEEqx92uNjnm6w.text: Good food, good atmosphere, good service, good times.  Can't find a much better place for a casual lunch or dinner.

6SH8kGtcMUEyiDTDqgGR3Q.text: The food was impeccable. My order was wrong and they forgot the main part of it, which I had to remind them of, but they were fast to remedy the problem. A bit slow on the service side. Presentation was remarkable. Some of the best yellowtail I have ever had, and I'm from California!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

PGxqrBHtp5zXVSPeSw_ZHQ.text: This place is amazing. A great find after doing some shopping at Southpark Mall. As a person with a shellfish allergy I have never had sushi. Sat at the bar and our awesome server helped me create an amazing bento box that included beef sliders and sushi with tuna and avacado!!  I will be back!!

h86blL_ljVN-f9b0jnrhaw.text: Yum! What a great restaurant idea.   First of all, prepare yourself for the largest menu you've ever seen. Seriously, this thing is like a novel. But with that being said, they have a wide variety of food/susi -  something for everyone from the most adventurous eaters to the pickiest.   I can't remember the name of the sushi roll I got, but it was delicious! I'm a little wary of trying new things, but the waiter was super knowledgeable and gave me some stellar recommendations.   I stuck to the regular fish sushi, but they have sushi rolls that incorporate pork, beef, chicken, etc. as well.  I can't wait to take my hubby here!

d0fFUpOkb_1g3qEWR7oWeg.text: A lot of locals (and visitors) love Cowfish. Its unique, delicious, and a popular date night spot. Although I'm personally not a fan of this particular type of cuisine, I would recommend Cowfish to anyone looking for great food with a twist in South Charlotte.

BJjpC7vMjiioOt_lwo641Q.text: I was not a big fan of sushi, but after tasting here I started loving sushi. It is little bit costly but the food is good.

fYYjpaJdiceZq3MZMc-1YQ.text: I just recently visited this restaurant this past Saturday. I was visiting South Park for the first time and was trying to decide on lunch. I went when lunch started, the hosts were really friendly. My server was excellent. This restaurant seems pretty popular because it started to get a nice crowd of traffic within 30mins. We were helped immediately we did not have any complaints. (I ordered a chicken salad, which was delicious. And I created my own sushi roll.)

HdZYWVJsFFlX1_Krs480VQ.text: I really liked the variety of food on the menu. The firecracker roll and sushimi were awesome. The only reason why I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I felt the portion sizes were large so if you wanted to share with others it makes it hard because dishes are so large.  It would be nice if they had a smaller plates section so you can share a lot of different dishes.

xDT_b834P_oZpfD0-umXzA.text: Great place to go.  Menu selection was unique and well done.  Can find something for everybody.  Great cocktails!  Staff was friendly and wanted you to enjoy your experience.  Would recommend to everybody out looking for something different that won't disappoint.

heL1m52pgEApiY1R4TPzcw.text: Love this place!  I can get my sushi with wine and my husband can get a burger with a milkshake!  Sushi is really good- fun atmosphere and locale.

MyNYbz_0LRrMV5S-lXx6ZQ.text: This place is incredible!!! Food was delicious! Portions very generous! Service was wonderful! We recommended this place to everyone and keep doing so!

Z8Hv1aGyxJb2eDPeEGprLQ.text: I had been eager to try this restaurant before it was even open and I saw the sign for Cowfish (Burgers & Sushi) and I thought to myself "wow, I wonder how this is going to work" But despite some initial skepticism, my curiosity along with the slew of great reviews won me over. My date and I went on a Thursday evening so I knew it would be busy (I called ahead and they didn't have any reservations) so I braced my company for a 15-30 mins wait on a table and we waited on the bench outside with a pager. We waited about a good 40 mins and other than the hostess asking if we wanted to sit at the bar (which we turned down) our pager never went off although we saw several groups of folks leaving so we finally just went inside again and of course it turns out there was space now and the pager was had didn't alert us :-( but once we finally got seated things started picking up. We had new waiter being helped by a veteran serving us and she gave a pretty long spill to cover the menu (which is pretty vast) took us a few minutes to digest it all which gave us time to enjoy our martinis and the ambience. I was torn between the Aronald Hamegger & the La Rose Sushi Roll  (ended up going with the latter) which was a shrimp based fusion.  My date went with the four play roll (oyster/salmon combo  fusion roll)  both 8 piece sets. We both tried each other's choice and they were both phenomenal, some of the best sushi I've ever consumed in my life, hands down! The portion size was more than enough without even getting appetizers or desert. I look forward to trying some more of the extensive menu on future visits. Just be sure to make a reservation or pack some patience because if you do, your dining experience will be well worth the wait.

8-V25Qq3unm0_CxDqW7poA.text: Had the Crab Rangoon appetizer and the R&R Crabcake roll (served a bit warm) and LOVED it.  Great service for the group of 8 I was with.  A bit of a wait because we couldn't make RSVP day of.

NjhlEzI164fdzPgzYVDjJw.text: Nice setting, but food was not good. Burger was cold and sweet potato fries were soggy and dripping with grease. The service was super slow. We received our drink refill after our meal was completed. There are much better sushi restaurants in Charlotte as well as burger joints.

yr-GcWoVZSPG7wURbzdJVg.text: Ah, the cowfish.  We tried to go for dinner one night but a two hour wait wasn't sounding too good to us. So we came back for lunch one afternoon and we were seated immediately. The place is much bigger than it seems, two large indoor wings and one heated outdoor patio.  The decor is cool and funky.  Hubby and I each got burgers, which were very tasty.  MIL got a grilled salmon sandwich which she gushed over and said something like it was the best sandwich she'd ever had(!) Service was meh.  It really was.  The hostess was nice enough but the server didn't do the after-you've-been-eating-for-a-minute check in.  That irks me. He was MIA when we needed takeout boxes. Basically he was MIA from order taking (a food runner brought our food in) till check drop. We might come back to try the sushi once I can eat raw things again, and if that's good they'll earn another star.  Or if we come back and our server is more on top of his/her game.  But as it was I can just say okay.

v3vXnxXr6y1fNqZZ0uyY3Q.text: I had a pleasant experience here last night. The atmosphere was fun and the server was attentive. I had the Tuna Tini appetizer and the Eel Dragon Roll and both were very very good. I had the Plum Sake and though it was delicious I feel there was actually very little alcohol in it. But overall i enjoyed my time here and I would defiantly go here again.

CCaZVI6Vbh-tsHVePKp0PA.text: The atmosphere is great. Food menu choices are abundant and the product is fantastic every time I've gone. The sushi rolls are large healthy portions of greatness! The place is so wonderful that the wait is usually pretty long so don't go expecting to just walk in to a table. They do have a nice bar which makes the wait less of an issue. Patience is the key.

tBYsBvyK2PMiJo19bvlLxQ.text: With great anticipation I took my daughter and her two friends to The Cowfish on Thursday night.  This was my second visit and what a disappointment.  We arrived around 8, given a pager and told the wait would be 15 to 30 minutes for first available.  We were paged 25 minutes later, but when I approached the hostess stand was told the buzzer malfunctioned and our table wasn't ready - while a party who arrived after ours was escorted by the hostess to their table.  Hmmm?  Ten minutes later, we were escorted to the back of the restaurant, past 3 empty and set tables, to the table next to the kitchen door.  I protested and we were given another table with an amazing server, Erin.  The food quality was so-so -- not worth a 40 minute wait or the poor customer relations experience.  Charlotte has many fine restaurants.  I think I will give them my money in the future.   If it weren't for Erin's great service, I would give 2 stars instead of 3.

j0RfG1NRpGeCtsjhwfb4Lg.text: I had the pleasure of attending the soft opening of the restaurant on this past Sunday, and it was great!  Being the sister restaurant to the magnificent eeZ Fusion in Birkdale, I had high expectations... and I was not disappointed!  I talked to owner Marcus, met another owner, Allen, and made a new BFF with Deborah, their most gracious service manager.  The bar staff is the best!!!  Shout out to Pat, Jason, Josh, Dave, and Sarah...  The decor at the former location of The Counter is fun and bright with very cute canvas wall art.  I dined on blackened tuna nachos for an appetizer, and a delicious broiled grouper topped with blue crab, served with sauteed asparagus and yellow squash and kaffir lime butter laced pasta as my main course... so magnificent!!!  While I was tempted to partake of their spirit (liquor) spiked ice cream milk shakes, I refrained since my mouth was primed for a yummy creation I saw being served to various patrons throughout the restaurant.  Indeed, "The Mousse is Loose" is a huge portion of chocolate brownies with chocolate and vanilla mousse, and is a sweet indulgence for the eyes.  However, when it was time for me to indulge... the mousse was definitely loose, and had left the building!  They ran out of the decadence!!!  Oh well, I had the apple pie wontons which proved to be a formidable substitute, especially when topped with vanilla ice cream... yum!  I look forward to my next visit, as I enjoyed a wonderful dining experience.  I wish them all the best on their new culinary adventure.  And when I return, perhaps I will eat dessert first!

HsnDgLNXteSts2ZWgmYIyA.text: Really great burgers, and decent sushi. The cuts of fish are better than what the average sushi place in Charlotte offers, but don't expect a traditional nigiri or roll. These things are huge! My nigiri pieces were 3 times the size of a traditional sushi. The only downside was our waitress took a looooong time to check on us.

iXcQFrnYFWUf6YqXrsh4UQ.text: After our initial trip to Cowfish we HAD to go back.  This time we made a reservation and decided to bring some out of town guests with us.  We were very impressed when we arrived for our reservation and were immediately taken to our table.  To bad it was the WORST table in the whole restaurant.  We ended up in the very back by the doors leading out to the porch area (apparently they were serving out there also).  We were treated to a blast of cold air each time the doors were opened.  As usual the food and service was phenomenal. But being sandwiched between blasts of cold air and waitstaff bumping our table as they tried to get to the kiosk or kitchen really put a damper on the experience.  We'll certainly be back to Cowfish but we'll just be more specific about our seating choice.

YZA5Fl18KaDcOTgXhJabLQ.text: GREAT sushi, I had the Bento Box, which has a little bit of everything. A mini burger, edemame, 4 sushi pieces and a salad. I had the coconut onion rings...very tasty, but huge appetizer! However, the onion rings, the bento box...everything seemed to salty at the end.

uBhnx1cCI9-Zltr_zdtgiw.text: We just love Cowfish!  One of our most favorite restaurants in Charlotte!  We love the burgers and have tried many of them.  Never disappointed in them.  One of my favorites is the lamb burger.  My family also loves the Bento Box.  You can choose your sushi and your burger for it.  Sweet potato fries, Thai cucumbers, and edamame are delicious in the Bento Box.  The Chinese Chicken Salad is wonderful  too!  Makes me want to go there right now.  Great desserts too!  We love the Fresh Berry Tall Cake, which is lots of pound cake with vanilla ice creams and raspberries on top.  The only problem that we have had is that the wait for a table may be long but it is worth the wait!

yjxYugoOoK3x87XVV9fb_g.text: This place was hard to find considering we started in the mall and thought we could easily walk here. Yeah we walked, but it wasn't easy. Tip: look for The Residence Inn and you can't miss it. My husband and I were in Charlotte for a wedding and wanted to eat something different than the typical restaurants in Cali.  The ambiance was great! This place really marrys sushi and burgers which seems impossible until you actually eat here. They had a lot of options for the nonred meat and nonpork eaters like myself. We started with the crab and lobster spring rolls which were awesome both to the eye and to the taste buds! I had the bento box which was a perfect pairing of a slider (turkey burger) sweet potato fries (very good) edamame (stemmed and salted) 4 Cali rolls (fresh and flavorful) and sweet/spicy cucumbers (good). I couldn't finish all my food and my combo was a perfect balance of burger and sushi. My husband had a cheeseburger and onion strings which he said was very good. I would recommend this place to anyone regardless if you eat sushi or not. I'm not one for raw fish and they separate raw sushi from cooked rolls on the menu. Great idea!

ebGjj3kHpnRZpJawYWWnLQ.text: Went in there with three of my other great friends and it was a disaster from the start.  We were not greeted for more than five minutes once we were sat and it wasn't until some server came by to ask if someone has been to us.  Two out of the four orders were totally screwed up by either the server or kitchen and both meals had to be comped and when we received our food it was less than par for the course.  Burgers were dry and overcooked per request.   Simple things that came on the some of the items we ordered were absent and after all the problems so was the manager from talking to us.  This was my fourth time here and probably will be my last along with the other three I went with.

MSczJya-egXpzstJr5M_bw.text: Sushi is good but nothing you couldn't find at a real Sushi house. Had to wait hours for a table then they double billed our credit card and refused to fix it.

tw1DmoffHblcr6r8MsT3Hw.text: The food was great at Cowfish - I had a combo box with a Vegetarian roll and a mini burger. The burger was delicious, cooked just right. The vegetarian roll had a mixture of asparagus, cucumber and avocado. We didn't have a reservation for a Friday night, but we only had to wait about 40 minutes to get a table for 6 which was nice. The 1 downfall is that they didn't have a tumpura sweet potato roll - which I crave when I am out for sushi!! I definitely recommend this place if you're in the Charlotte area!!

OqFqe2fBg00VHVjOHSL-vw.text: Sushi was just ok. The turkey burger was horrible. Everything is overpriced.

tt4h6BFk1WrgoaLCFF2EbA.text: Ok so I tried them again. It's still crowded and loud and I can't really imagine this being a date restaurant unless you want to sit across the table and yell at your date. Neither of those things are really necessarily bad though. The food was pretty good especially the sweet potato fries. This time I had a burger and it was also pretty good (although my medium rare burger was WAY on the rare side of medium rare) . Here's the thing though. The food is not really all that . . and in a place crowded and loud and expensive I really need the food to be all that and it's just not. It is very trendy but for me trendy is kind of a bad thing. I can go to Fudruckers and get a burger that's just as good and not leave with a headache. So yeah I'm taking them down to 3 stars. Because for as long as I wanted to be seated and as much as I paid the food needed to be better. A previous reviewer said over rated, I tend to agree.

HQjYdVG_JJLWnt8JnqNywg.text: One of the best burgers in charlotte. Just wish they had reservations so I didn't have to wait in line for an hour.

5bkbszD4eFaSftGzia3Evw.text: food was pretty good.  i understand this place is popular because of the vibe it gives.  service was ok.  would go back

CGv2g80CyHkn-5JUguffTA.text: Friendly & Fun atmosphere, with amazing creative flavors!

kUjPXJTT2eysx80bTpSbkQ.text: We  stopped in here for lunch today. We were sat down right away at about 11:50, and by 12:15 the place was packed up. I would highly recommend putting in a reservation so that you can get a table and not wait as long. Whether you reserve or test your luck, it will be worth it either way.  Cowfish is a combination sushi bar and burger joint, but our party only had burgers so that's all I can vouch for. The burgers were a bit steep in price (ranging from $10-$15) but totally worth the price. You won't find a normal bacon cheeseburger here, and all the burgers are made of the best quality meat and toppings, and most of the burger options are a bit different, and HUGE!!! I ordered the C.B.C.L.T. ($10) which was a burger with sharp cheddar, white cheddar, and bacon on a brioche bun. I substituted the beef burger for the bison burger (extra $4) because I prefer bison to beef for the leaner meat and superior taste. It was a gigantic burger that took up a good chunk of my plate. Filling out the rest of the plate was a heaping order of sweet potato fries. There were so many that my wife, mother-in-law and myself were unable to finish even half the order. I'm not big on drinking alcohol with lunch, so I stuck with the mango iced tea which was a very tasty "unsweetened" iced tea, and I would recommend it if you're into unsweet tea.  My wife went with the fresh basil pesto turkey burger ($11) which pretty much speaks for itself. It was a good turkey burger with some nice spice to it, and the pesto tasted pretty darn fresh. She got the fried pickles as a side and absolutely loved them. My mother-in-law had the seared ahi tuna burger ($11) which was pretty good, aside from the fact that she ordered the tuna cooked MEDIUM (I gave her a stern lecture later on about that fiasco). That was served on a whole wheat bun with veggies and slaw with a ginger dressing.   The burgers here are very delicious. Our bill came out to $44 in the end, which may seem a bit much for lunch for three, but it's totally worth the price. You can really taste the freshness in the burgers and the portions are insane! I highly recommend getting your butt here if you crave a great burger and are near the South Park Mall.

qQXbhB3_kblEZUTJGKNZYw.text: Who would have thought that burgers and sushi could go together so well. You have to try the burgershushi. It's an amazing experience. Fun place!

Vyv1zRbI4lNPmXQIRaqyMQ.text: Very trendy, cool place. I had some coworkers that went just about every week for the $5 martinis on Tuesdays or the half-off wine on Wednesdays so I finally decided to try it for myself. The bf and I went on a Friday night, a little after 8 - the place was PACKED. We were told it would be a hour and a half/forty five minute wait but the seating around the bar and sushi bar was first come first serve, so we hovered around that area like hyenas on the prowl and less than 10 minutes later 2 stools opened up. I ordered the crab and lobster spring rolls, they were pretty good. I like that they have a build-your-own sushi roll feature on the menu, I've never seen that anywhere else before. Not actually "build you own" as in you make it, but you choose whatever you want. My bf ordered a burger and fries and a milkshake. Overall, the food was about an 8, and I would come back here just because it's a unique, different experience, but it's not anything I just gotta have.

kNZ5KkLqn_5EfFmDZj13qQ.text: Cowfish is one of those rare restaurants that is able to take two random food groups (burgers and sushi) and meld them in such a way that once you've been, you can't seem to remember why you thought it was so random in the first place. I'll base my review on the two times I've dined there - once for lunch and once for dinner. Here's the scoop:  Be sure to get a reservation. This place is constantly slammin' and each time I went there was a long wait (an hour for lunch and 2.5 hours for dinner). Good thing we thought to call ahead or I would not have had the chance to indulge....  The decor is interesting. Everything from the red walls to the cartoon art to the voiceover in the bathroom translating sayings...all eye catching and very entertaining.  Parking is not a problem. You may have to head over to the parking deck, but it's not too far of a walk.  Service is great. Our server was very informative, attentive, and friendly both times we dined. The manager came over when we went to lunch, and since it was my boyfriend's first time, gave us a coupon for a free appetizer for our next visit. That's a great way to keep people coming back.  The food is phenomenal (and good luck narrowing it down with that crazy large menu). In terms of appetizers, I've had the crab rangoon dip and the coconut onion rings - both of which I'd have again. But if you're only going for one, get the dip - not low fat by any stretch, but totally worth it. I've had the tropical storm roll and the mango tango roll as entrees - both of which were some of the best sushi I've had - but ask them to slice into 10 pieces instead of 8 - when sliced into 8, the pieces are just way too big. My boyfriend had a burger and has been talking about going back ever since. We also got a chocolate and a mint chocolate milk shake to go and they were so thick that we had to wait a bit for the ice cream to melt to really enjoy them (as all milkshakes should be, in my humble opinion). The drink menu is also very extensive and I can't wait to go back to try some of their martinis. And all prices are reasonable for the location and sheer amount of food you are given.  Ultimately, you're missing out if you don't try Cowfish. Just make sure to call early for a reservation (I know, I know - I said that before, but I don't see the wait times dwindling any time in the near future).

fiHK4IwGJuTygWHbKyL6QQ.text: So, after exchanging a couple of e-mails with someone from the management team at Cowfish, I made an effort to visit the restaurant.  You can read about my initial experience in my first review.  However, the person from the management team provided a reasonable explanation for why they are reluctant to seat too many patrons at one time (they don't want to overwhelm the kitchen staff and compromise the food quality).  Moreover, the person I exchanged e-mails with was very interested in making sure that my future experiences at Cowfish would be really good.  He even wanted to send me a gift card to compensate me for the inconvenience from last Saturday.  I turned down the offer for the gift card and the offer for "special" treatment.  I feel that a restaurant should do a good job of attending to everyone - not just folks who have complained.  But, I give the management a TON of credit for working so hard to make this restaurant successful.    With that as an introduction, here's the scoop on Cowfish.    The food was really good.  Surprisingly good, actually.  I ordered a cucumber appetizer with sweet and spicy sauce, and then I ordered two rolls.  One roll was a specialty roll - Mark's Roll - and the other was from their "Burgushi" menu.  All three items were excellent.  The appetizer was huge, and very reasonably priced.  The sauce/dressing on the cucumbers was tangy and spicy, yet it wasn't too heavy or too hot.  The special roll - Mark's roll - was fantastic.  It had jalapeno, tuna, cream cheese and a bunch of other items.  The roll was flash fried and served with a spicy sauce on the top.  The "burgushi" roll was called "Doug's Filet".  Basically, it was a Philly roll covered with filet mignon (seared slightly, but still very raw).  This roll was huge, and it was very heavy.  However, it was also very tasty.  I didn't like this roll quite as much as Mark's Roll, but it was still an item I would order again.    My girlfriend also ordered a sushi roll - from the "make your own" menu - as well as a Cowfish bento box.  The Cowfish box contains a mini burger, a small roll, and some side items.  It's a great deal for $11.     I was surprised to find that Cowfish is actually a good value.  The rolls I ordered were $14, but they were huge.  Two of them left me absolutely stuffed.  (In fact, I couldn't finish all of the food I was given.)  With the appetizer, three beers, the bento box, and three rolls our tab was $72.  Not bad at all for Charlotte.  A few last comments... Cowfish is really, really noisy.  The atmosphere is fun, but it isn't a place for an intimate conversation. And, unfortunately, the service still isn't great.  The folks we interacted with were very kind and helpful.  (Which was not the case last Saturday.)  However, the restaurant is so popular right now that they are struggling with some basic issues.  We waited almost ten minutes to get our first beers.  Our server was VERY apologetic.  He said the back up was due to it being half priced martini night.  That's not a very compelling excuse, though.  They know in advance that it is half priced martini night.  They know they are very popular right now.  It's important to have enough staff to serve all of the customers in a timely fashion.  At the end of the meal our server - an incredibly nice guy - seemed to go AWOL.  I think that this was due to his waiting on the manager to come by to visit us as first time customers.  It's nice that the manager checks in with first time customers (even giving out a coupon for a free appetizer on the next visit), but I value my time more than I value a free appetizer.  I was tired and I was ready to go.  Yet, we didn't have our bill.    I would give Cowfish 3.5 stars right now.  I suspect that the service will improve over time, and I can easily imagine it becoming a 4 star restaurant.  I certainly look forward to going back.

RShTKiHU1xBrDEp8v_aFhg.text: GREAT FOOD! GREAT ATMOSTSPHERE, but kinda a long wait...Well worth it though.  I do wish they took reservations, we had a large party for a birthday party and had to wait b.c they did not take reservations :( but well worth every minute.  You have to try the Crab Rangoon Dip!

gL5QMwKq3kBuhxtmvFGUyg.text: While visiting the Queen City, I found this place in and around my old stomping grounds. We went on the $5 Martini night.  The drinks were exotic, fun and tasty.  The Key Lime Pie Martini is deliciously dangerous. I hate that we ate a late lunch because I wanted to try some of their signature rolls. I am excited about visiting again.

aoBFyyj9ynuon3hgOwK1IA.text: Fun atmosphere, great place to meet with friends and people watch. Food: so much to choose from. The menu needs a glossary. Recommend it!

l7RdQQb_LZK8wdSH85W_ew.text: Went on Father's Day (1st time visitor). The menu is eclectic and my dinner partner ordered a burger and I ordered an infusion meal. Absolutely fantastic. My only "complaint" is that the atmosphere is just a little above a fast food restaurant, a little disappointing given the prices. Also our wait person was a little cranky, seemed like she just wanted to get rid of us for the next customers even though they were not crowded. A good wait staffer would engage in conversation after I announced that we were first time visitors and really enjoyed the meals, a little enthusiasm would have been nice.  Will definitely will go back again, perhaps will sit outside for a better ambiance.

dfnU4hEuErpJSCV1zJtBCg.text: love, love, love this restaurant, but they need to bring back the smoked salmon sandwich.  great customer service as well!

oH6nIlsUKN2vkreln2CIHA.text: Being over two hours from the coast, I was worried I wouldn't find good sushi in Charlotte. Boy, was I wrong! I came to Cowfish with an open mind and left with an empty plate. I came here first with my family. We started with edamame. You might think it's hard to mess up steamed soy beans, but I've been to many places that just can't seem to get it right. Cowfish served up some delicious edamame. We then split three rolls (Miss Moffitt, Marks Roll and Tropical Storm) The fusion sushi rolls are expensive, but keep in mind they are entree size. Each one was better than the next. The tuna was fresh, and the ingredients in each one complemented the fish but did not overpower to roll itself. I came here again with my husband and had an equally good experience. i will be back again to try some burgushi!

fq1A2NNMWJXLVnAAkmRkog.text: Great atmosphere, delicious food, and excellent service. The sushi here was very good. I highly recommend trying Cowfish-Charlotte.

ZLPYDpyCNKMZrxvsLBBRVg.text: I like this place alot.  Very americanized mayonais like rolls, but I like them.  Drinks are averpriced but delicious especially the saki-martini- like drink. A little cheesy but a really extensive delicious menu.  Not one that is easy on the wallet for you bargain shoppers tho!

THzvPDuAM6PsVeQN5PN6bA.text: Love the burgers and sushi! Cool atmosphere! I have only been to a Cowfish in Orlando, FL and now Charlotte, NC and have been happy both times. Now that we live near a Cowfish in Charlotte I'll be here more in the future.

gw7ozViz5PJPT7GrYvkUBg.text: I had been trying to get back after my first visit.  We came by 4 times prior to this one, only to leave because of the long waits. Well, I showed up before 5pm, and it was empty.  Cowfish is awesome! We had burgers again and they are perfect, my new favorites in Charlotte. Now I need to rethink my other burger reviews, ha. Huge 1/2 pound patties and fresh toppings, cooked over an open flame. Multiple bun options as well. The fries were crispy and seasoned perfect.      We sat at the bar again and had excellent service. The Longhorn Cowfish in the aquarium is quite the talk, yes a Cowfish is a real fish.  You gotta try this place!

uJbaXf0vxYBEPIhWAVTyBA.text: I've been here plenty of times and have always had a great medal. The menu can be a little overbearing but you're sure to find something that will enlighten your taste buds.  Now this place is not a restaurant you go during peak times. There will be a wait, you will have to wait outside or cramped inside, and you will drive yourself crazy watching closely to see if your fish ( your place in line) is getting bigger on a giant screen.   Appetizer wise you can't go wrong with the crab Rangoon dip or the truffle fries! My go to entree is the bento box because their menu is big and i can never decide if i want burger or sushi, and the box offers both. The cucumber salad is honestly the best thing in the box, skip the sweet potato fries and get extra cucumbers! I've had a couple of their burgers. They are huge, flavorful and very filling! Their sushi is so yummy and fresh, never had any that i did not like!  Service is good, but can be lacking due to them being so busy. Prices are decent for what you get but this is no cheap date. This place is full of everything from kids birthday dinners to anniversary dinners and get dressed up or stay casual, it all seems to work here.

o4XIlUoudsXvqBbcXLpISw.text: HOLY COWfish! I love this restaurant. Combining all great things American! Hamburgers, French Fries and Sushi! This restaurant is so popular, I would highly recommend getting here early if you are coming with a larger party as I did. We were able to get seated right away as they had  plenty of seating in the back patio. The patio is heated, so we were very comfortable during our dining experience.   Spectacular service! Our waiter was so patient with us, answered all our beer and hamburger questions and was checking in on us throughout the meal to refill our drinks. Also have to mention, that although the restaurant was busy and we had already finished our meals, we were not rushed at all! The manager even came around and asked us how we liked the meals and chatted with us about his hometown as he found out some members of my party were from the same place he was. All staff was so friendly!!  I ordered the Fusion Specialty Bento Box  - with this option you can select which hamburger and sushi you want. I went with the Boursin Bacon Burger and Dion's OMG! Roll. I would highly recommend both options! I was recommended by the waiter to try the fusion rolls as those are specialties to the restaurant. Glad I listened!  The bento box also came with  sweet potato fries, Thai cucumbers and edamame. Would order the same thing all over again!   I also ordered the fresh Meyer lemonade with yuzu sauce. Excellent spin on lemonade!  Great Food & Great Service!

xJhFe6tBBYsO6qjX9DGDkw.text: This was my first time at Cowfish. My server Tiana (like the princess) was AMAZING!!!! She knew the menu and really seemed excited about working for this company. She made a few suggestions that were right on the money.....actually all of her suggestions were great.

nR1TpQfoWIFxDFi9hMicGw.text: One of my favorite place when I am craving burger. Sushi was good. The service was great.

g4XQ2_TeOrQg9QO7Sioxvg.text: Once the best place in Charlotte, the last few years have been rough enough that I had to edit what was once a glowing review.  Even though the wait times have always been astounding, the quality of the food and most importantly what used to be stellar service provided by tenured staff would make up for it, in spades. Our family ate here at least once a month, often more, and would bring out of town visitors there, many of whom would return and request a return visit.   About a year ago we started noticing a lot of staff and management turnover, accompanied by service level drop off. We stopped going regularly due to tons of errors and mediocre service, but still dined here occasionally. Then about 4 months ago had a horrible experience with a server changeover during shift change when we had guests visiting. A table of 8 and only one order correct. Correcting this was a 30 minute experience.Some people didn't even have food by the time others had finished. Management knew they'd screwed up and gave us some comp cards to bring us back. We were so put off that we waited until recently to return.  Another new server, only this one lost control of her tray, and dumped a glass of red wine on the table and on my wife's clothes. She and a nearby manager scrambled to clean up and get a new glass of wine, but when we mentioned the clothes, they ran off, and didn't offer to clean them or pay for cleaning, as would be expected. While I'm fuming about this, the same manager arrives with our food, dumps my plate on the table knocking the burgers over/open, and while handing a plate to my son, dumps half of his fries on his lap ~ At this point I'm dumbfounded that they just literally threw food and wine at us; my wife has red spots on her clothes, my son has grease spots on his shirt and pants, and no one has tendered an apology. Oh, and they "forgot" my wife's sushi, and it took another 10 mins to reach us. Pics of the fries on the ground and the empty place where my wife's sushi should have been are attached.  We got a single apology from the server, and a $22 discount on the almost $100 check.  After 5+ years of regular patronage, they lost us. We won't be back.

mg6r_beE532QP-VHxH7uZw.text: Quick service and their sushi is definitely best in its kind in the area. Clean and cozy environment. Crowd is normally moderate and wait time is not long. I would always recommend this place for a good date night or simply chill chat with a bud.

30nEb_x03kAP1CkjfgojTQ.text: Fresh & delicious is the way to best describe this trendy spot with a great concept, "burgushi", burgers & sushi, who would have thought?  As a non meat eating vegetarian, I had tons of options & had trouble deciding.  We ordered several different sushi rolls (which our wonderful server so kindly described) & seaweed salad.  Everything was ssoooooo fresh & delicious.  The service was also great and the atmosphere modern & clean.  Look forward to another trip in to try different items.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burgushi - fusion of burgers &amp; sushi, cool concept
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cool atmosphere

MrG8y0GFPrHIhebex2W3Xw.text: Night out with family & friends and it was just your ordinarily OUTSTANDING evening at the Cowfish. The family absolutely loves The Cowfish and now is the best time of the year to visit. Why you ask? GOBBLE-GOBBLE USHI!...  ...It sounds gimmicky right? I remember my first encounter with it about three years ago and I said to myself "OK I'll get it to try it, but it can't be as good as a real turkey dinner..." Boy was I WRONG! Roasted turkey, fried green beans, holiday stuffing all inside a soy wrapper. Thin sweet potato strings wrapped around the roll and flash fried. Topped with more green bean, cranberry sauce, and gravy... I was telling Chris the manager tonight how if they were open on Thanksgiving, we'd just drive to the restaurant! Outstanding flavor and perfect harmony. Textures are what really have the potential go wrong with all these different ingredients, but they've executed everything thoroughly and it has an amazing contrast between crunchy and soft!  This is a bit backwards, but let me talk about tonight's appetizer: Blackened Tuna Nachos. Everything about this dish takes each individual element and amps the quality to world-class. The best tuna served rare and just seared on the surface, crunchy and rich pita-like chip, crab rangoon dip, outstanding guacamole, and finished with micro-greens, tomato and onions. Each individual component is a superstar all on it's own, but put them together and it's straight magic!  Our service was impeccable. Chris stopped by the table at the beginning and the end of the dinner service and is definitely adept on ensuring the guest experience is top notch. Our waitress Maggie was as good as it gets with a prompt greeting as we sat down and getting our food out with what seemed like almost no wait between courses. Speaking of wait, they told us about a 30min wait when we got there and it ended up being less than 10! What more could you ask for?  We got desserts to go, absolutely stuffed with the appetizer and entree. Again, there's a reason out of all my reviews (102 as of this update), Cowfish is still #1 in my book!

RzOrb94CcyFCQNWQIEpp_A.text: Food was really good , in my opinion the menu is too large with too many options, sitting was pretty fast for a weekend and the serving time was very decent.  Will recommend for a friend to try their tuna taco .

6YUFV_HuL3qcN4Y48H_28Q.text: Wow what a grand list to choose from, I was pumped! However, not sure if it was just what I ordered or it wasnt my day.  I had pretty high expectations for this place and it left me curious and bewildered. Crab rangoon dip. Calamari. Peach blossom tea and mango cado roll with spicy mayo. Everything was mediocre except the flavorful delicious tea. The mango cado roll,  especially lacked any ooumfph and quickly became a disappointment. The spicy mayo in the side was quite different than the usual and I liked that ! Parking is in a large complex, as the restaurant is attached to a rather large flat mall looking space. I'd say , and I'm sorry to say it - the many offerings does not out weigh the lack of excitement in the food. I flirted with a 2 buy settled on a 3.

iMI90PDRO_RHSKYhxCTbzA.text: Cowfish is quickly becoming one of my favorite places to dine in Charlotte! Trying to decide between a burger and sushi is so tough every time.   We came here last night for my girlfriend's birthday. She wanted sushi and we wanted to try two different rolls so we split the firecracker and the blackened tuna roll. Both were incredible and we had no problem finishing both off. The rolls we ordered came with 9 pieces of sushi and it ended up being plenty of food.  A complimentary double decker chocolate cake with whipped cream and chocolate flakes was the perfect ending to a birthday dinner; thank goodness she was willing to share. I know it is tough to get in and get seated here at times but that is the reality of good, quality restaurants.   If you have not tried cowfish you are missing out.

fbo5eJTPT6wcSCT1XfI4Lw.text: WOW!!!!! This place was awesome!!!! I had a hard time finding it but I am glad I didn't give up looking. The decor is great lol. But let's talk about the food. I started with the crab Rangoon dip...... HOLY COW!!!!  The best dip probably ever. The tortillas come with a i think sweet Thai drizzle on them, amazing. I ordered the thundering herd burger and again...... completely blown away. It was phenomenal!!!!!!!!  I ALSO ordered the marks roll sushi...... which never came out.... but they completely rectified themselves.  I told the server it didn't come out and I was cool with that, I didn't anticipate being so overly stuffed.... so she removed it from the bill.... great.... but then the service manager came over with a fresh roll made to go for me. That went way above and beyond. I was cool with it just coming off the bill....  of course I ate it later that night..... IT TOO WAS GREAT !!!!  They nailed it on all 3 of my orders. Definitely going back.

7J7g9xFkSb-jlk3PJb1QDw.text: Sushi was delicious and service was great but very pricey. Wasn't a fan of the burgers, but others might like it.

3GRWp9iPa8-R46J5M-90cg.text: Amazing! While you should expect a wait if you go on a weekend or Friday night it's worth the wait. I got the bento box option which came with sushi, burger, and a few sides. The atmosphere is nice and the drinks look good although I didn't try one. They also let you check in before you get there (I believe you can do it through yelp or the no wait app) so you save your spot in line before you get there. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a place with options for any type of water or diet.

qGu7Fqj5yH8ATQLb40_HvA.text: Surprisedly disappointing - as we usually have a good experience here. The hostess was rude and the wait staff was off - food was late coming out of the kitchen and everything was over cooked.   Disappointing as we brought family here from out of town and we had built the experience up. I'll try it again - but if this was my first time eating here I would return...

-gU_mbo2Re9uOw3vcaGQPQ.text: What a treat this place was! I'm no longer eating red meat, but if I were I'm sure I would have tried one of their "Burgushi" options, which is as you guessed a fusion of a hamburger and sushi.  They also experimented with adding beef and other peculiar ingredients to several fo the more traditional sushi options. So, good job them!  We didn't have it, but the crab rangoon dip smelled and looked delicious. it was recommended by several around us, and by the server, but ultimately you can imagine its just a deconstructed crab rangoon.  So, instead we tried the Lobster spring rolls. They came out in the most elaborate presentation and they tasted phenomenal.  There was a sauce on the side with a great deal of spice.  You could use as much or as little as you wanted.    THE DRINKS!  So, we tried several cocktails as well. And, boy were they amazing.  I couldn't tell you how much I appreciated the servers recommendations, and their nice twist on the old fashioned (my go-to bourbon drink).   Try this place for sure, and get there early to have the best parking.

R7CEFF52TbKJtvQYqm_rdQ.text: We stopped here for lunch and we had the best sushi ever and the most wonderful service from the friendliest staff ever.

zNcZo1u8B0FR39iSvQm8cA.text: Whenever I'm in Charlotte, I always stop by The Cowfish! All of the sushi, appetizers, and drink selection is top-notch and super tasty. If sushi isn't your thing, the menu is expansive enough for anyone to find something they'll like. They have a full bar with beer, cocktails, and alcoholic milkshakes that are to die for. There's also outdoor seating that's perfect for the warmer months. This is the perfect spot to catch up with friends, go on a date, or have a girls night at! I promise you won't be disappointed.

Qy-iwusXEs9uEbdiYdXM9A.text: While the food was yummy, this review is specifically for the service.  Coming from an F&B background myself, I am always on the lookout for outstanding service. This restaurant definitely has it. Our server (Alison?) was great from the get-go. She offered suggestions and never left the table without picking up a straw wrapper here, an empty plate there. She even brought us new silverware after our appetizer course. I watched as she seamlessly handed off an iced tea pitcher to another server who was passing by. This small interaction that would normally go unnoticed, told me that this restaurant values teamwork and taking care of guests above everything. Here's where they proved that they take care of their guests... We were dining out on the patio, and my sister-in-law was feeling a little warm, so she went inside to get in the A/C. The servers inside noticed her looking not so good, and my SIL fainted. My husband and I were still outside so we did not witness the incident, but Alison came to get us quickly. Another patron who was dining was on the ground with my SIL, and another server was already on the phone with 911. We were right inside the door to the patio, but no server ever made us feel like we were in the way. They were so helpful and quick to get us anything we needed, and everyone was concerned about my SIL. The quick action on all the staff's part was much appreciated in such an unexpected situation. Alison boxed up our food for us, and another server got us a to-go water and wet a cool rag for my SIL. The manager took down some information from my husband so he could call and check on how my SIL was doing. I appreciate the service from every staff member we interacted with and commend the managers and owners for valuing the wellbeing of all customers.   Thank you to all the staff at The Cowfish! (SIL is feeling much better, by the way.)

dZw2JisH-p195HyE2O4png.text: This place has not disappointed and today's was apparently really really good (I'm on a diet).  The all American double cheese burgushi is a cheeseburger in the form of a roll.  It potato strings  wrapped around  ground beef and rice and cheese.   He had shark eyes (u know where they roll back when they are in a frenzy eating).  Also had the bento box that just has so much food its just not fair.   The cucumber salad was really good and he also had shark eyes.  Last was just a staple California roll but she said it was delish.  Shark eyes all around.

M-9oXYeBpcCZa2KhuM_ZxQ.text: Went to this restaurant today to celebrate my sisters birthday. The wait time was less than 15 mins. Very good for a Saturday Afternoon around 4 p.m. The hospitality of one of the managers Steven was instant as soon as we arrived. He catered to our party of 7 needs, with a generous smile. The hostesses at the front were nice and our waitress was also nice and attentive. Everyone enjoyed their entree. I had the bison burger which was good. My husband had the lamb burger and he really enjoyed it, he also had the birthday cake milkshake he enjoyed that also.. The crab dip was good. Family enjoyed the food. Will be back.

K_ZmcQUxe6c2-Q8YFmoXEA.text: Went here on a Saturday night and it was packed. They don't take reservations so you have got to wait. The sushi is goooood, I had the North Hills roll and although pricey ($14 for one roll) it was worth every penny. The drinks are on a higher side too but everything was good to compensate for the price. Service was good and attentive. The only downside is the wait time otherwise I recommend checking this if you love burgers and sushi or just sushi!

CVIw0PuYScStJwxia9DKPQ.text: After having visited the Cowfish table at Yelp Gets Lucky (cough, cough-maybe three times), I was so impressed by the medium rare burgers and chunks of sashimi tuna, that I was inspired to go.  Fast forward one month.  Sounds like a great place to go with the family after The Nutcracker. Yelp app = take me there, please of course.  Wow, this place is huge (and that was inside)! And just look at that fish tank! Pretty and classy! The patio is definitely the way to go - enclosed with heaters and the perfect mix of brisk and warm.  At first I was a little turned off by the size of the menu (Cheesecake Factory Encyclopedia Menu Flashback alert!) but it's broken into easily digested sections (hehe - pun intended).  Anyone that carries Wicked Weed Tyranny Red IPA is near and dear to my heart - this beer is beyond amazing. Really well chosen selection of beers!  Okay - hold the phone. Who thought it was a good idea to take a giant New York Barrel Style dill pickle, slice it thick and then deep fry it? Because I want to shake your hand - pure genius - BEST fried pickle I've had in Charlotte yet!!!  The Boursin Bacon Burger was more than one human can eat - the toppings themselves, Boursin Cheese, bacon, sauteed mushrooms and grilled onions were a meal!!!  The Bento box with your choice of mini burger and sushi is bound to be a winner. Why? Because you choose what comes in it!!! The edamame are a delicious and addictive side!! Get them!!  Don't get me started on the kid Bentos! Okay, you did! Ninja Nuggets! Real pieces of chicken not processed crap! And if you don't go gaga for the kid sushi dessert (Rice Krispy treat with Swedish fish) and say "aw it's so freakin' cute" then you probably don't think puppies and kittens are cute either.  Now for the hand spun shakes... Vanilla with Mango and Raspberry - an ice cream lover's fantasy!!!   Can't say enough great things - they must have some magic formula that just makes things work!!! Awesome job guys and gals!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

3Zui2JyRt8qp5DctI-VetA.text: I've been to the Orlando Cowfish and was told here at this location that they are even better. As I loved the Orlando location...I was excited.   Our server, Chris, was excellent.  He knew a lot about the menu and really helped my guest figure out a way to get/try everything she wanted to for the best price. He was polite and on point with everything.   I ordered the half portion of the Parmesan truffle fries because the app size is massive.  These things are to die for. I mean...once of the most yummy things I've had in a long time.  The Deliverance Roll here is just like the "High Class Hillbilly" Roll in Orlando. It was just as I remembered. The BBQ was so moist and flavorful, the bacon infused coleslaw was amazing, and the crispy potato straws on top added a nice crunch. Love love love.  I finished off the meal with a Rice Krispy Treat milkshake that really hit the spot.  Good on you, Cowfish!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Deliverance Roll!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 order of the Parm Truffle Fries. Amazing!!!!!

mFI_ulfPNgjNbVMsNOcAhw.text: I came here for lunch on a cold, rainy day and we sat in the heated patio area. Overall, it wasn't horrible, but it was a little on the chilly side. I ordered the Cowfish bento box. What's really nice is that you can customize your box with the sides and 4 piece sushi roll of your choosing. I wasn't a fan of the edamame but our server was kind enough to bring me another side at no additional charge. Other than that, the bento box was a great way to sample several different items at once and was quite tasty. Our server was super nice and very knowledgeable. Overall, it was a really good experience definitely worth a try. Oh, and definitely check out the bathroom. It's pretty cool!

YsQUqmFWsYrtn8Xk1FBfNg.text: Really late to the game on Cowfish, but finally got a chance to try it out. Very crowded on a Friday night but the bar is huge so we were able to score seats at the bar after about 20 minutes waiting for a table. Kristin was our sever and she was absolutely wonderful! Very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. She gave us some great recommendations for first timers!   As others said, the menu is overwhelming! There is so much to choose from and almost everything sounds delicious. We went with the crab rangoon dip and shishito peppers to start. The dip is a must get! My boyfriend and I split a burger and a sushi roll. They do have bento boxes if you don't have someone who wants to split with you. I was not a fan of the sushi roll we got (Dion's OMG Roll), but I think we just ordered poorly. There are a lot of other rolls I wanted to try. The Boursin Bacon Burger was absolutely delicious! You can't get a burger with boursin cheese anywhere.   I definitely want to go back and try some of the other menu items!

vuGee63N7LsLj6JWw9mzsg.text: I can't believe it took me two years living in Charlotte to finally eat here!  Bonus-We had a great parking space and didn't have to park far at all!!  Came here for my husband's birthday. We were quoted 25-30 minutes but didn't wait long at all. Maybe 15 minutes. They have a good mix of specialty drinks. I wanted to get a milkshake but was too full to get it.   We got the crab dip. I saw it was highly recommended on YELP and was very pleased. It's a very large portion. We could barely finish it. The dip was creamy with large chunks of crab in it. Chips were large and crispy. That sauce that's on it really made it delicious. Everything mixed together was just amazing!!   I got the shrimp tempura roll. I was surprised at how big it was. It was awesome, especially with the siracha sauce. I also got the Taste Explosion roll. It was my first roll like that. It was flat with ground beef, jalepenos, onions, some type of amazing sauce with a tomato and cilantro sauce on it with cheese. It was wrapped with seaweed and rice. It was delicious!! It was large and very filling. Ground beef was amazing.   My husband got the firecracker roll. He said it was one of the best sushi rolls he's ever had. He also said he can tell the ingredients were really good quality and very fresh.   I secretly told our server, Bryan that it was my husband's birthday and he made it so special. They came out and sang to him and gave us a birthday cake! The cake was huge! Chocolate layers with an awesome layer up top. Bryan was such a great server. He was very helpful and was super attentive. Highly recommended!!

1HzQaApzaTAY-vjtKmakaw.text: We love cowfish We just moved to Orlando and will have to try it at universal studios

y5LnBYSuE8XhL11b_BazHQ.text: I had to sit next to some nasty customer that complained about everything.  She was looking for a free meal.  I wish the restaurant would've just let her leave.  Her issue was that the sushi was too expensive.  Did you not see the prices on the menu?? My opinion of the food was fairly good.  I ordered the yellowtail appetizer and it was great but the slices of the fish were too big.  I ordered the bento box for dinner.  Everything was good except I subbed the French fires for friend pickles.  The fried pickles were too think.  They need to slice the pickles thinner.  I would visit again.

P9b8nPeVZYuQ948l9-NU2g.text: Fantastic food, sake, and service! Tiana was an amazing server, ask if she's working if you want one of the best server experiences in the Charlotte area.

KnNwXRq_pZHifX-gGr-8Zg.text: Highly recommended restaurant while we visited the Charlotte, NC area. Absolutely loved the menu and the variety. Atmosphere of the restaurant was gorgeous and in a very nice area in Charlotte. Our waitress was the best and knew the menu like the back of her hand. A few of us ordered cocktails and we greatly enjoyed them. We ordered a few appetizers which I can say the calamari was a hit for me. My colleagues stated the mini burgers received 5 stars as well as the crab Rangoon dip, neither I tried though.   We ordered a selection of different rolls to try and as always the California roll is a hit for me. I took a picture of the beautiful presentation of the Deliverance roll with pulled pork but I will say after high recommendations I tried the Doug's Filet roll with filet mignon and it was very good!!! Some I didn't try but our table was clean by the time we all left.  When I visit one of the other three cities this restaurant is in I hope it's just as great as this one.

wHv45Ufjq_A6P5pRewyBDA.text: I've eaten here  five times, and each time it's been nothing but the BEST !!! From the food to the drinks .. I can't believe it's a chain restaurant !!!! I recommend this place to everyone..: The serves is on point..

dW1jtBmsdENknyaesNE-4Q.text: The food, portions and options were great.  There was a little bit of a wait but that's not abnormal for a Friday night.  We mentioned we were celebrating a birthday and they  complied with the blush enducing birthday song and gong.  Our server Ellie was great and explained all our menu options.  It was a great iverall experience.  At times there seemed to be some lag in service but I attribute it to a full restaurant on a Friday night.

WtVZ-R4Khx6Yt7ts0PZHsw.text: This place has awesome cocktails, great food and sushi. Perfect spot If you have one person in your crew that doesn't do sushi. There is usually a wait but it's worth it. Give it a try!

nXRilIJxti2dFdikpLyWpg.text: Definitely one of my favorite places in Charlotte! We recently went here with some friends of ours and everyone had a great time. We started by sharing the crab rangoon dip, which everyone loved. My friend and I split a bottle of wine since they were half off and it was tasty and a great deal.   Normally I get the bento box but on this particular occasion, I just wanted sushi. I ordered the firecracker roll and it was aaaaaaa-mazing. My boyfriend loves their burgers. His favorite is the arnold hamburgler (or something like that?!?!) and he often raves that it is one of his favorite burgers.   Overall, this is an awesome spot and they have something for everyone.

8jmpUKTJJqRCjEbqbm1wVg.text: Went back to give them another try - fun place, excellent staff and delicious food. The restaurant biz is a very difficult one. Things can change for better or worse all the time, depending on management, chefs, servers, etc.

xwjGPQMk0C_6-zpN4UFzGg.text: The Cowfish is one of my favorite sushi places in Charlotte. It has a special aspect in that you can bring sushi haters with you, as they have a full burger menu. :)  We went for lunch on April 7th, and got there around 11:45. When we walked in we were told there was a 15-30 minute wait, and we could wait at the bar if we liked. We ordered some blood mary's (which were amazing), and parked it for wait for lunch. The Cowfish fills up early and is always busy, so a wait is expected unless you get there exactly at opening.  We watched people come and go, and then noticed that people who came in after us were being seated. My lunch mate went to speak with the girl who asked us to wait at the bar, and we found that she hadn't given us a beeper. She assured us we would get the next table, and we were seated within 5 minutes.  Always get the fried pickles here - they are great! They come with a semi-hot cream dip, which I think gets its heat from Sriracha; and a ranch dip. The pickles come directly out of the fryer and are always extremely hot. Sip on your drink for a couple while they cool down.  I ordered the King's Roll, it is my favorite at Cowfish. Once again it didn't disappoint. Stuffed with tuna, kani, jalapeno, cream cheese, and scallions; it's very lightly fried and then topped with crab salad, masago, hot and cream sauces. The pieces are huge, and I've found somewhat difficult to eat with chopsticks. So yes, I look like a noob eating it with my fork...but I'm happy with my King's Roll!   Highly recommended trying the Cowfish. If they tell you there's a wait, you can eat at the bar (first come, first served); if you prefer a table, make sure to get a beeper!  :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The King&#39;s Roll at The Cowfish Sushi Bar in Charlotte.

HrKjXFu09ZdxYsAmiZva_g.text: The crab Rangoon dip is absolutely amazing. I've only ordered sushi here which was very good!

RN0SGYHzb1vHDesK8dAUlQ.text: This was a great place for lunch  Thoroughly enjoyed the sushi and burgers. Would be back if we lived in Charlotte.

SwJ4M336Oile9v2Gs8WnBQ.text: Came at an odd time - 3ish on a Thursday.  TNT roll - the boyfriend ordered the lunch special with edamame. Sushi is good but the prices could be better.  Cowfish bento box - this is a pretty good deal especially if you want to try everything. The sushi seemed fresh and the slider had good beef.  Creamsicle milkshake - this was the boyfriend's favorite, thick and creamy with a nice orange flavor.  Sidenote - they seem pretty dedicated to the "cowfish" theme.  Verdict - Prices were pretty high but the quality is there.

Well after eating the blacken tuna nachos we were sold ! Amazing food we ordered different kinds rolls so we could taste as many as our stomachs could hold . The Woohoo Burgushi roll was like a  burger in a roll . Wow awesome ! The staff was super friendly service was excellent .  I wish we had one in New Orleans !

WvmBFgmZs2FU4UbTZO1hdQ.text: Always my favorite place to stop by when in Charlotte! A bento box and truffle fries are my go to dishes. Love the atmosphere. Went on a Thursday around 3 this time. My only complaint was our food did take a while to come out. We'll be back for another meal here definitely.

C5w5k2-vS5Ferk7TKFJ9fQ.text: Pleasantly surprised. Food was very good. Excellent beer selection. We sat at bar. And the service was good but bartender was busy. Recommend

MgCrbIQzxbd6RdmTQxA0OQ.text: A friend and I sat at the bar for dinner and drinks, our bartender Dave was amazing and very hospitable. Drinks and burgushi was incredible, highly recommend!!

u1f7T6TMyCx0Lu99TNrJJQ.text: Best dinner date ever. Me and my wife went out looking for something new and we hit the jack pot. The menu is HUGE and the food/service was on point. I had a armedagger breakfast burger and it was the bomb. We will definitely be back soon!

WZC5UMxhdpamf5065C4MLA.text: There is nothing great about this place. Ok burgers, ok sushi, great location...that is all. You are paying for the idea of having a combination of burgers and sushi rather than quality food.  I have been here twice. The first time was decent, but nothing special. I wish that I could better describe the food, but that is just what it is: forgettable. The second time was terrible. A friend and I sat down at the bar, waited...and waited...and waited...and ended up leaving without ordering anything. Terrible service.  I would definitely check this place out once to see what it is all about, but that is just that. It's kind of like an accident that you see on the interstate. Sure, you may slow down a bit to see what happened, but you will never return to check it out twice. Meh.

7HuFO7RU47EqsDwSaFXkog.text: Once upon a time, there was an amazing burger place right outside of SouthPark Mall: The Counter. This place was amazing, and when it closed I was devastated. Once it was replaced with The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar, my grief quickly went away. The Cowfish is absolutely amazing. It's owned by the same people who own eeZ in Birkdale, and having dined there, I knew the food would be delicious & inventive, and I was absolutely right. But then again, I'm always right =)  The Cowfish has the traditional style rolls (Philly, rainbow, etc) and a huge list of wildly inventive & exotic rolls to choose from as well. When Graham & I visited the day after Christmas, I wanted to try something different than I had ordered on previous visits. We decided on three (although I wanted about ten...), one from each section: the rainbow (a traditional roll), the blackened tuna (a more unique/fusion style roll) & the Doug's Filet Roll (burgushi).  I'll start with the burgushi, because it's what makes The Cowfish stand out above other sushi restaurants (and Charlotte has a TON of them!). Burgushi is taking the elements of a burger and making it into a sushi roll, or taking the elements of a sushi roll and making it into a burger/sandwich.  This was amazing. It was a Philly roll, topped with a piece of seared filet mignon, spicy sauce, scallions & masago. Absolutely amazing. I could even look past the blob of cream cheese (which I HATE in sushi). The roll was enormous, but everything about it was perfect, I really loved the spicy sauce and the very mild flavor of the filet. This is definitely my favorite item on the "burgushi" part of the menu, so far.   The Rainbow Roll was, of course, my favorite. It was a California roll topped with assorted fish & spicy sauce. The fish was fresh & firm, the sauce was nice & didn't overpower the roll. I absolutely hate it when there is so much sauce you can't really taste anything else. I would have been more than happy to eat this all day.   The last roll we had was the blackened tuna: Lump crabcake mix & cream cheese inside, rolled in temoura flakes, topped with blackened tuna, guacamole & a slice of jalepeno.   While this roll was good, it didn't compare to the other two. The roll tasted dry & the slice of jalapeno was completely overpowering. However, the guacamole was a nice touch and absolutely delicious. I removed the jalapeno and added a different kind of heat with a little srirachia. It was a better flavor combination, in my opinion and I enjoyed the remaining pieces a lot more with this change.   Not only was the food excellent during our lunch time visit, but the service was excellent as well. Our server took the time to go over every single aspect of the menu, and gave us a recommendation out of each category. The Filet Roll was one of her suggestions, and I'm so glad we went with that.   My ONLY complaint here is that they are always busy, and they only take reservations from 11:00-6:00, which makes zero sense to me. Especially since most of the shops in the area (excluding the mall), close at 6:00 or 7:00. Lunch patrons can browse & shop while waiting for a table. Dinner patrons can not. I had wanted to eat here for our anniversary, but knew we would have to either wait forever or eat at the bar, so we changed our plans. We still had to wait, but 15 minutes isn't too bad in the grand scheme of things. Last time I went was on a Thursday night, and the wait was much, much longer so we ended up dining at the bar. Fine for a dinner with a friend, not as okay for an anniversary dinner with your husband. However, this place is worth the wait and I can not wait to go back on my next trip home.

PshTvvGQnNAyDAB51XKmeg.text: Sushi burgers and shakes were delish.  Lost a star because special requests never happened. Asked for poke appetizer to come out with main course. Nope. Asked for sushi to come out on one platter. Nope. Asked for no whipped cream on shake. Nope. Won't stop me from coming back next time in Charlotte.

ZObASs7lXv7-9i324U2JRA.text: If I could... I would live in this restaurant! We were visiting NC for 4 days, and has to come back twice. The service was top notch and the food was amazing. We had their burgers, sushi, spring rolls, mixed drink, and etc. It was all delicious!

owTbeLyVgjE6uKRUACG2WA.text: I went here tonight with a girlfriend right after work so the crowd wasn't bad when I got there - I actually got rock star parking in the very first spot - SCORE!  We were seated immediately and greeted by our friendly waitress moments after that.  She got our drink and app order of fried pickles.  The drinks were brought back within moments, the pickles followed soon after smoking hot.  As usual, I ate one too soon and burned my mouth.  When will I learn?  The fried coating on the pickle chips was crunchy and yum and the pickles were served with a side of ranch and Cowfish sauce (I dunno, it's orangeish and kinda spicy... it's good, have some).    For my meal I had Granny's Pimento Burger, cooked medium, with fries.  The fries at Cowfish are shoestring and they were served hot and crunchy, perfectly seasoned.  The burger was cooked to perfection and juicy.  Granny's is a burger served on toasted rye with pimento cheese, a fried green tomato, lettuce and Duke's mayo (if you are southern, you know the importance of Duke's being the mayo on your burger).  Delicious!  The juicy burger did soak through the bottom piece of bread, but I just turned that sucker upside down and kept eating.  Scrumdiddlyumptious as always!

VFcNem1ogchGEjCp-XTU_g.text: Everything was delicious, creative, and well blended fusion.  Got the Poke Dip (which I highly recommend) and Prime Time Surf and Turf roll...amazing!!!  Hope they make it to DC Metro area!  I ate at the bar and Sean, the bartender, was very attentive, friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable (Not to mention a great mixologist).

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Poke Dip - Ah-Freakin-mazing

Zt2GF9qIG43babtfw_AhKQ.text: This place is great. Delicious food and awesome art. The 4 instead of 5 stars is because of seating/service. All the times I have been here, there are opwn tables consistently but a wait for a table.. No idea why this is always an issue for them. It is a little pricey as well but worth it for special meals.

73VxP3l_lEsqB9ni0B2unQ.text: I've been here a few times and haven't figured out what the buzz is all about. Love the bar and ambiance with the aquariums. Food is nothing to write home about. The combination of ingredients with sushi make no sense to me and my refined palate. Parking is all nonexistent unless you park and take a taxi to the restaurant. Waitstaff is inattentive when it comes to returning to the rabble to check on you or refills.  Better options for sushi in Charlotte.

_1giQ9ZOYaVcVIcY8FqBlQ.text: Brought my wife here for lunch today. It was her first time. She had the Spinach and Bacon side salad with the warm bacon dressing. Her response sums it up well: "Mmmmm! GREAT first impression!" If you are in the area you have got to check it out!

wSuAlGMlnhjSqf_o7Poutw.text: This place exceeded our expectations! Although they don't take reservations, have awesome food & great atmosphere we were still able to show up during prime time with a large party & be choosy about our seating food & drinks! The staff has been trained very well, everyone had excellent customer service & great attitudes. We ordered almost the entire menu & everything was delicious especially the sashimi & sushi!! We came in town for NASCAR but discovered a new reason to visit Charlotte! Our entire party agrees we will definitely be back! Thanks!

5yhAkw6_c_hrr6Eh1jxv4A.text: This place is just ok. I don't really understand why they have such a long wait all the time! There are better choices for both burgers and sushi in the area. It's not terrible, but not amazing either.  The tuna nachos are a solid choice. It's convenient that they serve burgers for the sushi loving/sushi hating problem that some people might find themselves in, otherwise not sure why you would make these 2 cuisines a combo as the split focus seems to make the food suffer.

Y2jxPneirO6LOogBalh8nw.text: OH. MY. COWFISH! Went there last night and I gotta say, Cowfish makes freaking AWESOME burgers!! I ordered the Jalepenos (i think that's how you spell it...) Popper. Dude, that burgers was seriously orgasmic. I know it's a bit weird comparing foods to sex, but if a burger makes you moan, how would you describe it? Yeah, you know that I'm right. So back to the subject, I got their onion rings, again, and I tried the Tuna BLT which was really good too. And I love the ambience at Cowfish, It's laid-back and metro. And the service was superb like always. Though I'm a bit sad that I can't book a reservation after 6pm, since my birthday is Nov.9  ( 007: Skyfall release date too :D) and I get out of work at 8 pm... Oh well, I guess I'll be testing my luck! ;)
