Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb burger... Well, you can never go wrong with lamb burger! Lol
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Texas Longhorn burger is pretty good with jalapeño bacons

bw04vzFRAIf2ViF-vHEBBw.text: This is not your grandma's sushi burger place...in fact the menu alone will send them into cardiac arrest!  Lots of unique options, both sushi and burgers!  We with were a vegan couple when we visited and everyone had exciting options!  I had the ahi bacon burger and it was out of bounds (yes I am trying to be obnoxious like Guy Fieri).  I didn't care for the rice bun but I appreciated the creativity!  The couple had make your own sushi and it was amazing!  Cool fun art and a funny bathroom!  What more could you want!

TQd_ygE3Qr8u_r7FaDZefQ.text: Delicious and unique experience! The burgushi is a treat! This takes American cuisine to the next level. Sushi was also fresh and good quality. They recommend the crab rangoon dip as an appetizer but I would hold off as it is extremely heavy and filling. Overall, it was a great experience!

CIUYVevdDPanQsYn3lJ9rg.text: Very cool place..and concept.  I loved that I could play digital Connect Four at the bar while eating and drinking!  It's not cheap by any means, but considering how big the rolls and sashimi is..it's well worth it.  What we ate there would have cost $200 in NYC so I considerate it a deal.  Downside:  very packed and some of the staff were snobby.  Upside:  The food outweighed the snobby staff..haha

PpDTVnFolLwFmKo7cof6Xg.text: AMAZING FOOD AND SERVICE! You cannot pick a better place to enjoy a great meal! Burgers, sushi, cocktails, FREE WIFI, and amazing people! This is the perfect place for a party or just to hang out! Every time I am in Charlotte, I always make a point to come here! You just cannot go wrong! Plus the staff is sooo nice!  Try the Avocado and Ahi Tuna Tartini! Its AMAZING!!!!

QY5sYXfYHkQbvTd4sOPaug.text: Very nice and popular restaurant in the mall. We had a group of 25 runners/coaches/parents after cross country nationals. Was a little but of a wait to get the tables and to order but we were a large group. Coach ordered some soy bean and cheesey bacon fry apps(very good) food came out shortly after. Very attentive staff. Got the blue cheese burger with fries and s California roll. Hit the spot! Very nice and clean bathrooms. Good beer and wine selection as well.

mTCzBaybDkj6_dfH8IVauA.text: My husband and I went for dinner one night and found the interior of the restaurant very interesting and different. We set at the bar on a crowed nite in front of a gigantic tropical aquarium filled with live coral moving about with beautiful tropical fish, sea urchins and starfish. Absolutely beautiful and unique. Our server at the bar was David who was very friendly and excellent at his job. Now for the food-I had the lamb burger which was very tasty and had a slice of fried feta on it which was real good. Husband had a cheddar burger which was cooked perfectly with a side of Thai cucumbers that were original and very good.  Overall nice experience and good food.

C37fhdYclaogYMbpuMWBrw.text: Felt like a lab rat... squeezing down two clogged lanes of rush hour traffic on 85, from Raleigh, and winding my way around the convoluted, impossible, multi-level, sprawling-across-intersections layout that is Southpark Mall. I finally called Cowfish to get a better bead on their location, and found them (eventually). The place was packed on my arrival, but they have quite a large horseshoe bar, and I was able to find a seat on the end.   The former Yelp CLT CM used to post Cowfish food porn pics, and they always looked awesome. And when I heard Cowfish was coming soon to Raleigh, I wanted to get a scoop on what to expect...  The idea of burger-sushi fusion is intriguing... but after my long drive, and looking over the burg-ushi, etc. options, I decided I wasn't feeling up to ordering something I might not enjoy. They have quite a long list of burgers and sushi rolls, which makes this restaurant concept kind of cool, because it's a place that will please anyone; it actually occurred to me I could take my non-sushi-eating parents there if I ever had a raw craving. I started with nigiri (white fish and yellowtail) and sake. Then followed that up with the Chef roll, which was large and tasty. All rolls can be made with brown rice for an extra fee.  Despite being busy, service was fast and attentive. The bar area has touch games built into the surface, which is neat-o. My biggest problem was the sticker shock. My drink, two pieces of nigiri, roll, and tip ran me ~$40, which is a lot to spend considering there's equally high-quality fish available for less where I live. Compelling concept, but not sure I'd be the one to suggest it, unless organizing a group get-together of varying palate preferences.

OZKIrDA4hRwuv1oGGRzWmQ.text: I couldn't have enjoyed this dining experience much more.  The menu was a bit scary at first.  A million dishes usually equals mediocre food.  This was not the case for me.  I am a firm believer in going with the flow when it comes to restaurants.  This means...ordering what they're good at...or what their niche is.  I did exactly that...and loved it.  The price was as expected...not cheap...but not wallet busting.  Drink selection was decent.  The wait was reasonable for a Saturday night.  I can't wait to go back again

thYqYDMy92J-mOjJ339bWQ.text: This is by far the best restaurant in Charlotte.  Plan to go during off hours or on a weeknight- otherwise you will be waiting in line for 1+ hours.  (Still worth it)  There is something on the menu for every and any one: burgers, salads, sushi, and combos of everything.  I live for the bento boxes filled with a sushi roll, mini burger, shoe string fries (yes sweet potato is an option), spicy cucumber salad AND edamame.  The mile high chocolate cake is delicious and totally worth the awkwardness of sharing it with your coworkers.

DakjOkergsOpzJqhtvEIdg.text: This place is so much fun and has something for everyone.  The nature boy roll is so good.  Don't forget you milkshake.

Py2iAruRQnbspw6XPB3pBQ.text: Great food. Not too worried about the recent health issues because stuff happens I get it. But the service is below average big time. Primarily the hostess. Typically they are ditsy blondes that seem to not really have a good grasp on what's going on. Love the food. But hate dealing with the bimbo idiots working at the front.

TMm40u-LfTaUt39QZRUQjw.text: This place is great!  The lobster and steak sushi is a must try!  Nice combo of american and japanese food with a good atmosphere.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chipotle Bison roll

JZ28ldXhz_dCIFRCQ9ropg.text: Great concept!    I had the Ultimate Bento Box - with the Blackened Lobster Roll + the Boursin Burger.  -- Blackened Lobster Roll:  very interesting concept, having lobster crab cake in a sushi roll.  First couple pieces were good, but I got a little tired of it after a while.  I'd go for something closer to legit sushi next time to even out the flavor.    -- Boursin Burger:  the boursin cheese was awesome, and the burger was pretty good, but it was a little dry for my flavor.  -- Sides:  Soured cucumbers were good, but there was a little too much of it.  Sweet potato fries were good, but a little mushy.  And edamame was delicious, there's really no way to mess up edamame anyway.  -- Environment:  Is great, the decor around this place was very nice.  I loved their canvas'.  And their fish tank is amazing.  They actually have a longhorn cowfish in their tank!  -- Overall, I would recommend this place.  It's great to see urban fusion in Charlotte.  They're doing something no one else really is, and I would really support this.  I would recommend trying something else though.  The waitress told me to try the Bento Box, but if I were you, I'd either just go for the rolls or try the Burgushi.   Bento Box was good, but I wish I would've tried the Burgushi.

N82AGk9vEMXBk1EDFnwtHQ.text: I got in the van thinking that my co-workers were headed to Mert's.  Lo and behold, we ended up at the South Park Mall and The Cowfish.  Parking was a cinch in the deck and we had a short walk to the restaurant.    We arrived around 1:00pm on a Friday and we had to wait roughly ten minutes for a table for six.  We were seated and handed our menus.  As has been previously noted, these menus are books.  You should allow yourself ten minutes just to read through the menu, as there is a lot to take in.  Our waitress came by to introduce herself and take our drink orders.  She asked if we had been to the restaurant before and when we replied that we hadn't, she walked us through the major sections of the menu.  Our drinks were brought out (including a quart glass milk-style bottle for water refills) and we placed our orders.  It was no more than fifteen minutes when all our plates were brought out.  I can only speak for the burger, but the CBCLT was quite good.  Served on a brioche bun (other bread options are available) with bacon, lettuce, tomato, and two types of cheddar, this is a solid burger.  The beef is all-natural, grass-fed which is something that I look for when I eat beef.  I had requested my burger be cooked medium, and for the most part it was.  The sweet potato fries on the side were tasty, but maybe just a tad above average.  The burger was served with their Cowfish Sauce, which I didn't quite care for.  But I loved that they had Sriracha Sauce in the lazy susan on the table.  Mixed some of that with some ketchup and had a spicy dip for my fries.  Good times.  This restaurant has a great vibe and a really eclectic burgers and sushi menu.  Prices may be a teensy bit high, but I think the food is worth it every once in a while.  Service was top-notch and personal.  And the men's bathroom had a scented candle!  Be sure to check out the book prints in the hallway on your way to the restroom.  They're pages from a children's book explaining the cowfish story.  I'll be back!

hmc5reaBce9VXJ6b2kUuXQ.text: This place is to die for & is an absolute must every time I come to Charlotte....EVERYTHING is good on the menu but make sure you get there early to get a reservation! WW

hTCS174w4JNHWSTYTK0g6A.text: Great vibe with friendly service. Food was excellent. We got a burger and soft shell crab sandwich- both were on point. Burger was cooked exactly as ordered and flavors were amazing. We would definitely come back to try Fillmore if their menu-so creative!

1IahRTaLQ8_Eh4GeNkE3LQ.text: The food was pretty good. The sushi servings were huge! Our waitress was standardly good, not outstanding services but nothing to complain about. The atmosphere was very cool!!

KWcadhjT8XHObe0V8odlLw.text: Solid food, cool vibe and good service. Great spot for after work.

5S5_0HUdodL4jHvcDSogyA.text: The Deliverance Roll= Heaven in my mouth.

pQxRAPRS2SLlSg6Xun1fAQ.text: Once again impressed had 18 of my co workers meet me at Cowfish they all were impressed awesome food all around service was awesome could not have asked for more. Good job Cowfish

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taste explosion!!!

EmLnaQ6weBpB4PGUSAoDlA.text: I am going to give this place four stars because it's such an interesting concept to take the components of a burger and put it in sushi roll and vice versa.  After eating horribly for the past weekend, I decided to stick with just the sushi.  It was a little spendy, but you get a lot of the price--I made two meals out of two rolls!  For sushi in North Carolina, it was very decent.  My waitress was very informative and attentive.  I am allergic to crab and she made such that wasn't an issue, also replaced the kanji in my roll with extra shrimp tempura.  My iced tea never went empty either.  Good customer service, great concept, okay food.

kdD64u0JiV1o3etNFPAFNA.text: You would not think the sushi would be any good, but it is even in Charllotte.  Great selection on the menu, it seems overwhelming, but the second read is much easier.

4jZ3DqsxtkHGuMvXzZo8Kw.text: I had spicy tuna roll and California roll. I thought not that good quality.They are using cheap imitation crab. (I can tell, I'm Japanese.)I wasn't satisfy for that sushi neta's quality and price. But it's nice environment though. I'll pick Yama to have sushi instead the cowfish around there.

C23gR4Tlid1lguOqbunktQ.text: The first time I went to Cowfish I waited 1.5 hours and got the Motherload- which was a HUGE disappointment. However, when I shared my experience with friends too many people were shocked by that so we went back for round two- and thank God we did! The Deliverance roll, a pulled pork roll covered in bacon coleslaw, was easily one of the best rolls I have ever had! The crab rangoon dip comes out blazing hot, so beware, because it is so good you will burn yourself unable to slow down. I'm a fan for sure- but primetime dining hours are a beast of a wait so come early or go on a weekday to fully appreciate this place.

HyiGujIQ25V1otYxz_Jt2A.text: Easily the best meal I have had in Charlotte in the 4 months since relocating. I love the atmosphere of the restaurant and the idea of putting sushi and burgers together had me intrigued. The eclectic menu was so big that I wish I had scoped it out before going. The calamari appetizer was the only disappointing part of the meal. It was simply "ok". I ordered the Prime Time Filet and Lobster Roll and it was love at first bite. It was cooked to perfection and my taste buds were happily bursting with all of the different flavors.  Once I try a cocktail and another appetizer, Cowfish could easily get 5 stars; I will be back!

pBfncJSCmpseaRj7HQFjFA.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants to go to when I visit Charlotte! It's a good restaurant for groups since they have so many different options.  My favorite thing is the What's Shaking Tuna sandwich.  The bread for the sandwich is actually rice.  It's delicious! My husband always goes for the bento box that includes a slider and sushi.  My dad always go for a burger. An my mom goes for the spring rolls.  Everyone always enjoys everything.  I highly recommend this place!

s_2tZizPdTGkV_0PPtJ7sw.text: Love Cowfish! I think all their food is good. The burgers are great and so is the sushi. I love creating my own sushi too. I am pregnant now so I cannot have raw fish so I make my own sushi with steak right now and you can ask for it with brown rice or no rice which is nice for a healthier meal. The sea weed salad is also a favorite of mine.

ozX_MCCi5nOqknFPKel2Vg.text: Cowfish is awesome. Whenever my wife and I have out of town visitors, we always take them here at least once. Everything here is great. The burgers, the sushi, the ribs, ALL GOOD! It's cool enough to come here to just hang out and have drinks (which I have). The food is terrific. The milkshakes are awesome. The portions are huge. The waitstaff is great. Super attentive and friendly. The bartenders are really cool too and have great stories. The only downside is that it's so popular that there's usually a long wait on weekends. But that's alright.

kmuSSE0BPO7b68AMGAGrnA.text: After hearing a lot about Cowfish, we finally checked it out for lunch.  There was a 15 minute wait for a table, so we sat at the sushi bar.    C ordered the Chinese chicken salad, and while it was very good, a few of the ingredients were not the freshest.  She enjoyed it, and would get it again.  I should know better than to have sushi anywhere but an authentic Japanese restaurant, as this was very disappointing.  As soon as I saw the rice in the yellowtail hosomaki, I could tell it was not made properly.  Overcooked (with a mushy texture) is not how it is supposed to be done.  Though it may take five years to learn how to make perfect sushi rice, I have to think a restaurant of this caliber could produce something better than what I was served.  The yellowtail was just fair.  The spicy tuna hand roll was probably the weakest one I've ever had(!)  Large, clumsy chunks of grade B tuna, a bland sauce and limp cucumber strips.....I don't think so.  Well, maybe the burgers are better..

e3T70ns3VrRj_HseKgLNmA.text: One of the most unique restaurants in the city - or really anywhere to be honest.  In the mood for burgers - they have great burgers...in the mood for sushi - they have great sushi...in the mood for filet mignon wrapped up like sushi - they have that too...in the mood for a sammie but craving sushi - well, they can do that too.  On top of that, they have awesome appetizers, great martini's and some every day type of salads, sammies and 'knife and fork' type of dishes.  The atmosphere is great - they actually have cowfish swimming in the fish tank - and don't miss going in to the bathroom - you'll get a very entertaining language lesson.  On the weekends, there is always a wait, but they take your cell phone number so you can go shopping at Crate and Barrel while you wait.  Go here...soon!  You will love it!

arNyvOhaXImhygexFS-8Qw.text: A little sparse inside in my opinion but nice. Considering the place is usually packed that's probably a good thing.  Definitely get the nacho appetizer! Excellent. Burgers are good. I had the lamb.  Don't know about sushi there but it's not a Japanese joint  so go from there.

m7YK3p5Zj0rMFsRStN9Tiw.text: Love cowfish. Wait times can be a bit long, but grab a drink from the bar and take advantage of the time to relax and catch up with your friends. The staff are helpful and humorous. Make sure you visit the restroom if you want to learn new words ;)

1_FBOFR4p46Snm25FAKqvA.text: 3 1/2 stars actually Check out my food blog: ilovefood13.wordpress.co... Recently I tried a new restaurant in the Southpark area, The CowFish. Hidden near Crate & Barrel, you'd miss it unless you knew it was there. The same for all the shops near the area, the parking is very limited...good luck! Normally a sushi or burger joint is not my thing but I was open to trying something new so off we went. Met up with a group prior to dinner time for a glass of wine so the restaurant was not busy. The bar and dining area is quite large though you wouldn't think so from the outside. Once you enter, your eye can't help but look at the large aquarium. Very nice! The bar wraps around both dining rooms. We were seated immediately, as they weren't busy. And our first waiter quickly appeared to give us the full "Cow Fish Menu experience." He went over all the items on the menu, highlighting his favs, & the restaurant's best dishes. Our second waiter was happy to recommend wines & our third took our order. Apparently, shift changes, sick staff caused us to have three waiters in less than 20 minutes...hmmmm Our first two were very helpful & attentive, the third unfortunately not. We started with a little appetizer with our wine & if you know me, it was carbs! So truffle fries were ordered & delivered quickly. A large platter of house fries with truffle, melted parmesan cheeses, & chives...yum! We ordered dinner while we munched on the appetizer & dinner arrived quickly...we didn't even finish our yummy fries. The menu is eclectic from sushi burgers, sushi boxes, & burger salads. I tried the The Screamin' Korean Chicken burger. Unique burger with flash fried chicken breast topped with kimchi & sriracha, ranch, & Asian slow. It was served with the burger usual's, lettuce, tomato, onions & pickles. I added a little more sriracha to the sandwich, because everything is better with heat :) and it wasn't bad. While the burger was $11, you certainly get a large portion for your money & that goes for all the dishes. The other dishes were the same too. Another entree that looked good ordered was the Cowfish Bento Box. Literally served in an Asian box, you get a lot for your $12: sliders, sweet fries, edamame, sushi rolls, & Thai cucumbers. While I didn't try any of it, my friend certainly enjoyed. And the shrimp dish was proportionally large & apparently good as everyone shared, minus me of course. The proportions were large, so no room for dessert this time. Not to mention the restaurant did get very busy & loud. By 6, there was a line outside the door to get in. Decor is interesting from large comically pictures all around the restaurant to the leather chairs, booths, Asian foods artwork. For a unique experience & great ambience, definitely give it a try.

KVnYzKd-e1QCoDzmV25PqA.text: I would love have given this place 5 stars based on the food and atmosphere, service and drinks but I had a bad reaction to the lamb burger later that evening. I narrowed it down because my girlfriend did not get sick. The shrimp, crab dip and crab cakes were good and the lamb burger with fried feta tasted great at the time but was a little to much for my stomach.

65ko8INjwnDb7t2Z-_EONw.text: There are better places to get sushi in Charlotte and likewise with the burgers. The 'something for everyone concept' works and I like the decor so I give it 3 stars because when the food is warm, timely and well cooked it's a nice place to have a drink, grab a burger and shake or some americanized sushi.  However, the problem with Cowfish is that they are consistently off the mark, whether its one thing or a combination of things I list some of the negatives in the half dozen times we've visited: cold burgers, cold fries, bad sushi, slow service, rude service, over cooked food, long hair in a burger, wrong orders... need I go on. After giving this place multiple chances to put right any 'newly opened' glitches, my friends and I have given up and stopped visiting. That's a shame because we all live within walking distance and used to visit a lot.  The place is always very busy so I hope for the sake of the southpark village area businesses and residents that other patrons are not experiencing what we have.

8btjzAtCw_iJP59cSetBHw.text: Cowfish is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. The concept is great - I love the fact that I can have sushi and my friend can have a burger. The service is always great here too. It gets SUPER busy on the weekends but honestly, it is worth the wait, especially if you have some drinks at the bar. My favorites from the menu are the Ahi Tuna Nachos, the fried pickles, the crab rangoon dip, "THE BOSS" roll, and the make your own sushi - I love that they offer brown rice for sushi as well (so much better for you than white). If you want to try something new/amazing - try the Taste Explosion roll - OH MY GOD! Love this place.

aicKAzDTp8BvEM7XTS59ZA.text: I loooove this place...it is absolutely wonderful. I've eaten here twice and I just cannot get over how good everything is. The chefs have perfected burgers, sushi, dessert...everything. The bartenders are excellent. Cowfish is totally comfortable and inviting and we love the outdoor space. Prices are fair for what your get - all high quality ingredients, expertly prepared and seasoned, and good sized portions. You'll never get bored here, the menu is extensive and unique. We love you Cowfish, keep up the good work!!

Y73nH6BdtgSbOKsAdi8E-A.text: I love this place. We originally came because I received a gift card for Christmas and the reason this was picked out for us was because my brother dined here and loved it. And so knowing that I love sushi but my other half does not, he knew this would be a great place for us to visit.  Well needless to say we did love and fell in love. This is definitely our go to spot when someone comes in town, for a birthday or holiday or whatever.   The food is always fresh and very well seasoned. The service is always impeccable and that definitely goes a long way.   The menu is vast and they have many options and I am very impressed with their kid menu. My son loves cowfish too and for us to have a nice family restaurant that we all really love is not an easy task.  And I am very happy to report that Cowfish turned my non-sushi eating man into a sushi lover.   It is typically quite busy and the wait was always long but on our last visit, there was absolutely no wait time.

11VOJq_PyxAAie5Sj4kA2Q.text: We have been here randomly, but never tried the steak and sushi combos.  Holy crap! Doug's Filet Roll!  The service was on point.

WHDUkQd80sRh8vgavU2fPA.text: Finally made the plunge last night with another couple for "date night".  My hesitation in coming here is that it always seems to be crowded and they don't take reservations.  The other couple with us was able to check in on their app which helped some but you have to be within a certain distance from the spot to do it.  When we arrived around 5:30 on Saturday there was an hour wait even with checking in on the app.  OK, I don't mind of the sushi is awesome.  We had a crab dip app at the bar and waited it out.  Our server, Jamal was really good.  Funny, attentive and knew the menu well so there's that.  The sushi was really good.  I had the two time roll and it was excellent I had one more but can't remember the name.  The selection on the menu was varied and included burgers, bento boxes, sushi and the "burgushi".  It's the kind of place you want to keep coming back to try different things so we'll get back here eventually.  The food was solid, experience was good except for the wait so the only thing I could suggest is them allowing you to make reservations but the way they're doing it now hasn't hurt business any so rock on, Cowfish!

7p78gVvX8WgFSBy3ubT3RQ.text: Great food. This is not the cheapest spot! Drinks are overpriced but it was tasty. My burger was super fresh and I loved it. The wait will probably be long. I think the best time to go on a Saturday is around 2 to 3 pm. Pretty good service but the food is what makes this place great.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

m3GhBfPVc4iH74IIUN9zqg.text: Great service and great clean authentic style of Japanese food while also presenting an option to those beef eaters. LOL. How can one not love this place? The staff are kind and take their time to actually talk to you. They won't rush you and are always as accommodating as possible. It's hard to find authentic fresh sashimi. But what is even more rare, is quality staff. This place gets 5 stars!

54YvtyyEt4-2X--OC2518A.text: Had the double moriawase, and needed help finishing it!  It was extremely delicious and fresh.  I will be a frequent flier at this sushi joint.

svum86dcw3_98mavYk2GLQ.text: I love cowfish!  The staff at this location were very nice! My waitress, Whitney was very patient with my party and I!  There was a couple other waiters that were very courteous to us while we ate and enjoyed our time. I didn't catch their names but the staff was awesome!  Would definitely visit this location again! The food is excellent every time I go!  Reasonably priced my Firecracker roll was a good portion for $17 had edamame as an appetizer for $6.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

bannzn2N4YK5cnHR3a2aFQ.text: The wait here is extremely long. They are not on open table so there really is no way to book ahead. You can always hot the bar or sushi bar if you don't want to wait. The food however is delicious, to die for. I had the calamari and lobster roll, which was creatively constructed and artistically pleasing to the eyes. For my entree, I had the lamb vindiloo, an Indian inspired dish with fries. It was the tastiest burger I've ever had. I consumed the thing in 2 minutes because if I didn't, I had family and friends there with me eyeing my plate as of it were there last supper.  The service was great, and our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu. The ambiance was very chilled and leased back. I want to come back and taste the other burgers on the menu.

Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

OJCOJsQul07S2ktZveQCtw.text: Great food and service. Expansive and creative menus. Server Ryan was great. I had a burger and it was great! Would come back for sure!

u1wycFuBIsvT5sztvioRIg.text: This place is always fantastic until they mix sushi and burgers and that is just an unholy marriage. Everything from the calamari to the burgers are truly outstanding.

zZUL8RJtzd14eR8T9ISIxQ.text: My wife and I love this place. Best fresh sushi you can find in town, and the best burgers too. Highly recommend this to anyone looking for a good time with good quality food, the only downfall is it's not cheap!

JMxkcHj7HFzJuxdJe8pP8w.text: For ALL sushi and burger lovers, this is the place to try if your new to the city or just visiting!!! First time here we waiting 1 hour and it was well worth the wait. A lot of people means great food and that's what they have here ready to serve you! The restaurant is located in a great area and a good place to eat after a day of shopping at South Park mall.  Even if your just experimenting the menu you won't be disappointed. We took our waiters recommendations of the tuna nachos and they were awesome! The best sushi in Charlotte, I will definitely be coming back here!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double Salmon roll and Tuna Nachos.

7G2qeheDkMxnsj2wL6RlNQ.text: I had such a super experience sitting at the bar last week that I wanted to share. Scott was super chill and chatted with me as if we were friends. Score! He helped me pick out a roll based off of my cravings. I got the coconut shrimp tempura roll with mango and cucumber. Lots of wasabi and spicy mayo to go with it. I stayed and had one more glass and chatted with Andrea and Joe, who also were relaxed and cool to chat with. I ended leaving my shopping bag at the bar and Joe, the kind soul that he is, ran out into the parking lot to find me. Thanks Joe!! *embarrassing but memorable : )

jMBLvUIisKIPULpzsaJSZQ.text: My bartenders Shelly and Rob made everything amazing!! I sat down at the bar with a friend, there was a 30 min wait for tables, and they made sure we were taken care of. I could tell they were busy by how much they were moving but they made sure everything was great for us. The food was flavorful and I would recommend sitting at the bar with these two to any Cowfish newcomers!

6OVBjNEgoh81MZMl4G1zLA.text: Came here after spending the afternoon in Mcadensville checking out the Christmas lights. My girlfriend and I both got a drink and she got the bento box and I got cheeseburgushi. Both were phenomenal and I highly suggest coming to Cowfish!

EU6OPSi8tgl_ibADiMpZWA.text: Honestly,, I have no idea how they have four stars!! I know Cowfish for years and every time I've been there I was more than happy to have great food, very friendly people and great service! Sushi is fantastic and the burgers is sooo good!! Hit that place you won't regret!

BWjnlfepJiKVT7rYuWPqNA.text: So I've been coming here for 2 years.  There was another review posted by my sister, that post was from 2 years ago since we started coming here.   Prices have changed ( we all understand prices go up ) but if you're prices are going to go up, make sure your product remains the same or make it even better.  Burgers have become a joke , each time I come, they get smaller and smaller.  Don't get me wrong , the flavor is good still, but, as a business owner myself...if I raise my prices, it's because I'm offering something even better or remain the same product at least.  After coming here every other weekend for the last 2 years, I WILL NOT VISIT THIS PLACE.  Time to find another favorite place

Dqy0JVumTRajjcbzGfP2lQ.text: If you're looking for a different kind of burger, try the lamb burger.  Awesome and flavorful.

r4XuNxcWotq_K0SAQzsHJw.text: I love this spot.  It has something for everyone.  I love the awesome aquarium when you sit at the bar and the authentic Art Deco artwork.  My absolute favorite item on the menu is the salmon and mixed greens salad.  It has fried goat cheese medallions that sets this salad apart from any other one I've had similarly.  It's a fun and delicious experience which I highly recommend.

N_SDBm3QD6p6xb_lJfvS0A.text: I had huge expectation for this place after reading all of the other positive reviews with this place.  I wanted to love their food so badly but I just couldn't trick my taste buds.  I got a taste explosion roll and my friend got a bento box. After stuffing an entire piece of the roll into my mouth, I thought I loved it. It was a fabulous confusing mixture of sushi and a burger swimming about. Then as I had my second and third roll I couldn't lie to myself anymore. The concoction of a burger with sushi had an overwhelming conflicting taste that just did not work together. I did not despise the roll but it just did not meet my expectation. I am sure there is some way you can befriend the flavors of sushi and burgers but this was not it. As for the bento box, there was nothing too special other than seeing sweet potato fries and edamame served as a side next to each other.   Asides from the food, the restaurant had a great vibe. Red and black decor with this sweet fish tank. PLEASE NOTE THE FISH TANK! I saw nemo, dori, and some other characters from finding nemo and then this fugly looking fish. As I was waiting for my food, I decided to look up where the name originated from and to my surprise, I saw a COWFISH! I do not see the cow resemblance with the fish but they had a cowfish swimming in their tank! Props. So... this place is definitely worth going to to experience the bizarre food with Andrew Zimmern but I personally did not love the food. (the mojito was delish tho)  Concluding Haiku:  Give the Cow' a lick Funky fish too burgerish Give the Fish' a lick

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. There is a burger in my bento box

Jtd5J_TF2mm_VRPqXlDyBA.text: I've been here many times with friends for both lunch and dinner and it's been excellent every time.  The best however was back in September when I went with my parents for lunch the day of my wedding. I wish I remembered our servers names because they were amazing. Our food was delicious as usual and when they went above and beyond after finding out i was getting married that evening. We were blown away. Incredible service.

SEg7qMNuL8KXieRd5ziKEw.text: Very difficult to locate, but well worth the drive.  Delicious raw fish (sushi) and hamburgers with special charm and taste.  Lunch crowd was rowdy and loud.  Might return for a quiet dinner.  Waiter seemed knowledgable about beer and wine, but not too enthused about much else.  Several local celebrities claim that this is their favorite place for a quick bite.  Sweet potato french fries were evenly crispy and prepared with loving touch.  Interesting selection of sauces to put on things.

_dFQ2rkg-ZswpAkVyKj4Xg.text: The crab Rangoon dip, awesome! The drink...whatever it was called, awesome! The appetizer fries (bacon-parmesan?) Awesome! You see where I'm going with this, right? Loved the Jalapeno Popper Show Stopper, my wife got a bento box, I had a firecracker roll too, and I left stuffed, happy, and sleepy. :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. My Jalapeño Popper Show Stopper!

hJam73TaJ8Vd4YisonOLXQ.text: Probably my favorite Sushi in Charlotte! The atmosphere and menu are superb. We eat there weekly.

bFQbe_Ljzbpwn2nO2Vt9gg.text: Amazing burgers and sushi! I love that I can create my own roll. I made one with filet mignon and another with shrimp tempura! Great service!

y9enLevHrOEUfPTsnJVNXQ.text: Best sushi in town. Such a fun place! Great drinks, great prices, great service. Awesome place for people with kids for an early dinner. Patio seating is fun and gives a pretty view of South Park. The Blackened Tuna Roll is AMAZING! You will not be disappointed.

FPJV68652RMBxMFq2rTmfw.text: Love it! This is definitely one of my favorite sushi places in Charlotte. Get there early, either for lunch or dinner... or you'll be waiting an hour plus for a table.   I haven't had a bad roll here, though the downside to that is that their menu seems to be a little too long. A couple of their burgers were a little greasy, but overall I've had good burgers here.   If you are adventurous, make sure you try the burgersushi, they are very inventive & flavorful. They do make the classics if you are not so adventurous, but then again... if you like sushi you probably are willing to try something outside of the ordinary ;-)

e_wGrcoicDeJaP00yxY_9w.text: This place never seems to get old.  I do get nervous coming here because they have been shut down 3 times due to their lack of cleanliness in the kitchen (or so I've heard) - but I also thoroughly enjoy myself. Whether I'm out side on the patio or sitting inside at the bar the rolls always taste amazing.  I love the Salmon Avocado Tini as an app and one of my favorite rolls is the Marks.  A manager once came over to my table to started talking to me, and gave me discount cards at the end.  Which I felt was great. Check it out! You'll enjoy yourself.

SuOMhJy6poOca0dfcmSj4w.text: Interesting place! Burger/sushi fusion.  The sushi that everyone had was excellent as was the crab dip appetizer.  One of the dinner options is a bento box that comes with sweet potato fries, edamame, a slider, cucumber salad, and 4 pieces of some sushi roll. My only compliant is that the burger that came with the box was tiny. Hard to keep a burger super juicy when it's that small. Wasn't bad, but didn't really satisfy the urge for a burger. Otherwise, large portions.  Next time, I'd go one way or the other... Sushi or burger.   Patient staff with some high maintenance customers.

fCNVo_yeJwLtvmOOlg0C0A.text: My husband and I had lunch at Cowfish on Halloween. The place was packed so we just plopped at the bar. Hubby ordered a burger. I opted for the tuna poke. We shared the Blue Crab Lobster Spring Rolls. I was stuffed after eating two pieces of the spring roll. Took my tuna to go. Delicious! Everything was excellent including the service!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blue Crab Lobster Spring Rolls...yummy!
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger with side of Seaweed Salad
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna Poke

HIeBHeQo2okj_2Uz23w-mg.text: Pretty good sushi, though not the caliber of Musashi is Pineville,Nc. Very interesting menu: concept of the burgashi is interesting. Waitress said they were amazing. Best part was the design your own roll. My son loved this. Burger cooked to rare perfection-Angus beef makes all the difference. Quite pricy. We get a lot more at Museum for same price.

LbFc8fjXiFnt8Oj2e7Pzmw.text: This is a great spot. I sat at the bar, the bar tender was the best. He was very patient about me trying wine, and making recommendations til I was happy. We ordered sushi and sashimi and were very pleased with the food. My friends said the burgers are great too. Will definitely be back and will definitely recommend to friends!

L2lKJQrQdJ5lg4DvGNZhYA.text: Cowfish had a rep to protect, and so far they have done it. I have been at night with a large party and was well taken care of. I recently went for lunch and felt the same attention and care was given to my small table as well.  I try to get something different every time I go and this time I sampled the coconut onion rings as an appetizer... OMG. They were huge, perfectly made, and with two tasty sauces to dip them in. I was in love. Our waitress was awesome and didn't hover, but still managed to keep our glasses full. I have no complaints about this place. I always leave full and happy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Behold, the Motherload!

5OpKkNvm8YEwtM_mr3Wo3Q.text: Okay so this was everything. I ended up getting the bento box burger combo, which the special for the mini burgers today was a jalapeno burger w/ may I add jalapeno bacon! Like cmon! It was too good to be True! I got the Georgia Sushi roll, the sushi was so fresh, the sauce included with the sushi was A1 as well. It was an eel roll btw. The cucumber salad was fresh and not soggy which is rare! My French fries were crisp! Everything was literally just made to perfection! I will be back ASAP.   PS. Rob (Robert) was my server at the sushi bar and he needs a raise! Get this man a raise! He oozes quality customer service and you can tell its genuine.

vCl_3X1GTt9qxfawd9SGUQ.text: We loved everything!  The crab and lobster spring rolls are equally pretty and delicious!  The sauces definitely make the dish.  The sriracha and pesto are awesome together.  I went a tad lighter and had the turkey burger with cranberries and apples.  Added feta for some saltiness and it couldn't have been better!  The burger was massive and the side of sweet potato fries was also pretty huge!  I don't remember what the boyfriend got because I was too busy gobbling mine up!  But I know there was way more than either of us could finish!  Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey burger with cranberries and apples and side of perfectly cooked sweet potato fries!  Yuuuuuuummm!

a0JpMpTk2jRVhpWYnnZZFQ.text: We came here for my girlfriends birthday dinner. It was an hour wait but on a Saturday I figured it would be busy everywhere. It was definitely worth the wait. We shared calamari for an app which was very good. I got a burger and my girlfriend got the Bento fusion box and a sake flight. Dinner was awesome and very filling. The atmosphere was great and they even offered us drinks while we were waiting for our table. We plan on coming back again to explore more of their large menu.

B31yfB7nNcemxZTDDlu3WA.text: We love Cowfish. The tuna nachos are one of the best apps in all of Charlotte - superb!!

SV3qM0VwUOw_TEwcAlIY8w.text: This place was excellent!! The crazy concoction of a bacon cheeseburger in a sushi roll was amazing and filling!! Great atmosphere and customer service!!

wIjAnZQBnh27Ay5Mja-K-Q.text: Great food! Great service! Iyesha was so sweet and very attentive! She made our dining experience phenomenal! Will be back soon!!

YkL6olmFHHV2W6DlPsI7MA.text: I recently visited Cowfish Sushi Burger bar for the second time. I was disappointed by the sushi and left famished. Usually when you order $22 worth of sushi you should leave satiated. The sushi is mediocre tasting, lacking flavour and fish! I could barely taste the salmon. On my first visit I had tried the bento box and it was less than memorable. The burger portion was tasty , but it was the size of a slider and the sushi part was bland. I suspect if a patron sticks to their burgers they will leave happy and full. Satisfy your sushi cravings elsewhere. I have yet to find delicious sushi in Charlotte!

boZjYo7WhUmHS9x1dTZIBg.text: Awesome food, awesome service.  This place is definitely different and the bento bowls & burgushi are definitely worth a return visit.  Great place to eat!

xcJ05aJ7dUfPOkuaNKAe4A.text: I had a veggie burger and onion rings as an appetizer.   The atmosphere is really great and it's in one of my favorite areas. The food portions are big! I loooove the onion rings, the coconut covering made it stand out from any I've had before. After eating the onion ring I could not come close to finishing my burger, which was great also. The staff are very nice and the crowd is very diverse and relaxed.

yQHF3SG3YfqmxDfFfXeNVA.text: When I'm wrong, I say I'm wrong. I thought burgushi sounded like a really gross concept, but It was really delicious! Other pluses of the meal were the ahi tuna nachos and the Elvis milkshake.  Do expect long waits on the weekend nights -- This place is packed! Also, if you can, take advantage of the option to make a reservation before 6pm.

5luzKeRTRpWT8aJQ4lt67A.text: Got the mixed box with sliders and sushi.  Wasn't impressed by either.  Long wait too.

fTq4q1HrQHlodGscZ0k21g.text: Great atmosphere and great burgers.  Me and one of my friends went here because we heard the burgers were good. (I'm not a sushi person, but people come here for that as well) And I have to say that the burgers were a nice size for the price. I was able to get fried pickles as a side and that was amazing!  We also had awesome service too. Two thumbs up for this place!

1Blv4FDkMn4S9IE-SxJWew.text: Update. The food was very good and our waiter/barmen very attentive . Lamburger was tasty and the sushi very good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sorry this is the Lamburger
Photo of The Cowfish Sushi Burger Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamberger

SAX8T2Mf2zO7Llb6hMdw3g.text: The wait (2 hours!) and the high price ($16 for a basic sushi roll) are what causes this place to lose two stars.  The quality of ingredients, ambiance and taste are worth three stars!

7HJU4ph40v3MysdvyPJGvA.text: After seeing the lines and hearing the raves via word of mouth, I expected something more. It was overall a good experience and I enjoyed my food and received good service as a solo diner at the bar. The sushi was good but not memorable. I just felt that I could have gotten sushi and drinks of equal quality and service at another, less expensive restaurant. I suppose it a place to be seen and maybe my expectations were too high. To each their own!

eZNY_6wQ8yGghVBpgRsVaA.text: My cousin treated a friend and me to this place, and I'm so glad he did! This is a novel little concept (I love "different") and the food is really good. I had a lamb burger, which was AMAZING!  This place has a great ambiance... not too romantic, not "fast-foody". If I lived in Charlotte, This might be the go-to spot for my crew because they definitely have something for everyone.

79WOZT5TtcWIOR4b8mHycQ.text: Decided to give this place a try again against my better judgment.  What a waste of time and $60. Unbelievable the wait and service. It's beyond ridiculous trying to eat here. Cowfish is incredibly overrated and over priced.

B3BynJE7qqa82kCPN1HOnw.text: Such a cool concept for a restaurant! I love sushi, everyone loves burgers and you get the best of both worlds! Great for large parties. The drink menu was nice, the food was great, especially the Camarillo and the blackened tuna roll!

xniN_KvrHavvLJ4L_-qO7A.text: Sushi tasted old & I felt bad afterwards. Correlation may not be causation, but I don't want to chance it. The menu variety was cool, but I couldn't get over the old fish, especially for the price. Probably won't go back unless invited with a group or something.

UGWXVg96Eb4JXqDL8yrC1A.text: Purists of both the sushi and burger variety are sure to frown on a restaurant that combines two seemingly disparate menu items, but for the rest of us, Cow fish is top notch!   The well-decorated restaurant offers a full menu's worth of burgers as well as a solid sushi menu with both traditional items (such as tuna rolls and single slice nigiri) but also offers the more "fusion" style rolls which include things like red meat, veggies and fried rolls.   While I wanted this to be a 5-star restaurant, the service was not quite good enough to put it over the top.   The staff while friendly, bungled a couple of our orders, and could have been a bit more attentive.   Even so, the charm of the menu, the building and the staff makes it a "must" for anyone in the Charlotte area.

vIaYMin1cYId2l9vAes3rw.text: Excellent. Every order has been of good quality and taste. Try to go there every 1-2 wks. Not the fastest service, but worth the wait.

UAvt9aurKwb25nf72Wy8wA.text: Fabulous as always!  The Boss roll was so fresh and tasty. The calamari was perfect and plentiful! Such a fun atmosphere but go early or you will need to bring some patience!

H82Bsbfv3jEjT77SKDAWqg.text: We're regulars at this place and it's our favorite sushi restaurant.    We always start off with edamame, which can be prepared with 4 different flavorings, (e.g., cajun, sea salt, etc.).  I used to always get the seared sesame tuna salad which is served over a seaweed and cucumber salad with sesame seeds and sriracha (love) but lately I've been getting the tuna nicoise salad, which is huge and has a lot of tuna.  For other apps, the blackened ahi tuna nachos and avacado and tuna tini are also great.    For sushi, I love the southpark roll but I usually do the "make your own roll" - you can use cucumber as the outer roll if you don't like the seaweed wrap or want to go healthy and avoid rice.    John, the manager, is such a quality guy and always has taken good care of us.  Our kids love it here as much as we do; they usually get the bento boxes, which have a ton of food so if you want some fries/sweet potato fries, you can just eat your kid's because they'll never eat them all.  Great dirty martinis here also (I've liked all the 'tini drinks I've had here).

IVpzujqBodAf2xGK8fXBnQ.text: When I lived in the area, this was one of our go-to places! Delicious fusion burgers and sushi. Great side orders too.

z8KCJtl37Cr2S5rQ3LErXQ.text: There was a part of me that wanted to be disappointed by this place. I mean all the hype, there's no way it'd live up to my expectations. Well, it did. I ordered the double salmon roll, which was incredibly flavorful. The depth of flavors were not something you'd find at your average sushi establishment. Also the service was magnificent.

t0XWcI_74GCkYvyBsBd6qQ.text: Love this place! Great sushi and burgers, I haven't tried the shakes but I'm sure they're yummy. The crab dip appetizer is the absolute best!! Their bento boxes are also great! There are so many sushi rolls which is great for variety and options, did I mention I love this place. They need another location though b/c the wait time on weekends is ridiculous.  Other than that this is one of my favorite sushi places.
